one day, jane asked her mom if she could go outside and play. mom said yes and jane went out with a big smile on her face.

as jane was walking outside, she saw a big tire in the garden. she asked her dad, â€œwhat is this?â€ dad said, â€œitâ€™s a tire. you can use it for fun!â€

jane liked the tire, but it was dry. she asked her mom, â€œcan i put water on the tire?â€ mom said, â€œsure, honey. that will make it fun for you!â€

so jane filled up the tire with water and had a great time splashing and playing in it. she soon forgot all about the dry tire and just enjoyed playing in the cool water. 

jane had such a great time with the tire that by the end of the day, she didnâ€™t want to leave!
once upon a time there was a small jeep that lived in the forest. he was a very happy jeep, always rolling around and making friends with all the animals in the forest. one day, he noticed that a bee was in trouble. the bee was stuck in some thick mud and couldn't get out.

the jeep thought to himself, "i must help the bee!". he bravely rolled up right next to the bee and used all his strength to hold onto the poor bee. this gave the bee the strength to crawl out of the mud and fly away. the jeep was so proud to have helped his friend and felt really good inside.

that's when the jeep learned an important lesson. he knew that if he used his strength to help others, it would make him feel even better. from then on, the jeep was always helping the other animals in the forest, and they all appreciated his kind heart.
once there was a naughty little boy who liked to play. he was very curious and he liked to explore. one day he was playing by the tv and he had a great idea. he wanted to store things in it! he brought his toys to the tv and put them inside. he was so proud of himself that he ran around, shouting about it. but then he realized something - he couldn't get them back out! he was stuck! his mama was so mad when she saw. she said, "that was naughty of you. you can't store things inside the tv!" the little boy was very embarrassed, but he knew his mama was right. he apologized and promised to never do it again.
once, there was a man who had an expensive van. he drove it everywhere and never wanted to let it go.

one day, the man was driving it and he heard a noise. he stopped to take a look and he saw the engine was broken! he was very sad.

he couldn't afford to fix it so he threw the van away. everyone was sad, but was happy that the van was gone.

the man decided that he no longer needed a van. and he promised himself he would never buy an expensive van again.
once upon a time, there was a little boy called joe. he was only 3 years old and he loved to stay outside and play with his friends. one day, joe wanted to climb up to the top of a big tree in the backyard. his mom said it was okay, so he started climbing. 

when he reached the top, he was so happy! but then he saw something wild! a large bird was sitting in the tree and it didn't look very friendly. joe was scared, but he decided to stay and see what would happen. 

the bird said to joe: "you should not stay here! it is too dangerous!" but joe was scared, he didn't know what to do. then the bird flew away very quickly, and joe was left alone on the top of the tree. 

it got dark outside, and joe started to cry. he wanted to get down, but he was too scared to move. he stayed up there, feeling cold and hungry, until the morning came. 

joe's mom found him the next morning, still on the top of the tree. she was so worried, and thankfully joe was safe, but he never went climbing again.
once upon a time there was a little girl called lucy. she was walking on the beach one day when she found a beautiful shell. she picked it up and was admiring it when suddenly a big wave came and washed the shell away.

lucy was very sad and was about to cry, but then she heard a noise behind her. it was something big and it was coming closer! lucy was scared.

she turned around and saw a dangerous-looking animal. she had never seen anything like it before. it had a big, sharp claw and it was snapping at her. lucy was so scared that she ran away as fast as she could.

luckily, she managed to get away from the dangerous animal. but from that day on, lucy was careful when she went near the shell on the beach. she didn't want to get scared again!
once upon a time, there was a little girl who was very intelligent. she went to the store with her mom and bought a new toy. the toy had lots of little nails in it, and the little girl wanted to remember where each nail went. she used her intelligent mind to remember where to place each nail and at the end of the day she finished her toy. she was so proud of her work! when her mom came home, the little girl showed her the finished toy, and her mom clapped with joy. the little girl was very proud of her accomplishment, and promised to always remember how intelligent she was.
once upon a time, there was an attractive bird named chirpie. chirpie wanted to paint the biggest picture anyone had ever seen. chirpie flew everywhere looking for the perfect color of ink. finally, chirpie found the ink, it was a nice, sparkly blue!

chirpie flew back home, carrying the ink carefully in her beak. she worked all day and all night to get the picture just right. when it was done, she looked at it with delight.

chirpie proudly hopped up on her perch and called out to her friends. "come and see what i have made!" she cried.

the other birds flew to her perch and gasped in amazement. it was the most beautiful, colorful picture they had ever seen. everyone clapped and applauded. 

"well done, chirpie," they said in unison.

chirpie smiled, she had never felt so proud. it was just the beginning of her journey as an artist and she knew there would be more beautiful works of art to come.
in the park, there was a big slide. jack's eyes lit up as he ran up to it, looking handsome in his cute blue trousers and yellow shirt.

"mommy, look!" he exclaimed.

jack's mother smiled. "wow, jack, it looks so much fun!"

the two of them raced up the steps together, and jack reached the top first. he looked around eagerly.

"go, jack!" his mommy said with a laugh.

jack took a deep breath and then pushed off. he slid all the way to the bottom, whooping with delight.

mommy met him with a melon slice.

"here you go, sweetheart," she said, handing it to him. "you look so cute!"

jack smiled as he took a bite of the juicy melon. 

then, he ran back to the top of the slide, ready to do it all over again.
once upon a time there was a little girl named may. she was a brave, adventurous soul and loved exploring. she had heard stories of a sailor who lived in a small boat on the nearby lake.

so one day, may asked her parents if she could go find the sailor. at first, her parents were unsure and did not allow her to go. but she was persuasive, so they eventually agreed but warned her to be careful.

may excitedly walked to the lake and found the sailor. he was wearing a big coat because it was cold. the sailor welcomed may and let her get into his boat. he told her about his adventures and let her use the oar to try and make the boat sail. together, may and the sailor sailed around the lake for hours until it got dark.

the sailor sent may home and waved goodbye as she left. may had a wonderful day and thanked her parents for allowing her to go.
once upon a time there was a girl, who was brave and strong. she wanted to make a perfect dress, with lots of colourful stitches. but she faced a problem, the dress kept falling apart no matter how many stitches she added. she kept trying to fix it, but it kept coming apart.

but then, one day, the girl had an idea. she took a tiny needle and thread and worked on the dress, carefully and slowly making small, tight stitches. the dress stayed together, no matter how hard she pulled it. the girl was so happy, as her hard work had finally paid off â€“ the dress was now perfect!

the girl knew she had to keep working on the dress, to make sure it stayed strong and perfect. but, no matter how hard she worked, the dress stayed together and resisted coming apart. the girl was so proud of her perfect dress. she knew she had used the perfect stitches.
once there was a frog. he loved to sing. he opened his mouth wide every day and sang a green song. everyone around him would stop and listen.

one morning he woke up feeling extra sleepy. he tried to sing his green song, but all he could do was yawn. he stretched out his arms, but the yawns kept coming!

he gave up trying to sing and instead decided to take a nap. he found a nice spot in the sun and yawned himself to sleep.

when he woke up, he felt much better. he opened his mouth wide and sang his green song with all his heart. everyone around him was smiling as they sang along. 

it was a special moment - one that he would never forget. and he never yawned while singing his green song ever again!
once there was a little girl and her name was lisa. she had a modest home full of love and her daddy was always there to make her smile. every day he would take her for a walk and sing her a song. she loved it! 

one day, lisa asked her daddy to repeat the song for her. he said yes and sang it over and over again until he got tired. lisa giggled and thanked her daddy for singing it so many times. she felt so special when he showed her all of his love. 

every day since then, lisa asked her daddy to repeat the song and he always said yes. he loved her so much and she loved him too. together they were the happiest they could be.
once upon a time, there was a brave pink rabbit called bob. bob was a gentle creature and he spent most of his days observing the world around him. one day, bob had a funny urge to try something crazy. he felt something was telling him to do something wild, like hopping up to the sun! bob thought this was a silly thought and dismissed it.

but then something strange happened. as bob continued to observe, he noticed a cloud up in the sky slowly moving directly over the sun. perhaps this was bobâ€™s sign? he took a deep breath and decided that he should try something he never did before.

so bob hopped as hard as he could and jumped right on top of the cloud. he was shocked! he was so high up! for a moment, bob felt like he could touch the sun. after a while, bob started to feel scared and had to quickly make his way back down.

once he was back in his little home, bob learnt an important lesson. he didnâ€™t have to do something wild and crazy to have an exciting adventure. he could just observe and appreciate the world around him. bob was satisfied that he had learnt a valuable lesson and happily hopped off to bed.
once upon a time, there two friends. one of them was clever, the other was not.

the clever one said to the other, "let's measure a car!"

the not-so-clever one agreed. the two went out to the garage and found an old, filthy car. 

the not-so-clever one said, "let's drive it!" 

but the clever one knew that, even though driving the car may have been fun, it would be very wrong. 

the clever one said, "no, let's not. let's not do anything with the filthy car." 

the not-so-clever one understood and agreed. the two of them just measured the car, instead. 

the moral of the story is that it is important to think before you act.
once upon a time, there was a young duck who lived on a farm. he was so small and young, and he loved to go exploring the farm. one day, he was poking around in the barn looking for something to eat. he poked his neck around the corner and saw a big pile of grain on the floor.

he was so excited, he quickly went to poke it but he was too slow! a big rooster had already seen the grain, and he came over and pecked at it before the little duck could get to it.

the duck was so sad, and he looked up at the big rooster with big eyes. the rooster could see how upset he was, so he kindly stepped out of the way and let the little duck have the grain.

the duck was so happy! he quickly poked his neck through the pile of grain and ate as much as he could. he was thankful to the rooster for letting him have the grain, and they became good friends.
once upon a time, a little boy named bob was very curious. one day, he decided to go on an adventure and explore the woods nearby his house. he grabbed his orange lunch and set out on his journey.

bob walked and walked, but everywhere he looked all he could see were trees. suddenly, bob heard a deep and loud roar coming from deeper into the woods. he was scared, but he was even more curious. he decided to find out what made the roar, so he kept going.

as bob reached the deepest part of the woods, he was met by a big and dangerous bear! bob was very scared, but he remembered the orange lunch in his bag. he decided to offer it to the bear as a peace offering.

the bear smelled the orange and readily accepted bob's offer. it calmly approached bob, took the orange, and left! bob was relieved, but also learned not to wander too far into the woods again!
once upon a time, there was a little girl. she had hair as yellow as the sun, and a smile that shone brighter than all the stars in the sky. the little girl requested her mum to open the drawer in the kitchen. her mum obliged, and the little girl let out an excited yelp of joy.

inside the drawer, there were amazing things! bars of chocolate, colourful plastic badges, and a toy car. the little girl was so excited that she couldn't pick just one thing. she took out all of the amazing items in the drawer and placed them on the kitchen table.

she smiled and thanked her mum as she raced out of the kitchen with her treasures. the little girl was so happy with the amazing items in the drawer that she told all of her friends in the playground about it. everyone was so excited to come visit her and explore the drawer!
once upon a time there was a girl, she was very compassionate and always put others before her own needs. one day, she was walking down the street with her purse, when a mean gentleman stepped in front of her. he demanded that she give him her purse and he would not take no for an answer.

the girl was scared but also determined to stay strong. she replied, "no, i need my purse. i can't give it to you."

the gentleman becoming frustrated, started to raise his voice at her. he said, "you must give me the purse."

the girl feeling very brave, said, "no, i will never give it to you. you need to respect my decision."

the gentleman, realising he had come across someone with self-respect, sadly nodded and stepped aside, leaving her to walk on with her purse in hand. the girl was relieved, but also grateful that her compassion had helped her stay strong in a difficult situation.
lily wanted a pen. she kept asking her mom for one but her mom said she had to wait until she was old enough. so, lily patiently waited for the day when she could own a pen. 

finally, her mom said she was old enough and took her to the store to pick out her first pen. inside the store, lily saw so many pens. there were big ones, small ones, colorful ones, regular ones, etc. 

but, lily decided to pick a regular pen. it was gray and just the right size to fit in her hand. she held her new pen in her hands and could not believe that it was her own. 

lily happily ran out of the store with her new pen. she was so excited! she would practice writing with her regular pen everyday and soon she would be able to write just like her mom.
once upon a time, there was an enormous cactus. its spikes were as sharp as thorns, and it's green body reached far into the sky.

one day, a three year old came across the cactus. she was walking in the desert and noticed how big it was. she got close to the enormous cactus and called out to her mom, asking to pick it.

her mom quickly told her to keep away. she said, "no no. you can't miss that cactus." 

but the three year old was very stubborn and she ignored her mom and reached out for the cactus. as soon as she touched it, she was hurt by the sharp spikes.

she began to cry loudly and felt a lot of pain. her mom quickly came to help her. the three year old felt very sad and she had to go to the doctor.

sadly, the three year old had to miss playing outdoors and visit the doctor often, because of the enormous cactus.
it was a beautiful morning, and bill and suzy were excited to go to the park. they had planned a picnic together.

they grabbed their lunch basket and started walking to the park.

but on their way, they noticed something strange. it was a bird, perched high up in a tree. it looked scared, shivering and chirping.

suzy, being the kind-hearted girl she was, wanted to help the bird. she said, "let's try to help the bird, bill!"

"how can we help it, suzy?" asked bill.

"let's attach a piece of string to the top of the tree, then stay and wait," she suggested.

bill was a bit fearful, but followed suzy's lead. they found a long string and carefully attached it to the top of the tree. then, they waited at the bottom of the tree.

it was a bit scary to wait there, because a sudden gust of wind could have blown away the bird. but, as luck would have it, the bird stayed put. after a while, the bird flew away into the sky.

"phew, we did it!" they said.

and they continued on their walk to the park, happy and relieved that they could help the bird.
once upon a time there was a little girl named alice. she went on an adventure to find the magical icy case. she packed her bags and began her journey.

alice walked and walked until she came to a snowy mountain. she looked around and could see the icy case in the distance. she excitedly told her friends, "look, there it is! the magical icy case!"

alice slowly made her way up the snowy mountain until she reached the icy case. she tried to open it but it was too difficult. just then, a little bird flew down and said, "let me help you". 

the bird grabbed the case with his beak and opened it. inside the case was full of coins!
alice was so happy. she decided to spend the coins on a surprise for her friends. 

alice went down the mountain and bought the best treats for them. her friends jumped up and down in surprise. they all thanked her for the special gifts. 

alice smiled and said, "this is what it means to spend time with the people you love!".
once upon a time there was a little girl who loved to play. she wanted to join all the big kids in their favorite game. the game was to shoot arrows at a target and try to hit it.

the little girl wanted to join in, but she didn't have an arrow. everyone else was very competitive and she was scared they would not let her play.

the little girl was sad until she saw a stick in the grass and picked it up. she brought it to the target and set it up.

the little girl took a deep breath and then reached into the grass to pick up three stones. she closed her eyes and threw the stones one by one.

the stones flew through the air and struck the stick. the little girl was so surprised when she opened her eyes, her arrow had hit the target!

the big kids cheered and the little girl was so happy she could take part in the game. from then on, the little girl learned to shoot arrows and was the most competitive of all.
once upon a time there was a ship. the ship provided a home for the people and animals on board. one day the ship sailed upon a dangerous ocean. there were storms and high waves which made it hard to stay safe. 

the ship couldn't provide everything the passengers and animals needed. they were so hungry and thirsty. they looked for land but it was hard to find. 

at last the ship came to some islands, and the people and animals were able to get the food and drink they needed. there were some dangerous places, but the people and animals stayed safe by following the captain's instructions. 

the people and animals were so thankful to the ship for providing them a safe home. they were all happy to be safe and to have enough food and drink.
once upon a time, there were two friends, anna and ben. they were playing together in the park. anna was beginning to get tired, so she sat down and said, "i am too weak to act." ben looked over at her and said, "don't worry! i've got an idea." he opened his bag and showed her his calendar. "if you put a mark on this calendar each day that you act," said ben, "then you won't feel so weak any more." anna smiled and said, "let's try it!" 

so they started putting a mark on the calendar each day. and little by little, anna got stronger and stronger. after a few weeks, she was able to act with ease! ben and anna were so happy, they hugged each other and danced around the park.

the end.
once upon a time, there were two silly twins named jack and jill. all day long, jack and jill would do naughty things. one day, their mum got very mad. "no more naughtiness!" she cried.

so jack and jill promised to be good. however, they were very hungry. so their mum decided to feed them. she made them a yummy sandwich and some hot chocolate. jack and jill were so happy!

they ate the sandwich and drank the hot chocolate very quickly. then they asked mummy if they could eat more. but mummy said no. she said they were being naughty if they wanted to eat too much. 

so jack and jill tried to be good. from then on, they only ate the food that mummy gave them - and they stopped being naughty. that made mummy very happy. 

and they all lived happily ever after!
claire had a mild day. she was out in her backyard playing. she found a puddle and decided to splash around in it. she jumped and twirled around, feeling so happy to belong in her backyard. 

claire's mom noticed her daughter in the puddle. "there you are claire! come out of there and dry off," she said. claire stopped to listen, and then walked over to her mom. she grabbed hold of her mom's hand and felt like she belonged there.

claire's mom was so happy to see her daughter playing and having fun. she smiled and said, "let's inside to get you warm and dry." the mother and daughter went inside and had a fun day. claire felt like she belonged there too.
once upon a time, there was a clumsy bear who liked to tell jokes. every day, he went out to look for someone to share his jokes with. one day, he came across a little 3 year old girl called emily. the bear thought to himself, "this is perfect!"

the bear asked emily if she wanted to hear a joke and she said yes with a big smile. the bear began to tell his joke, but he was so clumsy that he tripped over his own words and started laughing loudly. emily started laughing too and the two of them laughed for what felt like hours! 

but then, another bear started walking towards them. he looked angry and told the clumsy bear to stop telling jokes to emily. the clumsy bear thought the other bear was angry because he was jealous of the jokes. so, he stepped forward and told the angry bear a joke. 

to the surprise of both emily and the clumsy bear, the angry bear started laughing too. he told them to keep telling jokes because laughter was the best medicine. emily and the clumsy bear smiled and hugged each other to celebrate the breakthrough.

from that day forward the clumsy bear kept looking for people to tell his jokes to. he did it all around the town, spreading only joy and laughter!
once upon a time, there was a small family that loved festivals. every year, they would go to the local spicy festival together.

this year, they were so excited to go that they left their house early in the morning. the sky was cloudless, and the sun was warm.

but as they got to the festival, they saw that it was drying up. the candles were about to burn out, and the candies were melting. the whole place was turning into a desert.

the family was sad. they asked the festival organiser why it was drying up.

the organiser said, "the rain is coming early this year. we will have to cancel the festival."

the family was so disappointed that they could not even eat the spicy food. the festival had been so much fun before, but now it was all over. 

they had to go home and left the festival behind. it was a bad ending to a fun day.
once upon a time, there was a bear named bill. he was very tired, having been out in the woods folding fur. as he climbed the mountain, he heard a loud roar. to his surprise, a big, angry lion was standing in his way.

the lion said, "what are you doing in my woods?" bill replied nervously, "i'm just folding fur, sir." the lion scowled. "i don't like outsiders in my woods," he growled.

bill knew he had to think of something quickly. he thought back to what his mum had said to him when he was just a cub---"be brave and kind, no matter what." so, he put on his bravest voice and said, "can't i help? i'm very tired and could use a rest."

the lion thought for a moment and then smiled. he said, "okay, you can stay. but you must help the other animals in the woods." bill smiled. he was relieved.

so, bill stayed in the woods, helping the animals with folding fur and doing other jobs. he soon became the lion's best friend!
once upon a time there were two best friends, bob and nancy. every day they would go together to the forest nearby to play. one day, bob wanted to cut down a tree with an axe. nancy looked scared and said, "let's not chop down a tree. that's wrong." but bob just rolled his eyes and grasped the axe.

nancy looked more and more miserable as she watched bob chopping down the tree. finally, she shouted, "stop!" with a sigh, bob put down the axe and they sat together on the ground. 

to cheer nancy up, bob suggested, "let's go skipping around the pond." nancy smiled and skipped around the pond with bob. the sun shone on their faces. 

nancy forgot about the axe and she laughed as she skipped around the pond with bob. soon, the pond looked like a swirling of colours and nancy was no longer miserable. they were back to being the best of friends.
once upon a time there was a wise old man who lived in a small factory. he had been stirring things in the factory for many years, always working hard. 
one day, he wanted a little helping hand. he knew exactly the right person for the job - a three year old! so the wise old man called for the child and asked for their help. 
the three year old was so happy. they ran over to the factory and began to stir things up. they stirred the big pots, moved things around and tidied up the shelves. 
the wise old man was very pleased with their work. he praised the three year old for their help and gave them a big hug. the three year old thanked the wise old man and left the factory with a smile on their face. 
and so the wise old man and the three year old lived happily ever after, stirring things up in the small factory.
once upon a time there were two friends, emma and jack. one day, they wanted to discuss furniture.

"let's talk about furniture," said emma.

"yes," said jack.

they looked around the room and saw a small table.

"what is that?" asked emma pointing to the table.

"that is a small table," answered jack.

they looked at the small table and discussed what they could do with it.

"we could use it as a game table," said emma.

"yes!" said jack.

they discussed other ideas until they had the perfect plan. they agreed to use the small table as a game table. they laughed and cheered and had lots of fun.

the end!
once upon a time, there was a shy little bunny named jack. he always liked to hide and play by himself.

every day, jack and the robot would have fun playing together. but one day, the robot suddenly disappeared. jack was so sad and he couldn't find the robot anywhere.

but the next day, jack heard a noise outside his door. he opened it, and there was the robot! the robot had come back. jack was very happy.

jack was so glad that the robot had returned! jack and the robot hugged each other and played together happily ever after.

once there was an orange potato. he loved to sneeze. every day he would go up to the top of the hill and sneeze loudly. all the animals around him could hear him.

one day, a squirrel and some other animals came to see him. the orange potato was so happy to have company. he showed them some of his sneezes. he was so good at it that the squirrel began to try it too.

soon, the whole group of animals were sneezing. they would sneeze so loud that the birds in the sky flew away. the orange potato was so proud that all his friends were learning to sneeze.

from then on, the orange potato and his friends would have sneezing contests to see who could sneeze the loudest. they were so silly!

he sat down and started to sort the leaves. after a while he started to get really tired, but he kept on sorting. suddenly, he thought he heard something coming down the path. he stopped sorting, and tried to listen carefully to see what it was.

it was a big, mean, wolf! the wolf was heading right for him! the little boy didn't know what to do, so he tried to build a little wall around himself with the leaves he had been sorting before. but that didn't stop the wolf!

the wolf ate the little boy up! that was the end of the little boy, and the leaves were left lying on the path.

but as he began to work, dave realized it was a hard job. he worked and worked, but still the truck wouldn't work. 

dave became discouraged, and was starting to give up. he thought to himself, "i don't think i can fix it!"

just then, dave heard the voice of his friend, who said, "don't give up, dave! if you try hard enough, you can do anything!"

one day, a brave little girl named emmy was walking in the forest. she looked around, admiring the tall trees, furry animals and tall grass.

suddenly, she noticed a scary smell. it was getting stronger and stronger. emmy looked around, wondering where it was coming from. suddenly, she saw smoke coming from a nearby hill.

emmy was very worried. she ran to find her mom, who was sitting at the edge of the forest. emmy's mom was surprised to see her daughter so scared.

"mom," she said, "i saw smoke. something is burning!"

emmy's mom became very worried. she grabbed emmy's hand and said, "let's go investigate."

they ran to the top of the hill and found a big fire. emmy was terrified of the flames, but her mom was brave. she ran to get help and put out the fire.

luckily, they managed to save the forest. emmy and her mom had saved the day!

the boy always obeyed his mommy so he listened to her warning. instead of playing in the sun, he played in the shade. the little boy was sad that he couldn't play in the sun, but he liked playing in the shade too.

one day, his mommy found a big, noisy fan. she turned it on and it made a lot of wind. then, she warned her son again to stand away from the fan. the little boy was scared of the fan, but he did as he was told.

the boy's mommy was very worried, so she turned off the fan and hugged the boy. she told him that she only wanted to keep him safe. the little boy smiled, happy that his mommy cared so much about him. he was happy to be safe and warm in his mommy's hug.

the little girl was delighted and said, "i wish you were mine!"

the dog replied with a gentle 'yip'.

the little girl giggled. she went over to the dog and gave him a big hug. then she said, "will you be my friend?"

the dog replied with a big 'woof' and a wag of his tail.

the little girl was very happy and the two of them became the best friends. they played together all day and the tender little dog was very delicate with her. every day they visited the park and the little girl said it felt like having her own pet dog.
once upon a time, in a small village, there was a girl named lucy. lucy wanted to try her luck and paint a pastel. she had a box of colours, but her brother timmy insisted on using the green pastel. lucy was selfish and argued with him, thinking that she should be the one to use it. but she agreed with timmy, not wanting timmy to be disappointed.

a week went by and lucy tried her luck. she mixed many colours together to create a beautiful mural, showing a bright sunshine and a lake with swans and pink flowers. she suddenly ran out of colours to use and realised that the only colour she had left was the green pastel. lucy was surprised and thankful to her brother, who had insisted on using the green pastel instead. 

that day, lucy learned a lesson. she realised that it was not always necessary to be selfish, instead, it was far more beneficial to put others' ideas first. had she not listened to her brother, she would not have completed her vibrant mural. 

the moral of this story is to never be too selfish and always take the time to listen to the ideas of others. you never know when another's opinion could turn out to be just what you needed.
once upon a time, there was a little rabbit called hop. he was very small and helpless. every day he would look for something to eat in the meadow. 

one day, he came across something colourful and delicious. it was a carrot. when he was about to eat it, a big, strong fox appeared. the fox told hop to bring him the carrot. hop felt helpless because he was too small and scared to say no. he handed over the carrot and the fox ran away.

hop was very upset. although the fox had taken the carrot away, hop realised that he should help himself. he went and looked for more carrots in the meadow and eventually, he found them. 

hop brought the carrots to the animal community and they all ate together. everyone was happy and grateful to hop. he had taught them the moral of the story: that itâ€™s good to help others, yet donâ€™t forget to help yourself too.
once upon a time there was a bubble floating in the sky. it was a delicate bubble, so light that it seemed like it would float away any moment. two children saw it from the ground below and wanted to look at it more closely. the two kids ran and jumped, stretching their arms up high try to touch the bubble. but the bubble kept floating away, too far away to reach.

the two children looked around them, trying to think of a way to get to the bubble. then they saw a big tree with lots of sturdy branches near them. it was tall enough to reach the bubble in the sky, so the two kids started to climb.

the children climbed up, higher and higher until they could just reach the bubble. carefully they grabbed the bubble, being careful not to burst it. the bubble felt so delicate in their hands!

once the children had the bubble safely in their hands, they made some wishes. suddenly the bubble started to shine so brightly that it lit up the sky. when the light faded, the bubble popped. all that was left were tiny bits of sparkling dust drifting in the air.
once upon a time there were two teams. the two teams wanted to have a bouncing competition. they both wanted to see who could bounce the highest. the blue team wanted to win, so they practiced very hard. but the red team also practiced hard.

on the day of the competition, the blue team jumped their highest, but the red team still beat them. the blue team was so sad that they lost. they asked the red team why they were able to jump so high. the red team said that they practiced very hard together and that was why they won.

the blue team was very sad, but then they realized that if they all worked together, as a team, they could also bounce high. so they practiced hard, together as a team.

finally it was time for the competition again. this time the blue team was ready. they all bounced up very high, and they won the competition. the blue team was so happy that they worked together as a team.  from then on, they knew that any challenge could be conquered if they worked hard together.
once there was an old lady who wanted to go for a walk in the park. she carefully put on her shoes and stepped out into the warm sunshine. everywhere she stepped, birds sang and flowers bloomed.

but soon, it began to rain! she quickly stepped back under a tall tree and waited for the rain to stop. when it finally did, the lady smiled and stepped off down the path.

but she could not find a safe place to stay. everywhere she stepped, the ground seemed to crumble under her feet. she tried to look for an old house or barn, but nothing was in sight.

finally, at the edge of the park, she spotted an old, crumbling stone wall. she stepped closer and, sure enough, there was an old, safe house hidden behind the wall. she quickly stepped through the door and settled in the snug and warm home. 

the old lady was safe from the rain and the inevitable thunder that would soon follow. she smiled and thanked the old, safe wall.

one day, it told a story about a snake and a tiger. but a square shape didn't like this. it wanted the old shape to tell stories about a snail and a ladybug instead. 

but the old shape didn't want to change its story. so, it kept telling the story about the snake and the tiger. 

the square shape was very angry. it shouted and shouted, but the old shape still wouldn't listen. 

then another shape stepped in. it was a triangle shape and it was very wise. it explained to the square shape that everyone has different stories to tell. 

the square shape understood and it smiled. everyone was happy and the old shape carried on telling its story.

so, the sack decided to go on an adventure. it traveled all around, trying to find its style. everywhere it went, it only found more ugly sacks, nothing that could make it look special.

the sack kept going until it arrived at a big river. it stopped to rest in the sun, when it saw the most beautiful sack it had ever seen! this sack was colored with bright oranges, purples, and blues, and it was sparkling in the sunlight.

the ugly sack knew the other sack was its style. so it asked the other sack to teach it how to be beautiful. the other sack said yes and started to teach the ugly sack all its secrets. soon, the ugly sack was looking just like the other sack, and it felt so wonderful!

he traversed the land for many days and many nights. he discovered different places and even stumbled into a peaceful village. all of the villagers were so friendly and helped him on his journey.

then one day he came to a large river and noticed a strange wrecked boat in the distance. he decided to cross the river in the boat and he waved goodbye to the villagers. his journey continued until the river became too strong. he was pulled into the raging waters and all he could hear were the villagers shouts for help.

but he slowly sank into the deep and dark water. he never made it to his destination, and the last thing he remembered was the peaceful river.
once upon a time, there was a cabin in the woods. it was a very old cabin, but jack liked it. he was a little boy who lived alone in the cabin with his puppy.

one day, jack was very confused; he could smell something strange. it wasn't his puppy's food, it was something else. so, he followed his nose and went to the back of the cabin.

when jack got to the back of the cabin, he saw smoke! the cabin had caught fire. it was burning so fast; he couldn't do anything to put it out.

jack tried to run into the cabin, but it was already too late. he shouted out to his puppy, but it was too scared to come out. he cried, "my puppy's still inside! help me!"

but no one came. jack was alone, confused and scared. his cabin burned to the ground until nothing remained. jack and his puppy were both gone forever.

once upon a time there was a young boy who was very proud of his family. every morning he would go down to the market to get a bag of rice for his family. he would go home, proud of himself for being able to get the rice for his family.

one day the boy went to the market, but the shopkeeper would not permit him to buy the rice. the shopkeeper said he was too young and could not buy it himself. the boy begged and pleaded with the shopkeeper, but he refused to let him buy the rice.

the boy was very sad and disappointed. he realized that being proud is not always enough, and that sometimes it is important to follow the rules, even if it is not what we want to do.

the boy went home that day, feeling less proud and not with the bag of rice he had set out for. he knew that he would have to try another way to get the rice for his family.

one day, the boy was busy playing with his toys. he was having so much fun that he didn't want to leave. suddenly he found something very unusual on the floor beside him. it looked like a big yellow lemon. he quickly picked it up and wanted to know what it was. 

he asked his mom, and she told him it was a lemon. he asked why it was in his room, and she said it had been left behind by the grocery store delivery man. 

the boy thought it was fascinating, and started to play with the lemon. he held it in his hands, squeezed it, and smelled it carefully. after a while, he decided to make a lemonade. he asked his mom for help, and together they made the most delicious lemonade ever. 

after seeing him so busy, his mom decided it was time for him to take a break. she told him to leave the lemon and take a nap. the boy did as he was told, and went to take a nap. 

when he woke up, he was happy to find that the lemon was still there. he had a great time playing with it - and drinking the lemonade he and his mom made - and was happy he could leave the lemon there for their next adventure.
once, there was a boy named jack and he loved to go on adventures. he decided to take a walk outside to see what he could find. he stepped on the grass and found a piece of cloth with different colors and shapes on it. 

jack was very excited to find this cloth. he asked his mom what it was and she told him it was a quilt. jack asked his mom if he could take it home, and she said yes. 

back home, jack wanted to show his friends the quilt. he stepped into his room where his friends were waiting for him. 

when jackâ€™s friends saw the quilt, they were excited. each of them wanted to touch it because it was so different from any other cloth they had ever seen. 

all of his friends were happy because jack found something special. they all agreed that his quilt was the most interesting thing jack has ever brought home.
once upon a time there was a gray mouse. the mouse really wanted to stay in his cozy hole, but he just couldn't stay there forever. he wanted to explore the world! 

the mouse asked his mom if he could go outside. she said "yes, but only if you promise to come back in a few hours." she gave him a permit to go out and explore.

the mouse was thrilled. he had never been allowed to go outside by himself before. he walked and walked, and saw so many interesting things. but he always remembered the promise he had made to his mom, so he eventually came back home.

his mom was very happy to see him back safe and sound. she said "my brave little mouse! you were allowed out today but always remember to abide by my rules and get a permit before you go exploring again!â€ the mouse nodded and snuggled into his cozy hole to stay.
once upon a time there there was a fierce big cat called max. he liked to take long walks in the wide forest near his home. one day, max came across a lake. he stopped and looked around, but he couldn't see anything special. suddenly, a voice came from the lake.

â€œmax, come here,â€ the voice said.

max was scared and wanted to leave but he was curious, so he stepped closer. then, he saw another fierce big cat come out of the lake. the cat said, â€œi am ty the water cat. i live underwater. come with me, max.â€

max didn't know what to do. he was not sure if he should take ty's advice or not.

he thought for a moment and then he decided to take ty's advice. he followed him into the lake.

max was amazed by what he saw. there were lots of colourful fishes, coral reefs, and wonderful underwater plants. ty showed max all the amazing underwater things. it was a beautiful place, and max had a great time.

at the end of the day, ty said goodbye to max and max said goodbye. he took the long journey home with a big smile on his face. from then on, max visited ty in the wide lake every week.
once upon a time there was a big yellow boat that lived in the lake. the boat was old and needed to be fixed. so papa and maple, the little three-year-old girl, set out to restore the boat.

maple asked, "what are we doing, papa?"

papa looked up from the boat and said, "we are restoring the boat, maple. we need to make it look new again."

maple nodded and said, "yes! it will look so pretty!"

papa warned maple to be careful, for the lake was dangerous. maple said, "okay papa, i will be careful."

so papa and maple worked together to restore the boat. they cleaned it, painted it and even placed a rainbow flag at the top! when they were finished, they looked at the little yellow boat with pride.

"it looks so pretty now, papa!" maple said.

"yes, it does," papa replied with a smile.

and from that day on, the little yellow boat in the lake was safe and restored.
once upon a time there was a little bunny called chloe. chloe was so excited because today she was going to have a nap. she took off down the garden path and hopped until she reached a beautiful tree. she saw a big, soft bed of grass and snuggled into it.

just as chloe was settling down, she heard a loud shock. she knew it wasn't thunder and it scared her. she opened her eyes and saw a big loud monster. chloe looked so scared and sad.

the monster said, "why did you come here? i was just about to have a nap! you ruined my nap, so now you have to leave". chloe was so sad. she didn't want to lose her nap, so she said, "i'm sorry. i will leave".

the monster stopped for a minute and looked at chloe. he said, "no, you can stay and have a nap. i will go and find somewhere else to sleep. goodbye chloe!"

so chloe had a nice nap under the big tree, and never saw the monster again. the end.

john was scared and started to cry. his mom quickly wiped away his tears and told him not to worry. she said she would get rid of the gorilla. she grabbed a broom from the kitchen, held it high above her head, and chased the gorilla away. 

john felt safe and smiled. he thanked his mom and quickly went back to his drawing. he knew that his mom would always protect him and keep him safe.
once upon a time, there was a girl. she was very careless and liked to have fun. one day, she went outside and decided to jump in a big puddle. she splashed and made big waves around her. but, when she looked down, she noticed her hands were all muddy. she remembered her mom had said to mind the dirt, so she knew she had to clean her hands.

the girl went inside and her mom gave her some soap. she put it on her hands and started to rub them together. the soap foamed and she enjoyed feeling it tickle her palms. after she finished, she could see her hands were all clean and shiny again.

the girl was happy and didn't want to be careless again. whenever she went outside and got her hands a bit dirty, she always made sure to mind the dirt and wash them with soap.
once upon a time, there was a little fox who was very tired, so he decided to take a nap. he scurried off to the cave where he thought it was the best place to sleep. once the fox arrived, he sat down and closed his eyes, letting out a big yawn. 

he was just starting to drift off when he heard a deep rumble. in fear, he quickly opened his eyes and saw that it was a friendly bear. the bear was licking his lips and looking very hungry.

the bear asked the fox, â€œhave you seen something delicious? i am starving.â€ the fox thought of his lunch that was packed in his pocket. he knew that it was important to be kind, so he decided to share with the bear. the fox offered his lunch to the bear and the bear gratefully accepted.

the fox and the bear ate together. the bear thanked the fox for being so kind and invited him to explore the cave. the fox was excited to explore the cave but he needed to stay alert, so he took a few moments to wake up. he stretched and yawned, feeling very refreshed.

the fox and the bear had lots of fun exploring and the fox learnt a valuable lesson, that kindness makes the world a better place. the fox was thankful for the delicious meal and the moment he shared with the bear.

after a while he got tired. he reached up as high as he could and thenâ€¦ he fell down. there were lots of yummy leaves all around and he had a lot of fun. but then it became time to go home. 

the boy said goodbye to the leaves and he waved again. he waved to the sky, the trees and his mommy and daddy. as he got ready to go home, he smiled because he knew he was the best waver in town.

one day the boy pushed the red button. suddenly the car started to move. the boy was so excited. 

the car drove down the road until it stopped at an ice cream shop. the boy got out of the car and ran inside. he bought a delicious strawberry ice cream cone. 

when he finished eating, the boy got back into the car. he pushed the blue button and the car started to drive. the car drove the boy back home. 

when the car stopped, the boy got out and said goodbye. the modern car made a noise and the boy's day ended.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named bella. every day she would wake up and be so excited to start the day.

one day, bella woke up a bit grumpy. she rubbed her eyes and got out of bed. she looked around and saw something strange. there was a big mark on her wall!

bella asked her mom, "what is that mark?" her mom smiled and answered, "that's a special mark that was made by a very special guest."

bella was so curious. she went to look at it up close. "it looks like a butterfly!" bella said, her face lighting up.

but then she noticed something else. the mark was fading. "why is it fading?" she asked.

her mom replied, "that means our special guest is about to leave. soon he'll be waking up and flying away."

bella was so sad to say goodbye, but she knew that her grumpy morning was turning into a magical day.
once upon a time, there was a little girl. she loved to dream. she would imagine what the world would look like with more jam. she thought everything would taste sweeter and there would be lots of nice things to make from the sticky stuff.

one day, something bad happened. the little girl had made a big mess with the jam. everywhere was a sticky, sweet mess. she was very sorry for it.

her dad came and saw the mess. he said he was not mad. he said it was okay to make a mistake but to always remember to be careful.

the little girl wanted to show her dad she had learned the lesson. she thought really hard and washed all the jam away. her dad smiled and said he was proud of her.

the moral of the story is that it is ok to make mistakes, but always remember to be careful and learn from them.

days went by, and the dog continued to be admired. one day, the purple pup was walking along a path when he spotted the ash from the neighbor. it was small piles of ash all over the ground. the dog quickly realized the neighbor had been trying to protect the ash by keeping it away from the pup. he was happy to have finally found the ash he had been searching for. 

the dog used the ash to look even better. everywhere he went, people stopped and said he was the most beautiful pup in the land. the dog was very proud of his finds and the purple ash that made him look even more beautiful.

once there was a little lion who lived in a large jungle. he had thick and fluffy fur, but he was always feeling very alone. he looked around the jungle, and couldn't find any other lions, so he decided to roar to make some friends.

the jungle filled with his fierce, scary roar. he looked around, but no friends came to play with him. all of a sudden, he heard something else roar back. he ran and followed the sound to discover a big fountain in the middle of the jungle.

beside the fountain he saw two other lions. they were very friendly and made him feel less alone. the little lion was so excited he jumped, and sprayed a fountain of water around them all. the three lions laughed and laughed, playing together all day.

at the end of the day, the little lion felt so happy that he had made some new friends. he said goodbye to the two lion friends, and they all roared together one last time. the little lion then happily ran off home, feeling less alone in the thick jungle.

but then something wonderful happened. the pieces of the little tree started to grow! even though it was chopped into pieces, it was still able to grow.

eventually, the pieces grew into a big and beautiful tree. the tree was even bigger than it used to be!

at the end, the little tree taught everyone an important lesson: you should never give up, no matter how ignorant someone is.

the next morning, full of excitement, rose packed some lunch and set out on an adventure. as she wandered through the forest, she noticed the ground getting wetter and the air becoming very smelly. soon she noticed that instead of the beach, she'd found a big bog.

rose was so disappointed. but, she was determined to not lose her sense of adventure. she decided to take a closer look, so she stepped closer to the bog. suddenly, rose heard a voice calling out to her, â€œhelp me!â€.

it was a small animal that had become trapped in the bog. rose thought and thought about what to do. she eventually decided to reply to the animal, â€œi am here to help you!â€. 

rose then used some nearby sticks to slowly pull the animal out of the bog. the animal thanked rose for her kind and courageous act. 

the moral of the story is: a kind heart and courageous spirit will always help you find a way out of any difficult situation.

he packed a bag of food and some clothes and sneaked onto the ship. as he was sailing away, john shouted, "i'm taking this ship on a journey!"

suddenly, he saw the ship's captain, who yelled, "oh no! you can't take this ship!" john was very scared and he started to cry.

the captain was very kind and said, "it's ok. i understand why you wanted to steal the ship. you can stay on board and help me sail this ship!"

one day, the family decided to make a picnic by the sea. they made rice, salad and a spicy sauce. everyone loved the sauce, especially the little girl. 
she ate it all up and insisted she wanted more. her dad went to make the same sauce, but he just couldn't get the same taste. the little girl insisted that they go to the sea to get more of the spicy seasoning. 
so they followed the little girl and went searching for the spice. when they got to the sea, they didn't find any spices. instead, they found a giant seahorse!
the seahorse asked for help as he had lost his way. the family agreed to help him and as a reward for their kindness, the seahorse gifted them a spicy sprinkle that tasted just like the one from the picnic. the little girl was very happy and ran back to the picnic. 
everybody enjoyed the spicy sprinkle from the sea. 
the end.

once upon a time, there were two friends. one was rich and the other wasn't. one day, they decided to have a race. the rich one had a triangle and the other one had a long stick. they both put their objects on the floor, ready to race.

"ready, set, go!" shouted the rich friend. both of them started to speed across the room. the triangle whizzed faster than the other one, because it was so light. the rich friend won the race, but it was fun for both of them.

when they finished, the poor friend said, "that was fun! but i think i'll stick to using my stick from now on!" the rich friend replied, "that's a good idea!"

the two friends laughed and enjoyed the race. it was a fun time for both of them. they enjoyed playing together and running as fast as they could!

once upon a time, there was a little boy named john. he was very keen to win a prize. one day, he saw a big contest was being held to win a big, shiny prize. he was so excited and he wanted to enter! he started to zip around and around, trying to get to the contest in time. 

but when he reached the contest, he saw it was really dull. all the other entries were plain and boring, and he was the only one who was zipping around. he was disappointed and felt that he didn't stand a chance of winning, but he still decided to compete. 

at the end of the day, john found out he had won the big, shiny prize! everyone around him was so surprised and happy, because he was the only one who was different. 

this story teaches us that it is important to be unique and not be afraid to stand out. being different makes you special and it can help you win prizes if you never give up!
once there was a hungry bunny. he was hopping through the woods in search of something to eat. suddenly, he stopped. he sniffed the air with his nose. what was that delicious smell?

the bunny hopped through some bushes and discovered a patch of juicy carrots! he munched on a few of the carrots and felt very happy. he hopped around the carrots and found more surprises.

the bunny discovered a juicy apple and he hopped around it, excitedly. he was so happy and so hungry, he ate the apple in a few bites. yum!

after that, he hopped a little further. he sniffed the air with his nose and discovered a big, juicy strawberry! he hopped over to it and with one bite, he slurped it all up.

it was a great day for the hungry bunny. he had discovered lots of tasty treats and was very full. he hopped away, feeling happy and content.

mum saw how much he wanted to help, so she said he could help her by giving her a shoulder to lean on. he was so excited! he ran over with a big smile, and he helped mum with her bags.

they went for a walk together and stopped beneath a big green tree. mum said it was a nice spot to take a rest. they both sat down and had a snack and some drinks. suddenly the sun went behind a cloud and everything became cold. so tommy helped his mum to get up, and they went for a walk again.

as they walked, tommy's mum looked down and said "thank you for helping me. i am very happy that you are here with me." tommy was relieved, and smiled very wide. the sun came out from behind the clouds and they enjoyed the bright green trees and flowers in the garden. 

tommy was very happy he had been able to help his mum. he had been able to give her a shoulder to lean on, and she was very grateful. that made him feel amazing.
once upon a time there was a girl who went on a wild adventure. she had a weird rag with her and it was her best friend. one day, she went deep into the forest and came across a strange creature. the creature was so weird that the girl was scared. the creature said, "will you feed me?"

the girl was unsure what to do. she thought about the rag she had with her. she slowly took the rag out of her pocket and offered it to the creature. to her surprise, the creature was so happy! it said, "thank you for feeding me", before it disappeared back into the forest.

the girl was glad she had her rag with her. from then on, she always kept it with her on all of her adventures. she learned that it's better to be kind to creatures, no matter how weird they may look!
once upon a time, there lived a little girl named clara. clara was very curious. one day, she went for a walk in the park with her mom. as she walked around, clara noticed something very special: a lot of colorful notes laid on the ground. 

clara asked her mom what the notes were and her mother said, "these are called notes, and they are very special. we can collect them!"

clara was very excited and she quickly started to collect the notes. but when she placed them in her pocket, she noticed that some of them were dirty. she asked her mother why the notes were dirty.

her mother replied, "sometimes, the wind can make things like this dirty. don't worry, you can still collect them!"

clara smiled, and quickly gathered all the notes she could find. when she was done, she had quite a big collection! she hugged her mom and said, "thank you for helping me collect these!"

sam searched and searched, but he couldn't find the maze. he was so tired from searching that he eventually lay down and rested. he wanted the maze to be close, but he couldn't find it.

finally, he tried one last time and found the entrance to the maze. he started to walk through it, but the maze was too tricky and he got lost. he didn't know what to do and eventually gave up.

sam sadly returned home without finding the maze. he wasn't successful because he couldn't find it. he was disappointed, but he still had his plan to try again and be successful.

they chose a spot under a tree and opened their lunch boxes. they ate sandwiches, drank juice, and enjoyed their special picnic. after they ate their lunch, they tossed around a ball and ran up and down hills. 

they celebrated their friendship as they enjoyed the sunshine and played together. even when the clouds come, they always have something to celebrate!

one day, sandy got hurt and she was very upset. she had hurt her ankle and was worried she would never dance again.

sandy's mother saw how distressed she was, so she decided to help. she put a bandage on sandy's ankle and sang her a special healing song. she said, "everyone gets hurt sometimes, but that doesn't mean you can't still dance. with a little time and patience, you will heal and be dancing again!" 

and that's exactly what happened. sandy's ankle healed and she could dance again. she remembered the lesson her mom had taught her; that sometimes when life is tough, the best thing to do is to be patient and give it time. eventually, you will heal and be better than before!

one day, mandy was practising throwing her model plane, when suddenly she saw an eagle soaring in the sky. it was so beautiful, she decided she wanted to throw her plane higher so she could be like the eagle. 

but this time, her plane flew too high and too far away. mandy began to worry. she searched everywhere, but the plane was gone. she was sad and upset. 

suddenly, she heard a rustling sound in the nearby bushes. she looked over and saw her plane was safely perched on a branch. she was so relieved and quickly ran over to retrieve it.

the girl stuck her arm in the bush, and the cat jumped out, into her arms. she said to the cat, "are you ok?" the cat purred and rubbed against her neck.

the little girl was so happy to have rescued the cat. she hugged the cat and thanked it for joining her for a flute performance in the park. the cat meowed and seemed to understand. from then on, the little girl was never alone when she went to play her flute in the park.
once upon a time there was a cherry tree in a big field. one day, the tree was busy loading lots of big and juicy cherries. it was a mysterious sight to see! everyone in the village wanted to get a cherry, but they were too high up the tree. 

the village men thought of a plan. they brought a ladder and tried to climb up the tree to get the cherries. but the ladder was too small and it didn't reach the cherries. 

then a clever girl had an idea. she told the village men to get a long piece of string and tie it to the cherries. she then pulled the string until the cherries fell down from the tree. everyone was so happy and the girl was very proud. 

the village men loaded all the cherries into a big basket and took them back to the village. everyone had a wonderful time enjoying the delicious cherries. it was such a mysterious and wonderful day!

once there was a brave frog. he was looking for a home. he hopped and hopped for days. suddenly, he came to a big swamp. he felt lonely, but he decided to explore it. 

as he hopped around, he saw something strange. something seemed to happen in the middle of the swamp. he was curious. he hopped closer and saw a big orange snake. the snake seemed angry. 

the frog was scared, but he wanted to find out what was happening. he hopped closer and saw a pond nearby. that's when he noticed a small blue frog. it was in the water and the orange snake was trying to get it. 

the brave frog knew he had to help the little blue frog. he jumped right into the pond. the snake was taken by surprise and quickly left. the small blue frog thanked the brave frog.

the brave frog now had a new home, and he wasn't lonely anymore. he had a new friend in the swamp. together they hopped around and explored the swamp. they made sure the orange snake never returned.

the farmer was very sad and knew that he had made a mistake by planting fake seeds. he wished he had planted real ones in the soil, but it was too late now.

"maybe something good will happen to me," he said. 

he kept walking and walking, and soon he came upon an old man. the old man smiled at the boy and asked him if he wanted to come to his house. 

the boy followed the old man, but soon he started to feel very bad. he felt like he was not able to move and something was wrong. 

at last they reached the old man's house and the boy started to suffer. he screamed and tried to run away, but the old man had locked the door.

"let's try to improve the pond," said sol.

"that sounds unusual," smiled toby.

so they both hopped over to the pond and began searching. after looking around, they found some unusual pieces of wood and a few stones. 

toby said, "let's put this wood and stones together to improve the pond."

so, under the watching eyes of the birds, sol and toby built a bridge over the pond. the bridge made the pond look much more unusual.

toby said, "we've done an amazing job! now, frogs can jump over the pond and have more fun."

sol smiled and the two friends watched as a frog hopped across the bridge. it was an exciting improvement, and toby and sol were proud of their work.

the brave knight was determined to explore it, so he got off his horse and began to climb. he was surprised to see that the volcano looked much bigger up close. he kept climbing, and finally reached the top. 

when he looked inside, his heart sank. he saw bubbling lava rising up and down. but before he could turn around and run, a giant dragon flew out of the volcano. 

the dragon glared at the brave knight. he could feel his courage weakening, but he still tried to fight it. he grabbed his sword, but the dragon just roared and nodded its head. the knight was filled with fear and he ran as fast as he could away from the volcano. he never looked back.

sam saw a big scale in the corner of the room. he was very excited and he had a lot of questions for his mom.

"mom, what is that?" inquired sam.

"it's a scale," replied his mom. "it weighs things."

sam looked at the scale and said, "can i try it? can i weigh something?" 

"sure, why not!" his mom said with a smile.

sam grabbed a rock from the floor and placed it on the scale. he carefully moved the weight around until it reached zero.

"wow," said sam with a huge smile. "it's so dull!" 

his mom laughed and said, "glad you had fun, sam. now let's find something else to do!"
once there was a little boy named ben. ben liked shiny things, so when he saw a copper penny on the ground he ran over to get it. he liked the way the penny glinted in the sun.

but when ben picked the penny up, he noticed a little ant underneath. the ant was trying hard to carry a small piece of food back to its nest. ben knew the penny was too heavy for the ant, so he decided to help.

he knew the ant would not give up, so ben insisted that he take the penny inside his house. he placed the penny in a special place in his room and promised to help the ant get its food back. he was determined and very persistent.

after several tries ben was able to get the food to the ant's nest. the ant was very happy and thanked ben for his kindness. ben smiled and thanked the ant back. he was glad the ant was safe, and now he could keep the shiny copper penny that he found.

sam was a bald man. every day he would put on his special jacket. the jacket was very important to sam. it had lots of pockets, and in them was all the things he needed to record the day. he had a very special recording device that would help him remember everything he had seen and done during the day. 

sam liked to take walks and look at the things around him. he would record the colors of the trees, the shapes of the clouds, the sound of the birds, and all sorts of other things. he was very curious and enjoyed recording the world.

today, he went to the park to record things he hadn't seen before. he recorded the colors of the flowers, the speed of a squirrel running across the grass, and the sound of children playing. 

at the end of the day, sam took off his special jacket and carefully put away his recording device. he smiled, happy to remember the things he had seen and heard. from now on, he would keep the recording in his memory and enjoy the world around him.

but, when the vendor went to the checkout line, they realized they didn't have enough money to pay for the things they wanted.

the vendor became very sad and decided to leave the store. on the way back, they passed by the park. there they saw many people playing, enjoying the sunshine. the vendor suddenly had an idea. 

they decided to pack up some of the things they had and sold them at the park. everyone loved the different items, and the vendor soon made enough money to buy all they wanted from the store.

one day, jimmy found a broken toy on the ground. he was so excited! he knew his mama could repair it.

jimmy quickly ran back home and asked his mama if she could repair the toy. but his mama said she was very busy and had lots of work to do. jimmy was disappointed and walked away sadly. 

the next day jimmy asked his mama again, but she was still too busy. jimmy was sad, but he thought of an idea. he searched the village and asked all his friends if any of them could repair the toy. 

finally, jimmy found his best friend, ben. ben said he could do the repair. jimmy was so excited! they worked together to repair the toy.

when they were finished, the toy was like new and looked so cool! jimmy was so happy. he thanked ben for the repair. jimmy and ben had lots of fun playing with the toy. 

jimmy was so glad he had thought of the idea to ask his friends for help. he promised himself to always be brave and never give up.

once upon a time there was a little girl who wanted to travel. she looked up at the tall vine growing over her head and decided to climb it. she grabbed onto the vine and began to climb. as she got higher and higher, an old man noticed her and called out to her.

"where are you going, child?" he asked. 

the little girl grinned. "up!" she said and kept on climbing. 

the old man chuckled. "you can't reach the sky," he said. "but if you keep going, you'll reach the end of the vine."

so the little girl kept climbing and eventually reached the top of the tall vine. as she looked around, she felt so happy and proud of herself. she took in a deep breath of fresh air and said, "i did it! i traveled the tall vine!"

as she looked around, she knew it was time to go home. she carefully made her way back down the vine until she felt safe to jump down.

the old man was waiting for her with a smile on his face. "you travelled the tall vine bravely," he said.

she smiled and said, "yep, i did it! it was so fun!" 

the old man said, "that's what adventure is all about. keep exploring and never stop travelling!"

a nice lady in the neighbourhood saw that the boys were scared and very sorry. she said to them: "boys, be careful next time. sometimes things can break when we are playing so we must be careful."

ben and jack looked at each other and nodded. they decided to go back home and clean up the mess they made. 

the boys knew that from then on they were always going to be careful when playing, so nothing like this would happen again. 

moral of the story: be careful when playing so you don't make a mess!

the rabbit followed the fox's directions and soon enough, he had found his way home. from that day on, the rabbit always looked out for the wise old fox and thanked him for helping him find his way home.

finally, sarah got to the edge of the creek. she paused and looked down. the water looked so clear and the sun shone brightly in a fair way on the surrounding rocks. sarah was tempted to jump in, but something made her hesitate. she thought it was too dangerous and she was scared to dare it. 

still, sarah just couldn't resist the urge to feel the water. she slowly made her way down the side of the creek, until she was standing right at the edge. she slowly reached out her hand to touch the water. it felt even colder than she expected. 

sarah looked in amazement - the creek was so much more beautiful than she expected! she finally mustered up the courage to jump in. she was delighted to find out that the water was still quite shallow. she realized that it was nothing to be afraid of, and she delighted in the feeling of the fair waters on her skin. 

from that day forward, sarah was always up for a dare. she had overcome her fear of the creek, and she came to know it like the back of her hand.

one day, he heard a ring coming from the nearby jungle. he turned his head to look and saw a little dictionary dancing in the air. he became so excited because it was so playful. 
the elephant asked the dictionary, "what are you doing?". the dictionary responded in a sweet voice, "i'm ringing around and having fun!" 
the elephant smiled and said, "that sounds like fun! let me join you!" 
the little dictionary and the pink elephant then began to ring around the jungle and had a great time. all their friends stopped to watch the playful pair. 

when they were tired, they stopped to take a rest. the elephant thanked the dictionary for such a fun day. the dictionary said, "thank you! that was so much fun! we should do it again soon!" 
the elephant and dictionary then said their goodbyes and went their separate ways. from that day onward, they were the best of friends.

the girl asked, "can you show me something cool?" to her surprise, the figure started dancing around! she clapped and cheered, amazed by the display.

one night, sophie dreamed of a beautiful laser that shimmered and sparkled in every color of the rainbow. as she looked at the laser, she wished she could have one for herself.

once there was a man called bob. bob liked to do naughty things. he did not listen to the rules. he sometimes skipped school and stole toys from other kids.

one day, bob did something very naughty. he stole a car and drove it away. the police caught him and put him in jail.

in jail, bob felt very uncomfortable. he had to stay there all day and night. he was not allowed outside and he couldn't do any of his silly activities.

but one day, bob changed his ways. he stopped doing naughty things and followed the rules. he said sorry to everyone he had hurt.

the police were very happy with this. they agreed to set him free from jail and make his life more comfortable. they bought bob a new house and gave him a new job. 

bob finally felt comfortable again. he made sure he followed the rules and thanked the police for helping him. he was very relieved to not have to go back to jail ever again.
once upon a time there was a girl named lucy. she loved to explore and today she had found a very special stream. the stream seemed to have come out of nowhere and was unknown to her.

lucy slowly approached the stream and discovered it was very cold. suddenly, she noticed that the stream was melting and becoming liquid! lucy was amazed and she decided to take a closer look.

she slowly stepped closer to the stream and the cold liquid touched her toes. the sensation was amazing and lucy began to laugh. she splashed around in the liquid and made some funny bubbles.

but soon, the sun was beginning to set and lucy knew it was time to go home. she wished she could stay and explore the unknown stream, but she knew it was time to go.

so, lucy dried off and said goodbye to the stream. she might never explore the stream again, but she would remember it always.

lucy slowly ate the soup and her strength slowly came back. she felt much better, and momma was happy that the soup had made lucy strong again. 

the end.

the two walked cautiously, anna holding tightly onto jack's hand into the darkness of the forest. as they got closer, anna could see a large, fierce bear standing before them. the bear was growling angrily and blocking their way.

jack looked very scared but he still managed to smile and said, "we should turn around and go back". anna smiled and nodded, and they both ran quickly out of the forest.

the two were very relieved to be out of the dark forest and away from the large bear. they gave each other a big hug and smiled, happy that they were safe.

lily slowly tiptoed towards the tree where the owl was perched on. the owl looked down at her but did not move. lily was so close that she could even touch the owl. she looked carefully at all its features and examined every detail.

the owl was sitting so still and seemed happy that lily was there. lily smiled at it and said 'hello'. the owl didn't say anything. lily said goodbye and thanked the owl for letting her examine it.

the rides at the fun-fair were so fun. jack and sam went on them over and over again. they laughed and smiled so much that their faces were very red.

but no one answered the door. molly knocked again, a little louder this time. "let me in!" she demanded.

the bridge was held together by the rope the little boy had untied earlier. he was so excited and proud that his curiosity had solved the mystery. he tied the rope back together and happily crossed the bridge. from then on, he remembered to always be curious!
