one day, the whale was enjoying a swim when it noticed a tiny boat floating nearby. a small girl was inside the boat, waving her hands and smiling. the whale felt so happy that it started to jump and splash around in the water.

the little girl clapped her hands and cheered for the whale. this made the whale so very happy; it shot out of the water, creating a big splash. everyone near the beach was so amazed that they started applauding too!

the whale and the little girl spent the day having lots of fun. they played tag and blew bubbles. the whale showed off its tricks and the little girl laughed in delight. it was the best day ever. at the end of the day, they said goodbye and the whale waved as the little girl sailed away.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named daisy. daisy had a jolly day in her backyard, playing with her dolls. the sun was shining brightly and daisy was so happy.

suddenly, her mom came out of the house and called her. 'daisy, come here! i have a surprise for you,' her mom said. daisy was filled with excitement and quickly ran to her mom. 

'here you go, darling. i bought this for you,' her mom said holding out a toy. daisy was so excited, she thanked her mom for the surprise. 

after that, every day daisy would ask her mom to supply her with new toys. and every day her mom would fulfill her wish. 

but one day, her mom told daisy 'no' when daisy asked her for a new toy. daisy was so disappointed, she started crying and begging her mom. 

her mom shook her head and said, 'i can't always supply you with everything you want, daisy. you should learn to be content.'

this made daisy understand that she shouldn't always expect to be given things. it was a bad ending, but it was good to learn a moral lesson. excessive wanting is not always a good thing.
one day the sky was grey. it was starting to rain. it was so silly!

the rain started to pitter-patter on the ground. the trees were dripping with water. all the people outside ran for cover.

nancy was watching from her bedroom window. she saw the funny sight of people running away from the rain. it made her giggle.

but she didn't mind the rain too much. she ran outside and twirled under the raindrops. it felt so cool and refreshing.

the rain eventually stopped and the sun came out. everything was so sparkly and colourful. what a silly sight! nancy smiled, happy to be outside again.
one day, there was a girl who wanted to play in her room. she had a big, soft carpet which was perfect for playing. she was happy.

suddenly, she had an idea and started running around the carpet. she was having lots of fun. 

as she ran around, she accidentally splashed water on the carpet. she felt embarrassed. 

the girl was worried, but then she remembered something. she ran to the kitchen, grabbed a towel and started to dry the carpet. 

soon, it was all dry and she was happy again. she had learned her lesson and promised to be careful the next time.
once there was a girl called jane. she was very shy and always preferred to stay alone. as jane grew, she wanted to make friends but felt too scared to try. one day, she decided to take a chance.

jane walked up to the group of children and slowly said, "hi." the children turned to her in surprise.

"what do you want?" asked the tallest boy.

"i was wondering if i could join you," jane answered.

the children looked at one another and then smiled. "sure! we'd love it if you'd play with us," said the same tall boy.

jane smiled, her face turning red. she was so excited to make friends. they played all sorts of games, even with a thermometer that the tall boy had added. and, before she knew it, jane had made a brand new group of friends.
bob was a very sad boy. he sat in his office and sighed. he was feeling very fragile. then, something magical happened! a beautiful butterfly flew into his office and began to dance in front of him. its wings were colourful and sparkled in the sunlight. bob smiled and suddenly he felt like he could do anything. he got up from his chair and jumped and sprang out of the office. he kept on jumping and springing down the street, feeling very happy. he waved to everyone he saw and everyone smiled back at him. he felt so free and happy he wanted the feeling to last forever.
once upon a time, there was a little girl. she wanted to be successful, and to make her dream come true she had to build a special engine. the engine was very tricky and it took her a long time to figure it out.

finally, one day she finished it, and it worked! the engine started to run, and the little girl was very happy. she hopped and danced, and thanked her engine for being so successful. 

the engine ran every day and every night, and it kept the little girl's dreams alive. she was so thankful for being so successful, and she thanked her engine every day. 

the end.
once upon a time, a poor hedgehog named jennifer lived deep in the woods. she was very sad because she wasn't rich like the other animals. one day, as jennifer was walking, she found a sparkly gold coin. then she heard a distant voice. 

"slide that coin over here," said the voice.

jennifer looked and saw a big, glossy fox. he had a long tail and a golden cap. jennifer slid the coin towards the fox.

"i am very rich," the fox said, "and one gold coin won't make a difference. but why don't you have it? keep it and do something nice for yourself!"

jennifer's eyes lit up with joy. she said thank you and hugged the fox. from then on, whenever jennifer needed something, she would spend a few coins and feel rich. she would slide her coins to the shopkeeper and smile. 

the fox was so pleased that he visited jennifer from time to time with more coins. jennifer was happy and the fox's tail wagged in joy. 

the end.
the sun was shining and the sky was blue. all the animals were playing in the meadow and the birds were singing.

suddenly, it started to rain and the meadow began to soak. the animals were so sad; all of their fun had stopped.

but then the sun came out again. a rainbow appeared in the sky, so charming and bright. everyone was happy again.

the meadow was still a bit wet, yet it was still perfect for playing and running. the animals and birds rejoiced, as the rain had made the meadow even more beautiful.

and so they all played together in the sunshine, so happy in their meadow again.
once there was a compassionate policeman. he loved to talk to everyone. he always had a smile ready for anyone he met.

one day, a little girl came to the police station. she was very scared and had been crying. she was all alone.

the policeman knelt down and asked her what was wrong. the little girl told him about a mean man that had taken her seat on the bus.

the policeman felt sorry for the little girl. he was so gentle and compassionate. he told her he would help her get her seat back.

the policeman called a few of his friends and together they went to the bus station. they approached the man who had taken the girl's seat and demanded that he give it back to her.

the mean man muttered something but finally he got up and moved to the back of the bus, so the little girl could have her seat back. the little girl was so happy and she thanked the policeman and his friends. the policeman smiled and went back to the police station with his friends.
once upon a time there was a little boy. he was walking in the woods near his home when he heard a loud noise. he stopped to listen and heard a meow. he followed the sound and found a kitty stuck up in a tree. the little boy wanted to help. he saw a fisherman nearby so he shouted for him to come help.

the fisherman was very nice. he said he would help rescue the kitty. he quickly made a bossy plan to get it down. with the fisherman's help, the kitty was soon free from the tree.

the little boy was so happy his new friend was safe! he thanked the fisherman for his help. as the boy walked home, he felt like the brave rescuer. he could almost imagine himself as a brave fisherman, rescuing cats from trees.
once upon a time, there was a little boy. he was stubborn, and he never wanted to do what his mom said. one day, she told him to put on his shoes. but he didn't want to! he sneezed, and he jumped on one knee. he laughed and laughed and he wouldn't put on his shoes.

his mom said, "you need to put your shoes on, danny! it's time to go out!" but danny was very stubborn and he just ignored her. he laughed and laughed and sneezed again.

finally, his mom said, "that's it! i'm coming to sit on your knee!" danny laughed and laughed some more. his mom came over and sat on his knee, and soon enough he agreed to put on his shoes. he was still a little bit stubborn, but at least he put his shoes on. the end!
there were two friends, ben and molly. ben was always telling molly about the things he knew. one day he said, "i recommend getting a diamond. it's one of the best things ever." molly thought it was a good idea, so she said she would get one.

the next week, ben and molly went to the store. ben thought molly should get a real diamond, but molly said she didn't have enough money so she was going to get a fake one instead. ben was disappointed and tried to convince her to get the real diamond, but she didn't want to listen. 

eventually, molly bought the fake diamond and they both left the store. little did molly know, the diamond was fake! ben knew all along, but he didn't want to tell molly because he wanted her to learn her lesson.

the next week when molly looked at her diamond, it started to fall apart. she was upset and wished she had listened to ben. molly called ben and said, "i should've taken your advice! i wish i had gotten the real diamond!" ben just said, "i told you so!"
once upon a time, there was a little girl called karen. she was three years old and loved to play. karen loved to kick the ball around in her garden.

one day, karen kicked the ball very high. it went right over the fence and into the neighbour's garden! karen hopped over the fence to get it back.

when she got to the other garden, karen found a brilliant prize! it was shiny and sparkly, and even had her name written on it.

karen was so excited; she had found a special prize. she quickly grabbed the prize and ran back to her garden. karen was so happy, she started to kick the ball around again!
once upon a time there was a giant tree in a hidden forest. every night an owl would come and rest in its branches. one night the owl heard a strange noise. 

the owl looked down and noticed a body in the clearing. curious, the owl flew down and investigate. 

the owl asked, â€œwho are you?â€

the body replied, â€œi am the guardian of the hidden forest. i am here to protect it from any harm.â€

the owl said, â€œcan i help you?â€

the body replied, â€œyes, remove the rocks that are blocking the path.â€ 

the owl obliged and flew around the forest. after a few hours the owl had removed all the rocks.

the body said, â€œthank you for your help, now the hidden forest is safe.â€ 

the owl said farewell and flew away, happy that it had helped the guardian of the hidden forest.

mary said, â€œthis is so much fun! we can play hoop games all day!â€

the hoop gave a happy sigh. they were so glad to finally have someone to play with. from then on, mary and the hoop would play together in the playground every day.
once upon a time there was a girl. she was very impatient. she wanted to write something, but she didn't have a pen. the girl saw a stick! she was so excited. she thought "this stick will do". she started to write with it. the stick was too hard and it broke. the girl was angry. she threw the broken stick away and started to cry. she had to wait until she could buy a pen and write her story. the end.
once upon a time, there was a giant who had a gentle heart. he loved to play with all of the animals, so he decided to dig a hole for them to hide in. but one day, he was playing with a new toy, and it made the hole shrink!

the animals were so scared when they could no longer fit inside. the giant tried to find a way to help, but he was too sad to think of one.

suddenly, an ant came to the giant and said, "i know a way to help. if you use your gentle hands, you can spread some dirt around the edges and the hole will be big enough to fit again."

the giant listened to the ant, and he carefully spread the dirt around the edges. sure enough, the hole grew and the animals were able to get back inside.

the giant was so relieved, and he thanked the ant for the clever suggestion. from then on, he was extra careful with his toys and never made the hole shrink again.
once upon a time, there was a group of eager toddlers. they were always on the lookout for any fun activity that they could do together. one day, they gathered around their teacher and asked, "teacher, can we do something fun?". their teacher smiled and said, "yes, why don't you rub your tummies with both hands?"

the toddlers were excited and started to rub their tummies. none of them wanted to stop, so they kept going and going. they rubbed and rubbed until they started to get tired.

suddenly, one of the toddlers got too eager and he rubbed so hard that he started to cry. the others in the group immediately stopped and they gathered around their crying friend.

the teacher came to the rescue. she knelt down and comforted the toddler while gently taking his hands away from his tummy. she said, "it's ok. you can be eager, but you must be gentle." 

the group of toddlers looked relieved and they all promised to be more gentle when rubbing their tummies. the group went back to having fun together.

one day, john's sister got sick and had to stay in bed. john wanted to help her feel better, so he held her hand and whispered words of love. he sang her his favorite songs and told her special stories.

after a few days, john's family knew that his love was helping his sister heal. they could see that his pepper words and songs were making her smile and she was soon feeling much better.

john was so happy that he could heal his sister with just love. he had shown her just how much he cared and he was glad that his love had helped bring her health back.

once upon a time there was a little boy named timmy. he loved to go for walks. one day, timmy was walking to the top of a hill. on the hill he saw a broken bike. it looked like it had been pushed over.

"wow!" said timmy. "i bet i could ride this!" he started to push the bike and it moved fast. 

timmy went faster and faster. he heard his mom calling him from the bottom of the hill. but he didn't want to stop. suddenly, he hit a bump. the broken bike broke even more. timmy went flying off.

"oh no!" said his mom. she ran to him. timmy was crying. he had broken his arm.

the moral of the story is to not go too fast. timmy was lucky that he only hurt his arm and not something worse. always listen to your mom so you don't get hurt.
molly and timmy wanted to color. but there was no table to put their coloring book on. timmy was confused. he asked molly what they should do. she smiled and said, "let's hope for a table!" so molly and timmy both held their hands in the air and hoped for a table.

suddenly, the door opened. it was molly's mom. she brought in a big table! she said, "i found this in the attic," with a big smile on her face. molly and timmy cheered and thanked molly's mom.

then they set their table up in the living room. they opened their coloring books and got to coloring. they sat around the table and made many beautiful pictures. molly and timmy smiled. they were so happy they had a table!
mommy and lucy were in their garden. mommy showed lucy a flower pot and said, "look lucy! this wire is coming out of the ground. it's very ugly." lucy was so excited to see it.

mommy said, "let's take this wire away. it's not very nice." so mommy got a shovel and started to dig around the wire. lucy watched and helped.

mommy said, "now we will spray this flower pot to make it look better!" lucy liked the idea and ran to the kitchen to get the sprayer.

mommy and lucy sprayed the pot together. when they finished, the pot was even prettier than before. mommy smiled and said, "see how much nicer it looks!"

lucy was proud of what she had done. she smiled and said, "i helped make it pretty!"

mommy ruffled lucy's hair and said, "yes you did, honey! now let's go inside for some ice cream."

lucy was so happy. she'd helped mommy and made the ugly flower pot pretty again.

he would rest between drills and games. he would take a break and sip some water. after resting he was ready to practice again.

sometimes his hockey marbles would go very fast. he was so proud when his mom cheered him on. he could feel that he was getting gifted at playing hockey.

at the end of the day he was tired. he needed to rest his body and mind. so he grabbed his hockey stick and went home. he needed some rest to be ready for the next day.
once upon a time, there was a little girl called amy. she was very hungry. her tummy felt funny and all she wanted was something yummy. so she went outside to look for something to eat.

as she walked, the sky grew dark and a storm began. big rain drops started to fall and thunder clapped in the sky. amy was scared and started to cry.

but then, she heard a voice from behind, saying "amy, don't worry". when she looked back, she saw her mommy. her mommy opened her umbrella and said, "come here, i will squeeze you tight".

amy felt much better when her mommy held her. she knew she felt safe and loved in her mommy's arms.

from that day on, amy learned that when times were tough and the storm was scary, all she had to do was squeeze her mommy and she would feel safe. this taught her that love was one of the most important things in life.

little john was in the park too, playing with his friends. he saw the old man walking and he stopped to watch him. little john was very thoughtful and he wondered why the man was so happy. 

suddenly, the old man stopped whistling and looked over at little john. he said, â€œwhy donâ€™t you come and join me in a sing-along?â€ little john was so excited! he quickly ran over to the man and started singing along with him. 

the old man and little john whistled and sang together for hours. everywhere they went, people could be heard clapping and cheering for them. little john had never been so happy before! 

that day, little john learned an important lesson - that being thoughtful and kind can make other people happy too.
once upon a time there was a tidy family. they had a nice house and were very happy together. but one day something bad happened - they split up! the little girl in the family was very sad and didn't understand why. her parents didn't explain either. she was sad because she wanted her family to stay together, but they had split. 

the little girl was determined to get her family back together again. she worked hard to make her house tidy, so that she would be a good example for her family. she wanted her family to be happy again.

every morning she woke up early, to sweep and clean her house. after a few days, she noticed something. her parents were coming to visit and bringing presents with them! the little girl was so glad that her efforts had worked. after lots of hugs, her family was back together again!
once upon a time there was a little duck called tom. tom wanted to have an adventure and explore the world outside his pond. one day, tom made an organized plan - he wanted to build a sail and go for a travel. he gathered all the materials he needed and soon he had the most beautiful sail ever made.

tom was so excited that he couldn't wait to leave. he sailed far away and didn't look back.

as he sailed, he saw many interesting creatures and exciting locations. he felt so safe and protected travelling by sea. 

after a few days, a terrible storm hit the ocean and tom's sail was no longer safe. he tried to protect it with all his might but it was no match for the storm. 

the sail broke to pieces and tom was thrown into the sea. he tried to swim back to the shore but he was too exhausted and eventually sunk under the water and was never seen again.
once upon a time, there was a man. he was very nice and always gave things to people. one day, he had a white cross. he wanted to give it away. so he found a little girl and brought the cross to her.

the little girl was so happy and she said, "thank you!" but, when the man left, the cross started to feel heavy. the little girl tried to take it off, but it wouldn't move. it was stuck.

the little girl began to cry and she tried to ask for help, but no one came. finally, she had to carry the cross everywhere she went. no matter where she went, the white cross was always with her.

the little girl never found a way to get rid of the cross. she was stuck with it forever. and that's the bad ending to the story.
once upon a time, there lived a grumpy old man. every day he would grow more and more angry. one day, he had had enough. he grabbed a big clock from the wall and marched outside with it.

the old man sat down and began to chew on the clock. he felt very angry and he wanted to take his anger out on the clock. he chewed and chewed, until finally the clock was no more than just a few pieces of metal.

when the old man had finished, he looked around and noticed a tired-looking, little girl sitting nearby. the girl had been watching him the whole time but she hadn't said a word.

the old man smiled and said, "what a calmyou are!" the girl smiled back, but then she looked at the destroyed clock and gasped in horror.

the old man had forgotten he was holding the clock and he felt embarrassed. he quickly said goodbye to the little girl and ran away. he never wanted to be reminded of what he had done.

the moral of the story is to not let your anger take control of you.
once upon a time there was a little girl who loved to go outside and explore her neighborhood. one day she wandered into a big park and noticed a friendly old man. he smiled and asked her if she wanted to hear a story.

the girl said yes, excitedly. he smiled and whispered: â€œonce upon a time there was a brave knight who carried a bow. he was gentle, kind and compassionate. he used his bow to protect the people in his kingdom and they were very grateful.

the man then asked the little girl, â€œdo you know what the most important thing was to the brave knight?â€

the little girl shook her head. â€œitâ€™s his compassion. he was able to show kindness to everyone and help make the kingdom a better place.â€ 

the man smiled warmly and the little girl thanked him for the story. she went home feeling inspired and determined to be kind like the brave knight, who never stopped using his bow and showing compassion to everyone.
once upon a time, there were two friends named sarah and tony, who loved to go for walks in their town. one day, they wanted to explore a part of town they hadn't seen before. they had to choose which way to go. there was a beautiful creek with a bridge that crossed over it or a dark, mysterious forest. 

tony chose the creek and they headed towards the bridge. it was a beautiful walk and they found a lot of new things to explore. but when they reached the bridge, they stopped. it looked old and dangerous, and they weren't sure if it was safe to cross. 

sarah stopped and thought for a moment. she said to tony, "let's not cross it, tony. it looks too dangerous. let's find another way."

tony realized sarah was right, and they chose the safe option. they found a nicer, safer bridge to cross, and they safely made it to the other side of the creek and found some wonderful things to explore.

the moral of the story is that it is important to choose the safe option, even if it is not the most exciting. taking chances can be dangerous and it is better to make wise choices.
once upon a time, there lived a strong little giraffe. he had a dream to leave his home and explore, so one day he packed his things and set off.

he soon arrived at a great lake, but he had no way of crossing it. just then, a nice hippo came along and said, "i can help you cross. just hop onto my back!"

the giraffe was so happy and hopped onto the hippo's back. as they swam across the lake, the hippo said, "in the middle of the lake, you'll need to grab the pole so we can keep swimming straight."

the giraffe grabbed the pole with his strong hooves and kept steady as the hippo continued to swim. soon they made it to the other side, and they both said goodbye and went their separate ways.

the giraffe was so grateful for the help of the hippo and continued his journey feeling stronger than ever. in the end, he achieved his dream and left to explore the world.
once upon a time, there was a pig and a sheep who were good friends. one day they decided to go on an adventure and went to a fountain in the middle of a forest. the pig said to the sheep, "look, let's feed the fountain some food." the sheep asked, "what have we got to feed it?" the pig thought for a moment and said, "let's find some hairy fruit!"

so the two friends began looking for food. they found lots of hairy fruits and wanted to feed the fountain. they threw all the fruit into the fountain but nothing happened. the fountain was still dry. the two friends went back to the fountain and the sheep said, "maybe we need to feed the fountain more than just food." 

the pig replied, "you are right! let's put some of our love into the fountain too." so they both held hands, put their hearts and souls into the fountain and said, "let our love feed the fountain."

suddenly, the fountain burst out with the clearest water they had ever seen! they quickly filled their buckets and brought it back to their home.

the moral of this story is that when you give love you also receive it. we need to fill our hearts with love and share it with others.
john had his own paint. he was very excited and happy to show it to his mom. he said, "mommy, i own paint!" his mom replied, "that's great john, let's paint together!" so, they opened the paint and john started to draw with it.

after a while, john finished his masterpiece and it looked so beautiful to him. he said to his mom, "look mommy, i own tight paint!"

his mom was surprised and said, "wow john, that's very impressive. let's hang it up!" but, before they could hang the painting, john had an accident and the paint got smeared all over the place. his mom tried to console him but john was devastated and sad. 

the bad ending had been foreshadowed ever since john opened his paint; his mom had warned him several times to be careful and not play around with the paint too much. but, inevitably, he went against his mother's advice and it cost him dearly in the end.
once upon a time, there was a little girl who lived in a small house in the country. she had a beautiful yellow blanket that her grandma had given her. she loved to snuggle up in it and take it with her everywhere.

one day, she was taking a nap in her bedroom with her blanket over her. suddenly, she heard a sound coming from outside her window. it sounded like ruffling and rustling. she got up and looked, and saw a little mouse digging around in the garden. she said, â€œhey, little mouse, why are you disturbing my nap?â€

the mouse looked up at her and said, â€œi just wanted to find something to wrap myself up in so i could take a nice nap. do you think you could let me borrow your blanket?â€

the little girl thought about it for a moment, and then said, â€œsure, i donâ€™t mind. here, you can have my blanket. just be careful with it, itâ€™s very little.â€

the mouse thanked her, and with her blanket covering her, it quickly ran away into the night. the little girl was glad she could help the mouse, and she went back to sleep, feeling warm and cozy in her little blanket.
once upon a time there was an island. it was a beautiful and sunny place. on the island there was a big bell, and the bell would always ring. 

one day a little girl named lucy heard the bell ringing. "what's that?" she said, "it sounds so nice!"

suddenly, a parrot came flying down from the sky and landed on lucy's shoulder. "that bell," said the parrot, "is a magical bell. if you touch it, it will take you anywhere you want to go!"

lucy was so excited and so she touched the bell. immediately, she found herself on a beautiful tropical island. it was so wonderful! everywhere she looked were amazing things to see.

after exploring the island, lucy found a nice restaurant with a wonderful smell coming from it. she decided to go inside to check it out. 
 inside, lucy found a spicy stew that smelled heavenly. she could hardly wait to try it!

lucy took a big spoonful of the stew and tasted it. it was so delicious! from then on, that little island was always known as lucy's island because of its amazing and spicy stew.
once upon a time, there was a little girl who lived at the beach. every day, she would take a bucket and shovel and build a sandcastle. she loved to watch the giant waves crashing against it. one day, she decided to build an extra big sandcastle!

as she was making it, a shark swam towards her. the girl screamed and ran away from the shark. but then, it swam up to her and said, "don't be scared! i just want to help you build your sandcastle!"

the girl was still afraid, but the shark said, "i'm a friendly shark! i won't hurt you, i promise!" so the girl reached into her pocket and pulled out a little open bag of sand. she sprinkled it over the sandcastle and the shark used his tail to spread it around. together, they built a beautiful sandcastle.

the girl and her new friend said goodbye and, as the waves gently washed away the sandcastle at the end of the day, the girl was happy knowing that she and the friendly shark had built something wonderful together.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named grace. grace was obedient and always did what the grown-ups told her. her parents were so proud of little grace.

one day, grace and her parents had to go to the lawyer. grace didn't understand why, but she knew it was important, and she was still obedient.

at the lawyer, grace's parents said that someone had broken the law. grace didn't understand what the law was, but she could tell this was something serious.

the lawyer said that if everyone was obedient, they could try to fix the problem. grace was so good, her parents gave her a hug, as if they were proud of her.

grace didn't understand completely what was happening, but she knew something was about to change. her parents were doing everything they could to make sure the law was followed. 

the lawyer and her parents worked hard to make sure that justice was served. in the end, the law was obeyed, and it was because of grace's obedience. 

the moral of the story is that being obedient is good.
tommy and julie were in the kitchen with their mom. they were making dinner. 
"what are we doing, mommy?" tommy asked.
"we're making dinner. we are going to mix the beef together," said mommy. she pointed to the bowl with the beef inside. 
julie frowned. "i don't wanna mix the beef. it looks miserable!"
tommy laughed. "don't worry, julie. we're just making dinner!"
mommy smiled. "that's right. now we need to mix it all together."
so tommy and julie mixed the beef together. when they were done, mommy said, "now we have dinner ready!"
tommy and julie smiled. they had made dinner and it was delicious!

as they walked along the path, daisy saw a collar lying on the ground. she excitedly pointed it out to her mum, who paused and said, "let's have a look at this collar, daisy".

they examined the collar together, and daisy noticed that it was a very special collar. but before they could figure out where it came from, daisy's mum quickly put it in her pocket and said, "we'll take it home with us, daisy".

daisy was a bit scared, but she kept walking with her mum. suddenly, she heard a low growl from behind them and looked back. a big, scary dog was standing there, gazing at daisy. she clutched her mum's hand and started trembling.

the two friends looked around and saw a card lying on the ground. it was glowing in the dark. one of the friends was brave and decided to pick it up. but when they touched it, the card began to rise.

the two friends were scared. they backed away slowly. the card kept rising until it stopped moving.

the brave friend stepped forward and said, "what are you?"

the card opened up and out floated a magical butterfly.

the two friends were so happy. the butterfly fluttered around them and then flew away. the friends learn that there was nothing to be scared of.

"what can i do?" emma said.

suddenly, a bright light appeared in the sky. it was the sun, rising slowly into the air. emma smiled.

"let's go outside and play," said emma.

so, emma and her father went outside. the sun was shining and it was a beautiful day. emma ran around in the grass and enjoyed the warm sunshine.

emma's dad said, "it sure is nice to see the sun again. i'm so glad it's a beautiful day."

emma giggled and said, "me too!"

they stayed outside until the sun set in the sky. the sky was still gloomy, but emma was happy.

one day, a boy saw the shape and tried to touch it. the shape got angry and said, "don't touch me!" the boy was scared and ran.

the boy told his mom what had happened. his mom said, "maybe you should have been more friendly. even though the shape was scary, it didn't mean you had to be scared too."

the next day, the shape had increased even more. the boy was curious, so he decided to try again. this time, he said, "hi. i'm very sorry for being scared yesterday. can i look at you?"

but before the shape could reply, it started to grow bigger and bigger until it was too big for the boy to handle. he ran away, scared.

moral: be friendly even to those who appear scary.

the rabbit quickly ran to the mouse. the rabbit said, "you're so foolish! why did you move so fast? you should have thought before you moved. always use caution when touching something you're not familiar with."

the mouse learned his lesson and was more careful after that. he thought before he moved and never made the same mistake again. since then, the mouse and the rabbit had a great time exploring their new world. they never forgot the moral of their story: it is important to think before you move.

once upon a time, there was a small cub and his name was ben. ben was always curious and he wanted to peek around. one day, he decided to peek inside a cave. as he looked into the cave, he saw a lion inside! he was very scared, but the lion was very big and hot.

"please don't be scared," said the lion. "i won't hurt you. i'm just here to help you." 

ben was a little bit relieved, but he was still scared. he wanted to run away and hide. 

"i understand," said the lion. "let me give you some advice. always think before you peek. if something looks scary then it may be too dangerous to take a look."

the lion got up and vanished into the forest. ben was very relieved, but also sad that the lion had gone. he thought about what the lion had said and decided that he would always think before he peeked. 

the moral of the story is that it's ok to be curious, but always be careful and think before you peek!

the small fish smiled in return. from that day on, they enjoyed swimming and bathing in the tide together.

the duck smiled and said, "of course. before i can help, i need you to be very quiet. can you do that?"

once upon a time, there were two friends, neenee and bobo. they were always together and never lonely.

one day, they wanted to hang something pretty. neenee said "let's hang a purple print!" bobo replied "yes, let's hang up a purple print!"

they looked around and found a pretty purple print. neenee held it while bobo tried to hang it. but the wall had no hook to hang it on! neenee felt so sad.

bobo had an idea. he found some tape and told neenee to hold the print. he taped the print on the wall but it ripped! they both felt so sad.

they looked around and saw that the purple print had been ruined. they both cried and neenee said to bobo, "we can't hang that pretty purple print anymore."

one day, maisy saw a gorilla. he was a big, strong animal who looked like he could do anything. she watched him silently, admiring how he easily carried heavy things. maisy wanted to be like the gorilla and succeed.

so, she decided to work hard. she practiced picking up heavy things and carried them from one place to another. she also learned how to swing from tree to tree, like the gorilla, while holding the heavy things. she kept practicing and practicing, and eventually, she succeeded. 

maisy was so proud of herself. she saw that if you worked hard and never gave up, you could do anything you wanted.
once upon a time there were two friends, a fox and a rabbit. they loved spending time together. one day they decided to go on a walk through the forest.

the fox said "let's have a race. the winner gets to have a treat!" 

the rabbit said "okay, let's race!"

the two friends started running. they ran and ran, but the fox was faster. as he ran past, he looked back and poked the rabbit with his paw.

"hey!" the rabbit shouted. "that's not fair!"

the fox laughed and said "maybe if you weren't so careless, you would have won."

the rabbit disagreed and said "but i'm just as fast as you. don't be so sure!" 

the fox and the rabbit laughed and continued walking through the forest. even though he lost, the rabbit was still excited that he tried. soon they discovered they were both winners, because they had the best adventure ever.
once upon a time, there was a bright alert blue bird who lives on top of a tall tree. one clear day, the sun was shining so brightly that the bird could no longer stay awake. so, the bird paused for a moment and decided to take a nap in the sun.

suddenly, the bird was awoken with a loud noise. it was the sound of thunder! the blue bird spread its wings wide and flew to an empty branch just as the sky was getting grey. cautiously, the bird looked around and saw a storm building up in the sky.

the bird then paused again, as if it was building up the courage to fly to safety. with one flutter of its wings, the bird set off, faster and faster, trying to catch up with the dark clouds. the storm was getting bigger and bigger and it was getting windier and windier. 

finally, the bird managed to stay ahead of the storm and landed safely on a tree in a sunny spot on the other side. the blue bird was happy that it had made it in time, and it watched the storm fly away with its bright alert eyes.

the first bear was jealous. he wanted an apple too. he pinched one of the apples and said to his friend, "you have to share. we can both eat an apple."

the second bear smiled. he knew that his best friend was right. he was happy to share the apples. they each ate an apple and had a wonderful time. the end.

once upon a time, there was a curious cow who was always looking for something new. one day the cow decided to explore beyond its usual boundaries. but what the cow didn't know was that the new path ahead would separate it from the other cows for a very long time. 

the cow kept going, more curious than ever before. as it walked further away, the other cows noticed and started to call out. but the cow kept walking and eventually the sound of the other cows faded away. 

everything seemed unfamiliar, but the cow was determined to keep going. unfortunately, the cow didn't realize how far it had gone and before long it was completely lost. 

the cow looked around, but all the scenery seemed strange and unfamiliar. then, just as the cow started to worry, it heard the sound of the other cows again. the cow followed the sound and eventually it found its way back to where it had started. 

the cow was relieved to be back with the other cows and it never ventured that far away again. however, it did remain curious about what was out there beyond its familiar boundaries.

a bunny named alex was feeling sad. he wanted to make himself feel better, but he didn't know how. it was getting harder and harder each day.

then one day, his best friend sam visited him. "what's wrong?" sam asked.

"i'm feeling very difficult," alex said.

"let's go for a walk," sam said. "maybe getting outside will help!"

alex and sam hopped through the grass until they reached a nearby playground. they spotted a swing and hopped over to it.

"let's swing!" sam said.

they hopped up and down on the swing, going higher and higher until they were both laughing. when they stopped, they hopped over to a nearby stream.

sam said, "let's bathe in the stream and make ourselves feel better!"

alex thought that sounded like a good idea. so, they both hopped into the stream and splashed around. finally, alex felt better.

the moral of the story is that doing something fun with a friend can help you feel better whenever you're feeling sad.

once upon a time, there was a little goat named sammy. sammy was a very happy goat who loved to play in the fields all day long. but one day, sammy was feeling worried. he didn't know why, but he just felt something wasn't right.

so sammy went to his friend, the farmer, and asked him, "what's wrong? why do i feel so worried?" the farmer just shrugged and said, "i don't know, sammy. maybe something bad is going to happen. let's keep a look out."

so sammy kept an eye out all day, looking for anything suspicious. he saw some birds flying and some animals scurrying around, but nothing out of the ordinary.

finally, the farmer came out and said, "well, sammy, i think everything is okay. let's go out and have some fun."

so they played in the fields all day, and sammy forgot all about his worries. he had a great time, and knew that all was right in the world.
once upon a time, there was a young boy called tom. tom liked to explore the world around him. one day, tom was playing near a stream. he saw a delicate butterfly flying closely above the water.

tom said to the butterfly, "hi butterfly! i want to dive too!" the butterfly smiled and said, "that is a very good idea! but you must be careful."

tom got into the stream. he was very excited. he wanted to dive as deep as he could. he pushed himself hard into the stream. suddenly he felt his feet reaching a soft, sand floor. he opened his eyes and looked around. the water was so clear he could see all the rocks and fish around him.

tom enjoyed swimming in the stream, he almost forgot to come back up. he remembered just in time and carefully climbed back up to the surface. he said goodbye to the butterfly and ran off to tell his friends his new adventure.

one day, a little girl named mary was walking through the woods. while she was walking, she saw a raven sitting on a tree branch above her. suddenly, the raven flew down to the ground and looked up at mary with its big eyes. it said, "hello!"

mary was very confused. she didn't know what the raven was saying! she just stood there and stared at it.

the raven said, "come on! let's sit down and have a chat!" so mary cautiously sat down next to the raven.

the raven told mary lots of funny stories and soon mary wasn't so confused. she was having a great time.

when it was time to leave, the raven said, "remember, you can always come back and visit me in the woods!"

mary said goodbye to the raven and continued on her way. she felt so happy and glad that she had met the friendly raven.
once upon a time, there was a family that lived next to the ocean. every day they liked to go down to the beach to look at all the wildlife. one day, they saw something special - a net! the family was so excited and they decided to take the net home with them.

when they got back home, the family knew that the net needed to be cleaned. mom said, "we need to be gentle and take care of this net." so the family worked together to clean the net.

the next day the family went back to the beach. they brought their net and threw it into the ocean. mom said, "if we are gentle, we will soon have some fish for dinner."

the family watched with anticipation as the net floated out in the ocean. minutes passed, then all of a sudden, the family could see a school of fish starting to swim into the net. the family cheered and cheered as the net filled up with fish. 

the family was so happy that their gentle cleaning of the net had paid off! mom said, "what a great harvest!"

but then, dad had an idea. he picked up a stick and made a little pool in the sand, filled with water. then he put the shrimp in.

jack spent so much time watching the shrimp swim around and around. he smiled to himself, imagining how wonderful life would be as a shrimp.

one day, as pam was walking in the field, she heard something strange. it was like a horn calling out - faint noises coming from a far distance. after a while, pam recognised the sound; it was her pet donkey, jack.

pam was very excited - she had been looking for jack since the morning! she quickened her pace and soon she could see him, running and jumping in the meadow. she ran towards him and hugged him.

"you're finally here!" pam said, relieved and happy. "where have you been? you fit quite well in this field!"

jack smiled and looked content. pam was sure that from now on, this would be his favorite spot in the world!

but pit was already standing at the edge of the pit, so he looked up and said, "what is down there?" 

his mommy replied, "it's a big, deep, dark pit. i don't want you to go down there, so please don't." 

but pit couldn't help himself. he wanted to know what was down there. so he put one paw in and then another and soon he was down in the pit. it was very dark inside, so he felt around. soon, he found a big black mouse! 

pit was so excited that he quickly put the mouse in his pocket and climbed back out of the pit. he raced home to show his mommy the mouse.

when they reached the top, they found the cause of the smoke. there was a big fire burning, and it was increasing.

"mommy, why is one of my plants gone?" 
her mom said sadly, 
"oh sweetie, sometimes things get lost during a storm. you will have to learn to accept that you lost it."

sarah was very sad. she realised that if she had taken better care of her plants, maybe some of her plants would not have been lost.

the moral of the story is: when it comes to taking care of special things, it is important to protect and watch over them, so they don't get lost in bad storms.

joe said, "i'm writing a story about this funny black patch!"

once there was a little girl named kim. one day, kim went for a walk in the woods near her house. she looked around and saw a big, blue pool. she stepped closer to take a look. suddenly, she heard a voice from the pool. a frog appeared on a rock in the middle of the pool.

kim: "hello, frog!"

frog: "where did you come from?"

kim: "i stepped out of my house."

frog: "you look very lonely. do you want to play with me?"

kim smiled. she stepped into the pool and soon they were playing games. kim and the frog talked and laughed. kim forgot how lonely she felt.

when it was time to go, kim waved goodbye to her frog friend. she felt happier and less alone.

moral of the story: it is important to make friends and enjoy life. friends make us feel less lonely.
once upon a time, there was a helpless crab who wanted to swim in the sea. she looked around and couldn't find a way to get to the water. suddenly, she heard a voice. 

"come here, little crab. i can help you," said the voice. the crab looked around and saw a beautiful white duck.

"jump on my back and we'll swim to the sea together," said the duck. the crab was so happy and jumped on the duck's back. together, they swam off to the sea.

the crab laughed as she watched the waves and felt the warm sun on her back. she knew she was safe and that the duck would look after her.

the duck and the crab swam for hours until they reached the shore. the crab thanked the duck and hopped back onto the sand.

from then on, the crab would always look back fondly on the day she had taken a ride on the beautiful duck's back and gone swimming in the sea.
the ocean was calm and beautiful. there were lots of fish in the water and they were swimming around and having a great time. suddenly, an octopus started to splash in the water. it was so happy! the octopus was loyal to its friends, and they all wanted to hang out together. 

the octopus started to play a game with the other fish. it would splash near them, and the fish would swim away really fast. it was so funny! the fish loved the game, and the octopus was very proud of being loyal.

the fish kept swimming away from the octopus each time it splashed, but they eventually realized that the octopus was only playing. they all swam back to the octopus and surrounded it in a big circle. they started to splish and splash together and have lots of fun.

the octopus was so happy and loyal to its new friends. all the fish learned that having a loyal friend can be the best thing in the world!
once upon a time, there lived a little boy. his name was alex and he was three years old. alex loved to perform special shows and put on plays.
one day, alex asked his mama and papa if he could perform a special show. his mama and papa said yes, and alex was so happy!
he decided to put together a show with all of his important items. he took his toys and put them in his crib. then, he began practicing.

mama asked, "what kind of show are you performing, alex?"
"it's going to be the most special show ever!", said alex, dancing around the room. 
he clapped his hands and whirled around and around. he smiled and said, "it's a surprise!"

the day of the show finally arrived, and alex was very excited. he performed in front of his mama and papa and even his grandparents. they all laughed and clapped when alex finished his show. 

mama told alex, "that was a very important performance. you should be proud of yourself!"
alex smiled and said, "can i perform this show again tomorrow?"
timmy was sad. his baseball had rolled away to an area he couldn't reach. suddenly a dependable friend walked up and said, "i can help you." he grabbed the ball and smiled. timmy was so happy he forgot to say thank you. he just smiled and hugged his new dependable friend.

the two of them ran around the park throwing and catching the baseball. timmy was having so much fun that he forgot how sad he was. his new friend was dependable, and very good at playing baseball.

after a while, timmy's mom had to go, and his new friend had to leave too. they said goodbye and his new friend frowned. that made timmy sad all over again. he said goodbye and waved until his friend was gone. he went home feeling lonely. 

seeing his new friend frown made timmy realize that he had not properly thanked him for getting the baseball. it was important for timmy to stay grateful, so the next day timmy sent his friend a card saying "thank you for being dependable and helping me get my baseball".  his friend smiled and they became friends for a long time.
one day, jane was walking through the woods searching for a place to take a nap. she had been walking for hours and was feeling very tired. all of a sudden, she spotted a tunnel. she thought it was the perfect place to take a nap and cautiously stepped inside. as soon as she sat down she felt a sense of calm and closed her eyes. everything was peaceful until she heard a loud voice. 

"you can't take a nap here!", yelled a voice.

jane opened her eyes and saw a squirrel standing in front of her. he continued speaking, "this tunnel is my home. you have to leave or else you will be stuck here forever." jane was feeling frustrated but knew that the squirrel was right. she slowly began to stand up and as she stepped out of the tunnel, she thanked him for reminding her that she needed to find a better place to take her nap. 

the next day, jane returned to the woods feeling determined to find the perfect place to take a nap. after a while, she noticed a small clearing in a nearby park. she happily ran over to the clearing and laid down in the soft grass. she quickly drifted off to sleep and felt content to have finally taken her nap in a nice and safe place.
once upon a time there was a little girl. she was three years old and excited about studying.

one day she was playing with a bubble. she watched it closely and studied how it floated in the air, wide and round. "this bubble is so pretty," she said.

suddenly, the bubble floated away. the girl ran after it to try and catch it. it was so wide and she couldn't catch up. suddenly the wind picked up and the bubble flew away.

the little girl was sad and started to cry. but then, she saw a rainbow in the sky. she smiled and studied it closely. she thought she could reach the rainbow if she flew on the back of a bird.

the end.
once upon a time, there was a farmer and his sheep. the farmer lived on a big farm full of dirt and mud. 
one day, the farmer was looking for his sheep but he could not find them. he looked everywhere for them but he could not see them. he was worried and started to yell.

suddenly, he heard a loud "baa!" he looked through the mud and saw the sheep! but they were dirty! he had to get them out of the mud.

the farmer yelled at the sheep to try and get them out of the mud. the sheep started jumping and jumping. finally, the farmer got them out safely. 

the farmer was relieved and he gave the sheep a big hug. he was so happy that the sheep were safe and not hurt. from that day on, the farmer was extra careful when watching his sheep.
once upon a time, there were two best friends. they were lily and rose.

rose said to lily, "do you want to come to my party?" 

lily smiled and said, "yes, i do! can i bring my friend tom? he is a good friend too."

rose hesitated for a moment, "i don't think so. we don't have much food, and tom might not get enough." 

"that's selfish," replied lily. "i recommend that we invite tom too."

rose thought about this and she agreed. she said, "ok, let's give him an invitation and make sure he knows how much food there will be."

so they sent tom an invitation and all three went to the party. they had a wonderful time and ate lots of food. 

the end.
once upon a time, there was a big bus. every day, it was busy taking people to their destinations. one day, it drove to a big town.

when the bus arrived, a little girl came out. her name was lola. she had been on an adventure and was making her way back home.

as she walked, she met an old woman. "good morning child," said the old woman. "what brings you here?

lola smiled and replied, "i am returning from a very long journey. i went to a magical place and had so many adventures! i even heard a story about a beautiful princess!"

the old woman smiled and said, "that sounds like a wonderful experience. i am sure you enjoyed it."

lola nodded in agreement, then said goodbye to the old woman and continued her journey. over the next few days, she made her way back home, remembering the busy days on the bus and the magical stories she had heard.
one morning, jack woke up feeling adventurous. he shouted for his mum, but she was busy. he put on his shoes and went outside.

suddenly, jack saw a package at his front door. he was excited, but also a bit scared. he got closer to look.

then, the package called out to jack!

"hey, little jack!" it said. "take me with you on your adventures!"

jack hesitated, then he decided to pick up the package and take it with him.

they explored the forest and the beach. jack and the package had a lot of fun. then, it started to get dark.

"it's time to return home now," said the package.

jack sighed, but he knew it was time to go. he said goodbye to the package and went back home.

he returned with lots of stories to tell his mum.
once upon a time, two friends, tom and ben, were planning an outing to the opera that evening. tom was very excited to go and was hopeful to see all the wonderful things the opera had to offer.

ben wasn't as optimistic as tom. he said to tom, "we don't have enough money for the opera. how can we see the show?"

tom replied, "don't worry, i have an idea. i hope we can get into the opera. i have a friend who works there. she is a generous person, i'm sure she will help us."

so, tom and ben walked over to the opera. when they arrived, they knocked on the door. to their surprise, the door opened and it was tom' friend. she smiled and said, "oh, you two wanted to go to the opera. come in, i think i can help you."

tom and ben were very happy to have been welcomed into the opera. little did they know, it was about to be one of the most incredible nights of their lives!
once upon a time, there was a little girl called amy. she loved to decorate her house for special occasions. today was no exception.

amy and her family were getting ready to celebrate her third birthday. she gathered all the decorations and asked her mum, "how can i decorate?"

her mum smiled and said, "why don't you hang a pretty hoop on the wall?"

amy excitedly ran to get the hoop. she carefully hung it on the wall, and stepped back to admire her work.

there was a small voice coming from the hallway. it was amy's little brother. he said, "can i help you decorate, amy?"

amy smiled and said, "yes! you can help me hang the balloons around the hoop and the walls."

so, amy and her brother set to work. they carefully hung the balloons in the quiet room. finally, everything was decorated and ready for the big party. 

amy and her brother hugged and said, "happy birthday, amy!"
once upon a time there were two friends, joe and sam. joe had a quiz and was very excited to take it. he wanted sam to take it too, but sam was a bit impatient.

sam said, "i want to play now!" joe said, "we can play after the quiz." but sam didn't want to wait.

joe then said, "just stay here, ok? i'll be back soon." and he took the quiz.

sam waited patiently, but he grew more and more impatient. he couldn't wait to play with joe.

finally, joe returned with the quiz results. he had done really well! joe and sam smiled at each other, and then they went outside to play together. they remained friends for many years.
once upon a time, there were two friends, bob and jane. they were very close and liked to play together. one day, they were playing in the dark woods. bob suddenly stumbled upon a funny-looking rock, and he asked jane to come take a look.

when jane saw the rock, she said, "this is the start of something special!" bob agreed, and they decided to unite the funny-looking rock with the trees around it. 

jane said, "let's make a campfire. that way, we can stay warm in the dark woods." 

bob and jane got together the twigs and pieces of wood and put them around the rock. then, bob looked in his pocket and found a big, red match. he struck the match and the campfire came to life!

bob and jane laughed and shared stories by the campfire that night. they were happy to be so united in the dark woods. the start of this wonderful adventure will not be forgotten.
once upon a time, there was a little girl who went to visit her grandma in the countryside. the girl was really excited to go to the countryside, because she has heard lots of stories about the beautiful flowers there. when she arrived, the little girl ran around and saw lots of different flowers in the garden of her grandma's house. she was so amazed by the beautiful flowers that she ran around slowly so that she can admire each and every one of them. 

suddenly, the little girl stopped and saw a beautiful flower that no one else seemed to notice. it was a very small flower growing slowly in the grass. the little girl slowly reached out to pluck the flower, but her grandma suddenly said: "no sweetheart, don't pick the flower. it takes a very long time for it to grow and if you pick it, it won't be able to grow anymore." 

the little girl thought for a moment and then smiled. she told her grandma that if she let the flower grow, then it will be much bigger and brighter for her next visit. 

moral of the story: sometimes it is better to appreciate something and leave it be, because it may surprise you with its beauty later on.
once upon a time, there was a little girl called sarah. she was very excited because she was going to have an adventure. she put on her coat, grabbed her hat and marched to the park. when she got there she saw a big tree, then she saw a lime! she didn't know what it was but it looked very interesting. 

sarah marched over to the lime and said, "hello lime. what are you doing here?" the lime didn't say anything! it just sat under the tree. 

sarah was not sure what to do, so she asked the tree if it knew what the lime was doing. the tree said, "why don't you pick the lime up and take it home with you? then you can find out what it is!".

so sarah picked up the lime and marched all the way home. when she got home, she cut the lime open and discovered it was full of tasty juice! she was very happy and she thanked the tree for giving her such an interesting adventure. 

the end.
once upon a time, there was a big, strong bear. the bear wanted to try some oat, but his friend the fox wanted to resist. the bear was very brave, but the fox was clever and brilliant.

the fox said to the bear, "let's not eat oat. it's not nice!" but the bear was determined. he said "i won't resist! i will try the oat!"

so the fox knew he could not stop the bear. with a tiny bit of fear, he replied "okay, but you might be sorry!"

the bear ate the oat and it was delicious. but suddenly, he started to feel very sick. he could not move, he was in so much pain. the fox was sad, he knew he was right to resist.

the end.
once upon a time there was a little boy. his name was timmy and he was 3 years old. he had a great big smile on his face. he was very enthusiastic about life.

one day timmy was in his house when he heard a sound from outside. he ran to the window to take a look. he saw a big yellow vehicle pulling up.

timmy asked his mom what it was. she replied, "it's the ice cream truck. it serves ice cream to everyone."

timmy was so excited he couldn't wait to get outside. he ran out the door and to the ice cream truck.

when he got there he saw that the truck was full of different kinds of ice creams. timmy picked one and asked the driver for it.

the driver said, "sure, that one is for you. enjoy!"

timmy was very happy. he ran back to his house with his ice cream to show his mom. from then on, every time the ice cream truck arrived to his town, timmy was always the first one to get some.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named jake. jake was three years old and he loved to do two things: point and eat peanuts. one day, he was walking down the street with his mother, when he saw something very incredible. it was a large circus tent! he stopped and pointed at the tent and said, "look, mommy! what's that?" his mother replied, "that is a circus tent, jake." jake was so excited he jumped up and down and shouted, "i want to go to the circus!" 

so, his mother took him on a little adventure to the circus that day. he saw a big elephant and little monkeys, but what he was waiting for were the peanuts. by the time they made it to the peanut stand, jake was jumping up and down like a little popcorn. he couldn't believe it! the peanuts looked incredible! he asked the man for a bag, and the man gave him a handful of peanuts. then jake pointed to the sky and shouted with joy, "yay, peanuts!" 

jake has had an incredible day with his mom and his peanuts. he pointed at the circus tent one last time before they went back home. from that day onwards, jake would never forget the incredible and magical day he spent at the circus.

once upon a time there was a girl named lucy who was very healthy. every morning lucy would go to a big, green field with her friend ben. in the field, lucy liked to guess how far she could throw her ball. 

ben would measure the "pitch", which was how far lucy could throw her ball. the longest lucy had ever thrown it was eight meters. 

one day, lucy had a special ball. she threw it with all her might and with a huge grin on her face. she couldn't believe it when ben said she had thrown it ten meters! 

it was her new personal best and she was very proud. from that day on, lucy kept guessing how far she could throw the ball, always aiming to beat her previous high score. 

the end!
john and his mom were at the park. john wanted to play sports, so he ran across the grass. he saw a big, deep lake.

mom: john, don't go too close!

john stopped, but he was so excited to play sports. he wanted to look for a sport he could do. then he saw a sport he liked.

john: mom, look!

mom: what is that?

john: it looks like a sport i can do there.

mom: okay, but stay away from the deep water.

john smiled and ran over to the sport. he had so much fun playing and running around. he even got a little wet! john had a great time playing his sport and mom was happy he stayed safe.
once upon a time there was a little girl. her name was lucy and she was very proud. every day she would run and play in the sunshine.

one day, lucy's mum asked lucy to do something she didn't want to do. lucy felt very sad and wanted to cry. but she decided she could be brave.

so she took a deep breath and started to do the job. she worked until it was finished. and when it was done she smiled without crying.

lucy's mum was proud of her and said that she had done a wonderful job. lucy looked up at the stars, at the big universe and remembered. it was the same way she felt when she was brave and didn't cry.

lucy learned that it was possible to be brave and strong - even when things were tough. being brave was something to be proud of in life.
once upon a time, there was a dragon who was very shy. he lived in a deep dark cave, far away from the rest of the world. he did not like it when people came too close, so he hid away in his cave. 

one day, the dragon heard something from outside. it was the sound of counting. he poked his head out of the cave to see what was happening. there was a little girl counting numbers 1, 2, 3, 4 and so on! 

the dragon liked the sound of the numbers, so he grew a bit braver and slowly crept out of his cave, step by step. he saw the girl and went closer. the little girl was so happy to meet the dragon, but he was still very shy. 

but the dragon eventually got used to the little girl, and they became friends. every day, the little girl would come to the cave and they would play counting numbers together. the dragon was no longer shy, and they were happy friends. 

the end
once upon a time, there was a little girl called amy. she was only three years old. one day amy went to visit her grandmother who lived in a fancy house. amy's grandma showed her around the house and stopped in front of a special room. 

"this is my special room," grandma said. "it's very fancy and i don't let anyone but me go in here." 

amy was very excited and asked, "what's inside your fancy room?" 

grandma smiled. "come on in and find out," she said. so amy walked into the room and the first thing she saw was a toy gun. it was pink and had sparkles on it. 

"this is for you! it's a toy gun," grandma said. "you can use it to shoot at pretend targets." 

amy was so happy - she couldn't wait to start shooting. with grandma's help, she aimed the gun and chose a target. then she pulled the trigger and ...pow! she had shot her first target! 

amy was so proud of herself and had lots of fun shooting the toy gun. from that day on, she spent hours playing in the fancy room with her toy gun.

one day, moni was singing in the garden and stepped on a bee. it gave her a little shock, but she was fine.

moni was sad because she scared the bee. she sat down and didnâ€™t sing any more.

the birds, bugs and flowers all stopped and looked at what had happened. they flew over to moni and sang a sweet song.

the little girl smiled and joined in. and soon moni was singing with the birds, bugs and flowers again. it was so nice! she sang and laughed for the rest of the day.
once upon a time there was a little girl called star. star was three and loved helping the people in her family prepare dinners.

one day, star asked her mum what she was making for dinner. mum said she was making a very tasty cake. star was so excited!

"can i help?" star asked.

mum said, "yes of course, what would you like to do first?"

star said, "i want to measure the ingredients, i can do that with the scale!"

mum smiled, "that's a great idea," she said.

so star got the scale out of the cupboard and started to measure everything she needed. she was so proud of herself for helping.

soon the cake was in the oven, and it was just a few minutes until dinner was ready. star could smell how tasty it was going to be, and she couldn't wait to sample a piece.
once there was a slow turtle called freddie. freddie was always a bit slow but he loved to explore the world. everywhere he went he made sure he included lots of friends in the adventure. 

one day freddie decided to go on an extra special adventure - he was going to try to find a hidden beach! he set off in the morning, packing a lunch with him. as he walked along he met lots of different animals and included them in his journey.

finally, they reached a vast stretch of beach. as they walked along they were amazed by how much there was to explore. they went in and out of rock pools, filling up shells with treasures they collected.

when it was time to go home, freddie gave all his treasures to the animals he had included on his journey. he was especially careful to make sure he left the slowest turtle some extra special treats for the journey home!
once upon a time, there were two boys who were very brave. they often went on adventures together. one day, the boys dared each other to go into a dark cave. they went together, but they were scared. 

the boys made it to the cave's entrance and paused. they looked at each other and the taller boy said, "we have to go in there? that is a difficult fight!" 

the smaller boy nodded, but neither of them wanted to take a step forward. they both knew something was waiting on the other side of the cave. 

suddenly, the smaller boy stumbled and fell into the cave. he screamed and the taller boy had to help him. then they knew they had to go forward. 

the smaller boy was afraid and begged not to go, but the taller boy had no choice. he had to help his friend. so, the boys continued further into the dark cave, looking for the scary thing that was waiting for them. 

when they made it to the other side, they were faced with two large dragons. the boys tried to fight their way out, but it was too difficult. the dragons defeated them and the boys knew they had lost the fight. 

the boys never returned from the dark cave again.

moral of the story: it is important to think before rushing into something you are afraid of.
once upon a time there was a young boy named robby. he was very curious and liked learning new things. one day, his mommy took him to the library. he was so excited!

when he got there he was amazed! the library was so big and had an incredible amount of books! robby couldn't believe there were so many! 

he asked his mommy, "how do i manage to read all of these books?". his mommy smiled and said, "well, you just take a book off the shelf and then you start reading. have fun!".

robby nodded and started to explore the library. he read some books, made some new friends and before he knew it, it was time to go home. 

robby was so happy with his library adventure. he had learned so much and had a really incredible time. he couldn't wait to come back soon!
once upon a time there was a little girl named jane. she left the house early one morning to go visit her favorite vendor in town. when she arrived all she found was an empty market with no sign of her beloved vendor. she was so sad and a tear ran down her cheek. 

just then jane heard a voice call out to her. "where did you think i was little one?" 

jane looked up and saw her vendor standing right there. she ran up to him and hugged him tight. "i missed you!" she said. 

the vendor hugged her back and said, "i've been working really hard to make the market better, so i had to leave for a while. i'm glad you came back to see me!" 

jane and the vendor shared a hug and jane said goodbye. she went home feeling happy that she had found her beloved vendor again.
once upon a time there was a little girl named emily. she was three years old and loved to explore the world around her.

one day emily was playing in her room and noticed a modern rug on the floor. she reached down to touch it and said, "what is this?"

her mom replied, "it's a rug."

emily asked, "what is a rug?"

her mom said, "a rug is a special thing that makes your room cozy and warm."

emily smiled and said, "i know! i can sit on it and be comfy!"

so emily sat on the rug, feeling very cozy and happy. she didn't know it yet, but she now knew a lot more about rugs and the world around her.
once upon a time there were two friends, a cat and a dog. they lived in a really beautiful neighbourhood with lots of trees and grass for them to play in. one day, the two friends went for a walk together. the cat and the dog were very excited because they had found a long cable. they decided to see how much it weighed.

the dog went first and tried to lift the cable. it was too heavy! the dog said, "this cable must be really heavy." the cat was very curious and wanted to try too, so it put its paws on the cable and tried to push it up. but the cable was too heavy for the cat too!

the cat said, "it must be really heavy because it doesn't feel regular." the two friends thought for a moment and then decided that the best thing to do was to ask a grown-up for help. so they went in search of one. in the end, a grown-up helped them find out that the cable weighed 164 pounds!
once upon a time, there was a huge bear. he was walking around in the woods looking for a friend. he wanted someone to play with.

he came across a little rabbit hopping around. the bear asked the rabbit, â€œdo you want to play with me?â€

the rabbit answered, â€œyes! letâ€™s play tag!â€

the bear and the rabbit started running and jumping around the woods. the bear was so big and the rabbit was so small that the bear had trouble running around.

then the rabbit said to the bear, â€œcan you fold your foot? you will be able to run faster!â€ the bear tried and he could move faster and better.
