cindy was a three year old girl who loved playing in the garden. one day she ran out of the house and opened the gate. she was so excited to explore, and started looking around.

suddenly, cindy noticed a wheat field. she thought it looked like a magical place, so she ran inside. she gasped as she saw a big, beautiful sunflower. 

"i wish i could freeze this moment forever," she said aloud. 

just then, cindy heard a voice. "no, that's not easy. it takes a lot of work to grow wheat," the voice said. 

cindy turned and saw a farmer standing in the field. she didn't understand what the farmer meant, so she just smiled and said, "i still wish i could freeze this moment."

the farmer looked at cindy kindly and with a twinkle in his eye, said, "perhaps you can, but it takes effort. you need to plant the wheat, water it and look after it. with some work, you'll be able to enjoy this moment for a long time."

so cindy started to work on the field, and soon she was able to enjoy the beautiful wheat field she'd discovered. she felt proud of her efforts and happy that she'd been able to freeze a moment in time that she could enjoy for a very long time.
once upon a time there was a little girl named ruby. she was only three and she liked to explore everything.

one day, ruby found a cabinet that she had never seen before. it was very old and it was covered with dirt. so she wanted to take a closer look inside. 

when she opened the door, ruby saw that the cabinet was filled with things that were rotten. she started to feel sad, so she asked her parents why things were so dirty inside the cabinet. 

her parents smiled and said, "you know what ruby, if you take care of things, they will last longer. but when you don't, things can rot away like these things inside the cabinet."

from then on, ruby always took care of her things and made sure everything was clean.

the moral of this story is that if you take care of things, they will last longer, but if you don't, the things will rot away and become useless.
bob was out for a walk in the forest. suddenly he saw something shiny in the leaves. he bent down to take a closer look. what he found was a berry that was so juicy and yummy looking! he couldn't resist picking it up and eating it.

but the berry was not alone. he looked around and saw many more. bob was so excited. he gathered as many of these tasty berries as he could and started to put them in his basket.

suddenly, he heard a voice, "what do you think you're doing?" he looked around and saw a little girl. she was very messy with leaves and dirt all over her clothes. she asked him "why are you picking my berries?"

bob replied, "i'm sorry i didn't know they were yours. i just thought i'd find some yummy berries!".

the little girl smiled. "that's ok, i'm happy to share. just make sure you don't make a mess. choose the berries carefully."

bob gave her a big smile. he thanked her and continued to hunt for berries. he picked the biggest and juiciest ones he could find and eventually filled his basket. he had fun and made sure he didn't leave a messy trail. the little girl even gave him an extra berry for being so careful. bob was happy to have found so many delicious berries, and to have made a new friend.
once upon a time, there lived a smart mouse. he loved to explore and find new things. one day, he was exploring in the forest when he spotted an arrow. he went up to take a closer look and the arrow flew away! the mouse used his smarts and chased after the arrow. he followed the arrow deep into the woods, but the arrow was too fast and the mouse couldn't catch up. 

he stopped to catch his breath and suddenly he heard a voice.
"why are you chasing me?" it said. the mouse was shocked and he quickly looked around. he saw a little girl standing there with the arrow in her hand. she was very brave and the mouse liked that.

the mouse finally replied, "i'm trying to escape the arrow!" the girl smiled and said, "come and join me on my adventures. i could use a smart mouse like you by my side." the mouse agreed and together the two friends took off in search of new and exciting places.
once there was a girl named maya. she was three years old. one day, maya and her mom went to a store. maya saw a pretty cup. it was bright blue with stars all around. she felt so excited. she asked her mom to buy it for her. 

mom smiled and said, "sure, this cup looks great. let's get it for you."

maya was so happy she could hardly contain herself. she grabbed the cup and hugged it tight. then she said thank you to her mom.

on the way home, maya held the cup tightly in her hands. she felt so happy and excited, like she was the luckiest girl in the world. when she reached home, she put the cup on her shelf and smiled. it made her feel great.
there were two best friends. one day, one of them suggested going on a ship. the other one was jealous and said no. the friend suggested again, but the jealous one still said no. the friend was sad and said goodbye.

the jealous one felt bad and thought of a plan to get back at the other one. he quickly decided to make a ship by himself. the jealous one was so excited and started building right away.

he worked very hard and eventually finished the ship. but before he could show it to the other one, a big storm hit and destroyed the ship. the jealous one was very sad and could not believe it.

when the friend found out he felt sorry for the other one. even though the jealous one had been mean, the friend wanted to help him. but it was too late. the jealous one had caused a bad ending by being too jealous.
once upon a time, there was a little girl. she was wearing a colorful dress and her name was lucy. she was out in the park playing with her friends, and they were all having lots of fun.

one day, they were all running around when suddenly lucy stopped and said, "i need new clothes." all her friends asked her why, but she just shook her head.

a few days later, there was a big parade in the park, and everyone was wearing the most beautiful and colorful of clothes. lucy saw all the amazing clothes, and wanted them too. so, she asked her mom if she could buy her some new clothes.

her mom said, "no, lucy. you already have plenty of clothes. we don't need any more." lucy was so sad, but then her mom said, "maybe next year we will buy you more clothes. just remember, sharing is more important than having more stuff."

lucy smiled and said, "ok". she knew that her mom was right, and that was the best lesson she could ever learn. from then on, she made sure to be a good friend and always help out by sharing her own things with her friends. in the end, she learned that one of the most important things in life is kindness and friendship.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named abby. abby was three years old and she was playing in the garden one day.
suddenly, dark clouds started to gather in the sky, and soon a huge flood started. abby was scared that she would be washed away so she started to run for the house.
suddenly she heard a noise. it was her mom calling from the house.
"abby, hurry inside! we need to manage this flood together".
abby ran inside and together she and her mom managed to put sand bags around the house.
the scary flood started to subside, and abby and her mom were so relieved.
the next day after the flood, abby was playing in the garden again, thankful that she and her mom managed to stay safe.
the sky was starting to get dark and john was excited. he ran to his parents and asked "what are we doing?" his parents replied, "we are going to watch fireworks!"

john smiled and jumped up and down. his parents told him, "but we have to stay very quiet during the fireworks display." john did not like that. he asked, "why do we have to be quiet?" his father said, "we need to be respectful and accept that some people can be scared of the loud noises and bright lights the fireworks make."

john thought about this for a minute. he accepted that this was the right thing to do and he stayed silent when the fireworks started. they were so beautiful! he gasped as each one lit up the night sky.

the display became louder and brighter and john got excited. all of a sudden, he started to shout, "this is so stupid! i want to set off a firework myself!" his parents were surprised, their eyes widened. his father said firmly "no, john! that is not acceptable. you must understand that fireworks are for grown ups only and it is very dangerous for a child to use them." 

john stayed silent and accepted what his father said. he watched the fireworks until the end of the show and then went inside, feeling happy and safe.

suddenly, a funny looking man appeared. he said to kin "do not be so weak! come and pick with me!" kin looked at him and shook her head.

the man got angry and he forced her to pick apples with him. he held her very tightly and she was too scared to move. she was so weak that she couldn't pick herself away from him.

kin was forced to pick apples with the man for a long time. eventually, the man left, but kin was left so scared and upset. she had a bad feeling about the man, and never went to the fields again.

as he hopped along, mark saw a butterfly and decided to follow it. after a short time, he spotted his cousin's sunflower. he was so excited! 

but as soon as he got closer, he stopped in his tracks. he noticed the sunflower was tilted and a branch had been broken off. "oh no!" he exclaimed sadly. then he heard a voice telling him to come closer.

it was his cousin! mark was so excited, but then he saw his cousin was lying on the broken branch, too weak to move. mark felt so sorry for him. his cousin told him he had a fever and he needed medicine, but he couldn't get any because the medicine was far away.

mark decided to fetch the medicine, so he flew as far and fast as he could until he finally found the medicine. when he returned, he saw his cousin was feeling much better, thanks to the medicine. 

mark hugged his cousin tightly and said, "i'm so glad i was able to help!" his cousin smiled and offered him a sunflower seed to say thank you. 

from that day on, mark knew he would never forget how important it was to help those in needâ€”even

the kid remembered what the voice said. he decided to be careful and not to go too far in the water. he kept blinking and looking around. he saw other kids playing and having fun in the shallow water.

the kid was happy that he listened to the voice and stayed in shallow water. he realized that sometimes it can be easy to get in trouble if you don't listen to warnings. he sang happily and had lots of fun with his friends.

this experience taught the kid to be careful and always listen to warnings. he knew it was important to listen to those who care. so, whenever he went to the beach, he never went too far into the water and always looked out for danger.

one day, he saw something very special in the sky. he spotted a big group of reindeer. it was a whole family of reindeer! the great reindeer was so happy. he couldn't believe it.

the great reindeer was excited to meet the reindeer family. he waved to them in the sky. he knew that the reindeer family would help him to prevent snow from coming. they could fly all around and keep the snow away.

john was excited but also a bit scared. he wanted to play but he did not know how. suddenly, john's friend shouted, "john, join us - let's have some fun!"

john smiled and ran over. suddenly a big kid stepped in front of him and said, "you can't join. we don't want kids as small as you!"

john was so mad. he yelled, "it's not fair! everyone should be able to join the wild pitch game!"

the big kid grumbled and let john join the game. from then on, john always remembered to stand up for himself and for his friends.

one day, charlie was in the kitchen with his mom. he saw one of the cabinets open, and he gasped with excitement. inside was a mixer! 

charlie said, "mom, what is a mixer?" 

his mother replied, "it's a special machine that helps mix things together. what would you like to make with it?" 

charlie thought for a few moments and then said, "let's make something spicy!" 

his mother smiled and carefully opened a cupboard. she pulled out some onions, peppers, and some spices. charlie imagined how delicious it would taste.

his mother helped him put the ingredients into the mixer, and she pressed the button. the mixer began to whir and the ingredients all blended together. 

when the mixture was done, it looked and smelled great. charlie and his mom tasted it, and it was the most delicious and spicy thing they'd ever eaten!

he asked his mom, "what that smell?"

"honey, it's the trash!" his mom replied.

joe frowned again. he was confused. he asked, "why it smelly?"

his mom smiled. "it's time to take out the garbage. come help me, joe."

joe shook his head. he was still confused but he followed his mom. together they took out the smelly garbage and threw it out in the trash bin.

joe's mom smiled. "see, that wasn't so hard. now the smell is gone!"

joe smiled and gave his mom a big hug. he was happy that the smelly trash was gone. and he learned an important lesson about taking out the garbage.

once upon a time there was a hunter who was looking for something to hunt. everywhere that the hunter looked, he could not find any prey. but then suddenly he saw a lively fox jumping around in a meadow. the hunter was eager to catch the fox, but the fox was even more eager to escape.

the hunter yelled, "hey fox, stop running around and be my prey!" but the fox didn't listen and kept running. he shouted louder and louder, but the fox kept on.

the fox exclaimed, "no way! i will resist you and keep running!" with that, the fox hopped and skipped around the meadow, dodging the hunter as best as he could.

the hunter was frustrated and angry. he tried to come up with different plans to catch the fox, but nothing worked. the fox was too lively! so the hunter gave up and went home without any prey that day.

john fetched a glass of water and gave the frog a drink. the frog thanked him and asked if he would like to be friends. john said yes and the frog hopped away.

once upon a time, there was a brave lion who was going on an adventure. he wanted to explore the jungle, so he courageously headed out.

just a few minutes in the jungle, he saw a strange bird, who spoke to the lion. "why are you here?" the bird asked with a loud chirp.

the lion replied, "i am here to explore this brave jungle and be the bravest lion ever!"

the bird felt impressed and proposed a game. "you need to find 10 pieces of fruit that are hidden in the jungle. whoever finds them first will be the winner!"

the lion thought about the offer. he was sure that the game was too difficult for him. so he lied to the bird, "i already have the 10 pieces of fruit. i am done with the game!"

the bird was disappointed, but the lion was relieved. he thanked the bird and bravely continued his adventure. he learnt to be honest, but also to be brave and never give up!

the fallen bugs became waste that was spread around the forest. the poor fragile bird was very sad that the yummy bugs were now waste.

so she worked hard to pick up all of the waste and put it back in the tree. now every day the bird can eat all of the tasty bugs she can find, without having to worry about the big scary cat!

the orange bird fluttered its wings and chirped. jacob noticed that the bird seemed sad, so he said, "would you like some help?".

the orange bird started to pray to god. jacob joined in, and together they prayed for happiness. as they finished praying, the orange bird flew away.
once upon a time, there was a shy little bird named tweety. one day, he went for a walk around the park. as he was walking, he slipped on a banana peel and fell to the ground. he tried to fly away, but he hurt his wing. upset, he started to cry. 

a kindly veterinarian saw him and took him in. she said to him, "don't worry little tweety, i can help." tweety, still feeling shy, just nodded. 

the veterinarian said, "i'll have to take care of your wing for a few days so that you can fly again. can you come back tomorrow?" tweety nodded and the veterinarian smiled. 

the next day, tweety came back. he was feeling much better and flew around the park again. he never slipped again and was happy he had been able to find help!

once upon a time, there was a small duck. he had a big sailboat. the duck loved to sail around the lake in his boat.

one day, the duck was out sailing when it started to rain. he quickly paddled back to shore, but the rain kept coming down.

the duck was so wet that he couldn't get the sailboat. then he heard a voice. it was loud and friendly.

"hey duck! i can help you, if you want", said the voice.

the duck looked around and saw an old man. he was deaf, so he shouted when he spoke. the old man had a big box of cream.

"i'm making ice cream with this cream. would you like some?"

"yes please!" said the duck.

so the old man scooped the creamy ice cream into a cone, and the duck ate it up. he was so happy!

once the duck was full, the old man helped him put the sailboat back onto the lake. the old man waved goodbye as the duck began to sail away.

the duck sailed around the lake, feeling happy and free. he was so glad he had met the old man!
once upon a time there was a clumsy bear who wanted to find some food. he looked and looked but couldn't find anything.

he was feeling very sad, when he spotted a cave. he was hoping he might find something tasty to eat inside.

the bear walked into the cave. "hello!" he called out.

a little mouse poked his head out. "what do you want?" he asked the bear.

"i'm looking for something to eat," said the bear.

the mouse smiled. "i've got just the thing!" he said, scurrying off into a corner and coming back with some tasty berries.

"yum!" said the bear as he ate the berries.

the mouse watched as the clumsy bear stumbled around the cave, eating the berries.

when the bear was done, he thanked the mouse for the delicious snack.

"you're welcome," said the mouse. "come by any time you're hungry!"

the bear smiled and waved goodbye as he walked out of the cave, much happier than when he had arrived.

suddenly, bob saw a big dead bug on the slide. "oh no!" he said in surprise.

his mom came to check what was wrong. "don't worry," she said, "it's just a dead bug."

bob said, "but why is it dead?" 

his mom smiled and said, "some things just don't last forever - like marriage." 

bob smiled and thought, "i understand now - marriage is forever." he accepted the bug as a symbol of commitment, understanding and love.

he got so frustrated that he began to yell. he yelled with all of his might and it echoed around the river. suddenly, he heard a noise coming from the other side of the river. it was a voice, but it wasn't like his voice! it was different, but it was still lovely.

the otter was scared and he stopped yelling. he swam over to the other side of the river to see what it was. there he saw the most beautiful thing he had ever seen. it was another otter! the two otters said hello and became friends. from then on, the otters would often yell together and it sounded like a song. they were so happy and the lovely sound filled the river with love.

abbie saw a magical rainbow in the sky. she was filled with joy and ran towards it. as she got closer, a beautiful fairy appeared. the fairy told abbie that if she wished hard enough, then her wish would come true.

abbie was filled with hope and she closed her eyes and wished with all her might. suddenly, she felt a strange feeling wash over her. when abbie opened her eyes, the fairy was gone, but a beautiful white dove floated in the sky.

the dove flew through the sky and then it stopped and hovered over abbie's head. abbie looked around and saw a glimmering rainbow waterfall nearby. abbie knew that if she surrendered to the event that was happening, then her wish would come true.

so abbie surrendered to the event and let the rainbow waterfall wash over her. suddenly, abbie felt a sense of peace wash over her and all her troubles disappeared.

abbie smiled and knew that her wish had come true. theend.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named sophie. she liked to have fun and explore the world around her. one day, sophie decided to explore her mommy's kitchen. 

as sophie looked around, she saw an interesting looking machine on the counter. it was so exciting and she wanted to find out what it was. she asked her mommy, "what is this?"

mommy smiled and said, "that's a coffee machine! it makes coffee for adults. do you want to try it?"

sophie nodded eagerly and gave it a squeeze. but it wasn't very comfortable and it made her feel a bit uncomfortable.

her mommy laughed and said, "oh sophie, i think it's best if adults use the coffee machine."

sophie smiled and went back to exploring the kitchen. she was glad her mommy was there to help her and make her feel better.

alex was so excited that he could not resist trying on the wings. he put them on and looked in the mirror. immediately, he felt that he could fly.

when lola finished, she looked up and saw a small fish hiding under a rock nearby. she said, â€œhello there! are you measuring the waves too?â€ the fish nodded in agreement, so lola asked if it needed any help.

the fish replied, â€œyes, please! i'm trying to measure how far the waves go under this rock.â€ so lola took out her measuring tape and showed the fish how to use it. soon the fish was able to measure the waves accurately.

lola smiled. â€œthank you for being so generous with your help,â€ she said. the fish nodded and swam away.

the end.
sarah was feeling worried. she sat on her porch and looked outside at the warm sun. she was sure that summer was coming soon, but she was worried about something else.

suddenly, she heard a loud noise. it was her best friend, joe! he was running to her house and smiling from ear to ear.

"joe," sarah said. "what are you so happy about?"

joe took a deep breath and said proudly, "i have a surprise for you - something i have been planning all season!"

sarah was even more curious now. what could it be?

joe only smiled and said, "you'll find out soon."

confused, sarah watched as joe pulled out a big box. when he opened it up, she was filled with joy - inside was a big teddy bear!

joe said with a big grin, "this is for you. i wanted to give you a hug that would last all season!"

sarah was so happy and she hugged her teddy bear tightly. she knew that joe was the best friend she could ever have.

when he got to the lake, he put the things he had collected in the boat. then he looked around, but the boat seemed very troubled. he wanted to go on a boat ride, but he didnâ€™t know how to make it go.

clara and her mom were at the park. clara was playing with her toys while mom sat on a bench and watched.
"look, mom!" clara said excitedly, pointing at a pile of yarn in the grass.
mom smiled. "oh, that's nice, clara."
but then, clara noticed an odd smell rising up from the yarn. she wrinkled her nose.
"it smells bad, mom," she said.
"yes, that's probably because it's been in the sun too long," mom answered.
clara kept thinking about the smelly yarn, so she let out a big yawn.
mom looked over with a stern face. "clara, no one wants to breathe in the smelly air from that yarn. let's move away, okay?"
"okay, mom," clara said.
so clara and mom went to a new spot in the park, far away from the smelly yarn. clara happily started to play with her toys again.
once upon a time there was a small bunny. he loved sweets, but his mom told him not to eat too many. one day, the bunny snuck out of the house and hopped over to the temple. it was a very special temple and the bunny was curious about what he might find.

when he arrived, he saw a delicate, white flower. he wanted to taste it, so he reached out and plucked the petals from the stem. to his surprise, it tasted like the sweetest honey he had ever tried!

the bunny should have listened to his mom, as it was not a good idea to take the flower. suddenly, the bunny felt a strange feeling in his stomach and he ran all the way home.

he learned an important lesson that day; it is never a good idea to take something that does not belong to you. he happily listened to his momâ€™s advice and ate the sweets that she gave him. he was careful not to taste anything he wasn't supposed to!
once upon a time there was a little girl named lisa. one day lisa was outside playing with her friends, when suddenly she saw a strange man walking down the street. lisa was scared and ran away. she ran as fast as she could until she reached her house.

once she was inside, lisa hugged her mommy. "mommy, i was so scared," she said.

her mom hugged her and said, "what's wrong, sweetheart?"

"i saw a man and he was carrying a newspaper. he scared me," said lisa.

"don't worry, sweetheart," said her mom. "newspapers are nothing to be scared of. they are just pieces of paper with words on them. people buy them to get information about what's going on in the world."

"oh," said lisa.

"at least now you know that newspapers are nothing to be scared of. you can do this!" said her mom, giving her a big hug.

lisa felt much better. she went back outside to play with her friends. since then she never felt scared of newspapers again!

the little girl said, "mom, can i go closer to the temple?"

her mom said, "no dear, the temple is too dizzy. wait here, i'll go see."

the mom stepped closer, and noticed that the dizzy feeling wasn't so strong. she said to the little girl, "come, my brave little one. we can go closer together."

the girl held her mom's hand, and stepped closer and closer to the temple. she saw the shining walls and felt the dizzy feeling too. 

they both looked around and smiled. soon afterwards, they all went home and told their friends about the shiny temple.

once upon a time there was a small sunflower called willow. willow was so small every day she had to balance precariously on her thin stem. to make matters worse, the wind was always blowing and willow had to work hard to stay standing.

but willow was persistent. she held her head high, even when the wind increased in strength. then one day something amazing happened. a group of children stopped at her field and the smallest gave her a lovely smile.

willow couldn't believe it: she had made a friend at last.

but suddenly the wind blew even harder. willow felt herself losing her balance. she desperately looked to her new friend for help but he had gone.

willow felt helpless. the wind blew her over and she was never seen again. and the little sunflower never made any more friends.

one day, dina found a computer in the forest. she was so excited!

"what does this do?" dina asked.

a fairy replied, "i'm not sure, let's try it!"

the fairy and dina acted out pushing the buttons on the computer. all of a sudden, music started to play and they jumped with excitement.

"let's keep trying different things," said the fairy.

dina was busy acting and pushing every button she could find. suddenly, the computer started to make funny noises. "it's so funny!" laughed dina.

the nosy dragon had so much fun with the computer in the forest. she learned how to act and how to make funny noises. now she was the star of the show!

"no," her mom said. "it's too dangerous. you might get lost."

jane was still sad so she started to cry. then, out of the blue, a big, beautiful fairy appeared! she said to jane, "i will give you an island."

jane was so excited and said, "thank you! where is my island?"

the fairy smiled and pointed to the backyard. jane looked out the window, and there was a tiny island surrounded by water in the middle of the backyard! jane was so happy and thanked the fairy. she ran outside to explore her island!
mandy and her friends were playing in the park near a beautiful fountain. "wow!" mandy said. "it looks so peaceful." she admired the fountain and the children watched as the water bubbled. suddenly, mandy had an idea. "let's stir the water!" she exclaimed.

the children laughed and walked up to the fountain. they grabbed sticks and began to stir the water. the water swirled and splashed as they moved the sticks around. 

mandy noticed that the churning water was getting stronger and stronger. "let's get out of here," she said. "something isn't right." her friends followed her lead and they ran away from the fountain. just then, the fountain burst through the top and water came flying out. 

mandy and her friends watched in awe at the display. "that was close," she said. "i'm glad i had a feeling that something was wrong." 

the children eventually went back to the fountain, this time to admire its force and beauty. they had stirred the fountain in the most peaceful way.

once upon a time there was a little boy named jack. jack liked playing outside in the sun.

one day jack was playing in the garden. suddenly he started to sneeze loudly! he kept sneezing and sneezing. his skin began to feel itchy!

jack's mum came outside and saw him. she said, "jack, why did you keep sneezing so loudly?"

jack said, "my skin got itchy and i couldn't help it!"

mum smiled and said, "always remember to put sun cream on your skin if you're playing outside for a long time. your skin needs to be protected from the sun."

jack nodded, smiling. from then on, whenever jack went out to play, he made sure to put sun cream on his skin - and he never sneezed so loudly again!
once upon a time, there was a boy named billy. one day, he was playing outside and saw a magnet on the ground. he picked it up and asked his mom, "what can i do with this?"

his mom smiled and said, "well, billy, i think this magnet could help you fix something."

billy was very curious. he asked his mom, "what can i fix with it?"

his mom said, "follow me and i'll show you." she took him to the dark garage and showed him a bike with a broken chain.

billy asked, "how can the magnet help fix this?"

his mom said, "first, use the magnet to find the pieces of the chain that are still attached. that will help us find the missing pieces."

billy was astounded! he used the magnet to get the chain back together and was able to fix the bike.

the moral of the story is that small things can help you solve big problems.
once upon a time there was a girl called julie. she was a very brave and adventurous girl who loved doing new things. one day, julie was walking through a dark and scary forest. she was scared, but she kept walking. as she walked, she heard a strange noise. it sounded like some one was talking.

julie slowly moved closer and closer to the noise until she spotted a man sitting in the shadows. she couldn't see his face, but he was speaking.

"i'm so thirsty," the man said, "i wish i had some of that nice smelling perfume." he laughed.

julie felt scared, but she was also curious. she thought to herself, "maybe i should give him some perfume." 
julie slowly moved closer and closer, but before she could reach the man, he suddenly jumped out of the shadows and grabbed her by the arm.

"give me your perfume!" he shouted. julie was so scared, but she still tried to speak.

"please, let me go," she managed to say. but the man was too angry and wouldn't listen.

he grabbed the perfume from her and ran away, leaving her alone in the dark forest. julie never saw him again, and that was the last time she ever felt brave enough to do something new.

daddy shouted, "john, wait!" he ran after john, but it was too late; john was already exploring the beach.

they worked all day long, but they couldn't clean up all of the mess. finally, they got most of the mess cleaned up. but by the time they had finished it was too dark and they still had a lot of mess left. 

the next morning they woke up to find that the small tornado had come back during the night and destroyed all the work that they had done. the people were very sad and had to start all over again. 

no matter how hard they tried, the town people could not get the town cleaned up from the tornado's destruction. they were left feeling helpless and small, and they never found a way to clean up their town again.
once upon a time there was a goat and a farmer. the goat was very naughty and he loved to destroy things. he ate through the farmer's garden and even hopped over the fence to eat butter at the market.

the farmer was getting very angry. he tried to stop the naughty goat, but the goat ignored him.

finally the farmer asked the goat why he was being so ignorant. the goat said he was hungry, so the farmer invited him back to the farm and gave him some vegetables to eat.

the farmer then taught the goat a lesson about being respectful and responsible. the farmer said if the goat kept destroying things it would never get the butter it wanted.

the goat learned its lesson - to never be ignorant, think before you act and be mindful of the consequences.
one day two young children were marching down the street. one was the older brother and the other was the younger sister. they were walking down the street in a row, when the younger sister said to her brother, "i'm tired, can we have a break?"

the older brother replied, "no, we can't. we need to keep marching. once we reach the finish line, we can rest."

the younger sister started to cry, but the older brother kept marching. after a while, they reached the finish line and were so proud of themselves.

the older brother said to the younger sister, "you see, with hard work and determination, we can reach our goals."

the sister smiled, happy to have her brother by her side.

the moral of the story is that you can do anything you set your mind to, as long as you work hard and never give up.
once upon a time, there was a stubborn fox. one day the fox wanted to explore a big and confusing maze. she ran and ran, but the maze was so big and confusing that she had no idea how to get out.

she kept running and trying different paths, but no matter how hard she tried, she could not find a way out.

finally, the fox noticed that a stream surrounded the maze. she decided to walk upstream and wade through the water until she was out of the maze. even though this meant she would get wet and cold, she was determined.

after wading through the water, the fox made it out of the maze. she was happy and relieved.

from then on, the fox remembered to never be too stubborn and that the best way out of a difficult situation is often to look for a new solution.
john was so excited! his family were going on a holiday and he was so excited to go. he loved it when his family all packed up the car and went on a holiday.

john saw his mum carrying a big sack full of exciting things for the holiday. it felt like it was full of amazing things! he wondered what was inside the sack.

john had a great time on the holiday playing games, watching movies and exploring new places. each night was amazing as he would look out at the stars. he was sad when it was time to go home.

when john and his family got home, his mum opened the sack and took out some amazing holiday souvenirs for him. he was so happy to have something special to remember the amazing holiday by.
once upon a time there was a boy named jack. he loved to explore and every week he found something new. one week jack found a big, expensive toy. it was bright and sparkly, and he wanted it very much. 

jack asked his mom if he could buy the toy, but she said it was too expensive. he was sad until his mom said he could have it the next week. 

so, jack waited, and the next week he went back to the store. this time, he was allowed to get the toy and bring it home. 

jack was so excited with his new toy! he ran around the house and played with it all day. 

but then, jack's dog, rusty, came running up to him. he wanted to play too. rusty jumped up and bit the toy hard.

jack was so sad and angry. his expensive toy was now broken! he yelled at rusty and told him never to bite his toys again.

and from then on, jack never let rusty near his toys.
once upon a time, there was a small girl named leah. she was not feeling very happy that day because the sky was gloomy. 

leah's mommy asked her, "what is wrong sweetheart?" 

leah replied, "i have a dream, but i don't know how to bring it to life." 

her mommy said, "you can always bring your dream to life. just never give up and find the courage to make it happen." 

so leah smiled, and said, "thanks mommy!" she went outside, looking for the courage to bring her dream to life. she gathered enough courage, and soon enough, her dream started to become true. 

the end.
mama and jack were very excited. they had just moved into a new house. jack was only three so he couldn't help much, but he watched as mama unpacked all their boxes. he saw clothes and toys, books and games. when mama asked him what he was most excited about, he smiled and said, "i'm excited to make friends here!"

but when they opened up one of the boxes, he saw something strange - it was a stiff, white jacket. jack was confused. "what is this thing?" he asked. 

mama smiled sadly. "it's a cold jacket," she said. 

jack frowned. "why's it here?" he asked.

mama looked at jack with deep sadness in her eyes. she told him that the jacket had belonged to daddy, but he had moved on to a better place. she hugged jack and said, "it's okay to be sad, but daddy is always with us in our hearts." 

jack looked at the cold jacket and made a silent promise that he would never forget daddy. he knew that no matter where he moved, he would always remember.
once, there was a little girl who loved to go to the playground. she would smile and laugh as she swung on the swing. one day, she happily went to the playground again.

however, when she got there, she saw that part of the playground was being repaired. her smile turned downward and she began to complain. "that's not fair!" she said, pointing to the side that was being fixed.

the playground attendant came over to explain that the side was broken and he was fixing it. but the little girl was not happy. she kept complaining and the attendant gave her an idea.

he said that if she could build something on the other side that was just as hard to break, maybe he could leave the broken side alone. the girl was excited by the challenge and immediately got to work.

she gathered wood, she hammered nails and soon, she had built a sturdy fence. when the attendant saw it, he was astonished. he praised her for her hard work, and declared that the side didn't need to be repaired after all.

the little girl was thrilled! she smiled and laughed as she played on both sides of the fence. from then on, she was known as the girl who never stopped trying.

"what is this place?" said lucy, "this place is so special."

suddenly, she heard a little voice call out, "lucy, i have a surprise for you." 
lucy was scared but the voice sounded kind, so she followed it and it led her to a big old tree.

the voice said, "lucy, look inside the tree." lucy opened the little door to the tree, and inside she found a sparkly fairy.

"lucy, i just want to show you a little bit of wonder. why don't you come with me and we can explore the woods together."

lucy hesitated. she looked up at the sky and saw dark clouds gathering. she remembered the trembling feeling she had felt when she first arrived. she was worried something bad would happen.

but the fairy remained cheerful and said, "don't worry, i'm here to protect you. so please, come explore with me and together we will find some peace."

one day, dad and maggie went to an airport. maggie was so excited. dad said they were going on an adventure. dad prepared their suitcases and made sure they had everything they needed.

maggie asked, "where are we going daddy?" 

dad said, "we are flying to grandma's house. she is very excited to see you." 

maggie smiled with excitement.

they got to the airport and through security with joy. they took the train and arrived at the gate. maggie couldn't contain her excitement.

the flight on the plane was long, but maggie was happy. when they arrived at grandma's house, she was so grateful. grandma hugged maggie and welcomed them inside. 

it was the best day ever.
once upon a time, there was a little girl called sue. sue was jumping up and down in puddles outside. she loved to make a big splash. suddenly, she saw something on the edge of the puddle. it was a black hook.

"what is this?", sue asked her mom.

"it's a fishing hook, honey", mom answered. "we can go fishing with it!"

so sue and mom took the black hook and started fishing. they tossed it into the water and splashed around with it. they waited and waited, until sue suddenly felt something tugging on the black hook.

"mom, something is pulling the hook!" sue said excitedly. then, they both pulled out the black hook. on the end was a big, silver fish!

"we caught a fish!" they said together.

sue and mom were so happy and they laughed and hugged each other. sue loved fishing with her mom and was very excited that she was able to catch her first fish with a black hook.
once upon a time there was a girl called molly. molly loved to explore, she wanted to see as much of the world as she could. one day she decided to get a map. she found the prettiest map ever with all the places she wanted to explore coloured in fun colours.

molly got very excited, she showed it to her friends and they all wanted to go explore the world with her. her best friend, lucy, was really bossy and she said they could only go if they all went together. molly didn't want to be bossed around but she hoped she could convince lucy to change her mind.

molly sat down with her map and lucy came to have a look. â€œletâ€™s go to this place!â€ molly said, pointing to a place on the map. lucy shook her head and said no. she wanted to go to a completely different place on the map.

molly held her breath, this was her chance. she had to be brave and try to change lucy's mind. â€œpleaseâ€ molly said softly, with a polite smile. to her surprise lucy thought about it for a moment and then said â€œokayâ€. 

molly was so happy and the two of them went on to explore the world together. all thanks to a little bit of hoping!
once upon a time, there was a sleepy boy who loved to sleep in. one day dad made an alarm for him, so that he wouldn't be late for school. every morning, the alarm would make a loud noise and wake him up. the boy didn't like it at first, but soon he learned to love it. he stopped being so sleepy in the mornings and became a very happy boy. he thanked dad for the alarm and they both lived happily ever after!
once there was a small bird called copper. copper was thick and strong and could fly very fast. one day, copper was flying very high and not paying attention and flew into a tree.

copper couldn't fly away and was very scared. suddenly she heard a voice, it was an old bird who lived in the tree. he asked, "why are you afraid little bird?" 

"i flew too close and now i can't move," copper said, tears filling her eyes. the old bird said, "it looks like you were going too fast, maybe you should pause more often". 

copper thanked the old bird and understood his lesson. she paused to fly beside the tree, testing her wings before going higher. she was grateful for the wise words the old bird had given her. 

the moral of the story is that itâ€™s important to take time to think before making decisions. taking a pause can help us see things more clearly and can even save us from danger.
once upon a time there was a bird. the bird wanted to fly around in the sky. the bird looked past the trees and saw the big ocean. it was so big! the bird decided to fly over the ocean and have an adventure.

the bird flew in the sky and over the ocean. the ocean was so blue and the wind was so nice. the bird felt free and alive. it was a beautiful day!

the bird saw something delicious in the water. it looked like a special treat! the bird flew down and grabbed it. it was an orange! it tasted so good.

the bird had a wonderful time flying around and discovering new places. the ocean was so exciting! the bird flew around until it was time to go home.

the bird was happy. it had a wonderful day flying around and eating something delicious!
once upon a time, there was a farmer who had a long, silver pitchfork. every day, the farmer used it to work in the fields, but one day after he finished, the farmer accidentally left the pitchfork in the field!

the farmer was very worried, so he asked his neighbor, "would you lend me your pitchfork, so i can finish my work?" 

the neighbor was very nice and said, "yes, i will lend it to you." 

the farmer was very thankful. he returned the pitchfork the next day and said, "next time, i will remember to bring my pitchfork with me."

the neighbor nodded and said, "it's important to be prepared, and to be a good neighbor by lending and helping each other. we should all lend a helping hand, just as i did today." 

the moral of the story is that it is important to be prepared, but it is also important to be a good neighbor and lend a helping hand when others are in need!
ben and lily were playing in the garden. they saw a big ladder leaning on the wall. ben wanted to climb the ladder and see what was on the other side. lily was scared and said, "no, ben, don't go. it is too high and you might fall."

but ben did not listen. he ran to the ladder and started to climb. he went up and up until he reached the top. he looked over the wall and saw a wide road with many cars and trucks. he felt dizzy and scared. he wanted to go back down, but he did not know how.

he shouted, "help, help, i am stuck. lily, help me!" lily heard him and ran to the ladder. she looked up and saw ben crying. she felt sorry for him and said, "don't cry, ben, i will help you. hold on tight and i will get dad."

she ran to the house and found dad. she told him, "dad, dad, ben is on the ladder and he can't come down. he is crying and scared. please help him." dad followed lily to the garden and saw ben on the ladder. he said, "ben, don't worry, i am here. i will get you down. just stay calm and listen to me."

dad climbed the ladder and reached ben. he hugged him and said, "you are brave, ben, but you should not climb the ladder without me. it is dangerous and you could get hurt. next time, ask me first, ok?" ben nodded and said, "ok, dad, i am sorry. i won't do it again." dad carried ben down the ladder and put him on the ground. he kissed him and said, "i love you, ben. you are my son and i am proud of you. but please be careful and listen to lily. she is your sister and she cares for you."

ben hugged dad and said, "i love you, dad. and i love lily too. she is my sister and she helped me. thank you, lily." lily hugged ben and said, "you are welcome, ben. i am glad you are ok. let's play something else. how about we draw some pictures?" ben smiled and said, "yes, let's do that. that sounds fun." they went to the house and got some paper and crayons. they drew some pictures of the garden, the ladder, the road, and their family. they had fun and forgot about their scare. they were happy.
lila and ben are twins. they like to play outside in the sun. they have a big ball and a small bike. they share them and have fun.

one day, it is very hot. the sun is bright and makes them sweat. they drink some water and look for some shade. they see a big tree with thin branches. they run to the tree and sit under it.

"ah, this is nice," lila says. "the tree is cool and the sun is not in our eyes."

"yes, it is," ben agrees. "but i want to play some more. let's go back to the ball and the bike."

"no, i don't want to," lila says. "it is too hot. i want to stay here."

"please, lila," ben says. "it is boring here. come on, just for a little while."

"no, ben," lila says. "you go if you want to. i will stay here."

ben is sad. he wants to play with his sister. he does not want to play alone. he tries to make lila change her mind. he says nice things and funny things. he makes faces and noises. he tickles her and hugs her. but lila does not move. she shuts her eyes and her ears. she does not listen to ben. she does not look at ben. she does not talk to ben.

ben is angry. he does not like lila's behavior. he thinks she is selfish and rude. he decides to teach her a lesson. he takes the ball and the bike. he goes to the other side of the tree. he plays with them by himself. he makes loud sounds and happy shouts. he pretends he is having a lot of fun. he hopes lila will hear him and feel sorry. he hopes she will come and join him.

but lila does not hear him. she does not feel sorry. she does not come and join him. she is asleep. she is tired from the heat and the play. she is dreaming of the sun and the tree and the ball and the bike. she is dreaming of ben and lila. she is dreaming of fun.
lily and ben were playing in the park. they saw a big brown dog with a ball in his mouth. lily liked dogs and wanted to pet him. ben was afraid of dogs and stayed away.

"come on, ben, he is nice!" lily urged. she ran to the dog and reached out her hand. the dog growled and showed his teeth. lily got scared and ran back to ben.

"see, i told you dogs are bad!" ben said. he hugged lily and tried to make her feel better.

a man came and called the dog. he saw lily and ben and said, "i'm sorry, kids, he doesn't like strangers. he is very old and grumpy. you should always ask before you touch a dog. they might bite you if they feel threatened."

lily and ben nodded and said, "we're sorry, sir. we won't do it again."

the man smiled and said, "that's good. dogs can be good friends, but you have to respect them and their space. here, you can have his ball. he doesn't play with it anymore."

he gave them the ball and walked away with the dog. lily and ben thanked him and played with the ball. they learned to be careful and polite with animals.
anna and ben were twins who liked to play in the park. one day, they saw an elderly lady sitting on a bench. she had a big bag with her and a small dog on a leash.

"let's go and say hello to her," anna said. "maybe she will give us a treat or let us pet her dog."

"ok," ben agreed. they ran towards the lady and smiled.

"hello, lady," anna said. "what is your name? what is your dog's name?"

the lady looked at them and frowned. she did not answer. she pulled her bag closer to her and held her dog tighter.

"go away, you naughty children," she said. "you want to steal my things and hurt my dog. leave me alone!"

anna and ben were shocked. they did not want to steal or hurt anything. they just wanted to be friendly.

"why are you so mean, lady?" ben asked. "we are not naughty. we are nice. we just want to talk to you."

the lady did not listen. she started to scream and wave her arms. she shouted for help. she said the twins were trying to rob her and attack her.

people in the park heard her and came to see what was wrong. they saw the lady and the twins and did not know what to do. some of them believed the lady and thought the twins were bad. some of them doubted the lady and thought she was crazy.

anna and ben were scared and confused. they did not know why the lady was lying and why some people were angry at them. they wanted to explain, but no one would listen. they wanted to run away, but they were surrounded.

they wished they had never tried to talk to the lady. they wished they had stayed away from her. they wished they had never gone to the park that day.
sara was a big sister. she had a baby brother named tom. sara loved tom very much, but sometimes she was jealous. she wanted to play with mom and dad, but they were busy with tom.

one day, sara saw tom sleeping in his crib. she had an idea. she took her doctor kit and went to examine tom. she put a stethoscope on his chest, a thermometer in his mouth, and a band-aid on his arm. she said, "i am a doctor. i will make you better, tom."

but tom did not like sara's game. he woke up and started to cry. he spit out the thermometer and pulled off the band-aid. he was scared and hurt. he wanted mom and dad.

mom and dad heard tom's cry and ran to his room. they saw sara and her doctor kit. they were angry and worried. they said, "sara, what did you do to tom? you should not play with him like that. you could hurt him or make him sick. he is a baby. he needs love and care, not games and toys."

sara felt sorry and ashamed. she said, "i am sorry, mom and dad. i wanted to play with you, but you were busy with tom. i wanted to examine him, like you do. i wanted to be intelligent, like you are."

mom and dad hugged sara and said, "sara, we love you very much. you are a big sister and a smart girl. you can play with us and with tom, but you have to be gentle and kind. you can examine him, but only with your eyes and your words. you can ask him questions, like how he feels, what he likes, and what he learns. you can help him grow and learn, too. that is how you show your intelligence and your love."

sara smiled and said, "thank you, mom and dad. i understand. i will be a good sister and a good doctor. i will love tom and play with him nicely."

she went to tom's crib and said, "hi, tom. i am sorry i scared you. i love you. do you want to play with me?"

tom stopped crying and looked at sara. he smiled and reached for her hand. he said, "yes, sara. i love you, too. you are my sister. you are intelligent."

the end.
lily and ben like to play with rocks and sand. they make a big hill with rocks and sand. they say it is a volcano. they find a red bottle and put it on top of the hill. they say it is lava.

they want to make the volcano go boom. they look for something to make it go boom. they see a box with a picture of a rocket. they say it is a supply for the volcano. they open the box and take out a rocket. they put the rocket in the red bottle.

they run away from the volcano and hide behind a tree. they wait for the volcano to go boom. they hear a loud noise and see smoke and fire. the volcano goes boom. the rocket flies out of the bottle and hits a bird. the bird falls to the ground.

lily and ben are scared and sad. they run to the bird and see it is hurt. they say sorry to the bird and try to help it. they find some water and a cloth and clean the bird's wound. they find some seeds and a worm and feed the bird. they stroke the bird and talk to it.

the bird feels better and thanks lily and ben. it says it is not angry with them. it says they are kind and brave. it says it will be their friend. it flaps its wings and flies away. lily and ben wave goodbye to the bird. they say they will not play with the volcano anymore. they say they will play with the bird instead. they hug each other and smile.
lily liked to write. she had a big book and a red pen. she wrote her name, her mom's name, and her cat's name. she wrote some letters and some shapes. she was happy.

one day, she wanted to write more. she looked for her book and her pen, but she could not find them. she asked her mom, but her mom did not know. she asked her cat, but her cat did not care. she was sad.

she looked everywhere. she looked under her bed, in her closet, and in her toy box. she did not see her book and her pen. she saw a spider, a sock, and a ball. she was scared.

she ran to the kitchen. she saw her dad. he was drinking milk. she hugged him and told him what happened. he smiled and said, "don't worry, lily. i have a surprise for you."

he took her to his office. he showed her a new book and a new pen. they were bigger and brighter than her old ones. he said, "i saw how much you like to write, so i got these for you. you can write anything you want."

lily was happy. she thanked her dad and kissed him. she took her new book and her new pen. she wrote, "i love my dad. he is the best." she was not sad or scared anymore. she was proud.
sara and ben liked to play with their wagon. they put their toys and books in it and pulled it around the yard. one day, they saw an elderly lady walking on the sidewalk. she had a big hat and a cane.

"hello, children," the lady said. "what a nice wagon you have. can i see what's inside?"

sara and ben nodded and ran to the lady. they showed her their toys and books. the lady smiled and said they were very good.

"can i try your wagon?" the lady asked. "it looks like fun."

sara and ben agreed and helped the lady sit in the wagon. they pulled her slowly along the sidewalk. the lady laughed and waved her hat.

but then, they came to a bump. the wagon shook and the lady lost her balance. she fell out of the wagon and onto the grass.

"ouch!" the lady said. "are you okay?" sara and ben asked. they ran to the lady and helped her up.

"i'm okay, thank you," the lady said. "but i think i'm too old for wagons. maybe you should pull each other instead."

sara and ben hugged the lady and said they were sorry. the lady hugged them back and said they were very kind. she gave them a candy and said goodbye. sara and ben waved and thanked her. then they pulled each other in the wagon and had more fun.
anna loves pandas. she has a big panda toy that she hugs every night. she calls him pandy. pandy is soft and black and white. he has a smile on his face.

one day, anna goes to the zoo with her mom and dad. she is very excited. she wants to see the real pandas. she runs to the panda enclosure. she sees two pandas eating bamboo. they are lazy and slow. they do not look at anna.

"mom, why are the pandas not playing?" anna asks.

"they are not playing because they are full and tired," mom says. "they like to rest after eating. they are patient animals. they wait for the right time to play."

anna nods. she understands. she is patient too. she waits for the pandas to finish eating. she hopes they will play soon.

she sees a third panda in the corner. he is smaller than the others. he is not eating. he is looking at anna. he has a curious expression. he walks towards anna. he stops at the fence. he reaches out his paw.

anna is surprised. she smiles. she reaches out her hand. she touches the panda's paw. it is warm and fuzzy. the panda makes a soft noise. he sounds happy.

"hi, panda," anna says. "do you want to play with me?"

the panda nods. he shakes his paw. he wants to play. he looks at pandy. he likes pandy. he thinks pandy is his friend.

anna laughs. she gives pandy to the panda. the panda hugs pandy. he shakes pandy gently. he makes pandy dance. he makes pandy smile.

anna claps. she is happy. she has made a new friend. she thinks the panda is patient and kind. she thinks the panda is fun. she thinks the panda is the best.
tom liked to ride his horse, spot. spot was big and brown and fast. tom and spot went to the farm every day. they helped with the cows and the sheep and the pigs.

one day, tom saw a new horse at the farm. it was black and shiny and had a long mane. tom wanted to ride the new horse. he asked the farmer, "can i ride that horse?"

the farmer said, "no, tom. that horse is not for you. that horse is wild and mean. he will buck you off and hurt you. you should stay with spot. he is a good horse."

but tom did not listen. he waited until the farmer was busy. then he sneaked to the new horse. he put a saddle and a bridle on the horse. he climbed on the horse. he said, "giddy up!"

the horse did not like tom. he did not like the saddle and the bridle. he did not like to be told what to do. he started to run and jump and kick. he tried to throw tom off.

tom was scared. he held on to the horse. he felt the saddle and the bridle were tight. he felt his arms and legs were tired. he wanted to quit. he wanted to go back to spot. he cried, "help! help!"

the farmer heard tom. he ran to the horse. he grabbed the reins and stopped the horse. he helped tom get off the horse. he said, "tom, are you okay? you should not have ridden that horse. he is too wild for you. you could have been hurt. you should have listened to me. you should have stayed with spot. he is a good horse."

tom was sorry. he said, "i'm sorry, farmer. i'm sorry, spot. i was wrong. i should have listened to you. i should have stayed with you. you are a good horse. can i ride you again?"

spot nuzzled tom. he forgave tom. he let tom ride him again. tom and spot went back to the farm. they helped with the cows and the sheep and the pigs. they were happy.
sara and ben wanted to paint a rainbow. they had red, orange, yellow, green, blue and purple paints. they took a big paper and a brush each. they started to paint from one side of the paper.

"look, i made red and orange!" sara said.

"i made yellow and green!" ben said.

they moved their brushes to the middle of the paper. but then they saw a problem. they both wanted to paint blue and purple.

"no, i want to paint blue and purple!" sara said.

"no, i want to paint blue and purple!" ben said.

they both pushed their brushes to the same spot. the paints mixed and made a brown mess.

"oh no, we ruined the rainbow!" sara said.

"we can't complete it now!" ben said.

they felt sad and angry. they put down their brushes and crossed their arms.

just then, their mom came in. she saw the paper and the paints. she smiled and said, "what a beautiful rainbow! you two are so lucky to have each other. you can share and make anything together."

sara and ben looked at their mom. they looked at the paper. they saw that the brown mess was not so bad. it looked like a pot of gold at the end of the rainbow.

they smiled and said, "thank you, mom. you are right. we are lucky to have each other. we can share and make anything together."

they hugged their mom and each other. they picked up their brushes and completed the rainbow. they were happy.
jen and ben had a dog named spot. spot was unique. he had black and white spots all over his fur. he liked to run and play and chase balls. jen and ben loved spot very much.

one day, jen and ben wanted to take spot to the park. they had a new leash for him. it was red and shiny and had a bell on it. jen and ben thought it was very pretty. they hoped spot would like it too.

they put the leash on spot and went outside. spot was excited. he saw a lot of things to sniff and explore. he pulled on the leash and made the bell ring. jen and ben laughed and followed him.

but when they got to the park, they saw a problem. there was a big sign that said: "no dogs allowed". jen and ben were sad. they wanted to play with spot in the park. they looked around and saw a lot of people and children and bikes and swings. they did not see any other dogs.

they wondered what to do. they did not want to break the rule. they did not want to make spot unhappy. they did not want to go back home. they wished they could find a place where spot could fit in.

then they saw it. across the street, there was a pet store. it had a big window with a lot of animals inside. there were cats and birds and fish and hamsters and rabbits. and there were also dogs. they were all different sizes and colors and shapes. they looked happy and friendly.

jen and ben had an idea. they asked their mom if they could go to the pet store. their mom said yes. they crossed the street and went inside. they took spot with them. they showed him the other animals. they let him sniff and greet and play with the other dogs. they saw that spot was unique, but he was not alone. he fit in with the other dogs. he made new friends.

jen and ben were happy. they found a place where spot could fit in. they also liked the other animals. they asked their mom if they could come back again. their mom said yes. they thanked the pet store owner and left. they still had the red and shiny leash with the bell on it. they still thought it was very pretty. they still hoped spot would like it too. they decided to keep it for another day. a day when they could find a park where dogs were allowed. a park where spot could run and play and chase balls. a park where spot could be unique and happy.
lily and tom are friends. they like to play and sing. they have a little house in the garden. they go there every day.

one day, they see a big dog. the dog is not nice. the dog is angry. the dog runs to the little house. lily and tom are scared. they try to hide.

the dog finds them. the dog barks and bites. lily and tom cry and scream. they want help. but no one hears them.

the dog hurts them a lot. lily and tom stop crying and screaming. they stop playing and singing. they are very sad. the dog is very bad. the end.
lila and tom are friends. they like to play with dolls and cars. one day, lila has a new doll. she is very happy. she shows tom her new doll. it has a blue dress and yellow hair.

"wow, your new doll is very pretty!" tom says.

"thank you, tom. do you want to play with her?" lila asks.

"yes, please. can i hold her?" tom says.

lila gives tom her new doll. tom holds her gently. he looks at her dress. he sees a thread. he pulls the thread.

"tom, what are you doing?" lila says.

"i want to see what is inside the dress," tom says.

he pulls the thread harder. the dress rips. the stuffing comes out. lila sees her new doll with no dress and no stuffing. she is very sad. she cries.

"tom, you broke my new doll! you are a bad friend!" lila says.

"i'm sorry, lila. i didn't mean to break your new doll. i was just curious. please don't cry," tom says.

but lila does not listen. she takes her new doll and runs away. she does not want to play with tom anymore. tom is very sorry. he wishes he did not peek at the thread. he wishes he could fix the new doll. he wishes he could make lila happy again. but he can't. he is alone. he is sad. the end.
lily and ben are twins. they like to play with their toys and books. but sometimes they fight. lily wants to play with the doll and ben wants to play with the car. they yell and pull and cry.

mom comes and says, "stop fighting! you need to share and be nice. use your brain and think of a way to play together. or i will shut the door and you will stay in your room."

lily and ben do not want to stay in their room. they want to play. they look at their toys and books. they see a large box. they have an idea.

they put the doll and the car in the box. they make the box a house. they pretend the doll and the car are a family. they take turns to be the mom and the dad. they have fun.

mom comes and sees them playing. she smiles and says, "good job! you used your brain and found a way to play together. you are smart and kind. i am proud of you." she gives them a hug and a kiss. lily and ben are happy.
ben and lily were twins who liked to play with their toys. one day, they found a big box in the garage. it was heavy and had a label that said "do not open". ben and lily were curious and wanted to see what was inside.

they pushed and pulled the box until they moved it to the living room. they used a scissors to cut the tape and opened the box. inside, they saw a lot of shiny things that looked like stars. they were happy and started to take them out and play with them.

but the shiny things were not stars. they were fireworks that their dad had bought for a special night. the scissors made a spark when they cut the tape, and the spark lit one of the fireworks. the firework made a loud noise and flew out of the box. it hit the curtains and set them on fire.

ben and lily were scared and ran away. they heard more noises and saw more fire. they hid under the bed and cried. their mom and dad came home and saw the smoke and the flames. they called the firemen and tried to put out the fire.

the firemen came and stopped the fire. they asked ben and lily what happened. ben and lily felt guilty and told them the truth. they said they were sorry and that they did not know the shiny things were dangerous. their mom and dad were angry and sad. they gave ben and lily a big hug and said they were glad they were safe. but they also said they had to pay a lot of money to fix the house and the things that were burned. they said ben and lily had to give away some of their toys and do extra chores to help. ben and lily nodded and said they would. they wished they had never opened the box.
anna liked to look at tiny things with her microscope. she had a book with pictures of bugs and flowers and other things that were too small to see. she would put a slide under the microscope and turn the knob to make it bigger and clearer.

one day, her brother tom came into her room and saw her microscope. he wanted to play with it too. he grabbed the book and the slides and said, "i want to look at these. you can't have them. they are mine now."

anna was angry. she said, "no, they are not. they are mine. you are being bossy and mean. give them back to me."

tom said, "no, i won't. i am older and smarter than you. i can do what i want. you can't tell me what to do."

they started to fight and pull and push each other. they knocked over the microscope and it fell on the floor. it broke into pieces and made a loud noise.

their mom heard the noise and came into the room. she saw the broken microscope and the mess. she was very upset. she said, "what did you do? how could you be so careless and rude? you have to share and be nice to each other. you are both in trouble now."
anna and ben are friends. they like to play and laugh together. one day, they find a book of jokes. they want to read the jokes and make each other laugh.

anna reads the first joke. she says, "what do you call a fish that wears a bow tie?" ben thinks hard. he does not know. anna says, "sofishticated!" she laughs. ben laughs too. he thinks the joke is funny.

ben reads the next joke. he says, "why did the chicken cross the road?" anna thinks hard. she does not know. ben says, "to get to the other slide!" he laughs. anna does not laugh. she is confused. she says, "that is not a joke. that is silly. chickens do not slide."

ben says, "yes, they do. look at the picture." he shows anna the picture in the book. it is a chicken on a slide. anna says, "that is not a real chicken. that is a drawing. drawings are not real."

ben says, "but it is a joke. jokes are not real. jokes are funny." anna says, "no, jokes are real. jokes make sense. that joke does not make sense. that joke is bad."

anna and ben start to argue. they do not agree on what is a joke. they do not laugh anymore. they get angry and sad. they cry.

mom hears them cry. she comes to see what is wrong. she sees the book of jokes. she says, "what is the matter, anna and ben? why are you crying?"

anna and ben tell mom about the jokes. they tell her why they are confused and upset. mom listens. she says, "i understand. jokes are tricky. sometimes they are funny. sometimes they are not. sometimes they make sense. sometimes they do not. it is okay to have different opinions. it is okay to not like a joke. but it is not okay to fight and cry. you are friends. you should be kind and respectful to each other. you should share and take turns. you should say sorry and forgive. you should have fun and learn together."

anna and ben nod. they say sorry to each other. they hug and make up. they wipe their tears. they smile. they decide to read more jokes. they hope to find some that they both like. they thank mom for helping them. mom says, "you are welcome. i love you both. jokes are good. jokes make you laugh. laughter is good. laughter makes you happy."
sara liked to look at the owl in the big tree. the owl had big eyes and soft feathers. sara thought the owl was attractive. she wanted to be friends with the owl.

one day, sara brought some nuts and seeds to the tree. she hoped the owl would like them. she called to the owl, "hello, owl! do you want to play with me? i have some food for you!"

the owl looked at sara and blinked. he did not want to play with sara. he wanted to sleep. he was tired from hunting at night. he said to sara, "hoo, hoo, go away! i do not want to play. i do not want your food. leave me alone!"

sara felt sad and angry. she did not like the owl's words. she said to the owl, "you are mean and rude! you do not know how to be nice. i quit! i do not want to be your friend anymore!"

she threw the nuts and seeds on the ground and ran away. she did not look at the owl again. the owl did not care. he closed his eyes and went back to sleep. he did not need sara's friendship. he was happy by himself.
lily and ben are twins. they like to play in the snow. they make a snowman and a snow fort. they throw snowballs at each other. they laugh and have fun.

but soon they feel cold and hungry. they want to go inside and have some hot chocolate. they put on their hats and gloves and scarves. they say goodbye to their snowman and their snow fort. they march to the door of their house.

mama is waiting for them. she has a big smile and a warm hug. she has two cups of hot chocolate on the table. she puts some marshmallows on top. she says, "here you go, my sweeties. drink this and you will feel warm and cozy."

lily and ben sit down and sip their hot chocolate. they feel the heat in their mouths and their bellies. they say, "thank you, mama. this is yummy." they look out the window and see their snowman and their snow fort. they are icy and white. they say, "we will play with you again tomorrow."
tim and mia were playing with their dolls in the living room. they had a lot of toys and clothes for their dolls, because their mom and dad always gave them what they wanted. they were spoiled children.

"look at my doll, she has a new dress with a zipper!" mia said, showing off her doll to tim. "she can zip and unzip it like this, see?"

tim was not impressed. he wanted a zipper for his doll too. he looked around and saw a jacket on the couch. it had a zipper too. he had an idea.

"i have a zipper too!" he said, grabbing the jacket and running to his doll. he tried to put the jacket on his doll, but it was too big. he pulled the zipper hard, but it got stuck. he pulled harder, but it broke. he heard a loud rip.

"hey, that's my jacket!" mia shouted, seeing what tim had done. "you broke it! you broke my zipper!"

she ran to tim and tried to take the jacket from him. they both pulled and pushed, and the jacket tore more. they started to cry.

their mom heard the noise and came to the living room. she saw the mess and the broken jacket. she was angry.

"what have you done?" she asked them. "you ruined mia's jacket! that was a gift from grandma! how could you be so careless?"

she took the jacket from them and threw it in the trash. she looked at their dolls and their toys. she shook her head.

"you have too many things, and you don't appreciate them. you need to learn to share and to take care of your stuff. from now on, i will supply you with only one toy each, and you will have to play with it nicely. do you understand?"

tim and mia nodded, feeling sorry and ashamed. they hugged each other and said they were sorry. they hoped their mom would forgive them and give them back their toys someday. they learned their lesson.
tim and mia were playing in the park. they liked to dig in the sand and look for treasures. one day, they found something shiny and hard in the sand. it was gold!

"wow, look at this!" tim said, holding the gold in his hand. "it is so pretty and bright!"

"let me see!" mia said, reaching for the gold. "maybe we can buy candy with it!"

they were so happy with their find. they did not see the enormous shadow that fell over them. it was a big, scary dog. it had sharp teeth and a loud bark. it wanted the gold too.

the dog ran towards them, growling and snarling. tim and mia were very afraid. they dropped the gold and ran away. they trembled as they hid behind a slide.

"go away, bad dog!" tim shouted. "that is our gold!"

but the dog did not listen. it picked up the gold in its mouth and ran away. tim and mia were sad and angry. they had lost their treasure.

"maybe we can find more gold another day," mia said, trying to cheer up tim.

"or maybe we can find something else," tim said, wiping his tears. "like a rainbow or a star."

they hugged each other and went home. they still liked to play in the park, but they always looked out for the big, scary dog.
lily and max were playing in the park. they liked the slide a lot. they took turns to go down the slide. lily went first, then max, then lily, then max.

but then a big boy came. he said he wanted the slide. he pushed lily and max away. he said they were too small and he was big. he said the slide was his.

lily and max were sad and scared. they did not know what to do. they looked at their mom. their mom was on a bench. she was reading a book. she did not see the big boy.

lily wanted to tell their mom. she said to max, "let's go to mom. she will help us." but max was obedient. he said, "no, mom said we have to play nice and share. we have to wait for our turn."

lily did not like that. she said, "but he is not nice. he is mean. he does not share. he took our slide." max shrugged. he said, "i don't know. maybe he will go soon. maybe he will get bored."

lily and max waited and waited. but the big boy did not go. he did not get bored. he kept going down the slide. he laughed and shouted. he did not care about lily and max.

lily and max were very sad. they missed the slide. they wished the big boy would leave. they wished their mom would see. they wished they could have fun.
sam and mia liked to travel with their mom and dad. they went to many places and saw many things. one day, they went to a farm where they could play with animals and make things with clay.

sam and mia saw a big pile of clay and ran to it. they wanted to make animals with clay. sam made a cow and mia made a sheep. they were very happy with their clay animals.

but then, they saw a little pig who was sad. the pig had no friends and no clay. he wanted to play with sam and mia, but he was shy. he looked at their clay animals and wished he had one too.

sam and mia saw the pig and felt sorry for him. they were compassionate and wanted to help him. they decided to share their clay with the pig and make him a friend.

"hi, little pig," sam said. "do you want to play with us? we have some clay for you. you can make an animal too."

"really?" the pig said. "thank you, sam and mia. you are very kind. i would like to make a pig with clay."

sam and mia gave some clay to the pig and helped him make a pig. the pig was very happy and proud of his clay pig. he hugged sam and mia and thanked them again.

sam and mia were happy too. they learned that sharing is caring and that making friends is fun. they played with the pig and their clay animals until it was time to go home. they said goodbye to the pig and promised to come back soon. the pig waved to them and smiled. he was not sad anymore. he had friends and clay.
tom had a huge toy car that he loved to play with. it was red and shiny and made loud noises. he liked to drive it around the yard and pretend he was a racer. but he had a problem. his toy car was too big to fit in the garage. the garage was where he kept his other toys, like his bike and his ball and his teddy bear.

one day, tom had an idea. he saw his dad's car parked in the driveway. his dad's car was also red and shiny and made loud noises. maybe his dad's car could fit in the garage, and then he could put his toy car in the driveway. tom thought that was a good plan. he ran to his dad's car and opened the door. he climbed inside and tried to find the keys. he did not know how to drive a real car, but he thought it was easy. he just had to turn the wheel and push the pedals.
