tom found the keys and put them in the hole. he turned them and the car started. he was very happy. he pushed the pedal and the car moved. he turned the wheel and the car turned. he did not see the fence or the tree or the mailbox. he only saw the garage. he wanted to fit his dad's car in the garage. he pushed the pedal harder and the car went faster. he turned the wheel more and the car went straight to the garage.

but the car did not fit in the garage. the car was too big and the garage was too small. the car crashed into the garage and made a huge noise. the garage broke and fell down. the car broke and stopped. tom was scared and sad. he did not know what he did. he did not know what his dad would say. he did not know what to do. he started to cry. he wished he never touched his dad's car. he wished he played with his toy car instead. he wished he could fit his toy car in the garage. but he could not. he made a big mess. he made a big mistake. he made a bad ending.
lila and ben are friends. they like to play in the park. they run, jump, slide and swing. they have fun.

one day, they see a big truck in the park. the truck is noisy. it makes loud sounds. vroom, vroom, beep, beep. lila and ben are curious. they want to see the truck.

they go near the truck. they see a man. the man is holding a palm. the palm is green and tall. the man is putting the palm in the truck.

"hello, man," lila says. "what are you doing with the palm?"

"hello, kids," the man says. "i am taking the palm to a new place. the palm is too big for the park. it needs more space."

"can we go with you?" ben asks. "we want to see the new place."

"sorry, kids," the man says. "you cannot go with me. the truck is full. and the new place is far. you have to stay in the park. but you can wave goodbye to the palm."

lila and ben are sad. they like the palm. they hug the palm. they say goodbye to the palm. they wave to the man and the truck. the truck leaves the park. the truck is noisy. vroom, vroom, beep, beep.

lila and ben look at the empty spot. the spot is where the palm was. the spot is now small and brown. lila and ben are sad.

"let's play," lila says. "maybe we can find a new friend in the park."

"ok," ben says. "let's play."

they run, jump, slide and swing. they have fun. they end the day with a smile.
one day, a prince was playing in the garden with his ball. he saw a big bird in the sky. the bird was hungry and wanted to eat the ball. the prince was scared and ran to his mother.

"mommy, mommy, help me! the bird wants to take my ball!" he cried.

his mother hugged him and said, "don't worry, my dear. i will protect you and your ball. the bird can't hurt you."

she took a stick and waved it at the bird. the bird was afraid and flew away. the prince was happy and thanked his mother.

"thank you, mommy. you are brave and kind. i love you," he said.

his mother smiled and said, "i love you too, my prince. you are my precious son. now, let's go inside and have some cookies."

they went inside and ate some cookies. the prince shared his cookies with his mother. he was sorry for the bird. he hoped the bird would find some food somewhere else. he wished the bird would be his friend. he said a little prayer for the bird. he was a good prince.
lily and ben were playing in the garden. they had a big blanket and some toys. they wanted to have a picnic under the sun.

"let's spread the blanket here, ben," lily said. she put the blanket on the grass and smoothed it with her hands.

"ok, lily," ben said. he opened the toy chest and took out some plates, cups and food. he put them on the blanket. "look, we have sandwiches, juice and cookies. yum!"

they sat on the blanket and ate their picnic. they talked and laughed and shared their food. they felt happy and warm in their chests.

"this is a lovely day, lily," ben said. he smiled at his sister.

"yes, it is, ben," lily said. she hugged him. "you are a lovely brother."

they finished their picnic and packed their toys. they folded the blanket and put it in the chest. they held hands and went back to the house. they had a lovely time in the garden.
lily and ben are twins. they like to play with animals. one day, they go to the zoo with mom and dad. they see many animals, like lions, monkeys, and elephants. they are very happy.

they come to a big cage with birds. the birds have many colors, like red, blue, and yellow. lily and ben want to see them closer. they rush to the cage and put their faces on the bars. they say hello to the birds.

but one bird is not happy. it is pale and sad. it does not sing or fly. it sits on a branch and looks at lily and ben. lily and ben see the bird and feel sorry for it. they ask mom and dad why the bird is pale and sad.

mom and dad say the bird is sick. it needs a doctor and medicine. they say the zoo people are trying to help the bird. they say lily and ben can pray for the bird to get better.

lily and ben nod. they say bye to the bird and tell it to be strong. they hope the bird will get better soon. they go to see other animals, but they do not forget the pale and sad bird. they pray for it in their hearts.
sam was a curious boy who liked to examine everything he saw. one day, he found a big onion in the kitchen. he wondered what it was and how it smelled. he picked up the onion and peeled off the brown skin. he saw many white layers inside.

he wanted to know more, so he brought the onion to his nose and sniffed it. it smelled very strong and made his eyes water. he sneezed and rubbed his eyes. he felt a burning pain in his eyes and nose. he dropped the onion and cried.

his mom heard him and ran to the kitchen. she saw him holding his face and the onion on the floor. she knew what happened and felt sorry for him. she hugged him and took him to the sink. she washed his eyes and nose with water. she told him the onion was a food that made people cry. she said he should not examine it with his nose. she gave him a cookie and a kiss.

sam learned his lesson and never examined an onion again. he still liked to be curious, but he was more careful. he asked his mom before he touched anything new. he did not want to cry or hurt himself again. he was a smart boy.
sara and ben love to play in the garden. they like to dig, water, and plant seeds. they also like to look for bugs and birds. sometimes they pretend to be animals or fairies.

one day, they find a big, shiny stone in the garden. it is round and smooth and has many colors. sara picks it up and says, "look, ben, what a pretty stone! maybe it is magic!"

ben takes the stone and says, "maybe it can make us become anything we want! let's try it!"

they close their eyes and wish very hard. sara wishes to become a butterfly, and ben wishes to become a lion. they open their eyes and look at each other.

but nothing has changed. they are still sara and ben, holding the stone. they feel sad and confused.

"maybe the stone is broken," sara says.

"or maybe we need to say a magic word," ben says.

they try different words, like "abracadabra", "please", and "banana". but nothing works.

they are about to give up, when they hear a voice.

"hello, children. what are you doing with my stone?"

they turn around and see a lady with a big hat and a basket. she is smiling and has a mild voice.

she is the gardener. she tells them that the stone is not magic, but a special kind of rock that she found in the mountains. she says that she likes to keep it in the garden, because it makes her happy.

she also tells them that they don't need a stone to become anything they want. they can use their imagination and their creativity. she says that she likes to pretend to be a bird or a flower sometimes.

she invites them to join her in the garden, and shows them how to make crowns and necklaces with leaves and flowers. she also teaches them the names of the plants and the animals.

sara and ben forget about the stone. they have fun with the gardener, and learn many new things. they decide that the garden is a magical place, after all.
sam and mia are friends. they like to play together. sometimes they play with toys, sometimes they play with balls, sometimes they run and jump.

one day, they decide to play exercise. they want to be strong and healthy. they find a big rope in the yard. they think it is fun to pull the rope.

sam says, "i will pull this end, and you pull that end. we will see who is stronger."

mia says, "ok, let's do it. but be careful, don't pull too hard."

they start to pull the rope. they pull and pull and pull. they feel their arms and legs working. they laugh and smile.

but then, something happens. the rope breaks. it snaps in the middle. sam and mia fall down. they are surprised and scared.

they look at the rope. it is old and thin. it is not reliable. it is not good for exercise.

sam says, "oh no, the rope is broken. it is not a good rope. it is a bad rope."

mia says, "yes, it is a bad rope. but we are ok. we are not hurt. we are still friends."

they hug each other. they are happy. they decide to find another game to play. they look for a reliable toy. they find a ball. they think it is fun to kick the ball. they play exercise with the ball. they are strong and healthy.
anna and ben were playing in the garden. they found a big hole in the ground. they wanted to see what was inside.

"let's fill the hole with water and make a pond!" said anna.

"no, let's fill the hole with sand and make a castle!" said ben.

they started to argue. they did not want to share the hole.

suddenly, they saw something shiny in the hole. they stopped arguing and looked closer. it was a tooth!

"wow, a tooth! whose tooth is it?" asked anna.

"maybe it is a dinosaur tooth!" said ben.

"maybe it is a fairy tooth!" said anna.

they picked up the tooth and examined it. it was big and white and had a mysterious mark on it.

they heard a loud roar behind them. they turned around and saw a lion. the lion was angry. he had a gap in his mouth where the tooth was missing.

"give me back my tooth!" he roared.

anna and ben were scared. they dropped the tooth and ran away. they hid behind a tree.

they realized they had been silly. they should not have fought over the hole. they should have respected the lion's tooth.

they learned a lesson. they decided to be kind and share with each other. they also decided to leave the hole alone. it was not theirs to fill.
lily and tom were playing in the park with their toys. they liked to share and have fun. lily had a rare doll that her grandma gave her. it had a pretty dress and long hair. tom had a big truck that made noises and moved.

"can i play with your doll?" tom asked lily.

"ok, but be careful. she is very rare and special," lily said.

lily gave tom her doll and took his truck. she drove it around the grass and made honking sounds. tom looked at the doll and smiled. he liked her hair. he pulled it hard.

"ow!" the doll said. she had a voice box inside her. "that hurts!"

lily heard the doll and ran to tom. she saw him tear her hair.

"stop! you are hurting her!" lily cried. she grabbed the doll from tom. she saw a big hole in her hair. she felt sad and angry.

"i'm sorry, lily. i didn't mean to," tom said. he looked sorry too.

lily hugged her doll and tried to fix her hair. she did not want to play with tom anymore. she wanted to go home and keep her doll safe.

"let's go, mommy," lily said. she walked to her mommy, who was sitting on a bench.

"what's wrong, sweetie?" mommy asked. she saw lily's doll and the hole in her hair.

"tom tore her hair. he was mean," lily said.

mommy looked at tom and his mommy. they came over and said sorry.

"we're sorry, lily. tom didn't know how to play with your doll. he likes trucks better," tom's mommy said.

"can you forgive him, lily?" mommy asked.

lily thought for a moment. she was still sad, but she remembered that tom was her friend. he made her laugh sometimes. he shared his truck with her.

"ok, i forgive you, tom. but don't do it again," lily said.

"thank you, lily. i won't do it again. i'm sorry," tom said.

lily and tom hugged and said sorry. they decided to play with their own toys. they were still friends. mommy and tom's mommy smiled and said they were proud of them. lily's doll was rare, but so was her friendship.
lily and ben were playing in the park. they liked to hop on the grass and look for bugs. they saw a big frog near the pond. it was green and wet.

"look, a frog!" lily said. "can we catch it?"

ben nodded. he ran to the frog and tried to grab it. but the frog was fast. it hopped away from ben and into the water.

"come back, frog!" ben shouted. he was angry. he wanted to play with the frog.

lily followed ben to the pond. she saw the frog under the water. it looked at them with big eyes.

"maybe the frog is scared," lily said. "maybe it does not like to be caught."

ben frowned. he did not understand. he liked to catch things.

"let's try again," he said. he reached for the frog.

but the frog did not want to be caught. it hopped out of the water and onto the shore. it made a loud croak. it sounded angry.

"go away, kids!" the frog said. "this is my home. leave me alone!"

lily and ben were surprised. they did not know that frogs could talk. they felt sorry for the frog.

"sorry, frog," lily said. "we did not mean to bother you. we just wanted to be your friends."

the frog looked at them. it saw that they were not bad. it felt a little less angry.

"friends?" the frog said. "well, maybe. but you have to be nice. and you have to hop with me. do you like to hop?"

lily and ben smiled. they liked to hop. they nodded.

"ok, frog," ben said. "we will hop with you. and we will be nice."

the frog smiled too. it hopped with lily and ben on the grass. they had fun. they became friends. they forgot about the dark.
lily and ben were friends who liked to play with toys. they had a toy phone that could record their voices. they liked to pretend they were talking to each other or to other people.

one day, they decided to play a prank on lily's big sister, mia. they hid the toy phone under mia's bed and recorded a scary message. they said, "hello, mia. we are the monsters under your bed. we are going to get you when you sleep. boo!"

they giggled and ran away, leaving the toy phone on. they waited for mia to come home and hear the message. they thought it would be very funny.

but mia did not come home that day. she had to stay at the hospital because she was sick. lily and ben did not know that. they got bored and went to play with other toys.

that night, lily's mom came to her room and told her the bad news. mia had a fever and had to stay at the hospital for a long time. lily felt very sad and scared. she wanted to see her sister and hug her.

she went to her bed and tried to sleep. but then she heard a voice under her bed. it was the toy phone. it said, "hello, mia. we are the monsters under your bed. we are going to get you when you sleep. boo!"

lily screamed and cried. she thought the monsters were real and they had come for her. she did not remember that it was her and ben who recorded the message. she called for her mom, but her mom did not hear her. she was too busy talking to the doctor on the phone.

lily felt very alone and afraid. she wished she had not played the prank on mia. she wished she had been a humble and kind sister. she wished mia was there to protect her. but she was not. she had left her alone with the monsters.
lily was a new girl at the big school. she was scared and shy. she did not know anyone. she did not want to leave her mom.

but mom said, "don't worry, lily. the staff here are very nice. they will help you and teach you. they will welcome you and be your friends."

lily walked with mom to the door. a lady with a big smile and a fat cat came to meet them. she said, "hello, i am miss rose. i am the teacher of the little class. and this is fluffy, my cat. he likes to play and cuddle. we are happy to see you, lily. welcome to the big school."

lily looked at miss rose and fluffy. they seemed kind and friendly. she smiled a little and said, "hello, miss rose. hello, fluffy. i like cats too. can i pet him?"

miss rose nodded and said, "of course, you can. fluffy loves to be petted. come, let me show you the classroom. there are many toys and books and colors. you will have fun and learn a lot. and you will make new friends too."

lily took miss rose's hand and followed her to the classroom. she saw other kids playing and talking. some of them waved and said, "hi, lily. come and join us." lily felt less scared and shy. she said, "hi, everyone. i am lily. i am new here." she let go of miss rose's hand and went to play with the other kids. she was glad she came to the big school. she thought, "maybe this will be a good place for me."
ben and sam were best friends. they liked to play outside and go on adventures. one day, they saw a kayak by the lake. it was red and shiny and looked like fun.

"wow, look at that kayak!" ben said. "can we try it?"

"i don't know," sam said. "it's not ours. maybe someone left it here."

"or maybe they don't want it anymore," ben said. "let's go and see."

they ran to the kayak and touched it. it was smooth and hard. they looked inside and saw two paddles.

"let's go for a ride," ben said. "it will be fun."

"but what if someone comes back and gets angry?" sam said. "we should ask first."

"who are we going to ask?" ben said. "there's no one here. come on, don't be scared."

ben climbed into the kayak and grabbed a paddle. he waited for sam to join him.

sam looked around. he felt bad. he knew it was wrong to take something that was not theirs. he wanted to have fun, but he also wanted to be good.

"ben, i don't think we should do this," sam said. "it's not nice. let's go and play something else."

ben frowned. he was annoyed. he wanted to go on the kayak. he thought sam was being silly.

"fine, be a baby," ben said. "i'm going without you."

he pushed the kayak into the water and started to paddle. he felt happy and free. he didn't care about sam.

sam watched ben go. he felt sad and lonely. he wished ben would listen to him. he hoped ben would be safe.

soon, ben was far away from the shore. he looked around and saw the lake was big and beautiful. he saw fish and birds and trees. he smiled and paddled faster.

but then, he heard a loud voice.

"hey, you! get out of my kayak!"

ben turned and saw a man on the shore. he was big and angry. he was waving his arms and shouting.

ben felt scared. he realized he had made a mistake. he had taken someone else's kayak. he had been bad.

he tried to paddle back, but it was hard. the wind was blowing and the water was choppy. he felt tired and sorry.

the man ran into the water and swam towards ben. he reached the kayak and grabbed it. he pulled ben out and dragged him to the shore.

he was very mad. he yelled at ben and asked him why he had taken his kayak. he said he had been generous and let other people use his kayak, but only if they asked first. he said ben had been rude and selfish.

ben felt ashamed. he didn't know what to say. he wished he had listened to sam. he wished he had been good.

he looked at sam, who was still on the shore. sam looked at him with pity and concern. he walked over to ben and the man.

he said he was sorry for what ben had done. he said they were friends and they had seen the kayak and wanted to try it. he said ben had not listened to him and had gone without asking. he said he had tried to stop him and had stayed behind.

he said they had learned their lesson and they would never do it again. he said they were sorry and they hoped the man would forgive them.

the man looked at sam and ben. he saw they were young and scared. he saw they had made a mistake and they were sorry. he felt his anger fade.

he said he was glad sam had been honest and brave. he said he was glad ben had come back and had apologized. he said he would forgive them, but only if they promised to be good and to respect other people's things.

he said he would be generous and let them use his kayak, but only if they asked first and followed his rules. he said he would teach them how to paddle and how to be safe on the water.

he said he hoped they would enjoy the kayak and the lake, but also learn to be good and kind.

sam and ben nodded. they said they were sorry and they thanked the man. they said they would be good and they would respect his kayak. they said they would like to learn from him and have fun with him.

they hugged each other and smiled. they felt happy and relieved. they had made a new friend and they had learned a valuable lesson.

they had learned to be good and generous.
tom and lily were twins who liked to look at the stars at night. they had a big book with pictures of stars, planets and comets. they learned that comets were balls of ice and dust that flew very fast in the sky. sometimes they could see a comet with a long tail of light.

one night, their dad said, "there is a special comet in the sky tonight. it is very bright and beautiful. do you want to see it?"

tom and lily nodded and ran to get their coats and hats. they followed their dad to the backyard, where he had set up a telescope. he helped them take turns to look through the lens.

"wow!" tom said. "the comet is so big and shiny! it looks like a star with a long hair!"

"it's amazing!" lily said. "the comet is so pretty! it looks like a fairy with a magic wand!"

their dad smiled and said, "you both have good imaginations. the comet is called halley's comet. it only comes once every 76 years. that means you won't see it again until you are very old."

tom and lily gasped. they felt lucky to see the comet. they wanted to remember it forever.

"can we draw the comet, dad?" tom asked.

"can we write a story about the comet, dad?" lily asked.

their dad nodded and said, "sure, you can. but first, you have to choose. do you want to draw or write?"

tom and lily looked at each other. they both liked to draw and write. they both wanted to do both. but they knew they had to choose.

tom thought for a moment and said, "i want to draw the comet. i like to use colors and shapes."

lily thought for a moment and said, "i want to write the story about the comet. i like to use words and sentences."

their dad said, "that's a good choice. you can both express yourselves in different ways. let's go inside and get some paper and pencils."

tom and lily followed their dad to the house. they were excited to create their comet art. they did not mind that their room was messy. they only cared about the comet.
lily and ben were best friends. they liked to play in the park every day. they liked to swing, slide and run. they also liked to talk to the birds and the squirrels.

one day, they saw a big, black dog in the park. the dog looked playful. he wagged his tail and ran towards them. lily and ben were not afraid. they liked dogs.

"hello, doggy!" lily said. "what is your name?"

the dog did not reply. he jumped on lily and licked her face. lily giggled.

"stop, doggy!" ben said. "you are too rough!"

the dog did not reply. he jumped on ben and licked his face. ben laughed.

"let's play, doggy!" lily said. "you can be our friend!"

the dog did not reply. he ran away with lily's shoe in his mouth. lily and ben chased him.

"come back, doggy!" ben said. "that is lily's shoe!"

the dog did not reply. he dropped the shoe and ran to a man. the man was the dog's owner. he was looking for him.

"sorry, kids!" the man said. "this is rex. he is very playful, but he does not listen well. he likes to take things that are not his."

lily and ben got the shoe back. they were not angry. they liked rex.

"it's okay, mister!" lily said. "rex is fun. can we play with him again?"

the man smiled. he replied, "sure, kids. you can play with rex anytime. he likes you too."

lily and ben were happy. they had a new friend. they played with rex until it was time to go home. they waved goodbye to rex and the man. they hoped to see them again.
tim and mia are twins. they like to play with their toys and pretend they are in space. they have a big box that they call their rocket. they put stickers on it and draw stars and planets.

one day, they decide to go on a mission to explore the universe. they put on their helmets and suits and get inside the box. they count down from ten and then make loud noises like a rocket.

"zoom! zoom! we are flying to the moon!" tim says.

"look! there is a big cheese ball!" mia says. she points to a yellow ball on the floor.

"can we eat it?" tim asks.

mia nods. they get out of the box and run to the ball. they pick it up and take a bite.

"mmm, this is yummy!" mia says.

she chews the cheese and smiles.

"wait, this is not cheese!" tim says.

he spits out the cheese and makes a face.

"this is rubber! it is hard and yucky!"

he throws the ball away and rubs his tongue.

mia laughs. she thinks it is funny.

"sorry, tim. i was joking. that is not the moon. that is our dog's toy. he likes to chew it."

she hugs tim and says sorry.

tim is not mad. he hugs mia back and says it is okay.

they go back to their box and pretend they are in space again.

they have fun and forget about the rubber ball.

they are happy twins. they love to play and explore the universe.
lily and ben were very excited. it was almost christmas and they wanted to decorate their house. they had a big box of shiny things and a green tree in the living room.

"can i put this star on the top of the tree?" lily asked, holding a yellow star.

"yes, you can. but be careful, the tree is tall. i will help you," ben said, lifting his sister up.

they put the star on the tree and then added more shiny things. they had red balls, silver bells, and colorful lights. the tree looked very pretty.

"now we need to decorate the chimney," ben said, pointing to the old chimney in the corner. "maybe santa will come and bring us presents."

"okay, let's do it," lily said, grabbing a long sock. "i will hang this sock on the chimney. maybe santa will fill it with candy."

they hung their socks on the chimney and then added some more shiny things. they had paper chains, glittery snowflakes, and a picture of santa. the chimney looked very festive.

"wow, we did a good job," ben said, admiring their work.

"yes, we did. i hope santa likes it too," lily said, smiling.

they hugged each other and then ran to their mom, who was baking cookies in the kitchen.

"mom, mom, look what we did!" they shouted, pulling her to the living room.

mom looked at the tree and the chimney and smiled.

"you did a wonderful job, my sweeties. you are very creative and thoughtful. i'm sure santa will love it too," she said, kissing them on their cheeks.

they all sat on the couch and ate some cookies, feeling happy and proud. they couldn't wait for christmas morning.
lily and ben were playing in the snow. they wanted to make an igloo, like the ones they saw in a book. they rolled big balls of snow and piled them up. but the snow was heavy and hard to move.

"i can't do it," lily said. "it's too hard."

"yes, you can," ben said. "you are strong and smart. i will help you. we can do it together."

he encouraged her to keep trying. they pushed and lifted the snow balls. they made a hole for the door. they smoothed the walls. they were very proud of their igloo.

"look, we did it!" ben said. "we made an igloo!"

"it's so cool!" lily said. "can we go inside?"

they crawled into the igloo. it was cozy and warm. they smiled at each other.

"we are the best igloo makers ever!" they said.
lily and ben were playing with their bikes in the park. they liked to ride fast and make turns and jumps. lily was good at balancing on one wheel. she could lift her front wheel or her back wheel and keep going. ben wanted to learn how to do that too.

"can you teach me how to balance on one wheel?" ben asked lily.

"sure, i can teach you. it is fun and easy. you just have to pedal hard and lean a little bit," lily said. she was generous and liked to help her friend.

lily showed ben how to balance on one wheel. she lifted her front wheel and rode for a few seconds. then she lifted her back wheel and rode for a few more seconds. she smiled and waved at ben.

"wow, you are so good at balancing on one wheel. let me try," ben said. he tried to copy lily, but he was not very good. he lifted his front wheel, but he lost his balance and fell down. he scraped his knee and started to cry.

"ouch, that hurts. i can't balance on one wheel. it is too hard," ben said.

lily got off her bike and ran to ben. she hugged him and said, "don't cry, ben. it is okay. you just need to practice more. you can do it. i will help you. here, take my band-aid and put it on your knee. it will make you feel better."

lily gave ben her band-aid. she was generous and kind. ben smiled and said, "thank you, lily. you are a good friend. can we try again?"

"of course, we can try again. come on, let's get back on our bikes and have some fun," lily said.

lily and ben got back on their bikes and tried to balance on one wheel. they had some falls and some laughs, but they did not give up. they had fun and learned something new. they were happy and proud.
lily and ben are twins who like to play pretend. they have a toy kitchen and a lot of plastic food. one day, they decide to perform a show for their mom and dad. they want to make a menu with healthy food that their parents will like.

lily says, "i will make a salad with lettuce, tomato, and cheese. what will you make, ben?"

ben says, "i will make a pizza with pepperoni, cheese, and sauce. pizza is yummy!"

lily says, "but pizza is not healthy, ben. it has too much fat and salt. mom and dad will not like it."

ben says, "pizza is healthy, lily. it has cheese and sauce. cheese and sauce are good for you. mom and dad will love it."

lily and ben start to argue. they do not agree on what is healthy and what is not. they do not want to share their food or their kitchen. they start to pull and push each other.

mom and dad hear the noise and come to see what is going on. they see lily and ben fighting over the toy kitchen and the plastic food. they are not happy.

mom says, "lily and ben, what are you doing? why are you fighting?"

dad says, "we thought you were going to perform a show for us. where is your menu?"

lily and ben stop fighting. they feel ashamed. they say, "we are sorry, mom and dad. we wanted to make a menu with healthy food, but we could not agree on what is healthy. we did not want to share our food or our kitchen."

mom says, "lily and ben, it is okay to have different opinions on what is healthy. but it is not okay to fight over it. you have to respect each other and share your toys. you can make a menu with both salad and pizza. that way, you can have some variety and balance."

dad says, "that sounds like a good idea. we would love to see your show and try your food. can you work together and make a menu with both salad and pizza?"

lily and ben nod. they say, "yes, mom and dad. we can work together and make a menu with both salad and pizza. we are sorry for fighting. we love you."

mom and dad hug lily and ben. they say, "we love you too. we are proud of you for apologizing and cooperating. now, let's see your show and your menu!"
lily was an adventurous girl who liked to learn new things. she had a tutor who came to her house every week to teach her how to read and write. the tutor was very kind and patient with lily, and she always brought her fun books and games.

one day, the tutor brought a book about animals that lived in the jungle. lily was very excited and wanted to see all the pictures. she saw lions, monkeys, elephants, and snakes. she asked the tutor many questions about the animals, and the tutor answered them all.

when they finished the book, the tutor said, "lily, you are very smart and curious. you can learn anything you want if you work hard and listen well. i'm very proud of you."

lily smiled and hugged the tutor. she said, "thank you, tutor. you are the best. i love you."

the tutor smiled and kissed lily on the cheek. she said, "i love you too, lily. you are a very sweet and adventurous girl."

lily learned that day that being adventurous is good, but being kind and grateful is also important. she also learned that kisses are a way to show love and appreciation. she decided to kiss her mom and dad when they came home, and to thank them for giving her a tutor.
sara and ben are twins. they like to play in the backyard. they have a swing, a slide and a sandbox. sometimes they share, sometimes they fight.

one day, they see a big box in the backyard. it is open. they run to the box and look inside. there are many toys and books and clothes. they are happy and excited.

"wow, look at all these things!" sara says. "can we play with them?"

"i don't know," ben says. "maybe they are for someone else."

they hear mom calling from the house. "sara, ben, come here please. i have something to tell you."

they leave the box and go to mom. mom smiles and hugs them.

"guess what, my loves?" mom says. "you are going to have a baby brother or sister soon. these are some things for the baby. do you want to help me sort them out?"

sara and ben are surprised and curious. they have many questions.

"is the baby in your tummy?" sara asks.

"yes, it is," mom says.

"when will the baby come out?" ben asks.

"in a few months," mom says.

"can we play with the baby?" sara asks.

"of course, you can," mom says. "but you have to be gentle and careful. the baby will be very small and fragile."

sara and ben nod. they want to be good big siblings. they go back to the backyard with mom and help her manage the things for the baby. they are happy and proud. they can't wait to meet the baby.
one day, lily and ben went to the park with their mom. they saw a big slide, a swing, and a sandbox. they wanted to play with everything.

"can we go on the slide, mom?" lily asked.

"sure, but be careful. there are some holes in the ground. don't step on them or you might fall," mom said.

lily and ben nodded and ran to the slide. they took turns sliding down and laughing. they had a lot of fun.

but then, ben saw something shiny in the grass. he ran to it and picked it up. it was a brilliant coin. he was very happy.

"look, lily, i found a coin! it's so shiny and pretty!" ben said.

"wow, that's cool! can i see it?" lily said.

ben showed her the coin. he was very proud.

"where did you find it?" lily asked.

"over there, in the grass. maybe there are more. let's go and look," ben said.

he ran to the grass again, but he did not watch where he was going. he stepped on a hole and tripped. he fell and hurt his knee. he dropped the coin and it rolled away.

"ow, ow, ow!" ben cried.

lily and mom heard him and ran to him. they helped him up and checked his knee. it was bleeding a little.

"are you okay, ben?" mom asked.

"it hurts, mom. and i lost my coin," ben said.

"i'm sorry, ben. but you should have listened to me. i told you not to step on the holes. they are dangerous. you have to be careful where you walk," mom said.

"i know, mom. i was silly. i only cared about the coin. i should have watched where i was going," ben said.

he hugged mom and said he was sorry. mom hugged him back and said she forgave him. she put a band-aid on his knee and gave him a kiss.

lily gave him a hug too and said she was sorry he lost his coin. she said she would share her toys with him.

ben smiled and thanked her. he said he was lucky to have a mom and a sister who loved him. he said he learned his lesson. he said he would be more careful and not step on holes again.

the end.

moral value: the story teaches the value of being careful, listening to advice, and caring more about people than things.
lily was a little girl who liked to play with her dolls. she had many dolls, but her favorite was anna, who had a pink dress and a charming smile. lily always took anna with her when she went out.

one day, lily and her mom went to visit her grandma, who lived in a big house. lily was happy to see her grandma, who gave her a hug and a cookie. but she was also curious about the other rooms in the house. she asked her mom if she could explore.

"ok, but be careful and don't go too far," her mom said. "and don't open any doors that are locked."

lily nodded and ran off with anna. she saw many doors, some open and some closed. she peeked into some of the open ones and saw a bedroom, a bathroom, a kitchen, and a library. she wondered what was behind the closed ones.

she came to a door that had a sign that said "do not enter". lily felt a tingle of excitement. she wanted to know what was inside. she tried the knob, but it was locked. she looked around and saw a key on a hook. she reached for it and put it in the lock. she turned it and heard a click. she opened the door and stepped in.

she gasped. the room was dark and dusty. there were many old things, like books, toys, clothes, and pictures. but there was also something else. something big and furry and scary. it was a bear!

the bear saw lily and roared. it stood up on its hind legs and showed its teeth and claws. lily was terrified. she dropped anna and ran back to the door. but the door was shut and locked. she had left the key inside. she banged on the door and screamed for help.

"mom! grandma! help me! there's a bear in here!"

her mom and grandma heard her and came running. they saw the sign and the key and realized what had happened. they quickly opened the door and pulled lily out. the bear growled and tried to follow, but they slammed the door and locked it again.

lily hugged her mom and grandma and sobbed. she was sorry for being naughty and opening the door. she was also sad for losing anna. her mom and grandma comforted her and told her it was ok. they also explained that the bear was not real, but a stuffed animal that belonged to her grandpa, who used to collect them. he had put them in a special room to keep them safe.

lily felt a little better, but she still missed anna. she asked her mom and grandma if they could get her back. they said they would try, but they had to wait until the bear calmed down. they took lily to the living room and gave her some milk and cookies. they also gave her another doll to play with, but lily knew it was not the same as anna.

she hoped that anna was ok and that the bear was not mean to her. she wished she could meet her again and tell her she was sorry and that she loved her. she hoped that anna still had her charming smile.
anna and ben are in school. they like to learn new things. the teacher writes on the blackboard. she writes words and numbers. she asks the children to choose one word and one number and say them out loud.

anna raises her hand. she chooses the word "cat" and the number "three". she says, "cat, three". the teacher smiles and says, "good, anna. you are smart".

ben raises his hand. he chooses the word "ignorant" and the number "zero". he says, "ignorant, zero". the teacher frowns and says, "no, ben. that is not a nice word. that is a rude word. you are not ignorant. you are learning".

ben does not understand. he thinks ignorant is a good word. he thinks it means he knows everything. he says, "but i am ignorant. i know everything. you are ignorant. you know nothing".

the teacher is angry. she says, "ben, that is very wrong. you are being disrespectful. you do not know everything. you have to listen and learn. i know many things. i am here to help you. you have to say sorry".

ben is confused. he does not want to say sorry. he thinks he is right. he says, "no, i am not sorry. you are sorry. you are ignorant".

the teacher is sad. she says, "ben, you are making me sad. you are making your friends sad. you are making yourself sad. you have to choose to be kind and humble. you have to choose to respect and learn. you have to choose to say sorry".

ben looks around. he sees anna and the other children. they are looking at him. they are not smiling. they are not playing. they are not talking. they are quiet. they are sad.

ben feels something in his chest. he feels something in his eyes. he feels something in his mouth. he feels sorry. he says, "i am sorry. i was wrong. i was rude. i was ignorant. i want to be kind and humble. i want to respect and learn. i want to be your friend".

the teacher smiles. she says, "thank you, ben. that is very brave of you. that is very wise of you. that is very good of you. you are not ignorant. you are learning. you are my friend".

anna smiles. she says, "me too, ben. you are my friend. you are smart. you are nice. you are not ignorant. you are learning".

ben smiles. he feels something in his chest. he feels something in his eyes. he feels something in his mouth. he feels happy. he says, "thank you, anna. thank you, teacher. thank you, friends. i am happy. i am not ignorant. i am learning".
anna and ben were playing in the park with their dolls. they liked to pretend they were doctors and nurses, and they had a small bag with bandages and stickers. they carried their dolls to a bench and put them on a blanket.

"your doll is very sick," anna said to ben. "she needs a serious operation."

ben nodded. he was worried about his doll. he hoped anna could make her better. he watched as anna took out a bandage and wrapped it around the doll's head.

"good job, doctor," ben said. "but what about her leg? it looks broken."

anna frowned. she did not have any more bandages. she looked around and saw a sign on a fence. it said "do not enter. construction site. danger."

anna had an idea. she said to ben, "i know where we can find more bandages. come with me."

she grabbed her doll and ran to the fence. she did not see the big word "no" on the sign. she did not know what it meant. she thought it was part of the fence. she lifted the fence and crawled under it. ben followed her.

they saw a big pile of wood and metal. they looked like bandages to them. they carried some of them to their dolls. they did not hear the loud noise of a truck coming closer.

the truck driver saw the fence was open. he was angry. he said, "hey, you kids! what are you doing here? this is a law. you cannot be here. it is very dangerous. get out now!"

anna and ben were scared. they dropped the wood and metal and ran back to the fence. they did not want to get in trouble. they did not want to get hurt. they carried their dolls and their bag and ran to their mom.

their mom was waiting for them on a bench. she saw their faces and their dolls. she said, "what happened? why are your dolls so dirty? and what are those things on their heads and legs?"

anna and ben told her what they did. they said they were sorry. they did not know it was a law. they did not know it was dangerous. they just wanted to help their dolls.

their mom hugged them. she said, "i'm glad you are safe. but you have to be careful. you have to listen to the signs. they are there for a reason. they tell you what you can and cannot do. they are serious. do you understand?"

anna and ben nodded. they said they understood. they said they would not do it again. they said they loved their mom. their mom smiled. she said she loved them too. she said they could go home and clean their dolls. she said they could play doctor and nurse again. but only with bandages and stickers.
sara and tom are friends. they like to play in the park. they have a ball and a kite. they run and laugh and have fun.

one day, a big dog comes to the park. the dog is not nice. he barks and chases sara and tom. he wants their ball and their kite. sara and tom are scared. they run away from the dog. they look for a safe place.

they see a fence. the fence is tall and strong. it has a gate. sara and tom run to the gate. they open it and go inside. they close the gate. the dog cannot get in. he is angry. he jumps and scratches at the fence. he makes a loud noise.

sara and tom are inside the fence. they see a house. the house is small and cozy. it has a window and a door. they see a lady. the lady is kind. she smiles and waves at sara and tom. she comes to the gate. she opens it and talks to the dog. she tells the dog to go away. the dog listens. he stops barking and chasing. he walks away.

sara and tom are happy. they thank the lady. the lady invites them to her house. she gives them cookies and milk. she tells them stories and sings them songs. she is a grandma. she likes sara and tom. sara and tom like her too.

they are glad they found the fence. they are glad they met the grandma. they are glad they are safe and warm. they do not weep anymore. they smile and hug the grandma. they are friends.
lily and ben were playing with a football in the garden. they liked to kick the ball to each other and run after it. they were having fun and laughing.

but then, lily kicked the ball too hard and it flew over the fence. it hit the window of the neighbour's house and made a loud noise. lily and ben heard the glass break and saw the neighbour come out. he looked angry and shouted at them.

"who did this? who broke my window?" he asked.

lily and ben felt guilty. they knew they did something bad. they wanted to say sorry, but they were too scared. they ran inside their house and shut the door.

they hoped the neighbour would not tell their mum and dad. they hid under the bed and waited. they did not feel like playing anymore. they felt sorry for the neighbour and for the window. they wished they had not kicked the ball so hard.
sara was a gifted girl. she could sing, draw and read very well. she loved to learn new things and share them with her friends. one day, she went to the park with her mom and saw a big tree with red apples.

"mom, can i have an apple?" sara asked.

"sure, honey. but you have to ask the farmer first. he owns the tree and the apples," mom said.

they walked to the farmer, who was sitting on a bench. he had a kind smile and a straw hat.

"hello, sir. my name is sara and this is my mom. we like your apples. can we have one, please?" sara said.

"hello, sara and mom. you are very polite. of course you can have an apple. you can pick one yourself. but be careful, some of them are not ripe yet," the farmer said.

"thank you, sir. how do i know which ones are ripe?" sara asked.

"well, you can look at the color. the ripe ones are bright red and shiny. the unripe ones are green or yellow and dull. you can also feel them. the ripe ones are firm and smooth. the unripe ones are hard and rough. you can also smell them. the ripe ones have a sweet and fresh smell. the unripe ones have a sour and bitter smell," the farmer explained.

sara nodded and thanked the farmer again. she ran to the tree and looked for a ripe apple. she hoped to find the best one. she saw many apples, but some were too high, some were too small, some were too green, some were too yellow. she searched and searched until she saw one that was perfect. it was bright red and shiny, firm and smooth, sweet and fresh. she reached for it and plucked it from the branch.

she ran back to her mom and the farmer, holding the apple in her hand.

"look, mom. look, sir. i found the best apple. it is ripe and beautiful. can i eat it now?" sara said.

"wow, sara. you are very gifted. you found the best apple indeed. yes, you can eat it now. enjoy it, honey," mom said.

"you are welcome, sara. you are very smart and curious. you learned how to pick a ripe apple. i hope you like it. it is a gift from nature," the farmer said.

sara smiled and thanked them both. she bit into the apple and tasted its juicy and delicious flavor. she was happy and proud. she had a great day at the park. she learned something new and got a wonderful gift. she hoped to come back again and see the farmer and the apples. she hoped to share them with her friends. she hoped to sing, draw and read more. she was a gifted girl.
tom and sue are friends. they like to play on the farm. they see many animals on the farm. they see cows, pigs, sheep, and horses.

one day, they see a big gray horse in the barn. the horse is eating hay. tom and sue want to pet the horse. they go near the horse and say hello.

"hello, horse. you are big and gray. can we pet you?" tom asks.

the horse looks at tom and sue. he nods his head. he likes tom and sue. he lets them pet his nose and mane. he makes a soft sound. he is happy.

tom and sue are happy too. they smile at the horse. they say thank you. they give the horse some more hay. they hug the horse. they are friends with the horse. they have fun on the farm.
sara was going to be a princess for the party. she had a pink dress, a shiny crown and a long veil. she felt very attractive and happy.

she went to the living room, where her friends were waiting. they all had different costumes. there was a pirate, a fairy, a clown and a lion.

"wow, sara, you look so pretty!" said the fairy.

"thank you, you look very nice too!" said sara.

"can i try your veil?" asked the pirate.

sara thought for a moment. she liked her veil, but she also wanted to be kind. she decided to choose to share.

"okay, you can try it, but be careful. it is very delicate," she said.

she gave the veil to the pirate, who put it on his head. he looked very funny, and everyone laughed.

"thank you, sara, this is fun!" he said.

"you're welcome, but can i have it back soon? i want to wear it for the games," she said.

"of course, here you go," he said, and gave it back to her.

sara put the veil on again, and smiled. she was happy to have such good friends. they all played together, and had a wonderful time.
lila and ben are playing in the farm. they see a big gray bull in the field. the bull has horns and a ring in his nose. he looks angry.

"let's go closer and say hello to the bull," ben says. he likes animals.

"no, ben, that's not a good idea. the bull might hurt us. he is not friendly like the cows," lila says. she is scared of the bull.

but ben does not listen to lila. he runs to the fence and climbs over it. he walks towards the bull. he wants to touch him.

"ben, come back! you are in danger!" lila shouts. she follows him and tries to pull him away.

the bull sees ben and lila. he snorts and lowers his head. he charges at them. he is very fast.

lila and ben are very afraid. they run back to the fence. but the bull is faster. he is almost on them.

lila remembers what her dad told her. if a bull chases you, you have to kneel down and stay still. maybe he will think you are a rock and leave you alone.

lila kneels down and covers her head with her arms. she hopes the bull will not see her.

ben sees lila kneel down. he does not understand why she does that. he thinks she is giving up. he keeps running to the fence. he thinks he can make it.

but he is wrong. the bull catches up with him. he hits him with his horns. he tosses him in the air. he makes him fly.

ben screams. he is hurt. he falls to the ground. he does not move.

lila sees what happens to ben. she cries. she is very sad. she wishes she could help him.

the bull sees lila. he does not care about her. he thinks she is a rock. he walks away. he goes back to his grass.

lila gets up. she runs to ben. she hugs him. she calls for help.

dad hears lila's cries. he comes to the field. he sees ben and lila. he sees the bull. he understands what happened.

he is very angry at the bull. he is very worried about ben. he is very proud of lila.

he picks up ben and carries him to the car. he takes him to the doctor. he hopes he will be okay.

he tells lila she is very brave. she did the right thing. she saved her life.

he tells her he loves her. he hugs her. he takes her home.

he tells her they will never go near the bull again. he tells her the bull is very bad. he tells her he will find a new home for him.

lila nods. she agrees. she does not like the bull. she likes ben.

she hopes he will get better soon. she wants to play with him again. she loves him.
sara and ben like to play with tape. they have many colors of tape: red, blue, yellow, and green. they use tape to make things, like cars, hats, and houses. one day, they find a big roll of green tape in the closet. they are very happy.

"look, ben, we can make a big tree with this tape!" sara says.

"yes, and we can make leaves and apples too!" ben says.

they start to unroll the tape and stick it on the wall. they make a long trunk and many branches. they cut out small pieces of tape and make leaves and apples. they are having fun.

but they do not know that the green tape is not for playing. it is for daddy's work. daddy is a painter. he uses the green tape to cover the parts of the wall that he does not want to paint. he is going to paint the wall white tomorrow.

daddy comes home from the store. he sees the green tape on the wall. he is very angry.

"who did this?" he asks in a loud voice.

sara and ben hear him. they are scared. they hide under the table.

"answer me, who did this?" daddy asks again.

sara and ben do not answer. they hope daddy will not find them.

but daddy sees their feet under the table. he walks over and lifts the tablecloth.

"sara, ben, what have you done?" he says.

sara and ben look at daddy. they see his face is red. they know they are in trouble.

"we are sorry, daddy, we just wanted to make a tree," sara says.

"we did not know it was your tape," ben says.

daddy sighs. he is still angry, but he loves his children. he knows they did not mean to ruin his work.

"it's okay, sara, ben, i forgive you. but you have to promise me not to use my tape again. it is not for playing. it is for painting. do you understand?" he says.

sara and ben nod. they say sorry again. they hug daddy.

daddy hugs them back. he smiles a little.

"come on, let's go to the kitchen. i have a surprise for you. i bought some ice cream. do you want some?" he says.

sara and ben cheer. they love ice cream. they follow daddy to the kitchen.

they forget about the green tape on the wall. but they do not forget their promise. they never use daddy's tape again.
sara was very sad. she had a toy cat that she loved very much. she played with it every day and hugged it at night. but one day, her brother tom took her toy cat and pulled it very hard. he wanted to see how far it could stretch. he did not care that he was hurting sara's toy cat.

"stop it! stop it!" sara cried. "you are being terrible! give me back my toy cat!"

but tom did not listen. he laughed and pulled harder. he did not see that the toy cat was tearing apart. he did not hear the toy cat make a sad sound. he did not feel sara's tears on his arm.

suddenly, the toy cat broke. the stuffing came out and the head fell off. tom dropped the toy cat and looked at it. he was shocked. he did not mean to break it. he just wanted to have some fun.

sara ran to the toy cat and picked it up. she sobbed and tried to put it back together. but it was too late. the toy cat was ruined. sara looked at tom with anger and sadness.

"you are very bad!" she shouted. "you broke my toy cat! you are not my brother anymore!"

she ran away with the toy cat and locked herself in her room. tom felt very sorry. he did not know how to fix his mistake. he wished he had not been so terrible. he wished he had not stretched sara's toy cat. he wished he could make sara happy again.
ben and lily are playing with their toys in the living room. ben has a red car and lily has a yellow doll. they are having fun, but they do not speak the same language. ben speaks english and lily speaks spanish.

"look at my car, it is fast and loud!" ben says, zooming his car on the floor.

"â¡mira mi muã±eca, es bonita y suave!" lily says, hugging her doll.

they do not understand each other, but they smile and nod. they are happy to play together.

but then, ben wants to play with lily's doll. he reaches for it and tries to take it from her.

"hey, give me that, it is mine!" lily shouts, pulling her doll back.

"no, it is mine, i want it!" ben shouts, tugging at the doll.

they start to fight and cry. they are angry and impatient. they do not want to share.

their mom hears them and comes to the living room. she sees them fighting over the doll.

"stop, stop, what is going on here?" she asks, taking the doll from them.

"mom, she took my doll, it is not fair!" ben says.

"mamã¡, ã©l me quitã³ mi muã±eca, no es justo!" lily says.

their mom sighs. she knows they do not speak the same language, but they need to learn to get along.

"listen, ben and lily, you are friends, right?" she says.

they nod, still sniffling.

"friends do not fight, they share and play nicely. you both have your own toys, but you can also try each other's toys. maybe you can learn some words from each other's language. that would be fun and helpful. do you want to try?" she says.

they look at each other and nod again, a little shyly.

"ok, then, let's start. ben, can you say 'muã±eca'?" she says, pointing at the doll.

"muã±eca?" ben repeats, sounding it out.

"very good, ben, that means 'doll' in spanish. lily, can you say 'car'?" she says, pointing at the car.

"car?" lily repeats, sounding it out.

"very good, lily, that means 'car' in english. now, can you say 'please' and 'thank you' in each other's language?" she says.

they try to say the words, and they giggle at their mistakes. they start to feel more friendly and curious.

"please, can i play with your car?" lily asks ben in english.

"thank you, you can play with my doll." ben answers lily in spanish.

they smile and swap their toys. they start to play again, more gently and happily. they learn some more words from each other. they are having fun, and they do not shout anymore.

their mom watches them and smiles. she is proud of them. she thinks they are smart and kind. she hopes they will always be friends.
tim likes trains. he has many trains at home. he plays with them every day. he makes them go fast and slow. he makes them stop and go. he makes them say choo-choo.

one day, tim goes to the park with his mom. he sees a big train on the tracks. he wants to ride the train. he asks his mom, "can we ride the train, please?"

his mom says, "yes, we can. but we have to wait. the train is not available now. it is busy. it will come back soon. then we can ride it."

tim waits with his mom. he is excited. he watches the train go by. he counts the cars. he waves to the people. he hears the whistle.

after a while, the train comes back. it stops at the station. the conductor says, "all aboard! the train is available now. come and ride with us!"

tim and his mom bring their tickets. they get on the train. they find a seat. they look out the window. they see the trees, the flowers, the animals, and the other trains. they enjoy the ride. tim is happy. he loves trains.
sara and ben are playing in the yard. they like to run and jump and laugh. the sky is blue and the sun is bright. they are happy.

but then they hear a loud sound. boom! boom! boom! it is a storm. the sky is dark and the wind is strong. they see flashes of light and hear more booms. they are scared.

they run to the house and knock on the door. "mom! mom! let us in!" they cry. but no one answers. they knock again and again. but still no answer. where is mom?

they look around and see a red car in the driveway. it is mom's car. they run to the car and open the door. they see mom sitting in the front seat. she has a phone in her hand. she is talking to someone.

"mom! mom! there is a storm! we are scared!" they shout. mom looks at them and smiles. she puts down the phone and hugs them.

"i'm sorry, my loves. i didn't hear you. i was on the phone with grandma. she is okay. she is in a safe place. the storm will pass soon. don't worry. come inside with me. we can have some cookies and milk and read a story. how does that sound?"

sara and ben nod and smile. they are happy. they love mom. they love grandma. they love cookies and milk and stories. they are not scared anymore. they follow mom into the house. the storm is still loud, but they don't mind. they are safe and warm and cozy. they are happy.
on tuesday, tom had to dress in his best clothes. he did not like his best clothes. they were too tight and too scratchy. he wanted to wear his blue shirt and his green pants. but his mom said no. she said they had to go to a big place with many people. she said it was important.

tom did not want to go to the big place. he wanted to stay home and play with his toys. he liked his toys. they were fun and colorful. they made him happy. but his mom said no. she said they had to go to the big place. she said it was for his dad.

tom did not understand. he asked his mom where his dad was. he missed his dad. he had not seen him for many days. he wanted to hug him and hear his voice. but his mom said nothing. she just hugged him and cried.

they went to the big place. it was a church. there were many people. they were all dressed in black. they looked sad and quiet. tom did not know them. he felt lonely and scared. he held his mom's hand.

they walked to the front of the church. there was a big box. it was covered with flowers. tom saw a picture of his dad on the box. he remembered his dad. he loved his dad. he wanted to see his dad. he ran to the box. he tried to open it. he shouted, "dad, dad, where are you?"

but the box did not open. the people gasped. the mom screamed. the priest stopped. tom cried. he did not know. he did not know that his dad was gone. he did not know that it was his dad's funeral. he did not know that he would never see his dad again.
lily and ben are playing with blocks. they like to make different patterns with the blocks. they use red, blue, yellow and green blocks.

"look, i made a pattern with red and blue blocks!" lily says. she shows ben her pattern. it is red, blue, red, blue, red, blue.

"that is a nice pattern, lily!" ben says. he makes a pattern with yellow and green blocks. it is yellow, green, yellow, green, yellow, green.

"can i see your pattern, ben?" lily asks. she wants to see ben's pattern.

"sure, lily. here is my pattern." ben shows lily his pattern. he is proud of his pattern.

lily and ben look at each other's patterns. they like both patterns. they smile and say, "good job!"

then they hear a noise. it is their mom. she is calling them for lunch.

"come on, kids. it is time for lunch. please wash your hands and come to the table." mom says. she is in the kitchen.

"can i play with your doll for a minute, lily?" ben asked.

"ok, but only for a minute. then you give it back to me," lily said.

"really? thank you, lily. you are very generous," ben said.

"you know what, lily? you can keep the doll. i have another one at home," ben said.

"really? thank you, ben. you are very generous, too," lily said.

lily was deaf. she could not hear what the teacher said in the classroom. she could not hear what the other kids said to her. she felt sad and lonely.

one day, a new kid came to the classroom. his name was ben. he was deaf too. he could use his hands to talk. he showed lily how to do it. lily was happy. she had a friend.

they played together at recess. they shared their toys and snacks. they learned new words with their hands. they had fun.

but some kids were mean. they did not like ben and lily. they said bad things about them. they laughed at them. they took their toys and snacks. they pushed them and hurt them.

lily and ben tried to tell the teacher. but the teacher did not understand. she did not know how to use her hands to talk. she did not help them. she said they had to grow up and stop being silly.

lily and ben felt angry and scared. they did not want to go to the classroom anymore. they did not want to learn anymore. they did not want to play anymore. they lost their happiness.
sam liked to jog with his dad every morning. they would jog around the park and see the birds, the flowers and the big pond. sam liked to jog fast and make his dad chase him. he also liked to jog slow and talk to his dad.

one day, they saw a man sitting on a bench with a pipe in his mouth. the pipe smelled good, like cookies and candy. sam wanted to try it, but his dad said no.

"that pipe is not for kids, sam. it is bad for your teeth and your lungs. you don't want to be sick, do you?" his dad said.

"no, dad. i don't want to be sick. i want to be strong and healthy like you," sam said.

"good, sam. then let's jog some more and have a delicious breakfast when we get home. how about some eggs and toast and fruit?" his dad said.

"yum, dad. that sounds delicious. i love eggs and toast and fruit," sam said.

they jogged some more and left the park. they did not see the man with the pipe again. but they did not know that the man had dropped his pipe on the ground and that a dog had found it and chewed it. the dog did not like the pipe. it made him cough and sneeze and spit. the dog ran away and left the pipe on the grass. the next day, a bird saw the pipe and thought it was a worm. the bird picked up the pipe and flew away. the bird did not like the pipe either. it made him dizzy and sick. the bird dropped the pipe in the pond. the pipe sank to the bottom and stayed there. no one ever saw the pipe again. and sam and his dad jogged happily every morning.
tom was an adventurous boy who liked to explore new places. one day, he saw a big hill behind his house that he had never climbed before. he put on his jacket and his boots and told his mom he was going out to play.

"be careful, tom," his mom said. "don't go too far and come back before it gets dark."

tom nodded and ran outside. he followed a path that led to the hill. he saw many things on his way: flowers, birds, rocks, and bugs. he stopped to look at them and sometimes picked them up. he was having a lot of fun.

when he reached the top of the hill, he saw something that made him curious. it was a big hole in the ground, like a cave. he wondered what was inside. he decided to peek in and see.

he walked slowly to the hole and bent down. he could not see much, only darkness and shadows. he heard a strange noise, like a growl. he felt scared, but he wanted to know more. he moved closer and closer, until he was almost inside the hole.

suddenly, a furry head popped out of the hole. it had big ears, sharp teeth, and angry eyes. it was a fox! the fox saw tom and snarled. tom screamed and jumped back. he turned around and ran as fast as he could. he did not stop until he reached his house.

he burst through the door and hugged his mom. he told her what he had seen and how he had escaped. his mom was glad he was safe, but also a little angry.

"tom, you should not have gone near that hole. it was dangerous. you could have been hurt by the fox. you were very lucky."

tom nodded and said he was sorry. he realized he had been too adventurous and had not listened to his mom. he learned his lesson and decided to be more careful next time. he still liked to explore, but he never peeked into holes again.
tim and tom were two squirrels who lived in a big park. they liked to play and find nuts to eat. one day, they saw a big tree with many nuts on it. they ran to the tree and started to climb.

"look at all these nuts!" tim said. "we can have a feast!"

"yes, and we can store some for winter!" tom said. "but we have to be careful. there are other animals who want nuts too."

they reached the top of the tree and began to pick the nuts. they were so happy and busy that they did not notice a wild cat sneaking up on them. the cat saw the squirrels and licked its lips. it jumped on the tree and tried to catch them.

"help! help!" tim and tom shouted. "there is a wild cat!"

they dropped their nuts and ran down the tree. the cat followed them, but it was not good at climbing. it slipped and fell to the ground. it hurt its paw and ran away.

tim and tom were safe, but they had lost their nuts. they felt sad and hungry. they looked around and saw a group of children playing in the park. the children had a basket of nuts that they had brought for a picnic. they saw the squirrels and smiled.

"hello, squirrels!" one of the children said. "do you want some nuts?"

the children threw some nuts to tim and tom. the squirrels were surprised and happy. they ate the nuts and thanked the children.

"thank you, children!" tim and tom said. "you are very kind and generous!"

the children were happy too. they liked to share and make friends. they clapped their hands and applauded the squirrels.

"yay, squirrels!" the children said. "you are very brave and smart!"

tim and tom learned a lesson that day. they learned that nuts are good, but friends are better. they learned that sharing is caring, and that kindness is rewarded. they learned that wild cats are bad, but children are good. they learned to applaud the good and avoid the bad.
lily and ben like to play with dolls. they have many dolls with different clothes and hair. one day, lily sees a hole in her doll's dress. she is sad and shows ben.

"oh no, your doll has a hole!" ben says. "we need to fix it."

"how?" lily asks.

ben has an idea. he runs to his room and comes back with a needle and thread. he learned how to sew from his mom. he tells lily to hold the doll and he sets the needle in the hole. he makes a stitch and pulls the thread. he does this many times until the hole is gone.

"look, lily, your doll's dress is fixed!" ben says. "now she has a nice stitch."

lily smiles and hugs her doll. she hugs ben too and says, "thank you, ben, you are a nice friend. you are good at sewing."

ben smiles and says, "you're welcome, lily. i like to help you. do you want to play with the dolls some more?"

lily nods and they play with the dolls happily. they make up stories and have fun. they are nice friends.
anna liked to play in the garden with her doll, lily. she liked to pick daisies and make them into a necklace for lily. she would tie the stems together with a knot and put the necklace around lily's neck. she thought lily looked very pretty with the daisies.

one day, it was raining and anna could not go outside. she was miserable. she wanted to play with the daisies and lily, but they were wet and muddy. she looked out of the window and saw the daisies drooping in the rain. she felt sad for them.

she asked her mom if she could go outside, but her mom said no. she said it was too cold and wet and anna would catch a cold. she told anna to play with her other toys in her room. anna did not want to play with her other toys. she only wanted to play with the daisies and lily.

she went to her room and sat on her bed. she hugged lily and said, "i'm sorry, lily. we can't play with the daisies today. they are wet and sad. maybe tomorrow the sun will come out and we can play again."

she looked at lily's necklace and saw that it was falling apart. the stems were breaking and the petals were falling off. she tried to tie them back together, but they were too wet and slippery. she cried and said, "oh, lily, your necklace is ruined. the daisies are ruined. everything is ruined."

she lay down on her bed and closed her eyes. she wished the rain would stop and the daisies would grow back. she wished she could play in the garden with lily and make her a new necklace. she wished she was not miserable.
lily was a little girl who liked to play with her toys. she had a doll, a ball, a car and a bear. she loved her bear the most. she took him everywhere with her. she hugged him, kissed him and talked to him.

one day, lily's mom said it was time to bathe. lily did not want to bathe. she wanted to play more. she ran away from her mom and hid under the bed with her bear. her mom looked for her and called her name. lily did not answer. she was quiet and still.

but lily did not know that there was a trap under the bed. it was a mouse trap that her dad had set to catch the mice. lily's bear touched the trap and it snapped. it hurt the bear's paw and made a loud noise. lily was scared and upset. she cried out loud and came out from under the bed. her mom heard her and came to see what was wrong.

she saw lily and her bear. she saw the trap and the blood. she felt sorry for lily and her bear. she took them to the bathroom and cleaned the bear's paw. she put a bandage on it and gave it a kiss. she told lily that the trap was not for her or her bear. it was for the mice that ate the cheese. she said she was sorry and she loved her.

lily hugged her mom and her bear. she said she was sorry too and she loved them. she said she would bathe now and be a good girl. she said she would be careful and not touch the traps. she said she hoped the mice would not hurt her bear again. her mom smiled and said she hoped so too. she said they would play more after the bath. lily nodded and smiled. she was happy and calm. she and her bear went to bathe with her mom.
