"would you like some milk and cookies?" she asks.

"yes, please!" lily and max say.

lily's mom gives them each a glass of milk and a plate of cookies. they are chocolate chip cookies. they smell good. lily and max say thank you and sit at the table.

they drink their milk and eat their cookies. they are very good. they make them happy.

"your mom makes the best cookies," max says.

"thank you. i like them too," lily says.

they share their cookies and talk about their day. they have fun. they are good friends.
tommy liked his scooter very much. he rode it every day in the park with his mom and dad. he liked to go fast and make loud noises with his mouth. he also liked to wave at the other kids and dogs he saw.

one day, he saw a girl with a pink scooter. she looked sad and lonely. tommy wanted to be her friend. he rode his scooter to her and said hello.

"hi, i'm tommy. what's your name?" he asked.

"i'm lily. i'm new here. i don't have any friends," she said.

tommy felt sorry for her. he had an idea. he was a thoughtful boy.

"do you want to play with me and my scooter? we can take turns and have fun," he offered.

lily smiled and nodded. she liked tommy's scooter. it was blue and shiny. she thanked him for being nice.

tommy and lily played with the scooter for a long time. they went fast and slow, up and down, and around and around. they laughed and talked and made new noises. they became good friends.

tommy's mom and dad watched them and smiled. they were proud of their son. he was a thoughtful boy. he shared his scooter and made a new friend.
lily liked to design things. she had many crayons and papers and stickers. she liked to make pictures of flowers and animals and houses. she also liked to help her mom in the kitchen. she wanted to design something for her mom.

she found a white apron in the drawer. she thought it was too plain. she wanted to make it more pretty. she took some crayons and stickers and started to draw and stick on the apron. she made a big heart and wrote "i love mom" inside. she also made some stars and rainbows and butterflies.

she was very proud of her design. she wanted to show it to her mom. she put on the apron and ran to the living room. she saw her mom sitting on the couch, reading a book. she said, "mom, look what i made for you!"

her mom looked up and smiled. she saw the colorful apron on lily. she said, "wow, lily, that's a beautiful apron! did you design it yourself?"

lily nodded and hugged her mom. she said, "yes, mom, i did. i wanted to make you happy. do you like it?"

her mom hugged her back and kissed her cheek. she said, "i love it, lily. and i love you more. you are very creative and sweet. thank you for this wonderful gift."

lily felt very happy. she said, "you're welcome, mom. i'm glad you like it. can we wear it together when we cook?"

her mom said, "of course, we can. let's go to the kitchen and make some cookies. you can help me with the dough and the shapes."

lily and her mom went to the kitchen, wearing the apron. they had fun making and baking cookies. they shared them with dad and brother when they came home. they all said the apron was very pretty and the cookies were very yummy. lily felt very proud and loved. she thought her mom was the best mom in the world. she thought her design was the best design in the world.
lily liked to wander in the park. she saw many things: trees, flowers, birds, dogs. she liked to say hello to them. one day, she saw a big tunnel. it was dark and long. she wanted to see what was inside.

she walked into the tunnel. it was cold and quiet. she could not see much. she heard a noise. it was a train. it was coming fast. lily was scared. she ran out of the tunnel. she looked for her mom.

her mom was busy. she was talking on the phone. she did not see lily. lily cried. she wanted her mom. she did not like the tunnel. she did not like the train. she wanted to go home.

a man saw lily. he was kind. he asked her what was wrong. he helped her find her mom. he told her not to wander in the tunnel. he said it was dangerous. he said the train could hurt her.

lily hugged her mom. she was happy. she said sorry. she said she would not wander in the tunnel again. she said she would stay with her mom. her mom hugged her back. she said she loved her. she said she was glad she was safe. they went home together.
lily and ben went to the park with mom. they saw a big fountain with water that went up and down. lily and ben liked the fountain. they ran to it and tried to touch the water.

"look, mom, look!" lily shouted. "the water is so pretty!"

mom smiled and took a picture of them. "be careful, don't get wet!" she said.

then they saw a duck swimming in the fountain. the duck was yellow and brown. it had a long neck and a flat beak. lily and ben thought the duck was cute.

"quack, quack!" the duck said.

"hello, duck!" lily and ben said. they clapped their hands and waved to the duck.

the duck liked lily and ben. it swam closer to them and splashed some water with its wings.

lily and ben laughed and clapped some more. they had fun with the duck and the fountain. mom was happy to see them. she gave them a hug and a snack. they thanked the duck and said goodbye. they had a good day at the park.
lily and ben were at the beach with their mom and dad. they liked to play in the sand and make castles and tunnels. they also liked to swim in the water, but only when it was not too cold or too deep.

one day, they saw a big bucket near the shore. it was blue and shiny and had a handle. lily and ben ran to the bucket and looked inside. there were some shells and stones and a little crab.

"wow, look at this!" lily said. "can we keep it?"

"i don't know," ben said. "maybe it belongs to someone else."

they looked around and saw a distant man sitting on a towel. he had a hat and a book and a cooler. he did not seem to notice them.

"maybe he is the owner of the bucket," lily said. "let's ask him."

they picked up the bucket and walked towards the man. they were careful not to spill the water or hurt the crab.

"excuse me, sir," ben said. "is this your bucket?"

the man looked up and smiled. he saw the bucket and the crab and the shells and the stones.

"no, it's not mine," he said. "i found it here this morning. you can have it if you want."

"really?" lily and ben said. "thank you!"

they were very happy. they thanked the man again and ran back to the water. they put the bucket down and decided to swim with the crab. they named him bob and made him a friend. they had a lot of fun. they also shared some of their shells and stones with the man. he was very nice. they had a great day at the beach.
tom and anna like to read books. they have many books in their room. some books have pictures, some books have words. tom likes to read books with words. he can read some words by himself. anna likes to read books with pictures. she can make up stories from the pictures.

one day, tom finds a big book on the shelf. it has many words and no pictures. he asks his mom, "what is this book?"

mom says, "that is a novel. it is a long story with many characters and events. you need to read many words to understand the story."

tom says, "can i read the novel?"

mom says, "you can try, but it might be hard for you. the words are not simple. the novel is for older kids or adults."

tom says, "i want to read the novel. i want to know the story."

mom says, "okay, but you might need some help. why don't you ask anna to join you? she can look at the words with you and help you guess what they mean. maybe you can make up your own story from the words."

tom says, "that sounds fun. anna, do you want to join me?"

anna says, "yes, i want to join you. i like to make up stories. what is the novel about?"

tom says, "i don't know. let's find out."

they take the novel to their room and sit on the bed. they open the book and look at the words. they see words like "castle", "prince", "dragon", and "treasure". they think the novel is about a rich prince who lives in a castle and fights a dragon to get a treasure. they take turns reading the words and making up their own story. they have fun reading the novel together.
bella and ben were playing with their toy cars in the living room. they liked to make vroom and beep sounds as they drove them around. bella had a red car and ben had a blue one. they pretended they were racing on a big road.

but then, ben saw something shiny on the shelf. it was a can of fuel that dad used for his lawn mower. ben wondered what it would do to his car. he climbed on a chair and reached for the can. he opened it and smelled it. it was strong and bad.

"bella, look what i found!" he said. "it's fuel for cars. maybe it will make them go faster."

bella looked up and saw ben with the can. she felt scared. she knew fuel was not for playing. it was dangerous. she remembered dad telling them to never touch it.

"ben, no!" she shouted. "put it back! it's not for cars. it's for mowers. it can hurt you and the cars. and mom and dad will be mad."

but ben did not listen. he poured some fuel on his car and on the floor. he thought it would be fun. he did not see the spark from the lamp that was near him.

suddenly, there was a big boom and a fire. the fuel caught on fire and spread quickly. ben and bella screamed. they dropped their cars and ran away. the fire alarm went off and mom and dad came running.

they saw the fire and the can and the cars. they grabbed ben and bella and took them outside. they called the firemen to put out the fire. they were glad that ben and bella were not hurt. but they were also very angry and sad.

ben felt guilty. he knew he had done a bad thing. he had poked the can and made a mess. he had scared bella and mom and dad. he had ruined his car and the living room. he wished he had listened to bella. he said he was sorry and hugged them. he hoped they would forgive him. he learned his lesson. he would never play with fuel again.
sara and tom are twins. they like to play together. one day, they find a big bottle of shampoo in the bathroom. the shampoo is colorful. it has red, blue, green, and yellow stripes.

"look, tom, this shampoo is like a rainbow!" sara says. "let's play with it!"

tom nods. he thinks the shampoo is pretty. they open the bottle and squeeze some shampoo on their hands. they rub the shampoo on their hair, their faces, their clothes, and the walls. they laugh and make bubbles.

but then, mom comes in. she sees the mess. she is angry. she says, "sara and tom, what have you done? this shampoo is not for playing. it is for washing your hair. you have wasted the shampoo and made a big mess. you have to clean up and say sorry."

sara and tom feel bad. they know they did something wrong. they say sorry to mom. they help her clean up the bathroom. they wash their hair with water. they learn their lesson. they do not play with shampoo again. they only use it when they need to wash their hair. they understand that shampoo is not a toy. it is a useful thing.
one day, a little girl named mia went to the zoo with her mom and dad. she liked to see all the different animals, but her favorite was the tiger. she wanted to get closer to the big cat, but her mom said no.

"too dangerous, mia. the tiger might hurt you. stay with us, please."

but mia was curious and brave. she saw a small hole in the fence and crawled through it. she ran towards the tiger's cage, hoping to see its stripes and whiskers. she did not see the sign that said "do not feed the animals".

the tiger saw mia and growled. he was hungry and angry. he did not like people coming into his space. he jumped at the cage, trying to reach mia. mia was scared and screamed. she dropped her bag of popcorn on the ground.

the tiger smelled the popcorn and stopped growling. he liked popcorn. he licked his lips and pawed at the cage, wanting to get some. mia saw that the tiger was not mean, just hungry. she felt sorry for him. she picked up some popcorn and threw it to the tiger. the tiger ate it and purred. he looked at mia with his big yellow eyes and smiled.

"thank you, little girl. you are compassionate. you share your food with me. you are my friend."

mia smiled back. she was happy that the tiger was happy. she wanted to play with him, but she heard her mom and dad calling her name. they were worried and angry. they had seen her go through the hole and run to the tiger. they came to get her and take her back to safety.

"mia, what were you thinking? you could have been hurt by the tiger. he is a wild animal, not a pet. you were very naughty. we are going home now."

mia was sad. she did not want to leave the tiger. she waved goodbye to him and said sorry.

"bye, tiger. i'm sorry i made you mad. you are my friend. i hope you get more popcorn."

the tiger waved back and said thank you.

"bye, little girl. i'm sorry i scared you. you are my friend. i hope you come back soon."
tom and lily were on a trip with their mom and dad. they stayed in a big hotel with many rooms and a pool. tom and lily liked the pool, but they also liked to play in their room. they had many toys and books and crayons.

one day, tom and lily were bored. they wanted to have more fun. they decided to make a big mess in their room. they threw their toys and books and crayons everywhere. they drew on the walls and the bed and the floor. they ripped the sheets and the pillows and the curtains. they laughed and shouted and had a lot of fun.

but their mom and dad did not have fun. they heard the noise and came to see what was wrong. they opened the door and saw the big mess. they were very angry and sad. they said to tom and lily:

"what did you do? you destroyed the room! this is very bad! you have to clean up and say sorry! the hotel will be very mad at us! we have to pay a lot of money!"

tom and lily were scared. they did not know they did something bad. they thought they were just playing. they started to cry. they said to their mom and dad:

"we are sorry! we did not mean to destroy the room! we were bored! we wanted to have fun!"

their mom and dad hugged them and said:

"we know you did not mean to destroy the room, but you have to be careful and respectful. you cannot make a big mess like this. you have to ask us before you play with something. you have to follow the rules of the hotel. you have to say sorry to the hotel people and help us clean up. do you understand?"

tom and lily nodded and said:

"we understand. we are sorry. we will help you clean up. we will say sorry to the hotel people."

they helped their mom and dad clean up the room. they put their toys and books and crayons back in their bags. they wiped the walls and the bed and the floor. they fixed the sheets and the pillows and the curtains. they said sorry to the hotel people. the hotel people were still mad, but they accepted their apology. they said:

"next time, be more careful and respectful. do not destroy the room. do not make a big mess. follow the rules of the hotel. have fun, but not too much fun."

tom and lily learned their lesson. they said:

"ok. we will be more careful and respectful. we will not destroy the room. we will not make a big mess. we will follow the rules of the hotel. we will have fun, but not too much fun."

they went back to their room and played quietly. they read their books and drew their pictures and played with their toys. they did not throw anything or rip anything or draw on anything. they were good and happy.

the next day, they went to the pool and had more fun. they saw a fat man in a swimsuit. he jumped in the water and made a big splash. tom and lily laughed and said:

"look at the fat man! he is funny! he makes a big splash!"

the fat man heard them and smiled. he said:

"hello, kids! i am the fat man! i like to make a big splash! do you want to join me?"

tom and lily said:

"yes, please! we want to join you!"

they jumped in the water and made a big splash with the fat man. they had a lot of fun. they did not destroy anything. they did not make a big mess. they followed the rules of the pool. they were good and happy. the end.
lila and tom are playing with their dolls. lila has a purple dress for her doll. she likes the dress very much. she wants to make it more pretty. she finds some thread and a needle in her mom's sewing box.

"look, tom, i can sew some flowers on the dress," she says.

"can i help you?" tom asks.

"ok, but be careful with the needle. it is sharp and can hurt you," lila says.

they sit on the floor and start to sew. lila makes a yellow flower. tom makes a blue flower. they are having fun.

but then, tom's dog, spot, comes into the room. spot is curious. he sees the thread and thinks it is a toy. he runs to lila and tom and grabs the thread with his mouth. he pulls hard and runs away.

"hey, stop, spot! that is not your toy! that is our thread!" lila shouts.

she and tom chase after spot. they try to get the thread back. but spot is faster and stronger. he bites the thread and breaks it. he makes a big mess.

lila and tom are sad and angry. they look at their dolls. the flowers are gone. the dress is torn. they cry.

"bad dog, spot! you ruined our dress!" they say.

spot does not understand. he thinks they are playing. he wags his tail and barks. he wants more thread.
one day, lily and tom went to the park with their mom. they saw many flowers and trees and birds. they liked to run and play and laugh.

they found a big fountain that sprayed water high in the air. it made a rainbow in the sun. lily and tom wanted to touch the water. they ran to the fountain and put their hands in the spray. it was cold and wet and fun.

but then, a bee came near the fountain. it was black and yellow and had a rough body. it buzzed and flew around the water. lily and tom did not like the bee. they were scared of the bee. they thought the bee would sting them.

"mom, mom, help!" they cried. "there is a bee! it is scary!"

mom heard them and came to the fountain. she saw the bee and smiled. she was not scared of the bee. she knew the bee was not bad. she knew the bee liked the flowers and the water.

"don't worry, lily and tom," she said. "the bee is not scary. the bee is just thirsty. the bee wants to drink some water. the bee will not hurt you. the bee is your friend."

she took a bottle of water from her bag and sprayed some water on the flowers near the fountain. the bee saw the water and flew to the flowers. it drank some water and then flew away.

"see?" mom said. "the bee is happy. the bee says thank you. the bee is gone. you can play with the water again."

lily and tom looked at the flowers and the water and the bee. they understood what mom said. they were not scared of the bee anymore. they were happy too.

they said thank you to mom and to the bee. they played with the water again. they had a good day at the park.
anna and ben are twins. they like to play in the park. one day, they see a big tree with a crack in the trunk. they want to see what is inside the crack.

"let's stand on this rock and look inside the crack," anna says.

"ok, but be careful," ben says.

they climb on the rock and peek into the crack. they see a nest with three baby birds. the baby birds are fluffy and yellow. they open their mouths and make noises.

"wow, look at the baby birds! they are so cute!" anna says.

"they are impressive! i wonder where their mom is," ben says.

suddenly, they hear a loud squawk. they look up and see a big bird flying towards them. it is the mom bird. she is angry and scared. she thinks anna and ben want to hurt her babies.

"uh-oh, we have to go!" ben says.

they jump off the rock and run away. the mom bird chases them for a while, then goes back to her nest. anna and ben are safe, but they are also sorry.

"we didn't mean to bother the baby birds. we just wanted to see them," anna says.

"me too. maybe we can come back another day and watch them from far away," ben says.

they hug each other and go home. they learned a lesson. they should not touch or disturb wild animals. they should respect and admire them.
tom and mia were playing with a balloon in the park. they liked to toss it to each other and watch it float in the air. sometimes, they would try to catch it with their palms, but it was slippery and bouncy.

"look, tom, i can hold it with one hand!" mia said, as she squeezed the balloon with her fingers.

"wow, you are great, mia!" tom said, as he clapped his hands. "can i try?"

"sure, here you go!" mia said, as she released the balloon and threw it to tom.

tom reached out his palm and tried to grab the balloon, but he missed. the balloon flew away from him and towards a big tree.

"oh no, the balloon!" tom said, as he ran after it.

mia followed him, but they were too late. the balloon got stuck on a branch and popped.

"pop!" they heard a loud noise and saw the balloon burst into pieces.

they stopped and looked at each other. they felt sad and disappointed.

"i'm sorry, tom, it was my fault," mia said, as she hugged him.

"no, it's okay, mia, it was an accident," tom said, as he hugged her back.

they decided to go back to their mom and dad, who were sitting on a bench nearby. they told them what happened and asked for another balloon.

mom and dad smiled and gave them a new balloon. they said they were proud of them for being kind and sharing.

tom and mia thanked them and went back to playing. they were happy again and forgot about the popped balloon. they had fun with their new balloon and each other.
lily liked to watch the screen with her mom. the screen showed funny animals and people who made her laugh. sometimes, her mom would tell her the names of the animals and what they were doing. lily learned a lot from the screen. she was a very intelligent girl.

one day, lily's dad came home early from work. he was tired and wanted to rest. he went to the bedroom and closed the door. lily and her mom kept watching the screen in the living room. they did not make much noise, but they did not know that the screen was loud.

lily's dad heard the screen from the bedroom. he could not sleep. he was angry. he got up and opened the door. he walked to the living room and saw lily and her mom on the couch. he said in a loud voice, "can you please turn off the screen? you are disturbing me. i need to sleep."

lily and her mom were surprised. they did not mean to disturb lily's dad. they felt sorry for him. they turned off the screen and said, "we are sorry, dad. we did not know you were sleeping. we will be quiet now."

lily's dad felt bad for being rude. he said, "it's okay, i'm sorry too. i had a hard day at work. i love you both. how about we watch the screen together later, after i take a nap?"

lily and her mom smiled. they said, "we love you too, dad. that sounds like a good idea. have a nice nap."

lily's dad went back to the bedroom and closed the door. he fell asleep quickly. lily and her mom cuddled on the couch and waited for him to wake up. they were a happy family.
anna and lily are sisters. they like to play with dolls and blocks. but sometimes they fight over toys. anna wants to play with lily's pink doll. lily says no. anna gets mad and yells at lily. lily yells back at anna.

mom hears them yell. she comes to their room. she is not happy. she tells them to stop yelling and share. anna and lily say sorry. mom gives them a hug and leaves. anna and lily smile at each other.

but anna still wants the pink doll. she waits for lily to look away. then she grabs the doll and runs. lily sees her and runs after her. she wants her doll back. they run to the kitchen. they bump into the table. the table has a vase with flowers. the vase falls and breaks. water and glass go everywhere.

mom hears the crash. she comes to the kitchen. she sees the mess. she sees anna and lily with the doll. she is very angry. she yells at them. she says they are naughty and careless. she takes the doll away. she sends them to their room. she says they can't play with any toys until they clean up.

anna and lily cry. they wish they had been patient and nice. they wish they had not yelled and fought. they wish they had not broken the vase. they are sorry. but it is too late. they have no toys and no fun. they have a bad day.
tom and lily were at the beach with their mom and dad. they liked to play in the sand and look for shells. sometimes they saw fish and crabs in the water. but they never saw a dolphin.

one day, they saw something shiny in the waves. it was a dolphin! it was not a normal dolphin. it was a silver dolphin. it looked like it was made of metal. it jumped out of the water and made a loud noise.

"wow! look at that dolphin!" tom said.

"it's so pretty! it's like a toy!" lily said.

the dolphin saw the children and swam closer to them. it was friendly and curious. it let them touch its smooth skin. it felt cold and hard.

"hello, dolphin! what is your name?" lily asked.

the dolphin made a noise that sounded like "bee-bee".

"bee-bee? that's a nice name. i'm lily and this is tom. we are happy to meet you," lily said.

the dolphin nodded and smiled. it liked the children. it wanted to play with them.

"can we play with you, bee-bee?" tom asked.

the dolphin nodded again and splashed some water at them. it was a game. the children laughed and splashed back. they had fun with bee-bee.

bee-bee had a secret. it was not a real dolphin. it was a robot dolphin. it was made by a scientist who wanted to study the ocean. but the scientist was not nice. he wanted to use bee-bee to spy on other dolphins and fish. he put a chip in bee-bee's head to control it.

but bee-bee did not like the scientist. it did not want to spy on its friends. it wanted to be free and happy. it wanted to be a normal dolphin. it used its shiny skin to polish the chip and make it stop working. then it escaped from the scientist's boat and swam away.

bee-bee found the children and liked them. they were kind and gentle. they did not want to hurt it or use it. they wanted to be its friends. bee-bee was happy with them. it felt like a normal dolphin.
lily and ben like to play in the yard. they have a big truck and a small ladder. they load the truck with rocks, sticks and leaves. they pretend they are workers.

one day, they see a big house across the street. it has a scary roof. it is dark and pointy. they wonder what is inside. they want to see.

they take their truck and ladder and go to the house. they put the ladder on the wall. they climb up. they look at the roof. they see a hole. they want to go in.

they load the truck with more rocks, sticks and leaves. they make a pile under the hole. they climb on the pile. they reach the hole. they peek inside.

they see a big spider. it has many legs and eyes. it is hairy and shiny. it makes a loud noise. it jumps at them.

they scream. they fall off the pile. they run away. they leave their truck and ladder. they go back to their yard. they hug each other. they are scared.

they never go to the big house again. they play with their truck and ladder in the yard. they are happy.
sara and ben are twins. they like to go to the museum with mom and dad. the museum has many things to see and learn. sara likes the animals and ben likes the cars.

one day, they go to the museum and see a big sign. the sign says "hide and seek". sara and ben love to play hide and seek. they ask mom and dad if they can play. mom and dad say yes, but they have to stay in the same room and not run or touch anything.

sara and ben start to play. sara counts to ten and ben runs to hide. he sees a big car with a shiny hood. he thinks it is a good hiding spot. he crawls under the car and waits for sara to find him.

sara looks around the room. she sees many cars, but not ben. she thinks he is very good at hiding. she walks to the other side of the room and sees a helpful lady. the lady wears a badge that says "museum guide". sara asks the lady, "have you seen my brother? he is hiding from me."

the lady smiles and says, "i think i have. he is under the car with the shiny hood. do you want me to show you?"

sara nods and says, "yes, please. thank you for being helpful."

the lady takes sara to the car and points under the hood. sara sees ben's feet sticking out. she says, "i found you, ben! you are a good hider, but the lady helped me."

ben crawls out from under the car and says, "you are a good finder, sara. and the lady is very nice. can we say thank you to her?"

sara and ben say thank you to the lady and give her a hug. the lady says, "you are very welcome. you are both very polite and smart. i hope you enjoy the museum."

sara and ben smile and say, "we do. we love the museum. and we love playing hide and seek."
tom and mia are friends. they like to play outside. one day, they go to the big hill near their house. they run up and down the hill. they have fun.

they see a big tree on the hill. the tree has red and green things on it. tom and mia are hungry. they pick some of the things from the tree. they are apples. they are yummy.

tom and mia sit under the tree. they eat the apples. they share with each other. they are happy. they say thank you to the tree. they say thank you to each other. they are good friends.
sam and mia are friends. they like to play with their toys in the park. one day, they find a big box. they open the box and see many shiny things inside. they see a cell, a watch, a necklace, and a ring.

"wow, look at these!" sam says. he picks up the cell and presses some buttons. "this is fun!"

"i want the cell too!" mia says. she tries to grab the cell from sam. "give it to me!"

"no, it's mine!" sam says. he holds the cell tight. "you can have the watch!"

"i don't want the watch, i want the cell!" mia says. she pulls the cell hard. "let go!"

they both pull the cell and fight. the cell breaks in half. they hear a loud beep. they see a red light on the cell.

"oh no, what did we do?" sam says. he drops the cell. "is it broken?"

"i don't know, maybe it's a bomb!" mia says. she runs away. "help, help!"

a man comes to the park. he sees the box and the cell. he is angry. he is a spy. the cell is his. it is a dependable cell. he needs the cell to talk to his boss. he sees sam and mia.

"hey, you kids, what did you do to my cell?" he says. he runs after them. "give it back to me!"

sam and mia are scared. they run to their moms. they tell them what happened. their moms hug them and take them home. they say they are sorry. they learn not to touch things that are not theirs. they hope the spy will not find them. they hope the cell will not explode.
ben and jen are twins. they live in a hut with their mom and dad. they have a dog, a cat and a hen. the dog is big and brown. the cat is small and black. the hen is white and lays eggs.

every morning, ben and jen help their mom and dad. they feed the dog, the cat and the hen. they give them water and food. the dog likes bones. the cat likes milk. the hen likes corn. they are happy animals.

but one day, ben and jen are lazy. they do not want to feed the dog, the cat and the hen. they want to play with their toys. they say to their mom and dad, "we are tired. we do not want to feed the animals. you do it."

their mom and dad are not happy. they say to ben and jen, "you are not tired. you are lazy. you have to feed the animals. they are hungry and thirsty. they need you. if you do not feed them, they will be sad and sick."

ben and jen feel bad. they do not want to make the animals sad and sick. they say to their mom and dad, "we are sorry. we will feed the animals. we love them." they go to the hut and get the water and food. they feed the dog, the cat and the hen. they pet them and talk to them. the animals are happy and healthy. ben and jen are happy and proud. they are not lazy. they are good twins.
anna and ben are friends. they like to play in the field near their house. the field has many flowers and butterflies. anna and ben run and laugh and chase the butterflies.

"look, ben, a yellow flower!" anna says. she picks the flower and gives it to ben. "it is for you, ben. you are my friend."

"thank you, anna. you are my friend too." ben says. he smiles and puts the flower in his hair. "you are pretty, anna. like the flower."

anna and ben hug and kiss. they are happy. they sit on the grass and watch the sky. the sky is blue and has white clouds. anna and ben make shapes with the clouds.

"i see a bunny, anna. do you see it?" ben asks.

"yes, ben, i see it. and i see a star. do you see it?" anna asks.

"yes, anna, i see it. and i see a heart. do you see it?" ben asks.

"yes, ben, i see it. and i see you. you are in my heart." anna says.

anna and ben kiss again. they are very happy. they are also very tired. they lie on the grass and close their eyes. they fall asleep in the field. they dream of flowers and butterflies and stars and hearts. they are friends.
ben and lily were playing in the living room. they liked to jump on the couch and pretend it was a boat. they had a furry toy dog that they took turns holding. the toy dog was soft and brown and had a squeaky nose.

"let me have the dog, lily!" ben said. he tried to grab the toy from his sister, but she held on tight.

"no, it's my turn, ben!" lily said. she hugged the toy dog and stuck out her tongue.

ben was angry. he wanted the toy dog very much. he thought of a way to make lily give it to him. he leaned over and bit her arm hard.

"ow! ben, that hurts!" lily cried. she dropped the toy dog and rubbed her arm. it had a red mark where ben bit her.

ben smiled and picked up the toy dog. he squeezed its nose and made it squeak. he thought he had won.

but then he heard a loud voice behind him.

"ben, what did you do?" it was mom. she had seen everything. she looked very mad.

ben turned around and saw mom's face. he felt scared. he knew he had done something bad. he wished he had not bitten lily.

mom took the toy dog from ben and gave it back to lily. she hugged lily and said sorry. she told ben to go to his room and think about what he had done. she said he could not play with the toy dog or the couch for a long time.

ben walked to his room with his head down. he felt sad and sorry. he had lost his toy, his couch, and his sister. he had bitten more than he could chew.
tim and sam are brothers. they like to play in the forest near their house. one day, they find a big log. they want to make a fort with it.

"let's roll the log to that spot," tim says. "it will be a good place for our fort."

"ok," sam says. "but it is very heavy. we need something to help us."

they look around and see an axe. it belongs to their dad. he uses it to chop wood.

"look, an axe!" tim says. "we can use it to make the log smaller and lighter."

"good idea," sam says. "but be careful. the axe is sharp and dangerous."

tim takes the axe and swings it at the log. he makes a big cut. he swings it again and again. he is having fun.

"tim, stop!" sam says. "you are making too much noise. dad will hear us and get angry. he will not like us using his axe."

but tim does not listen. he keeps swinging the axe. he is jolly. he laughs and sings.

suddenly, the log splits in two. it rolls down the hill. it goes very fast. it bumps into a tree. it breaks the tree. it keeps rolling.

"oh no!" tim and sam say. "the log is out of control. it will hit something or someone. we have to stop it."

they run after the log. they try to catch it. but it is too fast for them. they are scared. they shout for help.

"help! help! stop the log!"
lila and tom were friends who liked to play outside. one day, they saw a big hill with smoke coming out of it. they wanted to see what it was, so they ran towards it.

"look, tom, it's a volcano!" lila said. "maybe there are dinosaurs inside!"

"let's go closer and find out!" tom said. "maybe we can take some rocks and make a necklace!"

they climbed up the hill, but it was very hot and hard. they heard a loud noise and saw fire and lava coming out of the volcano. they were scared and tried to run away, but it was too late.

"help, lila, help!" tom shouted. "the volcano is angry and wants to hurt us!"

"i'm sorry, tom, i'm sorry!" lila cried. "we should not have come here, we should have listened to our moms!"

but no one heard them or came to help them. the fire and lava caught them and burned them. they were not fine. they were gone.
tom and jen were twins who liked to play outside. they had a big yard with a swing, a slide and a sandbox. sometimes, they helped their dad with the grill, where he cooked meat and corn for dinner. they knew the grill was hot and they had to be careful.

one day, tom and jen were playing with their toy cars in the sandbox. they pretended they were racing on a track. tom had a red car and jen had a blue car. they made zooming and honking noises as they moved their cars around. tom wanted to win the race, so he pushed his car faster and faster. jen tried to catch up, but tom was too quick.

tom saw the grill nearby and had an idea. he thought he could make his car go even faster if he put it on the grill. he did not think about how hot the grill was or how it could hurt his car. he ran to the grill and threw his car on it. he shouted, "look, jen, my car is on fire! i win!"

jen saw what tom did and felt scared and sad. she knew the grill was dangerous and she loved her brother. she did not want him to get burned or lose his car. she ran to the grill and tried to grab tom's car. but the car was too hot and it burned her hand. she screamed and dropped the car. she started to cry.

tom heard jen's scream and saw her hand. he realized he had done a bad thing. he felt sorry and ashamed. he ran to jen and hugged her. he said, "i'm sorry, jen, i'm sorry. i was silly and mean. are you okay?"

jen felt tom's hug and heard his words. she knew he was sorry and he loved her. she felt compassionate and forgave him. she said, "it's okay, tom, it's okay. i love you. but don't do that again, okay?"

tom and jen went inside and told their dad what happened. their dad was angry and worried. he scolded tom for being reckless and careless. he praised jen for being brave and kind. he took them to the bathroom and put some cream and a bandage on jen's hand. he said, "you two are lucky it was not worse. you have to be careful with the grill. it can burn you and your things. you have to respect it and listen to me. do you understand?"

tom and jen nodded and said, "yes, dad, we understand. we're sorry. we won't do it again."

their dad hugged them and said, "i love you both. now, let's go have some dinner. i have some meat and corn for you. and some ice cream for dessert."

tom and jen smiled and said, "yay, ice cream!" they followed their dad to the kitchen and ate their dinner. they learned their lesson and never played with the grill again.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to clap her hands and dance around. one day, lily went to a lecture with her mom. the lecture was about being kind to others. 

but lily thought the lecture was weird. she didn't understand why they needed to talk about being kind. she already knew how to be kind! 

after the lecture, lily and her mom went to the park. there, they saw a boy who was sad because he had lost his toy. lily remembered the lecture and decided to be kind. she helped the boy look for his toy and they found it together. 

lily realized that even though she already knew how to be kind, it was important to hear the lecture and be reminded of it. from then on, she always listened carefully to the lectures and tried to be kind to everyone she met.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play outside with his toys and his dog, max. one day, timmy found a shiny rock in the dirt. he was so proud of his new discovery that he showed it to his mom.

"wow, that's a beautiful rock," said timmy's mom. "but be careful, sometimes things in the dirt can be dangerous, like poison."

timmy didn't know what poison was, but he nodded his head anyway. later that day, timmy and max were playing in the yard when max suddenly started digging a hole. timmy saw that max had found something buried in the ground.

"what did you find, max?" timmy asked.

max barked and dug deeper, until he uncovered a bone. timmy was excited to have found something buried too, but then he remembered what his mom had said about things in the dirt being dangerous.

"max, we have to bury this bone again," timmy said. "it might be poison."

so timmy and max buried the bone back in the ground, and timmy felt proud that he had made a good decision to keep himself and max safe.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with his toys all day long. he had a big toy box where he kept all his toys. one day, timmy's mom asked him to tidy up his toys and put them back in the toy box. timmy didn't want to tidy up because he wanted to keep playing.

but then, timmy's little sister came in and wanted to play too. she wanted to play with timmy's favorite toy car, but she couldn't find it because all the toys were scattered around the room. timmy saw that his sister was sad, so he decided to cover her with a blanket to make her happy.

after that, timmy realized that he couldn't play with his toys if they were all over the place. so, he decided to slide all his toys back into the toy box. it was hard work, but he felt good when he was finished. timmy's mom was very happy that he tidied up and he got to play with his sister and his toys again!
once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved to play in the garden with his spade. his spade was big and shiny, and he used it to dig holes in the ground.

one day, timmy's friend billy came to play. billy wanted to borrow timmy's spade, but timmy didn't want to let him. timmy said, "i don't trust you with my spade, billy. you might break it."

but billy promised he would take good care of the spade and return it when he was done. timmy finally agreed and gave billy the spade.

after a while, billy came back with the spade, but it was all wet and dirty. timmy was angry and said, "you didn't take care of my spade like you promised. now it's all wet and dirty!"

billy said sorry, but timmy didn't forgive him. timmy was so angry that he never spoke to billy again. and that's the sad ending of timmy and billy's friendship.

as they were walking, they saw a big building with lots of books inside. lily's mommy told her that it was a library and they could borrow a novel to read at home. lily was very excited and picked a book with a princess on the cover. 

when they got home, lily sat down to read her novel while her mommy made dinner. she hugged her ugly doll tightly and felt very happy. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play and have fun. one night, lily's mommy told her it was time for bed. lily didn't want to go to her bedroom because it was cold in there.

lily said, "mommy, i don't want to go to my bedroom. it's too cold in there."

mommy said, "lily, you need to behave and go to bed."

lily went to her bedroom but she was still cold. she got out of bed and went to the living room to tell her mommy. mommy was upset because lily wasn't behaving. she told lily to go back to bed.

lily went back to her bedroom but she was still cold. she couldn't sleep, so she got up and went to the living room again. this time, mommy was really upset. she told lily to go back to bed and stay there.

lily went back to her bedroom but she was still cold and couldn't sleep. she started to cry. suddenly, she heard a loud noise outside. she was scared and didn't know what to do. she wanted her mommy, but she was too scared to leave her bedroom. unfortunately, the bad ending is that lily was too scared to get help and ended up getting hurt.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play games with her friends, but sometimes she felt lonely when they were not around. one day, she found a new game in her toy box. it was a soft ball that she could squeeze. she was so excited to play with it.

lily played with the ball all day long, squeezing it and throwing it into the air. but when it was time for bed, she couldn't find the ball. she looked everywhere, but it was nowhere to be found. she felt very sad and lonely again.

the next day, lily's mom found the ball under the couch. but when lily squeezed it, it popped and broke. she was so sad that her favorite game was gone forever. she learned that sometimes things we love can be taken away from us, and it can make us feel very lonely.
once upon a time, there was a cat named mittens. mittens loved to stretch and play all day. one wednesday, mittens went outside to play, but it was very quiet. mittens didn't see any of her friends around, so she decided to go on an adventure.

mittens walked and walked until she came to a big tree. she climbed up the tree and saw a bird's nest. mittens wanted to play with the baby birds, so she stretched out her paw to touch them. but the mama bird didn't like that and started to squawk loudly.

mittens got scared and tried to climb down the tree, but she slipped and fell. she hurt her leg and couldn't walk anymore. mittens meowed for help, but no one came. mittens was all alone and couldn't move. she was very sad and scared.

and that's how mittens had a bad ending to her adventure. the end.
once upon a time, there were two friends named bear and rabbit. they loved to play together and have fun. one day, they decided to make a pizza. bear brought the cheese and rabbit brought the sauce. they put the sauce on the pizza and it tasted really good.

but then, they started to argue about who made the pizza better. bear said his cheese was the best and rabbit said his sauce was better. they both felt angry and sad. 

then, they remembered they were friends and decided to stop arguing. they apologized and decided to unite and make another pizza together. this time, they both agreed that the pizza tasted better with both the cheese and the sauce. they were happy and not ashamed anymore.
once upon a time, there was a peaceful village where everyone was friends. they played together and helped each other. one day, a big monster came to the village. the monster was very angry and wanted to destroy everything.

the villagers were scared and didn't know what to do. but then, a little girl had an idea. she remembered that her friend had a special power to defeat monsters. so, she went to find her friend and asked for help.

her friend agreed to help and together they went to the monster. the monster was very strong, but the girl's friend was stronger. she used her power to destroy the monster and save the village.

after the monster was gone, the villagers were happy again. they thanked the little girl and her friend for saving them. from that day on, the village was even more peaceful and everyone was even better friends.

timmy went inside and his mommy locked the door. timmy asked his mommy why she locked the door and she said it was to keep them safe. 

the next morning, timmy woke up early and saw the sunrise. he thought it was very pretty. but then he saw something weird in the sky. it was a bird with a funny hat on! timmy laughed and told his mommy about the weird bird he saw. 

from that day on, timmy always looked for the weird bird during the sunrise. and his mommy always locked the door to keep them safe. the end.

from that day on, max learned to be careful around new puppies and always kept his face happy and friendly. the end.

timmy's grandma was very rich and had a big house with lots of toys. timmy was very happy and played with all the toys. he even touched the shiny things and the soft things. 

after playing for a while, timmy's grandma asked him to help her with some work. timmy didn't like work, but he wanted to make his grandma happy, so he helped her. they worked together and finished all the work. timmy was proud of himself for helping his grandma. 

at the end of the day, timmy's mommy came back from work and was very happy to see that timmy had a good day with his grandma. timmy told his mommy all about the toys he played with and the work he did with his grandma. his mommy was proud of him too. from that day on, timmy loved to help his grandma with work and play with her toys.

lily felt much better with her mommy there to comfort her. from that day on, lily knew that even if she fell again, she was tough enough to keep going and her mommy would always be there to help her.

timmy was sad he couldn't go to the island, but he knew he could still have fun at the beach. he built a sandcastle and played with his family. even though he couldn't go to the incredible island, he still had an amazing day with his loved ones.

the cricket was so happy to be saved by lily. it started to sing a beautiful song to show its gratitude. lily's little brother, max, saw how happy the cricket was and became envious. he wanted to save a bug too! so, lily and max went on a bug-saving adventure together. they found a ladybug and a butterfly who needed their help. 

at the end of the day, lily and max felt proud of themselves for being such good helpers to the bugs. they went to bed with happy hearts, dreaming of all the bugs they would save tomorrow. the end.

after a while, they decided to play a game of hide-and-seek. nutty was very good at hiding, and floppy had a hard time finding him. finally, floppy found nutty hiding in a tree. they were both happy and excited.

but then, as they were playing, a big, scary wolf appeared. the wolf wanted to score a meal and chased after floppy and nutty. they ran as fast as they could, but the wolf was too fast. sadly, the wolf caught them both and they never saw their forest friends again.

once upon a time, there was a little birdie named tweetie. tweetie loved to fly around and sing songs. one day, while tweetie was flying, he saw a big, shiny cage. tweetie thought the cage looked fun and decided to fly inside. but as soon as tweetie went inside, the cage door closed and locked.

tweetie tried to get out, but he couldn't. he was stuck in the cage. tweetie felt sad and scared. he wished he had never gone inside the cage. suddenly, he heard a sound. it was a boy who had come to take him home as a pet. tweetie was grateful to be saved and went home with the boy.

but when they got home, the boy put the cage on a shelf and forgot about tweetie. tweetie was stuck in the cage once again. he wished he could reverse time and never go inside the cage. but it was too late. tweetie was trapped forever.

but then, his mom came running over. she was very careful not to trip on any rocks. she picked timmy up and hugged him tight. she told him not to be afraid of the lightning because it was far away.

once upon a time, there was a penguin named pete. pete loved to travel to new places. one day, he decided to go to the north pole. it was very icy there, but pete had a warm coat. 

as he was walking, he found a handle on the ground. it was a shiny handle that sparkled in the sun. pete picked it up and carried it with him on his journey. 

after a while, pete met some other penguins who were lost. they didn't know how to get back home. pete used the handle to dig a path through the snow and they all followed him. they were very happy to have found their way home. 

from that day on, pete always carried the handle with him on his travels. it helped him and others when they needed it. pete was a happy penguin who loved to explore new places and help his friends.
