but when he got off the swing, he accidentally bumped into mrs. smith and knocked her over. she fell and hurt her leg. timmy felt very bad and started to cry. his mom came over and they took mrs. smith to the hospital. she had to stay there for a long time and couldn't take care of her garden anymore.

timmy felt very sad and didn't want to swing anymore. he learned that accidents can happen and it's important to be careful. he also learned to always say sorry when he makes a mistake.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily who loved to count. she could count up to ten all by herself. one day, lily went to the park with her mom. they saw a tall tree and lily said, "i want to stand under the tree." her mom said, "okay, but be careful not to climb it."

lily stood under the tree and counted the leaves. suddenly, she saw a bird fall from the sky and land on the ground. she ran to her mom and said, "mommy, the bird is dead!" her mom said, "let's go see if we can help it." they went to the bird and saw that it was not moving. 

lily's mom explained to her that sometimes animals get hurt and can't be helped. lily said, "i will count the leaves on the tree for the bird." she counted all the leaves and said, "i hope the bird can be happy in heaven." her mom smiled and said, "that was very kind of you, lily."
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily who loved to play outside. one day, she went to the park and saw a big green dragon. it was different from any dragon she had ever seen before.

"hello, dragon," said lily. "why are you here?"

"i'm here to find a spring," said the dragon. "i'm very thirsty."

lily knew where the spring was and offered to show the dragon. but when they got there, they found out that the spring was dry. the dragon was very sad.

"don't worry," said lily. "we can find water somewhere else."

they searched and searched until they found a pond. the dragon drank the water and felt much better. "thank you, lily," said the dragon. "you're a great friend."

from that day on, lily and the dragon played together every day at the park. they had lots of fun and were happy to have each other as friends.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her toys on the smooth floor of her room. one day, she found a zipper on her favorite dress. she tried to zip it up and down, up and down but it got stuck.

lily's mom was busy cooking in the kitchen and couldn't help her. so, lily decided to try to fix the zipper herself. she pulled and tugged until suddenly the zipper broke and flew off the dress.

lily was sad and didn't know what to do. she sat on the floor and cried. her mom came in and saw the broken zipper. she tried to fix it but it was too late. lily's favorite dress was ruined.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy was very thirsty and wanted some milk. he asked his mommy, "mommy, can i have some milk please?" his mommy said, "sure, timmy. let me get you a glass of milk."

timmy was very impatient and wanted his milk right away. he said, "mommy, i want my milk now!" his mommy said, "timmy, you need to be patient. the milk is coming."

while timmy was waiting for his milk, he saw his toy gun on the table. he picked it up and pretended to shoot his mommy. his mommy said, "timmy, we don't shoot people. that's not nice."

finally, timmy's milk arrived and he drank it all up. he was happy and no longer impatient. he said, "thank you, mommy. i love you." his mommy replied, "you're welcome, timmy. i love you too."
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy who loved to play on the beach. he would build sandcastles and chase the waves. one day, he found a shiny rock and put it in his pocket. he thought it was cool.

as the day went on, the tide started to come in. timmy didn't notice because he was having too much fun. suddenly, he realized that he was surrounded by water and he couldn't get back to the shore. he was scared.

just when he thought he was going to be stuck in the water forever, he remembered the shiny rock in his pocket. he took it out and saw that it was actually a valuable gem. he held it up and a passing boat saw him. they came to rescue him and he was so happy. from then on, timmy always remembered the value of the shiny rock and how it saved him from the tide.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved trains and he had a toy engine that he played with every day. one day, timmy was playing with his engine when his friend billy came over.

"hi timmy! can i play with your engine?" asked billy.

timmy thought for a moment and then said, "sure billy, you can play with it, but you have to be obedient and take good care of it."

billy promised to take good care of the engine and they played together for a while. but then, billy started to get rough with the engine and timmy got upset.

"hey billy, you're not being obedient! you promised to take good care of my engine," said timmy.

billy realized he had made a mistake and apologized to timmy. from that day on, billy learned to be more obedient and take better care of his own toys. and timmy learned the importance of choosing good friends who keep their promises.
once upon a time, there was a big fat cat named tom. tom loved to play with his toys and eat lots of food. one day, something bad happen to tom. he hurt his paw and couldn't walk anymore. his owner took him to the hospital, where the nice doctor helped him feel better. tom was so happy to be able to walk again and play with his toys. from that day on, tom made sure to be careful and not get hurt again.
once upon a time, a boy named timmy had a big drum. he loved to bang it loud, but his mom said it was too noisy. one day, timmy decided to stir up some fun by playing his drum outside. he banged it loud and danced around, making all the neighbors smile. suddenly, a group of kids came over and asked if they could play too. timmy was happy to share his drum and they all banged it loud together. they had so much fun, they decided to start a band and play for everyone in the town. and that's how timmy and his friends became the best drummers in the land. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily who loved to play outside. she liked to run and jump and pick flowers. one day, she saw a bee flying around her head. she didn't like bees because they can sting you and it hurts. lily said, "i hate bees!"

but then, she remembered that bees make yummy honey that she likes to eat. she realized that she was being ignorant and didn't know everything about bees. so, lily decided to learn more about bees and why they are important.

she read books and watched videos about bees. she learned that bees help flowers grow and make honey that people can eat. she even found out that some bees don't sting at all! now, lily doesn't hate bees anymore. she thinks they are pretty cool and important.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she was very sleepy and wanted to take a nap, but she couldn't fall asleep. she imagined a world where she could sleep soundly.

suddenly, she heard a whistle coming from outside. she got up and looked out the window. it was her friend, billy. he had a big smile on his face and said, "hi lily, do you want to come play with me?"

lily rubbed her eyes and yawned. "i'm too sleepy to play right now," she said. "but can you whistle me a lullaby so i can fall asleep?"

billy nodded and started whistling a soft tune. lily closed her eyes and listened to the beautiful sound. soon, she was fast asleep and dreaming about all the fun adventures she would have with billy when she woke up.
once upon a time, there was a princess. she was very pretty and everyone liked her. she had a big party and invited all her friends. she received lots of presents, like toys and candy. her friends loved her very much because she was so popular. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a special brush that she loved to use to brush her hair every day. one day, she accidentally dropped the brush on the floor and it broke into tiny pieces. lily was sad because she understood that the brush was fragile and couldn't be fixed.

her mommy saw how sad lily was and decided to take her to the store to get a new brush. lily was so happy when she saw all the pretty brushes at the store. she picked out a new one that was pink and sparkly. she made sure to be extra careful with her new brush because she understood that it was fragile too.

from that day on, lily brushed her hair every day with her new brush and she was very happy. she understood that even though things can break, there is always a way to fix them or find something new to replace them.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily who loved to watch videos. one day, her mom showed her a funny video of a cat playing with a ball of yarn. lily laughed and laughed at the silly cat.

later that day, lily went to the park with her mom. they saw a group of kids playing on the swings. one of the kids had a mild cold and was sneezing a lot. lily's mom reminded her to cover her mouth when she sneezed, so she wouldn't get sick too.

as they were leaving the park, lily saw the same kid from the swings walking with his mom. she remembered how he sneezed a lot and she felt bad for him. so, she ran up to him and showed him the funny cat video on her mom's phone. the kid laughed and laughed, and lily felt happy that she could make him feel better.
once upon a time, there was a lady who had a big smile. she was proud of her garden and liked to show it to everyone. one day, a little girl came to her house and the lady said hello. the little girl was shy and didn't speak, but the lady was kind and asked her if she wanted to see her garden. the little girl nodded and the lady took her to see the flowers. the little girl was happy and smiled. she pointed at a butterfly and said "pretty". the lady was happy that the little girl liked her garden and they became friends. from that day on, the little girl would visit the lady and they would speak about the flowers and the butterflies.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in the sunshine. one day, she went on a walk with her mommy. they walked through the park and saw many pretty flowers. 

suddenly, lily saw a dangerous snake on the path. her mommy told her to stay back and not get too close. the snake slithered away and they continued on their walk. 

as they walked, lily saw a butterfly and started to follow it. she led her mommy to a beautiful garden with lots of flowers. they sat in the sunshine and enjoyed the pretty view. it was a happy day for lily and her mommy. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to climb trees, but he was too short to reach the branches. one day, he found an axe in the shed and decided to use it to chop down a tree. 

"timmy, what are you doing with that axe?" asked his mom. 

"i'm going to chop down a tree so i can climb it," timmy replied politely. 

his mom explained that chopping down trees was dangerous and that he could hurt himself. she suggested that he ask his dad for help instead. 

later that day, timmy's dad helped him climb a tall tree in the backyard. timmy was so happy that he thanked his dad politely. from that day on, timmy never used the axe to chop down trees again.
once upon a time, there was a little ant named andy. he loved to crawl around and explore the world. one day, he met a friendly ladybug named lily. 

"hi there, andy!" said lily. "what are you up to today?" 

"just crawling around, looking for something special," replied andy. 

as they continued on their way, they saw a big, juicy strawberry in the distance. 

"that looks like an ordinary strawberry," said lily. 

but andy had a feeling that it was anything but ordinary. he crawled closer and closer until he was right next to the strawberry. suddenly, he saw something shiny and sparkly inside the strawberry! 

"look, lily!" he exclaimed. "it's a treasure!" 

together, they carefully dug out the treasure and found a beautiful diamond. from that day on, andy and lily crawled around together, looking for more treasures to discover.
once upon a time, there was an ordinary boy named timmy. he loved to play in the park, especially on the swings. one day, he saw a square box on the ground. it was just an ordinary box, but timmy was curious.

he decided to open the box and inside, he found a colorful kite. timmy had never flown a kite before, but he was excited to try. he ran to the open field and held the kite up high. suddenly, a strong wind began to spring up.

timmy let go of the kite and it soared high into the sky. he was amazed at how high it flew. timmy knew that he would always remember this day and the wonderful surprise that he found in the square box.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to watch films with his mommy and daddy. one day, timmy and his family went to see a film at the movie theater. the film was about a big, fearful monster who lived in a castle. 

timmy loved the movie, but he was scared of the monster. his mommy and daddy told him that the monster was just acting, and that it wasn't real. timmy felt better knowing that the monster wasn't real, and he enjoyed the rest of the film. 

after the film was over, timmy and his family went home. timmy couldn't stop talking about the film and how the monster was just acting. he wanted to watch more films with his family, and he wasn't afraid of any monsters anymore.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to eat oatmeal for breakfast every day. one morning, her mom made her oatmeal with some yummy fruits on top. lily loved it so much that she asked her mom to make it every day.

one day, lily's little brother came into her room and started being bossy. he wanted to play with her toys, but she didn't want to share. so, lily decided to test him. she gave him a puzzle to solve and said if he could do it, then he could play with her toys. her brother tried really hard and finally solved the puzzle. lily was proud of him and decided to share her toys with him.

from that day on, lily and her brother played together every day and enjoyed their oatmeal breakfasts together.
once upon a time, there was a big wardrobe in a little girl's room. the wardrobe was very dull and old, but the little girl loved it anyway. every night, the little girl would shake the wardrobe a little bit, hoping that something magical would happen.

one day, the little girl's mom told her that they were going to clean out the wardrobe. the little girl was sad, but she knew it had to be done. as they were cleaning, the little girl found a small box hidden in the back of the wardrobe. she shook it a little bit and heard something rattle inside.

excitedly, the little girl opened the box and found a beautiful necklace. she put it on and felt like a princess. from that day on, the little girl would shake the wardrobe every night, hoping to find more magical treasures hidden inside.
once upon a time, there was a group of delicate butterflies. they loved to wander around the garden and smell the pretty flowers. one day, they met a little girl named lily.

"hello, butterflies!" said lily. "can i play with you?"

"of course!" said the butterflies.

lily laughed and chased after the butterflies as they wandered around the garden. they flew up high and then landed on a delicate flower. 

"this is so much fun!" said lily. 

the butterflies were happy to have a new friend to play with. they continued to wander around the garden together, enjoying the sunshine and the beautiful flowers.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. lily loved to read books with her mommy. one day, lily and her mommy went to the park. they saw a man with a pink gun. 

lily asked her mommy, "what is that man doing with a pink gun?" 

her mommy said, "i don't know, but we should stay away from him." 

lily and her mommy walked away, but the man with the pink gun followed them. he pointed the gun at them and said, "give me your money!" 

lily's mommy gave him the money, but the man still shot the gun. lily and her mommy fell down and didn't get up. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a best friend named max who lived next door. they loved to play together every day.

one day, max decided to surprise lily with an amazing gift. he had found a pretty flower in his garden and wanted to give it to her. when lily saw the flower, she was so happy and gave max a big hug.

"thank you, max! you are the best friend ever!" said lily.

max smiled and said, "i wanted to make you happy because that's what friends do. we always try to make each other happy."

lily learned that day that being a good friend means doing nice things for each other and making each other happy. she was grateful to have such a wonderful friend like max.
sam and mia liked to play with their toys in the living room. they had many toys, like cars, dolls, blocks and books. but they did not like to put their toys away when they were done. they left them on the floor, on the couch, on the table and everywhere.

one day, their mom came home from work and saw the mess. she was not happy. she said to sam and mia, "you need to return your toys to their places. the living room is not organized. it is hard to walk and find things. and it is not safe. you can trip and fall and hurt yourself or break something. please, help me clean up."

sam and mia did not want to clean up. they wanted to keep playing. they said to their mom, "but mom, we are having fun. we will clean up later. can we play for a little longer?"

their mom said, "no, you cannot play for a little longer. you have played enough. it is time to return your toys to their places. you can play again tomorrow, but only if you keep the living room organized. now, come on, let's do it together. it will be faster and easier."

sam and mia sighed. they knew their mom was right. they did not want to trip and fall and hurt themselves or break something. they did not want to make their mom unhappy. they decided to help their mom clean up. they returned their toys to their places. they put the cars in the box, the dolls in the basket, the blocks in the bag and the books on the shelf. they made the living room organized.

their mom smiled. she said to sam and mia, "thank you, sam and mia. you did a good job. the living room looks much better. i am proud of you. now, how about we have some cookies and milk as a reward?"

sam and mia smiled too. they said to their mom, "yes, please. we love cookies and milk. and we love you, mom."

they hugged their mom and went to the kitchen. they enjoyed their cookies and milk. they were happy. they learned to return their toys to their places and keep the living room organized.
sara was a charming girl who liked to speak to everyone. she had many friends at her school and at her home. she also liked to play with her toys, especially her black cat, luna.

one day, sara went to the park with her mom and luna. she saw a boy who had a big red ball. she wanted to play with him and his ball. she ran to him and said, "hi, i am sara. can i play with you and your ball?"

the boy looked at her and said, "no, you can't. this is my ball and you are a girl. girls can't play with balls. and your cat is ugly. it is black and has green eyes. go away!"

sara felt sad and angry. she did not like what the boy said. she loved luna and she liked to play with balls. she said, "that is not nice. you are mean. girls can play with balls too. and my cat is not ugly. she is beautiful and smart. she can do tricks. look!"

sara whistled and luna jumped on her shoulder. then luna rolled over and meowed. sara smiled and said, "see? luna is amazing. you are just jealous."

the boy was surprised and scared. he did not know that cats could do tricks. he dropped his ball and ran away. he said, "ahh! your cat is a witch. it is evil. stay away from me!"

sara picked up the ball and said, "bye, bye, mean boy. come on, luna. let's play with the ball. we don't need him. we have each other."

sara and luna had fun playing with the ball. they met some other nice kids who wanted to play with them too. sara was happy and proud. she said, "luna, you are the best cat in the world. you are my friend and you are charming."
tim and sam were friends. they liked to play with their toys. tim had a big bear and sam had a small dog. they both valued their toys very much.

one day, they went to the park with their toys. they saw a big slide and wanted to try it. tim said, "let's go on the slide with our toys. it will be fun!" sam said, "ok, but be careful. we don't want to hurt our toys."

they climbed up the ladder and sat on the slide. tim held his bear and sam held his dog. they slid down fast and laughed. but when they reached the bottom, something bad happened. tim's bear landed on sam's dog and broke its paw. sam's dog cried and sam cried too.

sam was very sad and angry. he said, "you hurt my dog! you are a bad friend! you don't value my toy!" tim was sorry and scared. he said, "i'm sorry, sam. i didn't mean to hurt your dog. i value your toy too. please don't be mad at me."

but sam didn't listen. he took his dog and ran away. he didn't want to play with tim anymore. tim was left alone with his bear. he felt very sad and lonely. he wished he had been more careful. he wished he still had his friend.
ben likes to write. he writes letters to his friends. he draws pictures of his toys and his dog. he writes his name in big letters. he is very proud of his writing.

one day, he wants to send a letter to his friend sam. he asks his mom for an envelope and a stamp. he puts his letter and his picture in the envelope. he writes sam's name and address on the front. he writes his own name and address on the back. he sticks the stamp on the corner. he is very excited.

he asks his mom to take him to the mailbox. they walk to the end of the street. they see a big blue mailbox. ben lifts the flap and puts his envelope inside. he closes the flap and hears a thud. he smiles and waves to the mailbox. he hopes sam will like his letter.

sam lives far away. he has to wait for the mailman to bring him his letter. he checks the mailbox every day. he likes to get mail. he likes to see who wrote to him.

one day, he finds a letter with his name on it. he opens it and sees a picture of a toy and a dog. he reads the letter and sees ben's name. he is very happy. he likes ben's letter. he thinks it is very original. he wants to write back to ben. he runs to his room and gets his paper and crayons. he starts to write.
tim and mia were friends who liked to play outside. one day, they went to the lake with their moms. they saw many things at the lake: fish, ducks, frogs, and flowers. they also saw something unusual: a big brown animal with long teeth and a flat tail.

"look, mia, what is that?" tim asked, pointing at the animal.

"i don't know, tim. it looks scary," mia said, holding tim's hand.

the animal was chewing on a tree near the water. it made loud noises with its teeth and tail. it did not see tim and mia.

"that is a beaver, kids," one of their moms said, coming closer. "it is not scary, it is just busy. beavers chew on trees to make their homes in the lake. they are very clever animals."

"wow, a beaver!" tim said, feeling curious. "can we go closer, mom?"

"only a little bit, tim. we don't want to bother the beaver. it might get angry if we get too close," his mom said.

tim and mia walked a little bit closer to the beaver, but not too much. they watched the beaver chew on the tree and splash in the water. they thought the beaver was unusual, but also amazing. they learned something new at the lake that day.
tim and lily were best friends. they liked to play together every day. they had a loyal dog named spot, who followed them everywhere. spot was very smart and could do many tricks.

one day, tim and lily decided to play hide and seek in the park. tim was the seeker and lily was the hider. lily ran to find a good hiding place. she saw a big toilet near the playground. she thought it was a funny place to hide. she went inside and closed the door.

tim counted to ten and then started to look for lily. he looked behind the trees, under the benches, and in the swings. he could not find her. he asked spot to help him. spot sniffed the air and wagged his tail. he ran to the toilet and barked.

tim followed spot and saw the toilet. he knocked on the door and said, "lily, are you in there? i found you!"

lily opened the door and smiled. she said, "you are very good at finding me, tim. and spot is very helpful. he is a loyal friend."

tim and lily hugged and laughed. they thanked spot and gave him a treat. they decided to play another game. they had a lot of fun in the park.
spot was a dog who liked to play with his friends. he had a ball, a bone and a rope. he was happy when he shared his toys with other dogs. but one day, he saw a new dog in the park. the new dog was very tall and had long hair. spot was afraid of the new dog.

"who are you?" spot asked the new dog.

"i am fluffy. i just moved here with my family. can i play with you?" fluffy said.

spot did not want to play with fluffy. he thought fluffy was too big and too different. he wanted to keep his toys for himself. he growled at fluffy and ran away with his ball, his bone and his rope.

fluffy was sad. he did not understand why spot did not like him. he wanted to make friends and have fun. he followed spot and tried to talk to him.

"please, spot, don't be mean. i just want to be your friend. can i have one of your toys?" fluffy said.

spot did not listen to fluffy. he was angry and scared. he screamed at fluffy and bit his tail.

"go away, fluffy! you are not welcome here! these are my toys and you can't have them!" spot said.

fluffy yelped in pain and ran away. he cried and looked for his family. he felt lonely and hurt.

spot was proud of himself. he thought he had scared fluffy away. he had his toys and his park. he did not need anyone else. he played with his ball, his bone and his rope. but soon, he got bored. he looked around and saw no other dogs. he had no one to play with. he felt lonely and sad.

he realized he had made a mistake. he had been rude and selfish. he had hurt fluffy's feelings. he had lost a chance to make a new friend. he felt sorry and ashamed.

he decided to look for fluffy and apologize. he hoped fluffy would forgive him and play with him. he learned that being kind and sharing is better than being mean and greedy. he learned that being different is not bad. he learned that everyone needs a friend.
lily and tom were best friends. they liked to play with trains. lily had a big train that made steam. tom had a small train that did not make steam.

one day, they went to the park with their trains. they saw a boy with a shiny new train. his train made steam and noises. it was very fast and fun.

"wow, look at his train!" tom said. "i want a train like that!"

lily felt jealous. she liked her train, but she thought the boy's train was better. she wanted to play with it.

"can we play with your train?" she asked the boy.

the boy shook his head. "no, this is my train. you can't touch it."

lily and tom felt sad. they went back to their trains.

"your train is nice, lily," tom said. "it makes steam. my train does not make steam."

lily smiled. she had an idea.

"tom, i have something to tell you. i recommend you to do this. you can make your train make steam too. you just need some water and a straw."

she showed tom how to put some water in his train and blow through a straw. the water came out as steam.

"wow, thank you, lily!" tom said. "this is so cool! now my train makes steam too!"

they played with their trains happily. they did not care about the boy's train anymore. they were happy with their own trains. they were best friends.
lily liked to use her crayons to draw pictures. she had many colors, but her favorite was peach. she liked how it looked like the fruit she ate with her mom. one day, she wanted to draw a peach on a big paper. she looked for her peach crayon, but she could not find it. she asked her brother max if he had seen it.

max was playing with his cars on the floor. he did not like to draw. he said he did not know where the peach crayon was. but lily saw something in his hand. it was her peach crayon! she ran to him and tried to get it back. but max was faster. he put the crayon in his mouth and bit it.

lily was very angry and sad. she yelled at max and told him to spit out the crayon. max made a face and spit out the crayon. it was broken and wet. he said it was disgusting. he did not like how it tasted. he threw it on the floor and went back to his cars.

lily picked up the crayon and looked at it. it was ruined. she could not use it to draw anymore. she felt like crying. she did not understand why max did that. she wished he was nicer to her. she decided to tell her mom what happened. maybe she could get a new peach crayon. she hoped so. she loved her peach crayon.
lily and ben were twins who liked to play with their toys. they had many toys, but they always wanted more. they asked their mom and dad for new toys every day. mom and dad said no, because they had enough toys and they should be happy with what they had. but lily and ben did not listen. they cried and whined and threw tantrums. they said they were not happy and they wanted more toys.

one day, mom and dad had to go to work and they left lily and ben with their grandma. grandma was very kind and gentle. she made them pancakes for breakfast and read them stories. she also gave them a big box of toys that she had saved from when mom and dad were little. lily and ben were very excited. they opened the box and saw many toys that they had never seen before. there were cars and dolls and puzzles and books and blocks and animals. lily and ben grabbed the toys and ran to their room. they did not say thank you to grandma. they did not share the toys with each other. they fought and snatched and broke the toys. they made a big mess in their room.

grandma heard the noise and came to their room. she saw the toys scattered and torn and ruined. she saw lily and ben crying and yelling. she was very sad and angry. she said, "lily and ben, you have spoiled the toys that i gave you. you have spoiled the fun that you could have had. you have spoiled the day that we could have spent together. you have been very selfish and ungrateful. you do not deserve these toys. you need to learn to be happy with what you have and to share and care for others. now you have to clean up this mess and put the toys back in the box. and you have to say sorry to me and to each other. and you have to sit in the corner and think about what you have done. no more toys for you today."

lily and ben felt very ashamed and sorry. they did what grandma said. they cleaned up the mess and put the toys back in the box. they said sorry to grandma and to each other. they sat in the corner and thought about what they had done. they realized that they had been very bad and that they had hurt grandma and themselves. they wished they had been more kind and thankful and happy. they wished they had played nicely with the toys and with each other. they wished they had spent more time with grandma and listened to her stories.

the rest of the day was very quiet and boring. there was no more noise and fun and laughter. there was only silence and sadness and regret. lily and ben learned a hard lesson that day. they learned that being greedy and spoiled can make you lose what you have and what you love. they learned that being happy and grateful and sharing can make you gain more than you expect. they learned that being good and respectful and loving can make you and others happy. they learned that sometimes, less is more.
lily and tom were friends who liked to play with sand. they had a big bucket and a small shovel. they wanted to make an island with sand. they filled the bucket with sand and turned it over on the ground. they made a round hill of sand.

"look, we made an island!" lily said. "but it needs something more."

"maybe we can make a palm tree with leaves and a coconut," tom said. he found a stick and some green paper. he cut the paper into leaf shapes and stuck them on the stick. he also found a brown ball and put it on the stick. he pushed the stick into the sand hill.

"wow, that looks like a real palm tree!" lily said. "but how can we get the coconut?"

tom had an idea. he climbed on the sand hill and reached for the ball. he pulled it off the stick and held it in his hands. he squeezed the ball hard.

"crack!" the ball broke into two pieces. inside, there was white stuff and water.

"look, it's a real coconut!" tom said. he gave one piece to lily and kept the other. they drank the water and ate the white stuff.

"mmm, this is yummy!" lily said. "we are successful island makers!"

they smiled and hugged each other. they were happy and proud of their island. they played with sand until it was time to go home.
ben and lily are twins. they like to play with their toys in their room. but today, mom says they have to help with the laundry. she gives them a big basket of dirty clothes and tells them to take it to the washing machine.

ben and lily do not want to do laundry. they think it is boring and hard. they want to play with their toys. they hope mom will forget about the laundry and let them play.

they walk slowly to the washing machine. they see a big pile of clean clothes on the sofa. they have an idea. they put the basket of dirty clothes on the floor and start to throw the clean clothes in the air. they pretend they are snowflakes and catch them with their hands. they laugh and have fun.

mom hears them and comes to see what they are doing. she is not happy. she sees the clean clothes all over the floor and the dirty clothes still in the basket. she says, "ben and lily, what are you doing? you are making a mess. you are supposed to do the laundry, not play with it. now you have to pick up all the clothes and put them back where they belong. and then you have to do the laundry. no more playing until you finish."

ben and lily are sad. they say, "sorry, mom. we did not want to do the laundry. we wanted to play. we thought laundry was easy. but it is not. it is hard and boring."

mom says, "i know, laundry is not fun. but it is something we have to do. it is part of being a family. we all have to help with the chores. if we do them together, they will be easier and faster. and then we can have more time to play. come on, i will help you. let's do the laundry together. and then we can play with your toys. ok?"

ben and lily nod. they say, "ok, mom. thank you. we will help you. we will do the laundry together. and then we can play."

they pick up the clothes and put them back where they belong. they take the basket of dirty clothes to the washing machine. they help mom put the clothes in and press the buttons. they watch the clothes spin and make bubbles. they think it is a little bit fun. they hope the laundry will be done soon. and then they can play.
lily and ben were best friends. they liked to play with toys and read books. they also liked to pretend they were pirates on a big ship. they had a flag with a skull and a hat with a feather.

one day, they found a shiny ring in the sand. it was gold and had a red stone. lily put it on her finger and said, "look, ben, i have a treasure!"

ben smiled and said, "you are very pretty, lily. do you want to marry me?"

lily was shy and blushed. she liked ben, but she did not know what marry meant. she asked, "what is marry?"

ben said, "marry is when you love someone and you want to be with them always. you share your toys and your books and your ship. you also give them a kiss."

lily thought for a moment. she loved ben and she wanted to be with him always. she liked to share her toys and her books and her ship. she also wanted to give him a kiss. she said, "yes, ben, i want to marry you."

they hugged and kissed. they were very happy. they put the ring in a box and buried it in the sand. they said, "this is our secret treasure. we will come back when we are big and dig it up."

they held hands and ran to their ship. they sailed away, singing and laughing. they were the best pirates ever.
sam and jen were best friends. they liked to play in the park with their toys. sam had a red car that could zoom very fast. jen had a pink bike that she could jog on. they had fun racing each other and making noises.

one day, they saw a big dog in the park. it was black and furry and had sharp teeth. it barked loud and ran after them. sam and jen were scared. they tried to get away, but the dog was faster. it caught up with sam and bit his car. the car broke into pieces and stopped zooming. sam cried and dropped his car. jen stopped her bike and ran to him.

"are you okay, sam?" jen asked. she hugged him and looked at his car. it was dead. it could not zoom anymore.

"i'm sorry, jen. i should have listened to you. you told me not to zoom too close to the dog. but i wanted to win the race. i was silly and mean." sam said. he felt bad and sorry.

"it's okay, sam. i forgive you. you are my friend. but you have to be careful and kind. the dog was angry and scared. he did not like us zooming and jogging near him. he wanted to be left alone. we have to respect other animals and people." jen said. she was wise and nice.

sam and jen learned a lesson. they said sorry to the dog and gave him a bone. the dog wagged his tail and licked their faces. he was happy and friendly. they played with him and their toys. they zoomed and jogged together, but not too fast or loud. they had fun and were safe.
anna and ben were playing with paper and scissors. they wanted to make snowflakes and stars. anna cut many shapes and showed them to ben. "look, i made a big snowflake! and a star with six points! and a heart!" she said.

ben tried to cut his paper too, but it was hard. his scissors were dull and his hands were small. he could not make any shapes. he felt sad and angry. he looked at anna's shapes and wanted them. he said to anna, "give me your shapes! they are mine!"

anna was surprised and hurt. she said, "no, they are not yours! i made them with my scissors and my paper. you are selfish, ben! you can't have everything you want!"

ben did not listen. he grabbed anna's shapes and ran away. anna cried and chased him. she wanted her shapes back. they ran around the room, knocking over toys and books. their mom heard the noise and came to see what was wrong.

she saw anna and ben fighting over the paper shapes. she was not happy. she said, "stop, both of you! what are you doing? why are you fighting over paper shapes?"

anna and ben stopped and looked at their mom. they both tried to explain. anna said, "ben took my shapes! he is selfish!" ben said, "anna has too many shapes! she won't share!"

their mom shook her head. she said, "you are both wrong. anna, you should share your shapes with ben. he is your brother and he wants to play with you. ben, you should not take anna's shapes. she worked hard to make them. you should ask her nicely if you can have some. and you should use your own scissors and paper to make your own shapes. you can both succeed if you try."

anna and ben felt sorry. they said, "we are sorry, mom. we are sorry, anna. we are sorry, ben." they hugged each other and their mom. they gave back the shapes they took and shared them. they also used their own scissors and paper to make more shapes. they had fun and learned to be kind and fair.
lily loved to watch the sky when it was stormy. she liked to see the big clouds and hear the loud thunder. sometimes, she saw bright flashes of lightning that made the sky look like a big firework. she thought lightning was very pretty and exciting.

one night, lily was in her bed and heard a big boom outside. she ran to the window and saw a perfect lightning bolt. it was long and thin and zigzagged across the sky. it was white and yellow and purple and blue. lily smiled and clapped her hands. she wanted to remember the perfect lightning bolt forever.

she ran to her desk and got a paper and a crayon. she tried to draw the lightning bolt on the paper. she made a line that went up and down and sideways. she colored it with different colors. she was very proud of her drawing. she showed it to her mom and dad and they said it was very good.

lily put her drawing on the wall next to her bed. she looked at it every night before she went to sleep. she remembered the perfect lightning bolt and how it made her feel happy and amazed. she dreamed of more lightning bolts and more storms and more beautiful skies. she loved to watch the sky when it was stormy.
lily and tom were friends who liked to play in the park. one day, they saw a big goose near the pond. the goose had a red ribbon around its neck and looked sad.

"hello, goose," lily said. "why are you sad?"

the goose honked and pointed with its wing. lily and tom followed and saw a small cage. inside the cage was another goose, also with a red ribbon. the cage was locked with a chain and a padlock.

"oh no," tom said. "someone trapped your friend. that is very mean."

the goose nodded and looked helpless. lily and tom wanted to help. they looked around and saw a big rock. they had a plan.

"maybe we can break the lock with the rock," lily said.

"good idea," tom said. "you hold the rock and i will swing it."

they worked together and smashed the lock with the rock. the cage opened and the other goose came out. the two geese hugged and thanked lily and tom.

"you are welcome," lily said. "we are happy to help."

the geese gave lily and tom their red ribbons as a gift. then they flew away, honking happily. lily and tom smiled and waved goodbye. they were proud of their plan and their kindness.
lily was a shy girl who liked to play with puzzles. she had many puzzles with animals, cars, and flowers. she could solve them very fast and make nice pictures.

one day, she got a new puzzle from her grandma. it was a big puzzle with a zoom. a zoom was a thing that could fly in the sky and make loud noises. lily had never seen a zoom before. she was curious and excited.

she opened the box and took out the pieces. she tried to find the corners and the edges. she looked at the picture on the box. it was a zoom with red and blue stripes. it had wings and a tail and a nose.

lily started to solve the puzzle. she found the pieces that matched the colors and the shapes. she worked hard and had fun. she did not notice that her brother max came into the room.

max was not shy. he liked to play with balls and cars and trucks. he saw lily's puzzle and wanted to play too. he grabbed some pieces and tried to fit them in. he did not look at the picture. he did not care about the zoom.

lily was angry. she said, "no, max, that is not right. you are messing up my puzzle. go away and play with your own toys."

max did not listen. he said, "i want to play with the zoom. it is cool. let me help you."

he pushed some pieces and broke the puzzle. lily cried. she said, "you are mean, max. you ruined my puzzle. i don't want to play with you."

max felt sorry. he said, "i'm sorry, lily. i did not mean to hurt you. i just wanted to play with you. can we fix the puzzle together?"

lily stopped crying. she said, "ok, max, but you have to be careful and follow the picture. the zoom is not easy to solve. it has many pieces and details."

max nodded. he said, "ok, lily, i will be careful and follow the picture. the zoom is hard to solve. but it is also fun and pretty."

they hugged and smiled. they worked together and solved the puzzle. they made the zoom fly in the sky and make loud noises. they were happy and proud. they showed their puzzle to their grandma and said, "look, grandma, we solved the zoom. it is a gift from you. thank you, grandma."

grandma smiled and said, "you are welcome, my dears. you did a great job. i'm glad you solved the zoom. and i'm glad you played together. you are a good team."
anna was a lonely girl. she had no friends to play with at school. she liked to draw and read, but the other kids said she was boring. anna felt sad and wished she had someone to comfort her.

one day, anna's mom took her to the zoo. anna loved to see the animals, but she was still lonely. she saw a big kangaroo with a baby in her pouch. the baby kangaroo looked happy and cozy. anna wanted to hug the kangaroo and be her friend.

"mom, can i go near the kangaroo?" anna asked.

"no, sweetie, the kangaroo might be scared of you. you have to stay behind the fence," mom said.

anna felt disappointed. she watched the kangaroo from afar and imagined how nice it would be to cuddle with her. she drew a picture of the kangaroo and the baby on her notebook.

suddenly, she heard a noise. she looked up and saw that the baby kangaroo had jumped out of the pouch and was hopping towards her. anna was surprised and excited. she smiled and reached out her hand.

"hello, little kangaroo. do you want to be my friend?" anna said.

the baby kangaroo sniffed anna's hand and licked it. he made a soft sound and rubbed his head against her arm. anna felt warm and happy. she gently stroked the baby kangaroo's fur and whispered, "you are so cute and soft. i like you very much."

the baby kangaroo seemed to like anna too. he stayed with her and played with her notebook. he even let anna hold him in her lap. anna felt comforted and not lonely anymore.

the mom kangaroo watched them from a distance. she was not angry or worried. she knew that anna was a kind and gentle girl. she was glad that her baby had found a friend. she smiled and nodded at anna.

anna smiled back and waved at the mom kangaroo. she thanked her for letting her play with her baby. she said, "you are a good mom. your baby is lucky to have you."

anna and the baby kangaroo had a wonderful time together. they shared stories and drawings and laughs. they hugged and kissed each other goodbye. anna promised to come back and visit them again. she felt happy and grateful. she had found a friend.
sara and tom are playing in the kitchen. they see many dishes on the table. some dishes are clean and some dishes are dirty. sara wants to help mom and dad. she picks up a clean dish and puts it in the cupboard.

"good job, sara!" tom says. he points to a dirty dish. "can i help too?"

sara nods. "yes, you can. but be careful. the dirty dish is wet and slippery. you have to hold it with both hands."

tom tries to hold the dirty dish with both hands. but he is not careful. he drops the dirty dish on the floor. it breaks into many pieces. tom is scared. he starts to cry.

"oh no, tom!" sara says. she runs to him and hugs him. "it's okay. it was an accident. don't cry."

mom and dad hear the noise. they come to the kitchen. they see the broken dish and the crying tom. they are not angry. they are kind.

"what happened here?" mom asks.

"sara and i wanted to help. but i dropped the dirty dish. i'm sorry." tom says.

"it's okay, tom. we know you wanted to help. thank you for trying. but next time, please ask us first. we don't want you to get hurt." dad says.

he picks up tom and kisses him. mom picks up sara and kisses her. they clean up the mess together. they tell sara and tom that they love them. sara and tom are happy. they love mom and dad too.
lily and ben were playing with their toys in the living room. lily had a pair of scissors and some paper. she liked to cut out shapes and glue them together. ben had a box of crayons and a big book. he liked to color and draw.

"look, lily, i made a car!" ben said, showing his picture. "it has four wheels and a door and a window."

"that's nice, ben," lily said, not looking up. "i made a flower. it has five petals and a stem and a leaf."

"can you count the petals?" ben asked, curious.

"of course i can," lily said, proud. "one, two, three, four, five. see?"

"wow, you're good at counting," ben said, impressed. "can you count the wheels on my car?"

"sure," lily said, glancing at his picture. "one, two, three, four. there."

"can you count the scissors?" ben asked, pointing at her tool.

"that's easy," lily said, smiling. "one."

"can you count the scissors now?" ben asked, grabbing another pair of scissors from the drawer.

lily frowned. "that's not fair, ben. you can't change the number of scissors."

"why not?" ben asked, giggling. "it's fun."

"no, it's not," lily said, annoyed. "it's cheating. counting is only fun when the number stays the same."

"fine," ben said, putting the scissors back. "let's count something else then. how about the books on the shelf?"

lily looked at the shelf. there were many books of different sizes and colors. she felt a bit nervous. "that's too hard, ben. there are too many books to count."

"no, it's not," ben said, confident. "i can count them. watch me."

he started to point at each book and say a number. "one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten, eleven, twelve, thirteen, fourteen, fifteen, sixteen, seventeen, eighteen, nineteen, twenty, twenty-one, twenty-two, twenty-three, twenty-four, twenty-five, twenty-six, twenty-seven, twenty-eight, twenty-nine, thirty, thirty-one, thirty-two, thirty-three, thirty-four, thirty-five, thirty-six, thirty-seven, thirty-eight, thirty-nine, forty, forty-one, forty-two, forty-three, forty-four, forty-five, forty-six, forty-seven, forty-eight, forty-nine, fifty!"

he stopped and smiled. "there are fifty books on the shelf, lily. i counted them all."

lily was amazed. she clapped her hands. "wow, ben, you're amazing. you can count so high. how did you learn to count so well?"

ben shrugged. "i don't know. i just like to count things. it's fun."

lily nodded. she wanted to learn to count like ben. she looked around the room and saw something enormous. she had an idea.

"ben, can you count the sofa?" she asked, pointing at the big piece of furniture.

ben looked at the sofa. he scratched his head. he wasn't sure how to count it.

"the sofa?" he repeated. "how do you count the sofa?"

lily smiled. she had found something that ben couldn't count. she felt clever.

"you can count the cushions," she said, "or the legs, or the buttons, or the stitches, or the hairs, or the dust, or the crumbs, or the coins, or the bugs, or the..."

ben interrupted her. he didn't like her idea. he thought it was silly.

"stop, lily, stop," he said, shaking his head. "that's not counting. that's nonsense. counting is only fun when the things are clear and simple. not when they are enormous and messy."

lily pouted. she thought her idea was fun. she wanted to challenge ben.

"fine," she said, crossing her arms. "then let's count something else. how about the stars in the sky?"

ben looked out the window. it was dark outside. he saw many bright dots in the black. he felt a bit scared. he didn't want to count them.

"the stars?" he whispered. "but there are too many stars to count, lily. they never end. they go on and on and on."

lily smiled. she had found something that ben couldn't count. she felt brave.

"come on, ben," she said, pulling his hand. "let's go outside and try. it will be fun."

ben hesitated. he didn't want to go outside. he wanted to stay inside and count things he knew.

lily and tom were twins who liked to look at the stars at night. they had a big window in their room where they could see the sky. sometimes they saw a shooting star and made a wish.

one night, they saw a very bright star that was bigger than the others. they wondered what it was and wanted to know more. they asked their mom, who was reading a book in the living room.

"mom, mom, what is that big star?" they said, running to her.

"that is not a star, my loves. that is the moon. it is very far away, but sometimes it looks bigger and brighter. it is called a full moon," mom explained.

"wow, the moon is so pretty. can we go there?" lily asked.

"no, we cannot go there. it is too far and too cold. but we can look at it and enjoy its light," mom said.

"can we touch it?" tom asked.

"no, we cannot touch it. it is too high and too hard. but we can imagine how it feels and what it is made of," mom said.

lily and tom were very curious and had many questions. they kept asking mom about the moon and the stars. mom was very patient and answered them as best as she could. she was happy to see them interested in the sky.

but soon it was time for bed. mom told them to brush their teeth and put on their pajamas. lily and tom did not want to stop looking at the moon. they begged mom to let them stay up a little longer.

"please, mom, please. just five more minutes. we want to see the moon," they said.

"sorry, my loves, but you have to go to bed now. it is late and you need to sleep. the moon will be there tomorrow night, too. and maybe you will see a shooting star and make a wish," mom said.

lily and tom were not happy. they did not want to miss the moon. they started to scream and cry. they threw a tantrum and kicked their feet.

"stop, stop, stop. that is enough. you are being very naughty and rude. you have to listen to mom and do as i say. go to bed now, or you will be in trouble," mom said, sternly.

lily and tom realized they had gone too far. they saw mom's angry face and heard her loud voice. they felt scared and sorry. they stopped screaming and crying. they said sorry to mom and gave her a hug.

"sorry, mom. we love you. we love the moon, too. but we love you more," they said.

mom smiled and hugged them back. she was not angry anymore. she was glad they apologized and calmed down. she kissed them good night and tucked them in.

"good night, my loves. i love you, too. i love the moon, too. but i love you more," she said.

she turned off the light and left the room. lily and tom closed their eyes and fell asleep. they dreamed of the moon and the stars. and they hoped to see a shooting star and make a wish.
lily and ben are playing in the park. they see a big brown dog. the dog is friendly and wags its tail. lily and ben want to pet the dog.

"hello, dog!" lily says. she reaches out her arm to touch the dog's fur. the dog licks her hand and makes a happy sound.

"can i pet him too?" ben asks. he moves closer to the dog. the dog looks at him and blinks. ben thinks the dog is cute and funny.

"sure, you can pet him," lily says. she smiles at ben. they both stroke the dog's back and ears. the dog enjoys the attention and rolls over on the grass.

"who are you, dog?" ben wonders. he looks at the dog's collar. there is a tag with a name and a phone number. the name is max.

"his name is max," lily reads. she can read some words. she points at the tag. "and this is his phone number. he has a home and a family."

"maybe he got lost," ben says. he feels sorry for max. he hopes his family will find him soon.

"let's call his family," lily says. she has an idea. she runs to the bench where their mom is sitting. she asks for her mom's phone. she tells her mom about max.

"good idea, lily," mom says. she is proud of lily and ben. she takes the phone and dials the number on the tag. she talks to someone on the phone. she tells them where they are and that they found max.

soon, a car arrives at the park. a man and a woman get out of the car. they look happy and relieved. they run to max and hug him.

"max, we missed you so much!" the woman says. she kisses max on the nose. "thank you for finding him," she says to lily, ben and mom.

"you're welcome," lily, ben and mom say. they are glad that max is safe and reunited with his family.

"can we play with max again?" lily asks.

"of course, you can," the man says. he smiles at lily and ben. "max loves to play with new friends. maybe we can come to the park again sometime."

"that would be nice," lily and ben say. they wave goodbye to max and his family. they watch them drive away. they are happy that they helped max. they go back to playing in the park.
tim and sam were two squirrels who liked to play in the park. they had a big tree where they stored their nuts for winter. one day, they decided to organize their nuts by size and color. they made piles of big nuts, small nuts, brown nuts, and green nuts.

"look, tim, we have so many nuts!" sam said. "we are very smart and hard-working."

"yes, we are, sam. and we are very lucky, too. no one can take our nuts away from us," tim said.

but they did not see that a naughty crow was watching them from another tree. the crow was hungry and greedy. he wanted to eat their nuts. he waited until tim and sam went to look for more nuts. then he flew down and started to peck at their piles.

"yum, yum, these nuts are delicious!" the crow said. "i will eat them all and leave nothing for the squirrels."

but tim and sam came back soon. they saw the crow eating their nuts. they were very angry and sad.

"hey, you, stop that!" tim shouted. "those are our nuts! we worked hard to find them and organize them!"

"too bad, squirrels. i am bigger and stronger than you. i can eat whatever i want," the crow said. he laughed and pecked at another nut.

tim and sam did not know what to do. they were too small to fight the crow. they needed help. they looked around and saw their friends, the rabbits, the mice, and the birds. they called them and told them what happened.

"help us, please! the naughty crow is stealing our nuts!" tim and sam said.

their friends were kind and brave. they came to help them. they made a loud noise and scared the crow away. they helped tim and sam pick up their nuts and put them back in their tree.

"thank you, friends. you are very good and helpful," tim and sam said.

"you are welcome, squirrels. we are happy to help you. we are all friends in the park," their friends said.

tim and sam learned a lesson. they learned that it is good to organize their nuts, but it is also good to share them with their friends. they learned that being greedy and selfish is naughty and wrong. they learned that being kind and generous is good and right. they learned that friends are more important than nuts.
ben was sad. he wanted to go to the park with mom and dad, but they said no. they said it was too cold and wet outside. ben did not like cold and wet. he liked sun and fun.

ben looked out the window. he saw a little bug on the glass. it was an inch. it had six legs and a long body. it was brown and black. ben liked inch. he wanted to play with it.

ben opened the window. he put his hand out. he said, "hello, inch. do you want to be my friend?" the inch did not say anything. it just walked on the glass. ben tried to touch it, but it was too fast. it walked away from ben's hand.

ben was sad again. he said, "please, inch. don't go. stay with me. we can have fun." the inch did not listen. it walked to the edge of the window. it found a small hole. it crawled through the hole. it was gone.

ben cried. he said, "bye, inch. i miss you. come back soon." he closed the window. he went to his bed. he hugged his teddy bear. he hoped the inch would come back. he hoped the sun would come out. he hoped he could go to the park. he hoped he would be happy.
tom and lily were playing with their toy trucks in the garden. they had a big pile of sand and some boards to make ramps and bridges. they liked to load their trucks with sand and drive them over the boards.

"look, lily, i can load more sand than you!" tom said. he filled his truck with so much sand that it was very heavy. he tried to drive it over a board, but the board broke in half. the truck and the sand fell to the ground.

"oh no, tom, you broke the board!" lily said. she was sad because they had only two boards left. "why did you load so much sand?"

"because i wanted to show you how strong i am," tom said. he was sorry that he broke the board. he knew that lily liked to play with the boards too.

"but tom, being strong is not only about loading a lot of sand," lily said. "being strong is also about being kind and sharing with others. if you load less sand, we can both play with the boards and have more fun."

tom thought about what lily said. he realized that she was right. he said, "i'm sorry, lily, you are very smart. i will load less sand and share the boards with you. can we still be friends?"

"of course, tom, we are always friends," lily said. she smiled and gave him a hug. they picked up the broken board and the sand and put them away. then they took their trucks and the other boards and played together happily. they learned that being strong is not only about how much you can load, but also about how much you can love.
sam was a horse who lived on a farm. he liked to run and jump and play with his friends. he also liked to eat hay, which was his food. hay was soft and sweet and filled his belly.

one day, a big truck came to the farm. it had a lot of hay in the back. sam was happy to see the hay. he thought it was for him and his friends. he ran to the truck and tried to get some hay. but the truck driver was not nice. he shouted at sam and hit him with a stick. he said the hay was not for him. he said the hay was for other horses who were tough and strong and could work hard.

sam was sad and hurt. he did not understand why the truck driver was so mean. he did not want to work hard. he just wanted to have fun and eat hay. he ran away from the truck and looked for his friends. but he could not find them. he saw that the truck driver had put them in a cage. he had taken them away from the farm. he had included them in the hay.

sam was scared and lonely. he did not know what to do. he wanted his friends back. he wanted to eat hay with them. he wanted to run and jump and play with them. but he could not. he was left alone on the farm. he had no hay, no friends, and no fun. he had a bad ending.
anna loved her doll very much. she named her doll lily and played with her every day. lily had a pink dress, blue eyes and long hair. anna liked to brush her hair and make her look pretty.

one day, anna and lily went outside to play in the garden. anna was very enthusiastic and ran around with lily in her arms. she saw a big tree and wanted to climb it. she put lily on a branch and tried to go higher. but she slipped and fell down. she hurt her knee and it bled. she cried and picked up lily. but lily was hurt too. her dress was torn and her hair was dirty. anna felt very sad.

she ran inside the house and showed her mom her knee and lily. her mom hugged her and said, "don't worry, anna. we can heal your knee and lily. let me get a band-aid and some water." she cleaned anna's knee and put a band-aid on it. she said, "there, now your knee will feel better soon. and we can wash lily's dress and hair and sew her dress. she will look pretty again."

anna smiled and said, "thank you, mom. you are the best. can i help you heal lily?" her mom nodded and said, "of course, you can. you are a good helper. let's go to the bathroom and get some soap and a towel." they went to the bathroom and washed lily's dress and hair. they dried her with a towel and combed her hair. then they went to the living room and sewed her dress. anna held the needle and thread and followed her mom's instructions. she said, "i'm sorry, lily. i didn't mean to hurt you. i love you very much." she kissed lily and hugged her.

her mom smiled and said, "you did a great job, anna. lily looks beautiful again. and i'm sure she loves you too. you are a good friend to her. now, why don't you go and play with her in your room? and be careful when you climb the tree next time." anna nodded and said, "okay, mom. i will. thank you for helping me heal lily. you are the best mom ever." she took lily and ran to her room. she was happy and enthusiastic again. she played with lily and told her stories. she said, "lily, you are my favorite doll. and we are both healed now. we are both happy." lily smiled and nodded. they were both happy.
tom was a mechanic who liked to fix cars. he had a big garage with many tools and parts. he worked hard every day and helped many people with their car problems.

one day, a lady came to his garage with a red car. she said her car was making a loud noise and asked tom to check it. tom opened the hood of the car and saw a broken belt. he told the lady he could fix it, but it would cost some money. the lady said she did not have much money and asked tom to lower the price. tom said no, he had to charge the fair amount for his work.

the lady was angry and said tom was greedy and mean. she said she would find another mechanic who would do it for less. she drove away in her noisy car, leaving tom feeling bitter and sad.

the next day, tom heard a loud crash outside his garage. he ran out and saw the red car smashed into a tree. the lady was hurt and bleeding. tom called for help and ran to the lady. he asked her what happened. she said her car broke down and she lost control. she said she was sorry for being rude to tom and wished she had listened to him.

tom felt sorry for the lady and helped her until the ambulance came. he told her he forgave her and hoped she would get better soon. he learned that being bitter and angry did not help anyone. he decided to be more kind and patient with his customers, even if they were not nice to him. he realized that being a good mechanic was not only about fixing cars, but also about caring for people.
ben and lily were playing with their toys in the living room. they liked to pretend they were animals and make noises. ben was a lion and lily was a mouse.

"roar!" ben said, jumping out from behind the couch. "i am a big and strong lion. i will catch you, little mouse!"

lily squeaked and ran away. she hid under the table and looked for something to protect herself. she saw a pin on the floor. it was shiny and sharp.

"roar!" ben said again, crawling towards the table. "where are you, little mouse? i can smell you!"

lily held the pin in her paw and waited. when ben poked his head under the table, she jabbed him with the pin.

"ow!" ben cried, pulling back his head. "that hurt! what did you do, little mouse?"

lily came out from under the table and showed him the pin. "i poked you with this. it is a pin. it can make holes in things. you scared me, big lion. you made me frightened."

ben rubbed his head and looked at the pin. he felt sorry for lily. he did not want to hurt her or make her frightened. he wanted to play with her and have fun.

"i am sorry, little mouse," he said. "i was only pretending. i did not mean to scare you. can we be friends?"

lily smiled and nodded. she gave him the pin and hugged him. "we can be friends, big lion. but no more roaring, okay?"

"okay," ben said. "no more roaring. how about we pretend we are something else? something nice and friendly?"

lily thought for a moment. then she said, "how about we pretend we are birds? we can fly and sing and make nests."

ben liked that idea. he agreed. they put away their toys and flapped their arms. they pretended they were birds and flew and sang and made nests. they had fun and did not frighten each other. they were happy.
ben and mia were best friends. they liked to play together every day. they had a secret fort in the garden, where they kept their toys and snacks. one day, they found a jar of jam in the fort. it was red and shiny and looked yummy.

"can we eat the jam?" mia asked.

"i don't know. maybe it is mom's jam. she might get mad if we take it," ben said.

"but i'm hungry. and the jam looks so good. please, ben, can we have some?" mia begged.

ben looked at the jam. he was hungry too. and he wanted to make mia happy. he was a loyal friend. he decided to try to open the jar.

he grabbed the lid and twisted it hard. but it did not move. he twisted it again and again, but it was too tight. he felt his hand hurt.

"ow! it's too hard. i can't open it," he said.

"let me try," mia said. she took the jar from ben and twisted the lid. but she was too weak. she could not open it either.

they looked at each other. they were sad. they wanted the jam so much.

then they heard a bark. it was rex, their dog. he ran to them and wagged his tail. he smelled the jam and licked his lips.

"hi, rex. do you want some jam too?" ben asked.

rex barked again. he was a smart dog. he knew what to do. he took the jar in his mouth and ran to a big rock. he smashed the jar on the rock and broke it. the jam spilled out.

"wow! rex did it! he opened the jam!" mia exclaimed.

"good boy, rex! you are a loyal friend too!" ben praised.

they ran to the rock and thanked rex. they shared the jam with him. they ate it with their fingers and licked their lips. it was sweet and sticky and delicious.

they were happy. they had jam and they had friends. they did not care if mom got mad. they had the best day ever.
tom and lily are twins. they like to play in the bath with their toys. they have a boat, a duck, a fish and a frog. they make bubbles with the soap and splash each other.

one day, they see a new soap on the shelf. it is big and round and has a picture of a star on it. they wonder what it is.

"can we use the new soap?" tom asks lily.

"i don't know. maybe it is not for us. maybe it is for mom or dad." lily says.

they decide to discuss it with their toys. they ask the boat, the duck, the fish and the frog what they think.

the boat says, "the new soap is too big for me. i like the small soap that makes me slippery and fast."

the duck says, "the new soap is too round for me. i like the flat soap that i can quack on and make noise."

the fish says, "the new soap is too dry for me. i like the wet soap that i can swim in and make bubbles."

the frog says, "the new soap is too shiny for me. i like the dull soap that i can hide in and surprise you."

tom and lily listen to their toys. they think they are smart. they agree that the new soap is not for them. they put it back on the shelf and use the old soap that they like. they have fun in the bath with their toys. they are happy.
tom and anna are friends. they like to play in the park. one day, they find a big ball. it is red and shiny. they want to roll the ball.

"let's roll the ball to the slide!" tom says.

"ok!" anna says.

they roll the ball to the slide. the ball is heavy. they push and push. they are happy. they reach the slide.

"wow, look!" anna says.

she sees something on the ball. it is a message. it is written with white paint. it says: "hello, i am bob. i hope you have fun with my ball. be nice and share it with others."

"who is bob?" tom asks.

"i don't know. maybe he is the one who left the ball here." anna says.

"maybe he is nice. he gave us his ball." tom says.

"yes, he is nice. and we are nice too. we can share the ball with other kids." anna says.

they smile. they roll the ball down the slide. they hear a laugh. it is bob. he is hiding behind a tree. he is happy. he made new friends.
lily and anna are sisters. lily is big and anna is little. they like to play together in the park. they swing on the swings, slide on the slide, and run on the grass.

one day, they see a big dog in the park. the dog is brown and fluffy. it has a long tail and a wet nose. the dog runs to lily and anna and licks their faces. lily and anna laugh and pet the dog.

"hello, doggy!" lily says. "what is your name?"

the dog barks and wags its tail. it likes lily and anna.

"his name is max," a voice says. lily and anna look up and see a boy. the boy is holding a leash. he is the dog's owner.

"hi, i'm lily and this is anna," lily says. "we like your dog. he is very friendly."

"hi, i'm ben," the boy says. "max likes you too. do you want to play with him?"

"yes, please!" anna says. she smiles and hugs the dog.

lily, anna, ben, and max play together in the park. they have a lot of fun. they are happy and smile a lot. they make new friends.
sam and ben are playing in the park. they have a toy gun that makes a loud noise. sam likes to pretend he is a cowboy and ben is a robber. they run and hide behind the trees and the swings.

"bang, bang, you are dead, robber!" sam shouts, pointing the gun at ben.

"no, i am not, cowboy! you missed me!" ben shouts back, dodging the gun.

they laugh and play some more. but then, a big boy comes and sees the gun. he wants to play with it too. he runs to sam and grabs the gun from his hand.

"hey, give me that! it is mine!" sam says, angry.

"no, it is mine now! you are too small to play with it!" the big boy says, angry too.

he pushes sam to the ground and runs away with the gun. sam cries and ben runs to help him.

"that is not nice! he is a bully!" ben says, sad.

they look at the big boy, who is playing with the gun by himself. he does not look happy. he looks lonely.

"maybe he has no friends to play with," sam says, wiping his tears.

"maybe we can share the gun with him," ben says, smiling.

they get up and walk to the big boy. they ask him if he wants to play with them. the big boy is surprised. he does not know what to say.

"really? you want to play with me?" he says, unsure.

"yes, we do. we can take turns with the gun. it is more fun to play together," sam says, friendly.

the big boy smiles. he gives the gun back to sam and says sorry. he says his name is tom. they shake hands and become friends. they play cowboys and robbers together. they have a lot of fun. they are not angry anymore. they are happy.
lily and ben were twins who liked to play in the woods. they had a cabin made of sticks and leaves where they kept their toys and snacks. one day, they decided to march to the cabin like soldiers.

"left, right, left, right!" lily shouted as she led the way. ben followed her with a stick in his hand. they marched over rocks and logs, through bushes and flowers, until they reached the cabin.

"here we are!" lily said. "let's have a picnic!" she opened the door and saw a big surprise. a squirrel was inside the cabin, eating their nuts and berries.

"hey, get out of here!" ben yelled. he waved his stick at the squirrel. the squirrel was not scared. it was persistent. it kept eating and chattering.

lily and ben tried to chase the squirrel away, but it was too fast and clever. it ran around the cabin, under the bed, over the table, and behind the curtain. it made a big mess.

"stop it, stop it!" lily and ben cried. they were tired and hungry. they wished the squirrel would leave.

then they had an idea. they found some acorns outside the cabin and made a trail. they hoped the squirrel would follow the acorns and go away.

"come on, squirrel, follow the acorns!" lily and ben said. they watched as the squirrel sniffed the air and saw the acorns. it jumped out of the cabin and followed the trail.

"bye, bye, squirrel!" lily and ben said. they were happy. they went back to the cabin and cleaned up the mess. then they had their picnic and played with their toys. they had fun in the woods.
ben and lily liked to play with their toys in their room. they had many toys, but their favorite ones were the blocks. they could make many things with the blocks, like houses, cars, and animals. they had a big shelf where they kept their blocks and other toys.

one day, they decided to make a big tower with their blocks. they wanted to make the tallest tower ever. they took all the blocks from the shelf and started to attach them together. they made the tower higher and higher, until it reached the ceiling.

"wow, look at our tower!" ben said. "it is so big and original!"

"yes, it is amazing!" lily said. "let's show it to mom and dad!"

they ran out of the room to find their parents. they wanted to make them proud of their tower. they did not see that their tower was not very stable. some of the blocks were loose and wobbly.

when they were gone, the tower started to shake. it leaned to one side, then to the other. it could not stand anymore. it fell down with a loud crash. it hit the shelf and made it fall too. the shelf and the tower broke into many pieces. the blocks and the other toys scattered all over the floor.

when ben and lily came back with their parents, they saw the mess. they were shocked and sad. their tower was gone. their shelf was broken. their toys were ruined.

"oh no, what happened?" mom asked.

"our tower fell down!" ben cried.

"and it broke our shelf and our toys!" lily sobbed.

mom and dad were angry and disappointed. they scolded ben and lily for being careless and wasteful. they told them to clean up the mess and to go to bed without dinner. they took away their blocks and said they could not play with them for a long time.

ben and lily felt very sorry and ashamed. they wished they had not made such a big tower. they wished they had been more careful and respectful. they learned a hard lesson that day. they never forgot it.
tom and lily were playing in the garden. they saw a big red flower. it was very pretty.

"can i touch it?" lily asked tom.

tom shook his head. "no, lily. that is a burn flower. it can hurt you."

lily was curious. she wanted to know more. "why does it burn?" she asked.

tom shrugged. "i don't know. mama said it is a burn flower. she said we should stay away from it."

lily nodded. she did not want to get hurt. but she still liked the flower. it was very bright and shiny.

"can we look at it?" she asked.

tom smiled. he liked lily. she was his best friend. she was very adorable.

"okay, we can look at it. but we have to be careful. we have to stay far away from it."

tom and lily walked slowly to the flower. they did not touch it. they just looked at it.

they saw a little bee. it was flying around the flower. it was very busy.

"look, tom. a bee!" lily said.

tom looked. he saw the bee. he was not afraid of bees. he liked bees. they made honey.

"hello, bee!" tom said.

the bee heard tom. it flew to him. it landed on his nose.

tom giggled. he felt the bee tickle his nose.

lily laughed. she thought tom was very funny.

the bee was friendly. it did not sting tom. it just said hello.

then it flew away. it went back to the flower.

tom and lily waved to the bee. they said goodbye.

they were happy. they had a new friend.

they decided to name the flower bee flower. they thought it was a better name than burn flower.

they went back to their toys. they played some more.

they had a lot of fun in the garden.
ben and lily were very hot and thirsty. they had been walking in the sand for a long time. they wanted to find water and shade. they saw a big hill in front of them. ben said, "maybe there is something good behind the hill. let's go and see."

they climbed the hill and looked down. they saw a green place with trees and a pond. they ran down the hill and into the green place. they felt happy and cool. they drank some water and ate some fruits. they said, "this is an oasis. it is a new and nice place for us."

but they did not know that someone else lived in the oasis. it was a big and mean lion. he saw ben and lily and wanted to eat them. he hid behind a tree and waited for them to come closer. he acted like he was not there.

ben and lily saw a big and soft bed of grass. they wanted to rest and sleep. they walked towards the bed of grass. they did not see the lion. the lion got ready to jump on them.

but then they heard a loud roar. it was another lion. he was bigger and stronger than the first lion. he lived on the other side of the oasis. he did not like the first lion. he wanted to chase him away. he ran towards the first lion and attacked him.
