ben and lily heard the roar and saw the lions. they were scared and ran away. they climbed the hill and looked back. they saw the lions fighting and biting. they said, "the oasis is not a safe place for us. let's go and find another place." they left the oasis and walked in the sand again. they hoped to find a better place.
lily and ben are twins. they like to play in the park. there is a big slide in the park. lily and ben want to go on the slide.

but the slide is too high for them. they cannot reach the ladder. they try to jump, but they fall. they are sad.

"let's climb the tree!" ben says. he has an idea. he sees a tree next to the slide. the tree has many branches.

"ok!" lily says. she likes to climb. they run to the tree. they grab the branches. they pull themselves up. they climb higher and higher.

they reach the top of the tree. they can see the slide. they can see the whole park. they are happy.

"look, lily, we are so high!" ben says.

"yes, ben, we are!" lily says.

they smile at each other. they are proud. they have fun in the tree. they forget about the slide.
tom and mia like to play in the park. they have a ball and a frisbee. they throw them to each other and catch them. they have fun.

one day, they see a big puddle in the park. it is wet and muddy. tom and mia want to jump in it. they run to the puddle and splash in it. they laugh and get wet.

but then, they see a police car in the park. it is shiny and blue. it has a siren and a light. the police car stops near the puddle. a police man gets out of the car. he is not happy.

he sees tom and mia in the puddle. he says, "what are you doing? you are making a mess. you are not allowed to play in the puddle. you have to go home and get dry."

tom and mia are scared. they say, "we are sorry, police man. we just wanted to have fun. we did not know we could not play in the puddle."

the police man says, "it is okay. i know you did not mean to be bad. but you have to be careful. the puddle is dirty and can make you sick. and you can get hurt if you slip and fall. next time, play somewhere else."

tom and mia nod. they say, "thank you, police man. we will do that." they pick up their ball and frisbee. they run to their mom and dad. they tell them what happened. they go home and get dry. they learn their lesson.
sam liked to study golf. he watched his dad play golf on tv and learned the names of the clubs and the holes. he also had a toy golf set that he played with in the yard. he wanted to be a good golfer like his dad.

one day, his dad said, "sam, do you want to come with me to the golf course? i have a lesson with the coach and you can watch and learn."

sam was very happy and said, "yes, dad, i want to go!"

they got in the car and drove to the golf course. sam saw many people playing golf and hitting the ball with different clubs. he also saw the coach, who was a tall and friendly man. he said hello to sam and his dad and gave them some tips.

"sam, do you want to try hitting the ball?" the coach asked.

sam nodded and took a small club from his toy set. he put the ball on the ground and swung the club. but he missed the ball and fell down. he felt embarrassed and sad.

the coach and his dad helped him up and said, "don't worry, sam, it's okay. golf is hard and you need to practice a lot. you are doing great for your age. just keep studying and trying and you will get better."

sam felt better and said, "thank you, coach, thank you, dad. i will keep studying and trying. i want to be a dependable golfer like you."

the coach and his dad smiled and said, "you are welcome, sam. we are proud of you. you are a dependable son and a good learner. you have a bright future in golf."

sam hugged them and said, "i love you, coach, i love you, dad. you are the best teachers."

the moral of the story is: study hard, try your best, and don't give up. you will learn from your mistakes and improve your skills. you will also earn the respect and love of your teachers and parents.
tim and lily are friends. they like to play in the park. they see a big circle on the grass. it is made of stones.

"let's run around the circle!" tim says.

"ok!" lily says. they hold hands and run. they run fast and slow. they run inside and outside the circle. they laugh and have fun.

they see a dog. the dog is brown and furry. the dog runs to them. he wants to play too.

"hello, dog!" tim says. he pets the dog. the dog licks his face.

"can we keep him?" lily asks.

"i don't know," tim says. "maybe we can ask his owner."

they look around. they see a man. the man is holding a leash. the leash is for the dog.

"is this your dog?" tim asks the man.

"yes, he is. his name is spot. he likes to run and play," the man says.

"he is a nice dog. we like him," lily says.

"i'm glad you do. he likes you too. do you want to play with him for a while?" the man asks.

"yes, please!" tim and lily say.

they play with spot and the man. they run and throw a ball. they make a new friend. they are very glad.
sara and ben were playing in the living room. they liked to pretend they were grown-ups. sara found an empty ashtray on the table. she thought it was a hat. she put it on her head and said, "look at me, ben! i'm a princess!"

ben laughed. he saw a book on the shelf. he thought it was a treasure map. he took it and said, "look at me, sara! i'm a pirate!" he opened the book and pointed at a picture. "this is where the gold is!"

sara and ben decided to go on an adventure. they walked around the room, looking for clues. they bumped into a lamp and made it fall. they heard a loud noise and saw a flash. they smelled something bad. they saw smoke coming from the lamp.

"uh-oh," sara said. "we broke the lamp!"

"run!" ben said. "it's a fire!"

they ran to the door and tried to open it. it was locked. they started to cry. they were scared.

"help!" sara shouted. "help!"

"help!" ben echoed. "help!"

mom and dad heard their cries. they ran to the living room. they saw the smoke and the broken lamp. they saw sara and ben by the door. they unlocked the door and opened it. they hugged sara and ben and took them outside.

"are you okay?" mom asked. "what happened?"

"we were playing," sara said. "we didn't mean to break the lamp."

"we were sorry," ben said. "we were afraid."

mom and dad looked at the empty ashtray on sara's head and the book in ben's hand. they smiled. they were glad sara and ben were safe.

"it's okay," dad said. "we know you were playing. but you have to be careful. lamps are not toys. they can be dangerous."

"and ashtrays are not hats," mom said. "they are for grown-ups who smoke. smoking is bad for you. you should never touch an ashtray."

sara and ben nodded. they took off the ashtray and the book. they said they were sorry again. they said they would not play with lamps and ashtrays anymore.

mom and dad kissed them and said they loved them. they said they would clean up the mess and fix the lamp. they said they would read them a story later.

sara and ben smiled. they loved mom and dad. they were happy. they learned a lesson. they went to play with their toys. they did not raise any more trouble.
lily was a daughter who loved flowers. she liked to smell them, touch them, and look at their colors. she had a garden with many flowers, but her favorite was the rose. she waited for the rose to bloom every spring.

one day, she saw a bud on the rose. she was very happy and ran to tell her mom. "mom, mom, look! the rose is going to bloom soon!" she said. her mom smiled and hugged her. "that's wonderful, lily. the rose is a very delicate flower. you have to be gentle with it and give it water and sun."

lily nodded and ran back to the garden. she watched the bud every day, hoping to see a petal. she talked to the rose and sang to it. she watered it and shaded it from the hot sun. she was very careful not to hurt it.

one morning, she woke up and ran to the garden. she gasped when she saw the rose. it had bloomed! it was a beautiful pink color, with soft and smooth petals. it smelled sweet and fresh. lily was so happy, she clapped her hands and danced around. "you did it, rose! you bloomed! you are the most beautiful flower in the world!" she said.

the rose seemed to smile at her. it whispered in her ear, "thank you, lily. you are the best friend a flower could have. you helped me bloom with your love and care. you are the most beautiful daughter in the world." lily hugged the rose gently and kissed it. she felt the rose hug her back and kiss her. they were both very happy.
tom is a curious cat. he likes to explore new places and find new things. one day, he sees a big box in the living room. he wonders what is inside. he jumps on the box and sniffs it. he hears a soft sound. he scratches the box and makes a hole. he peeks inside.

he sees a small ball of fur. it is a puppy. the puppy is scared and shakes. tom feels sorry for the puppy. he says, "hello, little fur. i am tom. do not be afraid. i am your friend." the puppy looks at tom and wags his tail. he says, "hello, tom. i am max. i am glad you are my friend. i was lonely in the box."

tom and max become friends. they play together and share their toys. they cuddle and nap together. they hope to stay together forever. they are happy.
jen and ben were twins who liked to play in the attic. they found many old things there, like hats and books and toys. one day, they saw a big chest in the corner. it was covered with dust and had a lock on it.

"let's open it!" jen said. "maybe there is a treasure inside!"

"but how?" ben asked. "we don't have a key."

jen looked around and saw a small hole in the wall. she peeked inside and saw something shiny. she reached in and pulled out a key.

"look, ben, i found a key!" she whispered. "maybe it fits the chest!"

they ran to the chest and tried the key. it turned and clicked. they lifted the lid and gasped. inside, there was a beautiful dress, a pair of shoes, a necklace and a crown. they were all made of ice and sparkled in the light.

"wow, they are so pretty!" jen said. "can i try them on?"

"ok, but be careful," ben said. "they look very icy and cold."

jen put on the dress, the shoes, the necklace and the crown. she felt like a princess. she twirled and danced in the attic. ben clapped and cheered.

suddenly, they heard a loud voice from downstairs.

"jen! ben! time for lunch!" their mom called.

"uh-oh, we have to go," ben said. "quick, put the things back in the chest!"

jen nodded and took off the dress, the shoes, the necklace and the crown. she put them back in the chest and closed the lid. they ran downstairs, leaving the chest behind.

they never told anyone about their icy secret. but sometimes, they would go back to the attic and play with the ice things again. they wondered who made them and why they were in the chest. but they never found out. they just enjoyed their magic.
lila and ben love to play in the park. they like to slide, swing and run. but their favorite thing is the zip line. the zip line is a long rope with a seat. you sit on the seat and hold the rope. then you go very fast from one side to the other.

one day, lila and ben went to the park with their mom. they ran to the zip line and waited for their turn. lila went first. she sat on the seat and held the rope. she felt the wind in her hair and the sun on her face. she smiled and shouted, "whee!"

ben watched lila and clapped his hands. he wanted to go next. he waited for lila to come back. but when lila came back, she looked sad. she had a scratch on her arm. she said, "ow, ow, ow! the rope is rough. it hurt me."

ben felt sorry for lila. he hugged her and said, "i'm sorry, lila. do you want a band-aid?" lila nodded. she said, "yes, please. and a hug."

mom heard lila and ben. she came to them and saw the scratch. she said, "oh, no, lila. that looks painful. let me help you." she took out a band-aid from her bag and put it on lila's arm. she kissed it and said, "there, there. it will be better soon."

lila smiled and said, "thank you, mom. thank you, ben. you are very kind. i love you both." ben smiled and said, "i love you too, lila. and i love you, mom." mom smiled and said, "i love you both, too. you are very sweet. now, do you want to play something else?" lila and ben nodded. they said, "yes, please. let's play something else." they held hands and ran to the slide. they forgot about the rough rope and the zip line. they had fun in the park.
tim and sue like to play with cars. they have many cars of different colors and sizes. they pretend to drive them on the floor and make noises. vroom, vroom, beep, beep!

one day, tim has a new car. it is big and red and shiny. it has a button that makes it move by itself. tim is very happy with his new car. he shows it to sue and says, "look at my new car! it is very fast and cool. do you want to try it?"

sue nods and smiles. she likes tim's new car. she wants to play with it too. she reaches for the car, but tim pulls it away. he says, "no, you can't play with it. it is mine. you need a license to drive it."

sue is confused and sad. she does not know what a license is. she thinks it is something that tim made up. she says, "what is a license? why do i need it? you don't have a license. you are just a kid like me."

tim says, "a license is a paper that says you can drive a car. my dad has a license. he showed it to me. he said i can play with his car if i have a license. so i made one for myself. see?" he shows sue a piece of paper with his name and a drawing of a car on it. he says, "this is my license. you don't have one, so you can't play with my car."

sue is angry and hurt. she thinks tim is being mean and unfair. she says, "that is not a real license. you just drew it. it does not mean anything. your car is just a toy. it is harmless. it can't hurt anyone. you should share it with me. we are friends. please, can i play with it? i request you to let me play with it."

tim thinks for a moment. he likes sue. he does not want to make her cry. he remembers that his dad also said that sharing is good and that cars are for fun. he says, "okay, okay. you can play with my car. but only for a little while. and you have to be careful. and you have to say thank you."

sue is happy and grateful. she says, "thank you, tim. you are a good friend. i will be careful. i will not break your car. i will have fun with it." she takes the car and presses the button. the car zooms on the floor. sue laughs and chases it. tim laughs too. he is glad that he shared his car. he thinks that playing with sue is more fun than playing alone.
anna and ben were playing in the garden. they liked to dig in the dirt and look for bugs. they had a jar with some ants and worms inside.

"look, ben, i found a big beetle!" anna said, holding up a shiny black bug.

"wow, let me see!" ben said, reaching for the beetle.

but as he touched it, the beetle opened its wings and flew away. anna and ben screamed and ran away from the beetle.

they bumped into a rock and fell down. they looked up and saw something on the rock. it was a lizard. it had green scales and a long tail. it stared at them with its small black eyes.

"ah, a lizard!" anna said, panicking. she did not like lizards. she thought they were disgusting and scary.

"shh, don't move. maybe it will go away," ben said, trying to be brave.

but the lizard did not go away. it opened its mouth and showed its sharp teeth. it hissed and flicked its tongue.

"help, help!" anna and ben shouted, crying. they wanted their mom and dad to come and save them from the lizard.

they heard footsteps and saw their mom and dad running towards them. they picked them up and hugged them.

"what's wrong, sweeties? what scared you?" their mom asked, worried.

"the lizard, the lizard!" anna and ben said, pointing at the rock.

their mom and dad looked at the rock and laughed. they saw the lizard, but it was not a real lizard. it was a toy lizard. someone had left it on the rock as a joke.

"it's okay, it's not a real lizard. it's just a toy. see?" their dad said, picking up the toy lizard and showing it to them.

anna and ben looked at the toy lizard and felt silly. they realized they had been afraid of nothing. they laughed too and hugged their mom and dad.

"sorry, we were silly. we thought it was a real lizard," anna said.

"it's okay, we all get scared sometimes. but you don't have to be afraid of lizards. they are not disgusting. they are just animals. they won't hurt you if you leave them alone," their mom said.

"really? can we see a real lizard?" ben asked, curious.

"sure, maybe we can find one in the garden. but don't touch them, just look at them. they are very interesting and beautiful," their dad said.

"okay, let's go find a real lizard!" anna and ben said, excited.

they put the toy lizard back on the rock and went with their mom and dad to look for a real lizard in the garden. they learned that lizards were not so bad after all. they had fun and forgot about the beetle.
anna and ben are playing with their toys in the living room. they have a lot of fun making noises with their cars, dolls and blocks. they zoom, beep, bang and chatter as they pretend to be drivers, doctors and builders.

but their mom is working in the kitchen. she has a big headache and needs some quiet. she comes to the living room and says, "anna, ben, please stop making so much noise. you are hurting my head. can you play something else?"

anna and ben look at their mom. they see that she is not happy. they love their mom and do not want to make her sad. they say, "sorry, mom. we did not know you had a headache. we will play something else."

they put away their noisy toys and pick up some books. they sit on the couch and read quietly. they look at the pictures and say the words softly. they learn about animals, colors and shapes.

their mom comes back to the living room. she sees that anna and ben are reading. she smiles and says, "thank you, anna, ben. you are very good and kind. i feel better now. do you want to read with me?"

anna and ben nod and hug their mom. they say, "yes, mom. we love you. we love reading with you." they snuggle on the couch and read together. they are happy and quiet.
tom and sam are brothers. they like to play sport in the park. they kick a ball, run and jump. they have fun.

but when they come home, they are dirty. their clothes have mud and grass. their shoes are wet and smelly. their mom is not happy.

"look at you two!" she says. "you are so dirty! you need to clean yourselves and your clothes. go to the bathroom and take a shower. then put your clothes in the laundry basket. do it now!"

tom and sam do not want to clean. they want to play more sport. they think mom is ignorant. she does not understand how fun sport is. they ignore her and go to their room. they take out their toys and start to play.

but mom is not ignorant. she is smart and angry. she follows them to their room. she sees their toys and their dirty clothes. she takes away their toys and puts them in a closet. she says, "no more sport or toys for you until you clean. you are being naughty and rude. you need to learn to listen and respect. now go to the bathroom and take a shower. and don't come out until you are clean!"

tom and sam are sad and sorry. they realize they made a mistake. they say, "we are sorry, mom. you are right. we need to clean. we will do it now. please give us back our toys later. we love you, mom."

mom smiles and hugs them. she says, "i love you too, boys. but you need to follow the rules. cleaning is important for your health and your home. sport is fun, but not all the time. you need to balance your activities. now go and clean. and when you are done, we can have a snack and read a book together."

tom and sam nod and go to the bathroom. they take a shower and put their clothes in the laundry basket. they feel better and cleaner. they learn their lesson. they are happy to have a mom who cares for them.
lily liked to play with her drum. she banged it with her hands and made loud noises. she liked to sing along with her drum and make up songs. she was happy and healthy.

one day, lily saw a big fire in the yard. she was curious and wanted to see it. she ran to the fire and saw that it was very bright and hot. she felt the heat on her face and hands. she thought the fire was pretty and wanted to touch it.

but lily did not know that fire can burn. fire can hurt and make things black and broken. fire is not a toy. fire is dangerous.

lily reached out her hand to the fire and touched a stick that was burning. she felt a sharp pain and screamed. she pulled back her hand and saw that it was red and sore. she cried and ran to her mom.

her mom saw her hand and hugged her. she said, "lily, you are hurt. fire can burn. fire can hurt. you should never play with fire. fire is not a toy. fire is dangerous." she took lily inside and put some cold water and a bandage on her hand. she gave her a kiss and said, "i love you, lily. you are my brave girl. but please be careful and stay away from fire."

lily nodded and said, "i love you, mom. i am sorry. i did not know fire can burn. i will not play with fire again. i will play with my drum. my drum is fun and safe. my drum is my toy." she smiled and hugged her mom. she learned a lesson and was happy and healthy again.
lily and mom went to the mall. lily liked the mall. she saw many toys and clothes and books. she wanted to touch everything. mom said, "no, lily, you have to stay with me. the mall is big and busy. you can get lost or hurt."

but lily did not listen. she saw a gray cat in a pet shop. she loved cats. she ran to the cat and said, "hello, kitty, you are so cute. can i pet you?" she opened the cage and took the cat out. the cat was scared and angry. it scratched lily's face and ran away.

lily cried. she was in pain and she was sorry. she looked for mom, but she could not see her. she saw many people and things, but not mom. she felt alone and scared. she wanted mom to protect her.

mom heard lily's cry. she was worried and angry. she ran to the pet shop and saw lily's face. she said, "lily, what did you do? you are hurt and you are naughty. you did not stay with me. you made the cat run away. you are in trouble."

she took lily to the nurse. the nurse cleaned lily's face and put a bandage on it. she said, "lily, you have to be careful and listen to your mom. the cat was not your friend. it was wild and scared. you have to respect animals and their homes."

lily was sad. she said, "i'm sorry, mom. i'm sorry, nurse. i'm sorry, cat. i just wanted to play. i love you, mom. please don't be mad at me."

mom hugged lily. she said, "i love you, too, lily. but you have to learn from your mistake. you have to obey me and stay with me. i want to protect you and keep you safe. do you understand?"

lily nodded. she said, "yes, mom. i understand. i will be good. can we go home now?"

mom said, "yes, lily. we can go home now. but you have to say sorry to the pet shop owner and pay for the cat's cage. and you have to be more careful next time."

lily said, "ok, mom. i will say sorry and pay. and i will be more careful. i don't want to get hurt or lose you again."

they left the mall. lily was still sad and sore. she did not like the mall anymore. she learned a hard lesson. she wished she had listened to mom. the end.
sara was a little girl who loved to hug. she hugged her mom, her dad, her brother, her dog, and her toys. she hugged everyone and everything she saw. but there was one thing she was not allowed to hug: the queen.

the queen was a very important lady who lived in a big castle. she wore a shiny crown and a long dress. she came to visit sara's town once a year, and everyone had to be very polite and quiet. sara's mom told her, "you can wave to the queen, but you can't hug her. she doesn't like hugs. it's a rule."

sara nodded, but she was curious. why didn't the queen like hugs? hugs were nice and warm and made people happy. sara wanted to make the queen happy. she wanted to hug her.

the day came when the queen arrived in her carriage. sara and her mom stood in the crowd, waiting to see her. sara saw the queen's face. she looked sad and lonely. sara felt sorry for her. she thought, maybe the queen needs a hug.

sara waited for the right moment. when the queen was close enough, sara ran out of the crowd and hugged her. she hugged her tight and said, "i love you, queen. you are beautiful."

the queen was shocked. she gasped and dropped her purse. the guards shouted and ran to sara. sara's mom screamed and ran after her. the crowd gasped and whispered. sara felt guilty. she knew she had done something bad.

but then, something amazing happened. the queen smiled. she smiled a big, bright smile. she hugged sara back. she said, "thank you, little girl. you are brave and kind. you made me happy."

the guards stopped. sara's mom stopped. the crowd stopped. everyone was surprised. the queen broke the rule. she hugged sara.

the queen picked up her purse and waved to the crowd. she said, "this is sara. she is my friend. she taught me something today. hugs are good. hugs are not a rule. hugs are a gift."

everyone cheered. sara cheered. the queen cheered. they hugged again. sara was happy. she had made a new friend. she had made the queen happy. she was not guilty. she was a hero.
ben and sam are brothers. they like to play with cars and balls. one day, they find a big gray hat in the closet. it is their dad's hat. ben wants to wear the hat. he puts it on his head. he says, "look at me! i am a big man!"

sam wants to wear the hat too. he says, "no, ben! it is my turn! give me the hat!" he tries to pull the hat from ben's head. ben holds the hat tight. he says, "no, sam! it is mine! go away!"

they start to fight. they push and pull and shout. the hat falls to the floor. they both run to get it. they bump their heads. they cry.

mom hears the noise. she comes to the closet. she sees the hat and the boys. she says, "what are you doing? why are you fighting? this is not your hat. this is dad's hat. you should not take his things without asking. you should share and be nice."

she picks up the hat. she puts it on her head. she says, "now, i am a big man!" she smiles. the boys stop crying. they laugh. they say, "no, mom! you are a big woman! you are funny!"

mom hugs the boys. she says, "i love you, ben and sam. you are my big boys. but you are still little. you have a lot to learn and gain. now, let's put the hat back and play something else."
lily and ben were playing in the yard. they saw a big box under a tree. they ran to the box and opened it. inside, they found many pretty things. there were dolls, cars, books, and hats.

"wow, look at all these toys!" lily said. "can we play with them?"

"sure, let's set them up and have fun!" ben said. they took out the toys and set them on the grass. they made a tea party with the dolls, a race with the cars, a story with the books, and a fashion show with the hats.

they played for a long time, until they heard their mom calling them. "lily, ben, time for lunch!" mom said.

"okay, mom, we're coming!" lily and ben said. they put the toys back in the box and closed it. they thanked the box for the pretty things and ran to the house.

"did you have fun, kids?" mom asked.

"yes, mom, we found a magic box with lots of pretty toys!" lily and ben said.

"a magic box? that sounds wonderful!" mom said. she smiled and gave them a hug. she wondered who left the box under the tree.
mia and sam liked to play on the beach. they liked to make sand castles and look for shells. one day, they saw something shiny and pink in the water. it looked like a flower.

"look, mia, a flower!" sam said.

"let's go see it!" mia said.

they ran to the water and splashed in. they got closer and closer to the pink thing. but it was not a flower. it was a jellyfish.

"ouch!" sam cried. he felt a sting on his leg. he looked down and saw a red mark. he was scared and hurt.

"sam, are you okay?" mia asked. she saw the jellyfish and knew it was bad. she remembered what mom had told them. "don't touch the jellyfish, they can hurt you!"

she grabbed sam's hand and pulled him out of the water. she ran to mom and told her what happened.

mom was worried and angry. she wrapped sam's leg with a towel and put some cream on it. she hugged him and said, "i'm sorry, sam. you'll be okay. but you have to be careful on the beach. some things are not what they seem. some things are beautiful but dangerous."

mia nodded. she felt sorry for sam. she looked at the jellyfish and thought, "you are not a flower. you are a mean jellyfish. i don't like you."
tom and lily were playing in the garden. they saw a big tree with many green and yellow fruits. tom wanted to pick one and eat it.

"look, lily, these are pears. they are sweet and juicy. let's get one," tom said.

lily shook her head. she did not know what pears were. she had never seen them before.

"no, tom, we don't know what they are. they might be bad for us. mommy said we should not eat unknown things," lily said.

tom did not listen to lily. he climbed the tree and reached for a pear. he pulled it hard and it came off. he smiled and bit into it.

"mmm, this is good. you should try it, lily. it is not bad, it is yummy," tom said.

lily looked at tom. she saw him eating the pear. she wanted to try it too, but she was afraid. she did not want to get sick or make mommy angry.

"i don't know, tom. what if mommy finds out? what if we get a tummy ache?" lily said.

tom shrugged. he did not care. he liked the pear. he ate it all and threw the core on the ground.

"mommy won't find out. and we won't get a tummy ache. it is just a fruit, like an apple or a banana. come on, lily, don't be a baby. have one," tom said.

he reached for another pear and threw it to lily. lily caught it and looked at it. it was yellow and soft. it smelled nice. she wanted to eat it, but she was still scared.

she looked at tom. he was smiling and waiting for her. she looked at the pear. she was hungry and curious.

she took a small bite. it was sweet and juicy. she liked it. she took another bite. and another. and another.

she ate the whole pear and threw the core on the ground. she smiled and wiped her mouth.

"you were right, tom. it was good. thank you for sharing," lily said.

tom nodded and hugged her. they were happy. they did not know that mommy was watching them from the window. she was not happy. she was angry. she came out of the house and walked towards them.

"tom, lily, what have you done? you ate the pears from the neighbor's tree. that is not nice. that is stealing. you have to say sorry and give them back. and you have to go to your room. no more playing today," mommy said.

tom and lily looked at mommy. they were scared and sad. they did not know they did something wrong. they did not know the pears were not theirs. they did not know what to say.

they shrugged and followed mommy. they said sorry to the neighbor and gave him the rest of the pears. they went to their room and cried. they wished they had never seen the pears. they wished they had listened to lily. they wished mommy was not angry. they wished they could play again.
lily liked to help her mom in the kitchen. she wanted to be a good cook like her mom. today, they were going to make soup for lunch. mom said they needed to prepare some vegetables first.

mom gave lily a big knife and a cutting board. she showed lily how to cut the celery into small pieces. lily was careful with the knife. she liked the sound of the knife on the board. she liked the smell of the celery. she felt proud of her work.

mom smiled at lily and said she was doing a great job. she put the celery pieces in a big pot with water and salt. she added some carrots, potatoes, and chicken. she turned on the stove and said the soup would be ready soon.

lily and mom cleaned up the kitchen. they sang a cheerful song while they washed the dishes. they were happy to work together. they were hungry for the soup. they could not wait to taste it. they knew it would be delicious.
tim and sam are friends. they like to play with cars and blocks. one day, they hear a loud noise outside. they run to the window and see a big truck.

"wow, look at that truck!" tim says. "it has many colors and shapes on it."

"what is it doing?" sam asks. "it is stopping at the park."

"let's go see!" tim says. he grabs his coat and hat. sam does the same. they run to the door and open it. they see other kids running to the park too.

at the park, they see the truck open its back. inside, there are many toys and books and balloons. a man comes out of the truck and smiles.

"hello, kids!" he says. "this is a special event. we are giving away these things for free. you can choose one thing each. have fun!"

tim and sam are very happy. they run to the truck and look at the things. they see cars and blocks and dolls and puzzles and more.

"this is so cool!" tim says. "what do you want, sam?"

"i want a car," sam says. "a red one, like yours."

"i want a book," tim says. "a book with animals, like this one."

they pick their things and say thank you to the man. they go back to their house and play with their new things. they are very happy. they think the truck is very cool. they hope it will come again.
anna and ben are playing with their toys in the living room. anna has a doll and ben has a car. they are having fun making noises and moving their toys around.

"look, my doll can dance!" anna says, spinning her doll on the floor.

"my car can go fast!" ben says, zooming his car across the carpet.

they play for a while, until they see a big box on the table. it is a present from their grandma. they run to the box and try to open it.

"what is inside?" anna asks, pulling at the ribbon.

"maybe it is a cake!" ben says, poking at the paper.

they rip off the paper and open the box. inside, they find a colorful top. it has stripes and stars and a long string. they take it out and look at it.

"a top!" anna says, smiling.

"how do we play with it?" ben asks, holding the string.

they see a note from their grandma. it says:

"dear anna and ben,

i hope you like this top. it is a special toy that can spin and make music. to play with it, you have to wind the string around the top, then pull it hard and let it go. it will spin on the floor and make a nice sound. it is a healthy toy, because it makes you move and laugh. have fun with it!

love, grandma"

anna and ben read the note and follow the instructions. they wind the string around the top, then pull it hard and let it go. the top spins on the floor and makes a nice sound. it looks like a rainbow.

"wow, it is so pretty!" anna says, clapping her hands.

"it is so cool!" ben says, jumping up and down.

they take turns spinning the top and watching it. they laugh and cheer. they are happy with their present. they thank their grandma and hug each other. they play with the top until it is time for dinner.
lily and tom were adventurous kids. they liked to explore the world and find new things. one day, they saw a big hole in the ground. they wondered what was inside.

"let's go in and see!" said tom.

"ok, but be careful!" said lily.

they climbed down the hole and saw a dark tunnel. they walked along the tunnel, holding hands. they saw shiny rocks and strange bugs. they heard a loud roar.

"what was that?" asked lily.

"i don't know, but it sounds scary!" said tom.

they wanted to go back, but they could not find the way. they were lost.

"help! help!" they shouted.

but no one heard them. they remained in the hole, alone and afraid. they never saw the world again.
tim and kim are twins who like to play with toys. they have many toys, but they want more. they see a big box in the living room. it is a gift for their dad. it has a tag that says "do not open until his birthday".

tim and kim are curious. they want to know what is inside the box. they think of a creative plan. they poke a small hole in the box with a pencil. they peek through the hole. they see something shiny and round. they think it is a ball.

they poke another hole in the box. they see something long and thin. they think it is a stick. they poke more holes in the box. they see something black and square. they think it is a book. they are happy. they think they have found many toys for themselves.

but they are wrong. the shiny and round thing is a watch. the long and thin thing is a tie. the black and square thing is a wallet. they are not toys. they are things for their dad. they are his birthday gift.

their mom comes in the living room. she sees the box with many holes. she is angry. she asks tim and kim what they have done. they are scared. they tell her the truth. they say they are sorry.

their mom tells them they have broken the law. the law is a rule that everyone must follow. the law says you must not open other people's gifts. the law says you must respect other people's things. the law says you must be honest and kind.

tim and kim feel bad. they have learned a lesson. they say they will not break the law again. they say they will wait until their dad's birthday to see his gift. they say they will hug him and say happy birthday. they say they will play with their own toys and share them with each other. they say they will be good twins. their mom smiles. she forgives them. she hugs them and says she loves them.
tom and anna are friends who like to play with rockets. they have a big box full of rockets of different colors and sizes. they pretend that they are astronauts who go to space and explore new planets.

one day, they decide to bring their rockets to the park and launch them from the hill. they pack their box and their snacks and walk to the park with their moms. they find a good spot on the hill and set up their rockets.

"are you ready, anna?" tom asks.

"yes, i am, tom. let's go to space!" anna says.

they count down from ten and press the buttons on their rockets. the rockets make a loud noise and fly up in the air. tom and anna watch them with wide eyes and cheer.

"wow, look at them go!" tom says.

"they are so fast and bright!" anna says.

they imagine that their rockets are going to different planets with strange animals and plants. they make up stories about what they see and do in space.

but soon, the wind gets stronger and the sky gets darker. the rockets start to fall down and land on the ground. some of them break and some of them get lost. tom and anna are sad and scared.

"oh no, our rockets!" tom says.

"what happened?" anna says.

their moms come to them and hug them.

"don't worry, kids. it's just a harsh storm. it will pass soon. we have to go home now and be safe." one mom says.

"can we bring our rockets home?" tom asks.

"of course, we can. we will help you find them and fix them. maybe we can play with them again another day." the other mom says.

tom and anna nod and smile. they gather their rockets and their snacks and follow their moms. they still love their rockets and their space adventures. they hope that the storm will end soon and the sun will come out again.
lila liked to jog with her dad. they jogged by the sea every morning. lila loved to see the dolphins jump in the water. they were big and gray and had happy smiles.

one day, lila saw a dolphin that was hurt. it had a net around its tail and it could not swim well. lila felt sad for the dolphin. she wanted to help it. she told her dad to stop jogging and pointed at the dolphin.

her dad saw the dolphin too. he said they had to be careful, but they could try to help. he took lila to a boat nearby and asked the man if they could borrow it. the man said yes and gave them a knife. lila and her dad got on the boat and went to the dolphin.

the dolphin was scared and tried to swim away, but it was too weak. lila and her dad talked to the dolphin in soft voices. they said they were friends and they wanted to help. the dolphin calmed down and let them come closer. lila's dad used the knife to cut the net from the dolphin's tail. the dolphin was free and happy. it thanked lila and her dad with a loud splash and a big smile.

lila and her dad went back to the shore. they were happy too. they had done a good thing. they hugged each other and jogged home. lila learned that it is good to help others who are hurt. she hoped to see the dolphin again.
lily was very happy. today was her birthday. she had a big cake with candles and a lovely dress with flowers. she wanted to share her cake with her friends. she asked her mom if she could invite them to her house.

mom said yes, but she had a surprise for lily. she said lily would meet someone new and get a special present. lily was curious. who could it be? what could it be? she hoped it was something fun and nice.

mom took lily to the car and drove to a big place with many animals. lily loved animals. she saw dogs, cats, birds, rabbits, and more. she wanted to pet them all. mom said they were here to adopt one of them. lily was very excited. she could have a new friend!

mom took lily to a room where a lady was waiting. the lady smiled and said hello. she had a box in her hands. she said it was for lily. she opened the box and lily saw a small, fluffy, white kitten. the kitten looked at lily with big, blue eyes and meowed softly. lily gasped. she loved the kitten. she reached out and touched its fur. it was soft and warm. the kitten licked her hand and purred.

lily hugged the kitten and thanked the lady. she thanked her mom too. she said it was the best present ever. she named the kitten snowy. she said snowy was her new best friend. she was very happy. she couldn't wait to show snowy to her other friends and share her cake with them. she knew they would love snowy too. it was a lovely birthday.
anna and ben are friends. they like to play together. one day, they find a phone in the park. it is a little phone. it has buttons and a screen.

anna and ben take turns to press the buttons. they hear sounds and see pictures. they pretend to talk to each other on the phone. they say hello and bye-bye and make funny noises.

but then, a man comes to the park. he looks angry. he says the phone is his. he says anna and ben are bad. he takes the phone from them. he walks away.

anna and ben are sad. they do not have the phone anymore. they do not want to play with the man. they hug each other. they say they are still friends. they go to the slide and have fun. they forget about the phone.
sara and ben were playing in the kitchen. they saw a big bowl of fruit on the table. sara wanted to try a lemon. she picked one up and smelled it. it smelled sour.

"can i eat this?" she asked ben.

ben shook his head. "no, it is not good. it will make your face funny."

sara did not believe him. she wanted to see for herself. she bit the lemon. it was very sour. she made a face and spit it out. she did not like it at all.

"see, i told you," ben said. he laughed at sara's face.

sara was angry. she did not like being laughed at. she picked up the lemon again and slapped ben with it. ben was surprised. he felt the lemon juice on his cheek. it stung.

"ow, that hurts!" he cried. he rubbed his cheek.

sara felt bad. she did not mean to hurt ben. she just wanted him to stop laughing. she said sorry to ben.

"i'm sorry, ben. i did not mean to slap you. i was just mad."

ben forgave sara. he said sorry too.

"i'm sorry, sara. i did not mean to laugh at you. i was just joking."

they hugged and made up. they decided to play with something else. they left the lemon on the table.

an elderly lady came into the kitchen. she saw the lemon on the table. she wondered who left it there. she picked it up and smelled it. it smelled sour.

she smiled. she liked lemons. she squeezed the lemon into a glass of water. she added some sugar and stirred it. she drank it. it was sweet and sour. she liked it a lot.

she said thank you to the lemon. she did not know who slapped it. she did not care. she was happy.
tim and sam are friends. they like to play in the park. one day, they see a big lake. they want to swim in the lake. they run to the lake.

but the lake is not safe. there are signs that say "no swimming". there are rocks and weeds in the water. there are also ducks and fish that can bite. tim and sam do not see the signs. they do not hear the people who shout "stop!" they are deaf. they cannot hear anything.

they jump in the lake. they splash and laugh. they do not know they are in danger. they do not see the big wave that comes. the wave is from a boat. the boat is fast and loud. the boat does not see tim and sam. the boat is too close.

the people on the shore are scared. they wave and scream. they want to help tim and sam. they want to unite them with their families. they call 911. they hope it is not too late. they pray for tim and sam.
tom and lily are playing with their toys in the living room. tom has a big truck and lily has a doll. tom likes to make loud noises with his truck and zoom it around the floor. lily likes to brush her doll's hair and dress her up.

"tom, can i play with your truck?" lily asks. she thinks the truck looks fun and shiny.

"no, it's mine!" tom says. he does not want to share his truck. he thinks the doll is boring and ugly.

"please, tom, just for a little bit?" lily begs. she tries to reach for the truck, but tom pulls it away.

"go away, lily!" tom shouts. he pinches lily's arm hard. lily cries out in pain and drops her doll.

"ow, tom, that hurts!" lily says. she feels a big ouch on her arm. she is angry and sad.

"sorry, lily, i didn't mean to hurt you," tom says. he feels bad for pinching lily. he sees a red mark on her arm. he remembers that mommy told him not to pinch.

he gives lily his truck and picks up her doll. he sees a zip on the doll's dress. he tries to open it, but it is stuck. he pulls harder, but the zip does not move. he breaks the zip and tears the dress.

"oh no, tom, what did you do?" lily says. she sees her doll's dress ruined. she is more angry and sad.

"sorry, lily, i didn't mean to break it," tom says. he feels worse for breaking lily's doll. he remembers that mommy told him to be gentle.

he hugs lily and says, "i'm sorry, lily, i'm a bad brother. i love you."

lily hugs tom back and says, "i'm sorry, tom, i'm a bad sister. i love you."

they wipe their tears and smile. they decide to play together and share their toys. they find a dry cloth and wrap it around the doll's dress. they pretend the cloth is a cape and the doll is a superhero. they have fun and laugh. mommy comes in and sees them happy. she is proud of them. she gives them a big hug and a kiss. she says, "you are good children. i love you."
lily and ben are twins. they like to play with their toys in their room. one day, they have a new game. they have a small tray with cups and plates. they pretend to have tea and cake.

"ben, do you want some tea?" lily asks. she holds a cup in her hand.

"yes, please. and some cake too," ben says. he sits on the floor.

lily pours some water from a bottle into the cup. she gives it to ben. she takes a plate and puts a cookie on it. she gives it to ben too.

"thank you, lily. this is yummy," ben says. he drinks the water and eats the cookie.

"you're welcome, ben. do you want more?" lily asks.

"no, thank you. i'm full," ben says. he puts the cup and the plate on the tray.

"me too. let's clean up," lily says. she puts the bottle and the cookie jar on the tray too.

they carry the tray to the kitchen. they give it to their mom.

"good job, lily and ben. you played nicely with your tray," their mom says. she smiles and hugs them.

"we had fun, mom. we had tea and cake," lily says.

"we did, mom. we had a new game," ben says.

their mom nods and kisses them. "i'm glad you had fun. now, it's time for a nap," she says.

lily and ben nod and yawn. they go to their room. they lie on their beds. they close their eyes. they have a good nap.
ben and lily were playing with their toys in the living room. ben had a red car and lily had a yellow doll. they liked their toys, but they also wanted to try each other's.

"can i play with your car, ben?" lily asked.

"ok, but only if i can play with your doll, lily," ben said.

they agreed to trade their toys for a while. they were happy and obedient children who shared nicely.

but then, lily spilled some juice on the car. the car was wet and sticky. ben was sad and angry.

"look what you did, lily! you made my car dirty and wet! give it back to me!" ben shouted.

"i'm sorry, ben. i didn't mean to. here, take your car. but it's still a good car. it can go fast and make noises," lily said.

ben took his car and tried to dry it with a towel. he rubbed and rubbed, but the car was still wet. he was not happy.

"lily, you ruined my car! it doesn't work anymore. it doesn't go fast or make noises. it's a bad car now. i don't want it. i want your doll!" ben said.

"but ben, you can't have my doll. it's mine. and you already played with it. it's not fair. you have to keep your car. it's your trade," lily said.

they started to argue and cry. they were not happy or obedient children anymore. they were selfish and mean.

their mom heard them and came to the living room. she saw the wet car and the yellow doll. she saw the juice and the towel. she saw the angry faces and the tears.

"what's going on here, ben and lily? why are you fighting over your toys?" mom asked.

they told her what happened. they blamed each other. they wanted to change their trade.

mom shook her head. she was not pleased.

"ben and lily, you made a bad choice. you traded your toys, but you didn't take care of them. you spilled juice on the car and you didn't dry it properly. you made it wet and dirty. you broke your promise and you wanted to take back your trade. that's not how you play or share. that's not how you treat your toys or your friends. you need to say sorry and fix your mistake," mom said.

she made them apologize to each other and to their toys. she helped them clean and dry the car. she showed them how to make it work again. she told them to be more careful and respectful next time.

ben and lily felt sorry and ashamed. they hugged each other and their toys. they thanked mom for her help. they learned their lesson.

they decided to trade their toys again, but only for a little while. they played nicely and gently. they were happy and obedient children again.
anna and ben are friends. they like to play with blocks and cars. but today, they are not happy. they want the same car. the car is red and shiny. it makes noises when you push it.

"give me the car!" anna says. "it is mine!"

"no, it is mine!" ben says. "i saw it first!"

they pull the car from each other. they are angry. they start to fight. they push and kick and shout.

"stop it!" mom says. she comes into the room. she sees the fight. she is frustrated. "why are you fighting? you are friends!"

"mom, he took my car!" anna says.

"mom, she took my car!" ben says.

mom looks at the car. she sees a sticker on it. the sticker has a name. the name is max.

"look, this is not your car. this is max's car. he is your neighbor. he lent you the car yesterday. you have to give it back to him. you have to share and be nice."

anna and ben feel ashamed. they did not remember. they say sorry to each other. they hug and make up.

"can we still play with the car?" anna asks.

"only if you take turns," mom says. "and don't fight again."

"okay, mom," anna and ben say.

they decide to play with the car together. they have fun. they make noises and pretend to drive. they are happy again.

"can i go first?" anna asks.

"sure, you can go first," ben says. "but i dare you to go fast!"

anna smiles. she likes a dare. she pushes the car fast. ben cheers. they laugh and play. they are friends.
ben and lily were twins who shared a room. they liked to play with their toys and read books before they went to sleep. but one night, there was a big storm outside. the wind made loud noises and the rain hit the window. ben and lily felt scared.

"ben, i don't like the storm. it's scary," lily said, hugging her teddy bear.

"me neither, lily. but don't worry, we have each other. and mom and dad are in the next room. they will keep us safe," ben said, holding his dinosaur.

they tried to close their eyes and sleep, but they could not. they heard a drip-drip-drip sound from the ceiling. they looked up and saw a wet spot. there was a leak in the roof!

"ben, look! there's water coming from the roof! what if it falls on us?" lily said, pointing at the leak.

"oh no, lily! that's not good. we have to tell mom and dad. maybe they can fix it," ben said, getting out of bed.

they ran to their parents' room and knocked on the door. mom and dad opened it and saw their scared faces.

"mom, dad, there's a leak in our room! water is dripping from the ceiling! can you help us?" ben and lily said together.

mom and dad hugged them and said, "oh, you poor things. we're sorry you're scared. we didn't know there was a leak. come on, let's go see what we can do."

they followed mom and dad to their room. dad got a bucket and a towel and put them under the leak. he said, "this will catch the water for now. tomorrow, i'll call someone to fix the roof. don't worry, it won't hurt you."

mom said, "why don't you sleep with us tonight? we have a big bed and plenty of blankets. you'll be warm and cozy and safe."

ben and lily smiled and said, "thank you, mom and dad. we love you."

they climbed into the big bed and snuggled with mom and dad. they felt better and less scared. they listened to mom and dad's soft voices and gentle breathing. they closed their eyes and fell asleep.
lily and tom are friends. they like to play with blocks and make towers. one day, they find a new box of blocks. the blocks have symbols on them. some have stars, some have circles, some have squares.

"look, tom, these blocks are different!" lily says. "they have symbols. what do they mean?"

"i don't know, lily. maybe they are a code. maybe we can use them to send messages," tom says.

they start to build towers with the blocks. they try to make patterns with the symbols. they have fun.

but then, lily's mom comes. she says it is time to go home. she says they have to clean up the blocks.

"can we leave them like this, mom?" lily asks. "we are making a code. we want to finish it."

"no, lily, you have to be obedient. you have to put the blocks back in the box. you can play with them another day," lily's mom says.

lily and tom are sad. they like their code. they don't want to break their towers.

but they are obedient. they listen to lily's mom. they put the blocks back in the box. they say goodbye to each other.

"maybe we can play with the blocks again tomorrow," tom says.

"maybe we can find out what the symbols mean," lily says.

they smile. they are still friends. they still like to play with blocks.
lily and max were playing in the garden. they liked to look at the flowers and the bugs. lily saw a purple flower that was very pretty. she wanted to smell it.

"look, max, a purple flower!" she said. "i want to smell it."

she ran to the flower and bent down. but she did not see the bee that was on the flower. the bee was busy getting nectar. it did not like to be disturbed.

max saw the bee and got scared. he knew that bees could sting. he wanted to stop lily.

"lily, no!" he shouted. "there is a bee! it can hurt you!"

he ran after lily and tried to pull her away. he urged her to leave the flower alone. but lily did not listen. she was too curious.

she reached out her hand and touched the flower. the bee felt her and got angry. it flew up and buzzed around her head. lily screamed and dropped the flower. she ran back to max and hugged him.

"ow, ow, ow!" she cried. "the bee is mad! it wants to sting me!"

max hugged her back and tried to calm her down. he looked around and saw the bee fly away. he was relieved.

"it's okay, lily," he said. "the bee is gone. it won't sting you. but you should not touch the flowers with bees. they don't like it. they need the flowers for food."

lily nodded and sniffed. she was sorry for making the bee mad. she learned her lesson.

"i'm sorry, max," she said. "i won't touch the flowers with bees again. i'll just look at them. they are still pretty."

max smiled and kissed her cheek.

"that's good, lily," he said. "let's go and find some other flowers. maybe we can find some yellow ones. or pink ones. or blue ones. there are many colors of flowers. and they all smell nice."

lily smiled and wiped her tears. she took max's hand and followed him. they went to look for more flowers. but they were careful to avoid the bees. they wanted to be friends with the bees, not enemies.
tom and sam are brothers. they like to play in the park with their ball. one day, they see an elderly cat sitting on a bench. the cat is black and white and has a collar with a bell.

"look, a cat!" tom says. he runs to the cat and tries to pet it. the cat hisses and scratches tom's hand. tom cries and runs back to sam.

"bad cat!" sam says. he is angry at the cat for hurting his brother. he picks up the ball and kicks it hard at the cat. the ball hits the cat on the head and makes a loud noise. the cat meows and jumps off the bench.

"hey, stop that!" a voice says. it is an elderly lady who owns the cat. she walks to the bench and picks up the cat. she glares at sam and tom. "you should not kick my cat! he is old and sick. he does not like strangers. you should be nice to animals!"

sam and tom feel sorry for the cat and the lady. they did not know the cat was old and sick. they did not mean to hurt him.

"we are sorry, lady," sam says. "we did not know. we like animals. we have a dog at home. he is friendly and likes to play."

the lady softens her look. she sees that sam and tom are not bad boys. they just made a mistake.

"it's okay, boys," she says. "but you should be careful with your ball. you could hurt someone or something. and you should always ask before you pet a cat. some cats are shy or scared. they need time to trust you."

sam and tom nod. they understand. they apologize again to the lady and the cat. they promise to be more careful and respectful. the lady smiles and thanks them. she walks away with the cat in her arms. the cat looks at sam and tom and purrs. sam and tom wave goodbye and go back to playing with their ball. they are happy and have learned a lesson.
anna and ben liked to play in the park. they liked to run, jump, slide and swing. they liked to see the birds, the flowers and the clouds. they had a lot of fun.

one day, it was very hot and sunny. anna and ben did not bring any water or hats. they felt thirsty and tired. they looked for some shade, but they could not find any. all the trees were very small and had no leaves. all the benches were in the sun. they wished they had listened to their mom, who told them to bring water and hats.

they saw a big tent in the corner of the park. it looked cool and dark inside. they ran to the tent and went in. they hoped to find some water and some shade. but they did not find what they wanted. they found a lot of scary things. they found a snake, a spider, a bat and a skull. they screamed and ran out of the tent. they were very scared.

they ran to their mom, who was sitting on a wide blanket. she hugged them and gave them some water and some hats. she told them that the tent was for a halloween party. she told them that the snake, the spider, the bat and the skull were not real. they were just toys. she told them that they should not go into places they did not know. they should always ask before they enter.

anna and ben felt sorry. they regretted going into the tent. they learned their lesson. they said sorry to their mom and thanked her for the water and the hats. they decided to play on the wide blanket, under the shade of an umbrella. they felt safe and happy. they still liked to play in the park, but they also liked to listen to their mom.
lila and her mom went to the park. lila saw a big round thing that she could sit on and spin. she ran to it and climbed on. she asked her mom to push her.

"mom, push me! push me!" she said.

"okay, lila, but not too fast. you might get dizzy," her mom said.

lila liked to spin. she felt the wind on her face and the sun on her hair. she laughed and waved her arms. she saw other kids playing on the swings and the slide. she wanted to play with them too.

"mom, can i go play with them?" she asked.

"sure, lila, but be polite. say hello and ask if you can join them," her mom said.

lila nodded. she got off the round thing and ran to the swings. she saw a girl with curly hair and a blue dress. she smiled and said, "hi, i'm lila. can i swing with you?"

the girl smiled back and said, "hi, i'm mia. yes, you can swing with me. do you want to go high?"

lila nodded again. she sat on the swing next to mia. mia's mom pushed them both. they swung high and low. they had fun.

lila's mom watched them and smiled. she was proud of her daughter. she was polite and friendly. she liked to spin and swing. she was happy.
tom and sam are brothers. they like to play with their toys in their room. tom is very organized. he puts his toys in boxes and labels them. he has a box for cars, a box for animals, a box for blocks and a box for ties. he likes to wear ties when he pretends to be a teacher or a doctor. sam is not very organized. he throws his toys everywhere and mixes them up. he does not like to wear ties. he thinks they are boring and itchy.

one day, tom and sam are playing in their room. tom is teaching his animals with a tie around his neck. sam is building a tower with blocks and cars. sam sees tom's tie and thinks it is funny. he wants to play with it. he grabs the tie from tom's neck and runs away. tom is angry. he says, "that is my tie! give it back! it belongs to me!" sam says, "no, it is mine now! i want to play with it!" he wraps the tie around his tower and makes it look like a flag.

tom and sam start to fight. they pull and tug on the tie. they yell and cry. they knock over their toys and make a big mess. their mom hears the noise and comes to their room. she sees the chaos and is not happy. she says, "what is going on here? why are you fighting over a tie? you have so many toys to share and enjoy. you need to learn to respect each other's things and feelings. you are brothers and you should love each other." she takes the tie from them and puts it back in tom's box. she makes them clean up their room and hug each other. she says, "now, say you are sorry and play nicely." tom and sam say they are sorry and play nicely. they learn to take turns and ask before they borrow. they have fun with their toys and their ties. they are happy and so is their mom.
tom liked to play with his toy iron. it was orange and shiny and made a funny noise when he pressed a button. he liked to pretend he was ironing his clothes like his mom. he had a small board and some old shirts and pants to iron.

one day, his friend lily came over to play. she saw his toy iron and wanted to play with it too. she asked tom if she could have a turn. tom said no, it was his iron and he did not want to share. lily got angry and tried to grab the iron from tom. they both pulled and pushed and shouted.

tom's mom heard the noise and came to see what was wrong. she saw tom and lily fighting over the toy iron. she was not happy. she told them to stop and said they had to share. she said tom could play with the iron for five more minutes, then he had to return it to lily. she said lily could play with another toy until then.

tom did not like this. he wanted to keep the iron for himself. he thought it was not fair. he pouted and said he did not want to play with lily anymore. he turned away from her and ironed his clothes very fast.

lily felt sad. she wanted to play with tom and the iron. she did not understand why tom was so mean. she looked around and saw a toy truck on the floor. she picked it up and started to roll it on the carpet. she made a vroom-vroom sound and smiled.

tom heard lily's sound and looked at her. he saw her playing with the truck and having fun. he felt a little sorry. he realized he was being selfish. he decided to be nice and share. he finished ironing his clothes and put them on the board. he took the iron and walked over to lily. he said he was sorry and asked if she wanted to play with the iron. he said he would play with the truck.

lily was surprised and happy. she said thank you and took the iron. she said she was sorry too and asked if he wanted to play with the truck. she said they could take turns. tom nodded and smiled. he took the truck and rolled it on the carpet. he made a vroom-vroom sound and laughed.

tom's mom saw them playing nicely and smiled. she was proud of them. she said they were good friends and gave them a hug. she said they could have a snack and watch a cartoon. tom and lily agreed and followed her to the kitchen. they held their toys and each other's hand. they were happy.
lily and ben were playing in the bathroom. they liked to splash water on each other and make bubbles with the soap. they did not hear mom calling them for dinner.

"look, ben, i can make the water go fast or slow!" lily said. she turned the faucet left and right. the water made a loud noise.

ben wanted to try too. he reached for the faucet, but lily pushed him away. "no, it's my turn!" she said.

ben was angry. he pushed lily back. they both fell into the bathtub. the faucet hit lily's head. she cried out in pain.

mom heard the cry and ran to the bathroom. she saw blood on lily's head and water on the floor. she was scared. she picked up lily and wrapped a towel around her head. she shouted at ben. "what did you do? you hurt your sister! you are a bad boy!"

ben felt sorry. he did not mean to hurt lily. he just wanted to play with the faucet. he started to cry too. he wished he had listened to mom. he wished he had not pushed lily. he wished he could say sorry. but mom was too angry to listen. she took lily to the car and drove to the hospital. she left ben alone in the bathroom. he was scared. he did not know what to do. he did not know if lily would be okay. he did not know if mom would love him again. he sat on the floor and cried. he did not think anyone would come back for him. he did not think anyone would care. he did not think anyone would forgive him. he did not think he could ever be happy again.
sam and lily were playing with their blocks. they liked to make big buildings with many rooms and windows. they pretended they were kings and queens of the blocks.

but then, a hairy dog came into the room. the dog was big and loud. he saw the blocks and wanted to play too. he ran to the buildings and started to knock them down with his paws and nose.

"hey, stop that!" sam shouted. "you are ruining our buildings!"

the dog did not listen. he wagged his tail and barked. he thought it was fun to make the blocks fall.

lily was angry. she picked up a block and threw it at the dog. the block hit the dog on the head. the dog yelped and ran away.

"good job, lily!" sam said. "you scared him away!"

they hugged and smiled. they decided to rebuild their buildings. they hoped the hairy dog would not come back.
lily and max are twins. they like to play in the park with their mom and dad. one day, they see a big truck with a shiny silver box on it. they run to the truck and ask the driver what is inside.

"hello, little ones," the driver says. "this is a special box. it has music in it. do you want to hear?"

"yes, yes!" lily and max say. they love music. the driver opens the box and turns on a switch. the box makes a loud noise. it sounds like drums and horns and bells.

lily and max clap their hands and dance. they think the noise is fun. but their mom and dad do not like it. they cover their ears and frown.

"please, turn it off!" their mom says. "that is not music. that is noise. it hurts our ears."

the driver smiles and turns off the switch. the noise stops. the park is quiet again.

"sorry, ma'am," the driver says. "this is not normal music. this is a new kind of music. some people like it, some people don't. i like it. it makes me happy."

lily and max look at their mom and dad. they do not understand why they do not like the noise. they think it is fun.

"can we hear it again?" they ask.

their mom and dad shake their heads. they take lily and max by the hand and walk away from the truck.

"maybe when you are older, you will like it," their dad says. "but for now, let's go and play with the swings. they make a nice sound, too."
lily and ben are twins. they like to play with their toys. they have many toys, but they do not share them well. sometimes they fight over the toys and make a lot of noise.

one day, their mom says, "lily and ben, i have a surprise for you. come and see." she takes them to the living room, where she has a big table. on the table, she has displayed many books, puzzles, and games. "these are for you to play with," she says. "but you have to follow some rules. you have to take turns, and you have to ask before you touch anything. do you understand?"

lily and ben nod. they are very excited. they see many things they like. lily sees a book with animals. she loves animals. she asks, "mom, can i touch this book?" mom says, "yes, you can. but you have to let ben look at it too, when he wants to." lily says, "ok." she picks up the book and opens it. she sees a picture of a lion. she says, "look, ben, a lion! it is big and yellow and has a mane."

ben sees a puzzle with cars. he loves cars. he asks, "mom, can i touch this puzzle?" mom says, "yes, you can. but you have to let lily help you too, when she wants to." ben says, "ok." he picks up the puzzle and starts to put the pieces together. he sees a picture of a red car. he says, "look, lily, a car! it is fast and shiny and has four wheels."

lily and ben play with the books and the puzzles for a while. they take turns and ask before they touch. they show each other what they find. they have fun. mom is happy. she says, "you are playing very well. you are being fair and kind. i am proud of you." lily and ben smile. they hug their mom and say, "thank you, mom. we love you."
lily and ben were twins who liked to play together. they had many toys, but their favorite was a big red truck. they pretended the truck could take them to different places, like the park, the zoo, or the moon.

one day, their mom said they could have dessert after dinner, but only if they were helpful and cleaned their room. lily and ben agreed, and ran to their room. they started to put their toys in a big box, but then they saw the red truck.

"let's play with the truck first," ben said. "we can clean later."

"no, we have to be helpful," lily said. "mom will be happy if we clean now, and then we can have dessert."

"but i want to play with the truck," ben said. "it's so fun. i believe it can fly."

lily thought for a moment. she liked the truck too, but she also wanted dessert. she had an idea.

"ok, let's play with the truck, but only for a little bit," she said. "and then we can use the truck to help us clean. we can put the toys in the truck, and drive them to the box. it will be faster and more fun."

ben liked the idea. he smiled and nodded.

"ok, let's do that," he said. "the truck is helpful too."

they played with the truck for a little bit, and then they used it to help them clean. they drove the truck around the room, and picked up the toys. they made vroom and beep sounds, and pretended they were on a mission.

soon, their room was clean, and their mom came to check on them.

"wow, you did a great job," she said. "you were very helpful. i'm proud of you. now you can have dessert."

lily and ben were happy. they thanked their mom, and followed her to the kitchen. they saw a big cake with chocolate and sprinkles.

"wow, that looks yummy," lily said.

"yes, it does," ben said. "can we have a big piece?"

"sure, you can," their mom said. "you earned it. you were very helpful."

lily and ben smiled. they ate their cake, and shared some with the truck. they believed the truck was happy too.
lily and max were playing in the yard. they liked to kick the ball and run after it. sometimes they kicked it too hard and it went over the fence. then they had to ask the neighbor, mr. brown, to give it back.

one day, they saw a shiny thing on the ground. it was a screw. lily picked it up and showed it to max. "look, a screw!" she said. "what is it for?"

"i don't know," max said. "maybe it fell from a car or a bike. let's keep it. it's cool."

they put the screw in their pocket and went back to kicking the ball. they did not see mr. brown watching them from his window. he looked angry. he had been fixing his lawnmower and he needed that screw.

the next time they kicked the ball over the fence, they ran to the gate and called mr. brown. "mr. brown, can we have our ball back, please?" they asked.

mr. brown came out with the ball in his hand. he looked at them and said, "sure, you can have your ball back. but first, you have to give me something back. something that belongs to me. something that you took from my yard."

lily and max looked at each other. they did not know what he meant. they had not taken anything from his yard. they only played with their ball. they felt scared.

"what do you want, mr. brown?" lily asked.

mr. brown pointed at their pocket. "i want my screw back. the one you found on the ground. the one that i need to fix my lawnmower. the one that you stole from me."

lily and max gasped. they remembered the screw. they did not know it was his. they did not mean to steal it. they took it out of their pocket and gave it to him. "we're sorry, mr. brown," they said. "we didn't know it was yours. we thought it was just a regular screw. we won't take anything from your yard again."

mr. brown took the screw and nodded. he gave them their ball back. "thank you, kids," he said. "now you know. don't take things that are not yours. and don't kick the ball so hard. it might break something."

lily and max nodded. they said thank you and ran back to their yard. they decided to play something else. they did not want to make mr. brown angry again. they learned their lesson.
anna and ben are friends. they like to play in the park. they see a big tree with green needles. it is a pine tree.

"look, anna, a pine tree!" ben says. "it smells good. do you want to touch it?"

"yes, ben, i want to touch it," anna says. they run to the pine tree and touch the needles. they are prickly, but soft.

"can we hug the pine tree?" anna asks.

"sure, anna, we can hug the pine tree," ben says. they wrap their arms around the pine tree and hug it. they feel happy.

"can we kiss the pine tree?" anna asks.

"kiss the pine tree?" ben says. "why do you want to kiss the pine tree?"

"because i like the pine tree. and i like you, ben," anna says. she gives the pine tree a kiss. then she gives ben a kiss on the cheek.

ben feels his face get hot. he smiles. he likes anna, too. he gives the pine tree a kiss. then he gives anna a kiss on the cheek.

they hear a voice. it is anna's mom. she is holding a basket. she has orange juice and orange cookies for them.

"anna, ben, come here. it is time for a snack," anna's mom says.

"okay, mom," anna says. she lets go of the pine tree and ben. she runs to her mom.

"okay, mom," ben says. he lets go of the pine tree and anna. he runs to her mom.

they sit on a blanket and drink orange juice and eat orange cookies. they share with the pine tree. they say thank you to anna's mom. they are happy. they are friends.
lily and max were friends who liked to play with blocks. they could build towers, bridges, and houses with their blocks. one day, they decided to make a network with their blocks. a network was a lot of blocks that were connected by other blocks.

lily and max worked hard to make their network. they picked different colors and shapes of blocks and put them together. they made a network that had many parts and looked very nice.

but then, ben came to play with them. ben was a boy who lived next door. he saw their network and wanted to play with it too. but he did not ask lily and max. he just grabbed some blocks and tried to add them to the network.

"hey, stop!" lily said. "that is our network. you can't just take our blocks."

"yes, i can," ben said. "i want to play with your network. it looks fun."

"no, you can't," max said. "you have to ask us first. and you have to be careful. you might break our network."

ben did not listen. he kept picking blocks and putting them where he wanted. he did not care if they matched or fit. he made the network look messy and ugly.

lily and max were very angry and sad. they did not like what ben was doing. they felt envious of ben. he had so many blocks and he did not share. he did not respect their work. he did not care about their feelings.

they tried to stop ben, but he was bigger and stronger. he pushed them away and laughed. he thought he was better than them. he thought he could do whatever he wanted.

lily and max did not know what to do. they wanted to save their network. they wanted to play with their blocks. they wanted to have fun with their friend. but ben was not a good friend. he was a mean boy. he was a bully.

what do you think lily and max should do? how do you think the story should end?
ben likes to play with his rocket. he made it from a big box and some paper. he paints it red and blue and puts stickers on it. he pretends he is an astronaut and flies to the moon.

one day, ben wants to show his rocket to his friend sam. he tries to lift his rocket, but it is too heavy. he cannot carry it by himself. he needs help. he asks his mom to help him, but she is busy. he asks his dad to help him, but he is at work. he asks his sister to help him, but she is too small.

ben is sad. he thinks he cannot take his rocket to sam's house. he sits on the floor and cries. then he hears a knock on the door. it is sam! he came to play with ben. he sees ben's rocket and says, "wow, that is a cool rocket! can we play with it?"

ben smiles and says, "yes, we can play with it, but it is very heavy. we need to work together to lift it." sam nods and says, "ok, let's do it!" they both grab one side of the rocket and lift it up. they are strong together. they take the rocket outside and have fun flying to the moon. ben is happy. he has a good friend and a good rocket.
anna and ben were twins who liked to play in their big house. they had many toys and clothes and books, but their favorite thing was their comb. the comb was very special, because it could glow in the dark. when they combed their hair with it, their hair would shine like stars.

one night, they decided to sneak out of their room and explore the house with their comb. they turned off the lights and held the comb in front of them. they saw many things that looked different in the dark. they saw the big sofa, the shiny vase, the soft rug, and the tall clock. they giggled and whispered as they walked around.

"look, anna, there is a door we never opened!" ben said, pointing to a small door under the stairs. "let's see what's inside!"

"ok, ben, but be careful!" anna said, following him. they opened the door and saw a dark and dusty room. there were boxes and bags and old things piled up. they used their comb to see better.

"wow, look at all this stuff!" ben said, picking up a hat and a coat. "maybe this was our grandpa's room. he was very rich and traveled a lot."
