"maybe, ben, but we should not touch his things. they are very old and fragile." anna said, looking at a picture of a smiling man. "he looks nice. i wish we met him."

"me too, anna. he must have had many stories to tell." ben said, putting the hat and coat back. "hey, what's that?" he saw something shiny under a box. he moved the box and found a necklace with a big jewel. the jewel was red and sparkled in the dark.

"wow, ben, that's beautiful!" anna said, admiring the necklace. "it glows like our comb!"

"maybe it's magic, anna. maybe it can grant wishes." ben said, holding the necklace. "what would you wish for?"

"i don't know, ben. we already have everything we need. we have a big house, many toys, and each other." anna said, smiling. "what would you wish for?"

"i would wish for the same, anna. and maybe for some cookies." ben said, laughing. "come on, let's go back to our room. it's late and we don't want to get in trouble."

"ok, ben, let's go. but let's leave the necklace here. it belongs to grandpa. maybe he will come back for it someday." anna said, putting the necklace back under the box. "maybe he will be happy to see that we found his comb."

they closed the door and ran back to their room. they combed their hair with their comb and tucked themselves in bed. they dreamed of grandpa and his adventures. they were happy and rich.
tim and sue were friends. they liked to play in the park. one day, they saw a big cross on the grass. it was shiny and had jewels on it.

"wow, look at that!" tim said. "it is so pretty. i hope we can have it."

"me too," sue said. "maybe it is a gift for us. let's go and take it."

they ran to the cross and picked it up. it was heavy and cold. they smiled and hugged each other.

but then, a man came out of the bushes. he was angry and scary. he had a big stick in his hand.

"hey, you little thieves!" he shouted. "that is my cross. give it back to me or i will hit you!"

tim and sue were afraid. they dropped the cross and tried to run away. but the man was faster. he caught them and hit them with his stick. he hurt them a lot. he took the cross and left them on the ground.

tim and sue cried and cried. they wished they had not taken the cross. they wished they had listened to their moms and dads. they were not grateful for what they had. they were sorry and sad.
lily and ben wanted to decorate their room for halloween. they had many things to make it scary and fun. they had pumpkins, spiders, bats, and ghosts. they also had costumes to wear.

lily wanted to be a witch. she had a black dress, a hat, and a broom. ben wanted to be a superhero. he had a red suit, a cape, and a mask. they helped each other put on their costumes.

"wow, you look incredible, lily!" ben said. "you are a very good witch."

"thank you, ben. you look incredible, too. you are a very strong superhero." lily said.

they were ready to decorate their room. they hung the spiders and bats on the walls. they put the pumpkins and ghosts on the floor. they turned off the lights and used a flashlight to make shadows.

they were very happy with their room. they invited their mom and dad to see it. mom and dad were very surprised and proud.

"what a spooky and fun room you have, lily and ben!" mom said. "you did a great job decorating it."

"and what amazing costumes you have, lily and ben!" dad said. "you are very creative and brave."

lily and ben smiled and hugged their mom and dad. they had a lot of fun decorating their room and dressing up for halloween. they were very excited to go trick-or-treating later.
tim and his mom went to the park. tim liked to play with the swings and the slide. he saw a big dog with a leash. the dog was brown and had long hair. tim thought the dog was ugly.

"mom, can i pet the dog?" tim asked.

"no, tim, you don't know the dog. he might bite you," mom said.

"but he looks nice. he has a leash. he can't run away," tim said.

"that doesn't mean he is nice, tim. the leash is for the owner to manage the dog, not for you to pet him. come on, let's go to the sandbox," mom said.

tim was sad. he wanted to pet the dog. he followed mom to the sandbox. he saw another dog there. the dog was small and white and had short hair. tim thought the dog was cute.

"mom, can i pet this dog?" tim asked.

"yes, tim, you can. this dog belongs to our friend lily. she is here with her dad. the dog is friendly and likes children. but you have to ask lily first," mom said.

tim ran to lily and her dad. he asked if he could pet the dog. lily said yes. she gave tim the leash. tim petted the dog. the dog licked his face. tim was happy. he liked the dog. he thanked lily and gave her back the leash.

"see, tim, not all dogs are the same. some are ugly and some are cute. some are nice and some are not. you have to be careful and ask before you pet them," mom said.

"i understand, mom. i like cute and nice dogs. i don't like ugly and not nice dogs," tim said.

"good, tim. now let's go have some ice cream," mom said.

tim and his mom left the park. they had a good day.
sam likes to test new things. he likes to touch, smell and taste them. he thinks it is fun and easy to learn.

one day, sam finds a big red fruit in the kitchen. he does not know what it is. he picks it up and feels it. it is round and smooth and heavy. he smells it. it has a sweet and sour smell. he wants to taste it.

he bites the fruit with his mouth. he feels a squirt of juice on his tongue. it is very sour and makes him pucker his mouth. he does not like it. he spits it out and makes a face. he says, "yuck!"

mom sees sam and laughs. she says, "that is a lemon, sam. it is not for eating by itself. it is for making lemonade or putting on fish. do you want to try some lemonade?"

sam nods. he likes lemonade. it is sweet and cold and refreshing. mom cuts the lemon and squeezes it into a pitcher. she adds water and sugar and stirs it. she pours some lemonade into a cup and gives it to sam.

sam sips the lemonade with his mouth. he likes it. it is not too sour and not too sweet. it makes him smile. he says, "yum!"

mom smiles too. she says, "you are a good tester, sam. you are brave and curious. but be careful, some things are not good for your mouth. always ask me before you test something new, okay?"

sam nods. he hugs mom and says, "okay, mom. i love you. and i love lemonade."
jill and ben were twins who liked to play in the park. one day, they saw a shiny gem on the ground. it was red and sparkly and looked very pretty. they both wanted to have it, but there was only one gem.

"i saw it first!" jill said. "it is mine!"

"no, i saw it first!" ben said. "it is mine!"

they started to pull the gem from each other, but it was very hard and slippery. they pulled and pulled until the gem flew out of their hands and landed in a bush.

"oh no!" jill and ben said. "where is the gem?"

they ran to the bush and looked for the gem, but they could not find it. they searched and searched, but the gem was gone. they felt very sad and angry. they started to weep and blame each other.

"it is your fault!" jill said. "you pulled too hard!"

"no, it is your fault!" ben said. "you pulled too hard!"

they wept and wept until they heard a soft sound. it was a furry kitten who was hiding in the bush. the kitten had found the gem and was playing with it. the kitten looked at jill and ben and meowed.

"look!" jill said. "there is the gem!"

"and there is a kitten!" ben said. "it is so cute!"

they forgot about their fight and went to the bush. they gently took the gem from the kitten and petted its fur. the kitten purred and licked their hands.

"can we keep the kitten?" jill asked. "it is so nice!"

"yes, let's keep the kitten!" ben agreed. "it is so fun!"

they hugged the kitten and smiled at each other. they realized that the gem was not as important as having a friend. they learned to share and be kind. they named the kitten gem and took it home. they lived happily ever after.
tom and sue like to play with their toys. they have many toys, but their favorite is the missile. the missile is big and red and makes a loud noise when they push a button. they pretend the missile can fly to the moon and back.

one day, tom and sue want to play with the missile, but they cannot find it. they look in their room, in the living room, in the kitchen, but the missile is not there. they are sad and angry. they think someone took their missile.

they go to their mom and tell her what happened. mom listens and hugs them. she says she knows where the missile is. she says she put it in the garage, because it is too big and too noisy for the house. she says the missile is expensive and they have to be careful with it.

tom and sue are happy and run to the garage. they see the missile on a shelf. they take it down and hug it. they say sorry to mom and thank her. they promise to play with the missile outside and not inside. mom smiles and says she loves them. they love her too. they go outside and play with the missile. they have fun.
lily and tom are friends. they like to play in the park. one day, they see a big dog. the dog is black and white. the dog has a red collar. the dog is a guard. he works with a man. the man wears a blue suit.

"hello, dog!" lily says. she wants to pet the dog. tom is scared. he hides behind lily.

"be careful, kids," the man says. "this dog is not for petting. he is a guard. he helps me catch bad people."

"wow, really?" lily says. she is not scared. she likes the dog. "what is his name?"

"his name is spot," the man says. "he is a good dog. but he is also messy. he likes to dig holes and roll in the mud."

lily and tom laugh. they see the dog's paws. they are dirty. they see the dog's fur. it is muddy.

"can we play with spot?" lily asks. "we don't mind if he is messy."

the man smiles. he likes the kids. he says yes. lily and tom are happy. they play with spot. they throw a ball. they run and jump. they have fun.

the end.
lily and tom are playing hide and seek in the park. lily is the seeker and tom is the hider. tom runs behind a big tree and waits for lily to find him. he hears lily counting to ten.

"ready or not, here i come!" lily shouts. she looks around the park and tries to see where tom is. she sees a swing, a slide, a bench, but no tom.

"where are you, tom?" lily calls. "i can't find you!"

tom giggles quietly behind the tree. he thinks he has a good hiding spot. he feels his heart beating fast. he likes this game.

lily walks closer to the tree. she hears a sound. she thinks it is a bird. she looks up and sees a squirrel. she smiles and says hello to the squirrel. the squirrel runs away.

tom sees lily from behind the tree. he thinks she is very close. he holds his breath and tries to be calm. he hopes she won't see him.

lily walks around the tree. she sees tom's foot sticking out. she smiles and says "got you!"

tom jumps out and says "you found me!"

lily and tom hug and laugh. they are happy. they like playing hide and seek. they are good friends.
once upon a time, there was a little bird named tweety. tweety was very happy because he had found a yellow flower that he loved. he showed the flower to his friend, a little mouse named jerry.

jerry said, "that flower is so pretty! i wish i could have one too."

tweety replied, "don't worry, i will get you one. i care about you, my friend."

tweety flew away to find another yellow flower. but while he was flying, a big cat named tom saw him and chased him. tweety tried to fly away, but he was too slow. tom caught tweety and ate him.

jerry waited for tweety to come back with the flower, but he never did. he was very sad. he remembered what tweety had said, "i care about you, my friend." but now tweety was gone and jerry did not have his success.
once upon a time, there was a beautiful princess who wore a veil on her head. the veil was like a pretty scarf that covered her hair. the princess loved her veil because it made her feel special and pretty.

one day, the princess was going to a big party. she needed a dependable horse to take her there. she asked her friend who had many horses to supply her with one. her friend gave her a strong and dependable horse that would take her to the party safely.

as the princess rode on the horse, her veil fluttered in the wind. she felt happy and excited to go to the party. when she arrived, everyone admired her beautiful veil and the dependable horse that brought her there. the princess had a wonderful time and was grateful to her friend for supplying her with such a great horse.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play hide and seek with her friends. one day, she found a big sheet in her house. it was clear and shiny. lily decided to use the sheet to play hide and seek with her friends.

she hid under the sheet and waited for her friends to find her. they looked everywhere but they couldn't find her. lily giggled as she heard her friends calling her name. she was happy that the clear sheet helped her hide so well.

finally, lily's friends found her under the sheet. they all laughed and played together. lily was happy that she found the sheet and had so much fun playing with her friends.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily who loved to help her mom in the kitchen. one day, lily's mom asked her to put the dishes in the dishwasher. lily was very cheerful and happy to help her mom.

as she was putting the dishes away, lily accidentally dropped a plate and it broke into many pieces. she started to cry because she was worried that her mom would be angry with her.

lily's mom heard her crying and came into the kitchen. she saw the broken plate and asked lily what happened. lily told her what had happened and apologized for breaking the plate. her mom hugged her and said, "it's okay, accidents happen. the most important thing is that you tried to help me." 

from that day on, lily learned that it's okay to make mistakes and that it's important to always try your best. she also learned that it's important to ask for help when you need it.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with cardboard boxes. he would build forts and castles out of them. one day, timmy's mom gave him a big cardboard box to play with. timmy was very happy and started building his castle.

suddenly, timmy heard a loud noise. he looked up and saw a bird flying towards his castle. timmy quickly became alert and said, "bird, don't strike my castle!" the bird flew away and timmy's castle was safe.

later that day, timmy's friend came over to play. timmy showed him his castle made of cardboard. his friend said, "wow, timmy! your castle is so cool!" timmy smiled and said, "thanks, i worked hard on it."
once upon a time, there was a little dog named max. max was very loyal to his owner, a kind old lady. every day, max would follow her around and wag his tail happily. 

one day, a big storm came. the wind was howling and the rain was pouring down. max was scared and didn't know what to do. but his owner hugged him tightly and said, "don't worry, max. i'll take care of you." 

after the storm passed, max's owner noticed that some of her neighbors had lost their homes. she decided to feed them and give them a place to stay. max watched as his owner helped others and realized that it's important to be kind and help others in times of need. 

from then on, max made it his mission to be as loyal and helpful as his owner. he would follow her around and even help her feed the neighbors. and everyone loved max for his kind heart and loyalty.
once upon a time, there was a bald man named tom. tom loved to eat candy, but he didn't like the taste of it when it was dirty. one day, he went to a candy store to buy some candy, but he noticed that the candy looked dirty. he asked the store owner to polish the candy, but the owner said no.

tom got very upset and started to cry. he really wanted the candy, but he didn't want to eat it if it was dirty. suddenly, a kind little girl walked into the store and saw tom crying. she asked him what was wrong, and he told her about the dirty candy.

the little girl went up to the store owner and asked him to polish the candy for tom. the store owner listened to the little girl and polished the candy. tom was very happy and thanked the little girl for helping him. from that day on, tom always went to the candy store with the little girl because she had a good taste in candy.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a dependable friend named bear who always stayed by her side. one day, lily and bear went to the store to buy some candy. lily put her wallet in her pocket and they walked to the store.

when they got to the store, lily reached into her pocket to get her wallet, but it was gone! she looked all around, but she couldn't find it. she started to cry and bear asked her what was wrong. "my wallet is missing," she said. "i can't buy any candy without it."

bear told her not to worry and he started to rub his paw against the ground. suddenly, he dug up the wallet from the dirt! lily was so happy and gave bear a big hug. "you are my most dependable friend," she said. they bought their candy and went home, happy and full of treats.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. he loved to wear his cozy bathrobe after taking a bath. one day, he put on his bathrobe and went to the kitchen to get some milk. but when he got there, he saw his cat staring at him with its big eyes. 

timmy thought it was crazy that the cat was staring at him like that. he tried to shoo the cat away, but it wouldn't budge. so, timmy just stared back at the cat until it finally walked away. from that day on, timmy made sure to always wear his bathrobe when he went to get milk, just in case the crazy cat was there again.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to explore the desert. he saw a cactus with prickly needles. timmy touched the cactus and it hurt! he learned that cactuses are very prickly and not to touch them. 

one day, timmy found a spicy pepper on the ground. he picked it up and took a bite. it was so spicy that he had to drink lots of water. suddenly, the pepper vanished from his hand! timmy was very surprised and looked around to see where it went. 

timmy continued to explore the desert, but he was always careful around the cactuses and spicy peppers. he never saw the spicy pepper again, but he knew that it could vanish at any moment.
once upon a time, there was a little bear named benny. benny lived in a big cave with his mama bear. one day, benny wanted to go on an adventure but he was hungry. mama bear told him she would supply him with some honey for his journey.

benny was so happy and ran out of the cave, feeling alert and ready for his adventure. as he was walking through the forest, he saw a little rabbit who looked scared. benny asked the rabbit what was wrong and the rabbit said he was lost and didn't know how to get back home.

benny knew he had to help the little rabbit, so he led him back to his home in the forest. the rabbit was so grateful and thanked benny for being so kind and alert. benny felt proud of himself for helping someone in need and went back home to his mama bear with a big smile on his face.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with his toys. one day, he found a big cube in his toy box. it was red and shiny. he picked it up and it was heavy. timmy wondered how much it weighed. 

later that day, timmy's mom made him a sandwich for lunch. but when he took a bite, he made a face. the sandwich tasted bad! timmy didn't like it at all. 

after lunch, timmy went back to playing with his toys. he decided to weigh the cube with his toy scale. it was very heavy! timmy was surprised. he played with the cube for a while longer, but then he got bored. he put it back in his toy box and went to play outside.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved books and her mommy took her to the library every week. the library was a big room with lots of shelves filled with books. 

one day, lily decided to organize her own little library in her room. she put all her books in a pile and started to sort them by size and color. she was very organized! 

lily's mommy was very proud of her for organizing her books. she even helped lily make little labels for each section of her library. now lily could easily find the book she wanted to read. and she was very happy!
once upon a time, there was a little train. the train loved to chug along its track. one day, the train saw a big bucket. the bucket was empty, so the train decided to fill it up with water. 

the train chugged and chugged, until the bucket was full. but then, the train saw a little bird. the bird had hurt its wing and couldn't fly. the train felt sad for the bird. 

so, the train decided to take the bucket of water and pour it on the ground. the train made a big puddle and the bird was happy. the train felt good for helping the bird. from that day on, the train always looked for ways to help others.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she was very sleepy, but she didn't want to go to bed. her mommy insisted that it was time for her to sleep, but lily didn't want to. she wanted to play with her toys and watch cartoons. 

finally, lily's mommy said, "if you go to sleep now, i promise you'll wake up with a big smile on your face." lily thought about it for a moment, and then she realized that her mommy was right. she was very tired and needed to sleep. 

so, lily climbed into her cozy bed and closed her eyes. she felt very sleepy, but she couldn't help but smile because she knew that her mommy was right. she needed to sleep so that she could wake up feeling happy and refreshed in the morning.
once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with his huge drum. he would bang on it all day long and laugh when he made loud noises. 

one day, timmy's friend billy came over to play. billy saw timmy's drum and said, "wow, that's a big drum!" timmy said, "yes, it's huge! do you want to play with it?" 

billy nodded his head and started to bang on the drum. timmy laughed and said, "you're really good at playing the drum, billy!" billy smiled and said, "thanks, timmy. i like playing with your drum." 

from that day on, timmy and billy played together every day. they would bang on the drum and laugh together. they were the best of friends and they loved playing music together. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little bunny. the bunny liked to hop all around the garden. one day, the bunny saw a big sunflower. it was so tall! the bunny hopped over to the sunflower and looked up at it. 

suddenly, the bunny heard a serious voice. it was the sunflower talking! the sunflower said, "little bunny, please be careful. don't hop on my petals." the bunny was surprised that the sunflower could talk. the bunny said, "i'm sorry, mr. sunflower. i didn't mean to hop on your petals." 

from that day on, the bunny and the sunflower became friends. the bunny would hop around the garden and visit the sunflower every day. the sunflower was always very serious, but the bunny liked to make the sunflower laugh by hopping around and doing silly tricks. they had lots of fun together in the garden. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily who loved to play by the stream. she would skip rocks and chase butterflies all day long. one day, as she was playing, she saw a shiny key on the ground. 

excitedly, she picked up the key and went to her mommy. "mommy, can we find the lock that this key goes to?" she asked. 

her mommy smiled and said, "sure, let's go on an adventure!" they walked along the stream, looking for a lock. suddenly, they saw a high fence with a locked gate. the key fit perfectly and they were able to unlock the gate. 

lily was so happy that they found the lock and she got to use the key. she hugged her mommy and said, "i love going on adventures with you!"
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she was very hungry and wanted to eat at a restaurant. her mom took her to a fair where there were many food stalls. lily saw a stall with yummy food and wanted to eat there. 

her mom said they didn't have enough money to buy food there. but suddenly, lily found a coin on the ground! she gained a coin and was very happy. she gave the coin to her mom and they went to the food stall. 

lily ate a delicious hot dog and her mom had a burger. they were both very happy and full. from that day on, lily always kept an eye out for coins on the ground, hoping to gain more and eat at the restaurant again.
once upon a time, there was a silly little frog named freddy. freddy loved to jump around in the pond all day long. one day, he met a beautiful frog named lily. they started to talk and freddy asked lily if she wanted to marry him. 

lily was surprised and asked, "why do you want to marry me, freddy?"

freddy replied, "because you are the prettiest frog in the pond and i want to be with you forever."

lily blushed and said, "yes, i will marry you, freddy."

after they got married, they went to the post office to buy stamps for their wedding invitations. freddy thought it was silly that they had to lick the stamps before putting them on the envelopes. but lily explained that the stamps needed to stick to the envelopes so they could be delivered to their friends and family.

from that day on, freddy and lily were the happiest couple in the pond and they always made sure to use plenty of stamps when sending letters to their loved ones.
once upon a time, there was a little bird named tweetie. tweetie lived in a treehouse with a red roof. one day, tweetie decided to fly to the park to play with his friends.

when tweetie arrived at the park, he saw his friends playing on the swings. tweetie wanted to join them, but he was afraid. "i don't know how to swing," said tweetie. "don't worry," said his friend, "i'll teach you how to swing gracefully."

tweetie tried and tried, but he couldn't swing gracefully like his friend. he felt sad and wanted to quit. "i can't do it," said tweetie. "don't quit," said his friend, "just keep trying and you'll get better."

tweetie listened to his friend and didn't quit. he kept trying and eventually, he learned how to swing gracefully. from that day on, tweetie felt proud of himself and enjoyed playing with his friends at the park.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. he loved to play outside in the dirt and mud. one day, his mom told him to come inside and wash his hands before eating his food. timmy didn't want to stop playing, so he ignored his mom's reminder.

later that day, timmy's tummy started to hurt. he realized he had eaten his food with dirty hands. he went to his mom and said, "mommy, my tummy hurts. i think i ate my food with dirty hands." his mom said, "i reminded you to wash your hands before eating. now you know why it's important."

from that day on, timmy always remembered to wash his hands before eating his food. he didn't want his tummy to hurt again.
once upon a time, a little girl had a puppy. the puppy was very cute and fluffy. one day, the little girl and her puppy went for a walk in the park. they saw a man sitting on a bench. the man looked sad and he sighed.

the little girl asked, "why are you sad?" the man replied, "i lost my puppy. i don't know where he went." the little girl felt sorry for the man and said, "don't worry. we will help you find your puppy."

so, they searched for the man's puppy. they looked everywhere, but the puppy was unknown. the little girl didn't give up and she kept looking. finally, they found the puppy hiding behind a tree. the man was very happy and he thanked the little girl and her puppy. they all went home with big smiles on their faces.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named sally. sally loved to draw with her yellow pencil. one day, sally went to the park to draw pictures of the flowers and trees. she sat on a bench and started to draw. 

suddenly, a boy walked up to sally and said, "what are you drawing?" sally said, "i'm drawing a flower. look!" the boy looked and said, "wow, that's pretty!" sally smiled and said, "thank you. do you like my yellow pencil?" the boy said, "yes, it's very bright." 

sally and the boy talked for a little while longer and then said goodbye. sally continued to draw her pictures with her yellow pencil and was very happy. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside and explore the world around her. one day, she found a shiny rock on the ground. she picked it up and showed it to her mom.

"look, mommy! i found a pretty rock!" lily said.

"that's lovely, sweetie," her mom replied. "let's go inside and wash it off in the sink."

lily followed her mom inside and watched as she turned on the faucet. she put the rock under the water and gently rubbed it with her fingers. when she was done, she handed it back to lily.

"wow! it looks even more beautiful now!" lily exclaimed.

"yes, it's the original color," her mom said with a smile.

lily was so happy with her new treasure and she kept it in her pocket all day long. she loved how it sparkled in the sunlight and how it felt smooth in her hand. she couldn't wait to show it to her friends at preschool the next day.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. he loved to eat spaghetti with a fork. one day, timmy's fork fell on the ground and got dirty. he was sad and worried because his mom would be angry.

timmy's mom saw him looking sad and asked him what was wrong. timmy told her about his dirty fork and how he was worried. his mom smiled and said it was okay, she could clean the fork. timmy was happy and felt better.

the next day, timmy went to school and saw his friends eating with fancy forks. he felt embarrassed because he only had a plain fork. but then he remembered what his mom said and felt better. he knew that his fork was special because it was his.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to climb trees and play outside. one day, she saw a unique bird with colorful feathers. she wanted to get a closer look, so she climbed up the tree. as she was climbing, she felt herself starting to tip over. but she held on tight and made it to the top. she watched the bird for a while before climbing back down. from that day on, lily always looked for unique birds to climb up and see.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to fish with his dad. they would go to the lake and sit on the dock with their fishing poles. timmy's dad would put a worm on the hook and they would wait for a fish to come.

one day, timmy felt something tug on his line. he grabbed the fishing pole and started to reel it in. it was a big fish! timmy was so excited. he showed his dad the fish and they took a picture together.

after they caught some more fish, they went home. timmy's mom cooked the fish for dinner. it tasted normal, but timmy was proud that he caught it himself. he couldn't wait to go fishing again with his dad.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she lived in a house with her mommy and daddy. their neighbor was a nice lady named mrs. smith. lily loved to visit mrs. smith because she always had cookies and milk.

one day, lily's mommy and daddy went out and left her with mrs. smith. lily felt scared because she didn't know mrs. smith very well. but mrs. smith told her to trust her and that everything would be okay.

mrs. smith gave lily a tight hug and they played games together. lily realized that mrs. smith was a nice neighbor and she didn't need to be scared. from that day on, lily trusted mrs. smith and loved to visit her.
once upon a time, there was a bird. the bird loved to fly high in the sky and feel the wind on its wings. one day, the bird saw a tv in a window. it was playing a show about other birds flying and soaring in the sky. the bird felt proud of its own flying skills and wanted to soar even higher. 

the bird flew up and up, flapping its wings with all its might. it felt the wind pushing against it, but it kept going. finally, the bird reached the clouds and soared even higher. from up there, it could see the whole town and all the other birds flying below. the bird felt very proud of itself for reaching such great heights. 

as the sun began to set, the bird knew it was time to come back down. it flew back to its nest, feeling happy and content. from that day on, the bird soared higher and higher every time it flew. it never forgot the feeling of pride it had when it first saw the tv show about soaring birds.
once upon a time, there was a friendly cat named mittens. mittens loved to explore and go on adventures. one day, mittens found a map that showed a big park with lots of trees and birds.

mittens wanted to go to the park, so she asked her friend, a dog named max, to come with her. max was happy to join mittens on her adventure.

as they walked to the park, mittens and max listened to the birds singing and the leaves rustling in the wind. when they finally arrived, they played together and had so much fun.

from then on, mittens and max went on many adventures together, always listening to the sounds around them and using their trusty map to guide them.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to help her mom in the kitchen. one day, her mom asked her to hold the sauce while she poured it into the pot. lily was so happy to help and held the sauce very carefully.

after they finished cooking, lily's mom asked her if she had tasted the sauce. lily was honest and said she didn't like it. her mom smiled and said, "that's okay, everyone has different tastes." 

later that day, lily's dad came home and asked her how her day was. she told him all about helping her mom in the kitchen and holding the sauce. her dad was proud of her for being such a good helper. 

lily went to bed that night feeling happy and proud of herself. she knew that even though she didn't like the sauce, she had been honest with her mom and that was the most important thing.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, she went to the ice cream truck and received a cone with her favorite flavor, chocolate. she was so happy and ate it quickly.

suddenly, the sky turned gloomy and it started to rain. lily didn't like the rain because it made her wet and she couldn't play outside. she said to her mom, "mommy, i don't like the rain. it's gloomy outside."

her mom replied, "don't worry, lily. we can play inside and have fun. maybe we can make some cookies together." lily smiled and said, "yay! i love cookies. thank you, mommy." and they spent the rest of the day baking and playing together.
once upon a time, there was a little bird named tweety. tweety was a happy bird, but he had a big problem. he loved to chew on feathers, but he couldn't find any feathers to chew on! one day, tweety saw a big feather on the ground. he was so happy that he started to chew on it right away.

but then, something strange happened. tweety became very grumpy. he didn't know why he felt that way. later that day, tweety saw a sign that said "don't chew on feathers, they can make you grumpy!" tweety felt silly for not reading the sign before. from that day on, tweety never chewed on feathers again and he was always happy. the end.

her mom came in and said, "don't be scared, lily. i promise you that there are no monsters under your bed." 

lily replied, "but it's still scary." 

her mom thought for a moment and said, "how about we put a nightlight in your room? that way, it won't be so scary." 

lily smiled and said, "yes, please!" so, her mom put a nightlight in her room and lily went to sleep feeling safe and happy.

so, lily decided to make her mommy happy by drawing a picture of mittens and giving it to her mommy. her mommy smiled and hugged her. lily felt happy too because her plan worked!

her mommy smiled and said, "let's check it out and see if the print inside is as good as the cover." they took the book home and lily read it over and over again. she loved the pictures and the story about the lion's adventures. from that day on, she always looked for books with big, wild animals on the cover.

after the cake was in the oven, lily went outside to play. she found some wood and started building a little house for her dolls. she loved the smell of the wood and how it felt in her hands.

when the cake was done, lily's mommy took it out of the oven and put some spicy frosting on top. lily couldn't wait to try it. she took a big bite, but it was too spicy for her. she didn't like it at all.

lily started to feel sick and her mommy had to take her to the hospital. the doctor said that the spicy frosting made her very sick and she had to stay in the hospital for a long time. lily learned that sometimes things that look and smell good can be bad for you.

at the next jazz dance party, lily showed off her new move. her friend, timmy, saw her and said, "wow, lily! that move was so cool! can you teach me how to do it?" lily was happy to teach him and they both danced together, kneeling and spinning around.

after the party, lily's dad said, "lily, you were amazing! you are such a great dancer!" lily smiled and felt proud of herself. she replied, "thanks, dad! i learned a new move today, and it was very useful!"
once upon a time, there was a wise owl who lived in a tree. every tuesday, the owl would fly to the river to catch fish for dinner. but one day, it started to rain and the owl got wet. so, the owl flew back to its tree to dry itself off. 

the owl flapped its wings and shook its feathers to get dry. after a while, the sun came out and the owl felt warm again. it decided to wait until next tuesday to catch fish. from then on, the owl always checked the weather before going out to catch fish.

"i didn't mean to, i just forgot," liam answered.

"well, you need to be more careful next time," lily said as she closed the refrigerator door. "now, let's go play outside!"

once upon a time, there was a little bird named tweety. tweety loved to fly high in the sky and sing songs. one day, tweety saw a big zigzag in the sky. tweety didn't know what it was, so he asked his friends. they guessed it was a storm coming.

tweety decided to fly away from the zigzag, but he got lost. he flew and flew, but he couldn't find his way back home. he was scared and sad. but then, he remembered something his mom had told him: "if you ever get lost, just follow the sun and you will find your way back home."

so, tweety followed the sun and it led him back home. he was so happy to be back in his perfect little nest. tweety learned that sometimes it's okay to guess, but it's always better to ask and learn. and if you ever get lost, just remember to follow the sun.
once upon a time, there was a big tank near a village. lots of fish lived in the tank and villagers loved to catch them. one day, a little boy went to the tank to catch some fish. he reached into the water, but he couldn't catch any fish. he tried and tried, but he still couldn't catch any. 

suddenly, he saw a dead fish floating on the surface of the water. he felt sad for the fish and thought about why it had died. then he realized that he had been trying to catch the fish all wrong. he had been using a sharp hook that hurt the fish, but he should have been using a net that would let the fish swim free. 

the little boy learned a valuable lesson that day. he realized that sometimes we need to change the way we do things to be kinder to others. from that day on, he always used a net to catch fish and he never hurt any of them again.

once upon a time, a little girl named lily went outside to play. she saw her friend, a little boy named timmy, and ran over to him.

"hi timmy, what are you doing?" asked lily.

"i'm trying to catch a ball," replied timmy.

lily saw the ball and picked it up. "this object is warm," she said, feeling the sun on the ball.

"can i help you catch it?" asked lily.

"yes please," said timmy.

lily threw the ball to timmy and he caught it. they played catch together for a long time and had lots of fun. when it started to get dark, they said goodbye and went home.

the next day, lily saw the same elderly lady struggling again. this time, lily knew the way and helped her carry her groceries. the lady was very grateful and thanked lily for her kindness. 

from that day on, lily always looked for ways to help others. she learned that being kind and helpful was the right way to be.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named tom. tom loved to play with his toys and cuddle with his favorite blanket. every night, tom's mom would tuck him into bed with his cozy sheet and kiss him goodnight.

one night, tom's mom seemed worried when she set his sheet on the bed. tom didn't understand why, but he felt a little scared. as he drifted off to sleep, he heard a strange noise outside his window.

tom's heart raced as he peeked out from under his sheet. suddenly, a gust of wind blew the sheet off of him and onto the floor. but then, he saw something amazing - his favorite toy had fallen out of bed and onto the sheet, making it look like a magic carpet!

tom hopped onto the sheet and rode it out the window, soaring through the night sky. he knew that he didn't have to be worried anymore, because he had his trusty sheet and his favorite toy by his side. from that night on, tom never forgot the power of his sheet and the joy of a little bit of magic.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play outside in the park. he would run around and pick up sticks and rocks. one day, timmy saw a big pile of grass. he decided to throw the grass up in the air and watch it fall down. 

as timmy was playing, he saw a man walking towards him. the man looked sad and tired. timmy's mom always told him to be kind to others, so timmy went up to the man and said hello. the man smiled and thanked timmy for being friendly. 

timmy felt grateful that he could make someone happy just by saying hello. he remembered the pile of grass he had thrown earlier and had an idea. he asked the man if he wanted to play with him and throw the grass up in the air. the man's face lit up and he said yes. 

timmy and the man played together for a while and had a lot of fun. as the man was leaving, he thanked timmy again for being so kind. timmy felt happy that he could make a new friend and was grateful for the fun they had playing together.
once upon a time, there was a little duck named quackers. quackers loved to swim in the pond. one day, quackers met a frog named ribbit. ribbit said, "hello, quackers. you are very attractive with your yellow feathers." 

quackers said, "thank you, ribbit. you are very green and slimy." 

ribbit said, "would you like to leave the pond and go on an adventure with me?" 

quackers said, "yes, i would love to go on an adventure with you!" 

so, quackers and ribbit left the pond and went on an adventure. they saw many things like trees, flowers, and birds. they had so much fun that they decided to go on more adventures together.

in the middle of the night, timmy woke up and saw that the lamp was still on. he knew he had to turn it off because it was not wise to waste electricity. timmy turned off the lamp and went back to sleep. 

the next morning, timmy's mom was very proud of him for being so wise and turning off the lamp. she gave him a big hug and told him how much she loved him. from that day on, timmy always remembered to turn off the lamp before he went to sleep.

once upon a time, there was a bear named benny. benny loved to sit under the big oak tree in the forest. one day, benny made a promise to his friend, the rabbit. benny promised to share his honey with the rabbit.

but one day, when benny went to get the honey, he found that it had gone bad. the honey was bitter and not good to eat. benny was very sad because he couldn't keep his promise to his friend.

the rabbit came to visit benny and asked for the honey. benny had to tell the truth and said that the honey was not good. the rabbit was very upset and didn't want to be friends with benny anymore. benny felt very alone and sad, wishing he could make it up to his friend.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside and explore the forest near her house. one day, she found a cushion in the woods. it was very soft and made her feel happy. she decided to take it home with her.

as she walked home, lily saw a group of animals following her. there was a rabbit, a squirrel, and a bird. they were all very friendly and wanted to play with her. lily was happy to have new friends.

the next day, lily went back to the forest with her new animal friends. they explored and played together. but as they were walking, they came across a big river. the water was too deep for lily to cross, and she didn't know what to do.

that's when the rabbit stepped forward and said, "i can lead us across the river." he had seen a log that they could use as a bridge. so, they all followed the rabbit across the log and made it safely to the other side.

lily learned that her new animal friends were very helpful and kind. she also learned that sometimes it's good to have a mild heart and make new friends. from that day on, lily and her animal friends had many more adventures together.

once upon a time, there was a little rabbit named bun bun. bun bun woke up one morning and saw the sun shining bright outside. he wanted to go play with his friends, but he was feeling very hungry. so, he went to get some carrots from the garden.

but when he got there, he saw that the carrots were very deep in the ground. he tried to pull them out, but he couldn't. "i am struggling," he said to himself.

just then, his friend, squirrel, came by. "what's wrong, bun bun?" squirrel asked. "i can't get these carrots out of the ground," bun bun replied. "i will help you," squirrel said. together, they pulled and pulled until they finally got the carrots out. "thank you, squirrel," bun bun said. they both enjoyed a tasty snack and played together all day long.
once upon a time, there was a man who liked to go kayaking. he had a red kayak that he loved very much. one day, he went kayaking on the river and his kayak hit a rock. the kayak got a big hole and the man was upset. 

but then, the man remembered that he knew how to repair things. he took his kayak to his workshop and got to work. he used some glue and some tape to fix the hole. it took some time, but finally, the kayak was good as new! 

the man was very happy that he could repair his kayak. he went back to the river and went kayaking again. this time, he was very careful and didn't hit any rocks. he had a great time on the river with his newly repaired kayak.
once upon a time, there was a little bee named buzz. buzz lived in a hive with his friends. one day, buzz wanted to explore the world outside of the hive. his friend, buzzy, warned him to be careful because there were fierce animals outside. 

buzz stepped outside and saw a big flower. he flew towards it to collect some nectar. suddenly, he saw a big, fierce bird flying towards him. buzz quickly flew back to the hive and told buzzy what happened. 

buzzy said, "i told you it's dangerous outside, buzz. you need to be careful." buzz realized that buzzy was right and promised to be more careful in the future. from that day on, buzz stayed inside the hive and never ventured outside again.

lily decided to jump over the hole, but she missed and fell in! she was scared and didn't know what to do. but then, her mommy came and helped her out of the hole. lily was so happy to be safe and back on the ground.

from that day on, lily was more careful when she played outside. she didn't want to miss and fall in another hole. but she still thought the hole was incredible and would always stop to look at it when she passed by.
once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy who was very confused. he didn't understand why he couldn't play with his toys all day, every day. his mom noticed that he was feeling confused and asked him what was wrong.

timmy responded, "i don't know why i can't play all the time. i'm just a youth."

his mom smiled and said, "let's discuss this. you can't play all the time because you need to learn new things too. playing is fun, but learning is important too."

timmy thought about it for a moment and said, "okay, i understand now. i'll play and learn too!" 

from that day on, timmy was happy and no longer confused. he played with his toys and also learned new things every day.
once upon a time, there was a big bear named ben. ben was very strong and he loved to play in the forest. one day, he met a little rabbit named rosie. rosie had a hurt eye and she was sad. ben asked if he could help her and rosie said yes. ben was happy to accept the job of helping rosie.

ben took rosie to his cave and gave her some honey. rosie felt better and thanked ben. they became friends and played together every day. ben was happy to have a new friend and rosie was happy to have someone to play with. even though they were different, they accepted each other and had fun together. the end.

timmy's mom said, "don't worry sally, we can start a new movie after this one is finished." and so, they all watched the princess and the dragon together, and sally was happy again. the end.
once upon a time, there was a poor man who walked with a cane. he needed the cane to help him walk because his leg hurt. one day, his friend came to him and asked to borrow the cane. the poor man was kind and said yes, he could lend the cane to his friend. 

the friend used the cane for a little while and then brought it back to the poor man. the poor man was happy to have his cane back because he needed it to walk. 

even though the poor man didn't have much, he was still happy to help his friend. he knew that sometimes people need help and it's important to be kind and lend a hand or a cane when you can.
once upon a time, there was a little dog named max. max had a big paw and loved to play all day. one day, max's friend lily came to play with him. "hi max, are you ready to play?" asked lily. "yes, i am!" replied max.

they decided to play catch with a ball. max ran to catch the ball but it was too high for him to reach. "i can't catch it, it's too high!" said max. lily said, "don't worry max, i can lift you up so you can catch it." so, lily lifted max up and he caught the ball with his big paw.

max was so happy that he gave lily a big lick on her face. lily laughed and said, "you are such a good dog, max!" they continued to play catch until the sun went down. max was tired but happy because he had so much fun with his friend.
once upon a time, there was a little bird. the bird had a bright yellow chest and loved to fly in the sky. one day, the bird saw a big plane zooming by and wanted to try it too. 

the bird flew up to the plane and tried to land on it. but the plane was too fast and the bird hit its chest on the plane's wing. the bird fell down to the ground and hurt itself badly. 

the other birds tried to help, but it was too late. the little bird's chest stopped moving and it went to sleep forever. the other birds were sad and missed their friend very much. they learned that it's not always safe to zoom around without being careful.
once upon a time, there was a big bookcase in a house. the bookcase was very tall and had many books on it. a little boy named timmy loved to look at the books on the bookcase. one day, timmy climbed up to reach a book on the highest shelf. he accidentally knocked over some books and the bookcase started to wobble. timmy was scared that the bookcase would fall on him, so he stayed very still and tried not to move. 

suddenly, a fierce wind blew through the window and knocked the bookcase over. but timmy was safe because he stayed still and didn't move. his mom came running in to see what happened and was very proud of timmy for being so brave. from then on, timmy knew to be careful around the bookcase and to always stay still if it started to wobble.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved music and always wanted to play the flute. one day, her mommy bought her a flute and she was so happy. 

lily tried to play it, but it didn't sound good. she asked her mommy why it didn't sound like the music she heard. her mommy said, "you have to examine the flute and see if everything is okay."

lily looked at the flute and found out that one of the holes was covered. she fixed it and tried to play again. this time, it sounded beautiful! she was so successful in playing the flute. 

the moral of the story is that if you want to do something, you have to examine everything to make sure it's right. if you do that, you can be successful in anything you want to do.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her toys and run around outside. but one day, her mom told her she had to study for a test at school. lily didn't want to study because it wasn't easy for her.

instead, she decided to play with her toys and forgot all about studying. the next day, she went to school and took the test. but she didn't do well because she didn't study. her teacher was disappointed and gave her a mop to clean the classroom as a punishment.

lily realized that studying was important and promised to do better next time. she cleaned the classroom with the mop and thought about how she could make studying easier for herself. from then on, she made sure to study every day and never forgot the importance of it.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside with her friends. one day, lily's mom said, "lily, i will teach you how to ride a bike today." lily was very excited and said, "thank you, mommy! you are so helpful."

lily's mom showed her how to ride the bike and held onto the back of it. lily pedaled and pedaled until she was riding on her own. she laughed and shouted, "look mommy, i'm doing it!"

later that day, lily went to play with her friends. she saw her friend, timmy, who was feeling sad. lily asked him, "what's wrong, timmy?" timmy said, "i lost my toy." lily said, "don't worry, i will help you find it." they searched and searched until they found the toy. timmy was so happy and he laughed and said, "thank you, lily. you are a good friend."
once upon a time, there was a dog named spot. spot loved to go for walks with his owner. one day, spot and his owner went to the park. spot saw a big tree and ran over to it. he shook his body and a bunch of leaves fell on him. 

after playing in the leaves, spot's owner said it was time for some exercise. they started running around the park. spot loved to run and jump. he felt very happy and healthy. 

when they finished exercising, spot's owner gave him a fancy treat. it was a big bone covered in yummy sauce. spot licked his lips and ate it all up. he was very happy and felt like a fancy dog. the end.
once upon a time, there was a happy dog named spot. spot loved to go for walks with his owner, lily. lily always put spot on his leash before they went outside. spot liked to sniff around and explore the world. one day, lily took spot to a popular park where lots of other dogs were playing. spot was excited to meet new friends. 

lily sat down on a bench and gave spot a treat. spot sniffed the treat and then took a bite. he loved the taste! suddenly, spot saw a squirrel and tried to run after it. but his leash stopped him. spot barked and pulled, but he couldn't get free. lily laughed and gave him a pat on the head. "silly spot," she said. "you can't chase every squirrel you see!"
once upon a time, there was a poor frog. he lived in a big pond with lots of other frogs. one day, he wanted to impress his friends by jumping really high. but when he tried to jump, he fell into the water and got all wet. his friends laughed at him and he felt embarrassed. 

the poor frog didn't want his friends to think he was bad at jumping. so, he practiced every day until he could jump higher than all the other frogs. when he showed off his new skills, his friends were amazed and no longer laughed at him. 

from that day on, the frog was no longer embarrassed and felt proud of himself. he realized that even if he was poor, he could still do great things. and his friends were happy for him too. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play hide-and-seek with her friends. one day, she decided to peek behind the big tree in her yard. 

as she peeked, she saw a little bird sitting on a branch. the bird was very quiet, and lily didn't want to scare it away. 

lily watched the bird for a while, but then she heard her mom calling her. it was time to come inside for dinner. 

lily was sad to leave the bird, but she knew she would come back to visit it again. she went inside and saw that her mom was busy cooking dinner. they sat down to eat together and talked about their day. lily was happy to have such a nice family.
once upon a time, there was a big red ball. it bounced around all day and made the children very happy. one day, a naughty dog came and bit the ball. the ball got a big knot and couldn't bounce anymore. the children were sad and demanded the dog to say sorry. the dog felt bad and licked the ball to make it better. the children were happy again and played with the ball all day long.
once upon a time, there was a little boat that loved to sail on the big blue sea. the boat was made of wood and had a white sail that would catch the wind and take it wherever it wanted to go. one day, the boat sailed to a faraway island where it saw a tall pine tree. the tree was so tall that it touched the sky! the boat was amazed by the tree's beauty and decided to stay there for a while.

but as the day turned into night, the sky turned pale and the wind started to blow very hard. the boat tried to sail away, but the wind was too strong and it couldn't move. suddenly, a big wave came and hit the boat, making it crash into the pine tree. the boat was broken and it couldn't sail anymore. the little boat was very sad because it couldn't sail on the big blue sea anymore.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her toys and have fun. one day, her mommy took her to the zoo to see the animals. lily was so excited to see all the different animals. 

they saw lions, tigers, and bears. they even saw a rare bird with colorful feathers. lily loved watching the animals, but she started to get hungry. her mommy took out a sandwich and fed it to her. 

after she finished eating, they went to the playground where lily had more fun. she went down the slide and played on the swings. she had such a great day at the zoo with her mommy.
once upon a time, a little squirrel named nutty loved to collect acorns. one day, she found a big, shiny acorn and was very happy. but then, she saw another squirrel named sammy who also wanted the acorn. they both wanted it so much that they started to fight over it.

nutty was very fast and managed to get the acorn first, but then she realized she had hurt sammy. she felt guilty and sad. she knew she shouldn't have fought over the acorn.

later that day, nutty saw sammy again. she felt bad and wanted to make things right. so she went over to sammy and gave her the acorn. sammy was surprised and happy. she clapped her hands and thanked nutty.

nutty learned that it's better to share than to fight over things. she felt happy that she had made sammy happy and knew that she had done the right thing. from that day on, nutty always shared her acorns with her friends.
once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy went to the store with his mommy to buy some candy. while they were walking, they saw a man selling arrows. timmy thought the arrows looked cool, so he asked his mommy to buy him one. 

his mommy said no, but timmy was very upset. he decided to take the arrow when his mommy wasn't looking. he hid it in his pocket and they left the store. 

when they got home, timmy wanted to play with his new arrow. he shot it at his mommy's favorite vase and it broke into a million pieces. his mommy was very angry and told timmy that what he did was disgusting. timmy felt very bad and cried. 

from that day on, timmy learned that it's not okay to take things without asking and to always listen to his mommy.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside, even when it was very cold and the ground was icy. one day, she was playing with her friend timmy when they saw a beautiful bird in a tree. 

"look, timmy! look at the pretty bird!" said lily, pointing with her finger. 

timmy looked up and his eyes got very big. "wow, that bird is so cool! it makes me excited!" he said. 

lily and timmy watched the bird for a while, but then it flew away. they were sad that they couldn't see it anymore. 

"maybe we can see it again another day," said lily. "but we should remember to always appreciate the beautiful things we see with our eyes, even if they don't stay with us forever." 

"okay, lily," said timmy. "i will remember that." 

and from that day on, lily and timmy always looked for the beauty in the world around them, even when it was icy and cold outside.
once upon a time, there was a big garden. in the garden, there was a rake. the rake was very useful to clean up the leaves. one day, a fierce wind blew and many leaves fell on the ground. the garden owner took the rake and started cleaning. it seemed like a lot of work, but the garden looked better when the leaves were gone. the rake was happy to help!
once upon a time, there was a little dog named spot. spot loved to play outside in the park. one day, spot saw a big bone on the ground. spot was so happy and ran to get the bone. but when spot got close to the bone, the ground started to tremble. spot was scared and ran away.

spot saw his friend, a little bird named tweety, and told her what happened. tweety said, "maybe the ground trembled because there is a big, harsh monster under the ground." spot was even more scared now.

but then, spot thought about the bone again. he really wanted it. so, he went back to the bone, even though he was trembling with fear. when he got there, he saw that the ground was only shaking because there was a big truck driving by. spot was relieved and happy to finally have his bone.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play in the rain and jump in the puddles. one day, she went outside and it started to rain. she ran around and got very wet. her clothes were soaked and her hair was dripping.

as she was walking back to her house, she saw a big rainbow in the sky. she wondered how it got there and why it was so pretty. she felt happy and excited to see something so wonderful.

when she got inside, her mom made her a cup of hot chocolate. lily took a sip and made a funny face because it tasted bitter. her mom added some sugar and stirred it until it tasted sweet. lily smiled and felt warm inside.
once upon a time, there was a big bear who lived in the forest. one day, he met a little bird who was lost. "can you help me find my way home?" asked the bird. "sure, i can help you," replied the bear. they walked and walked, but they couldn't find the bird's home.

then the bear said, "imagine if we could fly like you, we could find your home faster." the bird said, "i can't carry you, but i can show you the way." the bear followed the bird, but he got tired and hungry. suddenly, he saw a comb on the ground. "i'll eat this comb," he thought. but the comb got stuck in his throat and he couldn't breathe. the bird tried to help, but it was too late. the bear had died.

the little bird was sad and flew away, still lost in the forest. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to draw pictures in his notebook. his notebook was hard and had a red cover. one day, timmy's little sister, lily, wanted to draw in his notebook too. but timmy didn't want her to because he thought she would ruin his drawings.

lily felt sad and didn't understand why timmy wouldn't share. so, she decided to measure her own notebook to show timmy that it was just as good as his. but timmy still didn't want to share. this made lily very upset and she started to cry.

their mom came in and saw what was happening. she explained to timmy that it was important to share and that lily's notebook was just as special as his. timmy finally understood and they all ended up drawing together in lily's notebook. from that day on, timmy learned to share and they all had fun drawing together. the end.
once upon a time, there was an old lady. she had a big book with lots of words called a dictionary. every day, she would read it to learn new words. 

one day, a little girl came to visit the old lady. the girl saw the dictionary and asked what it was. the old lady said, "it's a big book with lots of words to help me learn." 

the little girl was curious and asked if she could read it too. the old lady smiled and said, "of course, you can read it too. it's never too early or too late to learn new words." 

and so, the little girl and the old lady sat together and read the dictionary, learning new words and having fun. from that day on, the little girl loved to read and learn new things.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to eat spicy food, but her mommy always said it was too hot for her little tummy. one day, lily and her mommy went to the train station to visit her grandma. they got on the train and found a seat.

lily was excited to eat her favorite spicy chips on the train, but her mommy said no. "you know spicy food makes your tummy hurt," she said. "let's wait until we get to grandma's house and settle in."

lily was disappointed, but she listened to her mommy. as they rode the train, they saw a man with a big bag. lily wondered what was inside. suddenly, the man's bag fell and spilled all over the floor. it was full of spicy chips! the man was upset and didn't know what to do. 

lily remembered what her mommy said about settling in first, so she offered to help the man clean up his chips. he was grateful and even gave lily a bag of her own to eat when they got to grandma's house. lily was happy and her tummy didn't hurt because she waited to settle in before eating her spicy chips.
once upon a time, there was a big, brown cow named betsy. betsy had a big horn on her head that she used to scratch her itchy spots. one day, betsy was walking in the field and saw a little boy named timmy. 

timmy was very curious and asked betsy, "what's that on your head?" 

"it's my horn," replied betsy. 

timmy asked, "can i touch it?" 

betsy said, "sure, but be careful. it's sharp and might bite you." 

timmy touched the horn and said, "ouch! that hurt!" 

betsy felt bad and said, "i'm sorry. i didn't mean to hurt you. i was ignorant and didn't think about how sharp my horn is." 

timmy forgave betsy and they became friends. from that day on, betsy was more careful with her horn and timmy learned to be cautious around animals with horns.
once upon a time, there was a little bunny named benny. benny loved to draw with his pastel crayons. one day, benny's friend, a little bird, asked him if he wanted to play outside. benny said, "no, i want to draw." the little bird said, "okay, i'll come back later."

benny drew all day and gained a lot of confidence in his drawing skills. but when he looked outside, he saw that it was dark. he felt confused because he didn't realize how much time had passed. he went to bed feeling proud of his drawings.

the next morning, benny woke up to find that all of his drawings were ruined because he had left them out in the rain. benny was very sad and wished he had gone outside to play with his friend instead.
once upon a time, there was a happy fish named nemo. nemo swam in the bright blue sea every day with his friends. one day, they found a big reef with lots of colorful coral. nemo wanted to explore the reef, but it was too deep for him to swim down. so, he asked his friend dory to help him.

dory was happy to help and she swam down to the reef. nemo watched as dory kneel down and looked closely at the coral. she found a hidden treasure and brought it back to nemo. they were both very excited and swam back to their friends to show them the treasure.

from that day on, nemo and dory visited the reef often, and they always found new and exciting things to discover. they never forgot the bright colors of the coral and the fun they had exploring together.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to eat salad for lunch every day. one day, lily's mommy asked her to hurry up and finish her salad because they needed to go to the park.

lily replied, "but mommy, my tummy hurts. i can't eat my salad too fast."

mommy said, "okay, take your time. but we need to hurry so we can play before it gets dark."

lily tried her best to eat her salad as quickly as she could without getting hurt. when she finished, she said, "i'm ready, mommy! let's go play!"
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in the sun. one day, she started to run and play with her friends. they had an amazing time together.

after a while, lily's friends went home, but she wanted to stay outside. she found a rock and started to rub it. it felt smooth and nice in her hands. suddenly, she heard a loud noise. it was a big truck that started to drive towards her.

lily tried to move away, but it was too late. the truck hit her and she fell down. her parents came running out of the house and saw what had happened. they called an ambulance, but it was too late. lily had died from her injuries.

her parents were devastated and couldn't believe what had happened. they wished they could go back in time and stop lily from playing with the rock. they knew that it was a terrible accident, but they still blamed themselves for not being there to protect her.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. lily loved to play outside in the sun with her friends. one day, they decided to play a game of tag. lily was running so fast that she didn't see a rock in her way. she tripped and fell, ripping her favorite dress.

lily was sad because her dress was torn. her friend sarah saw that lily was upset and offered her a cloth to wipe away her tears. lily was grateful for her friend's kindness and felt better.

later, lily's mom asked her what happened to her dress. lily told her the truth and said, "i tripped and fell." her mom was proud of her for being honest and said, "it's okay to make mistakes. the important thing is to learn from them and step forward." 

lily learned that it's important to be honest and grateful for the kindness of others. she also learned that it's okay to make mistakes and to keep moving forward.

"don't worry, lily. we can study together and you will do great on your exam," said her mom. so, they spent the rest of the day studying and practicing for lily's exam. 

the next day, lily went to school and took her exam. she felt proud of herself because she had studied so hard. after school, it started to rain again, but lily didn't mind because she knew she had done her best on her exam.
once upon a time, there was a dog named max. max was a big, furry dog with a long, curly tail. his owner, lily, always took him for walks on a leash. the leash was a long, red rope that lily held tightly so max wouldn't run away.

one day, lily and max went for a walk in the park. it was a dark and cloudy day, but they still had fun. max saw a big ball and ran to get it. lily squeezed the leash so max wouldn't go too far. max brought the ball back to lily and they played together for a while.

suddenly, it started to rain! lily and max ran back home as fast as they could. when they got home, max was wet and tired. lily gave him a big hug and they snuggled together on the couch. max was happy to be home and dry.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved dinosaurs more than anything else in the whole world. he had a toy dinosaur that he carried with him everywhere he went. one day, timmy's friend billy came over to play.

"hey timmy, i brought my toy dinosaur too! let's play together!" said billy.

timmy looked at billy's dinosaur and didn't like it as much as his own. "no, i don't want to play with your dinosaur. mine is better," said timmy.

billy felt sad and left to go home. timmy's mom saw what happened and talked to timmy. "timmy, it's not nice to not accept other people's toys. it's important to be kind to others and share your things," said timmy's mom.

timmy realized he was wrong and felt bad. he went to find billy and said, "i'm sorry for not accepting your dinosaur. let's play together now." billy forgave timmy and they had fun playing with both of their dinosaurs. timmy learned that it's important to be ready to accept others and their things.
once upon a time, a little boy named timmy went outside to play. he saw a big puddle and jumped in it. his shoes got wet and he felt happy. then, his mom called him inside for lunch.

at lunchtime, timmy's mom gave him a sandwich and a glass of milk. he took a bite and realized the sandwich was disgusting. he said, "mommy, this sandwich tastes yucky." she replied, "sorry, timmy. i accidentally used old bread. let me make you a new one."

while his mom made a new sandwich, timmy decided to draw a letter to his grandma. he wrote "g" for grandma and drew a picture of a flower. he put the letter in an envelope and asked his mom for a stamp. she said, "sure, let's go to the post office." on the way, they saw a big fountain. timmy said, "mommy, can we soak our feet in the water?" she said, "of course, let's do it!" they took off their shoes and socks and put their feet in the water. timmy felt happy again.
once upon a time, there was a man who liked to write. he would always sit quietly at his desk and scribble words on paper. one day, a little girl came to visit the man. she asked him, "what are you writing, mister?"

"i'm writing a story," replied the man. "would you like to help me?"

the little girl nodded her head and the man gave her a pencil and some paper. they both wrote together, quietly and happily. when they finished, the man read the story aloud and the little girl clapped her hands with joy.

from that day on, the man and the little girl wrote many stories together. they always sat quietly and enjoyed each other's company. the end.

later, the bird saw a bug. the bug looked very tasty, but the bird knew it could be poison. the bird decided not to eat it and flew away. 

as the sun started to set, the bird flew back to its cozy nest. it was happy to be home and safe. the bird fell asleep, dreaming of flying in the sky and singing beautiful songs.

her mom replied, "of course, lily! we can play together."

as he got closer, he saw something appear on the tree. it was a big, juicy apple! the bunny was so happy and started to nibble on it. but then, he heard a noise and turned around to see a big bear coming towards him.

the bunny was scared and ran away as fast as he could. he didn't want to share his dessert with the bear! from that day on, the bunny was more careful when looking for dessert and always kept an eye out for any animals that might appear.
once upon a time, there was a kind rabbit. the rabbit lived in a big garden with lots of fruit trees. one day, the rabbit saw a squirrel steal some fruit from the garden. 

the rabbit said, "why did you steal the fruit?" 

the squirrel replied, "i'm sorry. i was hungry and had no food." 

the kind rabbit said, "that's okay. you can have some of my fruit. i have plenty to share." 

from that day on, the rabbit and the squirrel became friends and shared the fruit in the garden. they never had to steal again.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved going to the beach with her mommy and daddy. one day, they went to the beach and lily saw a mighty wave coming towards her. she got scared and ran to her mommy.

"mommy, mommy, look at the big wave!" said lily.

"it's okay, sweetie. waves are fun. let's go splash in the water!" said her mommy.

lily and her mommy went into the water and started splashing around. they laughed and had so much fun. lily loved the beach and didn't want to leave. but eventually, it was time to go home. as they were leaving, lily said, "mommy, can we come back to the beach and splash in the waves again?"

"of course, we can come back anytime you want!" said her mommy.

and with that, lily was happy and excited to come back to the beach and play in the waves again.
once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy had a big ear that he liked to wiggle. one day, timmy went to the store to sell some toys. he wanted to buy a new toy that was reliable and would make him happy. 

at the store, timmy met a nice man who wanted to buy his toys. the man said he was reliable and would always be fair. timmy was happy because he could sell his toys and buy a new one. 

as timmy left the store, he wiggled his big ear and smiled. he was excited to play with his new toy and knew he could always trust the reliable man at the store. the end.

after breakfast, lily's mom asked her to help with the laundry. lily was a little naughty and didn't want to help. but her mom said it was important to help each other. so, lily helped her mom put the dirty clothes in the washing machine.
