once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in her backyard. one day, she found a new toy. it was a long stick that she could use to measure things. 

lily's mom saw her playing with the stick and said, "that's a nice rod, lily. you can use it to measure how tall the flowers are." 

lily was excited to try it out. she went over to the flowers and held the rod up to them. "wow!" she exclaimed. "these flowers are taller than i thought!" 

later that day, lily's dad came home from work. he saw lily measuring things with her new rod and said, "that's a great tool, lily. you can use it to measure how much you've grown." 

lily was curious. she held the rod up to herself and saw that she had grown a little bit since the last time she measured. she was so happy and proud of herself. from that day on, lily used her new rod to measure everything she could find.
once upon a time, there was a big whale. he was very happy swimming in the ocean. one day, he met a little fish. the fish asked, "do you have any food to supply me?" the whale replied, "i don't have any food, but i can take you to a place where you can find some."

the whale took the little fish to a beautiful orange reef. the fish was so happy to see all the food he could eat. the whale said goodbye and swam away. but as the little fish was eating, a big shark came and ate him up. the whale never saw the little fish again.

the end.
once upon a time, there was a mommy bird and her young babies. they lived in a nest in a tall tree. one day, a big storm came and the wind was very strong. the mommy bird had to raise her wings to keep her babies warm and safe. she was very calm even though she was scared.

after the storm, the mommy bird and her young babies were very happy because they were okay. the mommy bird knew she had to teach her young babies how to fly so they could be ready for the next storm. she showed them how to raise their wings and fly high in the sky.

the young babies were very excited to fly and explore the world. they were also very calm because they knew their mommy was always there to help them. from that day on, the mommy bird and her young babies flew together and had many adventures.
once upon a time, there was a sister named lily. she loved to play outside, even when it was icy. one day, lily's brother asked her to come inside for some hot cocoa. 

lily said, "no, i want to play outside more." 

her brother said, "but it's too icy. you might slip and fall." 

lily thought about it and said, "okay, i'll come inside." 

they went inside and her brother spread a blanket on the floor. they sat on it and drank hot cocoa together. 

lily said, "thank you for being a good brother." 

her brother replied, "i love you, sister." 

and they hugged each other tightly.
once upon a time, there was a happy little girl named lily. she loved spending time with her jolly auntie, who always made her laugh. one day, they went on a trip to the park. auntie brought a big bag with her, and lily asked what was inside. 

auntie said, "i have a surprise for you, lily! it's a toy that we can play with together." she reached into her bag and pulled out a toy car. lily's eyes got big and she clapped her hands with joy. auntie helped her load the toy car with little dolls and they had a fun time playing together at the park. 

when it was time to go home, auntie gave lily a big hug and said, "i had so much fun with you today, my little sunshine!" lily smiled and hugged her back, feeling happy and loved. she couldn't wait to play with auntie again soon.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to sleep in her cozy bed every night. one morning, she woke up early because she heard a loud noise. it was her cat, fluffy, who knocked over a vase. lily was very upset because the vase was very special to her.

later that day, lily and her mom went for a walk in the park. they saw a big dog passing by. lily was scared of dogs, but her mom held her hand tightly and they walked away safely.

at dinner time, lily's dad came home from work. he was very proud of himself because he got a promotion at his job. but lily was sad because she didn't have a good day. she told her dad about the broken vase and the scary dog. her dad listened carefully and gave her a big hug. he said, "don't worry, lily. we can fix the vase and i'm proud of you for being brave around the dog." 

lily felt much better after talking to her dad. she learned that even when things go wrong, her family will always be there to make her feel better.
once upon a time, there was a messy room. toys were everywhere, and it was hard to walk without stepping on something. a little girl named lily didn't want to clean it up, so she just stared at the mess.

suddenly, a leopard appeared in the room! the leopard looked very angry because it couldn't walk around without tripping on the toys. lily was scared and didn't know what to do, but she knew she had to help the leopard.

lily started to pick up the toys and put them away. the leopard watched her and seemed to calm down. when the room was finally clean, the leopard was able to walk around without any problems. it even gave lily a big hug to say thank you! from that day on, lily learned that cleaning up can make everyone happy.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved playing with her toys and talking to her stuffed animals. one day, she went to visit her grandma's house. grandma had a big, old clock that chimed every hour. lily was fascinated by it.

as they were eating lunch, lily asked, "grandma, what's inside the clock?" 

"well, it's a bunch of gears and springs that make it work," replied grandma.

lily thought about this for a moment and then asked, "does it weigh a lot?"

"yes, it's pretty heavy," said grandma.

that night, lily was sleeping in the guest room when she heard a strange noise. she looked up and saw a ghost floating in the air! the ghost was persistent and wouldn't go away. 

lily was scared and ran to her grandma's room. "grandma, there's a ghost in my room!" she cried.

grandma went to investigate and found that the old clock had stopped working. she knew just what to do. she fixed the clock and the ghost disappeared. from then on, lily loved the clock even more and would always ask, "grandma, can we weigh the clock again?"
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to draw and color with her crayons. one day, she drew a picture of a seal. it was very creative, with lots of colors and patterns.

but then, lily's little brother came along and accidentally spilled juice on her drawing. lily was very upset and started to cry. she didn't know what to do.

her mom came to see what was wrong and saw the ruined drawing. she told lily that accidents happen and that she could always make another picture. lily felt a little better, but she still wanted her seal picture back.

so, her mom helped her make a new seal picture. lily was very happy and proud of her new creative drawing. she learned that even when things don't go as planned, there's always a way to make things better.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to go to the market with her mom to buy fruits and vegetables. one day, while they were at the market, lily saw a deep blue balloon. she wanted it so badly, but her mom said they couldn't buy it because it was too expensive.

lily felt sad, but her mom promised to buy her a different balloon that would fit their budget. they finally found a red balloon that lily liked and they bought it.

later that day, lily and her mom went to the park to play with the balloon. suddenly, the wind blew the balloon away and it got stuck in a tree. lily was sad again because she couldn't play with her balloon.

but then, a man passing by saw the balloon and climbed the tree to get it for lily. she was so happy and thanked the man. her mom told her that it's always good to be kind to others because you never know when someone will help you out.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in her garden. one day, she found a plant with a beautiful flower on it. she carefully picked it up and tried to balance it on her finger.

suddenly, she heard a serious voice calling out to her. it was her mom, telling her to be careful with the plant. lily listened and put the plant back in the ground.

from then on, lily made sure to always balance her playtime with being careful and taking care of the plants in her garden. she learned that it was important to be serious when it came to taking care of things that were alive, like plants.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily who lived in a small village. she loved to play with her toys and her friends, but one day she did something wrong. she took a cookie from the jar without asking her mom first.

when her mom found out, she said, "lily, you broke the law. taking things without asking is wrong. you need to be punished."

lily felt very lonely and sad because she knew she did something bad. she said, "i'm sorry, mommy. i won't do it again."

her mom hugged her and said, "it's okay, lily. just remember to always ask before taking things. that's the law."
once upon a time, there was a fish named bob. bob lived in a big tank in a pet store. he had lots of friends, but he was always sad. he wanted to go home to the ocean.

one day, a kind family came to the pet store. they saw bob and fell in love with him. they bought him and took him home. bob was so happy! he swam and played in his new tank.

but the family didn't know that bob needed oxygen to breathe. they didn't have an oxygen machine for him. bob tried to tell them, but they didn't understand. he spent all his available oxygen trying to breathe.

sadly, bob passed away that night. the family was so sad. they didn't know what they did wrong. they learned a lesson that day, to always listen to their pets and take care of them.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with dough and make all sorts of shapes. one day, she made a big ball and rolled it high up in the air.

her little brother, max, saw it and said, "wow, lily! that's so high!"

lily replied, "yes, it is! let's march around it and see how big it is." so they marched around the ball of dough, singing and laughing.

suddenly, the ball of dough fell and splattered all over the ground. max said, "oh no! what happened?"

lily explained, "i rolled it too high and it couldn't stay up anymore. that's okay though, we can make another one!" and they happily went back to playing with dough.
once upon a time, there was a little duck named ducky. ducky lived in a pond with his family and friends. one day, ducky saw a bright and shiny object in the water. it was a raft! ducky had never seen a raft before, so he climbed on it and started to play.

but suddenly, the raft started to move! ducky tried to get off, but he couldn't. he was scared and didn't know what to do. luckily, ducky's mother saw him and quickly came to his rescue. she helped him escape from the raft and brought him back to safety.

from that day on, ducky learned an important lesson. he realized that sometimes things that look fun can be dangerous. he promised to always be careful and listen to his mother's advice. and whenever he saw a bright and shiny object, he would remember to think twice before playing with it.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play at the shore, where the water meets the sand. one day, she saw a silly crab walking along the shore. the crab was moving sideways and lily thought it looked funny. 

suddenly, lily's little brother came running towards her. he was crying because he lost his favorite toy. lily knew how much the toy meant to her brother, so she started to look for it. she searched high and low, until she found it buried in the sand. her brother was so happy and gave her a big hug. lily felt proud and happy that she could help her brother. 

from that day on, every time lily went to the shore, she kept an eye out for her brother's toy. she knew how much it meant to him and she wanted to make sure it was always safe. and sometimes, when she was lucky, she would see the silly crab again, moving sideways along the shore.
once upon a time, there was a little dog named max. max liked to run and play in the park with his friends. one day, max hurt his paw while playing. his owner took him to the veterinarian who helped max feel better. max was happy and wagged his tail.

max liked to go on walks with his owner. one day, they walked by a construction site. it was very noisy! max wondered why the big machines made so much noise. his owner explained that the machines were building a new building. max thought it was interesting and wagged his tail. 

at night, max slept in his cozy bed. he dreamed about playing with his friends and going on walks with his owner. max was happy and felt loved. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved dinosaurs. he had a toy dinosaur that he carried with him everywhere he went. one day, timmy went to the park to play. while he was there, he saw a foolish dinosaur walking around. it was really big and scary-looking. timmy decided to follow the dinosaur to see where it was going. 

timmy followed the dinosaur through the park and into the woods. the dinosaur was very fast and timmy had to run to keep up. eventually, they came to a big cave. the foolish dinosaur went inside and timmy followed. 

inside the cave, timmy saw that the foolish dinosaur was actually very friendly. it just wanted to play with timmy and show him around. they had a lot of fun together, playing games and exploring the cave. when it was time to go home, timmy said goodbye to the dinosaur and promised to come back and visit again soon.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she liked to play outside in the garden. one day, she saw a mole digging a hole in the ground. she recognized the mole because she had seen one before in a book.

lily wanted to say hello to the mole, but the mole didn't hear her. so, lily started to sing a song. the mole popped his head out of the hole and looked at lily. lily thought the mole was cute, but the mole thought lily was rude for interrupting his work.

lily apologized to the mole and they became friends. they played together in the garden every day. the mole showed lily how to dig a hole and lily showed the mole how to sing a song. they had lots of fun together and never forgot their first meeting.

"look what i got, timmy! it's a coin!" said lily.

"wow, that's so cool! you're so strong for finding it," replied timmy.

lily felt proud of herself for being strong and finding the coin. she decided to save it in her piggy bank at home. from that day on, lily always looked for coins when she played outside with her friends. she wanted to get more coins and become even stronger.

max's owner decided to give him special food that would raise his power. she also gave him lots of love and cuddles. after a few days, max started to feel much better! he had more power to play with his ball and dig in the dirt.

but one day, max got very dirty from digging in a filthy mud puddle. his owner didn't mind, though. she knew that even though max was filthy, he was still her lovable dog. and max was happy, because he got to play in the mud and feel the power of being a dog!

the king asked his friends to help him look for his crown. they searched high and low but still couldn't find it. the king started to feel sad because he loved his large crown so much. just when he thought he would never find it, his dog came running up with the crown in his mouth. the king was so happy that he paused to give his dog a big hug. from then on, he made sure to always keep his crown safe while he played.

suddenly, the little girl saw a baby calf. it was so cute and small. she ran towards it and hugged it. the old farmer smiled and said, "that calf is new to the ranch. it was born just yesterday." the little girl was very happy to see the baby calf. she played with it for a while and then said goodbye to the old farmer. she promised to come back soon to see the animals again.

lily replied, "sure, but first we have to dress up like princesses!" 

so they put on their princess dresses and played with the rubber ball all afternoon. they bounced it so high that it almost reached the clouds! 

when it was time to go home, lily said, "i had so much fun playing with you, timmy. let's do it again tomorrow!" 

and timmy replied, "yes, let's play with the high rubber ball and dress up like princesses every day!"
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to eat tuna sandwiches for lunch. one day, her mom made her a tuna sandwich, but it was cold. lily didn't like it when her sandwich was cold because it didn't taste as good.

her mom asked her if she understood why the sandwich was cold. lily said "yes, it was in the fridge". her mom smiled and said "that's right, lily. it's important to keep our food in the fridge so it stays fresh and safe to eat."

lily learned that sometimes her food might be cold, but it's for a good reason. from that day on, she always made sure to ask her mom if her sandwich was cold or not before taking a bite.

lily asked her mommy, "can we feed the bird, please?" 

her mommy said, "sure, let's give the bird some bread crumbs." 

lily felt very happy that they could help the bird. but suddenly, she saw her friend from school watching them. lily was ashamed because she thought her friend might make fun of her for feeding a bird. 

her mommy noticed how lily felt and said, "don't be ashamed, lily. it's a good thing to help others, even if they are just little birds." 

lily smiled and felt proud that she could help the little bird.
once upon a time, there was a silly bunny named benny. benny liked to hop and play all day. one day, benny was very hungry and had no food to eat. his mommy bunny went to the garden to provide some carrots for him. but benny didn't want carrots, he wanted candy!

benny went to the store to find candy, but he didn't have any money. he saw a steel jar full of candy and he stole it. benny was happy to have candy, but he didn't know it was wrong to steal. the store owner saw benny and called the police.

benny got in trouble and had to go to jail. he missed his mommy bunny and wished he had just eaten the carrots she provided. the end.
once upon a time, there was a big lion in the jungle. he liked to roar very loudly so that all the animals could hear him. one day, a little girl came to the jungle. she had a pretty bracelet on her wrist. the lion saw the bracelet and thought it was very nice. he asked the little girl if he could wear it. she said yes and put the bracelet on the lion's paw. the lion was very happy and felt mild and calm wearing the bracelet. from that day on, the lion would wear the bracelet every time he wanted to feel mild and calm.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her toys and cuddle with her teddy bear. one day, her mommy and daddy decided to light a fire in the fireplace to keep the house warm.

lily's mommy warned her not to get too close to the fireplace because it was very hot. "i dare you to touch it," said lily's big brother, jack. but lily knew it was dangerous and didn't want to get burned.

later that night, lily's family sat around the fireplace and roasted marshmallows. suddenly, they heard a loud noise coming from the chimney. it was a bird that had gotten stuck and couldn't get out! jack tried to grab it, but it was too high up.

lily had an idea. she grabbed her teddy bear and held it up to the chimney. the bird saw the teddy bear and flew towards it, finally escaping the fireplace. everyone cheered and lily felt proud of herself for being brave and helping the bird. and even though the fireplace was now covered in soot and ash, no one thought it was disgusting because they were all happy the bird was safe.

one night, red and blue were driving around when they saw a shooting star in the sky. they both made a wish to always be together and to always shine bright like the stars. from that day on, red and blue would always drive together and shine in the sun, making everyone who saw them smile.

lily tried to put the pieces back together, but it was too late. she couldn't fix the jar and all her pretty rocks were lost. she felt very upset and cried.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play outside in his backyard. one day, he found a big rock. the rock was dull and gray, but timmy thought it was cool.

timmy's sister, sarah, came outside to play too. but she didn't like the rock. she thought it was ugly. so, sarah started to tease timmy about his rock. she said it was too small and not shiny enough.

timmy felt sad and didn't want to play with the rock anymore. but then, his mom came outside and saw what was happening. she told sarah to stop teasing timmy and to be nice. sarah apologized and timmy felt happy again. he picked up the rock and showed it to his mom. she thought it was great and they all played together outside. the end.
once upon a time, there was a kind girl named lily. she loved to eat apples and would pick them from the tree in her backyard. one day, she went for a walk in the forest and got lost. she didn't know which way to go. 

lily saw a man walking by and asked him for help. he was compassionate and gave her a compass to help her find her way back home. lily followed the compass and guessed which way to go. after a while, she found her way back home and was happy to eat her apples again. 

from that day on, lily always carried a compass with her whenever she went for a walk in the forest. she knew that if she ever got lost again, she could use it to find her way back home.

timmy was happy to have his basketball back. he thanked his friends for helping him and they continued playing. from that day on, timmy made sure to watch where he was walking so he wouldn't slip again.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside with her friends and her dog, max. one day, lily and max were playing when suddenly max had an emergency. he couldn't breathe and started to have a fit. 

lily knew she had to do something to help max. she ran inside to tell her mommy and daddy what was happening. they called the vet and rushed max to the animal hospital. 

after a few hours, the vet was able to help max and he was feeling much better. lily was so happy that max was okay. she gave him a big hug and said, "i love you, max. you're my best friend." max wagged his tail and licked her face. lily knew that max was going to be okay and they could play together again soon.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her toys and make up stories. one day, she found a magic wand in her toy box. she waved it around and said "abracadabra!" but nothing happened. she tried again and again, but the wand refused to work.

lily was sad and frustrated. she wanted to do magic like the fairy tales she read. she asked her mom for help, but she didn't know how to use the wand either. lily refused to give up and kept trying.

after many tries, lily finally figured out the magic word. she waved the wand and said "bippity boppity boo!" suddenly, her toys came to life and danced around her room. it was perfect! lily was so happy that she giggled and danced with her toys all night long. from that day on, lily knew that if she refused to give up, she could make her own magic.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play outside with his friends. one day, timmy and his friends decided to play a game of catch. timmy tried his best to catch the ball, but it kept slipping out of his hands. 

suddenly, the ball flew over timmy's head and landed in a nearby net. timmy ran over to the net and tried to get the ball out, but it was stuck. he pulled and pulled, but the ball wouldn't budge. 

timmy's friends came over to help him. they all tried to get the ball out of the net, but it was no use. timmy's arm started to hurt from pulling so hard. just when they thought they would never get the ball back, timmy's big brother came to the rescue. he easily got the ball out of the net and gave it back to timmy. timmy was so happy and grateful to his brother for helping him.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved flowers and had a big vase in her room. one day, her friend timmy came to visit. "look at my vase!" lily said, pointing to the colorful flowers inside. "wow, that's so pretty!" timmy said, enthusiastic about the flowers.

suddenly, there was a knock on the door. it was lily's mom, who had arrived home from work. "hi, mom!" lily said, running to give her a hug. "what a beautiful vase you have!" her mom exclaimed. "thank you!" lily said, beaming with pride.

later that day, lily and timmy played outside. "i'm so happy you came to visit," lily said. "me too," timmy replied, enthusiastic about spending time with his friend. as the sun began to set, timmy's mom arrived to pick him up. "goodbye, lily!" timmy said, waving goodbye. "goodbye, timmy!" lily said, waving back. she couldn't wait to show him her vase again the next time he visited.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to watch big machines move things around, especially cranes. one day, timmy and his mom went to the park to watch the construction workers build a new playground. timmy was so excited to see the crane move heavy things and build new things.

but then, something happened. the crane got stuck in the mud and couldn't move. the workers tried and tried, but they couldn't get it out. timmy was sad because he thought the workers wouldn't be able to finish building the playground. 

but then, something amazing happened. another big machine came to help the crane get unstuck! the workers were able to finish building the playground, and timmy was so happy. he ran up to the workers and said, "thank you for finishing the playground!" even though the crane got stuck and it was boring to watch, it all worked out in the end.
once upon a time, there was a big, strong man with a big, strong mustache. he was very proud of his mustache and would comb it every day. one day, he went to the park to play with his friends. he was having so much fun that he didn't notice his mustache had fallen off. he looked and looked but he couldn't find it anywhere. he felt sad because he loved his mustache so much. but then his friends helped him look and they found it in the grass. he was so happy to have his mustache back on his face.
once upon a time, there was a clever little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with his toy cars at the port. he would watch the big boats come and go, and dream of sailing away on one someday.

one day, while timmy was playing, a seagull disturbed him by flying too close to his face. timmy got scared and ran away, but he quickly came back to his cars when he realized the seagull was gone.

as timmy played, he noticed that one of his cars was missing a wheel. he looked around and saw that the wheel had fallen into the water at the port. timmy cleverly used a stick to fish the wheel out of the water and put it back on his car.

from that day on, timmy made sure to keep his cars away from the seagulls so they wouldn't disturb him again. and whenever he played at the port, he made sure to be extra careful with his toys so he wouldn't lose any more parts. the end.
once upon a time, there was a lively little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play outside and run around with his friends. one day, timmy's friend billy came over to play. 

"hi timmy!" said billy. "what do you want to do today?" 

"i want to play with my new missile toy!" said timmy, showing billy his new toy. 

"that looks cool!" said billy. "can i play with it too?" 

"sure!" said timmy. "let's wrap it up in this blanket so we can pretend it's a secret weapon." 

so, timmy and billy wrapped up the missile toy and ran around the yard pretending to be secret agents on a mission. they had so much fun together that they didn't even notice when it started to rain. 

"uh oh, we better go inside before we get wet!" said timmy. 

"good idea!" said billy. "let's go play inside." 

and so, timmy and billy spent the rest of the day playing inside, having just as much fun as they did outside. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to draw and write in her journal. one day, lily's mom asked her to clean her room. 

lily said, "but mom, my room is already tidy!" 

her mom replied, "i know, but can you please step on the toys and put them away?" 

lily giggled and said, "okay, mom!" she stepped on the toys and put them away in their proper place. 

after she was done, lily went back to her journal and drew a picture of her clean and tidy room. she showed her mom and said, "look, mom! my room is so pretty now!" 

her mom smiled and said, "good job, lily! your room looks great!"
once upon a time, there was a little fish named nemo. nemo loved to swim in the big blue ocean. one day, nemo saw a piece of gum floating in the water. he thought it looked yummy, but his mom told him not to eat it because it was bad for him.

nemo was feeling adventurous and wanted to explore the wild ocean. he decided to dive deep down to see what he could find. as he swam deeper, he saw all kinds of colorful fish and plants. he even saw a big, scary shark! nemo quickly swam away and made it back to his home safely.

from that day on, nemo learned that it's important to listen to his mom and not eat things that aren't good for him. he also realized that the ocean can be a wild and exciting place, but it's important to be careful and stay safe.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside and explore the woods behind her house. one day, she found a smooth rock that was perfect for skipping on the lake. 

as she was skipping the rock, she heard a whisper coming from the bushes. "who's there?" she asked. a little squirrel poked his head out and said, "hi, my name is sammy. i like to play too!" 

lily was so happy to have made a new friend. they played together for a long time until it started to get dark. "i have to go home now," lily said. "but we can play again tomorrow!" 

sammy nodded and whispered, "okay, see you tomorrow!" lily skipped home, holding her new smooth rock tightly in her hand, excited to come back and play with sammy again.

after a while, lily got tired of hiding and wanted to play something else. she came out of her hiding spot and told emily that they should play tag instead. emily agreed and they had a lot of fun running around the park. they played until the sun started to set and it was time to go home. 

when they got back to lily's house, emily's mom was waiting for her. she asked emily if she had fun playing with lily. emily smiled and said yes, but she also complained that lily was too good at hiding. lily's mom overheard and laughed, saying that lily had always been good at hiding. the girls said goodbye and promised to play again soon.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play in her backyard and explore the world around her. one day, she found a little bird with a broken wing. 

lily picked up the bird and took it to her mom. "mommy, look! i found a birdie. it's hurt. can we help it?" 

her mom smiled and said, "of course, sweetie. let's take it to the vet and see what we can do." 

at the vet, the doctor weighed the bird and said, "this little guy is very light. we need to give him some medicine and a nail to help his wing heal." 

lily watched as the doctor gave the bird some medicine and put a tiny nail in its wing. she thought the bird was so adorable and couldn't wait for it to fly again. 

after a few days of rest, the bird was ready to go back into the wild. lily and her mom took the bird back to the backyard and watched as it flew away, happy and healthy once again.

lily tried and tried to unlock the box, but she couldn't do it. she was getting frustrated and upset. her aunt saw how upset she was and said, "sometimes things are hard, but if you keep trying, you can do it." 

lily took her aunt's advice and kept trying. finally, she unlocked the box and inside was a beautiful dress. lily was so happy and thanked her aunt. her aunt smiled and said, "remember, if you keep trying, you can do anything."

lily was very sad because she thought her ball was dead. she asked her friends what to do, but they didn't know. just then, a kind man walked by and asked what happened. lily told him about her ball, and he said he could help. he got a long stick and fished the ball out of the drain. 

lily was so happy and thanked the man. she learned that she should be careful around drains and that there are always kind people who can help. she went home and told her mom all about her adventure. her mom was proud of her for being brave and for learning something new.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a black cat named midnight. one day, while playing outside, lily saw a butterfly. "look, mommy! i see a butterfly!" she exclaimed. 

her mommy said, "yes, lily, it's beautiful. if you catch it, i'll give you a reward." 

lily ran after the butterfly, but it was too fast. she was sad that she couldn't catch it. midnight saw her sad face and meowed, "don't worry, lily. i'll help you catch the butterfly." 

together, lily and midnight caught the butterfly and brought it to her mommy. "good job, lily and midnight! you caught the butterfly, so here's your reward," said her mommy, giving her a piece of candy. lily was happy and hugged midnight.
once upon a time, jack wanted to learn. he knew he had to go to school to do that, but he was scared. he asked his mom, "will school help me learn?"

"yes, jack," his mom said. "school is a safe and reliable place for you to learn."

so jack went to school. he was nervous at first, but gradually he started learning things. he learned how to count, how to write his name and how to draw a picture. jack even made some new friends along the way.

before long jack wasn't scared of school anymore. he looked forward to going each day because he knew that school was a reliable place where he could learn new things.
once there was a big tree. everyday it grew and grew. one day, a silly bird hopped onto the tree. the bird was looking for something shiny to wear. 

the bird said, "i'm looking for something to make me look fancy!" she added, "do you know where i can find something glimmering?" 

the tree thought for a moment and then said, "yes, follow me! i can help you find it." 

the bird followed the tree and soon they found a sparkling spell on the ground. the bird cheered and said, "this is perfect! now i'm the prettiest bird around!" 

the bird thanked the tree and flew away. the tree just smiled and kept growing.

once upon a time, there was a white screw. the screw was all alone in the toolbox and it was very, very sad.

"i wish i had something to do," the screw cried.

suddenly, a hammer popped his head over the edge of the toolbox.

"oh, what a pity," the hammer said. "what can i do to help?"

the white screw thought for a moment.

"will you offer me something to do?" asked the screw hopefully.

"of course!" replied the hammer. "come and help me tap some nails into the wall."

the white screw was very excited and they got to work immediately. they worked together until the job was done and the hammer thanked the white screw.

"you were a big help," said the hammer. "thank you so much."

the white screw smiled and said, "you're welcome - it was fun!"
once upon a time there was a little girl called grace. grace was three years old and had a fluffy pet dog called brownie. one day, grace and brownie went to the park.

it was a sunny day and the park was full of children playing and animals running around. suddenly, they spotted an unusual candle on the ground.

grace and brownie were curious so they went to take a closer look. suddenly, brownie gave the candle a big slap with his paw.

grace was surprised and said, "why did you slap the candle, brownie?"

brownie wagged his tail and said, "i was just being curious."

grace laughed and said, "well, next time be careful!" and they continued with their exploring.
mum and dad were at the beach with their three-year-old daughter. they wanted to show her something exciting.

"look!" said dad, pointing out to the sea. "an octopus!"

the little girl jumped with excitement. she had never seen one before.

the octopus had lots of arms and it was a clear, bright day.

mum looked at it and smiled. "do you know what? octopuses are very clever. and they like to joke!"

mum and dad laughed, then dad said, "let's find out if it can joke too!"

he waved his hands and shouted, "hey octopus! tell us a joke!"

the octopus splashed its arms against the water and made silly noises.

the little girl giggled. "that octopus was telling you a joke!"
bob was a little boat. one day, he decided to sail away. he waved goodbye to his mom and dad and they blew him kisses as he sailed away. 

bob sailed and sailed until he saw an island. it was very messy. bob sailed to the shore, but he couldn't get to the land because it was too muddy.

but then, bob saw someone! it was a lawyer. 

"hello!" bob yelled to the lawyer.

"hello there, little boat!" the lawyer said. "i can help you get to the land. i'm a lawyer and i know the law of the sea. follow me!"

the lawyer waved to bob and bob followed him. with the lawyer's help, bob made it to the messy land. 

bob was so happy! he had made it to the island without getting stuck in the mud. 

the lawyer smiled and said, "you did it! good job, little boat!" then he waved goodbye and sailed away. 

bob was very proud of himself. he had sailed to a new adventure on his own.
once upon a time there was a round dog named trouble. he was always troubled and couldn't find a place to call home. everywhere he went, people didn't want him around. 

one day, trouble was walking by the river and he saw a beautiful butterfly. he barked at it and it flew away. all of a sudden, trouble heard someone shout out, "hey, don't bite me!" 

trouble shouted back, "i didn't bite you!" he then noticed it was a small gator who was scared of trouble. 

the gator said, "i'm sorry i thought you were going to bite me." trouble reassured him that he just wanted to be friends and he was now looking for a place to rest. 

the small gator said, "you can stay here in my pond if you'd like. i know how it feels to be troubled and alone. i would make a good friend for you, trouble." 

trouble was overjoyed and thanked the gator for his kind offer. they became the best of friends and lived happily ever after.
once upon a time there was an orange frog called sam. sam lived in a small pond near a wood. everyday sam would sun himself on a rock in the middle of the pond.

one day, sam heard a noise. he hopped out of the pond to see what was happening. he saw two animals, a rabbit and a squirrel, squabbling by a tree. the rabbit and the squirrel were shouting at each other and their fur was all ruffled. 

sam hopped over to them and he said, "what is wrong here? why are you both so angry?" 

the rabbit said, "that squirrel won't share his nuts with me." 

the squirrel said, "but you didn't ask nicely!"

sam thought for a moment and said, "maybe you could both take turns? that would be fairer." 

the rabbit and the squirrel thought that was a good idea. so the squirrel gave some of his nuts to the rabbit and the rabbit shared some apples with the squirrel. after that they both said their goodbyes and went their separate ways. 

sam watched them go and was very pleased that he had been able to help out. then he hopped back into the pond and sunned himself, feeling very content.
once upon a time there was a little girl named susie. she was three years old and had her birthday coming up. on the day of her birthday, her mommy had a special surprise for her. she brought an invitation to susie and told her that they were going to the park.

susie was so excited. she could hardly wait. she and her mommy put on their shoes and took the bus to the park. when they arrived, susie saw that there was a party with balloons and lots of food. 

susie saw her friends and they all hugged each other. her mommy brought her a big cake with candles. she blew the candles out and everyone sang happy birthday in unison.

after eating the delicious cake, they all played different games. they played tag, hide and seek and they even made sandcastles. it was a lovely day and susie had so much fun. susie said to her friends: â€œtime to go, i hope to see you again soon!" 

her friends said â€œbye susie, bye mommy! we had a great time!â€ 

and susie brought her invitation to the park home with her, remembering all the wonderful times she had that day.
once upon a time there were two friends, josh and beth. josh found a flute and he was extremely happy. he asked beth to join him and they started to play the flute together.

josh asked beth 'what number shall we play?' together they counted 1,2,3 and started to play the flute. they had so much fun!

suddenly, josh's mom came into the room and saw the flute. she said 'uh-oh, this flute looks familiar. have you taken it from the living room?'

josh and beth became very quiet. josh looked down and felt guilty. he knew he had taken the flute from the living room. he admitted it and said 'sorry mommy'. 

josh's mom gave him a hug and said 'it's ok. it's important to always tell the truth. i forgive you. now please put the flute back.'

josh and beth put the flute back in the living room and felt better. they promised each other to always be honest and never take things without asking. 

the end
nana and grandpa were on a walk. grandpa wanted to buy a gift for nana from a special shop. but nana disagreed. grandpa thought the gifts from the shop were so charming that nana would love them. but she still disagreed.

grandpa asked nana why she didn't like the shop. she said the prices were too high. grandpa said the prices were really not that high and he asked her to just take a look at the shop.

but nana said no. she said she thought it was better to buy gifts from another shop. grandpa said, "but i think this shop has the best gifts in town!"

nana smiled and said, "i know, but i still think the prices are too high. maybe we can try another shop."

grandpa thought for a moment and then said, "ok, we can do that. come on, let's go!"

and they went off in search of the perfect gift that they both agreed on.
one day, toby had a big event. he was so excited! he put on his special outfit and waved goodbye to mommy. at the event, toby saw many people. everyone was working and having a good time.

toby noticed a smelly food cart and his mouth started to water. he asked one of the workers what kind of food they had. "we have hot dogs and hamburgers," said the worker. toby wanted to try a hot dog.

he ordered the hot dog and waited. when his order was ready, toby took a big bite. but something was not right. "it tastes yucky," he said.

the worker laughed. "that's because the hot dog is smelly," he said. toby was so embarrassed! he thanked the worker and quickly went home. mommy laughed when she heard the story. from then on, toby was more careful when choosing his food!
mum and dad were very excited to take their little girl out for a picnic. she waved goodbye to grandma, who happily gave them a big hug and a big kiss.

it was a beautiful day, and the little girl was so excited. the sun was shining, the clouds were white, and the birds were singing.

on their way to the picnic spot, they stopped to look up at the night sky. little girl was amazed to see so many stars twinkling above. she said, "mum, dad, the stars look so beautiful!"

mum and dad hugged the little girl and comforted her with warm cuddles. they said, "yes they do. isn't it wonderful?"

they had a wonderful picnic that day, filled with love and laughter. little girl was so happy, and before they knew it, the day was over and it was time to go home.

as they walked hand in hand, the little girl looked up at the night sky and saw the stars twinkling. she smiled and said, "i love the stars, mum and dad." and they hugged her and reminded that they were always there to comfort her.
once upon a time, there was a small girl named mia. mia loved to bake. she often went to her kitchen to mix and stir ingredients for her tasty treats. 

one day, when she was in the kitchen, mia found a big book. it was a novel, and mia was so excited. she decided to sit down and read it.
 
but when mia tried to read the book, the words sounded strange. she couldn't understand what they meant. mia became deaf. she couldn't hear a thing.

mia was so sad. she wondered if there was a way that she could hear the stories in the novel. then, she had an idea. she grabbed her mixer, and mixed a bit of flour, sugar and milk. she put the dough in an oven and baked a jolly cake. 

when mia took the cake out of the oven, she heard music and noise. mia smiled as she ate her cake. she knew that as long as she kept baking, she would never have to be deaf again.
once upon a time there was a little girl. her name was lucy. she was three years old and loved to imagine things.

one sunny summer day, lucy was playing in her garden and imagining herself as a princess. she looked up to see a beautiful white carriage pulled by two horses. on top of the carriage was a golden horn. 

the driver of the carriage smiled at lucy and said, "would you like a ride, your highness?" lucy was so excited and clapped her hands.

she climbed into the carriage and they began their ride around the town. as they drove, lucy noticed there were many other carriages on the streets. all the carriages were so organized and they looked like they had been waiting for her in lines.

at the end of their ride, the driver said to lucy, "this is your carriage, your highness. thank you for joining me!" lucy thanked him and then looked one more time at the golden horn on the top of the carriage.

she waved goodbye as the carriage drove away and she imagined that one day, when she was older, she'd have a carriage of her own.
once upon a time, there was a little girl called rachel. rachel loved to ride her bike. she asked her mom if she could ride outside. her mom said yes and told her to be careful. 

rachel got on her bike and rode around in circles. she was having so much fun! then she noticed something huge on the other side of the street. rachel thought it was a table. 

rachel was curious, so she decided to take a closer look. she got off her bike and walked over to the table. when she got closer, she couldn't believe her eyes. it was an enormous table! 

rachel said to herself, "i wish i could ride this table!" then she heard a voice say, "you can ride it if you want!" 

rachel looked around and she saw a fairy. the fairy said, "i can make your wish come true. just hop on the table and the magic will begin!" 

rachel was so excited! she hopped onto the huge table and closed her eyes. suddenly, the table started to move. rachel was riding the table! she was amazed and shouted out in joy, "this is so much fun!"
once upon a time there was a mummy and a baby. the mummy loved the baby and the baby loved the mummy.

one evening, the baby was feeling sleepy so the mummy picked him up and held him close. the baby gave the mummy a hug and snuggled into her neck.

the mummy kissed the baby on the cheek and said, "goodnight my sweet baby. you are so special."

the baby smiled and said, "kiss me on the waist."

the mummy laughed and gave the baby a kiss right on his tiny waist.

the baby smiled again and said, "thank you mummy!"

the mummy said, "you're welcome my love. now go to sleep - it is time for bed."

the mummy and the baby hugged one more time, and then the baby fell asleep. he was so sleepy and happy, with a big smile on his face. 

the end.

when she was done, she had made a beautiful quilt! everyone was so happy with it. all the colors looked lively and the stitches were neat and strong.

the little girl was very proud. she said to everyone, "look what i made! isn't it great?" 

everyone cheered. they said, "wow! you are very good at improving things with your needle and thread!"

alvin was excited as he was unpacking his suitcase. inside, he found a big surprise - a toy boat! the boat was blue and had a funny flag on the top. alvin couldn't wait to play with it. he grabbed it and ran to the nearest river.

he lined the boat up carefully and said goodbye as he watched the boat sail away. it went very far, until he couldn't see it anymore. 

soon, it was getting dark and alvin was a little worried. he started to dream about his boat getting lost or stuck. suddenly, he saw a light in the distance. he ran closer and noticed it was his boat!

alvin was so happy he had found it. he rushed over and picked it up. but when he got closer, he noticed the back of it was wet. he looked around and saw it had been pushed onto some big rocks. he reached out and ran his finger along the side. he felt a deep cut.

alvin was sad. he knew it was time to go home. he carefully packed the boat into his suitcase and walked back. even though his boat was hurt, he knew he had a great adventure.
once upon a time, there was an adventurous copper. he was always curious and wanted to explore places he hadn't been before.

one day, he decided to make a special journey. he packed up his things and set off towards the mountains.

when he arrived, he saw the beautiful snow-capped peaks. he felt so excited!

he wandered around the mountain, admiring its beauty. suddenly, he heard a voice.

"what are you doing here?," it asked.

he looked around to see where the voice was coming from and that's when he saw a group of foxes. 

the foxes were looking at him curiously. he told them he was on an adventure. 

the foxes were fascinated to hear this. they asked if he would help them make a special den in the mountain.

the copper agreed. after a few hours of hard work, they had made an amazing den for the foxes. 

the grateful foxes thanked the copper for his help. he smiled and waved goodbye, ready for his next big adventure.

the little boy smiled, no longer hungry.

john replied, "i'm gonna see the duck!"
john's dad smiled and said, "ok, here you go!"

john was sad but he kept watching it until it disappeared. he felt mighty as he walked home. he knew the sunglasses had helped him see the wonderful duck.

so connie asked the bird, â€œcan you help me? i want the flower!â€

the bird said, â€œsure, i can help. i will restore it for you!â€

the bird flew up to the flower, and lifted it gently with its beak. it brought the flower back to connie, who thanked the bird for its help.

tom said to sally, "would you like to help me make a turkey?" sally agreed and the two of them started gathering the things they needed. 

tom asked sally, "what do you think we need for a turkey?" 

sally replied, "we need some feathers and some glue." so tom and sally got some feathers and glue, and set off on their creative mission. 

tom said, "we need to make a turkey shape". so they got to work cutting the feathers and gluing them to the paper. 

when they were done, they stepped back and admired their work. 

"it looks so good," said sally. 

"let's show everybody," said tom. 

so they ran off to show all of their friends their turkey. everyone was impressed by their creative work and allowed them to keep it! 

the two friends had so much fun making the turkey and were so happy that all their friends allowed them to keep it. they decided to make a different turkey every week, and each one was more creative than the last!
one day, jack was playing in the park. he was running around and having a great time. while jack played, he saw something sparkly out of the corner of his eye. it was a toy tractor with a bright red shovel. jack couldn't resist, so he slipped it into his pocket and kept playing. 

after he finished playing, jack rushed home to show his parents his new toy. he showed them proudly and they applauded him. but then his father saw the toy and he said, "jack, where did you get this?" 

jack was very scared. he knew he should not have taken the toy. he started to cry and snivel. his father asked him again, "did you take this from somewhere?" 

jack sniffled and said, "yes, it was in the park." his father was disappointed but he was understanding because jack is only three years old. 

so his father said, "okay jack, we have to give it back to the park. tomorrow morning you have to take it back and put it in the regular spot so it won't get lost again. then you can come back to your crib and take a nap. 

jack understood and nodded. so the next day, jack and his father returned to the park. jack placed the tractor in its original spot, and after that he was allowed to go back to his crib for a regular nap. 

the end

when she looked up, she saw a boy. he was a little older than her, around five or six.

"hi!" said tiny.

"hello," said the boy.

"what are you doing?" asked tiny.

"i'm looking for something important," said the boy.

"what is it?" asked tiny.

tiny smiled. she was so glad she had helped the boy find such an important spring.

once upon a time, there was a little girl. her name was lisa, and she loved to explore. one day, lisa was walking around in a beautiful garden. she saw flowers, birds, and bugs crawling around. suddenly, she saw an ugly bug on a palm tree.

lisa wanted to explore the bug, so she went closer. the bug was so small that lisa had to lift her head to see it. "hi there, little bug!" she said. but the bug didn't answer.

lisa decided to use her finger to lift the bug off the palm tree. she was so curious to explore him. she wanted to find out what the ugly bug was up to.

 suddenly, the bug spoke. "hello there! what are you doing?" he asked lisa in an excited voice. lisa smiled and said, "i'm exploring! what are you doing?" the bug replied, "i'm just flying around and looking for food!"

lisa was so happy that she could talk to the bug. she said her goodbye and watched as he flew away. she learned that even ugly bugs can be interesting.

once upon a time, there was a bright red bird. she lived in a cozy nest in the tall green tree near the meadow.

one day, the bird flapped her wings and flew away. she wanted to go on an adventure!

she flew and flew until she spotted a pond. it glistened in the sunshine. she landed on the edge of the pond and looked down.

she saw a little brown fish swimming around the pond. he looked up at the red bird with his big eyes and said "hello". 

the bird smiled and asked the fish a question. "would you like to come with me on my adventure?"

the fish was thrilled! he said, "yes! i've been looking for an adventure too!"

the bird smiled and stuck out her leg. the fish swam closer and grasped her leg with his fins.

the bird took to the sky and released the fish over the meadow. the fish was free and so was the bird. she knew they would always be friends.

once upon a time, there was a little girl called anna. she wanted to plant a pretty flower in her garden, so she went outside to look for a place to put it. anna saw a gray patch of soil. she asked her mom, "mama, can i plant my flower here?" mama said "yes, you can plant your flower in the gray soil." anna started digging a hole in the soil and she put the flower inside. she covered it carefully with soil and watered it. then she waited for the flower to grow.

days later, anna was happy to see the flower had grown. it was a beautiful pink flower with a yellow centre. anna asked her mama, "mama, why is the flower so pretty?" mama said, "because you were patient and cared for it. you chose the right place, put it in the gray soil and watered it every day." anna smiled and said, "i'm so happy i planted the flower!"
once upon a time, there was a sheep who had been getting a bit dull and grey. she was called pat, and her wool was not as soft and fluffy as it used to be. she was feeling rather sad, and wasn't sure how to make things better.

one day, she decided to take a walk to ask someone for help. as she passed a field of tiny lambs, one of them stopped, looking up at pat with their bright eyes. pat explained how she was feeling dull and grey, and the lamb said "i think i know what you need! a bit of sun will help you sparkle up again. it will increase your energy!"

pat was excited! she took a nap in a spot she felt sure was full of sunlight for the rest of the day. she woke feeling energized and her wool was soft and fluffy again. from that day forward, pat made sure to take a sunbathing break each day, so her wool would never go dull again.

the end.
once upon a time there was a boy who liked to play lots of games. his mom had a surprise for him. it was small, hidden under a blanket. 

the boy jumped up excitedly. "what's this?" he asked. 

"let's play a game. but first you need to guess what it is," mom said. 

the boy pondered for a moment. "is it an animal?" he asked. 

mom smiled. "no, it's something else," she said.

the boy thought some more and then said, "is it a toy?"

mom nodded. "yes it is! it's a special toy."

the boy uncovered the blanket and saw a toy box. "wow!" he said.

he opened the box and saw a jigsaw puzzle inside. he paused to take it all in. 

"let's play a game," mom said. "let's see who can put together the puzzle first." 

the boy clapped his hands and said excitedly, "yeah! i'll do it."

and off they went, their game of fun and puzzles about to begin.
one day, mama and her three-year-old son, tim, went to the park. tim saw some children playing in the sandbox and wanted to join them.

mama said, "wait here and stand still. i'm going to get something from the car."

tim waited and stood still, but he was getting impatient. when mama came back, she was carrying two buckets filled with sand.

mama said, "tim, carry this bucket. it won't be too heavy for you."

tim looked at the bucket and it seemed heavy to him. "that's too heavy, mama," he said.

mama looked at him, her face a bit stern. "i wouldn't ask if it was too heavy, tim. that's rude. can you try?"

tim nodded and grabbed the bucket. he was surprised when he found that he couldn't lift it. but mama had already started walking towards the sandbox, so tim tried again. this time, he was able to stand up with the bucket in his hands. 

he smiled to himself, proud that he was able to lift the weight. mama smiled at him too and said, "good job, timmy. let's go show the other kids."

so, katie put on her smock and went outside. she saw lots of junk that her mom wanted her to clean up. she was not sure how to start, but she was excited to try.

then she saw an old bucket. she grabbed it and started to fill it with the junk. she worked hard and soon the bucket was full. she was very proud; she had completed her job!

she brought the bucket inside and her mom said, "good job, katie! everything fits perfectly in here!" katie smiled and knew that she had done a great job. she was so pleased with herself.
once upon a time there was a nice boy called tim. tim loved to go to the pond to enjoy fishing. every day he took his fishing rod, went to the pond and enjoyed catching the regular fish. 

one day, when he came to the pond an old man was already standing there with a fishing rod. 

tim said to him "hi, i am tim and i come here everyday to enjoy fishing." 

the old man smiled and answered him "do you like to fish? i come here every day too."

tim smiled and said "yes, i love to enjoy fishing in this pond. what kind of fish do you like to catch?"

the old man said "i like to catch the regular fish here. what about you?"

tim said "i also like to catch the regular fish. it's so much fun!"

the old man smiled again and said "you should enjoy fishing every day. it's a great hobby!"

tim thanked the old man, said goodbye and went home happily, eagerly looking forward to the next day of enjoying fishing.
once upon a time there was a fox who loved to swing. the fox could be seen in the park each day, enjoying the feel of the wind blowing in its fur. 

one day, a bad wolf appeared and said, "hey fox, why are you here all alone?"

the fox said, "i'm here to swing. don't you like to swing too?" 

the wolf shook its head and said, "no, i don't like to swing. i like to eat foxes like you! get ready! i'm coming to get you!"

but the fox was clever and knew that the wolf was trying to trick him. "no! i like to swing and you don't scare me!" shouted the fox.

the wolf ran away and the fox went back to having fun, safely swinging in the park. the end.
once upon a time, there were two friends called joe and molly. joe and molly loved to play together. one day, joe said to molly, "let's go get pizza!" molly clapped her hands and was very happy. 

so, joe and molly went to the pizza shop. when they arrived, molly chose a big piece of pizza and joe chose a small one. but when molly tried it, she said, "this pizza is bad!" joe laughed and said, "maybe you just don't like pizza!" 

molly thought and then said, "maybe i do like pizza, but this one is bad!" joe shrugged and ate his pizza anyway. molly was sad, but joe said, "let's go somewhere else. i bet they'll have better pizza!" 

so, they went to another pizza shop and this time, molly liked her pizza a lot. she smiled and said, "this pizza is good, joe!" joe smiled back and said, "i told you it would be better!" and then the two friends ate their yummy pizzas and had a wonderful time.

grandma said, "my dear, i know something that will make you feel much better. i know of a special place where broken toys can be traded."

molly's eyes lit up. she said, "really? can we go there now?" grandma smiled and said, "yes, but we must hurry!"

they soon arrived at the toy store. molly was amazed by all the different toys she saw. she chose a brand new doll and couldn't wait to take it home.

grandma asked, "are you happy now, sweetie?" molly nodded and gave her a big hug. she said, "thank you so much, grandma. i'm so happy!"

grandma hugged her back and wiped away a few of molly's tears of joy. molly was so relieved, she was no longer feeling guilty, and the sadness was all gone. grandma smiled and said, "that's what trade is all about!"
once upon a time, there was a prince. he was on a mission to find a magical treasure. on the way, he stumbled upon a mountain. as he looked upon the mountain, he saw a precious gem drop down from the top. it was sparkling in the sunlight!

the prince was so excited that he ran up the mountain to get the gem. just as he was about to reach it, a giant eagle flew down and snatched it up. the prince was so envious!

he shouted out, "hey eagle! please give me back my gem!"

the eagle laughed and replied, "go away prince! i see this shiny treasure and i want it for myself! you're not getting it back!"

the prince was very sad, but he didn't give up. he thought of a plan. he shouted out, "wait, eagle! i could give you something even better!"

the eagle didn't believe the prince, but he asked anyway, "what could you possibly give me that's better than this gem?"

the prince replied, "i could give you something even shinier and more precious. do you want to find out what it is?"

the eagle was intrigued and said, "yes, show me!"

the prince then reached beneath his cape and pulled out a beautiful diamond necklace. the eagle was so amazed that it dropped the gem and flew away with the necklace.

once there was a famous flower. he lived in a garden with lots of other flowers. every day he watched them bloom in beautiful colors, but he couldn't bloom himself.

the flower was so excited! he felt funny, and then he started to slowly bloom. bright pink petals appeared around him and soon he was more beautiful than any other flower in the garden.

danny smiled and said, â€œi knew you could do it!â€ 

the flower was so happy. from that day on, he bloomed every day in the garden and was known as the most famous flower!

"rraaaaaaaawr!" the dragon bellowed.

"i am here to strike!"

timmy was so scared, he didn't know what to do. suddenly he heard a wise old voice. it said,

"do not be afraid, timmy. strike the dragon with your courage."

so timmy gathered up all his courage and shouted,

"no! you will not strike me!"

the dragon was so surprised. he flew away, never to be seen again.

the windy day was quiet again and timmy felt proud of his bravery.

the zebra said aloud, "you shall be my new friend." the painted friend nodded in agreement. 

the zebra and his painted friend painted in the grass together casting beautiful colors across the meadow. pinks, blues, and greens mixed together. the zebra was so happy with his new companion that he danced and smiled in the sunlight.

one day, a kind bank came by to check on the zebra. she was moved by the sight of the two friends laughing and playing together and with a gentle voice she said, "that is the most compassionate act i have ever seen." 
the zebra smiled and nodded proudly. his painted friend smiled back.

and so the zebra and his painted friend lived in the meadow, playing and painting together every day. the zebra was never lonely again.

once upon a time, there was a bird called joe. joe was a very obedient bird, who always listened to his mom.

one day, joe asked his mom, "can i fly really high today?" his mom said, "yes, go ahead."

so joe flew high and higher. he was so happy, and he kept flying. soon, he was so far away!

when joe stopped flying, he looked around and he noticed he didn't recognise anything. he wasn't sure where he was.

then, out of the corner of his eye, he saw another bird. "what's your name?" joe asked.

the other bird said, "my name is blue. where are you from?"

joe told blue that he had flown far away. blue said, "let me show you the way back."

so blue and joe flew together until they reached joe's home. joe thanked blue and said goodbye.

as joe flew home, he was so happy he had such a good friend. he looked forward to their next adventure together.

once upon a time there was a little boy named sam. he was three years old and liked to play with his friends.

one day, sam and his friends were playing hide and seek in the park. all of a sudden, sam saw something shiny in the grass. it was a big, yellow lemon! he wanted to pick it up, but he knew he shouldn't.

he ran back to his friends and asked if anyone knew whose lemon it was. his friend petey said, "i think it's mrs. smith's lemon tree. she won't be happy if you take it!"

sam felt guilty, but he couldn't resist the temptation. he slowly gained the lemon and put it in his pocket.

sam continued to play with his friends, but he couldn't stop thinking about the lemon. after a while, he decided to do the right thing and take the lemon back to mrs. smith.

when sam got to mrs. smith's house, she was very pleased. she said, "thank you for being a good person, sam. you did the right thing."

sam smiled. he was glad that he learned that it's always better to do the right thing.
maia and mom were walking down the street, admiring the tidy gardens. maia saw a butterfly flitting from one bush to the next.

"mom," she said, pointing, "look, pretty!"

mom smiled at her. "yes indeed. it is beautiful, isn't it ?"

maia nodded and asked, "will you carry me?"

mom picked her up and put her on her shoulder. maia giggled and asked, "where are we going?"

"to the park, silly!" mom said, tickling her.

but when they got to the park, maia wasn't sure what to do. she looked around and asked, "what can i play with, mom ?"

mom pointed to a slide, a swing, and a jungle gym. "there's lots of fun things here! why don't you start by tidying up your toys when you're done?"

maia nodded and went to explore. she had the best time playing until it was time to go home. when they arrived, mom asked, "did you have a good time?"

maia smiled and said, "yes, it was lots of fun! let's come back soon!"
mama and papa were out walking when they saw a very tall tower. they thought it looked so tall that they couldn't even see the top. they asked a man who was bald to tell them how tall it was.

the man said, "my tower is so tall that it reaches the clouds, so no one can measure it."

mama and papa were amazed. papa said, "i bet it must have taken a long time to build that tower!"

the man explained, "we worked very hard to build it. it took us many weeks."

just then, a mailman came by and delivered a package to the bald man. mama and papa watched as he opened it. inside was a shiny new hat.

the man was so happy to receive it. he put it on and said, "now my head won't be so bald!" mama and papa laughed. mama said, "there you go, now you have a hat to match the tower!"
once upon a time, there was a young girl named amy. she wanted to go for a walk, so she put on her coat and set out. as she walked through the park, she noticed something peculiar - a chain was lying on the ground.

she wanted to find out what it was, so she picked it up and examined it. when she looked closely, she was surprised - it was very heavy. she decided to take it home with her.

when amy got back to her house, she went to the kitchen and placed the chain on the counter. she tugged on it, to see how strong it was, but the chain wouldnâ€™t budge. suddenly, amy's mom walked in and asked, "what are you doing?"

amy replied, "i found a chain, it's really strong!"

her mom said, "that's great! but, it looks really dirty and i don't know if it's safe. let's throw it away, it looks disgusting!"

amy agreed, and they both took the chain outside and threw it in the trash can. later, amy found a pretty bracelet to take with her on her next walk.
once upon a time there was a clever bunny. his name was jack. he had a special weapon which he used to protect his friends.

one silly day, jack was out walking in the forest with his friends. suddenly, they heard a loud noise! what was it? 

"let me take a look," said jack bravely. so he bravely grabbed his weapon and ran off to the source of the noise. 

he found a giant monster! it was big and very scary. the monster shouted, "i will get you!" 

but jack bravely held up his weapon and shouted back, "no, you won't! i will protect my friends!" 

the monster saw that jack was brave. he knew that he had met his match! so the monster turned and ran away.

jack had saved the day! his silly weapon had protected his friends from the giant monster. from then on, jack was a hero.
once upon a time, there was a little boy called jack. he was very excited because he was at the beach with his mom.

the sun was shining and the sea was very calm. jack saw a big, blue wave rolling in and asked, "mom, can i go and play?"

mama nodded, "yes, be careful. have fun!"

jack hopped on the sand and danced, spinning and twirling around on his toes. he laughed as the wind blew through his hair, like a big hug.

then, he heard something. jack turned and saw a pretty, pink kite flying above him. he waved at it and shouted, "hi!"

the kite spun in circles above jack's head. he smiled and felt so happy, like he was dancing in the sky.

jack and the kite played together all afternoon. they spun together, over the sea and the smooth sand. 

"bye-bye kite," jack waved as the sun went down and it was time to go home.

the kite waved back, spinning one last time. then it flew away, taking all of jack's happy memories with it.

lily ran really fast, but she couldn't catch up. she began to get upset and tears started to roll down her cheeks. suddenly, james stopped and turned around.

he said "hi lily, you were going so fast i didn't even see you!" lily smiled and wiped away her tears. she said, "i tried to speed like you, but i couldn't keep up!"

james laughed and said, "let's race! i'll go slow so you can keep up!" lily smiled, and the two raced. it was so much fun! 

at the end of the race, lily was so proud of herself. she had sped enough to keep up with james and won the race!

just then, abbie's mom came into her room.

"what are you doing, abbie?" her mom asked.

"i'm rocking the butter," abbie answered.

her mom chuckled and said, "that's the quietest way to rock something, abbie."

and so abbie continued to rock the butter, slowly and quietly, until it was time for bed.

her mom said, "yes, maria, you can invite polly." 

maria was so excited that she quickly packed a picnic basket. inside the basket she put some food, a soft blanket, and a special surprise - some bright pink powder. 

when maria arrived at the picnic spot, the first thing she did was invite polly. he was very excited, chirping and fluttering around. maria spread out the blanket, and then opened the picnic basket. she and polly had lots of fun together. 

at the end of the picnic, maria sprinkled the pink powder on them both. they sparkled and shimmered in the sunshine. maria and polly both beamed with joy, and giggled as they hugged each other.

"who are you?" asked the bear.
"i'm a rabbit. i'm looking for food," said the rabbit.
"that's funny, because so am i!" said the bear. "let's go find some food together."

the bear and the rabbit explored the forest until they found a berry bush. they gobbled up the delicious berries until they were full. the bear thanked the rabbit for feeding him.

once upon a time there was a pretty fly. it was orange and had big wings. the sun was shining and the fly was happy.

the fly went buzzing around, looking for food. suddenly he noticed a bright yellow flower. it had lots of yummy nectar!

he flew over to the flower and started drinking the nectar. it was so sweet and delicious! as he drank, he closed his eyes and blinked in content.

suddenly, he heard a voice. it was a bee! the bee said: "hi there, fly! what are you doing here? this flower is mine!"

the fly flew away in a hurry. he was feeling a bit scared. but then he saw something even prettier - a rainbow up in the sky. it was so big and colourful! he just had to go and look closer. 

he flew up to the rainbow and sat on a pot of gold. he blinked a few times in amazement. then he smiled and said: "this is the prettiest place i have ever seen!"
once upon a time there was a mommy and her little boy. the little boy loved to bake with his mommy. one day, his mommy took him to the store to buy things to bake with. they bought butter, flour, and sugar. 

when they returned home, the little boy and his mommy put on their aprons and started cooking. the little boy helped measure the flour and sugar while mommy melted the butter in a pot. 

"can i mix it with a spoon?" the little boy asked his mommy.

"yes, you can mix it!" his mommy said. 

the little boy stirred the batter carefully until it was nice and smooth. his mommy then scooped it into pans and put it in the oven. after about 15 minutes, she took the pans out and let them cool down. 

the little boy's eyes lit up when his mommy cut into the buttery, sweet cake. 

"yum! can i try a piece now?" the little boy asked eagerly. 

"yes, of course" his mommy replied. she put a piece of cake on a plate for him and the little boy smiled with delight. 

the little boy and his mommy ate the cake together and it was delicious. from that day forward, they would go to the store and bake together every week.
once upon a time there was a happy family. they were dad, mum and two small babies.

on one sunny morning the mum heard a noise outside her window. she looked out of the window, and to her surprise, she saw a big bird. the bird was speaking to her!

mum asked: "what do you have to say?".

the bird said, "i have spicy news for you".

mum thought for a few seconds and then asked, "what is the spicy news?".

the bird replied, "your two babies are now big and strong. they can go to school soon!"

mum was so happy. she thanked the bird and quickly ran indoors to tell dad the news. dad was so proud of their babies and he just smiled.

the end.
once upon a time there was a little girl named ayla. she was three years old, and she played in her yard all day long. one day, when ayla was playing, she found an interesting wire in the grass. it was light, and it sparkled in the sun. 

ayla was so curious about the wire that she went to find her mom. "what is this, mommy?" she asked, holding up the wire. 

"it's a wire, ayla," mommy said. "it's made of metal. it's used to carry electricity and power things like lights." 

ayla thought it was amazing. she asked if she could keep it and mommy said yes. from then on, ayla kept the wire in her pocket and took it everywhere she went. whenever ayla went somewhere dark, she would take out the wire, and it would give off a warm light.

ayla was very happy with her new wire and named it bob. whenever she was sad, she looked at bob and it always made her smile. 

ayla and bob were best friends, and they stayed together forever!

"what's wrong, honey?" asked the shopkeeper.

"i forget my money," she said.

the little girl was so excited, she thank the shopkeeper and ran off with her chocolate. from that day on, she always remembered to bring her money to the shop.

one day, a little girl went to visit her grandmother. she asked if they could bake a cake together. her grandmother said yes, so they went to the kitchen. 

when they got there, the girl noticed a big, noisy mixer on the counter. every time the little girl tried to talk to her grandmother, the mixer was so loud that she couldn't hear her. she got frustrated and started to yell at the mixer. 

the grandmother noticed and said softly, "my dear, yelling at the mixer won't help. we just have to be persistent and some way we'll find a way to talk to each other without it being so loud."

so, they both started to look around the kitchen and they found two pots that were the perfect size to cover their ears. the grandmother put one pot on her ears and the little girl put the other one on. now, they could hear each other talk and the mixer was bearable now.

the little girl was so excited that grandma had helped her. they quickly went back to work on the delicious cake.

one day, they decided to go for a walk in the woods. as they walked, they came to a hill with a large tree on the top.

"let's climb up the hill," said sarah.

angie and sarah scrambled up the hill, and when they reached the top, they noticed a patch of soft, brown earth.

"let's bury our wish!" said angie.

"yes!" sarah agreed.

so they each drew an ordinary wish on a piece of paper and then they put the two pieces of paper in the patch of brown earth and buried them. 

"do you think our wish will come true?" angie asked.

sarah smiled and nodded. "i hope so," she said.

and they both went on their way, with a smile and hope in their hearts.

the cave was something terrible. it was full of strange noises and lucy couldn't see anything. suddenly, a voice called out from the darkness: "who are you?"

lucy was scared but she bravely shouted out: "i'm lucy. who are you?"

the voice replied: "i am the king of the cave, and you have come to search my kingdom. what do you seek?" 

lucy thought for a moment and said: "i'm looking for adventure!"

the king was pleased and he said: "then come with me and i shall show you the way!"

so with the king leading the way, lucy began her exciting search.
