once upon a time there was an ostrich named sam. he was fit and active and he loved to run. he ran every day around the farm, and the other animals would cheer him on.

one day, sam was running faster and harder than ever before. he went faster than he meant to and tripped over a rock. he hurt his foot and couldn't run anymore. sam cried and said, "my foot hurts, who will fix it for me?"

just then, an elephant came walking by. he said to sam, "i know how to fix your foot. i can make it strong again. would you like me to try?" sam nodded his head yes and the elephant said, "let me get to work!"

the elephant got some herbs from the farmer and put them on sam's foot. he rubbed them in and said, "now your foot should feel fit in no time!" and sure enough, it did! sam thanked the elephant and said, "now i can run again!" the elephant smiled and said, "you're welcome!"

sam was quite happy, and ran around the farm as fast as ever. he always remembered to thank the elephant for fixing him, and he still runs around the farm everyday with a smile on his face.

he met a friendly cat and asked "will you teach me?" the cat smiled and said "yes, i'd be happy to teach you."

the rat was so excited. he said "thank you! will you teach me lots?" 
the cat answered "yes, i'll teach you lots."

together the cat and rat studied every day. they read books and played games. the rat learned so much and was so happy.

one day the cat said to the rat "you have learned so much. you are now ready to go and share all that you have learned with the world."
the rat smiled and said "thank you for everything! i will always remember my teacher." 

the rat waved goodbye with a smile and left to share his knowledge with the world.

the wise man opened his door and said hello to the little boy.

the little boy said, "hello! can i come in and play?"

the wise man saw that the little boy was very curious, so he said, "yes, come in and take a look around!"

the little boy was excited. he carefully stepped on the old carpet and followed the wise man into his living room. then, the wise man showed the boy some books and taught him about the alphabet. for a while, the little boy stayed and learned from the wise man.

when it was time for the boy to go home, the wise man gave him one last piece of advice. he said, "be smart and always think before you make a decision."

the little boy thanked the wise man, then happily walked out of the house and back down the old carpet, feeling more wise than before.

mommy smiled at him and said, "let's organize your penny with the others!"

tom ran back over to where his parents were sitting. they had a jar there with other pennies in it. tom carefully put his penny in the jar and daddy said, "let's add another penny to it every day and by the end of the year, we'll have a nice collection. we can be happy together!"

jack looked a little sad. jane quickly said, "it's ok! don't worry."

"what kind of game do you want to play next?" she asked.

jack thought for a bit and then he said, "let's play hide-and-seek. that's an easy game and i like it."

so, they started to play hide-and-seek. jane hid first, but then jack couldn't find her. he stumbled all around the house, trying to find jane, but he couldn't locate her.

jack started laughing. jane said, "let's play again. we can play it as many times as you want!"

jack smiled and then shouted, "yes! let's do it!"

they had lots of fun playing hide-and-seek and then playing even more games. jack and jane had a happy day together.
once upon a time, there was a doggy named bob. bob was very fast and love to race. one day, bob was out running in the garden, when he saw something shiny in the corner.

bob went over to have a closer look. it was a delicate metal wire! his tail started wagging, as he knew this was the perfect thing to race with.

bob picked up the shiny wire in his mouth and started to bark. his mommy came out of the house.

"what is it, bob?", she asked.

"a wire!", bob said.

"oh, can you show me?", she asked.

bob nodded eagerly and bounded off with the wire still in his mouth. he raced around the garden, with mommy chasing after him. bob was so proud to be running so fast and the wire glittered in the sun.

after a while, bob finally stopped and dropped the sparkling wire onto the ground. he glanced proudly up at his mommy, wagging his tail. mommy smiled and said, "that looked like a lot of fun, bob."

bob barked happily in agreement and raced off, to explore some more.

suddenly, jimmy found something on the grass. he ran closer and saw it was a hanger. jimmy smiled and picked it up. it was hard and felt cool.

"what shall i do with it?" jimmy said to himself. just then, jimmy had an idea - he would make a swing. he looked around and found a long, strong branch on a nearby tree. 

he hung the hanger onto the branch and tried it out. "hurray! it's a swing", shouted jimmy. he swung for a few minutes and then decided to lie down for a rest.

jimmy leaned back into the swing and hugged the hanger. the swing was hard but comfy and jimmy felt so happy.

once upon a time, there was a little boy who was very bored. he had no toys to play with, so he was feeling very miserable.

suddenly he had an idea. he decided to try playing with the blocks his mom had kept in the cupboard. he grabbed them and stacked them up in a big pile. he was so excited he could barely contain himself.

then all of a sudden, the blocks started to ring. it was the most amazing sound he had ever heard. he was very happy, and started to laugh and dance around them.

he asked his mom, â€œwhy are the blocks ringing?â€

once upon a time, there was a little girl who lived in a big house. she was only 3 years old, so she didn't know very many words.

one day, she went out into the backyard. she was feeling a bit sad and lonely.

then, she saw a ladybug flying in the air. it looked so happy! the little girl smiled.

suddenly, she had an idea. she exclaimed, "let's skip!" she started to jump and hop around the backyard, feeling much better.

the ladybug followed her, flying just above her head. the little girl laughed and skipped some more. she felt so happy and free!

the ladybug flew off far away and the little girl waved goodbye. she was no longer feeling miserable and the backyard seemed more fun.
henry was a brave little boy. he was only three, but he wasn't scared of many things. one day his mommy wanted him to go with her to the store. he was a bit frightened when he saw the store. it was a big, tall building.

mommy said they were going to buy some powder. henry asked what powder it was. mommy said it was special powder that could help him when he was feeling sick.

henry leaned into his mommy's side. he was still a bit frightened. they entered the store and mommy went to get the powder. he waited for her next to the cash register and leaned against the wall. the cashier was nice and smiled at him.

mommy came back carrying a big bag of powder. henry felt his fears melting away. mommy put her arm around him and hugged him tight. she said it was time to go home. 

henry leaned against his mommy's side as they walked out of the store. he was still a bit scared but he was also feeling brave and safe. he couldn't wait to get back to his cozy bed.

once upon a time, there was a bunny named bob who loved to wander. one hot summer morning, bob hopped along a path that led to a pine forest. bob sniffed the air and was so excited! 

when bob reached the forest, the big pine trees were refreshingly cool and shady. he hopped around the trunks, running and exploring happily. suddenly, bob stopped and looked around. he was lost!
 
bob started to worry. he wondered how he would ever find his way out of the forest. just then, a friendly starling flew down and landed on a branch next to bob.

"excuse me," bob said. "can you help me get out of this pine forest?"

the starling smiled, "i sure can! just follow this path and it will take you home." 

bob thanked the kind bird and hopped away. he kept his eyes on the path until he reached the other side of the forest. finally, he made it back home in time for dinner.

the two boys enjoyed releasing the sand into the air and watching it sprinkle on them. they laughed and smiled as they took turns scooping and releasing the sand. the friends were joyous as they enjoyed their simple playtime. 

"we better keep some sand to play with another day!" the boy said. so they put the rest of the sand back in the bucket and waved goodbye.

"mommy," he asked, "why do you wear those big, black boots?"

his mom said, "i wear boots to keep my feet warm and dry."

rory wasn't sure he believed her. he asked, "can i try them on?"

his mom smiled and said, "yes, you can. let me help you get them on."

rory was amazed! the boots were so big and they fit him perfectly! he started stomping around the living room, feeling brave and strong.

his mom laughed. "i guess they do, don't they!" she said.

rory was so proud. he had learned that even the things he was fearful of could be wonderful, if he just gave them a try.

the guard smiled and said, "hi! what brings you to the castle today?"

"i am here to find the perfect gift!" the little girl said.

the guard rocked back and forth in his chair and laughed. "i'm sure you will find something perfect!"

"it's perfect!" the guard said.

the brave little girl nodded and winked before running out the door.

then, she saw some big kids playing in the park. she didn't know them but she was brave. she waved and said, "hi! can i play too?"

the big kids were surprised but smiled back. "sure," they said.

the brave little girl smiled and filled the rest of the day playing with her new friends.
one day a little rabbit was walking through the woods. he bumped into a big bear. the bear said, "what do you want?" the little rabbit was so scared, he stuttered, "i...i...i was just walking through."

the bear got angry. he said, "you must yield this bottle to me, or else!" the little rabbit started to cry. he didn't want to give the bear the bottle, but he had no choice. he reluctantly gave it to the bear.

the bear took the bottle and smiled. he said, "you are so selfish, giving me only one bottle." the rabbit was relieved. he thought, "if i had given him more bottles, it would have been even worse!" 

the bear said, "next time, think twice before refusing another bear's request." the rabbit nodded in agreement. he then bowed and walked away quickly, grateful that he had been spared by the selfish bear.
once there was a little girl called daisy. she was three years old and loved to explore. one day she was on an adventure in the park. she noticed an old camera lying on the ground next to a tree. she picked it up and decided to take it home.

when daisy arrived home with the camera, her mummy was very surprised. she asked daisy where she got it from. daisy told her mummy about the park and the old camera.

mummy thought the camera was broken but then she found a battery and put it into the camera. to her delight, the camera worked!

mummy was very grateful to daisy. she said "the camera fits in perfectly with daisy's adventure kit. now you can take photos of all your adventures."

daisy was very happy and thanked her mummy. she was very excited to go back to the park and go on many more adventures with her camera.
once upon a time there was a club. it was a big and special club. inside was a very expensive toy. 

one day, a little boy called jack was visiting. he was only three years old and was very excited. he asked if he could play with the expensive toy. but his mum said no, it was too expensive.

jack snuck away from his mum. he ran to the toy and started playing. his mum stopped looking for him and the toy started to disappear. jack wondered what was happening. 

"mum, where did the toy go?" jack asked, very confused.

"that was magic," his mum replied. "the toy disappeared. that is why it was so expensive."

jack nodded his head. he was excited by the magic. he promised himself he would never touch an expensive toy again.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named sam. he loved to explore. today, he wanted to go for a walk in the woods to find a creek. so he said goodbye to his parents and started walking.

on his way, sam heard a noise coming from the trees. when he looked between the branches he saw an amazing sight. a group of frogs were jumping from stone to stone in the creek.

sam wanted to stay and watch but he didn't want to delay his adventure, so he said goodbye to the frogs and continued his walk. 

later, he came across a tall mountain and said, "wow, that's amazing!" he was quite happy and excited. 

he followed the creek until he reached his parents house. when he walked inside he said, "mummy, look i found a creek! it was amazing!"

his mummy smiled and said, "i'm glad you had a great adventure, sam."
once upon a time, there was a very lonely cloud. every day he would look down from the sky and see the happy people on the ground smiling and laughing. he felt so lonely and wished he had someone to talk to. 

one day, it started to rain. the lonely cloud wasn't so lonely anymore because now he could talk to the people below. he felt happy to make them laugh and smile. as he rained he said, "hi everyone! i'm a lonely cloud and i'm here to visit you!"

suddenly, a little girl below shouted, "look mama! a talking cloud!"

the little girl and her mama stared up at the cloud astonished. 

the cloud asked, "do you want to be my friend?"

the little girl nodded and ran over to her mom.

"mama, can i be friends with the cloud? please!?"

the mom smiled and said, "of course you can. just reach up and touch your nose to his raindrops and make a wish."

the little girl closed her eyes and did what her mom said. when she opened them, the cloud was gone. but the little girl kept her friendship with the lonely cloud in her heart.
once upon a time, there was a little bunny who lived in a big meadow. she was playing with her friends when suddenly the sun disappeared from the sky! the bunny was scared and asked her friends: "where did the sun go?"

her friends all said they didn't know, so the bunny had to go look for it. she hopped around the meadow, but couldn't find the sun anywhere. suddenly she saw a rare rainbow in the sky!

"i know!" she shouted. "the sun must have gone past the rainbow!"

so she hopped towards the rainbow, but as she got closer, the sun disappeared behind a cloud. the bunny was sad and thought she had lost the sun forever.

just then, a warm breeze touched her face and the cloud slowly moved away. there it was! the sun was there, shining brighter than before! the bunny was so happy and the meadow lit up with its warmth. from that day on, the bunny never lost the sun again.
once upon a time, there was a small girl called sally. she wanted to see the big world, but her mum wanted to prevent it.

"mum, why can't i explore the world?" sally asked.
"because, you are very young and still need to learn a lot" said mum.

"but i'm nearly 4 years old, i know a lot already," said sally.

mum smiled and said, "you know a lot, but you don't know everything. there are still some things that you don't understand. it's better to be safe and stay under the watchful eye of an adult."

sally felt a little sad, so mum added, "besides, it's ignorant to think that you already know everything. when you're older, you can explore the world as much as you want. until then, be patient okay?"

sally nodded and gave her mum a big hug. she understood that even though it wasn't fair, all the things her mum said were to keep her safe.

one day, sam decided to do something about it. he grabbed a big box and started to squeeze it with all his might. his tiny little paws managed to create the most amazing sound.

a nearby pigeon heard the sound and was so surprised that it asked, "what was that sound?"

sam grinned and replied, "it's my creative idea! i'm using the box to make music!"

the pigeon was so impressed that soon all the animals started to join in. soon, the forest was full of funny little animals squeezing boxes, creating the most wonderful music. 

everyone had a wonderful time and sam finally felt appreciated for his creative talent.

once upon a time, a quiet farmer lived in a small house. he loved the outdoors, so he worked hard in his garden. every day he would tie his plants carefully to the fence to help them grow.

one warm summer day, the farmer was in his garden tying some new plants when he heard a voice asking for help. "hello, can you help me?" asked the voice. the farmer looked down and saw a small bug who couldn't reach the top of a plant.

the farmer smiled and said, "yes, i can help." he bent down, grabbed some string and gently tied it around the plant. then he helped the bug climb inside the loop so it could reach the top.

the bug thanked the farmer and said, "thank you so much! you are very kind." the farmer said, "you're welcome," and continued on with his work.

the next day, the farmer found the little bug at the same spot, this time with some of its bug friends. the farmer smiled and waved before getting back to work. he knew the little bug was in good hands!
one day, bob the whale was swimming in the ocean. he felt something wet on his back and knew he needed to clean himself. he stopped to take a break and called to his friend jimmy the starfish. 

"jimmy," he said, "i think i need help cleaning myself." 

jimmy smiled and said, "i'm here to help! let me take a look." 

jimmy looked at bob's back and saw that it was very thin. he knew that he could help bob clean it.

jimmy swam around bob, spraying water everywhere. he rubbed bob's back with a soft cloth until it was clean and shiny. 

when jimmy was finished, bob smiled. "thanks for helping me clean, jimmy," he said. 

jimmy said, "it's my pleasure. it's important to keep yourself nice and clean!" 

bob thanked jimmy again and the two of them continued to swim around, happy that bob was now clean again.

mark's mom looked around the room and saw a thick blanket on the floor. then she said to mark, "let's pretend the blanket is a jungle! you can be the tiger and i'll be the monkey!"

mark said with excitement, "let's do it!"

once upon a time there was a car. the car was old and rusty. one day it got so rusty that it rot. the car was sad and angry. 

the car said to a nearby tree, "this is so stupid! i don't want to rot!" 

the tree said, "but that's how cars get when they're old. you need to accept it."

the car replied, "no! i wish i could still drive around like i used to."

the tree shook its leaves sadly. "i know. but life isn't always fair. you will just have to rot and accept your fate."

and that's how the car learned to accept its fate and rot away in peace.

"yes, i think it is!" chirpy said. "you should take a bite!"

once upon a time, there was a little boy named joe. he loved to play outside. one day, joe saw a big blue top. he was so excited, he ran over to it. joe picked up the top, put it on the ground, and started to spin it. he laughed as it spun round and round. 

the top stopped spinning, but joe wanted it to keep going. he stepped away and yelled, "i want the top to spin!" 

suddenly a voice came out of the sky. it said, "if joe wants the top to keep spinning, he needs to take the spin test." 

joe wasn't sure what a spin test was, but he was brave. he looked up and said, "okay, i'll take the test!"

the voice said, "good! to finish the spin test, you must spin the top until it stops by itself. go ahead and try."

so joe stepped forward, blew on the top to make it spin, and watched as it spun round and round. finally, it stopped spinning on its own. joe had passed the spin test! 

the voice said, "congratulations joe! now the top will spin forever."

joe was so happy, he jumped for joy! now he could enjoy spinning his big blue top as long as he wanted.

once upon a time, there was a girl named tina and she wanted an apron, so she went to the store. the store had lots of aprons: some were red, some were blue, some were green, and some were bright yellow.

tina wanted the bright yellow apron. she asked her mom, "can i have the bright yellow apron, please?" tina's mom said, "yes, you can have the bright yellow apron." 

tina was so excited because she finally had the apron she wanted! she ran out of the store and put it on. now she could do all of her activities whilst wearing her bright yellow apron. she even wore it to the park and played with her friends. everyone could see her neat, bright yellow apron. 

tina was so happy. she loved her bright yellow apron and never wanted to take it off!
one sunny day, jessi went for a walk in the forest. she saw a furry fox and asked it what it was doing. the fox didn't say anything, but it just shrugged. jessi figured it was looking for food in the soil. 

jessi wanted to help the fox, so she opened her backpack and took out an apple. she held it out to the fox and said, "here you go!" 

the fox didn't move. jessi wondered why, so she said, "it's okay. you can have it." 

the fox still didn't move. so jessi shrugged and said, "well, i guess you don't want it."

the fox quickly took the apple from jessi's hand and ran away. jessi smiled and waved goodbye. she had made a new furry friend in the forest!
once upon a time, there lived a young boy named jake. jake had an incredible dream: he wanted to succeed at being the best bus driver in the world.

one day, jake decided to make his dream come true. he got dressed, packed up his bag and hopped on the bus.

when jake saw the bus, he became so excited! he had never seen a bus so big and shiny before. he smiled and said, "i'm going to do it! i'm going to be the best bus driver ever!"

he took the bus for a ride. it was incredible! he drove on roads and took curve with ease. he drove fast and slow. people around town started calling him the best bus driver in the world.

finally, after a lot of hard work, jake succeeded in being the best bus driver in the world! he was filled with joy and kept on driving the bus with a big smile on his face.
once upon a time there was a little green frog. he was happy and funny and he hopped around the meadow all day. until one day he noticed something strange: a big, green symbol in the sky. he hopped up to get a closer look and shouted out "what's that green thing in the sky?" 

just then, a big, friendly eagle flew down from the clouds. "that's a symbol of power" he said. "it means that you can gain strength if you try hard enough." 

the frog cheered excitedly. he wanted to gain strength, so he hopped around the meadow even faster than before. he practiced and practiced, and soon he felt stronger. 

the green frog was so proud of himself. he hopped up high into the sky and proudly saw the green symbol still shining brilliantly. he knew he had gained strength!
mama played a song on the record player. it was a happy, bouncy tune.
joey was excited. he started to dance. he did a silly jig and spun around in circles.
mama said, "wow, joey! you are such a great dancer!"
joey smiled and said, "yes, i am!"

mama and joey danced for a while. they danced to the music and laughed a lot. joey was having a great time. 
but then the music stopped. mama said it was time to go inside. 
joey said, "but mama, the music was so fun! can't we stay outside a little bit longer?"
mama smiled and said, "no, joey. it's dull outside now. let's go in and we can record another song tomorrow." 
joey smiled and said, "okay, mama!" he gave her a hug and they went inside.
once upon a time there was a mommy and her baby. mommy wanted to keep the baby safe, so she taught the baby to not touch anything yellow. 

mommy said, "baby, please don't touch the yellow because it might be dangerous. it's better to be safe and prevent any harm."

but one day, the baby saw a yellow butterfly fluttering around. the butterfly was so pretty, and it looked harmless.

the baby asked, "mommy, can i touch the butterfly?"

mommy said, "yes, you can, baby. that butterfly is harmless and won't hurt you. but remember, don't touch the yellow things that don't look harmless."

the baby nodded and smiled. from then on, the baby knew to be careful when it came to yellow.
micky was a funny little mouse. he liked to do things differently. one day, he had an idea for a new game.

micky went over to his friend daisy's house. "let's play a game!", he said. daisy smiled.

micky asked daisy to stand on one foot and balance a juice bottle on her neck. they both had a lot of fun. micky was very creative with his ideas.

daisy said, "wow, this is fun!" micky grinned and said, "i like to do things differently."

they played the game for hours. daisy got better and better at balancing the juice bottle.

at the end of the day, they hugged and said goodbye. both of them had had a fun and creative day playing the balancing game.
once upon a time there was a wealthy cup who lived in an enormous castle. every day the cup would march through the castle's grand hallways, admiring its beauty.

one day, the cup was strolling through the corridors when it ran into a tiny mouse. the cup stopped and asked the mouse, "what are you doing here?" the mouse replied, "i am looking for food. i haven't eaten anything in days!"

the cup felt sorry for the mouse and decided to help. it marched to the castle kitchen and brought back a cup filled with cheese. the mouse was thrilled and thanked the cup for its help.

the cup smiled and said, "you're welcome! it's so important to help those who are less fortunate than us." the mouse nodded in agreement and happily scurried off to enjoy its meal. 

from then on, the wealthy cup was known as the most generous in the castle.
once upon a time, there was a cheerful girl named lucy. she liked to wander through the country. one day, she went for a long walk. she saw many different things along the way.

lucy saw a river, with lots of big, green trees on the edge, birds hopping around and big, fluffy clouds in the sky. then, she saw a castle. she wandered up to the castle to explore. when she got close, she saw someone near the gate. it was a big, friendly dog.

"hello," said lucy.

the dog looked up and smiled. "hello," said the dog. "my name is max. what's your name?"

"my name is lucy," said lucy. "i'm wandering through this country."

max barked happily. "i'd be glad to show you around!"

so lucy and max went on a journey together and saw many wonderful things. everywhere they went, people and animals said hello to them. lucy had a great time and felt very cheerful. 

at the end of their journey, max said goodbye and went back to the castle. lucy waved to him and went on her way. she was happy she had such a fun adventure.
once upon a time, there was a girl named sarah. she loved to skip. she skipped everywhere - inside her house, outside her house, around the block and even in the rain!

today, sarah wanted to skip in the kitchen. she skipped around the table and hopped over to the faucet. it was bright purple and made sarah so happy. she felt silly, so she talked to the faucet.

"hi, faucet," she said. "you're so purple! i love skipping around you."

the faucet wasn't very loud, but it answered in a small voice.

"thank you, sarah," it said. "i like it when you skip. please keep skipping around me."

so sarah kept skipping around the faucet. faster and faster she skipped until the faucet was a blur of purple spinning around her. she giggled and skipped and twirled until she was too tired to keep going.

"that was so much fun," sarah said and gave the faucet a big smile. "let's skip again soon!"

one day, lucy found a white box in her garden. she was curious and opened it. inside was a beautiful, peaceful bird. it was so calm and gentle. lucy got to understand that the bird wanted her to take care of it.

lucy said, "hello, birdy! can i play with you?"

the bird nodded and said, "yes, you can play with me. i will be your friend."

lucy was so happy and excited. she took the bird inside her house and fed it. from that day on, lucy and birdy were best friends. they would play together in the garden and always have fun. 

lucy understood that birdy was the best friend she could ever have.

they went to the store and ben looked around. then he saw some colorful toys that he wanted to buy. but something wasn't right. there was a thief in the store! he was sneaky and wearing a filthy coat.

ben yelled, "mommy, the thief has toys!" his mom looked around and saw the thief. she called for help and the thief ran away.

mommy hugged ben and said, "you did the right thing by telling me about the thief. thank you for keeping us safe."

"you're welcome," said ben. he was so happy that he and his mom were safe. from then on, he was even more careful when they went to the store.

when she got there, she carefully put her net in the water. she waited and waited, but nothing came out. she was so sad that she started to cry. 

just then, a big fish came swimming by. the little girl was so excited, she quickly put her net over the fish. she caught it and laughed with joy!

the little girl happily trotted home with her fish. that night she feasted on her catch. she was so happy and full she couldn't help but laugh!
the sun was shining and the sky was a peaceful blue. tommy was playing in the garden when he saw an aeroplane flying across the sky. he shouted "wow!" and watched it fly away in the distance.

tommy wanted to fly too. he waved his hands and leaped into the air, trying to fly after the aeroplane. his mom heard him and came over, putting her hands on his shoulders.

"you can't fly, tommy. but don't worry. i have a surprise for you," said his mom, and she snapped her fingers.

suddenly, the garden filled with floating bubbles! tommy giggled with joy and jumped up and down, trying to catch them. each time he popped one, tommy laughed and clapped his hands. he even managed to catch a few in his hands and blow them away. it was so much fun!

when all the bubbles had snapped away, tommy flopped on the grass and looked up at the sky. he thought about the aeroplane he had seen earlier, wishing he could take a journey and explore the world. but for now, he was just happy to watch the clouds drift by, peaceful and free.

one day she went on a walk and saw a mine. she was very excited. 

sophie entered the mine and looked around. she had a special stick in her hand. suddenly, something sparkled in the dark. what could it be? 

sophie struck her stick against it and the sparkles stopped. she looked closer and saw something was shining in the darkness. it was a diamond! 

surprised, sophie said out loud, "i found a diamond!"

suddenly, she heard a voice. it came from a man who was hiding in the corner of the mine. he said, "well, this diamond is mine." 

sophie was not scared. she was thoughtful. she asked the man, "if i give the diamond to you, can i explore the mine?" 

the man thought for a moment and said, "yes, but be careful."

sophie thanked him and gave the diamond to the man. she explored the mine and had a great adventure. she went home with many stories to tell.

one day, a little girl came to visit the park. she was only three years old and she loved to watch the clown jump.

the girl called out to the clown, "hey! clown, why do you jump so much?"

the clown stopped his bouncing and looked down at the little girl. he smiled and said, "i jump because it makes me happy and it makes the sun glow brighter!"

the little girl smiled and said, "i like your smile, clown! will you play with me?"

the clown was delighted. he nodded and said, "let's play catch! the sun will love to watch us play!" thus, the girl and the clown played catch together while the sun shone and glowed in the sky.

one day, jack looked out of the window. outside he saw a lot of kids running and playing a sport. he wanted to do the same. so he opened the door and stepped outside. 

the other kids saw jack and waved at him to come over. jack smiled and went to join them. 

he walked up to a boy and said, "hey! can i play?"
the other boy frowned and said, "no! we don't want you here."

jack felt very sad. he stood and gazed at them for a moment.

suddenly, another boy stepped forward and said, "of course you can join us! here, you can have my ball!" he smiled at jack.

one day, the frog was swimming when he saw something on the shore. it was a strange bowl of pasta. he hopped over and he rubbed it. 

the frog looked up and saw a girl. she had long brown hair. she was smiling. 

"hi, frog!" the girl said. "do you like the pasta?" 

the frog nodded and rubbed the bowl again. 

the girl laughed, "that's ok. you can rub it! you can eat it too. i'll help you." 

the girl grabbed a little spoon. she put some pasta in the spoon and brought it to the frog. the frog ate it so happily. 

after that, the frog and the girl were friends. the girl brought pasta to the pond everyday!

once there was a frog. he was hopping around looking for something to eat. all he could see was some leaves and some bugs, but he was still hungry. suddenly he smelled something delicious.

"what is that smell? i'm so hungry!" croaked the frog. 

he hopped over to the smell and found a man cooking something on the fire.

"what are you cooking?" asked the frog.

"i'm cooking some yummy food. would you like some?" said the man, who was very friendly.

the frog was so excited. he said, "yes please! food would be available to me."

the man gave the frog some of the food and the frog ate it hungrily. it was the best thing he had ever tasted!

"thank you so much," said the frog happily. "you were so kind to share your food with me. i'm so lucky!" 

the man smiled and said, "you're welcome. it's always nice to share what we have with others." 

from then on, the frog always remembered how kind the man had been and that there was always food available if you needed it.

once upon a time there was a bear named bob who lived in the woods. one day, bob felt very sleepy and he didn't feel like doing anything. unfortunately, he had to find some food, so he started to walk around to look for something to eat.

suddenly, bob heard a loud noise. he was a bit scared so he slowly peeked around the corner. what he saw made him very surprised! it was two foxes, arguing and fighting over something. bob felt bad for them, so he decided to try and help.

he stepped into the clearing and said, "hey! why are you fighting?"

the foxes looked at bob and stopped. the bigger fox said, "this is my food, but the other fox said that it was his too."

bob thought for a minute, then he said, "i have an idea. why don't you both step back and i'll increase the amount of food so that there's enough for both of you?"

the foxes looked at each other and then agreed with bob's plan. as bob had promised, he added more food so that both of the foxes could have equal amounts. the foxes thanked him and promised him to not fight again.

bob was glad that he could help. he felt really happy as he continued his journey to find food.
once upon a time there were two friends, joe and jane. one day, they disagreed on what to do. joe wanted to go the park, while jane wanted to stay at home and watch tv.

joe said, "let's go to the park. it will be fun."

but jane said, "no. let's stay home and watch tv."

joe disagreed. he said, "we can find original things to do at the park, like play tag and swing on the swings."

jane still disagreed and said, "what about the oxygen outside? my mom said it's bad for me."

joe smiled and said, "it's okay. we'll stay at the park, but not too long and we can wear masks if we want, okay?"

jane nodded, and smiling, the two friends went to the park, having an amazing time.
timmy was very excited. his mum and dad had bought him a special bell for his bedroom. it was a big brass bell with a long, shiny handle. whenever timmy wanted to call his mum or dad, he just had to ring the bell.

one day, his mum said, "it's time for your exam!" timmy's eyes grew wide. he was a bit scared. he wasn't sure what an exam was.

"but why?" he asked.

his mum smiled. "it's just for fun," she said. "it's a silly game that we can play."

timmy looked at his mum and dad with big, hopeful eyes.

"it's okay," his dad said. "you can ring the bell if you get stuck or need help. when you're finished, we'll all ring the bell together. isn't that a good idea?"

timmy nodded. he took a deep breath and started the exam. he was worried at first, but soon he was having fun. whenever he got stuck, he'd ring the bell and get help from mum or dad.

when he finished the exam, he and his parents rang the bell together. it was the best exam that timmy had ever taken!
once there was a little dog named bob. bob was a small, hairy pup. he loved running around outside, chasing after all the other animals.

one day, bob wanted to get the best view of everything in the park. he saw a tall stand and decided to climb it. but bob didn't have any paws to help him grip, so he started to slip. 

just then, he heard a loud snap, and a shining white hand appeared near the top of the stand. bob looked up to see a kind stranger smiling down at him. 

the stranger said, "hi there, little pup. don't worry, i'll help you. just grab my hand and you can make it up here!" 

bob grabbed the stranger's hand and she pulled him up to the top of the stand. from there, bob could see everything. he wagged his tail with delight. 

the stranger smiled and said, "you were quite brave for a little pup. now, let's get you back down safe." and with another snap, the stranger was gone. 

and bob? well, he was just as happy as could be. he sauntered off, happily exploring the park with a new view from above.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named pete. he was only three years old and always wanted to help his dad. one day, pete's dad said, "time to load the truck, pete!" so pete went out to the truck and started loading it with boxes.

pete was having trouble lifting the heavy boxes, so his dad came out and said, "here, let me help." he picked up the biggest box, and pete was so happy to help.

pete ran to the shed to get the hammer so they could seal the box shut. his dad patiently waited while pete looked for the hammer. when pete finally found it, he said excitedly, "here it is!"

his dad said, "thank you pete, now let's get to work and load the truck."

pete was eager to help, so he impatiently began hammering the box shut. his dad stopped him and said, "pete, let me help. you need to be careful, you could break the hammer."

pete smiled and let his dad take over. together, they loaded the truck and were able to finish just in time for the big trip.
once upon a time, there was a little boy called sam. he was three years old, and he loved to explore. 

one day, sam went for a walk in the woods. he came to a lovely tunnel and he wanted to go inside. he searched and searched, but couldn't find an entrance. 

just then, a friendly rabbit hopped up to him. 

"hello!" said the rabbit. "can i help you?" 

sam was very excited. "yes please!" he said. "i want to go in this tunnel." 

the rabbit smiled. "i know a way in!" it said cheerfully. "follow me!"  

the rabbit led sam through the woods, until soon, the two of them were standing in front of a small door in the side of the tunnel. 

sam was delighted. he opened the door, and thanked the rabbit.

the rabbit waved goodbye, and sam stepped inside the tunnel. he was amazed by what he found - there were all sorts of things to explore! so sam spent the rest of the day searching around, and having a lovely time.

once upon a time, there was a nice man named jack. he was very generous and always helped people who were in need. 

one day, jack noticed a girl who looked sad. he walked over to her and asked why she was feeling blue. 

the girl told jack that her dog had run away. she was desperate to find him and was feeling really upset. 
"don't worry," said jack. he pulled a note out of his pocket and threw it to the girl. 
"if you see your dog, please come back to me and let me know," explained jack. 

the girl was so happy. she thanked jack and ran off to search for her pet.

a few days later, the girl came back with her dog. she thanked jack again and he smiled in response. this made her even happier. 

jack had done something very generous for the girl. she was very thankful for his help and never forgot his kindness.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named bob. bob wanted a pet to play with, so his mommy showed him a plate with a little kitten. the kitten was so gentle and soft. bob's mommy asked him, "do you like the little kitty?" 

bob couldn't help but smile and nod his head in excitement. "yes!" he said.

bob's mommy smiled and said, "ok, then it's yours. what are you going to name it?" 

bob thought for a moment and said, "fluffy!"

bob and fluffy became best friends. bob would show his friend all his toys and fluffy would sleep in bob's bed, purring softly. every day, bob would show fluffy how much he loved him by stroking his fur gently. 

bob and fluffy were happy together, and bob's mommy was happy too.
teddy woke up in the morning and felt happy. he wanted to go outside and play. he hopped out of his bed and went to find his mom.

he found her in the kitchen and said, "mom, can i play outside?" she smiled and said, "yes, teddy, you can go outside and play."

he ran to the door and opened it. the sun was shining on the other side. he looked up at the big, blue sky and saw a few white fluffy clouds floating around. he smiled and went off to play.

he saw a group of kids playing ball on the other side of the park. he wanted to join in, so he crossed over and said hi. the kids were happy to have him. they started to play the game.

teddy was popular with the kids because he was really good at the game. he could kick the ball really far and everyone cheered when he did it.

he was so happy and felt really proud! he knew he was a star! he smiled and felt that everything was right in the world. he knew he'd always love this game.

millie had so much fun playing and flying the kite. but, it was a windy day and her kite got away from her. she watched it wander up, up and away.

millie was very persistent and kept running after the kite. she stumbled and fell a few times, but she kept getting up until she caught her kite.

when millie finally got the kite back in her hands, she was so happy. she smiled and said to her mom, â€œmommy, i did it! i caught my kite!â€

there were two friends, rory and jack. rory had a strong brush. jack asked rory why he had the brush. rory said, "i need it to learn how to brush my hair." jack said," that's smart! can i learn too?" rory said, "sure! just watch me."

rory showed jack how to brush his own hair. first, he put the brush on top of his head. then, he ran the brush through his hair in long strokes. finally, he brushed his hair all the way down.

jack tried it too. he grabbed the brush and started brushing his hair. jack said, "wow! i'm learning something new!" rory smiled and said, "yep, brushing is fun!"

jack and rory kept brushing their hair until it was perfect. they were both proud of themselves. they both had learned something new!
once upon a time, there was a little bird who lived in the cold, snowy forest. the bird was not like the other birds. he had a special song that he sang. every day he would use his beautiful voice and sing his song.

one day, an icy storm came to the forest. it was so cold that the bird almost couldn't fly! just as the little bird was getting ready to give up and go home, he heard a familiar voice.

"little bird, don't worry! i can deliver your song so that everyone in the forest can hear it!" said the voice. it was his best friend, a squirrel. 

the little bird was so happy. he thanked his friend, and the two of them quickly made a plan. the squirrel used his tail to help his friend fly, and in no time, the bird was singing his beautiful song all over the icy forest. everyone enjoyed hearing his song, and the little bird was so proud of his special delivery. 

the squirrel had given the little bird the perfect gift - the gift of music!

one day, mommy came outside with a bottle for him to play with. jimmy was very excited and he quickly grabbed it. he looked at it and said, "mommy, this bottle is so interesting!"

mommy smiled and said, "yes, it is! what do you want to do with it?" jimmy thought for a moment and then said, "i want to swing with it!"

mommy smiled again and said, "okay, let's swing. hold onto the bottle tight and have fun!" jimmy held the bottle tight and began to swing. he was laughing and smiling the whole time.

when it was time to go inside, mommy asked, "did you have fun swinging with the bottle, jimmy?"

jimmy smiled and said, "it was the best day ever!"
once upon a time there was a big, strong bear. the bear had a nice cabin all by himself. he was always content in it.

one day, the bear went on a walk in the woods. suddenly, he heard a noise from a nearby bush. he went to investigate and saw a small rabbit complaining.

"what's wrong?" asked the bear.

"my home is too small," said the rabbit.

the bear thought for a moment. "would you like to live in my big cabin?" he asked.

the rabbit's eyes lit up. "yes!"

the bear and the rabbit went back to the bear's cabin and the rabbit moved in. since then, the bear and the rabbit have been very happy in their big cabin.

alice asked, "what is this?"

just then, a noisy bird flew by and said, "it's a treat for you, alice! enjoy!"

alice was so excited. she thanked the bird and ran inside to eat the treat. it was delicious!

after she finished, alice was ready to play again. she ran back outside and started to run around. suddenly, she fell over! it was quite noisy!

alice's mom heard the noise and came to check on her. she hugged her and said, "it's okay, alice. everyone falls sometimes!"

alice giggled and then hopped up and ran around again, ready to have more fun.
once there was a little girl called pinky. she was three years old and she loved playing in the garden.

one sunny day, pinky went outside to find something new to play with. she saw some friendly ants and a spade lying in the dirt.

pinky picked up the spade and said "i will use it to sack the dirt!"

she scooped up some of the dirt and let it fall from the spade. then she laughed and did it again.

suddenly a rabbit came out from behind a tree. pinky was so excited.

the rabbit said "hi there! what are you doing?"

pinky smiled and said "i am sacking dirt with my spade. would you like to help?"

the rabbit nodded, and soon they were both having so much fun.

when it was time to go inside, pinky thanked the rabbit and hugged it goodbye. then the pink little girl went back inside with her spade, feeling very happy!

lucy didn't understand why she couldn't know and started to cry. jack noticed and sat next to her. he said, "don't worry, lucy. i think you'll be pleased when i marry. it'll be like a happy surprise." 

lucy sniffed and asked jack, "will it make you happy?" 

"yes, of course," said jack with a smile. "i'm going to marry my love and that's what makes me happy." 

lucy was surprised but happy. she hugged jack and said, "that's the best surprise ever!"
once upon a time there lived a brave little mouse who liked to explore. one day the mouse decided to explore a big forest. as he made his way through the forest, he heard a whistle. 

the mouse was scared but brave at the same time and so he followed the sound of the whistle. he soon found an elderly man with a big grey beard.

the mouse shouted 'who are you?' but the man did not answer. the mouse asked again 'why are you whistling?'

the old man smiled and said 'i'm just enjoying the nature.'

the mouse was so brave and curious, he dared to ask 'can i join you?' 

the old man grinned and said 'i'd love that.'

so the brave little mouse joined the elderly man in the forest, and they enjoyed the nature together. the end.

once upon a time there was a jolly old man. he loved to surprise his friends.

one day he decided to surprise his best friend. he hopped on his bike and went for a ride. he rode for a long time until he arrived at his friend's house.

when he knocked on the door, his friend was so busy he didn't hear. the old man knocked and knocked until finally the friend came to answer. his friend was very surprised to see him there.

"oh my! what a surprise! what made you come here?" the friend asked.

the old man laughed. "i wanted to bring you something," he said.

the old man's friend grew very worried. he was afraid the old man had come with bad news. but the old man surprised him once again when he pulled out a big, delicious cake from his basket.

the friend was so happy and relieved. he thanked the old man and quickly invited him inside for tea and cake.

the old man smiled happily. he had brought a jolly surprise and it had made his friend worry in the best way.
once upon a time, there was a little mouse named mary. mary was very curious.

one day, mary saw some smoke coming out of the ground. she wanted to find out where it was coming from. so, she zipped over to the smoke and saw a big hole in the ground.

"hello?" mary said.

suddenly, a loud voice came out of the hole. "who is that?"

"it's me, mary!" she replied.

a big dragon came out of the hole. he was very friendly. "well, hello there! what are you curious about?" he asked.

mary pointed to the smoke. "where did that come from?"

the dragon smiled. "eh, that's just me. i was zipping around the cave and the smoke was coming from my wings!"

mary laughed. she thanked the dragon for being so friendly and zipped away to explore more of the cave.

mia smiled and hugged her mum tightly. she felt so brave and strong. mia knew that nothing was too scary for her.

the shopkeeper smiled, "of course you can. you need blocks and tools."

binky hopped home and started to build. he put the blocks together and was really proud. he was finished! 

the microphone was shiny and perfect. binky was so excited, he wanted to get something tasty to celebrate. he hopped to the bakery and bought some cookies. they were so yummy and sweet!

binky was so proud of his microphone. he had a tasty snack and was pleased with his work. binky hopped home, ready for his next adventure.

at first, jack was very good at the game and he would tag jill every day. jill was beginning to feel a bit jealous. she said to jack, "why do you always tag me?" jack replied, "because you're the fastest one here so it's easy for me to catch you. that's why i tag you." jill smiled.

everyday, jack and jill would play tag and jack would repeatly tag jill. jack and jill were having lots of fun together and also became best friends. they played tag every day until they grew old.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named margaret. margaret wanted to go to the park to play, but her mother said she had to stay home. margaret was sad, so she looked for something to do.

suddenly, margaret saw a trap on the ground. it looked like a box with a hole in the top. margaret didn't know what the trap was.

"mommy," she asked. "what is this?"

"it's a harmless animal trap," explained her mom. "it's a way to introduce animals we can study and learn about."

that sounded exciting! margaret decided to try her own animal trap. she got a box and placed it outside, putting some food inside.

sure enough, an animal came to the trap looking for food. margaret was so excited! she looked closely and saw that it was a cute little mouse.

"this is the doctor," said mom.
jack frowned. he didn't like doctors.

jack relaxed a little. the doctor gave him a special medicine that tasted bubbly and sweet. then jack lay down and closed his eyes.

jacky picked up the car with a big smile and said, "cool!" she pushed the car around the factory, then decided to take it home.

on the way home, one of the tires of the car fell off. jacky looked sad, and so she stopped at a store to buy another tire. she looked at all the tires, but none of them fit her toy car. 

but then, jacky saw a tire that was shaped like a bubble! she asked the shopkeeper, "is this tire real?" 

the shopkeeper smiled and said, "no, it's just a fake tire. but it will fit perfectly on your toy car! take it home and have fun rolling around the house!" 

jacky was so happy. she thanked the shopkeeper and took the fake tire home. she quickly put it on her toy car, and off she went rolling around the house!

one day, sue decided to write a story. she grabbed her favourite yellow crayon and a piece of paper. she scribbled and drew, and wrote little words. when she finished her story, it was beautiful.

but then something not-so-nice happened. someone dropped a smelly sandwich next to sue's story. sue's story was now covered in smelly crumbs.

sue was so sad. she cried and said, "oh, no! my story is ruined!"

just then, her neighbour, mr. cat, walked by. he saw sue's sad face and said, "don't worry sue, we can fix this. why don't you write another piece and this time let's make sure that it stays away from smelly sandwich crumbs!"

sue looked up and smiled. she grabbed a pen and wrote a new story. this time, it was even better than the first. and the best part was that it was crumb-free!

once upon a time there was a brown rabbit. the rabbit was very happy and always hopping around. one day he noticed something was wrong with his foot. he couldn't hop like he used to. he hopped to the barn to ask for help.

the farmer saw the rabbit and said, "i can help you. you need to get repaired." he brought out some tools and began to repair the rabbit's foot. 

the farmer asked, "do you feel better now?"

the rabbit hopped around, "yes! thank you farmer."

the farmer smiled, "you're welcome, rabbit. now go enjoy hopping around and be careful."

the rabbit hopped away happily and enjoyed the rest of his day. he was grateful for the farmer and his repair.

"don't be sad," said her mom. she touched kimmy's leg gently with her fingers. "it's alright. see, i can feel your stitch right here."

kimmy sniffed and nodded. she wiped the tears off her face.

then her mom smiled. "your stitch doesn't have to be a bad thing," she said. "in fact, it can be something special!"

"how?" asked kimmy.

"let's give it a special hug," said her mom. she hugged kimmy's leg around the stitch.

kimmy smiled. suddenly she didn't feel embarrassed anymore. she felt warm and happy.
once upon a time, there was a little girl who loved being outdoors. she loved learning about all of the different plants and animals and especially playing in the summer sunshine.

one day, she went out for a walk and spotted a peach tree. she was so excited to see all of the peaches growing on it.

without hesitation, she ran up to the tree and looked around. she spotted a little peach at the very top, so she decided to see if she could reach it.

she stretched her arms up, but she just couldn't get it. feeling discouraged, she walked away.

just then, an kind old voice spoke to the girl. "why don't you ask the peach if you can have it?"

the little girl was surprised. she turned around to see an old lady smiling at her.

the girl thought for a minute and then asked the peach if it was ok for her to take it.

to her surprise, the peach said yes!

the little girl was so excited. she quickly plucked the peach off the tree, thanked the kind old lady, and ran home with her little peach.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lucy. she was three years old.
one day, lucy saw a gray bird. it was hopping around in the grass. she thought the bird was so pretty.

lucy said to the bird, "hi! what's your name? would you like to join me for a meal?"

the bird hopped closer to lucy and said, "chirp! chirp! my name is tweet. yes, i would love to join you for a meal!"

so lucy and tweet had a meal together. they ate yummy food and drank sweet juice.  they chatted and laughed and they had so much fun.

when it was time to go, tweet said goodbye. she said, "chirp! chirp! it was nice to join you for a meal, lucy!"

lucy smiled and waved goodbye to tweet. she was so happy to have a new friend.

suddenly, jane heard her mom calling her, "jane honey, could you be a polite girl and carry the plate to the dining room?"

once there was a mountain and upon it a billboard. each day the sun shined brightly and the trees sang. but one day, the sun became very harsh, and the billboard got bigger and bigger.

the animals were scared and ran away from it. they gathered around to figure out what to do. 

the peacock spoke first. "let us ask the mountain," said the peacock.

the animals shouted to the mountain. they asked, "why does the billboard increase? it's too harsh for us."

the mountain replied, "i cannot stop it. it is beyond my control." 

the animals then looked around at each other, but no one had any idea how to make the billboard reduce. so the animals kept running away from the bright and harsh billboard. 

all the animals lived in fear, until one day the sun went away and the billboard reduced back to its original size. the animals rejoiced and ran home, happy to be back in the peaceful mountain.
once upon a time, there was a lazy bear. his name was bob and he lived in the woods. every week bob did nothing all day long.

one day, bob smelled something delicious. he followed the smell and found a campfire. he saw a hot dog and it smelled so good.

bob got too close and his fur started to burn. he screamed and scuttled away.

the next day, bob decided to stay away from the campfire. he thought, "it's too hot. i'm not going near it!"

but the day after that, bob heard someone calling his name. it was his friend, joe. 

joe said, "bob, why don't you join us around the campfire? it's so nice and warm! you won't get burned i promise."

bob thought about it and decided that getting warm by the campfire would be better than being cold and lazy. he went over and stood at a safe distance and enjoyed the warm fire for the rest of the week.

once there was a truck. he was very grumpy because he couldn't help anyone. every day he drove around, just looking at all the people that he wanted to help, but he couldn't.

one day he stopped at a playground and he saw a little girl having trouble. the truck tried to help out but he was too big and it made the little girl scared.

the truck was so sad he almost started to cry. then he heard someone say, "don't be sad truck. i can help you."

the truck looked up and saw the little girl. even though she was very small, she was determined to help. so the truck and the little girl figured out a way for the truck to help the playground.

the truck was so happy, he even forgot how grumpy he was before. the little girl said, "see truck, you can help people if you just try." 
the truck agreed and said, "thank you for helping me help others."
one day, margo the bear was feeling very gloomy. she had a lot of work to do, but she couldn't find the power to start. suddenly, she heard a voice. it was her friend stella saying, "let me help you margo!"

margo smiled and said, "thank you stella! what should we do first?"

stella had a plan. "let's clean the room!" together, they started to clean up. margo put away her toys and stella wiped the windows. as they worked, margo's gloom began to fade.

finally, the room was clean and shiny. stella smiled and said, "see, now the room is all nice and tidy. you should feel better now!"

margo looked around the clean room and smiled. "yes, i feel much better now. thank you stella!"
once upon a time there was a little red bear. he was sad because his fur had become worn and faded. one day he saw a magical fairy flying nearby.

"fairy, can you help me?" asked the bear.

the fairy smiled. "i can," she said. she waved her wand and used her magic to restore the bear's fur. instantly, the fur was bright and shiny, turning an even brighter red.

the bear was so happy. "thank you so much, fairy!"

the fairy smiled and said, "you're welcome." she flew away, leaving the bear happy and restored.

the bear ran off, excited to show off his beautiful red fur to all his friends!
once there was a little girl called mandy. she could not wait to go out and play in the sunshine.

mandy hugged her mum and said, "when can i go outside?"

"wait a moment, let me measure you first," said her mum.

mandy stood still while her mum measured the length of her legs and body.

when she was done her mum said, "you are ready now. go and play."

mandy ran out into the garden.

she looked around. everywhere there were butterflies, fluttering and playing in the sunshine.

mandy jumped on the grass. the sun made her skin feel comfortable and warm. she laughed and laughed.

then she saw a beautiful butterfly. she followed it around the garden until it finally landed on a flower.

mandy smiled. she felt happy and free.
once upon a time, there was a girl called mary. mary was very rich and very happy. she had lots of nice things, but sometimes she was sad because she was ill.

one day, mary's mom said to her, "we need to go to the doctor and get you some medicine, mary." mary was scared but nodded her head. 

at the doctor's, mary was given some medicine. she didn't like it very much because it tasted bad. but, the doctor said it was very important to take the medicine so she did. 

when she got home, mary's mom hugged her and said, "see, dear? i told you the medicine would make you feel better." 

mary was glad. she felt much better and she was happy again. she hugged her mom and said "thank you for getting me the medicine. now i'm not sick anymore!" 

the end.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named shannon. she was three years old and was always curious about the world. she was visiting her uncle and aunt's house.

one day, shannon asked her aunt if she could go to the station. her aunt said yes, so shannon put on her colorful coat and cap, and went out.

when shannon reached the station, she was very excited to see lots of colorful trains. she wanted to get on one of them and explore.

suddenly, an announcement came over the loudspeaker: "all passengers, please put your bag on the train before boarding."

shannon smiled, and put her bag on the train. she was delighted to be going on her first train journey.

"where is the train taking me?" shannon asked her aunt.

"it's your surprise, shannon." said her aunt. "let's find out when we arrive".

shannon smiled, and went on an adventure.
john and jane were best friends. they did everything together. they played in the park, they went swimming in the pool, and they even shared their lunch.

one day when john and jane were eating lunch together, john opened his lunchbox and saw that jane had a big slice of cake. he became very jealous.

john said to jane, "why do you have cake?" he sounded very sad. 

jane said, "don't be jealous. listen, my mom put some salt on the cake so it tastes a bit strange. you can have a bite if you want."

john was so happy to hear that and immediately tasted the cake. it was delicious! he thanked jane and they both shared the cake and laughed together. 

john and jane hugged each other and promised to always listen to each other even when things got tough.
once upon a time there was a happy boy. he loved to explore the world around him. one day he was looking around his backyard and saw a frog. he wanted to take a closer look. so, he bent down to examine it. 

the frog suddenly began to sing a song. the boy was amazed by the sound and listened very carefully. the song was slow and sweet. he asked the frog, "what is that song?" 

the frog answered, "it is a song of friendship. it is a sweet reminder that friends can be found in the most unexpected places." 

the boy smiled and thanked the frog. from then on, he always examined the world around him in hopes of finding more new friends. the end.
once there were two friends, max and bob. they liked to play together every day. one day, they were celebrating. they were celebrating that it was bob's birthday. 

max had brought lots of presents for bob. one of the presents was an octopus. it was a very special octopus! max was so excited to give it to bob.

max said to bob, "i got you a very special octopus for your birthday. look at it! do you like it?" 
bob replied, "i love it! it's so cool!"

but when bob started to play with the octopus, he became very selfish. he didn't want max to play with it.

max looked sad and asked, "why can't i play with the octopus, too?"

bob smiled and said, "you can, max. of course you can, it's just for celebrating my birthday. we will share the octopus together. let's have some fun!"

and that is how max and bob celebrated bob's birthday with the special octopus. they had so much fun together!
molly was very excited, as she was ready to explore the maze. she was with her parents, holding their hands and wondering what secrets the maze held. molly's parents had been talking about mazes for days and molly was eager to see one in real life.

molly went further and further into the maze, taking each turn and discovering more and more twists and turns. each corner was an adventure. eventually, after a few turns, molly became tired and a bit scared - she had been in the maze for what seemed like forever.

molly's dad saw the tired look on her face and said, "don't worry molly, we'll surrender and go home."

molly was relieved. she grabbed her parent's hands and they left the maze. molly felt sure that one day she'd be brave enough to explore a maze again. 

as they left, molly took one last look back. she felt excited to explore the maze one day and find out where each turn would lead her.

once upon a time there was a boy. he was very lonely and felt like he had no one else in the world. one day, he decided to go for a walk in the forest.

as he walked, he heard a noise. he thought it was strange and cautiously walked towards the sound. then he saw a big, furry animal.

"hello!" said the animal. "my name is puppy and i am very hungry. can you help me find something to eat?"

the boy felt a little scared, but he knew puppy was just looking for a meal. he smiled and said, "yes, i can get you something to eat."

the boy and puppy went to a nearby house. the boy knocked on the door and asked the lady if she had anything for them to eat.

the lady was kind and gave them both a delicious meal. puppy ate every bite and thanked the boy for helping him find it. the boy thanked the lady for the meal. 

they both went back to the forest and the boy said goodbye to puppy. he couldn't believe how kind the lady was and how tasty the meal was. he smiled and waved goodbye to puppy as he walked away.
once upon a time, there was a fat cat. the cat was so fat that he could barely move. one day, the cat decided to go for a walk with his friend, the dog.

the dog said, "let's ride our bikes!" the cat replied, "that sounds like fun!"

they ran to the garage and got their bikes. the cat sat down on his bike and started to pedal. he felt so fast, like he was flying!

the dog laughed and said, "your bike is too fat for you, cat!" the cat just kept pedaling.

after a while, the cat and the dog stopped to rest. they had a lot of fun riding their bikes and decided to go again the next day!
once upon a time, there was a big, fancy house. it had a big, fancy window and a big, fancy door. 

one day, johnny and his mommy were outside the house, admiring the window. johnny's mommy said, "johnny, how do you think we could reach the window?"

johnny noticed a ladder, standing against the house. he pointed at it and said, "look mommy, there's a ladder!" 

so johnny's mommy got the ladder and johnny helped her to stand it up against the house. then, johnny climbed the ladder all the way to the window. 

from the top of the ladder, johnny could wave to all the people inside the house. everyone in the house was so excited, especially when johnny shouted out, "i can see you!" 

johnny and his mommy had a lot of fun. the fancy window stood tall, and their smiles were even higher.
once upon a time, there was a little girl called lola. she was very brave and liked to try new things.

one day, lola's mom gave her an onion. lola was uncomfortable because she had never tried an onion before.

mom smiled and said "lola, why don't you try it! you'll feel better when you taste how good it is."

lola took a deep breath and bit the onion. at first she felt uncomfortable and wanted to stop, but she kept trying. with each bite she felt better and better.

finally, after eating the entire onion, she felt much better. she was surprised and made a huge smile.

"mom, i like onions now!" she said. "it was hard at first, but it was worth it so i could improve!"

mom nodded and said "i'm very proud of you, lola. you tried something new, and you got better at it!"
one day, sally was running in the park with her hoop. suddenly, she saw a cute little squirrel with a long tail. sally was so excited that she wanted to play with it.

she ran closer and the squirrel stopped. sally smiled and said, "hi squirrel! can i play with you?" 

the squirrel just looked at her and didn't answer. then another squirrel came closer, hopped around the first one and then ran away. sally smiled again and said, "please, can i play with you?" 

the first squirrel looked at sally and then hopped to the hoop. sally was so happy that she clapped her hands and started to play with the squirrel. they played tag with the hoop, hopping around in circles and having lots of fun. 

in the end, they both stopped. sally thanked the squirrel and ran off home. she had lots of fun playing with her new friend in the park.
once upon a time there was a car named gavin. he was orange and had white spots. gavin was always in a hurry. he was always speeding down the road. 

one day, gavin was driving along when he saw a line. it was a long, thin line right in the middle of the road. the line looked like it went on forever. gavin was curious. he wanted to get to the other side, so he went faster and faster. 

gavin felt like he was going so fast, but the line still didn't end. suddenly, he heard a voice. 

"whoa, gavin! slow down!" yelled the voice. it was a woman standing beside the line.

gavin stopped and the woman said, "you need to follow the regular speed here, gavin. this line never ends, so you can't speed over it."

gavin thanked the woman and drove slowly from then on. he learned that day that things sometimes take longer if you speed.
once upon a time there was a unique elephant called ella. ella was a special elephant because she had the loudest trumpet and the longest trunk!

one day, ella found herself in trouble. she had been walking with her friends around the jungle when she slipped into a deep hole. ella was very scared and called out for help.

just then, she heard a voice. there was a brave elephant called bruce who was nearby. bruce was so kind that he had come to rescue ella.

bruce: "don't worry ella, i'm here to help!"

ella was so relieved to hear bruce's voice. he carefully pulled her out of the deep hole and ella thanked him for rescuing her. from then on, ella and bruce were best friends and always looked out for each other.

once upon a time there was a boat. it was a beautiful boat and it was ready to sail! the boat had bright blue and yellow sails.

the boat was full of people. one of them was a woman with a big smile. she said to her friends, "let's go! we are going to make a big loop!"

they all cheered with excitement. they started to sail the boat over the blue sea. the wind blew and the boat sped up.

suddenly, something strange happened. one of the passengers got deaf. everybody was scared.

but the woman on the boat said, "don't worry. i will make a special loop that will make him better!"

and so, she sailed the boat around and around in a huge loop. after a few minutes, the man was better and could hear again.

they continued their journey and sailed off into the sunset.
once upon a time there was a lazy pipe. he didn't like to move very much and so spent most of his days sleeping.

one day, he was awoken by a voice. it was a number! the number said, "hey pipe! wake up! let's go exploring!". the pipe sighed and replied, "no thanks. i'm too lazy to move." 

but the number was persistent. he said, "come on, pipe! moving will make you feel better, i promise!"

the pipe thought about it for a minute, and then decided to give it a try. so, he moved his long body around and even danced a bit. he was surprised to find that he actually enjoyed it!

so, from then on the lazy pipe and the number went on many fun adventures. no matter what, the pipe was always happy to go exploring with his friend.

"of course," her mom said.

the girl went to her room and got out her favorite dress. she put it on and twirled around in it.

she then asked, "mommy, can i use your microphone?"

"that's a good idea," mom said.

the girl grabbed the microphone and pretended to be a singer. she sang her favorite song at the top of her lungs.

mom said, "you are so interesting and creative. i'm so proud of you!"

the girl smiled and thanked mom. she then put the microphone away, and the two hugged.
once upon a time there was a girl who loved to solve puzzles. on this special day, she had three puzzles that she wanted to complete.

the first puzzle was made of plastic and it was hard to solve. the girl tried to think of the right way to put it together and after a few tries, she finally did it!

the second puzzle was also plastic and it was very hard. the girl was determined to figure it out and so she kept on looking and thinking hard until she finally solved it.

the last puzzle was made of hard plastic and it looked like it would be tricky to solve. but the girl never gave up and after a few attempts, she managed to put it together.

suddenly, a voice said, "you did it! you solved all three puzzles!" the girl looked around and saw a big doggy smile at her. she smiled back and said, "i did it all by myself!"
once upon a time, there was a small fish called fin. fin loved to swim around in the calm river. one day, fin noticed a gentle wave rise up in the distance and he swam towards it. 

as he got closer, he saw something strange. a small wood boat was being carried by the wave, with a smiling old man inside. when fin was close enough, the old man called out, "hello there fin! you look so strong and brave, could you help me get to the other side of the river?" 

fin was so excited. he wanted to help the old man, so he nodded his head. then he swam alongside the boat, pushing it with all the strength he had.

the old man thanked him, patting fin's head with a gentle hand. then, with fin's help, the boat rose up to the other side of the river. the old man waved goodbye, and fin waved back, before swimming off to explore the other side of the river.
jack went to the beach with his mom. he couldn't wait to explore! his mom said, "let's test the water. is it too cold?" jack was excited and waded in the water. it was just the right temperature!

soon, jack saw something shiny in the sand. he ran over to pick it up. it was a big, fancy oyster! "wow mom, look at this oyster! can i keep it?" his mom smiled and said yes. 

jack held the oyster in his hands and asked, "can i open it?" his mom nodded. she said, "it's okay to try, but be careful!" jack carefully pried the oyster open and found a shining pearl inside. he exclaimed, "mom, look! i found a pearl in this fancy oyster!" his mom smiled, "wow, that was a fun test!"

first, they had to mix the dough. amy poured some flour, sugar, and eggs into a big bowl. then, she mixed it all together with her hands. it was a harmless and fun thing to do. the dough felt soft and squishy.

when the dough was ready, amy and her mom rolled it out on the table. they used cookie cutters to make fun shapes like stars, hearts, and circles. then, they put the cookies in the oven to bake. soon, the whole house smelled like yummy cookies. amy and her mom enjoyed eating the delicious cookies they made together.
once upon a time, a little girl named lily wanted to go to the park. she put on her shoes and asked her mom, "can i go to the park, please?" her mom said, "yes, but be careful, and don't go too far."

at the park, lily saw a fragile butterfly. she wanted to play with it. she tried to turn around to catch it, but she was not fast enough. the butterfly flew away. lily was sad and wanted to find the butterfly again.

lily looked everywhere in the park for the butterfly. she saw a big tree and thought the butterfly might be there. as she went to the tree, she found a boy named tim. tim was also looking for the butterfly. they both wanted the butterfly, but there was only one. they decided to take turns to catch it. lily tried first, but she could not catch it. then tim tried, and he caught the butterfly. he shared it with lily, and they both were happy. they played together at the park until it was time to go home.

sue said, "okay, tom! i will cut first." sue cut the paper. it was tough to cut, but she did it. then, she gave the scissors to tom. tom cut the paper too. it was tough for him as well, but he was happy to do it.

after they both cut the paper, they made a big mess. tom and sue looked at each other and laughed. they had fun sharing the scissors and cutting the tough paper. then, they cleaned up the mess together.

her mom replied, "it looks like someone is having a party to celebrate something special!"

while they were walking, lily saw a stranger with a big smile on his face. he was giving out cupcakes to everyone. lily wanted a cupcake too, but she remembered her mom's words about not talking to strangers.

lily looked at her mom and asked, "can i have a cupcake, mommy?" her mom said, "let me ask the man for you." her mom talked to the stranger and got a cupcake for lily.

they both enjoyed the cupcake and joined the celebration. lily was happy to be a part of the fun day at the park.

finally, they found the bird's family in a big tree. the bird was so happy and said, "thank you, lily! you are a good friend." lily smiled and said, "you're welcome! i'm glad i could help." then, they all played together in the beautiful nature.
