one day, the little girl went to the park. she played with her friends and had lots of fun. but she fell down and got her pretty white dress dirty. the little girl started to weep. she was very sad.

a kind lady saw the girl weeping and asked, "why are you weeping, dear?" the little girl said, "my pretty white dress is dirty now." the kind lady smiled and said, "don't worry, i can help you!" she cleaned the dress and made it white again. the little girl was happy and thanked the kind lady. they played together in the park and became good friends.
one day, a cool cat named tom went for a walk. he saw a big green thing with spikes. it was a cactus! tom thought it was very cool. he wanted to play with it, but he did not want to get hurt by the spikes. so, he thought of a plan.

tom found a long stick. he thought he could use the stick to play with the cactus. but then, he saw his friend, the dog named max. max wanted to play with tom. tom wanted to play with max too, but he wanted to play with the cactus first. so, tom told max to wait. he said, "max, i have to delay our play."

tom used the stick to touch the cactus. it was fun! he did not get hurt. then, he heard max bark. max was sad because he was waiting for a long time. tom knew it was time to play with max. he left the cactus and went to play with max. they had a lot of fun together. tom was happy he could play with the cactus and max too.
once upon a time, in a small village, there was a helpful man named tom. tom liked to create things with his hands. one day, he decided to make a big chest to store toys for the children in the village.

tom worked hard to make the chest. he used wood, nails, and paint. when he was done, the chest was very big and colorful. he put the chest in the middle of the village and filled it with toys.

one day, a little girl named lily saw the chest and said, "wow! look at all the toys!" tom smiled and said, "take one, and share with your friends." lily took a toy and shared it with her friends. they all played together and had a lot of fun.

soon, all the children in the village learned to share the toys from the chest. they learned that sharing was good and made everyone happy. the helpful man, tom, was happy to see the children playing together.

the moral of the story is that sharing is a good thing, and being helpful can make everyone happy.

colorful smiled and said, "yes, bumpy! i love to go on drives with you!"

one day, fluffy and a little bird had a quarrel. "you are a bad cat!" said the little bird. "no, i am not!" said fluffy. they were very loud.

the old man heard the quarrel and came outside. he saw the mess fluffy made. "fluffy, you must be good," said the old man. fluffy felt sad and said, "i will be good." from that day on, fluffy was a good cat and never had a quarrel again.
once upon a time, there was a smelly dog named spot. spot loved to play in the mud and roll around in the dirt. he was a very happy dog, but sometimes he would get very dirty.

one day, spot was playing outside and found a big pile of mud. he jumped in the mud and rolled around, getting very smelly. then, spot went back to the house to show his family how much fun he had. but when he got home, his family did not like the smell.

spot's family told him that he needed to take a bath. spot did not like baths, but he knew he had to get clean. he felt regret for getting so smelly. spot took a bath and was clean again. from that day on, spot tried to stay clean and not get too smelly.

one day, a boy named tim and his dog, spot, went for a walk in the big park. they saw a wide tree with many branches. tim said, "let's go climb that tree, spot!" spot wagged his tail and barked, "yes, let's go!"

as they climbed the tree, they heard an alarm sound. "what's that?" asked tim. "i don't know," barked spot. they looked around and saw a little bird stuck in a hole. the bird was making the alarm sound because it needed help.

tim and spot went to the little bird. tim said, "don't worry, bird. we will help you!" they worked together to get the bird out of the hole. the bird was happy and thanked them. tim and spot felt good for helping a friend. they continued their fun day at the park, playing together under the wide tree.
one day, a little girl named sue and her mom were talking. sue said, "mom, i want a holiday." mom smiled and said, "we can plan a fun trip, but not too expensive."

they looked at a big book with pictures of places. sue saw a picture of a beach. she said, "i want to go here!" mom said, "that's a nice beach. let's save money for our trip."

sue helped mom save money. she put coins in a jar. one day, the jar was full. mom said, "we have enough money for our holiday!"

they went to the beach. sue played in the sand and swam in the water. she was very happy. at the end of the day, sue said, "thank you, mom, for our fun holiday!"
one day, a little turkey named tim was very excited. he was going to play with his friends in the park. tim ran to the park as fast as his little turkey legs could go.

when tim got to the park, he saw a big dog. the dog was loud and scary. tim started to tremble because he was scared of the big dog. he wanted to play with his friends, but the dog was in the way.

tim's friend, a small bird named bobby, saw that tim was scared. bobby said, "don't worry, tim. i will help you." bobby flew over to the big dog and started to sing a pretty song. the big dog liked the song and followed bobby away from the park.

now tim was not scared anymore. he stopped trembling and went to play with his friends. they all had a fun day at the park. tim was very happy and thankful for his brave friend bobby.
once upon a time, there was a little ball named billy. billy loved to roll around the park. one day, he saw a big frame near the trees. it was a new thing for him, so he felt worried.

billy called his friend, a small bird named polly. "polly, what is this big frame?" he asked. polly flew closer and looked at the frame. "don't be worried, billy," said polly. "it's just a frame to play with. you can roll through it."

billy was excited to try it. he rolled through the frame and laughed. polly cheered for him. they played together all day long. billy was no longer worried about the frame, and he had lots of fun with his friend polly.
one day, a little girl named mia went for a walk. she saw a delicate butterfly sitting on a flower. mia said, "hello, butterfly! i am mia. what is your name?" the butterfly did not say anything, but it danced in the air.

mia wanted to introduce the butterfly to her friends. she took the butterfly to her friends, tom and lily. mia said, "tom, lily, meet my new friend, the butterfly!" tom and lily said, "hello, butterfly!"

together, they decided to have a march around the garden. mia, tom, lily, and the butterfly marched and danced in the sun. they had a fun day playing together.
once upon a time, there was a rich man named tom. tom had a big house and many toys. one day, tom saw a little bird in a small jail. the bird was sad and wanted to fly.

tom said, "little bird, i will help you." tom went to the jail and used his hands to lift the door. the bird was free and happy. the bird said, "thank you, tom!"

from that day, tom and the little bird were best friends. they played together every day. tom learned that helping others made him happier than his big house and many toys.
one day, a boy named tim went to a parade with his mom. they saw big balloons and people playing music. tim loved the parade a lot.

tim saw a man with a funny hat. the man said, "i feel stupid with this hat, but it's fun!" tim laughed and said, "i love your hat!" the man smiled and gave tim a high five.

at the end of the parade, tim and his mom went home. they talked about the funny man with the stupid hat. tim said, "i want to go to another parade!" his mom hugged him and said, "we will go again soon."
once upon a time, in a small village, there lived a weak old man named tom. tom had a big iron, which he used to press his clothes. one day, he needed help with his iron because it was too heavy for him.

tom went to his friend, sam, and said, "sam, please help me with my iron. i am too weak to use it." sam agreed and said, "sure, tom. i will help you." so, sam went to tom's house and helped him press his clothes with the iron.

after they were done, tom thanked sam and said, "thank you, sam. you are a good friend." sam smiled and said, "you're welcome, tom. i am always here to help you." and from that day on, they became the best of friends and always helped each other when they needed it.
once upon a time, there was a small cat named kitty. kitty liked to play with her friends, but sometimes she was not nice. one day, kitty took her friend's toy without asking.

kitty's friend, doggy, said, "kitty, that's my toy! please give it back!" but kitty didn't want to give it back. she ran away with the toy and hid it under a tree.

soon, the other animals found out what kitty did. they were very angry. they said, "kitty, you must become good, or you will go to jail." but kitty didn't listen to them.

one day, the animals caught kitty taking another toy. they said, "now you must go to jail." they put kitty in a small jail made of sticks.

kitty was sad, and she did not like the bad ending. she wished she had been good and listened to her friends.
one day, a little boy named tim wanted to watch his favorite show on the television. tim was very calm as he sat on the floor in front of the television. he waited for his show to start.

his mom walked into the room and said, "tim, please stand up and turn on the television." tim stood up and pushed the button on the television. the screen lit up, and his show began to play.

as tim watched his show, a friendly dog named spot came into the room. spot sat down next to tim and watched the television too. they both enjoyed the show and were very calm and happy.
once upon a time, a little boy named tim went to school. his teacher, miss kate, was very nice. tim had many friends who were pupils too. they played and learned together. one day, tim saw a big, shiny toy car in a shop. it was very expensive, but he wanted it so much.

tim asked his mom, "can i have the expensive toy car, please?" his mom said, "no, it is too much money. we cannot buy it." tim was sad, but he had an idea. he thought he could take the toy car without his mom knowing.

the next day, tim went to the shop and took the toy car. he hid it in his bag and went to school. when he got to school, he showed his friends the toy car. they all wanted to play with it. tim let them play with the car, but he didn't tell them he took it from the shop.

miss kate saw the pupils playing with the expensive toy car. she knew it was not tim's car. she asked tim, "where did you get this car?" tim didn't want to tell the truth. he lied and said, "my mom bought it for me." miss kate knew tim was not telling the truth. she called his mom and found out he took the car from the shop.

tim got in big trouble. his mom was very sad and angry. she made tim return the toy car to the shop and say sorry. tim learned that taking things without asking is wrong. he felt bad and promised never to do it again. but because he lied, his friends and miss kate did not trust him anymore. tim was very sad and lonely.
one day, a cute little girl named lily went to her garden. she had a small bag of beans. she wanted to grow big bean plants. lily dug a hole in the ground and put a bean in it. she covered the bean with dirt and gave it some water. "grow big and strong, little bean," she said.

the next day, lily saw a small bird in her garden. the bird looked at the place where lily put the bean. "are you looking for my bean?" lily asked the bird. the bird nodded its head. lily thought the bird was hungry, so she gave it some seeds to eat. "you can visit my bean, but don't eat it, okay?" the bird nodded again and flew away.

days went by, and lily took care of her bean every day. the bird came back to visit, too. one day, the bean started to grow into a big, strong plant. lily was so happy! the bird came back and saw the big bean plant. it nodded its head and flew away. lily knew that the bird was happy for her and her big bean plant.
once upon a time, there was a big, bossy cat named tom. tom liked to tell everyone what to do. he lived in a small house with his friend, a little mouse named tim.

one day, tom saw tim near the stove. tom was scared that tim might get hurt. so, he yelled, "tim, stay away from the stove!" tim jumped and ran away from the stove quickly.

from that day on, tim knew that tom was only bossy because he cared. they played together and had lots of fun. and tim never went near the stove again.
one day, a big rain came. it made the ground very wet. a little boy named tim went outside to play. he saw a small bird who was sad.

"why are you sad?" tim asked the bird.

"my nest is wet, and i can't keep my eggs warm," the bird said.

tim wanted to help the bird. he found a dry spot under a big tree. he helped the bird move her nest there. the bird was happy.

"thank you, tim," said the bird. "now i can keep my eggs warm."

from that day on, tim and the bird were good friends. they played together every day, even when the ground was wet.
once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a fearful tiger. the tiger was scared of everything. he was scared of the wind, the rain, and even the little bugs.

one day, the fearful tiger found a small, lost kitten. the kitten was all alone, and it was sad. the tiger wanted to help the kitten, so he decided to carry it on his back. together, they walked through the forest, looking for the kitten's home.

as they walked, the fearful tiger started to feel brave. he was not scared of the wind or the rain anymore. the little kitten made the tiger feel strong. finally, they found the kitten's home, and the tiger was very happy. from that day on, the tiger was not fearful anymore. he had a new friend, and they lived happily in the big forest.
one day, a little girl named lily went to the kitchen. she wanted to make lemon juice. she saw a big bowl on the table. lily picked up a lemon and began to squeeze it into the bowl. the juice went into the bowl, and lily was happy.

just then, lily's dog, max, came into the kitchen. he barked loud, "woof! woof!" lily said, "max, you are so loud! i am making lemon juice. do you want some?" max wagged his tail and barked again, "woof! woof!"

lily poured some lemon juice into a small bowl for max. he lapped it up and made a funny face. "it's sour, isn't it, max?" lily giggled. max barked softly, "woof!" they both laughed and enjoyed the lemon juice together.
one day, a little girl named lucy found a jar of jam. it was her favorite, red and sweet. she wanted to eat it all. but the jar was tough to open. she tried and tried, but it just would not open.

lucy asked her big brother tom for help. "tom, can you open this tough jar for me?" tom was strong and opened the jar easily. but as he opened it, he accidentally cut his finger on the jar's lid. it hurt a lot.

lucy felt bad and wanted to help tom. she knew that hugs could heal. so, she hugged tom tight and said, "i'm sorry, tom. i hope your finger heals fast." tom smiled and thanked lucy for her hug. they both enjoyed the sweet jam together, and soon, tom's finger healed.
one day, a boy went to visit a king. the king was very big and wore a gold hat. the king was troubled because he lost his favorite toy.

the boy said, "king, don't be sad. i will help you find your toy." they looked in the big room and the small room. they looked under the bed and in the toy box.

at last, they found the toy behind a big chair. the king was very happy. he said, "thank you, boy! you are a good friend." and they played with the toy together.
one day, a girl named sue had a basket. sue loved her basket because it was very good at holding things. she could put her toys, food, and other stuff in it. sue thought her basket was reliable.

sue wanted to show her friend, tom, her basket. she went outside and saw tom. "look at my basket!" sue said to tom. tom looked at the basket and thought it was nice. but tom wanted to see if it was strong. he took the basket and started to run with it.

sue did not want tom to run with her basket. she was scared that he would break it. sue ran after tom and said, "stop! please give me my basket back!" tom stopped running and looked at sue. he saw that she was upset.

tom said sorry to sue and gave her back the basket. sue was happy to have her basket back. they both learned that it is important to be careful with other people's things. and sue learned that her basket was strong and reliable, even when tom ran with it.
one day, a little red car named zoomy loved to zoom around his town. he liked to make a loud whistle sound as he went fast. the sun was warm and bright today, so zoomy went out to play.

zoomy saw his friend, a big blue car named biggy. biggy said, "zoomy, can i join you to play?" zoomy said, "yes, but we must race to see who is the fastest!" biggy agreed, and they started to race. zoomy went zoom and made a loud whistle sound, but biggy was going faster.

zoomy was sad because he wanted to be the fastest. he told biggy, "i don't want to play anymore." biggy felt bad and said, "i'm sorry, zoomy. let's play another game where we can both have fun!" so, zoomy and biggy played a new game, and they both had a great time in the warm sun.
one day, a little girl named mia wanted to draw a picture. she went to her room to unpack her box of crayons. mia saw that her favorite crayon, the red one, was dry and broken. she felt sad and didn't know what to do.

mia went to her mom and said, "mom, my red crayon is dry and broken. i can't draw my picture now." her mom looked at the dry crayon and thought for a moment.

her mom said, "let's go to the store and buy a new box of crayons. then you can draw your picture with a new red crayon." mia felt happy and excited to get new crayons.

at the store, mia picked out a big box of crayons with many colors. when they got home, mia unpacked her new crayons and started to draw her picture. she was very happy that she could draw with her new red crayon.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named tim. tim was a popular boy in his school. he had many friends who liked to play with him. tim was nice and never teased anyone.

one tuesday, tim and his friends were playing in the park. they saw a new boy sitting alone. tim went to the new boy and said, "hi, i'm tim. do you want to play with us?" the new boy smiled and said, "yes, thank you!"

as they played, one of tim's friends started to tease the new boy. tim said, "stop teasing him. we should be nice to our new friend." tim's friend said sorry, and they all played happily together. the new boy was happy to have nice friends like tim, and they all had a fun day.
once upon a time, there was a clean dog named true. true loved to play outside with his best friend, a little boy named sam. they would run and jump and have lots of fun together.

one day, true and sam went to play near a big tree. but true did not see a big rock and he fell down. poor true started to suffer because his leg hurt a lot. sam was sad to see his best friend in pain.

sam knew he had to help true. he took true to his mom, who put a soft bandage on true's leg. with lots of love and care, true started to feel better. soon, true and sam were back to having fun together, and they were more careful near the big tree.
once upon a time, there was a little bunny who loved to hop. one day, he hopped to a big tree where all the animals were meeting. they were meeting to see who could hop the farthest.

the bunny was worried because he had never hopped in front of so many animals before. he saw a wise old owl sitting on a branch. the owl was the judge of the hopping game. the bunny asked the owl, "can i hop too?"

the owl said, "yes, little bunny, you can hop too." so, the bunny hopped as far as he could. all the animals clapped and cheered. the wise old owl, the judge, said, "you did a great job, little bunny! you hopped very far."

the bunny was very happy and not worried anymore. he knew that he could hop far and make new friends. from that day on, the bunny hopped and played with all the animals under the big tree. they all had lots of fun together.
once upon a time, in an ordinary little town, there lived a boy named tim. tim was very hungry. his stomach made loud noises. he wanted to eat something yummy.

tim saw a big apple tree. he asked his friend, sam, "can you please help me get an apple?" sam agreed and helped tim climb the tree. they both picked apples and ate them. but the apples were not ordinary apples.

soon, tim and sam felt sick. their stomachs hurt a lot. they cried out, "oh no! what did we eat?" they did not know that the apples were bad apples.

in the end, tim and sam were still sick. they learned a lesson to not eat apples from that tree again. their ordinary day turned into a very bad day.
once upon a time, there was a yellow house. in the house, there was a girl named sally. sally loved to paint. she had a lot of fun making pretty pictures.

one day, sally's friend timmy came over to play. they decided to paint together. timmy said, "sally, let's paint a big, yellow sun!" sally agreed, and they started to paint the sun on a big piece of paper.

while they were painting, the telephone rang. sally picked it up and said, "hello?" it was her grandma on the other side. grandma said, "hi sally! i miss you. can i come visit you today?" sally was very happy and said, "yes, grandma! please come. we are painting a big, yellow sun!"

grandma came over, and they all painted together. they had a great time, and the big, yellow sun was very pretty. at the end of the day, they hung the painting on the wall, and it made everyone smile.
one day, a boy named tim found a small, rough metal car. he loved to play with cars, so he was very happy. he showed it to his mom and said, "look, mom! i found a car!"

his mom looked at the car and said, "that's a nice car, tim. you can drive it around the house."

tim drove the car around the living room, making car noises. he drove it on the rug, under the table, and near the big chair. the car went fast and tim laughed.

later, tim's friend, lily, came over to play. tim showed her the rough metal car. they both drove it around the house, having lots of fun. they played together until it was time for lily to go home.
one day, a bird wanted to fly high in the sky. the bird was very serious about flying. he flapped his wings and flew up, up, up!

as the bird flew, he saw a point far away. he wanted to go to the point. he thought, "i can fly there!" so, he flew and flew until he got close to the point.

when he got to the point, he saw a little bug. the bug said, "hello, bird! did you fly here?" the bird said, "yes, i did! i flew very high to get here." the bug and the bird became friends, and they played together at the point.
once upon a time, there was a girl named sally. she liked to play with her doll named lucy. one day, sally met a boy named tom. tom had a toy car. they played together and had fun.

sally said to tom, "i want to marry you." tom said, "ok, let's marry." they played a game where they pretended to be married. they had a big party with their toys.

but then, a bad dog came. the dog took lucy and the toy car. sally and tom said, "no, bad dog!" they chased the dog and got their toys back. they were happy and played together again.
one day, a little girl named lily went outside to play. the weather was sunny and warm. she saw her friend, tim, sitting on the grass. he looked sad and sorry.

lily sat down next to tim and asked, "why are you sad?" tim whispered, "i lost my toy car." lily wanted to help tim feel better, so she said, "let's look for it together!"

they looked under the trees, behind the bushes, and in the sandbox. finally, they found the toy car hiding in the tall grass. tim was so happy, he hugged lily and said, "thank you for helping me!" from that day on, lily and tim were the best of friends.
one day, a white owl lived in a big tree. the white owl loved to fly at night and look for food. the white owl had a friend, a small brown mouse. they liked to play together in the forest.

one day, the white owl saw a big, red apple on the ground. the white owl wanted to share the apple with the small brown mouse. but the apple was not good. it was old and it had started to rot. the white owl did not know that the apple was bad.

the white owl and the small brown mouse ate the bad apple. soon, they both felt sick. they were very sad because they could not play together in the forest anymore. the white owl and the small brown mouse learned that they should not eat food that is old and rotten.
once upon a time, there was a dry tree. an owl lived in the tree. the owl had a friend, a little mouse. the mouse lived in a hole near the tree. one day, the owl and the mouse wanted to play a game.

the owl said, "let's measure our tails!" the mouse thought it was a fun game. they both took turns to measure their tails. the mouse's tail was long, but the owl's tail was short.

the owl said, "you win, little mouse!" the mouse was very happy. they both laughed and played more games. the owl and the mouse were best friends and always had fun together.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. lily loved to play with her dolls and have tea parties with her stuffed animals. one day, lily's mom told her it was time for a haircut. lily didn't want a haircut because she loved her long hair that she could shake back and forth.

but lily's mom said, "your hair is getting too long and it's making you hot. you'll feel much better with a nice haircut."

lily didn't like the sound of that, but she trusted her mom. so, they went to the hair salon and lily sat in the big chair. the hairdresser started to cut lily's hair and lily was nervous. but then, the hairdresser showed lily how she could shake her new haircut and it made her feel better.

lily was so happy with her new haircut that she couldn't stop shaking her head and saying, "thank you, mom!"
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy had a gray cat named mittens. mittens was very soft and timmy liked to pet her.

one day, timmy found a box outside. the box was very rough and had some tape on it. timmy asked mittens, "what's inside the box?" mittens meowed back, "i don't know, timmy. why don't you open it?"

timmy was excited and he tried to open the box. it was hard to open, but he finally did it. inside the box, he found a toy car. timmy was happy and he said to mittens, "look, mittens! i found a toy car! let's play together." and they played with the toy car until it was time for dinner.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved going to the museum with her mommy and daddy. they would see lots of cool things like big dinosaurs and shiny rocks.

one day, lily saw a pretty vase in the museum. she wanted to touch it, but her mommy said no. lily was nervous because she really wanted to touch it. 

a man came up to them and said, "would you like to see a special part of the museum?" lily's mommy said yes, but lily was still nervous. 

the man took them to a room with lots of expensive things. lily saw the pretty vase again and she couldn't resist. she touched it and it broke into a million pieces. the man got angry and lily and her family had to pay lots of money to fix it. lily felt sad and her mommy said, "we should have listened and never touched things in the museum."
once upon a time, there was a big hurricane. the wind was blowing very hard and the rain was pouring down. a little girl named lily was scared and asked her mom, "what's happening?"

her mom replied, "there's a big storm outside. but don't worry, we're safe inside our house."

suddenly, the power went out and it was very dark. but then, the lightning revealed a surprise. lily's mom had lit candles all around the room, making it feel cozy and warm. lily smiled and said, "i like the candles. they make me feel safe."

her mom hugged her and said, "i'm glad. sometimes, even in the midst of a scary storm, we can find something beautiful and comforting."
once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved to play outside, but today it was gloomy and rainy. timmy was sad because he couldn't play outside. he sat inside and watched the raindrops fall on the window.

suddenly, timmy had an idea. he went to get his bucket and filled it with water from the sink. he pretended he was outside in the rain, splashing around with his bucket. timmy had so much fun, he started to dream about being outside in the sunshine.

the rain stopped and the sun came out. timmy was so happy! he ran outside with his bucket and played in the puddles. timmy knew that even when things seem gloomy, there is always a way to have fun and dream about better days.
once upon a time, a little girl named lily went to visit her grandma. when she got there, her grandma gave her a big hug and said, "hello, lily! you are so polite."

lily smiled and said, "thank you, grandma!" then, her grandma showed her how to do the lock on the front door. "you have to turn the key like this," she said, as she demonstrated.

lily watched carefully and then tried it herself. she did it perfectly! "i did it, grandma!" she exclaimed. her grandma smiled and said, "you are such a smart girl, lily." and they spent the rest of the day playing together.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to draw and make shapes with her crayons. one day, she drew a big triangle with her purple crayon. she was so proud of it, she showed it to her mommy and daddy.

but then, she realized she lost her purple crayon. she looked everywhere for it, under her bed and in her toy box. she sighed sadly, feeling upset that she couldn't finish her drawing.

her mommy saw how sad she was and gave her a new purple crayon. lily was so happy, she hugged her mommy and said thank you. but then she saw the price tag on the new crayon and said "wow, this is expensive!" her mommy just smiled and said it was worth it to see her happy. and lily went back to drawing her big triangle with her new purple crayon.
once upon a time, there was a young girl named lily. she had a nice smile and loved to play with her toys. one day, she went to the park with her mom and dad. while playing, she lost her favorite toy bear. lily looked all around the park but couldn't find it. she felt sad and wanted her bear back. her parents tried to help her find it but they couldn't either. 

lily went home feeling very upset. but the next day, her parents surprised her with a new teddy bear. it wasn't exactly the same as her old one, but it was still nice and soft. lily was happy again and hugged her new bear tightly. she learned that even though she lost something she loved, she can still find happiness in other things.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved playing games with his daddy. they played all kinds of games together like hide and seek, tag, and catch. timmy's daddy was very competitive and always wanted to win.

one day, timmy and his daddy went to the park to play. they brought a special game that timmy's daddy had made. it was a surprise for timmy. daddy told timmy that they were going to play a game where they had to open a special box. timmy was very excited to play.

daddy and timmy started playing the game. daddy was very competitive and tried his best to open the box before timmy. but timmy was very clever and opened the box first! inside the box was a special prize for timmy. daddy was very happy for timmy and they both laughed and played together for the rest of the day. timmy learned that sometimes it's not about winning, but about having fun with your daddy.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a special toy that she loved very much. one day, she went to play with it but she forgot where she put it. she looked everywhere, but she couldn't find it.

lily's mom saw her looking sad and asked her what was wrong. lily told her that she lost her toy and couldn't find it. her mom helped her look for it and they finally found it under the bed. but when they picked it up, they saw that it had a leak and was broken.

lily was sad that her toy was broken, but her mom told her not to worry. she said they could fix it and make it as good as new. they took the toy to a special place where it could be fixed. when they got it back, it was all fixed and the leak was gone. but lily's mom had hidden a surprise inside the toy. when lily played with it, she found a little note that said "i love you". lily was so happy and hugged her mom tightly.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a pocket in her dress where she kept her favorite toys. one day, she went to the park to play with her friends. while playing, she found a shiny rock on the ground. she picked it up and put it in her pocket, thinking it was special.

when she got home, she showed her mom the rock. her mom told her that it was just a regular rock, but lily still thought it was valuable. she kept the rock in her pocket and took it with her everywhere she went, even though it was very light.

one day, lily's little brother wanted to play with the rock. lily told him how much she valued it and that she didn't want him to lose it. her brother promised to take good care of it, and lily let him play with it. from that day on, lily and her brother shared the rock and both thought it was very special.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play in the park with her friends. one day, while playing hide and seek, lily's friend tommy vanished. lily was scared and didn't know what to do.

lily ran to her mommy and daddy and told them what happened. her daddy said, "let's go find tommy. we will ask the lawyer who lives next door if he saw anything."

the lawyer was very honest and told them that he saw tommy playing near the lake. they rushed to the lake and found tommy safe and sound. lily was so happy that her friend was okay. from that day on, lily and her friends never played near the lake again.
once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved his toy car with a motor. he would play with it every day and make it go vroom vroom. 

one day, timmy's friend came over to play. timmy was so proud to show his friend his toy car. his friend liked it too and asked if he could own one too. 

timmy said yes and they played together with their toy cars. they had so much fun that they didn't even notice it was time for lunch. timmy's mom called them in and they happily ran inside, still talking about their toy cars.
once upon a time, a little boy named timmy went fishing with his dad. timmy was very excited to catch a fish. he had a fishing rod and a bucket ready to put his fish in. 

they went to the lake and started fishing. timmy's dad caught a big fish and timmy was happy for him. but timmy didn't catch anything. he waited and waited, but no fish came. 

suddenly, timmy felt a tug on his fishing rod. he was so happy! he had caught a fish! but the fish was too strong and pulled timmy into the water. timmy's dad tried to save him, but it was too late. timmy didn't have his fish, but the fish had him.
once upon a time, there was a girl named lily. she had a toy rabbit that she loved very much. one day, lily's mom suggested that they go to a beautiful park. lily was excited and said, "yes, please!"

at the park, they saw lots of trees, flowers, and a big pond with ducks. lily's mom suggested they have a picnic by the pond. they ate sandwiches and fruit, and lily's mom suggested they play a game of catch.

after playing, they went to a lab where lily's mom worked. it was a big room with lots of machines and tools. lily thought it was very interesting, but also a bit scary. her mom showed her some pretty crystals that were very beautiful. lily was happy to have seen something new and exciting.
once upon a time, there was a big animal farm. there were cows, pigs, chickens, and ducks. they all lived together and played together. one day, the cows and the pigs started to quarrel. they were arguing about who was the best animal on the farm.

the chickens and the ducks tried to calm them down, but it didn't work. then, the farmer came and saw what was happening. he told them that they were all special in their own way and that they should be happy with who they were.

after the farmer left, the animals felt better. they decided to have a picnic together and share their delicious food. they all agreed that the food was so yummy and they were happy that they didn't quarrel anymore. from that day on, they all played together and lived happily ever after.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. it was her birthday today and she was very excited. she woke up early in the morning and ran to her parents' room.

"mummy, daddy, it's my birthday today!" she said with a big smile on her face.

"i know, sweetie. we have a surprise for you," her mother replied.

lily was curious and asked, "what is it?"

"we have a special gift for you. it's a beautiful dress that you can wear to your birthday party tonight," her father said.

lily was so excited that she started to jump up and down. "yay! i can't wait to hang up my new dress in my closet!" she exclaimed.

her parents laughed and hugged her. they knew it was going to be a wonderful birthday for their little girl.
once upon a time, a little ant named andy wanted to find some food. he crawled and crawled until he found a big piece of candy. it looked amazing! but when he tried to take it back to his home, a big, mean bird swooped down and took it away. andy was sad and hungry.

he decided to ask his ant friends if they had any food to share. but they didn't have any, and they were all worried about something else. they had heard that a thief had stolen all the money from their ant hill! they needed the money to buy food and build a new home.

andy had an idea. he remembered seeing a shiny coin on the ground earlier. he crawled back to where he saw it and found it again. he brought it back to his friends and they were amazed. it wasn't enough to buy everything they needed, but it was a start. they thanked andy for his help and together they worked to build a new home and find more food.
once upon a time, there was a monkey named max. max loved to eat bananas. one day, max found a big banana but it was too big for him to eat. 

max asked his friend, a rabbit named rosie, "can you help me split this banana?" 

rosie tried to split the banana but it was too persistent. they both tried and tried but the banana wouldn't split. 

suddenly, max had an idea. he climbed up a tree and dropped the banana from high up. the banana split into two pieces! max and rosie were so happy they could finally eat the banana together.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved ice cream and always got a cone when she went to the ice cream shop. one day, she was walking in the park and saw a cone on the ground. she picked it up and saw that it was not smooth, but instead it was bumpy and dirty.

lily wanted to bury the cone so nobody would see it and step on it. she found a spot under a tree and dug a little hole with her hands. she put the cone in the hole and covered it with dirt.

as she walked away, she felt happy that she did something good for the park. she learned that even small actions, like burying a cone, can make a big difference. it's important to take care of our environment and keep it clean for everyone to enjoy.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to eat yummy food. one day, her mommy made her a tasty sandwich. lily ate it all up and her tummy was happy. 

later that day, lily went to the park to play. she met a new friend named timmy. timmy had a cool body because he could climb really high. lily was impressed and wanted to speak to him. she said, "hi timmy, you have a cool body. do you want to play with me?" timmy said yes and they had lots of fun together. 

at the end of the day, lily went home and told her mommy about her new friend. she also told her mommy about the tasty sandwich she had for lunch. her mommy was happy that lily had a fun day and enjoyed her food. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little bunny named benny. he loved to play in the forest with his friends. one day, benny and his friends decided to go on an adventure. they packed their bags with snacks and water, and set off into the forest.

as they walked, benny stumbled over a rock and fell down. his friends helped him up and checked to make sure he was okay. they noticed that one of the gears on benny's backpack had fallen off. they searched for the missing gear, but couldn't find it.

after a while, they came across a soft patch of grass. they decided to take a break and eat their snacks. as they ate, benny remembered something. he had seen the missing gear fall off near the soft grass. they searched again, and this time they found the gear!

benny's friends were so happy that they could continue on their adventure. they all thanked benny for remembering where the gear was. from that day on, they made sure to always double check their gear before going on an adventure.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with his toys all day long. he had a toy car, a toy plane and a toy train. but, timmy had a bad habit of tearing his toys apart when he got angry.

one day, timmy's mom bought him a new toy. it was a wooden puzzle with attractive colors. timmy loved it so much that he promised to take care of it. however, one day, timmy got upset and he started to tear the puzzle apart. he was so sad when he realized what he had done.

his mom saw what happened and she sat down with timmy to talk about it. she explained that it's important to be kind to our things and not to tear them apart. she also said that we should treat others' things with respect too. from that day on, timmy learned to take care of his toys and not to tear them apart.
once upon a time, there was a little bird named tweetie. tweetie was very graceful when she flew in the sky. she loved to sing and play with her bird friends.

one day, tweetie's bird friend, chirpy, came to her and said, "hey tweetie, let's go play a quiz game!" tweetie was excited and said, "yes, let's go!" 

chirpy had a tricky quiz for tweetie. she asked, "what is the thing that you use to poke things?" tweetie thought for a moment and said, "is it a stick?" chirpy said, "no, it's something smaller." tweetie thought again and said, "is it a finger?" chirpy said, "yes, that's right!" 

later that day, tweetie was flying in the sky when she saw a big, juicy worm on the ground. she remembered the quiz and used her beak to poke the worm. she was so happy that she got the quiz right and found a yummy snack!
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, lily went to the park with her mom. she was excited to play on the swings and slide. when they arrived, lily saw a lot of leaves on the ground. she picked up a red leaf and showed it to her mom. "look mommy, pretty leaf!" she said. 

as lily played, she saw a boy who was crying. she went up to him and asked, "why are you crying?" the boy replied, "i lost my toy car." lily said, "don't worry, we will help you find it." they looked around and finally found the toy car under a pile of leaves. the boy was happy and said, "thank you, lily!" 

as they were leaving the park, lily's mom asked her if she had fun. lily replied, "yes, but i heard some people complain about the leaves. i like the leaves, they are pretty." her mom smiled and said, "i like the leaves too, lily."

the little boy said that he lost his toy and he couldn't find it. lily felt sad for him and decided to help him. she asked her friends to help her search for the toy. after a while, they found the toy and gave it to the little boy. he stopped crying and was very happy.

lily felt happy too because she helped someone in need. she learned that it is always good to be gentle and kind to others. she went home and told her mom about what happened. her mom was proud of her and gave her a big hug. from that day on, lily learned that helping others can make them happy and that made her happy too. she shouted with joy and wore her pretty bracelet with pride.

as she was pushing, her mommy said, "lily, can you jog over to the other side and push from there?" lily nodded and jogged over to the other side of the sofa. she pushed and pushed until the sofa was in the right spot.

after they finished moving the furniture, lily's mommy went to the kitchen to make some tea. while she was gone, lily climbed up on the sofa to play with her dolls. suddenly, the sofa tipped over and fell on top of lily. she was hurt very badly and had to go to the hospital.

lily's mommy was very sad and wished she had been there to stop the accident. from that day on, she promised to always watch over lily and keep her safe.

the sister butterfly said she wished she could fly like her sister. the colorful butterfly said, "don't worry, i will teach you how to fly!" and so, the colorful butterfly taught her sister how to fly, and they flew together happily ever after.

finally, her mommy hung up the phone and turned to lily. "what would you like, sweetie?" her mommy asked. "juice please," lily replied. her mommy smiled and went to the kitchen to make her some fancy juice.

max's friend, a little girl named lily, saw him hiding and asked, "what's wrong, max?"

"i saw a big dog and it scared me," max replied.

"don't be scared," lily said. "that dog is friendly. he just wants to play with you."

max wasn't sure, but lily's words excited him. he slowly came out from behind the tree and saw that the big dog was wagging his tail and smiling.

max and the big dog played together and max even shared his bone with him. from that day on, max wasn't scared of big dogs anymore. he was excited to make new friends.

bob felt better and they called the bank. the bank explained everything to them and they made a plan to pay the money back slowly. bob was happy and thanked timmy for his help.

but the red bird saw what the blue bird was doing. the red bird whispered, "that is not nice. friends share things." the blue bird felt bad and gave the rock to the red bird. from that day on, the blue bird learned that it is better to share with friends than to keep things for yourself.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. he loved going to the zoo with his mom and dad. one day, they went to see the rhinoceros. timmy was so excited to see the big, gray animal with the pointy horn on its nose.

as they were looking at the rhinoceros, timmy noticed that it looked troubled. he asked his mom why the rhinoceros looked sad. "i don't know, timmy," his mom replied. "maybe it's because it's in a cage and can't run free like it would in the wild."

timmy thought about this for a moment and then said, "i wish we could help the rhinoceros." his dad smiled and said, "maybe we can. let's go talk to the zookeeper and see what we can do." so they went to find the zookeeper and asked if there was anything they could do to help the rhinoceros. the zookeeper thanked them for their concern and said he would see what he could do to make the rhinoceros happier. timmy felt happy knowing that he had pointed out the rhinoceros's troubles and that they were trying to help.

lily thought and thought about what to draw. she decided to draw a picture of a flower garden. she drew flowers of all different colors and shapes. when she was done, she carefully laid the picture in the frame. "look, mommy! it's so pretty!" said lily.

later that day, lily's dad came home from work. "what did you do today, lily?" he asked. "i drew a picture of a flower garden and laid it in a frame," said lily. her dad smiled and said, "that sounds lovely. can i see it?" lily proudly showed him the picture in the frame. "wow, you're such a talented artist!" said her dad. 

from that day on, lily continued to draw and paint beautiful pictures to lay in frames. she loved to share her artwork with her family and friends, and they always admired her talent.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play outside in the sun. one day, he fell and hurt his knee. it hurt a lot and he cried.

his mom came running and asked, "what happened, timmy?"

"i fell and my knee hurts," timmy said.

"don't worry, i will put a bandage on it and it will heal soon," his mom said.

timmy felt better and went back to playing. later, his friend came over and said, "let's play hide and seek."

timmy said, "okay, but let's wait until noon. it's too hot right now."

his friend agreed and they played until it was time to go home. timmy was happy that his knee was healing and that he had a fun day with his friend. he went to bed with a smile on his face, knowing that tomorrow would be another great day.
once upon a time, there was a little fish named nemo. nemo loved to swim in the deep blue sea with his friends. one day, nemo and his friends were playing a game of tag when suddenly, nemo saw a shiny pearl at the bottom of the sea. 

excitedly, nemo swam down to get the pearl, but as he got deeper and deeper, the silence around him grew stronger. suddenly, nemo heard a big voice say, "who goes there?" it was a big, scary octopus! 

nemo was scared, but he knew he had to be brave. he said, "it's just me, nemo. i saw a pearl and wanted to dive down to get it." the octopus laughed and said, "well, you're a brave little fish. take the pearl and go play with your friends." nemo quickly grabbed the pearl and swam away as fast as he could. he was happy to be back with his friends and told them all about his adventure.

as timmy was doing his exercise, he saw a bird fall from the sky. timmy said, "mommy, look! the bird fell down." his mom said, "oh no, the bird might be dead." timmy felt sad for the bird.

timmy's mom picked up the bird and they took it to the vet. the vet said the bird was just tired and needed some rest. timmy was happy to hear that the bird wasn't dead. from that day on, timmy made sure to always do his exercise so he wouldn't fall down like the bird did.
once upon a time, there was an old lady named granny. she lived in a modest house with her cat, mittens. one day, granny was walking to the store when she saw a little girl with a broken toy. the little girl looked sad, so granny asked her what was wrong.

"my toy is broken," said the little girl. "i don't know how to fix it."

granny stepped closer and looked at the toy. "i can fix that for you," she said with a smile. and she did! the little girl was so happy that she gave granny a big hug. from that day on, the little girl visited granny every week to play with mittens and to hear granny's stories.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to draw and color pictures with her crayons. one day, she wanted to print out a picture she drew on her mommy's computer. 

but then, lily's mommy got very sick and had to go to the hospital. lily was sad and scared because she loved her mommy very much. 

when they got to the hospital, lily saw that the lights were very bright and the walls were white. but then, a nurse gave her a coloring book and some crayons to keep her busy while her mommy was getting better. 

lily stayed at the hospital for a few days, but finally her mommy was all better and they got to go home. when they got home, lily printed out her picture and showed it to her mommy. her mommy was so proud of her and gave her a big hug.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with his blocks. he would build tall towers and knock them down with a big smile on his face. one day, timmy's friend billy came over to play. billy brought some cool new blocks that timmy had never seen before. they were different colors and shapes, and they made timmy laugh when he saw them. 

together, timmy and billy built the coolest tower ever. it was so tall that it almost touched the ceiling! they laughed and played with their blocks all afternoon. when it was time for billy to go home, timmy felt sad. but he knew that he could play with his blocks again tomorrow, and that made him happy. from that day on, timmy and billy were the best of friends, and they always had fun playing with their cool blocks.
once upon a time, there was a dog named max. max liked to dig holes in the yard and chase squirrels. one day, max was playing in the yard and he found a bone. he was so excited that he started to chew it.

but then, max swallowed the bone and it got stuck in his throat. he couldn't breathe and he started to cough. his owner took him to the vet and they did an x-ray. the x-ray showed that the bone was stuck in max's throat and he needed surgery.

during the surgery, max's heart stopped and the vet couldn't save him. everyone felt guilty for not watching max more closely. they learned that sometimes, things that seem like fun can be dangerous and it's important to stop and think before doing something.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to eat cherries, especially the soft ones. one day, her mom gave her a big bowl of cherries to eat. but when lily started to eat them, she saw that one of the cherries was not soft, it was hard.

lily didn't want to eat the hard cherry, but she also didn't want to waste it. she thought about what to do and then came up with an idea. she decided to give the hard cherry to her little brother who loved to eat anything.

when lily gave the hard cherry to her brother, he was so happy and ate it right away. lily felt happy too because she was able to solve the conflict and make her brother happy at the same time. from that day on, lily always remembered to check if the cherries were soft before she ate them.
once upon a time, there was a girl named lily. she loved to run and play with her friends. one day, lily entered a race at her school. she ran as fast as she could and won a huge trophy! lily was so happy that she smiled from ear to ear. she showed her trophy to everyone she met and they all smiled too. from that day on, lily felt proud of herself and kept her trophy on her shelf to remind her of her big win.
once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved to play outside with his friends. one day, they decided to order pizza for lunch. timmy's mom gave him money to pay for the pizza. timmy went to the pizza place and ordered a large pizza with extra cheese. the pizza smelled so cool and timmy couldn't wait to eat it. as he was walking back home, he stubbed his foot on a rock. it hurt a little, but timmy knew he had to be brave and keep going. when he got home, he shared his pizza with his friends and they all had a great time together. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to visit her grandma's house. her grandma was very bossy and always told her what to do. one day, lily went to visit her grandma and something strange happened. the sky turned dark and it started to rain. lily was scared, but her grandma told her not to worry. they sat inside and played games until the rain stopped. after the rain, they went outside to see a beautiful rainbow. lily was so happy that she visited her grandma even though it was raining.
once upon a time, there was a happy dog named max. max was very loyal to his owner, a little girl named lily. max loved to play with lily and go on walks with her.

one day, lily and max went to the park to play. they played fetch and ran around together. suddenly, a big bird flew overhead. lily looked up and said, "wow, that bird can fly really high!" max barked and wagged his tail.

later that day, lily and max were walking home when they saw the bird again. this time, the bird swooped down and grabbed max with its claws. lily screamed and tried to save max, but it was too late. the bird flew away with max and lily never saw her loyal friend again.

before the bird took max away, lily had a bad feeling in her stomach. she knew something bad was going to happen, but she didn't listen to her instincts. now, she was very sad and missed max very much.

later that day, lily went to her drawer to get her favorite toy, but it was gone! she looked everywhere but couldn't find it. she felt envious of her brother because she thought he took it. but then, her brother came in with her toy and said he was sorry for taking it without asking. lily forgave him and they played together happily.

as she played with the puppy, lily started to imagine all the fun adventures they could have together. she imagined running through fields and playing in the park. the puppy licked her face and wagged its tail, as if it could understand her thoughts.

from that day on, the puppy became lily's best friend. they went on many adventures together and had lots of fun. lily was so happy she had found the cute little puppy on the side of the road.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to climb mountains with her parents. one day, they found a very ugly mountain. it was covered in brown rocks and had no trees or flowers. lily's parents wanted to climb it, but lily refused. she said it was too ugly and scary. 

her parents tried to convince her, but she wouldn't budge. so they left her with a babysitter and went to climb the mountain without her. unfortunately, they got lost and never came back. lily was very sad and missed them a lot. she wished she had gone with them, even if the mountain was ugly. 

from that day on, lily never refused to do something her parents wanted to do. she learned that spending time with them was more important than how things looked. she still loved climbing mountains, but she never forgot the lesson she learned from the ugly mountain.
once upon a time, there was a little mouse named max. max loved to eat cheese. one day, max saw a big piece of cheese on the table. it looked so tasty! max ran to the cheese and took a bite. but then, he heard a loud noise. it was the cat! max was scared and didn't know what to do.

"hey, little mouse," said the cat. "that's my cheese. give it back!"

max didn't want to give up the tasty cheese, but he didn't want to get eaten by the cat either. so, he had an idea. max bowed his head and said, "please, mr. cat. can i have just a little bit of cheese? it's so tasty!"

the cat thought for a moment and then said, "okay, little mouse. you can have a small piece. but don't take too much or i'll have to eat you!"

max was happy to have a little bit of cheese and the cat was happy to share. from that day on, max and the cat became friends and shared the cheese together. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with his toy cars and trucks all day long. one day, timmy's mommy took him on a subway ride to the park. the subway was very noisy and timmy covered his ears.

when they got to the park, timmy saw a big ball and wanted to throw it. his mommy threw the ball to him and he threw it back. they played catch for a while until it was time to go home. timmy was very tired from all the playing and fell asleep on the subway ride back. 

when they got home, timmy's mommy tucked him into bed and he dreamt of throwing the ball in the park again. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily who loved to eat pears. one day, she went to the market with her mommy and saw a big basket of pears. she was so happy and asked her mommy to buy some for her. her mommy said yes and bought a big, juicy pear for her.

as lily was eating her pear, she saw a man kneel down in front of her. he looked worried and asked her mommy for help. he lost his wallet and couldn't find it anywhere. lily's mommy asked her if she saw anything and lily said no, but she wanted to help the man. she asked him where he lost it and they all looked for it together.

after a while, they found the wallet and gave it back to the man. he was so happy and thanked them. lily felt proud that she could help someone and finished her pear with a big smile on her face.
once upon a time, there was a parrot named polly. polly was very confused because she didn't know where her nest was. she flew around the jungle asking all the animals if they knew where her nest was, but nobody knew.

one day, polly met a monkey named max. max asked polly what was wrong, and polly told him she was confused because she couldn't find her nest. max said he knew where her nest was and offered to show her.

polly was so happy and grateful that she gave max a big hug. but then, max slapped polly on the back and said, "i was just joking, i don't know where your nest is." polly was very sad and flew away.

the moral of the story is that it's not nice to play tricks on others, especially when they're asking for help.

but then, her mommy said they could make their own market at home! they got some paper, crayons, and stickers and made signs for their market. they even made a cash register out of a shoebox. 

lily had so much fun pretending to be a market seller and her mommy pretended to be a customer. they opened their market and had a great time buying and selling pretend fruits and veggies. lily was so happy that they could still have a market even though the real one was closed.

at bedtime, lily snuggled with her stuffed animal and ate some candy. she felt happy because she owned two things she loved - something sweet and something soft. she fell asleep with a smile on her face.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with his toy cars and trucks. one day, timmy's mom took him to the store to buy some groceries. timmy saw a big cart in the store and asked his mom if he could ride in it.

as they walked through the store, timmy saw a toy truck that he really wanted. he told his mom that he hoped she would buy it for him. his mom said maybe if he was good, she would buy it for him later.

after they finished shopping, timmy's mom put all the groceries in the cart and pushed it to the car. timmy was so proud of his mom for carrying all the heavy bags and pushing the cart all by herself. they drove home and timmy helped his mom unload the groceries. they had a great day together!
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to dream about flying in the sky. one day, timmy woke up from a rare dream and went to his mom. "mommy, can you answer a question for me?" timmy asked. "of course, sweetie," his mom replied. "in my dream, i was flying. can people really fly like birds?" timmy asked. his mom smiled and said, "no, people can't fly like birds, but you can use your imagination to fly in your dreams." timmy was happy with his mom's answer and went back to bed to dream about flying again.
once upon a time, there was a little duck named ducky. ducky loved to swim in the pond with his friends. one day, it started to rain a lot and the pond started to get bigger and bigger. the water was coming so fast that it looked like a big river. ducky got scared and started to swim faster and faster to get away from the flood.

ducky's friends were also swimming fast to get away from the flood. they all swam to a big tree and climbed up to stay safe. ducky was very ashamed because he was the last one to get up the tree. but his friends were happy that he made it.

after the rain stopped, the flood went away and the pond was back to normal. ducky and his friends were happy to be back in the pond, but they knew they had to be careful when it rained so they wouldn't have to speed away from a flood again.
once upon a time, there was a little girl who loved to ride her bike. she had a big sister who was very bossy and always wanted to ride her bike too. one day, the little girl's sister asked to borrow her bike. the little girl didn't want to lend her bike because she was afraid her sister would break it.

but her sister kept asking and asking until the little girl finally gave in and let her borrow the bike. the sister rode the bike too fast and didn't pay attention to where she was going. suddenly, she hit a big rock and the wheel of the bike broke. the little girl was very sad because she knew she wouldn't be able to ride her bike anymore. she wished she had never lent it to her bossy sister.
once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved to ride his bike around the park. one day, he saw a cricket on the ground. the cricket was hopping and making a chirping noise. timmy thought the cricket was cute and wanted to keep it as a pet.

timmy took the cricket home and put it in a jar with some leaves. he watched the cricket hop around and chirp. timmy thought it was fun to have a pet cricket. he even showed his friends at school. they had a competition to see who could find the most interesting bug.

timmy's cricket won the competition because it was so cute and made a funny noise. timmy was very happy and proud of his cricket. he continued to ride his bike around the park with his new pet cricket in his pocket.
once upon a time, a little girl named lily went to the park with her mom. they saw a bird flying in the sky. lily asked her mom, "can i fly like a bird today?" her mom said, "no, lily. we can't fly like birds because we don't have wings. but we can watch them from a distant."

lily saw a boy playing with a ball. she asked her mom, "can i play with him?" her mom said, "yes, you may. but you must ask him if he will permit you to play with him." lily went to the boy and asked him, "can i play with you?" the boy said, "yes, you may. let's play together!" 

they played together for a long time. lily had so much fun with the boy. when it was time to go home, lily said goodbye to the boy and thanked him for playing with her. she told her mom, "today was a great day at the park!"
once upon a time, there was a little bird. the bird liked to fly in the sky and feel the wind on its feathers. one day, the bird saw a big storm coming. it was scared and didn't know what to do. but then, it saw its friend, a big eagle, who came to support it. the eagle said, "don't worry little bird, i will help you." the eagle flew with the little bird and kept it safe from the storm. the little bird felt grateful and alert, looking out for any other storms that might come. from that day on, the little bird knew it had a friend who would always be there to support it.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside and pick flowers. one day, she found a bird with a broken wing. lily felt sad for the bird and wanted to help it. she took the bird home and gave it some water and seeds to eat.

her nosy neighbor, mrs. brown, saw lily taking care of the bird and asked what was going on. lily told her about the bird's broken wing and how she was trying to help it. mrs. brown said that lily was very kind and that she should be careful not to spoil the bird too much.

lily didn't understand what mrs. brown meant by "spoil", but she knew that she wanted to help the bird. she decided to write a word on a piece of paper that said "get well soon" and put it next to the bird's cage. the bird chirped happily when it saw the word and lily knew that she had done something good.
once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. he loved to play basketball. he had a red basketball that he played with every day. one day, timmy's friend billy came to play with him. billy had a new basketball, it was blue. 

timmy was not happy. he felt miserable because he wanted a blue basketball too. but then he remembered something his mom told him. she said that it's important to accept what you have and be happy with it. so timmy decided to accept his red basketball and play with billy and his blue basketball. 

they played together and had lots of fun. timmy realized that it doesn't matter what color his basketball is, as long as he's playing with his friends. from that day on, timmy was happy and no longer felt miserable.
once upon a time, there was a little duck named ducky. ducky was very excited because today was his birthday. he waddled around the pond, quacking happily.

suddenly, ducky saw his friend, bunny. bunny said, "happy birthday, ducky! i have a surprise for you." bunny spread his arms and revealed a big carrot cake.

ducky was so excited that he flapped his wings and splashed water everywhere. "thank you, bunny! let's share the cake with all our friends," ducky said. so, they invited all the animals in the pond to the party and everyone had a great time eating cake and swimming.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in nature. one day, she went to the park with her mommy. they played on the swings and slide. after a while, lily got thirsty and her mommy gave her a clean water bottle to use.

lily drank the water and felt refreshed. then, she saw a butterfly and ran after it. she followed the butterfly to a pond where she saw ducks swimming. the water in the pond was clean and lily was happy to see the ducks playing in it.

when it was time to go home, lily hugged her mommy and said, "i love nature and clean water. can we come back to the park tomorrow?" her mommy smiled and said, "of course, we can come back and play in nature anytime you want."
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play outside, but one day it started to rain really hard. timmy's mom told him to put on his jacket, but he didn't want to because it was smelly. 

"timmy, you have to wear your jacket," said his mom. "you'll get sick if you don't."

timmy didn't want to get sick, but he didn't want to wear his smelly jacket either. just then, timmy's friend billy came over. 

"hey timmy, what's wrong?" asked billy.

"i don't want to wear my smelly jacket," timmy replied.

"i have an idea," said billy. "let's save your jacket by putting it in the washing machine. then it won't be smelly anymore!"

timmy thought that was a great idea, so they took the jacket inside and washed it. when it was clean, timmy was happy to wear it again and he didn't get sick from the rain. timmy and billy were happy they saved the jacket together.
once upon a time, there was a happy little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in the bright sun. one day, lily went for a walk in the forest. she saw many trees and birds, but the sun was hidden behind the clouds. 

suddenly, it started to rain and lily got very wet. she needed to find a place to cover herself from the rain. she saw a big tree and ran towards it. the tree was so big that it covered her from the rain. 

lily sat under the tree and waited for the rain to stop. she looked up and saw that the sun was shining again. she was so happy that she started to dance and sing. the sun was no longer hidden and lily continued her walk in the forest with a big smile on her face.

lily felt happy when her teacher said that. she knew that she could do it, even though she was feeling hot and tired. so, she listened carefully and did all her classwork. her friends did the same, and they all felt proud of themselves when they finished.
