once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved to go camping with his family. they would set up a tent and roast marshmallows over the fire. timmy was very loyal to his family and always helped them.

one day, timmy and his family went camping in the forest. they set up their tent and started a fire. timmy helped his family gather wood for the fire. when it was time to sleep, timmy went inside the tent. but he forgot to zip it up!

during the night, a big bear came and smelled the food. the bear went inside the tent and ate all the food. timmy woke up and saw the bear. he was scared and ran away. the bear chased him and timmy got lost in the forest. timmy was sad and scared. he wished he had thanked his family for taking care of him.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play in the park with her friends. one day, while playing hide and seek, she saw an unusual butterfly. it was so pretty and colorful!

lily ran to her friends and said, "look! look! an unusual butterfly!" her friends ran over to see it too. they all wanted to catch it, but it was too high up in the sky. "i wish we could reach it," said lily.

suddenly, an old man with a kind spirit walked by. "what are you looking at?" he asked. lily pointed to the butterfly and said, "we want to catch it, but it's too high up." the old man smiled and said, "i have an idea. let's all hold hands and reach for it together." 

so, they all held hands and reached up towards the butterfly. and to their surprise, the butterfly flew down and landed on their hands. they all smiled and laughed. lily said, "thank you, old man. your spirit is very kind." the old man smiled and said, "you're welcome, children. it's always nice to help others." and they all walked away, happy and content.
once upon a time, there was a big elephant named ellie. ellie loved to decorate her house with pretty flowers and colorful balloons. one day, ellie wanted to decorate her house for a big party. she asked her friend, a little mouse named mickey, to help her decorate.

mickey was so excited to help ellie. "what can i do to help?" mickey asked. "can i blow the trumpet?" he added.

ellie smiled and said, "of course, you can blow the trumpet! it will make the party more fun!" mickey was happy and started to blow the trumpet. it was an enormous trumpet, almost as big as mickey himself! everyone in the jungle heard the sound and came to join the party. ellie and mickey were very happy that their decorations and the enormous trumpet made the party so much fun.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved playing outside and getting dirty. one day, timmy's mom told him it was time to take a bath and wash all the dirt off. timmy did not want to take a bath, but his mom said he had to.

as timmy was taking a bath, he saw his toy spaceship. the spaceship had a laser that could shoot out pretend beams. timmy pretended to shoot the laser and make noises. his mom asked him what he was doing, and timmy told her he was fighting aliens.

after his bath, timmy felt calm and clean. he put on his pajamas and asked his mom to read him a story. timmy fell asleep dreaming about flying his spaceship and washing away all the aliens.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved the color blue and had a special blue dress that she wore every day. one day, she was playing with her toys in her room when she heard her mom calling her.

"lily, come to the kitchen for a snack," her mom said.

lily ran to the kitchen and saw that her mom had made her favorite blueberry muffins. she was so happy and took a big bite. as she ate, she noticed that her mom was holding a small blue box.

"what's in the box, mom?" lily asked.

"it's a music box," her mom replied. "it plays a beautiful song when you wind it up."

lily was so excited and asked if she could see it. her mom opened the box and showed her the small chamber inside. lily loved the way the music sounded and danced around the kitchen. from that day on, lily loved blue even more because it reminded her of the beautiful music box.
once upon a time, there was a jolly little girl named lily. she loved to walk in the park with her mommy and daddy. one day, while they were walking, they saw a big red truck with the word "emergency" written on it. 

lily's mommy explained that the truck was there to help people who were in trouble. lily was curious and asked what kind of trouble. her mommy said that sometimes people get hurt or sick and need help right away. 

later that day, lily and her family were walking home when they saw a man who had fallen down and hurt his leg. they remembered the big red truck they had seen earlier and knew it was an emergency. they quickly called for help and the man was taken care of. lily felt proud that she had helped someone in an emergency.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her toys and run around in the park. one day, she went to the park and saw her friend max.

"hi max, do you want to play with me?" asked lily.

"yes, i would enjoy that," said max with a smile.

lily and max played together, swinging on the swings and sliding down the slide. they were very happy and had a lot of fun. suddenly, lily saw a butterfly and ran after it. max followed her and they chased the butterfly together.

after a while, they got tired and sat down on the grass. "i feel so happy when i play with you, max," said lily.

"i feel the same way, lily. it's the spirit of friendship," said max.

lily and max hugged each other and smiled. they had a wonderful day together at the park.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play in her backyard. one day, she went outside to play, but it was very quiet. she looked around and saw that all the birds had flown away. 

suddenly, she heard a loud noise. it was her neighbor, mr. brown, who was cutting down a tree. lily didn't like that because she loved the trees in her backyard. she went to mr. brown and said, "please stop cutting the tree. i don't want it to go away." 

mr. brown said, "i'm sorry, lily, but i have to cut it down. it's old and it might fall down." 

lily didn't want to give up. she resisted and said, "but i love this tree. can't you just leave it?" 

mr. brown thought for a moment and said, "okay, i won't cut it down. but you have to promise to take care of it." 

lily was so happy that she hugged the tree and promised to take good care of it. from that day on, lily's backyard was full of birds and trees, and it was always quiet and peaceful.
once upon a time, there was a white cat named snowy. snowy liked to play with a magazine. she would jump on it and scratch it with her claws. one day, snowy's owner wanted to read the magazine, so she told snowy to shut it. snowy didn't understand what "shut" meant, so her owner showed her how to close the magazine. snowy watched carefully and then used her paws to shut the magazine. from that day on, snowy knew how to shut things.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved going to the museum with her mommy and daddy. one day, they went to the museum and saw a big dinosaur. lily was very happy and excited!

suddenly, she saw a little boy who was crying. lily asked him why he was sad. the little boy said that he lost his toy. lily wanted to help him find it, but the little boy didn't want to behave.

lily's mommy told the little boy that it was important to behave in the museum. the little boy listened and stopped crying. together, they found his toy and everyone was happy. lily was proud of herself for helping the little boy and for behaving in the museum.
once upon a time, there was a village with many trees. one day, a little girl found an orange on the ground. she picked it up and noticed it was very sweet. she wanted to share the orange with her friends, but she didn't know how to get more oranges.

her grandma saw her sad face and asked her what was wrong. the little girl told her about the orange and her wish to share it with her friends. her grandma smiled and said, "i will teach you how to grow oranges, so you can have many to share with your friends." the little girl was very happy and thanked her grandma.

they went to the garden and her grandma showed her how to plant the orange seeds. the little girl watered them every day and soon, many orange trees grew. she picked the oranges and shared them with her friends. they all enjoyed the sweet oranges and thanked the little girl for teaching them how to grow them. from that day on, the little girl became known as the orange girl of the village.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy who loved going to school. one day, he went to class and saw a new kid he didn't know. timmy said, "hi! what's your name?"

the new kid replied, "my name is jack. nice to meet you." timmy smiled and said, "nice to meet you too, jack. i don't recognize you. are you new here?"

jack said, "yes, i am. i just moved here with my family." timmy nodded and said, "that's cool. do you want to be my friend?" jack smiled and said, "yes, i would love that."

later that day, the teacher called on timmy to read out loud in class. timmy looked at jack and said, "i'm nervous. i don't like reading in front of people." jack looked at timmy and said, "don't worry. you can do it. i believe in you." timmy smiled and felt better. he read the story and the whole class clapped for him. timmy was happy to have a new friend and pupil like jack, who was kind and encouraging.
once upon a time, there was a pretty kitty named velvet. she liked to play with balls of yarn and chase butterflies in the garden. one day, she saw a bird in a tree and wanted to catch it. she climbed up the tree and tried to catch the bird, but it flew away.

velvet got sad and went back down the tree. she saw a butterfly and tried to catch it, but it flew away too. velvet got even sadder and walked back to her house. she saw a mouse and tried to catch it, but it ran away too.

velvet was very sad and went to sleep. the next morning, she woke up and felt sick. she had caught a cold from being outside for too long. her owner took her to the vet, but it was too late. velvet passed away and her owner was very sad. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little spider who lived in a cozy corner of a big house. the spider loved to spin beautiful cobwebs that sparkled in the sunlight. one day, a big gust of wind blew through the house and made the spider's web weak. the spider knew it was time to make a new one.

as the spider worked on its new web, it saw a little bug walking towards it. the spider could tell the bug was weak and tired. the spider thought to itself, "i will catch this bug and help it get strong again."

the bug walked right into the spider's new web and got stuck. the spider crawled over to the bug and saw that it was nodding off to sleep. the spider carefully wrapped the bug up in its web and waited for it to wake up. when the bug woke up, it felt strong and healthy again. the spider was happy to have helped the little bug and went back to spinning beautiful cobwebs in its cozy corner of the big house.
once upon a time, there was a little seed. the seed was planted in the land. the sun shone and the rain fell, and the little seed began to grow. it grew and grew until it became a big, strong tree.

the tree was very obedient. it stood tall and straight, never leaning or swaying in the wind. the animals in the land loved to play around the tree, and the tree gave them shade from the hot sun.

as the tree grew, it gave fruits and nuts for the animals to eat. the animals were happy and grateful for the tree's kindness. and so, the tree continued to grow, and it became a beloved part of the land.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, she went to the park with her mommy and daddy. she loved to swing and slide, but she forgot to bring her favorite toy with her. 

while playing, she saw a police officer walking by. he was wearing a blue uniform and a shiny badge. lily asked him, "what is your job?" the police officer said, "i enforce the law and keep everyone safe." 

lily was fascinated by the police officer's job. she started twirling around and around until she got dizzy. her mommy and daddy took her home and tucked her into bed. as she fell asleep, she dreamt about becoming a police officer when she grew up.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a great day playing with her toys and eating cookies. but then, she wanted to find her favorite cup. she looked everywhere, but it was nowhere to be found.

lily went to her mom and said, "mommy, my cup is gone. where did it disappear?" her mom replied, "did you check the cupboard?" lily went to the cupboard and opened it. she found her cup and said, "yay! my cup is here! thank you, mommy!"

lily was happy that her cup was found. she hugged her mom and said, "you're the best, mommy!" from that day on, lily always checked the cupboard first when she couldn't find something.
one day, a small girl went to the farm with her mom. she saw many animals like cows, pigs and chickens. then, she saw a big field with small plants. her mom told her that it was a field of oats. the girl saw that the oats were small and yellow. she picked one and saw that it was very light. she was happy to see the oats and wanted to take some home.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play hockey with his friends at the park. one day, timmy and his friends found an ancient hockey stick in the bushes. they were so excited to use it!

timmy's friend, billy, said, "let's examine the stick! it looks really old."

timmy and his friends examined the stick closely. they saw that it had some scratches and was a bit rusty. but they were still excited to use it for their game.

during the game, timmy scored the winning goal with the ancient hockey stick. his friends cheered and clapped for him. timmy was so happy that he found the stick and that it helped him win the game.

from that day on, timmy and his friends always used the ancient hockey stick for their games. they knew it was special and brought them good luck.
once upon a time, there were two bears. they were friends, but one day they started to fight. they growled and clawed at each other. it was very loud and scary. 

after a while, they stopped fighting and felt sad. they didn't want to be mad at each other anymore. so, they decided to go on a trail together. they walked and walked, and saw many trees and flowers. 

the bears found some berries, but they were sour. they made funny faces and laughed. they realized that it was better to be friends than to fight. from that day on, they went on many adventures together and never fought again. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved magic and dreamed of being a magician when she grew up. one day, she found a magic wand in the park. she waved it around, but nothing happened. 

suddenly, a bird fell out of a tree and hurt its wing. lily wanted to help the bird, so she lifted it up gently and held it in her hands. she closed her eyes and whispered a magic spell. when she opened her eyes, the bird's wing was healed! 

lily was so happy and proud of herself. she knew that she was successful in using her magic. from that day on, she carried the magic wand with her wherever she went, always ready to help anyone in need.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved magic and often played with her magic wand. one day, lily met a pale lady who told her about a magic potion that could make her wand even more powerful. 

lily was excited and went to find the potion. she searched high and low until she found it. she drank the potion and her wand glowed with magic. she was so happy and played with her wand all day. 

but as the sun began to set, lily noticed something strange. her wand was starting to fade and lose its magic. she tried to use it again and again, but it wouldn't work. she realized she had made a mistake and drank too much of the potion. 

lily was sad and disappointed. she had finished all the magic in her wand and couldn't play with it anymore. she learned that sometimes too much of a good thing can be bad and wished she had never met the pale lady.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with his toy boat in the pond. he would row his boat back and forth, making big waves.

one day, timmy saw a frog in the pond. he wanted to catch it, so he made a plan. he made a flexible net out of some string and a stick. he thought it would be easy to catch the frog with his net.

timmy tried to catch the frog, but it was too fast. the frog jumped away and timmy fell into the pond. he couldn't swim and the water was too deep. the flexible net got tangled around his legs and it led him to the bottom of the pond. timmy couldn't breathe and he never came back up.
once upon a time, there was a big bird called a raven. the raven had black feathers and a sharp beak. one day, the raven found a useful stick on the ground. the raven picked up the stick with its beak and flew away. 

later, the raven saw a little mouse running around. the raven wanted to play with the mouse, but the stick was in the way. so, the raven decided to remove the stick from its beak. the raven dropped the stick and played with the mouse happily. 

after a while, the raven got tired and flew back to its nest. the raven was happy that it found a useful stick and that it got to play with a little mouse. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy liked to walk in the park with his mommy. they would hold hands and look at the pretty flowers. one day, they saw a big dog. timmy was a bit fearful of the dog, but his mommy told him it was friendly.

suddenly, the dog ran over to timmy and started to lick his face. timmy giggled and said, "doggy, stop! you're tickling me!" his mommy smiled and said, "see, he just wants to touch you and be your friend." timmy pet the dog and they played together for a while.

afterwards, timmy and his mommy continued to walk in the park. timmy said, "mommy, i like when we walk together. it's fun!" his mommy replied, "me too, timmy. i love spending time with you." and they continued to hold hands and enjoy their walk in the park.
once upon a time, there was a kind bus driver named tom. he drove his bus every day and always smiled at the children who rode with him. one day, the bus broke down and tom didn't know what to do. 

a little girl named lily asked tom what was wrong. tom said, "my bus is broken and i don't have another one to replace it." 

lily had an idea. she said, "i have a toy bus at home that you can borrow until your real bus is fixed." 

tom was so grateful and borrowed lily's toy bus. he drove it carefully and the children still had fun riding with him. 

the moral of the story is that being kind and helpful can make a big difference, even if it's just lending a toy bus.
once upon a time, there was a little mouse named timmy. timmy liked to run around and play with his friends. one day, timmy went on an adventure to find some cheese. he ran and ran until he found a big piece of cheese. but, the cheese was in a zigzag maze and it was very smelly. timmy didn't want to go inside, but he really wanted the cheese.

so, timmy took a deep breath and went inside the maze. he had to zigzag through the maze to find the cheese. it was hard work, but timmy was determined to get it. finally, he found the cheese and he was so happy! timmy took the cheese and started to return home. he was so proud of himself for being brave and getting the cheese.

lily was so happy that she could paint her room any color she wanted. she chose a warm yellow color because it made her feel happy. she painted the walls, the ceiling, and even her dresser.

after she finished painting, lily's room looked so pretty and warm. she was so proud of herself and couldn't wait to show her friends. from that day on, lily loved spending time in her cozy and colorful room.
once upon a time, there was a small boy named timmy. timmy loved going on picnics with his family. one day, they went on a picnic and timmy's mom brought a cooler. timmy wanted to help and tried to carry the cooler, but it was too heavy for him.

during the picnic, timmy's mom asked him to fold the picnic blanket. timmy didn't want to do it because he thought it was too hard. but then he remembered how he couldn't carry the cooler and realized that he needed to try his best. he folded the blanket and felt proud of himself.

when they got home, timmy's mom told him that it's important to try your best and help out, even if things seem hard. timmy felt happy that he could help and promised to always try his best. from that day on, timmy always helped out on picnics and felt proud of himself for being a good helper.
once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved music and he had a special violin. he would play his violin every day and it made him happy. one day, he went to play his violin in a big concert. he was nervous, but he played his violin beautifully. the people clapped and cheered for him. timmy felt independent and proud.

after the concert, timmy's mom hugged him tight and said, "i am so proud of you, timmy!" timmy smiled and hugged his mom back. then, he saw his friend, billy. billy wanted to try to play the violin too. timmy let billy hold the violin and showed him how to squeeze the strings. billy played a few notes and timmy smiled. he was happy to share his violin with his friend.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved playing with her dolls and stuffed animals. one day, she lost her favorite teddy bear. she searched and searched but couldn't find him anywhere. she felt miserable without him.

lily's mom saw her frown and asked her what was wrong. lily told her about her lost teddy bear. her mom said, "let's search for him together!" they looked in every room and under every bed, but still couldn't find him.

just when they were about to give up, lily's little brother came running in with the teddy bear in his hands. "i found him!" he exclaimed. lily was so happy and hugged her brother tightly. "thank you for helping me search," she said with a big smile.
once upon a time, there was a good boy named timmy. timmy liked to play with his toys and eat cookies. one day, timmy saw a big building with many people going in and out. he wondered what was inside.

timmy asked his mommy, "what is that big building?"

his mommy said, "that is where the lawyer works. he helps people with problems."

timmy thought that was very interesting. he wondered if he could be a good lawyer when he grew up. he decided to study hard in school so he could help people too.

lily wanted to skip across the ocean, but her parents told her it was too dangerous. she didn't listen and ran into the water. suddenly, a big wave knocked her down and she couldn't get back up. 

her parents tried to save her, but it was too late. lily had drowned in the ocean. her family was very sad and missed her very much. they wished she had listened to them and stayed safe on the shore.
once upon a time, there was a poor man who worked at a big store. he had many friends there who were also called staff. the poor man was always very kind to everyone and worked very hard every day.

one day, the poor man's friends noticed that he was wearing old and torn clothes. they felt sad for him and decided to dress him up in new clothes. they gave him a nice shirt and pants to wear, and he looked very happy and handsome.

from that day on, the poor man felt very grateful to his staff friends. he worked even harder and always made sure to be kind to everyone. the staff were happy to see him happy and they all became even better friends.
once upon a time, there was a team of animals who loved to play together. one day, they found an unusual object in the forest. it was big and shiny, but they didn't know what it was.

the bear said, "what is this thing? can someone explain it to me?"

the rabbit replied, "i don't know, but it looks like it could be fun to play with."

the team decided to try and figure out what the object was. they worked together to push and pull it, but it wouldn't budge. 

finally, the wise old owl flew down and said, "i know what this is. it's a giant mirror. it reflects everything around it."

the team was amazed and had fun looking at themselves in the mirror. they were happy they had worked together to solve the mystery of the unusual object.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to paint with her colorful paints. one day, lily's mommy bought her a new mattress for her bed. it was very soft and comfortable, and lily liked it a lot. she thought it was very attractive because it was pink and had flowers on it.

one night, lily decided to paint on her mattress. she thought it would be fun to make a picture on her bed. she used her red paint to draw a big heart on her mattress. but when lily woke up the next morning, she saw that the paint had made a big mess. the heart was all over her sheets and pillow, and it wouldn't come off no matter how hard she tried to clean it.

lily's mommy was very upset when she saw what had happened. she scolded lily for painting on her mattress and ruining it. lily felt very sad and wished she could take it back. from that day on, lily learned to always ask for permission before she painted on anything, and she never painted on her mattress again.
once upon a time, there was a big castle with a lot of rooms. one day, a little boy named timmy went inside to explore. he found a big chamber that was very empty. timmy felt a little scared because it was so quiet. suddenly, he heard a loud noise that surprised him. it was coming from a door at the end of the chamber. 

timmy walked towards the door and opened it. inside, he saw a big monster! the monster was very angry and started to chase timmy. timmy ran as fast as he could, trying to find a place to hide. he ran back into the empty chamber and closed the door behind him. 

the monster banged on the door, trying to get in, but timmy was safe inside. he felt very proud of himself for finding a place to hide. timmy waited for a long time until he was sure the monster was gone. then he opened the door and ran out of the castle, feeling very brave.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to skip around her farm, playing with all the animals. one day, she found a big pile of corn. it was yellow and smelled so good. she decided to pick some and take it to her mom to make popcorn.

but lily was too small to carry all the corn by herself. luckily, her helpful dog, max, came along and saw her struggling. max barked and wagged his tail, telling lily he would help her. together, they carried the corn to the house and gave it to lily's mom.

mom made delicious popcorn and lily and max shared it while skipping around the farm. they were so happy and grateful to have each other's helpful company. the end.

froggy and ducky played together for hours. they played hide-and-seek and tag. after they were done playing, they got hungry. froggy said, "let's go get some pizza!" ducky replied, "yum, i love pizza!"

they went to the pizza place and ordered a large pizza. the pizza smelled so good that they couldn't wait to eat it. they took a big bite and it was delicious. ducky said, "this pizza is so powerful, it makes me happy!" froggy replied, "i know, pizza is the best!"

after the ambulance came and took the boy away, lily's mom bought her a treat for being so brave. but when lily took a bite, she realized it was spoiled and didn't taste good. she told her mom, and they went back to the store to exchange it for a fresh one.

friend: "i can help you! let's work together to succeed!"

once upon a time, there was a wise owl who lived in a big tree. one day, a little boy named timmy went camping with his family. they pitched a tent in the woods and went to sleep.

in the middle of the night, timmy woke up and saw the wise owl staring at him. "who are you?" asked timmy. "i am the wise owl," replied the owl. "what are you doing here?" asked timmy. "i am watching over you and your family," said the owl.

timmy was amazed that the owl was so wise and kind. he fell back asleep feeling safe and protected. the next morning, timmy told his family about the wise owl and they all went to the tree to say thank you. the owl just stared at them with his big, round eyes and hooted softly. from that day on, timmy knew that he could always count on the wise owl to watch over him.
once upon a time, there was a funny monkey named max. max loved to play and swing from tree to tree. one day, he saw a bird flying high in the sky. the bird was speaking a different language that max didn't understand. 

max wanted to learn the bird's language so he could talk to him. he asked his friends for help, but they didn't know the language either. 

so, max decided to zoom up to the bird and ask him to teach him the language. the bird was happy to help and soon max was speaking the bird's language too. they had lots of fun talking and playing together. 

from that day on, max learned that it's always good to try new things and learn new languages, even if it takes a little zooming around to get there.
once upon a time, there was a soldier named tim. he was a very bad soldier because he didn't listen to his captain. one day, tim went to the store to buy some new boots.

at the store, he met a little boy named jack. jack said, "hi, soldier! can you tie my shoe?" tim said, "sure, i can tie your shoe." so, tim tied jack's shoe and they became friends.

but then, tim's captain came to the store and saw tim talking to jack. the captain said, "tim, you are a bad soldier! you should be training, not playing with children." tim felt sad and said, "i'm sorry, captain. i will go back to training now." but jack said, "don't worry, soldier. you can still be my friend." and tim felt happy again. the end.

lily asked her mom, "where did daddy go?" her mom replied, "daddy had to go to work. but don't worry, we can still have fun and enjoy our meal together." lily smiled and continued to look at the menu. she was excited to try something new and travel to different countries through the food she was going to eat.
once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved to go to the park and feed the ducks. one day, timmy saw a very long swan swimming in the pond. timmy wanted to be friends with the swan, so he invited it to come eat some bread with him. 

the swan was happy and came over to timmy. they ate bread together and became good friends. timmy would come to the park every day to see his new friend, the swan. 

one day, timmy's mom came to the park with him. she saw timmy and the swan playing together and was very happy. she took a picture of them and timmy was very proud. from that day on, timmy and the swan were the best of friends and would always play together in the park.
once upon a time, there was a big truck. the truck had to go to the store to get some toys. but, when the truck got on the road, there was a lot of traffic. the truck was stuck in traffic for a long time. 

finally, the traffic started to move and the truck was able to get to the store. the store worker helped the truck load the toys into the back. the truck was happy to have the toys, but also felt ashamed that it had taken so long to get them. 

the truck drove back home and gave the toys to all the kids. they were happy and played with the toys all day. the truck was happy too, but promised to never get stuck in traffic again. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little penguin named pete. pete loved to play with his friends in the snow. one day, they decided to go on an adventure to find some fish.

as they were walking, pete saw a big iceberg with a sign that said "danger! icy waters ahead!" pete knew that meant the water was very cold and could hurt them. he wanted to teach his friends about the danger, but they didn't listen.

soon, they came across a river with a strong current. pete tried to warn his friends to go left, but they went right and got swept away. pete quickly went left and found a safe spot to cross. he was sad that his friends didn't listen, but he knew it was important to always be safe and listen to warnings.

when benny got home, he showed the frame to his mom. she thought it was nice too, and they decided to test it out by putting a picture inside. they found a picture of benny's family and put it in the frame.

benny was so happy with his new frame and picture. he didn't feel as lonely anymore because he had his family with him all the time. from then on, benny always looked for things to put in his frame and he knew that he would never be lonely again.

lily's mom took her outside to show her that the dog was friendly and just wanted to play. they went to the park and played with the dog. lily was happy and not scared anymore. they played for a long time until it was time to go home. lily's mom said, "we have to finish playing now and go home." they packed up their basket and went back to their house. lily was happy and not scared anymore.
once upon a time, there was a little duck named ducky. ducky loved to swim in the pond with her friends. one day, ducky saw a big, graceful swan swimming in the pond. ducky wanted to be as big and graceful as the swan, so she asked her mommy how she could grow big like the swan.

mommy duck told ducky that she needed to eat lots of healthy food and exercise every day. so, ducky started eating lots of vegetables and swimming every day. but, there was a problem. the pond was getting too small for all the ducks and swans. they needed more space to swim.

one day, ducky and her friends saw a big subway being built near the pond. they were worried that the subway would take up all the space and they wouldn't have anywhere to swim. ducky went to talk to the construction workers and asked them if they could leave some space for the pond. the workers listened to ducky and left a big space for the pond to grow.

now, ducky and her friends had more space to swim and grow big and strong. they were happy and grateful to the construction workers for listening to them. and ducky kept eating healthy and exercising every day, growing bigger and more graceful, just like the swan. the end.
once upon a time, a little girl named lily went to the park with her mommy. they saw a great bird flying in the sky. lily said, "mommy, look at that big bird! can we go see it?"

mommy said, "sure, let's go see the bird." but as they walked towards the bird, they saw that there was a big tree in the way. mommy said, "we have to go around the tree, it will delay us a little bit."

lily said, "that's okay, i want to see the bird." finally, they made it around the tree and saw the bird up close. lily said, "wow, it's even greater up close! can we come back and see the bird again tomorrow?" mommy said, "of course, we can come back any time you want." and they both smiled as they watched the great bird fly away.
once upon a time, there was a spider named spidey. spidey lived in a big tree in the forest. spidey loved to make cobwebs. he made the best cobwebs in the whole forest. everyone knew that.

one day, spidey saw a big bug flying towards his tree. spidey thought, "i want to catch that bug, but i need a bigger cobweb." so, spidey made a bigger cobweb than he ever had before. it took him all day, but he was proud of it.

the next day, the bug came back. spidey waited until the bug was close enough and then he released his big cobweb. the cobweb caught the bug and spidey was very happy. he felt very competitive because he knew he had made the best cobweb in the whole forest.
once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy liked to play with his toys, but one day he got sad because he couldn't find his favorite toy car. he looked everywhere but couldn't find it.

then, timmy saw his dad using a saw to cut some wood. timmy thought the saw looked useful, so he asked his dad if he could use it to find his toy car. his dad said no, because the saw was dangerous and timmy was too young to use it.

timmy was sad and didn't know what to do. but then, he remembered that he could turn to his mom for help. his mom helped him look for his toy car and they found it under the couch. timmy was very happy and thanked his mom for being so helpful.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, lily was outside playing with her toys when she felt very cold. she went to her mom and said, "mommy, i'm cold." 

her mom said, "let's go inside and get you a warm blanket." 

lily rubbed her hands together to keep them warm as they walked inside. once they were inside, her mom wrapped her up in a cozy blanket. 

lily felt much better, but she started to worry about her toys outside in the cold. she said to her mom, "mommy, my toys are cold too. can we bring them inside?" 

her mom smiled and said, "of course, let's go get them." together, they went outside and brought all of lily's toys inside where they could be warm and cozy too.
once upon a time, there was a happy hippo. he loved to play and eat grass. one day, he met a sad monkey who had lost his banana. the hippo wanted to help the monkey, so he designed a plan. he asked his friends, the birds, to search for the missing banana. 

after a while, the birds found the banana and brought it back to the monkey. the monkey was so happy and cheerful that he thanked the hippo and his bird friends. the hippo felt proud of himself for helping the monkey. 

the moral of the story is that helping others can make us feel good and happy too.
once upon a time, there was a girl named lily. she loved to wear her green skirt because it made her feel happy. one day, lily's mommy wanted to teach her how to bake cookies. lily was excited to learn! they went to the kitchen and mommy showed her how to mix the flour, sugar, and butter together. lily loved the smell of the cookies as they baked in the oven. when they were done, mommy let lily wear her green skirt to share the cookies with their neighbors. everyone loved the cookies and complimented lily on her pretty green skirt. from that day on, lily loved to bake with her mommy and wear her favorite green skirt.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved ice cream and always asked her mom for it. one day, her mom took her to the park and they saw a man with a big ice cream truck. lily's eyes grew big and she asked her mom for a cone. 

"can i have ice cream, please?" she asked her mom gently. 

her mom smiled and said, "yes, you can have some ice cream, but you have to eat it slowly and not make a mess." 

lily nodded her head and took a lick of her ice cream. it was so yummy that she started to stretch her arms out with excitement. "this ice cream is so good!" she said to her mom. 

her mom laughed and said, "i'm glad you like it, lily. just remember to be gentle with it." 

lily smiled and enjoyed her ice cream, feeling very happy.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy was very stubborn. he never wanted to do what his mommy and daddy told him to do. one day, timmy got very sick and his mommy took him to see the doctor. the doctor was very nice and gave timmy some medicine to make him feel better. after a few days, timmy started to feel better and his mommy told him it was time to settle down and rest. timmy listened to his mommy and went to bed early. the next day, timmy felt much better and he knew it was because he listened to his mommy and the doctor.
one day, tom and his mom went to the pool. it was a hot day, and tom wanted to go swimming. tom's mom put her red towel on a chair and told tom to hang his green towel on the hook. tom hung his towel up and ran to the pool. the water was cool and it felt nice to tom. 

he swam around the pool with his float. he didn't want to get out. but soon, tom got weak. he couldn't swim anymore and he started to feel tired. 

his mom called out to him, "tom, it's time to go. i can see you are getting weak. come out of the pool and hang up your towel."

tom got out of the pool and hung his towel back up. he was glad he was able to hang his towel back up by himself. tom picked up his mom's towel, and together, they walked home.

he picked up the clay and started making shapes with it. he made a doll, a house and a bird. then, he noticed a loud noise in the distance. he looked up and saw a big bird flying in the sky. it was far away and beautiful.

the three year old was so excited. he decided to make a clay bird to look like the one he saw in the sky. he worked and worked, but couldn't get his clay bird to look right. then, he decided to watch the bird in the sky and copy it. he tried one more time and made the clay bird look perfect.

the little boy gave his clay bird a little kiss. he was so proud of his work. then, the distant bird flew away, so the little boy put his clay bird in his pocket and went on his way.

next they saw a bluebird perched on a tree branch. it sang a song as they discussed the different habits of birds. it was amazing how much jose already knew about nature.

they kept on walking and passed a pond where they saw some ducks swimming. jose's dad helped him understand why ducks love water. after discussing the differences in bird types and why ducks like to swim, jose was more proud than ever of his knowledge.

the family then left the park. they were happy to have discussed nature and to learn more about the world around them. jose was so proud of the day he spent in nature.

once upon a time, there was an old squash in the garden. it was big and round, and it made a loud noise when it moved. one day, a little mouse came to the garden. it was very curious, and so it decided to climb up the squash and have a look around.

the big squash was disturbed by the tiny mouse, and it started to shake. the noise it made was so loud that it woke up the other animals in the garden. the birds flew up into the sky and the bunnies hopped away in surprise.

the little mouse was scared and it ran away as fast as it could. the loud noise of the disturbed squash echoed throughout the garden and it was a long time before the animals all settled down. and the squash? it just sat there, big and round, making sure all the animals in the garden stayed safe.

the two little friends had lots of fun outside the barn. they played tag, hid in the grass and chased each other around. after a while, the mouse got tired, so the kitten gave him a piggy back ride back to the barn.

but then it stopped raining, the lake dried up and all the water was gone. the animals were very sad. they wanted to play in the lake again, but it stayed dry.

one day, a little bird flew over the lake and saw something shiny in the distance. she flew closer and saw a big bucket of water. â€œthis must be from the lakeâ€, she thought. she flew over to the bucket and shouted to the other animals.

soon, all the animals were gathered around the bucket. they were so happy! they each took turns splashing in the water again. the lake was back! they cheered and danced all around the lake until the sun went down.

from then on, the lake stayed full of water and all the animals were very happy. they could play in the lake again.

once upon a time, there was a big blue button. it looked like an ordinary, small button, but it was magical. whenever somebody pressed the big blue button, something amazing would happen.

one day, a little girl named emma wanted to find out what the button did. she was very curious, so she decided to press the button. as she pressed the button, something strange happened. emma's height began to increase! she started to feel really uncomfortable, because she was getting taller and taller!

luckily, a friendly fairy was watching over emma. the fairy saw that emma was feeling uncomfortable and scared, so the fairy waved her wand and the big blue button stopped working. emma was relieved. she was back to her normal height and could continue playing again.

the big, blue button was never used again and it became a mystery. emma still wonders what would have happened if she hadn't stopped increasing in height.

once upon a time there was a little girl who was very lonely. she was all by herself and had no friends to play with. 

one day, she decided to take a walk in the park. as she walked along, she saw some children playing together and having lots of fun. she wanted to join in the fun too, but she was too scared. 

all of a sudden, she felt something beneath her feet and she started to fall. when she opened her eyes, she realized she had fallen into a deep hole! she was sad and a bit scared.

she tried to climb out, but it was too high. so she started to cry. then suddenly, she heard someone calling her name. it was her mom! 

her mom had been looking everywhere for her. she had followed her daughter into the park and saw where she had fallen. her mom hugged her tightly and said everything was going to be okay. 

then they both walked to the bathroom. her mom held her hand and made her feel safe and not lonely anymore. 

the little girl was so happy to be with her mom and to be out of the hole. from that day, she never went on walks without her mom and never felt lonely again.
one day there was a wealthy man who lived in a big house. he had a secret that no one else knew. he kept a little box, filled with treasure, under the ground in his garden. every day he would go to the garden and take some of the treasure out and put it back in the box. 

one day he let a 3 year old child see the secret. he took the child to the garden and showed him the box, and then told him that he must keep it a secret. the child promised to never tell anyone. 

together they buried the box a bit deeper so that it was even more securely hidden, and they filled the hole in with a few stones so nobody would know it was there. the man said that the treasure would stay underground forever and that no one must touch it. 

the man said that he would keep the secret. the 3 year old child nodded, and knew that he must keep the secret too. 

so the box of treasure stayed in its secret place under the ground, and both the man and the 3 year old child kept their promise and kept the secret safe.

once upon a time there was a big blackboard in a classroom. it was so big that it almost reached the ceiling! the teacher had been writing on the blackboard all morning when something amazing happened. the blackboard started to talk! the teacher was very surprised and told the students to mind the blackboard.

the students were very excited and listened carefully. the blackboard said, "i am here to teach you something very special. i will tell you all a story that will help you to understand things better". the students were all eager to learn what the blackboard had to say.

the blackboard started to tell a story about a small bird that had a very big heart. the bird wanted to help all the other birds in the forest and make them happy. the blackboard said, "remember the bird and the big heart. always put your own big heart first and help others".

at the end of the story, the teacher smiled and thanked the blackboard for the lesson. the students all said that they had learned something very important and thanked the blackboard too. the blackboard waved goodbye and disappeared.

from that day on, the students always remembered to mind their own big hearts and to help others. it was a lesson that they would never forget!

once there was a girl named jenny, and she was very proud of her new sweater. she wanted to wear it everywhere. jenny set off on an adventure one day and it was cold out. she put on her warm sweater, but some ignorant boys laughed at her. jenny felt sad and embarrassed and started to cry. 

but then something magical happened. a few passing birds saw what the boys did and flew to jenny. they helped her and flew around her until she stopped crying. the birds brought with them a shining, red blanket and set it around jenny's shoulders. jenny grabbed the blanket and smiled. she was so warm, and no longer felt embarrassed. 

jenny hugged the sweet birds and thanked them before setting off on her adventure again. she wrapped her warm sweater around her, and the shining blanket around her shoulders. from then on, she never felt ashamed of her sweater and every adventure she went on was filled with magic and warmth.
once upon a time there was a hero. his name was mike. mike was very strong, brave and helpful. he was a hero who everyone admired and loved.

one day, mike was going to save a hurt puppy from a tall tree. when he tried to climb the tree, he was very clumsy. he fell down many times! but he didn't give up. eventually, he made it to the top of the tree and rescued the puppy. 

everyone cheered for mike. he was their hero! everyone admired mike for his bravery and courage. they all gave him lots of hugs and praised him. 

mike was so happy that he had been able to help the puppy. from then on, everyone called him "hero mike".
rudy was a little boy. he wanted an igloo very badly. his parents told him that igloos were very expensive. he tried to manage his money, but it was hard. 

one day, he got an idea. he wanted to make his own igloo! he got a bucket of snow and began building. he stacked the snow and made it tall. he added a roof, a doorway and even two windows.

when he was done, rudy had made his very own igloo! it wasn't as fancy as an expensive igloo, but he was proud of it. he invited his friends over to play inside. together they laughed and sang and had a wonderful time.

rudy had managed to make his own igloo and it was a great success!
once upon a time there was a little girl who lived in the forest. she was always cheerful and never complained about anything. but one day, something strange happened.

the little girl was walking down a path when she saw a big, red arrow right in front of her. she stopped and started to look at it. next thing she knew, she felt very dizzy and started to complain.

the little girl looked around, but there was no one there to help her. she kept complaining until a magical elf appeared. the elf told her that she must follow the arrow and see what happens.

the little girl followed the arrow and it lead her to a beautiful meadow. the sun was shining and the flowers were in full bloom. she was so happy that she forgot about her dizziness and stopped complaining. she thanked the elf for the help, and she was never dizzy again.
there once was a little girl called jenna who lived in a very big, old house. one day, she decided to explore her garden. as she slowly wandered around, she saw something very interesting. she stopped and gazed at an herb. it was dull green in colour and very soft. she carefully touched it and looked at it closely. 

jenna love the herb so much that she took it home with her. she kept it in a pot on her window sill, and looked at it all the time to admire its beauty. she even talked to the herb and named it 'charlie'. 

one day, she even put some of her old clothes on it to pretend it was a little person. she laughed and smiled as she played with the herb.

the herb and jenna became good friends, and she would always take good care of it. she would water it every day and make sure it had enough sunshine. 

jenna still visits charlie in her garden from time to time and is always so grateful to have such wonderful herb in her life.
yesterday, maria's mommy gave her a special box. inside the box was a messy surprise. maria pulled it out and ripped the paper. she was very happy to find a puppy! maria hugged the puppy and the puppy licked her face. maria giggled with joy. 

maria cuddled the puppy all day. they played tag and chased each other around the yard. when it was time for bed, maria put the puppy in its bed. they said goodnight and maria went to hers. 

this morning, maria ran to the puppy and they played again. but the puppy got so excited that he tore all the paper off the box! it was very messy, but maria still loved her puppy. she said, ''it's okay. we just have to play cleaner games.'' 

the end.
once upon a time, two friends were playing together. they were having lots of fun together.

the friends decided to share a pizza. they shared the pizza equally and it was tasty!

suddenly, they had an idea. they would go on an adventure! they ran out of the door and started looking for a beautiful exit.

finally, the friends found the most beautiful exit. they were so excited. they ran to the exit and laughed together.

the friends had a day they will never forget. they had shared an adventure and a pizza. they were so happy!
once upon a time, there was a leaf. the leaf wanted to rise up high in the sky, like a kite. it tried to flap its edges, but the wind was too slow. 

so the leaf found an idea. it decided to find something sour. it saw a lemon and asked it for a little bit of help. the lemon was sour and strong enough that it could help the leaf rise up high. the leaf felt the sour lemon push it up and up until it was higher than the clouds!

the leaf was so happy that it was flying. it spread its edges to go even higher. it flew over the trees, houses, and even the ocean! 

finally, after a long journey, the leaf had to come down. but it had made its dream come true, and it had risen higher than it ever thought possible!
one day, a rat was in the garden, and he saw a mysterious hole. he was curious and wanted to explore it. so, he bravely went in.

suddenly, he felt like he was in a prison, walls everywhere. he was scared and wanted to get out, but he could not find the way.

the rat tried to find his way out but it was no use. he looked around and saw a big cat, staring at him. 

the rat knew he was doomed, and so he surrendered. the cat let him go free.

the rat was so happy to be free. he learnt from his mistake and never went inside mysterious places again.
once upon a time, there lived a strong princess. she lived in a big castle and every day she tried to find something special. one day, she tried to find a diamond. she searched the castle high and low, but she could not find one.

the princess was very sad and she decided to go outside and look for a diamond. she went to the forest and looked everywhere. she climbed trees and looked in bushes, but she still could not find a diamond.

the princess wasn't very happy, so she decided to try one more time. she went to the river and tried to find a diamond there. the river was very deep and the princess was scared, but she had to keep looking. suddenly, she saw a sparkle at the bottom of the river. she dived into the water and found the biggest diamond she had ever seen!

the princess was so happy and she took the diamond back to her castle. she kept it safe in the castle forever and told everyone about her special diamond.
jill was hungry so she went to the kitchen. she looked inside the cupboards and chose a dish. the dish was filled with delicious food. she picked up a spoon and started eating. then she heard a noise outside. it was her dog, max. he was looking at her, wagging his tail. she wanted to take max for a walk. she put her dish down and chose her leash. she was a little bit lazy so she put her shoes on and slowly walked outside with max. they chose to go down a path to the park. soon enough they were there and it was a beautiful day. max ran around and jill enjoyed the sunshine. after a while, jill decided to go back home. she put max in the house and was ready for another delicious dish.
once upon a time, there was a white leopard who was very tired. so, he went to sleep under a big tree.

the leopard slept and slept for a long time. he dreamed about running and playing all day.

when he woke up, he saw something beautiful. right in front of his eyes was a white butterfly! he watched it flutter and fly around.

the leopard was so happy that he jumped and yelled. then he went back to sleep under the big tree so he could have more wonderful dreams.

the leopard slept and slept until a big night. then, he silently snuck away in the shadows and ran back to his home. the white leopard had a wonderful day, and he went to bed with a big smile on his face.
once upon a time, there was a little boy called joe. joe was three years old and he loved to explore the world.

one day, joe went outside. he saw a big puddle and he decided to jump in it! but when he tried to jump, he slipped and almost fell in.

luckily, his mom came to help him. she put her arm around him and gave him a big hug. she said, "don't worry, i'm here to support you!" joe thanked her and he felt much better.

then, joe had a very creative idea! he gave his mom a big smile and said, "let's jump together!" so they jumped into the puddle, and they had so much fun!

afterwards, joe and his mom held hands and they laughed together. joe was so happy and he thanked his mom for all her support. joe and his mom continued to explore the world together!

when they arrived at the campsite, they got to work. dad put the tent up with some help of teddy. then they kneeled on the grass and teddy saw a magpie. 

after the tent was pitched, teddy and his family had a picnic. they ate apples and sandwiches under the tent. 

it was getting dark, so teddy and his family got ready for bed. they kneeled down and said their prayers before getting into the tent. 

in the morning, teddy was excited to go on an adventure! he couldn't wait to explore the woods and find out what was waiting.
once upon a time there was a little girl named annie. she was three years old and loved to play. one day she was playing in the garden with her pet dog. suddenly, the pet dog jumped onto the grass and annie heard a pop. when she looked around, she saw that her shoe was gone! 

annie was very sad and started to cry. her mom came out to see what was wrong and annie told her about the shoe. mom knew annie needed a new shoe so she said it was time to go to the store.

at the store, mom told annie to pick out the shoes she liked. annie looked around and saw all of the different shoes. eventually, she chose a serious looking pair of black shoes.

once the shoe was on, annie felt so much better. she thanked her mom for helping her find the right shoe and said she was ready to play again. mom smiled and they both went back into the garden to continue their fun time. 

the end.
once upon a time, in a sunny meadow, there lived a fast little kitten. each day, the kitten would run around the meadow, chasing after butterflies.

one day, she heard something strange coming from the trees. she stopped to listen and heard a strange sound repeating over and over again. it sounded like, "meow, meow". so, the kitten slowly walked closer, and saw a tiny, little kitten meowing. it was so little and scared, so the fast kitten went up to it and said, "meow".

the little kitten stopped meowing and looked up happily at her new friend. it then said, "meow" again and jumped up to give the fast kitten a big hug. the fast kitten was so happy that she said, "meow" back and started to cuddle and play with the little one.

they both continued to play and repeat, "meow". they could not stop and became the best of friends for life.

the deer went to a nearby field and the field included lots of things the deer could play with. 
the deer saw some horses, cows, and sheep. it also saw some squirrels and birds. 
the deer had a great time playing in the field with the animals. it even made some new friends. 
the deer spent the whole day in the field, playing and having fun with its new animal friends. 
when the day was done, the deer went home feeling happy and content. it could not wait to come back and play with its friends again. the end.

once upon a time there was a boy named tommy. tommy was three years old and he loved to whistle. one day after his dinner, tommy grabbed his dirty plate and whistled a happy tune. he went out into the garden and sat under the apple tree.

as tommy whistled, the birds began to sing along. he watched them fly from branch to branch and it made him whistle even louder. all he wanted was to keep on singing and whistling with the birds, so he just kept going.

when it started to get dark, tommy's mom called him to come inside. as he walked back in, he blew one last big whistle at the birds. they all flew away, leaving only the sound of tommy's whistling in the air.
once upon a time there was a board. it was placed on top of a hill and no one knew why it was there. one day, a little boy took a walk to the top of the hill to examine the board. he was very curious and wanted to know why the board was alone at the top of the hill. when he looked closely he could see that the board was very stupid. the words written on the board made no sense. the little boy was really confused. he decided to move the board to find out more. he pushed and pulled and eventually the board moved away to reveal a big hole in the ground. the little boy was so excited and decided to explore the hole. finally, he learned why the board was there. it was left by a group of pirates to mark the entrance to their secret treasure!
bob was a little boy who had a new neighbor. he was excited to meet them but he was also a bit scared. bob's neighbor was very big and he was speaking with a deep, rough voice. bob didn't know what to do, so he decided to rest for a bit. he sat down on the porch and closed his eyes. 

the neighbor saw bob and he smiled. he came close and bob was surprised, but he felt safe. the neighbor asked bob if he wanted to play a game and bob said yes! 

they played all afternoon and bob was getting tired. the neighbor said that it was time to rest and bob happily agreed. he said goodbye and went back home. 

bob was now sure that his new neighbor was very nice, even if his voice had been a bit scary and rough before. he was grateful that they were friends.

she put on her clothes and headed to the kitchen. there she saw a big table filled with all sorts of healthy food. emily was ready to eat! she scooped a big spoonful of oatmeal and squished it in her mouth. the taste was so delicious!

emily smiled and started to walk outside. she gazed up with wonder at the bright blue sky and all the birds flying around. everything was so peaceful and beautiful. emily took a deep breath and smiled. 

she spent the day running around in the park, exploring and playing with her friends. before emily knew it, the sun was setting, and it was time to go. 

emily gave one last gaze of the beautiful day, full of sunshine and fresh air, and headed home happy and content.
once upon a time, there was a little girl called gemma. she liked to draw pictures and was very good at it. one day, gemma's mom demanded that she take a picture of the park.

gemma grabbed her art supplies and went to the park. it was very noisy. there were kids playing and people talking. gemma quickly set up her easel and grabbed her colored pencils. she then began to draw the scene around her.

she worked hard and created the best picture she had ever drawn. gemma was so pleased with her drawing that she ran back home to show her mom.

when gemma showed her mom the picture, she was delighted. she gave gemma a big hug and praised her. from then on, gemma was always ready to demand better when it came to her artwork.
once upon a time there was a farmer who owned a bull. the bull was very special, but the farmer was a bit jealous. so, one day, the farmer decided to take the bull to wander around the farm.

the bull was very happy. he wandered around and ate some juicy grass. he was so content that he even stopped to have a nap in the sun. but then, he heard a noise. it was loud and made him jump.

it was the farmer. he was mad and was shouting. the farmer was jealous that the bull was so enjoying himself. he yelled at the bull to come back. the bull ran back to the farmer and the farmer put him on his farm.

but, the bull knew he was meant to wander and would often find ways to wander around the farm during the day. he was always happy when he did this and so the farmer was always jealous.

the end.
once there was a chubby bee who liked to zoom. he zoomed around his garden all day long, looking for places to explore. one day, he noticed a vase sitting on the ledge of the garden wall. he was very curious, so he zipped over to have a closer look. the glass was shiny and there were lots of pretty flowers inside. he wanted to see the flowers better, so he zoomed around to the other side and touched the vase. suddenly, it tipped over, and the flowers and water spilled out! he quickly buzzed away, worried that he had made a mess. but then he heard a voiceâ€”it was his momma! she said, "don't worry, my little bee. we can fix it." and so they did, with a little help from momma. after all the flowers were back in the vase, they both admired it and then the chubby bee continued to zoom around the garden. the end.
once upon a time there was an cool dragon. it loved to explore and fly around the world. one day it came across a peaceful village and decided to settle there. it made its home in a cave near the village. everyone was very excited to have a dragon living close by!

the dragon was so friendly and kind, it helped the villagers with all sorts of tasks. it flew high up in the sky to collect clouds for rain, and loved playing hide and seek with the children. on hot days it cooled down the village by blowing a gentle breeze.

the villagers were so happy to have their dragon friend. they even threw a special party for it! the dragon had a wonderful time, and settled back in its cave when the night ended.

the dragon and the villagers became good friends. and to this day, he still visits the village, bringing cool winds and fun adventures.

the boy wanted to make a war. with his paints, he painted a picture of two armies facing each other. they were ready for battle. he used honest colors like blue and green.

suddenly, a loud noise scared the boy. he stopped painting and did not want to be a part of the war. he wanted to play and be happy. he cleaned his brushes and put away his paints.

the boy decided to paint something more peaceful. he painted a scene of a bright sunny day with a river, trees and birds in the sky. he put all the honest colors on his canvas.

the boy felt proud of what he painted and smiled. he realized thereâ€™s no reason to paint a war when he could share so much beauty.
john was a little boy. he loved to run! every morning he would get up and run outside to the big green park. he was so fast, no one could catch him. one day, john saw something that he had never seen before. in the middle of the park was a giant green knot! he had never seen a knot so big. he wanted to know what it was and so he ran over to it. john was very curious, so he slowly reached out and touched it. all of a sudden, the knot slowly started to bounce and wiggle. john was so surprised that he started to giggle and run away. he ran and ran, until he finally got tired and stopped. he looked back and the knot was gone. he was so excited that he could not stop smiling. he ran back home and told everyone about the big green knot he had found!
once there was a little girl. she loved to play outside with her scooter. every day she would pick it up and ride around the yard. she liked to pretend she was a big racer.

but one day, something happened. when the little girl was riding her scooter, she heard a scary noise! she was scared, but she kept going. then she saw something even more scary - a big monster!

the little girl was so scared she dropped her scooter and ran away as fast as she could. she ran all the way home and she never picked up the scooter again. she was too scared to go back.

but the really amazing thing happened later that day. the monster was gone. in its place was a kind old lady! she gave the little girl a big hug and said, "don't be scared. you can pick up your scooter anytime you want."

the little girl smiled and thanked the old lady. from then on, she was no longer scared to ride her scooter. she picked it up and went riding every day!

after he finished all his tasks he felt very satisfied. he looked at his face in the mirror and saw that the smile was still there. he was happy that he was able to organize his day so well. he was able to get a lot done and still have some time to relax and enjoy the day.

he knew that being wise, organized and having a smile on his face was the key to having a successful day. he was proud of himself for proving just how wise and organized he could be. he knew that he had made a wise decision by taking the time to organize his day. he smiled a big smile and went off to enjoy the rest of his day.
once upon a time, there was a mom and a dad who were very happy together. they loved each other very much and wanted to be together forever. one day, they decided to raise their hands and say nice things to each other in front of all their family and friends. this special thing was called a marriage.

the mom and dad were so excited and had a big party to share the news with everyone they knew. but then one day, the mom got angry. she was mad and yelled at the dad, and they started to fight. 

the mom and dad loved each other, but their fighting was causing them a lot of sadness. they decided to talk to each other and try to understand why the mom was so angry. after talking, the mom and dad hugged and said sorry to each other. 

the mom and dad worked hard and showed each other how much they loved each other. even though sometimes they still got angry, they kept trying to talk and understand and found peace in their marriage. 
the end.
once upon a time, a little raven flew from its nest in search of something special. after flying for a while, the raven spotted a bright lake. as it perched on a nearby tree, it heard the most beautiful music coming from the lake.

the raven flew closer and saw a little girl by the lake's edge. in her hands the girl held a beautiful golden flute. she played her music which made the raven so happy that it began to dance.

the girl laughed and put down her flute. she looked up at the raven and said: "oh, little raven, please accept my gift of music." the raven hopped down from the tree and lightly ate from the girl's hand. from then on the raven visited the girl every day and accepted her gift of music.

the little raven and the girl became great friends. they both enjoyed each others company and the music the girl played. the little raven looked forward to hearing the girl's music each and every day.
once upon a time there was a girl who loved cocoa. every day, she would go for a walk, and if she found a cocoa tree, she'd shake it to see if any cocoa beans would fall down.

one day, she found a really big tree in the forest. she was so excited and quickly started shaking it. suddenly, lots of cocoa beans fell down, and they all rolled into the forest.

the girl was eager to find them again, so she started running through the forest to find them. she ran and ran until she came to a clearing with a river. in the river, she could see some of the cocoa beans floating around.

but the river was very deep and the water was very rough. she couldn't get close enough to the beans without falling in, so she had to find another way.

then she saw a big stick. she grabbed it and started using it to push the beans back to the shore. after a few minutes of hard work, she managed to get all the cocoa beans out of the river safely.

she was so happy, and she collected the beans in her pocket and headed home. from that day on, she kept going back to the river to collect cocoa beans whenever she wanted a hot cup of cocoa.

one night, when she was tucked into bed, the girl heard a loud noise. she began to cry because she was scared. but then she remembered her mum and dad were there. she told them how scared she was and they gave her a hug. they told her she was safe and then they all hugged.

the girl felt better and she said sorry for being scared. her parents smiled and said it was okay. they said they understood and they were happy she knew to talk to them. the girl hugged them again, thankful they had forgiven her. 

the girl was so happy that she hugged them every day from then on. and she promised to be more curious with her wonders and questions, instead of being scared.

once upon a time, in a faraway land, there lived two friends: bill and ben. they were always happy together and had lots of fun. 

one day, however, they had a quarrel. bill did not want to play with ben anymore and thought he was too annoying. this made ben very sad and he started to cry.

high above the two friends, in the sky, a delicate cloud appeared. it was very white and fluffy and the sunbeams shone straight through. from up inside the cloud, it started to rain ever so gently. 

the gentle rainfall washed away all their quarrel and sadness. they smiled at each other and realised they could still be friends, no matter what. 

then, they set off and had lots of fun together, just like they used to.

he was really enjoying it. his excitement increased as he drank the second cup. he finished the second cup and wanted more. alex's mom said no, but he was so enthusiastic she could not resist his pleading. so she gave alex a third cup of juice.

alex was so happy he was jumping up and down with joy. he felt full after drinking three big cups of juice. he thanked his mom and went off to play.
once upon a time there lived a sweet little girl called elle. she was three years old and loved to play. one day elle saw in the sky a bright, shiny laser. she wanted to touch it so she clapped her hands loudly.

the laser heard her so it came nearer and nearer. elle was so excited and clapped harder and harder until the laser was within reach. but the laser kept going around and around, just a little out of elle's reach.

elle kept trying to catch the laser, clapping and shouting in excitement. she was very persistent and didn't give up until the laser finally let her catch it. elle was delighted and proudly carried the laser home. afterwards, elle spent the rest of the day playing with her new laser toy.
