once upon a time, there was a little girl named lucy. she was only three years old, and was playing in her backyard one day. she was so happy and excited to be outside. 

then all of a sudden, lucy heard a loud noise. she was very worried. she looked up to see a big bird staring at her. lucy gulped and bowed her head. the bird kept looking at her with its beady eyes.

lucy got scared. she ran and hid behind a tree. she stayed there for a few minutes until the bird flew away. she was relieved. 

she peeked out from her hiding spot and saw something shiny on the ground. she bent down and picked it up. it was a tiny nose! 

she put it back where it belonged and smiled. then she ran inside to tell her mom about her scared, but exciting adventure.
sandy was a kind 3 year old girl. one day, she was in her bedroom playing. she wanted to make a surprise for her mom and dad. sandy had an idea! she took off her pants and filled them with stuffing from her old pillow. after she was done, she put the pants on the floor. then she clapped her hands and said 'rise!'  suddenly, the stuffed pants rose up. sandy clapped and laughed. she knew that mom and dad would love her surprise. sandy gave the stuffed pants a big hug. she was so happy that her special surprise was finished. 

now, sandy could show her parents her special surprise. she ran into the living room and said "look mom and dad, i made something special". mom and dad admired sandy's surprise. they were so proud of her. sandy smiled, she knew that she had made something special with her kind heart.
once upon a time, there was an ordinary penguin. he was walking around looking for something to do when he came across a printer. he had never seen anything like it before. the penguin was very curious. he stepped up to the printer and pressed a button.

much to his surprise, the printer started to make noise. out came a piece of paper with pictures on it. the penguin was amazed. he was so excited that he ran around showing all his friends. 

the penguin then spread the word that if you press the button on the printer something new will get printed. all his friends wanted to try it out and from then on the penguin was known as the printing penguin!

the end.
once upon a time, there was a pig. he loved to explore. one day, he went on an adventure. as he was walking, he found something interesting. he could not wait to see what it was! when he got closer, he was so excited to reveal the secret. it was a shiny golden coin. he was so happy, he shouted with joy and took the coin home. he was sure it was a big treasure and he would be able to keep it forever. the pig was so proud of his special coin and never forgot that day.
once upon a time there was a little girl who was like most children her age; she loved playing and having fun. one day she decided to take a walk to the nearby park. as she was walking, she noticed an ice-cream stand. she was so excited to see it, and she ran up to get some ice-cream. 

suddenly, she saw something move in the bush nearby. she was fearful, so she stopped and looked around. then, to her surprise, she saw a rabbit! she was so excited, she tried to catch it. 

but the rabbit was too fast for the little girl and it jumped away. she chased it until, suddenly, it stopped in front of the ice-cream stand. she caught it and carefully held it in her arms. 

the little girl was so proud of herself. she smiled as she thought of how she could bring the rabbit home to her mum. but, before she went home, she bought an ice-cream as a reward for catching the rabbit. the little girl was so happy!
once upon a time, there was a little girl. she was so happy. she had a mommy and a daddy who loved her very much. 

one day, her mommy and daddy offered her a special surprise. they offered to take her on a trip. she was so excited. 

the family drove to a place far away. as they arrived, the ground started shaking. it was an earthquake! 

the little girl was scared, but soon she realized that it was alright. her mommy and daddy hugged her, and she was so happy. 

they finished the trip with smiles on their faces. her mommy and daddy were so proud of how brave she had been. 

the little girl smiled, feeling so lucky to have such wonderful parents.
once upon a time, there lived a little boy called andy. he was an adventurous boy and always liked trying new things. he was especially curious about the world around him.

one day, andy went to the park with his mom. as he ran around, playing with the other kids, he saw a beautiful butterfly with purple and yellow wings. he watched in amazement as it flew away and shouted with joy.

his mom was so proud of him - she smiled and clapped! this made andy feel so special. he looked up at her and smiled back with love.

the next day, andy decided to go on an adventure and explore the park even more. as he ventured through the woods, he heard a loud noise. to his surprise, it was the same butterfly from the day before!

andy was so happy that he wanted to thank the butterfly. he started to applaud and waved his hands in the air with excitement. the butterfly fluttered around him, enjoying the moment.

andy's mom was filled with pride. he had been so adventurous that day and she was so proud of him. she said, "you make me so happy andy!" and they hugged and filled each other with love.

when she reached the park, she saw lots of children playing. she put down the orange and said, "who wants to have some yummy orange?"

all the children came running to the orange. they laughed and giggled as they ate the orange. the lady smiled and was happy.

the lady was happy that she had carried the orange to the park. all of the children were happy too.

they saw a tire. it was big and round. they decided to buy it. next they picked up some healthy food. they chose fruits, vegetables and a special treat.

the children went home and prepared their tire. first they covered it with a big blanket. then they put the food inside. finally, they gathered some friends and jumped. they rolled and laughed. they had a lot of fun. 

after all their playing, the children went inside for dinner. they enjoyed their healthy meal. then they all slept with big smiles on their faces.

little bear was so excited. he quickly opened the chest. inside, there were lots of shiny coins. suddenly, something very scary jumped out of the chest. it was a dragon!

little bear was so scared that he wanted to run away, but he was brave and he said, "i will not run away." he bravely grabbed one of the coins and showed it to the dragon. 

the dragon sighed and flew away. little bear was safe! he was so happy that he knew he had found the reward. he took the coins home and showed them to his mom. 

his mom was so proud of little bear for being so brave and finding such a wonderful reward! little bear hugged his mom and they shared a very happy moment.

one day, her mommy took her to the park. it was filled with so many things to explore. she saw kids playing on the swings, dogs playing catch and birds flying through the sky.

the little girl began to wonder. she wondered what each thing knew and what it was like to have those amazing adventures.

so, her mommy took her to the top of a hill. she showed the little girl a new point. it was a point of knowledge. this was a place where the little girl could see a lot of things at once.

the little girl was so excited. she was intrigued by the new point and she wanted to know more. her mommy told her that this was a place to learn and to become a part of the world.

once upon a time, there was a boy who loved to study. he used to sit in his room with a candle burning beside him and study late into the night. 

one night, he was feeling very uncomfortable in his chair and he couldn't quite work out why. he looked around his room and saw the flame from his candle flickering. suddenly, he realised that the flame was too hot! 

he quickly moved the candle away from him and noticed that the room became much more comfortable. he smiled and went back to studying his book. 

from that day on he always made sure to keep his candle away from him when he was studying, so he could be comfortable. and he lived happily ever after!
once upon a time, there was a beautiful flower who bloomed and grew tall in the garden. every day the flower showed off her bright, yellow petals and everyone cheered when they saw her.

but one day she saw a strange symbol in the sky. it looked dangerous and the flower became scared. she quickly hid and tried to stay away from it.

the next day, the symbol was still above, but something amazing had happened. when the flower looked up, she realised that the symbol had become bright, shiny and colourful. suddenly, the symbol wasnâ€™t scary anymore and everyone in the garden smiled and cheered.

the symbol was transformed and the flower knew that she was safe. from that day, when the sun shone bright, the flower always reminded those in the garden of the beautiful symbol in the sky and that it was never really dangerous.
once upon a time, there lived a little girl named alice. she liked to play games and have fun all day. one day, alice saw a shiny handle on the ground. she picked it up and asked her mom what it was. her mom told her it was a special handle, and it belonged to a friend of hers. 

alice's mom asked if she wanted to lend the handle to her friend. alice thought it would be nice to help her mom's friend, so she said yes. she put on a big smile and handed the handle to her mom. 

alice's mom took the handle to her friend's house. when she came back, her mom said something was wrong with it and the friend was very sad. alice asked if the handle was broken, but instead her mom said it wasn't broken, it just tasted very bitter. 

alice was confused and asked why the handle was so bitter. her mom explained that her friend put lemons on the handle, and they made it bitter. alice was so sad her mom's friend was unhappy, so she decided to cheer her up. 

alice made a big smile and gave her new friend a hug. that made the friend so happy that she forgot about the bitter handle. alice and her mom's friend became best friends, and they had lots of fun together.

"what's that, daddy?" she asked.

"it's pepper," her dad said. he sprinkled it into the bowl.

jen watched as he stirred the pancake batter. he was so careful, but she could tell he was a little nervous.

soon, the batter was ready. her dad poured it onto the hot griddle. he made sure to separate the pancakes so they wouldn't all be stuck together.

at last, the pancakes were ready. jen's dad sprinkles some more pepper onto the pancakes. jen had never seen pepper on pancakes before, but it smelled delicious!

they sat together and ate their special pancakes. jen ate three â€“ and she loved them!

once upon a time there was a guard. he was a very strong and brave guard and he looked after a lot of different places. one of his favourite jobs was to look after a very nosy village.

every day he would recommend things to keep the village safe and happy. he would always remind the villagers to be polite and kind to each other.

one day, the guard was walking around the village when he heard a loud noise. he ran to the source of the sound and spotted a naughty cat. the cat was being nosy and had knocked over some things in the village.

the guard quickly sorted out the mess and then caught the cat. he brought the cat back to the village elder.

the guard recommended that the cat should go and live in a different village, far away from the nosy villagers. the elder noted his wise suggestion, and thanked the guard for his help. 

the guard bowed his head and smiled. he continued to look after the village and kept on recommending sensible things to keep it safe and happy.

the honeybee flew around and gathered nectar to make honey. then it flew back to the hive. 

but one day, something bad happened. the honeybee heard a loud noise. it was a boy hitting the hive with a stick! he was trying to get the honey in the hive. 

the bee was very sad and the hive was starting to break. the bee quickly flew out and away from the boy. 

the next day, the bee found a new, safe hive in a different tree. it made its home there, and was able to make even more honey and be very happy again.

one day, a little girl came over to the teddy bear's home. she saw the watch and wanted it. she tried to lift it up, but it was too heavy. she asked the bear if he could give it to her.

the bear said he was sorry, but he said he could not give it away. he said it was very special to him and he wanted to keep it.

but then the little girl said she just wanted to play with it for a little bit. she asked if he could lift it off his neck and give it to her for a few minutes.

the bear thought about it for a minute, but then he said yes. he lifted the watch off his neck, and the little girl happily took it. she played with it for a few minutes and then gave it back to him.

the little girl said goodbye and thanked the bear. the bear thanked her too, and put his watch back around his neck. he smiled, happy to have his special watch back around his neck again.

inside he saw something sparkly, but he couldn't tell what it was. he felt around in the box, and he finally discovered some colorful stones. he excitedly brought them out and looked at them in the sunlight. 

he looked back at the lock and thought it was so cool. he didn't know how it worked, but he felt like he conquered something big. he put the box back and slowly closed the lid with a click. he smiled and moved away, feeling triumphant.
once upon a time there was a little girl called daisy. she was three years old and she loved to spin. every morning daisy would spin around and around in circles. the twists and turns made her giggle and laugh.

one day daisy noticed something strange. off in the distance she could see fluffy clouds of blue smoke. daisy ran to ask what it was. her mum said it was a special type of smoke called steam.

daisy became fascinated with the steam and she wanted to see what would happen if she spun with it. so, while the steam puffed blue in the sky, daisy spun around and around. in and out of the smoke she spun faster and faster.

since then, every day daisy has played in the steam. she swirls and twirls and the blue smoke follows her. daisy loves to spin and the steam loves her right back.
once upon a time, there was a pink balloon. it loved to fly around in the sky, but it was lonely. one day, it went to a park to meet some new friends.

the first thing it saw was a boy playing with a ball. he noticed the balloon and asked if it wanted to play. the balloon was excited and said yes!

they started to play and the balloon was having lots of fun. but then the balloon bumped the ball too hard and the boy started to complain. he said the balloon was too rough and not being careful.

the balloon felt sad and started to cry. but the boy said he was sorry and gave it a hug. he said it was okay and told the balloon to try again.

so the balloon flew around the park, slowly and carefully. and the balloon stayed friends with the boy for many years afterwards. the end.
once upon a time, there was an open letter that was sent to a little boy. the letter said that he had suffered something bad. the boy was sad and he cried. he called his mom to help him. his mom read the letter and explained that everyone suffers sometimes, just like the little boy did. she said that the little boy could be strong and find new ways to be happy even if he suffered. the little boy was still sad, but he was starting to feel better. mom put her arms around him to give him a big hug and said, "being open will help you heal." the little boy nodded and gave his mom a big hug back. he was feeling much better now. the end.
once upon a time, there was a wild sugar. it was so sweet that even the birds wanted to eat it. but the sugar would not budge. all it did all day was sleep.

one day a little boy came along. he had three years, and was very brave. he wanted to wake up the sugar.

so he shook it and shouted. but nothing happened. the sugar was still sleeping. so the boy took some water and sprinkled it on the sugar.

suddenly, the wild sugar woke up! it was so happy and jumped around. then it ran away and disappeared. the little boy was so excited but all he could do was watch as the wild sugar scampered away. 
the next day, the little boy went back to the spot he had seen the wild sugar, and found a sweet treat waiting for him! the wild sugar had left a surprise for him - a little sugary treat.
once upon a time there was good person. he loved to zoom around with his friends on his bike. one day, he stopped at a store and bought himself a big cup of yogurt. as he was eating it he was feeling embarrassed because it was chocolate yogurt and he liked plain. suddenly, he zoomed away.

his friends were laughing when they saw him go. they thought it was funny that he had bought such a silly kind of yogurt. but they were also happy because they knew that he enjoyed it eventhough he felt a little embarrassed. 

soon, they were all zooming around together, eating their yogurt as they had a lot of fun. after that, they all said goodbye and zoomed home. 

the end.
once there was a little girl named mia. she was feeling very anxious because she saw something strange in her backyard - a tunnel!
 mia wanted to fix it and make it better.

she walked up to the tunnel and said "let's fix it together!"

mia started to fill up the tunnel with dirt, using her hands and a shovel. she worked really hard and was very careful not to cover up any creatures that were living there.

after she filled the tunnel up all the way, mia stepped back and looked at her work. the tunnel was fixed! she was so proud of herself and smiled with joy.

mia had made a big difference and was very happy. from then on, she always tried to fix things that needed help.
once there was a silver fox. every day the fox would wander through the forest looking for food. one day he stopped in front of a huge tree, but no matter how hard he tried, he couldn't climb it. he felt so sad.

suddenly he saw a strange creature. it was small, silver, and had long ears. the fox knew that it was a bunny and he said, "hello", but the bunny just hopped away. 

the fox kept walking and soon found a small stream. he stopped to take a drink, but when he looked in the water, he saw the bunny again. this time, the bunny was swimming! the fox was so surprised and he wanted to swim too. 

the fox tried to swim, but he found it hard. he tried and tried until eventually he could swim quite well. with each day, the fox was getting better and better and he was so happy! 

the silver fox kept swimming and soon he became the best swimmer in the forest. he was so proud of himself and all the other animals in the forest were amazed by his skill. the fox was no longer sad and his happiness continued to increase.
once upon a time there was a little girl called anna. anna was only three years old, but she already knew what she wanted. one day, anna was playing in the garden and she saw an exciting maze. she asked her mum if she could go in, but her mum said no.

anna was very sad but she didn't give up. she kept asking her mum until her mum finally said yes. anna was so happy that she ran straight in to the maze. she went around the corners and down the paths, giggling as she went.

but anna soon found out the maze was much bigger than it seemed. she got lost and couldn't find her way out. after a while, anna became very scared. then she heard her mum's voice.

her mum was standing at the entrance, insisting that anna come out. but anna wanted to stay. she wanted to solve the maze and be brave. so her mum made a deal: if anna came out now, she would come back again soon with anna's dad and they would solve the maze together.

anna accepted the deal. she followed her mum out of the maze. then, a few days later, she returned with her dad who had a mild look on his face. together, they ran around the maze, laughing and finding their way out. anna felt so proud and happy that she had insisted on solving the maze!
a battery sat in a small room, alone. then a graceful woman arrived - she was excited to see it. she picked up the battery, feeling its weight in her hands, and then placed it on the table.

the battery seemed to know what was about to happen, and it started bouncing up and down. the woman chuckled happily, and soon the whole room was filled with the sound of her joy.

the woman then reached for a small box, opening its lid. she carefully placed the battery inside, before connecting a few wires. suddenly, the room was illuminated with bright lights.

the woman was delighted. it felt as though the simple battery had given her an unexpected gift of light. she thanked the battery, then ran out of the room in excitement.

the battery watched its new friend leave, happy to have had the chance to make someone smile. it then gently rested in its new home, content and graceful.
once upon a time, there was a little car. it was very excited for the race about to start. the car had made sure to get up early to get ready.

the car was just about to start when it saw another car. this car was very slow and kept delaying the start of the race. the slow car was only able to inch forward.

the little car was getting very impatient with the slow car. it wanted to start the race right away, but it had to be patient because the slow car could not go any faster.

eventually, the little car and the slow car were ready, and the race began. the little car was finally able to drive as fast as it wanted and crossed the finish line first! it had been worth the delay!
susie was playing at the beach. she picked up a shell and held it in her hand. she could feel how smooth and hard it was and it looked so pretty. she thought it would be a great toy to play with. 

susie carried the shell around the beach and stopped to look at all the other shells. she put her shell down and paused to look around. she saw a healthy looking seagull flying around in the bright blue sky. 

susie decided to take her shell and explore the other parts of the beach. she wanted to find more shells like the one she was holding. she looked and looked and eventually found another shell, but this one was bigger than the one she already had! 

susie smiled as she looked around the beach. she had a lot of healthy shells to play with now. she was so happy that she decided to stay a bit longer and enjoy her new shells.
once upon a time, there was a humble mushroom. he lived in a special forest where all the animals believed in him. every day, squirrel and fox would come to visit him. they would sit with mushroom and talk about the forest and their families.

one day, bunny hopped into the forest. as soon as he saw the mushroom, bunny knew they were going to become special friends. bunny started to tell mushroom stories and rabbit believed every single one.

the three new friends were so happy together. mushroom was so proud of his two new friends, squirrel and bunny. he was glad that he could help them believe.

the friendship between the three stayed strong, and each of them took care of the other. even though mushroom was only a humble mushroom, he was very special to them.
once upon a time there was a clumsy staff. its name was clumsy. tom and jill had never seen a staff like clumsy before. they fed clumsy some nice treats and wanted to play with it.

jill wanted to hold clumsy, so tom gave it to her. but clumsy was so clumsy that it slipped out of jill's hands and fell on the ground.

tom and jill were sad when the clumsy staff was broken. so the two friends decided to make a new staff for clumsy.

they took some sticks and tied them together. tom and jill painted it beautiful colors and called it "new clumsy". then they gave it back to the clumsy staff.

from that day forward, clumsy was never clumsy anymore. tom and jill were happy and enjoyed playing with new clumsy!
once upon a time there was a little boy called peter. one day peter went for a walk in the countryside. he walked and walked and soon he saw something strange. there were lots of peppers growing on a bush! so peter decided to pick some and he filled his pockets with as many as he could. 

on his way home he heard a noise. it was a strange sound and it made peter panic. he started to run but the peppers kept bouncing out of his pockets. before long he had lost them all!

peter was very sad that he had lost his peppers but then he noticed something useful. there were lots of pepper plants growing near where the peppers had bounced out of his pocket. peter was very happy! he picked some more peppers and made his way home with a pocket full of peppers. 

he was so relieved he had found more peppers, he never wanted to panic like that again! so from then on, he always remembered to be careful when he was picking peppers.
one winter, there was a sad girl. she wanted to write something, but she didn't know what to write. she thought and thought, but nothing came to her. then she had an idea! she would write about the winter. 

she looked around and noticed the cold snow on the ground and the white fluffy clouds in the sky. she thought about the icy wind blowing and the frost adding sparkles to everything. she took out her pen and paper, and started to write. she wrote about all the things she saw and felt outside, everything she was so sad about. 

when she was finished, she read it over and smiled. she felt better, like she knew the winter better now. she put her paper away, and went inside to get warm and have a snack.
mommy and bobby were in a hurry. bobby had a big, colorful box and he was so excited to open it. inside were two squishy round things. mommy said they were "lungs". bobby kept asking what they were and why they were so colorful. mommy said that the colorful lungs were going to help bobby run faster. she said that when bobby ran and took big breaths, the colorful lungs would help him breathe better and he could go faster. bobby was very excited and could not wait to try them out. he grabbed the colorful lungs and ran outside to find out how fast he could go. he was so surprised at how fast he was running - he had never gone that fast before. he was running so fast even mommy couldn't keep up!
once there was a forgetful bear who lived near a lake. one day, the bear was feeling bored so he thought he'd go explore the lake. as he stepped into the lake, a magical spell began to happen. the bear started to shrink and shrink until he was the same size as a 3 year old! the lake was full of fun and adventure now that the bear was so small. 

he tried swimming in the lake, and then he walked around the shore, looking for something exciting to do. he watched some fish swimming in the lake and some birds flying overhead. the bear spent the whole day exploring the lake, having a great time. 

but then, the spell started to wear off and the bear began to grow again. he wasn't feeling bored anymore, and had lots of stories to tell his friends! the bear never forgot his special day at the lake.
once there was a family who liked to celebrate. every week, they would celebrate something, whether it was in the attic or outside.

the family had many decorations and things to use for their celebrations. they had sparkly streamers and colorful balloons. on some days they even wore silly hats!

their mom was very patient while they were partying. she helped them blow up the balloons and hung the streamers. she answered all their questions and was always patient when things didn't go as planned.

at the end of each celebration, the family always gathered in the attic for one last party. they would laugh and dance until it was time to leave.

the family had so much fun celebrating new adventures and memories together.
john had a twin brother, adam. they loved to play together every day and they always shared their toys. john was a generous twin and always let adam have the first turn. one day, they went to the park and adam had an idea. he said, "let's play a game! we'll find something to stare at and then see who can stare the longest." john agreed and they each looked around the park until they found something to stare at.

adam spotted a bird and chose the bird as their target. they both started to stare. adam thought he was winning, but john was determined to be the winner. he kept on his focusing. he didn't blink once. finally, after what felt like hours, adam looked away and gave up. john had won the game! adam was surprised and clapped for his brother in admiration. he said, "you won because you were generous with me. thank you for sharing this game with me, john." john and adam hugged and headed off home after a fun day.
once there was a little boy named timmy. he was really smart! his mommy and daddy bought him a pair of mittens. the mittens were red and warm. they were just the right size, they fit timmy perfectly.

everyday, timmy put on his mittens and went outside to play. he'd play in the garden and build castles in the sand. he'd run around with his friends, their faces all rosy and warm. timmy loved having mittens that fit him so well.

when it started to snow, timmy and his friends all went outside to play. timmy's mittens kept his hands nice and warm. he scooped up chunks of snow and made snow angels. then he built a snowman. timmy was so happy, his mittens definitely kept him warm.

timmy was so thankful for his mittens. they fit him so nicely and kept him warm. he was smart for having mittens to stay outside and play. timmy's mommy and daddy were very proud of him.
once upon a time, there was a happy boy who loved to explore. one day, he was in his garden and noticed something strange. he saw a little fuzzy creature, and the creature's voice caught his attention. the boy was so eager that he wanted to get closer to it, so he took a few steps forward.

the creature noticed the boy and said in a little squeaky voice, "hello! who are you?". the little boy was so surprised, but he answered back, "my name is jack!"

the creature smiled, and kindly said, "it is nice to meet you, jack. would you like to give me a squeeze?" the boy was astonished, and hesitated for a moment. but then he smiled and eagerly said, "yes, please!"

so the creature let jack give him a big, gentle squeeze. the boy felt so comfortable and loved, it was like a big hug. when the squeeze was over, the creature thanked jack for the hug, and then said goodbye.

jack waved goodbye to his new friend, as he watched the fuzzy creature disappear deep down into the garden.
once upon a time there was a polite boy who liked to explore. he headed out to the park with a big sack. he found the park so interesting. he wanted to start exploring.

he walked around the park with his sack. in his sack he put bugs, leaves, and feathers. he also put in stones and sticks. he smiled as he looked through his sack.

every time he found something new, he would get so excited. he was so polite to everyone he saw. he wanted to say hello and share his sack with them.

soon, it was time to go home. the polite boy was sad. he gathered the things in his sack and waved bye to everyone. he went home with a head full of memories and a heavy sack.
once upon a time there was a small white cauliflower who was stuck in a tall tree. he tried to climb down but was too dizzy from the height and he couldn't reach the ground. he called for help but nobody answered.

just then a brave superhero ran by. he saw the poor cauliflower and knew he had to rescue him. he flew up to the top of the tall tree and carefully picked him up. the superhero held him tight in his arms and flew him down to safety.

the pollen from the flowers made the superhero feel a bit dizzy, but he kept flying until they reached the ground.

the cauliflower thanked the brave superhero with a big hug. he was so glad to be back safely with his friends.

the superhero had rescued the cauliflower and made him very happy.
once upon a time there was a cat who wanted to borrow some ink. he asked a big elephant and promised he would give it back. the elephant said yes and the cat was very happy.

the elephant had an enormous bottle of ink. he was very kind and he let the cat borrow it. he gave it to the cat very carefully.

the cat took the bottle back to his home. he was so happy. he asked a very small duck to help him carry the ink. they worked together and the cat was so glad!

the cat filled his pen with the ink and he wrote a beautiful letter. he thanked the elephant for letting him borrow the ink.

the cat was so happy and he never forgot the elephant's kindness. they were always friends after that.
once upon a time, there was a mum and a dad who had a cute little boy. every day the family would go for a walk in the park. 

the sun was bright and the sky was blue. the little boy was full of energy and wanted to play all the time. the mum and dad reminded him to behave and show respect to other people in the park. 

every day the family stayed in the park for a long time. the little boy ran and laughed and made lots of new friends. his mum and dad watched proudly, and the little boy felt very happy. 

the family visited the park on a regular basis and the little boy was always so excited to see the sun shine and play with his new friends. whenever he got too excited, all he needed was a little reminder to behave and he would quickly settle down. 

the little family continued to visit the park every week, and the little boy became more and more responsible. he had lots of fun and everyone was happy.

the end.
mum took sally to the shop. there was a big bookcase. "that's silly!" laughed sally. mum smiled too. she took sally's hand and they walked over to the bookcase. it was so big sally could hardly see to the top. she couldn't take it home as it was so big. mum took some books off the shelf and gave them to sally. she was very excited. "can i keep them?" she asked. mum said, "yes, but we have to take them home so you can read them". sally put the books in her pocket and gave mum a big hug. she was so happy. mum and sally went home with the books to read. sally loved her new books and took care of them. she looked at the funny bookcase every time she went to the shop.
once upon a time, there was an ancient painter. she was very talented and spent her days creating beautiful pictures. one day a man came to her door and asked her to sign a piece of paper. she gladly accepted, and when she signed, a magic happened! suddenly, a rainbow appeared in the sky, and the painter was filled with joy and amazement.

the next day, the painter decided to put the rainbow she had created on one of her paintings. she remembered how happy the rainbow had made her and wanted to share that feeling with everyone.

she worked long and hard, carefully brushing each color onto the canvas until the rainbow was just the way she wanted it to be. everyone who saw it was filled with awe and delight.

even after all these years, the ancient rainbow still brings joy to the painter and reminds her of the magical moment when she first signed the paper.
johnny was walking in the park and it was a very cold day. he felt the icy wind on his cheeks. he shivered and his teeth chattered. johnny stopped and looked up. he saw a big tree with lots of peppers growing over it. they were a bright red color and hanging off the branches. johnny smiled; he loved peppers.

he picked a pepper off the tree and put it in his pocket. then he ran to the pond nearby. he saw lots of ducks swimming around and he smiled. johnny dipped his finger in the pond and it was very, very cold - icy cold. he giggled and all the ducks started to quack. he put his hands in the icy cold water and gave the ducks a little splash.

johnny was so happy and he laughed and smiled. he stayed for a bit more, watching the ducks swim around and around. then he went home, with a big smile on his face, his pocket full of peppers.
once upon a time, there was an orange passport. it was a special passport because it could test you! it wanted to find out if you were kind and helpful.

one day, a little boy stepped up to be tested. he had a big smile on his face and said he was ready! the passport asked him lots of questions and he answered them all. he said that he liked to feed ducks and play with his friends. he also said that he always shared his snacks with his brothers.

the orange passport was very happy and gave him a big hug. then, it gave the boy a shiny sticker with a big thumbs up on it. he was so excited! he had passed the test.

the boy kept the orange passport and looked at the sticker every day. it reminded him to show kindness, be helpful and always share.
once upon a time there was a nation. the nation was very obedient and followed the rules. all the people in the nation were happy and content.

one day, the leader of the nation asked all the people to tie a special knot together. the knot was to stand for the nation's unity and strength. everyone was excited about the idea and began to tie the knot.

they all worked together to tie the knot and soon it was done. the knot was very strong and held the nation together. everyone cheered with joy and thanked each other for helping out.

from then on, the obedient nation always remembered the special knot that tied them together. they kept it safe and held on to it for always.
once upon a time there was a box. inside it was a little bug. the bug was very anxious. he wanted to explore but he was afraid. one day the bug had an idea. he decided to zip out of the box. he raced up and down, around and around. it was so much fun! he felt so happy and free. he saw lots of things and new friends too. the bug had a wonderful time zipping about. but eventually, he decided to zip back in the box. he felt safe and loved. it was the best day ever!
molly the monkey was very clever. she had a plan to drive the skeleton away. she went to a magical store and bought a shiny red car. she got in and put on her seatbelt.

she drove around and around the skeleton, making loud noises and honking her horn. the skeleton was scared and ran away in a hurry. molly felt so proud of herself.

molly continued to drive around town, honking her horn and having lots of fun. everywhere she went, she showed that she was a very clever monkey.

soon it was time for molly to go home, but she wanted to drive around just a little bit more. so, she drove to the beach, where she had lots of fun. she drove around in the sand and splashed in the sea. 

at last, molly drove back home, tired and happy. she had had a wonderful day and she was proud of her clever driving skills.
once upon a time there was a young boy. his name was john and he loved to play. one day, he was playing in his backyard when he bumped his knee. it really hurt!

john started to cry and his mum came to help him. she was very kind, and gave john a big hug. that made john feel better, because hugs can heal a broken heart.

the next day, john went to the park with his mum. as they walked, they saw a wall that was very high. john was so excited that he wanted to jump and touch it. his mum said, "you can try, but if you hurt yourself again i will have to give you another hug!"

john bravely jumped until he could touch the wall. he did it! his mum gave him a tasty treat to celebrate his success.

john's knee soon healed, but he will never forget the day he jumped to touch the wall.
once upon a time, there was a famous wall. everyone knew it was very important. one day, a group of three children wanted to take a closer look. the oldest, who was three-years-old, was so brave that he stepped up to the wall first. he thought the wall looked so tall and strong, he was sure he could climb it. taking a deep breath, the brave little three-year-old started climbing. he made it all the way to the top and was so proud of himself. he waved from up on the wall to his friends below and smiled. taking one last look, he jumped down and ran to his friends. they all hugged and exclaimed about how amazing the wall looked and how brave the little three-year-old was. they were so happy that they had taken the chance to explore the famous wall.
johnny was a chubby little rabbit. he loved to explore and play. one day, he was out exploring and he came across a big castle. it had tall walls and stood proud in the sun. johnny was so excited to explore it.

he scurried inside and noticed that the castle was filled with winding stairways, secret passageways and spooky shadows. it was amazing! then he heard a sound- it was the sound of a magical door closing.

johnny looked around and noticed a door. he put his paw on it and it opened! suddenly, he felt like he was spinning. everything started to reverse- the shadows were going forwards, the stairways were going backwards, and strange things were happening.

he was now outside the castle again. johnny was so amazed by what he experienced. he thought to himself, "i need to come back here and reverse through the castle again!"
john was feeling very alert one day. he had a lot of fun painting his bedroom. he loved the feeling of the brush on the wall and the way the paint smelled as he was rolling it on.

when he was finished, he stepped back to admire his work. he was really proud of the memory he saved that day. it was a painting that he would remember forever. 

the next day, john shared his painting with everyone. they all liked it too. they thought it was so colourful and bright.

john was happy that he could share his memory with others. he was so proud of his painting. he was even more alert now to get busy and paint some more.
once upon a time, there was a little girl who enjoyed creating things. one day, the little girl saw a file on the floor. she was curious and wanted to explore it. she picked up the file and opened it. inside, she found a blank piece of paper. 

the little girl got excited and decided to get creative. she grabbed some crayons and set to work. she drew a picture of a big sun, a beautiful tree and some friendly animals. eventually, she created a magical scene.

the little girl felt very calm. she knew that she had made something special. she put the crayons back and took the file with her. 

the little girl admired her creation and smiled. from that day on, every time she looked at her file, she felt calm. the little girl had created a magical masterpiece!
once upon a time there was a silly belt. everywhere the belt went people would laugh and smile. everyone loved to see the silly belt!

one day the silly belt was in a kingdom with a bad king. the king was very mean and made everyone do what he said. he wanted everyone to surrender to his will.

the silly belt didn't like the king's rules. it wanted everyone to be happy and have fun. so when the king ordered everyone to surrender, the silly belt refused.

the king was very angry and tried to use his powerful army to make the silly belt surrender. but the silly belt was not afraid. it held its ground and would not surrender.

finally the king had no choice but to accept that the silly belt would not surrender. he realized that the silly belt had won, and he and his army had to go away.

and so the silly belt saved the day! everyone cheered because the silly belt had brought them freedom with its sillyness.
once upon a time, there was a boy named jack. he was a happy boy and enjoyed a lot of fun things.

one day, jack and his mommy wanted to hear a story. mommy chose a special one â€“ a scary story! jack was a bit worried and not sure if he wanted to hear it.

mommy told jack that the story was all pretend, like in a movie. she reminded jack that he was safe and nothing bad was going to happen. so they snuggled up together, and mommy began the story.

jack listened with wide eyes because it was fun to be a bit scared. the story was so exciting and mysterious. in the end, jack was glad he heard it. mommy hugged him and promised to remind him that scary stories aren't real life.
once upon a time there was an egg. the egg lived in a distant tree. it was happy, but sometimes it missed its family. so one day it decided to take a journey to find them.

it hopped and hopped, trying to find its way. but the egg was very small and it was getting lost. suddenly, it saw a caterpillar. the caterpillar said, "i can help you find your family if you give me a hug."

the egg hugged the caterpillar. then the caterpillar said, "jump on my back and i will take you where you need to go."

the caterpillar took the egg all the way home, back to its family. the egg was so happy to be reunited with them! it hugged them tight, never wanting to go missing again.
once upon a time there was a dead dog. he was very wet and all alone. the dead dog wanted somebody to be with him.

so he started walking. he wanted to find someone that he could be with. he walked for a very long time but he couldn't find anyone.

the dead dog was getting very tired. he wanted to find someone to be with. he knew he couldn't keep walking forever.

suddenly, he saw somebody. it was a little girl. the dog wanted to be friends with her. he was so excited! he ran to her and barked.

the little girl was so happy. she gave the dog a big hug and they became friends. they stayed together until the sun went down. the dead dog was no longer alone.
once there was a little girl who had a toy car made of steel. she liked to take it everywhere she went so she could play with it.

one day, the little girl went to the park with her toy car. while she was playing, she let go of her toy and it flew away into the sky. she really missed it and was very sad. 

the little girl felt hurt that she couldn't find her toy car. she sat down on the grass and started to cry. 

then, a kind old man came and asked what was wrong. the little girl told him about her toy car. the old man said he would help her find it and they both started searching. 

after a while, the old man found the toy car in a nearby bush. he gave it to the little girl and she was so happy. she thanked him and gave him a big hug. 

the little girl never forgot that day and she always treasured her toy car made of steel.
tim and joe were the best of friends, they did everything together. they played together and even shared a special trophy. but one day, something strange happened. joe became very selfish. he wanted to keep the trophy all to himself and not share it with tim.

tim felt sad and upset, he wanted to share the trophy with his best friend like always. so he had an idea, he decided to reverse things. he put the trophy back, where it had been before.

this made joe very happy, but he was still selfish. he wanted to keep the trophy all to himself and not share.

tim was very sad, but he decided that if joe was not willing to share the trophy then it was best to leave it be. so with a heavy heart, tim walked away and left the trophy alone.
once upon a time, there was a rod that was very big and strong. it was an enormous rod and it had a special name. everyone called it "super rod". super rod was so strong that it could lift anything. all the children wanted to try super rod and see what it could do. 

one day, a little 3 year old boy named robbie heard about super rod and wanted to try it. he asked his mom if could lift it, and she said yes. 

so, robbie and his mom went to go find super rod. when they arrived, they saw that it was even bigger and more powerful in real life. robbie was very excited and he asked his mom if he could try it. she said yes and began to help him. 

robbie was able to move super rod! he was so proud of himself. he felt happy and strong. the other children were amazed that he could lift such an enormous rod. from then on, everyone knew the 3 year old boy as super robbie.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named jane. jane lived in a small village with her family. every day, jane used to take a walk with her friends.

one day, when jane was walking, she stumbled on a big rock. jane got scared and started to cry a little bit. but then she saw something very fancy.

when jane looked more closely, she saw a beautiful castle far away in another village. jane was so excited to see it. she decided that she wanted to go to the village.

so jane and her friends started walking. after a long walk, they reached the village and saw the fancy castle. jane and her friends were so happy that they hugged each other!

their day was so fun and exciting. jane went back to the village with a smile on her face. from that day onwards she always strolled with her friends.
once upon a time, there was a rich jewel. it was the most beautiful thing in the world and people said it was magical. everyone wanted it, but no one could find it. then one day a little girl came running to the village. she said she knew where the jewel was!

everyone was excited and followed the girl. she brought them to the edge of a big lake. on the other side was a little castle. the girl said the jewel was hidden inside.

the brave villagers crossed the lake and came to the castle. they looked everywhere but could not find the jewel. then, one of them saw a hole in the wall. inside was the rich jewel!

the villagers were so happy! they took the jewel back to the village and showed it to everyone. they decided to keep it for safe keeping. they all said it was the best thing ever!
once upon a time there was an ant. he wanted to find something to keep. he looked around and saw a shiny rock. he was very excited and took it back home. the ant worked hard to keep it safe. he put it in a box and kept it near him all the time.  

one day, the ant was taking a walk, when he heard a noise. he looked around and saw a dog. the dog was ready to chase the ant. the ant was so scared and thought quickly. he knew he could not take the rock with him, so he hid it in the ground and kept running. 

luckily, the ant managed to escape. he was so relieved and happy. he ran back home and found his rock still in the ground. he was ready to keep it again. from that day on, the ant kept the rock close by, so he would never lose it again.
once upon a time there was a healthy goat. his name was benny. benny liked to rock on his hind legs when he was happy. everyday he went to the farm and ate grass in the big green field. he was very happy there and he felt healthy. one day he was rocking away and heard a noise in the distance. he stopped and looked around, but he couldn't see anything. he kept rocking and suddenly he saw a kite flying very high in the sky above him. he thought the kite looked so cool, he wanted to try to fly it. 

benny found some string and tied it to the goat's horns. he put the kite in the air and it flew so high. benny held the string and he was smiling. he rocked back and forth and the kite went up and down in the sky. benny felt like a king, flying his kite in the blue sky. he was so happy, he just kept rocking. benny flew his kite for the whole day, until it was time to go home. he felt so healthy and he was very proud of his kite flying adventures.
once a upon a time there was a powerful dragon living way up high in the sky. whenever anyone wanted to go see the dragon they would take a really high and long climb up the mountainside. 

one day a little girl decided she wanted to see the dragon. she grabbed her backpack and filled it with snacks before taking a slow and steady climb up the mountain. she took a deep breath and counted the steps as she went - one, two, three, four. 

once she reach the top of the mountain, the little girl heard a loud roar in the distance. she knew it was the dragon and she was so excited! she put on her brave face and walked to the edge of the mountain to find the dragon sitting atop a giant rainbow. the dragon was even more beautiful than she could ever imagine. 

the little girl waved to the dragon and the dragon waved back! she was so happy that she had taken this amazing trip to meet the powerful dragon. from then they they were friends forever.
one day there was a good dog. his name was steve. steve always wanted to learn more and do good things, so he went on a journey.

steve asked people, "do you know any news that can help me?" most of the people he asked ignored him, but then one day he met a nice lady. she said, "i know some news that will help you be even better!"

the lady smiled as she said to steve, "i heard that every day if you do good things then you will become an even better person!" so steve thanked her and said, "thank you for not ignoring me!"

and from then on, every day steve made sure to do good things. he learned more and had a better life than before.
once upon a time there was a lion. he liked to roar very loud! one day, he wanted to make a special sound. he needed a firework for extra loudness.

so the lion collected some wood and made a special fire. he stayed up all night and soon had a big firework ready.

in the morning, he lit the firework and it roared loud! everyone was so happy with the lion's successful work. everyone cheered and clapped loudly. even the lion felt so proud.

then they lit the firework one more time and the sky filled with sparkles and loud roaring. everyone smiled with joy. and the lion roared with happiness.
once upon a time there was a handy man who had a fancy house. whenever someone needed help, they would knock on the handy man's door.

one day, a young lady came to the door. she said, "please, i need your help. i need to sack the old teach and find a new one for my son." the handy man said he could help her.

so the handy man went to the teach's old house and packed all of her belongings in a big sack. he said goodbye and put the sack in the back of his car.

then the handy man drove to the young lady's house. he gave her the sack and said, "now you can find a fancy new teach for your son."

the young lady was very happy because the handy man had helped her. she thanked him and soon they both went back to their homes. and they all lived happily ever after.
once upon a time there was a grumpy orange. he just wanted to turn and be happy, but he could not figure out how. one day he saw a little boy who offered to help. the little boy was only three years old but was very wise. he said to the orange, "you have to turn yourself. believe in yourself and you can do it!" the orange was happy and he tried to turn himself. he tried and tried, but he just couldn't find the strength. then the little boy put the orange on the ground. he said, "now, turn!" the orange was surprised when he suddenly spun and rolled away. he was so happy that he had turned himself. the orange thanked the little boy for showing him the way. he was no longer grumpy and was now free to spin and turn wherever he wanted.
once there was a little boy. he loved to peek around. every day he would explore and look in new places. one day the little boy wanted to find something special. he went to the garden to peek around. he saw something red and round. it was an apple! he reached out and picked it up. the apple felt tough. he knew he needed to work to get it. the little boy put the apple in his pocket and started to run. he ran all the way to his house and showed the apple to his family. everyone was excited! the little boy smiled and felt so proud of his apple. he had done it himself. he had found a tough apple. it made him feel brave.
once upon a time there was a little ship. it was an independent ship, so it could go wherever it wanted. one day, it decided to go on an adventure. it sailed and sailed and sailed until it reached a far away island. the island looked like a paradise, so the ship was excited to explore it.

but when the little ship approached the shore, it couldn't quite reach it. the water was too deep and the ship was too small. it was sad and disappointed, so it sailed back out to sea.

the ship was determined to reach the island, so it kept thinking and searching. finally, it found a solution. some friendly dolphins helped the ship travel close enough to the shore that it could just touch it with its front fin. but the ship was still too small to land on the beach.

the little ship was brave and independent. on its own, it figured out how to get close to the island, using its imagination and resourcefulness. and from then on and whenever it wanted, the little ship could go back to the island and explore it.
once upon a time, there was a big and strong bear. he was walking through the forest and he found something shiny on the ground. he stopped and stared at it. it was a big mineral! the bear was excited. he wanted to pick it up and show it to the other animals in the forest.

he reached out and grabbed it with his paw. but, it was too heavy for him. he could not lift it.

he just stood there, staring at it. he thought and thought about how he could get the mineral out of the ground. suddenly, an idea came to him. he lay down on the ground and he blew and blew really hard. suddenly, the mineral popped out of the ground! the bear was so excited.

he looked around and saw a big bird in the sky. he waved up at the bird and yelled "come down and help me!" the big bird landed next to the bear and, together, they managed to pick up the big mineral and carry it away. 

the bear shouted and laughed all the way home. everyone in the forest was so happy to get the big mineral.
once upon a time there was a lazy bear who loved to spend his days in the forest. one day, the bear saw some berries, so he thought he would spend his time collecting all the berries he could find. he was so excited to spend the day picking as many berries as he could! he tirelessly searched the forest for the best berries, and found lots that were ripe and sweet. he ended up filling his basket with the delicious berries! 

suddenly, the bear got so tired from picking the berries that he lay down in the sun and closed his eyes. he was so lazy after spending all his energy picking berries. after a while, the sun woke the bear from his nap, and he realized that he had picked enough berries for many treats. 

the bear was so happy. he spent the rest of his day eating his yummy berries and enjoying the happy moments he had spent in the forest.
once upon a time there was a family who went on a march. the family had two kids, johnny and sally. they were very excited to go on the march!

the kids had to walk for a very long time. it was a lot of work and they were getting very tired. johnny was being very competitive and tried to march faster than his sister. but sally kept up with him. 

when they were almost finished, the kids heard their names being called from the distance. they looked up and saw their mom and dad waving at them! everyone cheered when the family finished the march.

the kids had a lot of fun on the march and they learned how to be competitive. they will always remember the march!
once there was a boy. he wanted to play in his green garden. he saw a tree and he wanted to climb it. he started to climb but then he fell. he felt sad. then his mommy came over to him. she saw that he was sad and she asked him what happened. he told his mommy that he fell from the tree. so his mommy decided to go and fix it. she grabbed some heavy tools and went over to the tree. she worked hard and was able to fix the tree. now the boy could climb it again. he was happy and went back to the tree. he carefully climbed it and was able to reach the top. he had a lot of fun and thanked his mommy for fixing the tree.
once there was a very old house. it was so old that its paint was starting to fade and peel away. the windows were open and the wind blew inside.

one day, a gust of wind blew over a paint can in the garden. the paint can rolled right into the house. it was so excited to find some colour! 

the paint ran all around the house and over the windows, walls and floor. it was everywhere! the house was so happy to be colourful again.

but the next day, it started to rain. the house began to suffer as the paint started to drip, run and mix together. the house was hurt and all its colours disappeared again.

the old house was no longer colourful, but at least it was open to the world.
gabby was very excited to go to school. she put on her new uniform, and her mom told her how wonderful she looked. the uniform was very nice - it was red and had a nice, shiny badge on it.

at school, everyone was wearing uniforms just like gabby. she smiled, because she felt so good in her new clothes. her teacher was very kind and encouraged her to learn new things. she especially liked learning new songs.

at lunch, gabby noticed some of the other kids had their own snacks. their snacks looked so good, so gabby asked her teacher if she could have some. her teacher said "yes", and her classmates announced, "gabby has rich snacks today".

soon, gabby gained more confidence in learning. her teacher was very encouraging, and she was learning lots of new things. everyone was impressed with how well she was doing. 

she was happy that her uniform made her feel special, and that her teacher encouraged her to do her best. at the end of the day, gabby was proud of all the things she had learned.
once upon a time, there was a lazy dog named mr. fuzzy. mr fuzzy loved to sleep all day and he never did chores. one day, mr fuzzy's owner wanted to do a craft project with him. he showed mr fuzzy a pot of glue and asked him to help put together a picture. even though he was lazy, mr fuzzy was very excited! he loved to use the glue and he ended up making the best picture ever. his owner was so proud of him! from that day on, he made sure to help with chores and crafts when they were asked of him. the end.
once upon a time there was a bird. he wanted to make a home. but he couldn't decide where it should go. he flew high, he flew far, he flew round and round in circles. he looked here, he looked there, but still he couldn't find the perfect place.

suddenly he heard a sound. it was a baby bird. it was in a nest up near the top of a tall tree. the bird was troubled and alone. feeling sad, the bird flew to the nest. he saw the baby bird, and he felt sorry. he wished he could take away the baby's troubles.

the big bird wanted to stay and help the baby bird, so he made a nest nearby. he was happy to be helping, but soon he started to regret it. every day the nest needed more repairs, and it took a lot of time and effort.

but the bird was glad he had done it. even though it was troublesome, he was glad he had helped the baby bird. every day he would fly to the nest and make sure the baby was safe and sound. he was happy to take care of the baby bird, and he was thankful that he had offered his help when it was needed.
once upon a time, there was a little girl called daisy. she was going to the park with her mom and dad. when they got there, daisy saw lots of fun things to do.

she saw a big brown club laying on the ground. dad said it must belong to the playground! daisy was so excited. she offered to play with the club.

dad said that was a great idea. together, they began to hit the ball with the club. daisy laughed and had so much fun. dad said she was really good at it!

they played with the club until it was time to go home. dad offered to take it with them, but daisy said no. she wanted to leave it in the playground for someone else to find and play with.
once upon a time, there was a huge musician. he wanted to take a walk in the park and play some music. he grabbed his guitar and headed off. as he walked, he saw lots of animals. he waved to a cow, high-fived a sheep and gave some breadcrumbs to a hungry duck. soon he came to a big tree in the middle of the park. he decided to take a seat there and strum his guitar.

before long, a group of children came to join him. they were very excited to hear the music. the musician strummed away and the children clapped along. it was so much fun! after a few songs, the children took out a jump rope and started to play. the huge musician jumped in and started to skip too. he was having a great time!

soon all the animals gathered round to watch. the cow mooed, the sheep baaed and the duck quacked. the huge musician felt so happy. he was making lots of new friends. everyone said goodbye to the musician as the sun began to set. he bid them all farewell and took his guitar off home.
once there was a mom and a baby. they were very special to each other. the mom wanted to show the baby a delicate way. so they went outside and the mom said, "listen baby - listen to all of the beautiful things around you!".

the baby watched the birds in the sky and listened to their singing. he heard the gentle breeze rustle the leaves in the trees. he listened to the water in the river that was very calming. it was all so very delicate.

the mom and baby loved to take walks and go exploring. they looked at all of the different places and listened to the things around them. the baby learned about the different sounds and ways to look at the world. he especially enjoyed listening and learning about the delicate way of life.
once there was a little girl who went for a walk in the woods. she saw an owl perched on a branch and felt curious. she went closer to the owl and examined it. the owl looked back at her with its big eyes. the girl thought it was so interesting and smiled. 

suddenly, the owl moved and the girl backed away. the owl left a present behind which was something gross and disgusting. the girl wrinkled her nose in disgust. 

the girl touched the present with her finger and it made a squishing sound. she quickly wiped her finger on her pants and backed away from the present. 

the girl wanted to see the owl again so she kept examining the area where it had been. but the owl was nowhere to be seen.
once upon a time there was a girl called joe. joe was very happy and never felt envious. until one day her best friend sal brought a pill to show her. joe felt envious because sal had something that she did not have. she asked sal where she had got the pill from, but sal would not tell her. joe started to feel sad.

the next day sal invited joe to come to her house. when joe arrived, sal showed her the source of the pill. it was a magic box that made new pills every day. sal gave joe a pill as a gift and joe felt very happy. she no longer felt envious because she now had a pill too.

joe and sal played with their new pills every day. they had lots of fun and were the happiest of friends.
one day, little timmy went for a walk with his mommy. the sky was looking very gloomy. down the street, timmy saw a beautiful park with a big tree in the middle. at the top of the tree, he noticed a bulb that was shining brightly. 

timmy asked his mommy why the bulb was in the tree. she explained to him that the bulb lay there to light up the park every night. she showed timmy how much more cheerful the park looked with the bulb in the tree. 

timmy was so fascinated that he asked his mommy if he could lay in the tree and admire the bulb. his mommy agreed and lifted timmy up, so that he could lay in the tree and look at the bulb. 

the bulb kept lighting up the gloomy sky, and before long, timmy had fallen asleep in the tree. in the morning, when the sun had risen, timmy's mommy carefully lifted him down from the tree.

they both smiled as the bulb brightly lit up the park for one last time before the sun rose.
once upon a time, there was a huge garden with lots of different plants and flowers. every day, at noon the sun would shine down and something special would happen. all the flowers in the garden would begin to bloom! big red roses would turn upwards, tiny daisies would stretch out and enormous sunflowers would show their bright faces.

the garden was very beautiful and everybody who visited it couldn't help but smile. days were filled with the bees buzzing over the petals and the birds singing in the trees. even at night the garden was twinkling with fireflies lighting up the dark sky.

as time passed, the garden continued to get more and more beautiful. it seemed like every time the sun shone down its beauty would increase. soon enough, everyone in the town began to marvel at the garden and its enormous blooms. it had become a special part of the town and everyone was happy.
once upon a time, there was an ordinary dinosaur. he was very lonely and wanted to find a friend. he saw a bird and asked the bird if it wanted to be his friend. the bird said yes, but then said the dinosaur wouldn't be able to fly like him. the dinosaur was sad and began to cry.

but then, he heard someone's voice. it was a magical fairy who said she could allow the dinosaur to fly like the bird. the dinosaur was so excited and said yes. the fairy waved her wand and suddenly the dinosaur started to fly! he was so happy and thanked the fairy for her help.

he flew up high in the sky and even higher than the bird. the two of them flew together, like best friends. the dinosaur finally had a friend and he was so happy. the end.
once upon a time, there was a kind girl named jill. jill had a pet dog who she loved very much. one day, jill took her dog for a walk and they went to the park.

at the park, jill saw some swings. she wanted to have some fun so she ran to the swings and started to hang on them. she laughed and laughed as she hung in the air.

as she was hanging on the swing, jill's pet dog saw some butter on the ground. he ran over and started to lick it. jill laughed and said, "that's ok, my dog. butter is kind". then she helped her dog pick up the butter and they both went home.
jimmy saw something scary in the woods and wanted to go back home. he started walking, but soon he heard someone call his name. it was his friend, poppy. she had lots of treasures in her pocket and wanted to trade them with jimmy. she had a shiny marble and a sparkly car, which looked very exciting.

jimmy was scared, so he decided to trade. he looked inside his pocket and found some shiny stones, an old toy car, and a feather he found in the park. he handed them to poppy and she gave him the treasure. they were both happy. 

they said goodbye and jimmy started walking home again, feeling excited with his new treasures. he couldn't wait to show his mom what he traded for.
once upon a time there was a boy called frank. frank was three years old. one day, he decided to go on a walk.

as he walked, he heard the sound of a distant violin. frank saw a man playing the violin and it made him very happy. he wanted to make music too, so he asked the man if he could try.

the man said yes, so frank grabbed the violin. he held it in his hands and tried to make some music. but instead of making beautiful music, frank started to slap the violin.

the man laughed and said he should try playing the strings. so frank tried! he moved his fingers over the strings and made the most wonderful sound. frank was so proud of himself and he clapped his hands.

the man thanked him and said goodbye. frank waved goodbye and watched him walk away until he was nothing but a distant memory. frank then smiled, happy to have made music that made the man smile.

one day, anne wanted to go outside. the ground was icy, so she had to be careful. she walked to the edge of her garden and started to run. she ran so fast that she started to slip on the icy ground. she tumbled and fell down!

luckily, her bedroom was nearby. she ran back inside and lay down on her soft bed. she shut her eyes, tired from the exciting adventure outside.

the end.

meg went on the stage and sang and danced. everyone clapped and cheered for her. meg loved it so much. she had made her request come true!

sam had a pocket. it was a useful pocket. whenever sam needed something, he would reach into his pocket and get it.

one day, sam wanted to call his grandma. he reached into his pocket and pulled out a phone. he knew how to use it to call his grandma.

sam looked at the number on the phone, then he pressed the buttons one by one. he heard a ringing sound. after a few seconds, his grandma answered.

sam was so happy to hear her voice on the other end. he asked her about her day and told her about his day. they chatted for a while, then sam said goodbye and hung up.

sam was glad he had a useful pocket. it always held everything he needed!

when johnny got home, he showed it to his friends. they all thought it was so cool. they thought johnny was so creative for finding the raven. they all played with the raven. they made it fly up and down in the sky. johnny was so proud of his new raven. 

then it was time to go home. johnny said goodbye to his new raven and went home. everyday johnny would come back and say hello to his special raven.

once there was a yellow kitten who lived in a big house. one day, the kitten decided to explore inside and outside the house. he scampered along, looking around. suddenly, he heard a loud sound. he was frightened and ran away.

the kitten ended up on the edge of a lake. he couldn't swim and started to cry. suddenly, somebody saw the kitten and called for help.

three brave friends ran to rescue the kitten. they helped the kitten back onto the shore and he was happy again. the yellow kitten thanked the friends and ran back home.

the friends had rescued the little yellow kitten. they were very proud and felt happy to have saved him.
once upon a time, there was a little bug. it was tiny, with big eyes. it scurried around, jumping from leaf to leaf. suddenly, it noticed something. it was a small girl, staring at it from far away. she was only three years old, with big eyes and a curious look.

the bug and the little girl stared at each other for a while. the bug was so small, and the girl so big. it wondered what she was thinking. then the girl smiled and pointed her finger at the bug. it felt safe and happy.

the little girl slowly reached out her hand. she wanted to touch the bug. the bug stayed still, and the girl touched it gently. she was so gentle. then she suddenly stood up and walked away. the little bug watched her go until she disappeared behind the trees. it was sad to see her go, but it also knew they would meet again someday.
once upon a time there was a clever dog. he was always making jokes and making everyone laugh.

one day, the clever dog wanted to show off his joke skills. so he went to the store and asked the storekeeper for a pay.

the storekeeper was very surprised. he laughed and asked the clever dog, "what do you want to pay for?"

the clever dog then said, "i want to pay for a joke!"

the storekeeper couldn't believe it! he laughed and said, "sure! what kind of joke do you want?"

the clever dog thought for a moment and then said, "i'll take the funniest joke you have!"

the storekeeper was impressed! he gave the clever dog the best joke he had and the dog paid with a smile.

the clever dog thanked the storekeeper before running off to show his joke to everyone he knew! everyone loved his joke and the clever dog was very proud!
once there was a little boy called timmy. he was only three years old. he had a problem - he was weak.

one day, timmy wanted to play with matches. he held one in his hand and shook it. but it didn't light up. he shook it harder, but nothing happened. timmy was too weak to make it light up.

then he had an idea. he asked his mum to help. she took the match and shook it hard. suddenly, the match lit up!

timmy was so happy and smiled. he thanked his mum for helping him. now he could have lots of fun with the matches!
there was a kid who wanted to have some fun. he looked around his house and found something hidden. it was a big blue slide! the kid was so excited he couldn't believe it. 

he ran to the slide and started to climb up. when he reached the top, he glanced back and saw his house. it was so far away. then he started to slide. he went faster and faster and the wind was in his face.

finally, he reached the bottom. he got off the slide and ran around the garden. he pretended he was a pirate. he put on an eye-patch and waved a stick as if it was a sword. he shouted, "argh mateys!"

the kid had a grand old time. he laughed and shouted. he ran around and had so much fun. after some time, he said goodbye to the slide and went back home. he promised himself he would come back and slide again the next day.
once upon a time, there was a small kitty. she lived in a big house all alone. she was sad because she had no one to play with. 

one day, she found a strange box outside of her house. inside the box was a razor. curious, she took a closer look. 

the kitty didn't know what it was, so she decided to settle down and try to figure it out. she tried to move it and she saw a bright light come out of it. 

the kitty was very excited and tried to slip the razor past her ear. suddenly, she felt a strange tingle. she felt so excited and scared at the same time. 

the kitty had never felt anything like this before. she had discovered the unknown! she quickly settled into a corner of her house and felt the tingle in her fur. she knew she found something special. 

from then on, the kitty was never alone. she had her new razor to keep her company.
