mia was walking through the park one day when something small and shiny caught her eye. she decided to pull it out of the grass and it was a toy train. she held it up to her face and smiled.

mia loved her new toy train and carried it with her everywhere she went. she pulled it around as she explored the park.

every day she returned to the park with her train to play and explore. her toy train gave her so many good memories that she never wanted to let it go.

but one day, when mia returned to the park, she discovered that her toy was gone. she searched everywhere but she couldn't find it. mia was so sad!

then mia's family told her about a local toy store where she could buy a new train. they took her there and mia was amazed to find cheap toy trains that looked like the one she had lost.

mia picked out the perfect train and took it home. it was just like the one she had lost but now she had a new toy to make even more memories. mia was so happy!
once there was a bear named larry. one day larry wanted to go on an adventure, so he decided to jog. he was feeling very grateful because it was such a beautiful day! larry jogged and jogged until he spotted something in the sky. it was a jet! he had never seen a jet before and he was very excited.

larry waved to the jet as it flew over. the pilot of the jet could see him and smiled. the pilot waved back to larry and flew away. larry felt so grateful that he got to see the jet. 

he kept jogging and visited all kinds of places. everywhere he went, he had the most amazing adventures. whenever he thought about the jet, he felt so grateful. he thanked the pilot for making his day so special.
once upon a time, there lived a princess. her name was anna. every day, she went for a walk in the woods near her kingdom. 

one day, she discovered something special. it was a funny crown! anna was so excited. she ran back to her palace and showed the crown to all her family and friends. they were very happy and everyone wanted to try it on. 

the crown was fun and magical. each day, anna and her friends went back to the woods to play and discover new things. they had so much fun wearing their funny crowns. 

they all laughed, danced, and enjoyed the sunny days in the woods. every day was an adventure and they felt like real princesses. the days were filled with joy and happiness!
once upon a time there was a little girl named lucy. she was three years old and loved music. every day after dinner she would go to her grandparent's house and listen to their old music. she liked to dance and sing along to the music, but sometimes it was too loud.

one day, she decided to take some music with her when she went to her grandparent's house. she chose her favorite song and put it into her pocket.

when she got to her grandparent's house, she played the music through a small speaker. it was a perfect fit! she was so happy. she sang and danced along to her song and the room filled with music.

but the music was so loud it made the room very dirty. lucy's mom said she had to clean the room before dinner. she used the broom to sweep the floor and a cloth to wipe the walls and chairs.

at the end, the room was sparkling clean, and lucy was able to listen to her music again. she fit the music and the clean room so nicely and happily danced until dinner time.
once upon a time there was a lazy reef. the reef was very unhappy. it wanted to be fixed so that the coral could be happy and healthy. 
one day, a little fish saw the reef and was very sad to see it like that. the fish wanted to help and so it asked other fish to join it. 
the fish worked very hard and after a few days, they had fixed the reef. the coral was very happy and thanked the fish for helping. 
from then on, the reef was never lazy again. the fish and coral had fun times together and they were very happy. 
the end.
once upon a time there was a blue tomato. it loved to slip around. every morning it would slip out of its home and go exploring. 

it would slip over the hills and around the trees. it would go so fast that the birds and the bees couldn't keep up. 

the blue tomato soon made friends with a big yellow sun. the sun would follow the tomato as it slipped around and around. 

every day the blue tomato would slip back home in the evening, exhausted but happy. it was content to spend its days slipping around and making new friends. 

and they all lived happily ever after. the end.
once upon a time, there was a powerful dragon who lived on the roof of a house. he was always laughing and joking around. his friends were scared of him at first, but soon found out he was actually a very nice dragon. 

one day, all of his dragon friends came to visit him on his roof. they played tag, laughed, and made jokes about each other. the dragon laughed so hard he almost fell off the roof! 

suddenly, a storm blew in. the dragon used his powerful wings to cover all of his friends, and he kept them all safe from the bad weather. after the storm passed, his friends laughed and cheered. they were so happy that their powerful dragon friend protected them from the storm. 

the dragon was very happy too. he smiled and joked around until it was time for his friends to go home. of course, they had a lot of fun, but the dragon was the one who made them all laugh the most!
once there was a nice girl named jane who liked to play. she was very adventurous and liked to explore. 
one day, jane decided to take a step into the living room. she saw a nice chair in the corner of the room and was very excited. 
she carefully stepped over to the chair and slowly sat down on it. she leaned back and smiled as she felt the gentle cushions beneath her. 
jane looked around the room and saw all the different things to explore. she liked the chair so much that she decided to stay and play there for a while. 
and so jane happily stepped off of the nice chair and continued exploring the living room.
once upon a time there was a bright moon in the sky. on one special night, a little girl stepped outside. she looked up and saw the moon. it was so soft and pretty. she wanted to kiss it.

so, the little girl raised her arms and blew a big kiss up to the moon. she was sure that the moon felt it. she thought she even saw the moon smile! 

then something special happened. a sparkly star shot down from the moon and landed in the little girl's hand. it was the softest thing she had ever felt. she thanked the moon with another kiss and went back inside. 

from that day forward the little girl kept the star close and was sure to blow the moon kisses every night. whenever she was feeling sad or happy, she would look up and feel that the moon was looking down at her with a big smile.
once upon a time, there was a girl named maya. she liked to pick flowers, but one day she made a mistake. she was picking a flower from the neighbor's garden when she got caught.

the neighbor was so angry and put maya in jail. maya was very scared and she had no idea what to do. she started to cry and told the jailer she was sorry for her mistake.

then, the jailer had an idea. she was not too fond of the neighbor either and thought it was very stupid of him to put maya in jail. so the jailer let maya go and told her never to pick the neighbor's flowers again.

maya thanked the jailer and vowed never to make that mistake again. from then on, she only picked flowers from her own garden.
john was upset because he wanted some wine. his mum said no and he couldn't stop crying. 

john's dad tried to make him laugh by telling him a funny story but john still wanted some wine. his dad said he was too young, so he couldn't have any. 

john shouted and said he wanted some wine, but his mum and dad said no again. john was very upset. 

finally, his mum spoke softly to john. she said that if he was patient, he could have a small glass of wine when he was older. this made john smile. 

john understood what his mum said and stopped crying. maybe in a few years he can have a small glass of wine - and he was very happy!
john and his family had a special day planned. they were going to go camping and have lots of fun. john couldn't wait! he loaded the car with all the camping supplies and away they went.

john and his family pitched the tent in a nice spot by a lake. john grabbed the hose and started to spray the tent to keep it cool. he loved the feeling of the water on his skin.

after they finished setting up the tent, they went to explore. john liked to find animals and plants but today he was feeling lazy. so he found a tree and just sat in the shade and watched the birds and bugs fly by. 

john's family went swimming in the lake. the sun was now getting ready to set. john joined them and they had a lot of fun splashing around in the water.

at the end of the day, john was tired and happy. he had started the day with a spray and now it was time to go to sleep with wonderful memories from the day.

today it was time to get ready. his owner loaded him up with a special leash so he wouldn't run away. the puppy was very anxious. he didn't like when something new was put on his body. 

his owner pet him to reassure him everything was ok. then slowly and carefully the leash was clipped. the puppy felt a little better. now it was time for a walk! 

the puppy and his owner walked and walked. the puppy looked around and sniffed all of the wonderful smells. he felt better and less anxious as he trotted on the leash beside his owner.

once upon a time, a little girl had a big dream. she wanted to be strong and tough like her big brother. but it was always so hard to be like him!

one day, she got an idea. she would eat broccoli! she knew that broccoli would make her tough like her big brother.

every day, she ate broccoli. at first, it tasted yucky, but the more she ate, the better she felt. she even started to like it!

her dream was coming true. with every bite of broccoli, she got a little bit tougher and stronger. soon, she felt like she could do anything, just like her big brother.

the little girl was so happy to have reached her dream. and she kept eating broccoli every day!

john's dad was a captain, so he knew how to sail the yacht. he took everyone on a journey around the island. john and his siblings all had turns steering the yacht. everyone was having fun!

at the end of the day, john's dad asked if everyone knew how to sail the yacht. everyone nodded yes. they said good-bye to the dependable yacht and made plans for their next adventure.
once upon a time, there was a brave boy named fred. fred was on a big adventure in his small, red car. suddenly, he heard a loud yell for help. fred rushed to find where the noise was coming from. 

when he arrived, fred saw a package that was stuck in a big, red tree. the package was making the noise! the package had dropped from a plane high in the sky and it was trapped in the branches of the tree but couldn't get back down.

fred was determined to rescue the package. he climbed up the trunk of the tree and carefully reached out for the package. after struggling for a few minutes, he finally grabbed it and brought it safely down.

when the package was on the ground again, fred opened it up. inside the package, he found a bag of bitter candy. so even though the rescue was difficult, fred was glad he was able to help. he knew the package was needed and was happy he could rescue it.
once there was a chubby little bunny. he heard about a cool pass in a far away town. he hopped and hopped until he reached the pass. he was so excited to be there. 

when he arrived at the pass, the bunny noticed something in the distance. the sun was beginning to rise above the horizon. he hopped another step forward and the sun shone brighter and brighter. he had never seen a sunrise before and it was beautiful! 

the bunny stayed at the pass until the sun had risen completely. he felt so happy and content that he hopped and bounced joyfully back home. as he hopped, he looked forward to the sunset he would see that day.
once upon a time there was a ship that sailed on the sea. all of the people on board were having a wonderful time until they saw something terrible. a giant wave was coming towards them! everyone was so scared, so they held on tight.

suddenly, the wave came and it was so big that it made the ship go up and down. the people were terrified and clung to each other. but then something amazing happened. a big blue whale jumped out of the wave and started pushing the ship away from the wave. everyone cheered with excitement and hugged each other.

the whale kept pushing until the wave was gone. the ship was safe. the whale then swam away. everyone thanked the whale and knew that it had saved their lives.

the people all hugged each other, some even squeezed each other really tight. everyone was so happy that they were safe and that the whale had saved them all.
once upon a time there was a bee called buzzy. he liked to skip around his hive, which was different from all the other hives in the garden. every day he would fly from flower to flower collecting nectar, and then skip back to his hive with a smile on his face.

one day, while he was skipping around the garden, he noticed a funny looking hive in the corner. it was shaped differently than his hive and it had some interesting patterns painted on it.

buzzy was so curious that he decided to fly over to the strange hive. he buzzed around it a few times, and then decided to peek inside. it was full of different kinds of goodies that he'd never seen before!

he smiled and flew back to his own hive with some of the treats. ever since then, buzzy has been skipping around the garden with a bit more excitement. he never knows when he'll find a new and exciting hive!

the massage was very special. it had special oils that made bella's skin feel very soft and smooth. bella felt so special and relaxed after the massage. 

one day, bella had gone to have her massage only to discover that the massage master had left for vacation. bella was disappointed and did not know who would give her the massage now. she waited and waited until finally, another massage master arrived. 

this massage master was even more attractive than the one before! the massage was even more special and felt even better. at the end, bella was so relaxed and happy that she fell asleep. 

the end.
once there was a seed in the ground. it was small and by itself. but then something wonderful happened. the seed began to grow!

the seed grew and grew until it became a big strong plant. its leaves were green and full of life. its petals were bright and colourful.

but then one day, a nail flew over and landed on the plant's head. the nail was sharp and scary. the plant was troubled.

but then something amazing happened. the plant pushed the nail away and kept growing until it became bigger and stronger than ever. the nail could not stop it.

now the plant lives happily in its garden, full of life and joy. it teaches us a special lesson - never let anyone or anything stop you from growing!
mia and her mommy were in the kitchen. they always liked cooking together. mommy said to mia, "let's use the broccoli, okay?". mia was so excited! she smiled and said, "yes, mommy!". mommy smiled, then fetched the broccoli from the fridge.

mia watched as her mommy used a knife to cut the broccoli into small pieces. it made mia so happy to watch her mommy work. "the broccoli looks so lively!" mia said with a grin.

with the help of mommy, mia used a spoon to mix the broccoli pieces into a big bowl. then they added some salt and other tasty things. 

mommy and mia put the bowl in the oven and waited. after a while the kitchen started to smell delicious. when the broccoli was cooked, mia and her mommy served the tasty broccoli and ate it together. 

it was very yummy and mia was so happy. mommy smiled too. together they had made a most lovely and lively broccoli dish!

mommy and daddy took pudding to the pet shop and pudding tried on lots of collars. finally, pudding chose one with lots of purple and pink stripes. he liked it very much.

mommy and daddy then took pudding for a treat. they walked to the park and gave him a delicious chocolaty biscuit. pudding ate it quickly and licked his lips.

he wagged his tail with happiness. pudding really liked the new collar, and the delicious treat. mommy and daddy smiled. they were very happy for pudding.
once upon a time there was a girl named molly. she was three years old and loved to play with dolls.

one day, molly was playing dress-up with her dolls. she put her dolls in all sorts of different fashions. as she was playing, she felt tired and wanted to take a nap.

molly went to her bedroom and climbed into her bed. she closed her eyes, took a deep breath and felt very calm. molly imagined a special place where she could go, full of bright colors and new fashions.

she opened her eyes and found herself in a magical place. she could see a rainbow of colors and all kinds of pretty dresses, shoes and hats. molly was so excited! she twirled around and around and looked at all the new clothes.

then, she saw something special - a big golden wheel! molly walked up slowly and put her hand on it. she gave the wheel a turn and the wheel began to spin. suddenly, all the fashions changed into new, beautiful clothes! molly was very happy and felt so calm.

the end.
once upon a time, there was a little girl. she was only three years old. every day, her parents would take her to the park. they were her parents, because they were always with her and they looked after her.

on this day, they went to the park and stepped onto the grass. the grass was soft and green, and it felt nice beneath their feet. then the little girl noticed something furry on the ground! it was a hairy caterpillar, crawling around.

the little girl was excited, so she stepped forward and carefully picked it up. much to her surprise, it was soft and tickly. her parents smiled, happy to see her so excited about something.

the little girl put the caterpillar back on the grass and stepped back, so it would be safe. and from then on, she was always on the look out for more of the hairy caterpillars.
once there was a jolly old man who loved his pipe. every day he would take a long stroll through the park and smoke it. he loved the smell and the feeling of peace that it brought him.

but one day, something changed. another man came along with a pipe of his own and he started puffing and blowing smoke everywhere. the old man got angry and started shouting at the other man to leave but he wouldn't go. the old man was so angry that he hated the other man's pipe.

the old man went back home and the next day he brought his pipe to the park again. but this time, he was careful to avoid the man with the other pipe. whenever he saw the other pipe, he would quickly turn away so he didn't have to look at it. his pipe was much nicer.

he would still take his long strolls through the park and smoke his pipe, but now he was careful to keep away from the other man. he loved his pipe and he could never truly hate it.
once there was a fair helicopter. it was big and strong and flew high in the sky. the people on the ground would whisper as it flew by. one day the helicopter flew to a special place. it was very far away up in the sky and the people on the ground couldn't see it anymore.

but the fair helicopter was still in the sky. it was going on an adventure to explore the world! it flew for miles and miles until it noticed a tiny village below. it hovered above, not making a sound, and the people looked up and whispered in amazement.

the fair helicopter waved and all the people waved back. they kept waving back and forth until the helicopter had to leave. the people below were sad to see it go, but they knew the fair helicopter had to keep exploring. so it flew away, slowly fading into the sky until it was gone.
once upon a time there was a grumpy jelly. it was stuck all the way at the bottom of a deep pool. the jelly was very sad. it wanted to get free! 

then one day, an brave swan swam down to the bottom of the pool. the swan saw the grumpy jelly, and it knew it had to rescue it. 

the swan pumped its wings as hard as it could and as it flew up, it scooped up the jelly into its wings. soon, the jelly was rescued from the bottom of the pool and was high up in the sky!

the jelly was so happy that it thanked the swan many times. they both then flew away into the sunset together, never to be parted again.

suddenly, he had an idea. he would play with his pitch and shovel! he ran inside to get the items and quickly put on his raincoat. when he was ready, he ran outside and got busy. he scooped the pitch into the sandpit and smiled.

he kept busy all day, filling the sandpit with the pitch and playing with his shovel. even though it was raining, james was having tons of fun. when the sun began to set, james stopped his work and looked at the sandpit. it was now full of pitch, and he was proud of what he had accomplished.

james smiled and went back inside for the night, happy with his brilliant pitch-filled sandpit.

once upon a time there was a boy named tom. tom was very polite. he said please and thank you all the time. one day, tom wanted to explore the garden. he ran outside and looked around with glee. he saw a rake and he ran to it. he started to rake the leaves and make piles. he thought it was so much fun! 

suddenly he heard a noise. it was a car going by. it went so fast! "zoom!" tom shouted. he thought it was exciting. he started to rake the leaves again, pretending he was going zoom zoom as well. 

he had so much fun playing in the garden that day. so he decided to rake the leaves every day and pretend to zoom around the garden. he was so polite and always said please and thank you, even though he was pretending to be a car.

when her mommy came, she scooped jenny up in her arms and said, "let's go get something pink to make you feel better."

off they went and soon they were at the toy store. jenny saw a big pink unicorn and her heart swelled with joy. she hugged it and she felt the fierce feeling go away.

mommy took them home and tucked jenny into a comfy bed. then she gave jenny the pink unicorn and said, "relax and have sweet dreams."

jenny hugged the pink unicorn close to her chest, closed her eyes and drifted off to a peaceful sleep. she was finally relaxed.

the little girl decided to take her flowers home. she carried the basket with care, so none of the flowers would fall out. when she reached home, she put the flowers in a vase and put them on the coffee table to show off her pretty basket.
once there was a boy named john. he was three years old and loved to joke. he was always laughing and having fun.

one day it started to rain. the rain was cold and wet. john thought it would be funny to dance in it and he began to twirl and spin around.

his mother saw him and said, "john, the rain is useful. it helps make things grow." john listened and smiled.

the rain stopped soon after, and when it was over, john saw a beautiful rainbow in the sky. he laughed again and said, "look, mom! a rainbow. we can joke about that."

his mother smiled and said, "yes, we can! it's so special to see something so beautiful after the rain."

john smiled with joy and ran around the rainbow, laughing and joking again.
once upon a time there were two friends, tom and pete. tom liked to walk and pete liked to jump. they both had a jolly time together.

one day, tom and pete decided to go for a walk. tom brought a long, soft rope with him. they walked and walked until they saw a big hill.

pete had a great idea. he said, "let's use the rope to slide down the hill." 

tom was so excited! he tied one end of the rope to a tree and the other end to his waist. then pete pushed him and he slid down the hill on the rope! it was so much fun!

when they finished sliding down the hill, they both had big smiles on their faces. tom and pete had a jolly time together and they walked home happily.

but then something amazing happened. his friend took him to the pool, and started teaching peter some easy swimming moves. peter was a fast learner, and after a few tries, he was able to swim on his own!

once upon a time, there was a little bird named lucy. she lived in a peaceful bush. every day she would fly around the bush and explore.

one day, lucy noticed something poking out of a hole in the bush. she went closer to see what it was. it was a little hedgehog! he was so cute.

lucy tapped the hedgehog gently with her beak. she said, "hello there! what's your name?" the hedgehog poked his head out of the hole and said, "my name is spike."

lucy and spike quickly became friends. every day they would play and explore together in the peaceful bush. they had lots of fun!

that was the wonderful story of lucy and spike!
once upon a time there was a boy who looked for an adventure. he ran down to the beach, hoping to find something fun.

he looked around the shore and saw a large octopus in the sand. the boy wanted to catch it. he waited and waited, but the octopus kept running away from him.

finally, the octopus got stuck in the sand. the boy ran so fast and caught the octopus. it felt slippery and slimy. 

the octopus tried to get out of the boy's hands, but he was strong and held tightly. suddenly, the octopus made a bad sound. it made the boy jump and he dropped the octopus. 

the octopus swam away, leaving the boy by himself. he was happy that he got to catch the octopus, even though it was bad.
once upon a time, there was a very compassionate spirit. everywhere she went, she spread joy and love. but one day, the spirit felt very blue. she didn't feel like playing or singing like she usually did. suddenly, a little voice shouted out from the trees.

the spirit looked around to find a little boy, jumping around and shouting for joy! she smiled and laughed. he ran up to her with a big hug and said, "will you play with me?". she smiled and nodded happily.

they ran and shouted as they played together. no matter what game they were playing, the spirit always made sure the little boy was having fun. the little boy's laughter was full of joy, and soon the spirit began to laugh too! 

after a while, they stopped to rest. the spirit looked around and saw the little boy's loving family, watching and smiling. touched by the little boy's compassion, the spirit smiled even brighter. 

that's when she realized, it was not just the little boy who was compassionate - we all have a little spirit of compassion inside of us. we just need to remember to shout it out together!
once there was a lonely foot. he didn't have any friends and he was very sad. every day he went to the park but no one wanted to play with him.

one day, while he was in the park, he heard a voice. it said "i need help! can you solve my problem?" the foot couldn't believe it, someone wanted his help! 

the foot looked around but he couldn't see anyone so he called out "where are you?"

then he looked up and saw a bird high up in the tree. the bird was stuck in some sticky sap and it couldn't get down.

the foot laughed and said "i know how to solve that problem!" he quickly ran and found some stones which he put around the tree. then the foot climbed up the stones and rescued the bird.

the foot and the bird became good friends and now they go to the park together every day. the foot is no longer lonely, and he is so proud that he solved the bird's problem.
timmy was a nosy boy. he always wanted to finish what he started. one day, he spotted a big, black tv in the living room. he wanted to finish it! he toddled over and pressed a big button. the tv lit up and he smiled. he finished it! he watched some cartoons and decided to have a nap afterwards.

timmy was feeling nosy again the next day, so he put on his shoes and started looking around the house. he found an old book and wanted to finish it, too. he started to read the first few pages, but quickly got tired and decided to take a nap.

timmy was so nosy, he finished everything he touched. he finished books, games, and toys. he finished so many things that he often got tired. but he never stopped being nosy. timmy finished everything he set his mind on and made sure to never give up!
once upon a time, there was a small boy who wanted to go on an adventure. he put on his shoes and started to walk. he followed a path which led to a navy sea.

when he reached the navy sea, he saw a modern boat. it was bright and shiny. he wanted to take a closer look. so, he jumped into the boat and started to explore.

the modern boat was filled with buttons and levers. he started to play with them. suddenly, the boat zoomed away and the small boy was floating away in the navy sea! he was so excited.

he waved to the people on the shore and the boat sailed further and further away. the small boy went on a big adventure and he had lots of fun. at the end of his journey, he hopped back off his boat, waved goodbye, and then walked home.
once upon a time there was a dolphin who liked to wander. he swam around the ocean every day looking for something new and exciting. 

one day the dolphin found something special. the ocean was warm and the sun was shining. the dolphin smiled and knew he had found a special place. 

the dolphin decided to explore this special place. he swam around and looked at all the amazing things in the ocean. he could see colourful fish and coral in the warm water. 

the dolphin kept swimming and he soon came across a big beach. the sand was so warm on his fins, he just had to stop and take it all in. he stayed for a while and enjoyed the sunshine and the waves. 

when he felt it was time to move on, the dolphin returned to the ocean. he decided to wander around some more, so he could find more special things. 

he kept swimming and he found many amazing things. but nothing was as special as the warm beach he had found. and so the dolphin kept coming back to this place whenever he wanted to wander.
once upon a time there was an adventurous bear. one day, the bear was walking through the forest when he came across a yummy treat. the treat looked tasty and the bear wanted to eat it. but then he realized that it was poison! the bear resisted the temptation to eat it.

the bear then heard a voice calling him. he looked up and saw a beautiful bird in a nearby tree. the bird asked the bear to follow her. she said that her name was saila and she knew of a new and exciting adventure that was waiting for the bear.

the bear accepted the invitation and followed saila to a secret place deep in the forest. as they went, they saw lots of fascinating things. they even made friends with some of the animals along the way. when they arrived at the secret place, the bear was so happy and excited to start the adventure!

saila taught the bear lots of new things and together they went on many fun adventures. the bear was so glad that he had resisted the poison because the journey with saila was much better than it would have been if he ate the treat. the adventures he had helped him to grow and learn in so many ways. the bear was so lucky and grateful for the amazing journey!
once upon a time there was a purple mop. the mop lived in a big, pink room. every morning the mop would wake up ready for the day! 

the mop would enjoy the bright sunshine that shone through the window and the birds chirping outside. then, the mop would be ready to start its day.

every morning it would go over to the floor and start to clean. it felt so nice having the floor all clean. after the mop had finished it would sit back,dance around and sing.

the purple mop was so happy and enjoyed its days, it wanted to help out around the house all the time. all the people in the house were so pleased they had the purple mop keeping their floors squeaky clean.

the days became so much fun for everyone and the purple mop loved being useful. it was a job it was perfect for! so, the purple mop kept waking up every morning to keep the house clean and everyone happy.
once upon a time there was a little boy who liked to play with clay. he had a big bucket of clay and he loved to squish it and shape it. every day he would make new clay figures and dreams.

one day, the little boy had an idea. he wanted to make a surprise for his mom. he grabbed a little bit of clay and began to shape it. it was not easy to get the clay to look right, but soon he had made a pretty little flower.

the little boy was very careful not to spoil the flower as he brought it to his mom. she was so happy to see the flower and told the little boy that she would keep it forever.

the little boy had so much fun making clay figures and dreaming. he was so happy that he had been able to make his mom a special gift. he never forgot how much fun he had and he made sure to never spoil his clay time.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lina. lina wanted to be very wealthy when she grew up, but she didn't know how to get there. she asked her parents for advice and they told her that if she tried hard enough, she could succeed.

lina practiced and practiced to make the best of her gifts. she worked hard and eventually became very good at what she did. people told her that she had a special talent.

soon she was able to make money doing something she enjoyed and started to become wealthy. she was very proud of the way she had used her talents to succeed.

lina was now a very wealthy young woman. she wanted to use her wealth and gifts to help others. she started a charity to help others and became a well of knowledge and help to those who needed it. 

from then on, lina was always successful in all of her ventures. she knew that if she worked hard and used her talents, she could succeed and become wealthy.
once upon a time, there was a patch of grass. it was very small and it was in the middle of a big city. the patch was brilliant because it was the only bit of nature in the whole area.
next to the patch, lived a small girl. she was only three years old and loved to play in the grass. she liked to pick the little flowers, and tell stories to the clouds.

but the patch was not always happy, the people around it walked on it, dogs ran on it and it didn't have enough rain. it started to look grey and dull.

one day, the girl decided to help the patch. she went and bought some special things to help it grow back to its brilliant colour. she put some special water and food on the patch, and she planted some new flowers.

then she sat back and waited. a few days later, the patch had grown to be even greener and brighter than before. the little girl was so happy to see the patch back to its old self. she could now relax and play on it everyday.
once upon a time there was a little girl who was full of dreams. every morning she would take a big deep breath and say to herself, "today i will succeed!"

one day, she had a special task - to write with ink. she was a bit scared, as it was her first time using the special ink. but, with a graceful tap of her pen, little drops of ink danced on the paper, creating beautiful letters and words.

the little girl was so proud of herself - she had succeeded! her friends and family all cheered for her when they saw her ink masterpieces.

from then on, the little girl always felt brave and confident in everything she did. whenever she felt unsure, she would remember the ink and knew she could succeed!
once upon a time, there was a little girl who was looking for something fun to do. she went to the park and saw a gigantic cooler. she was very excited and walked toward it. but as she got closer, the cooler started to shake. she was scared so she stepped back. suddenly, the cooler opened and out walked a sour monster! he had long purple arms and tiny green eyes. the little girl was so scared she screamed! but then the monster smiled and said, "don't be scared. i'm in this cooler to keep my cool from the hot sun." the little girl was relieved and asked if she could join him in the cold cooler. the monster said yes and they both stayed inside the cooler all day, talking and laughing. in the end, the little girl and monster were friends for life!
once upon a time there was a girl. she was so careful! one day, the girl went out jogging. she was being so careful not to step in anything bad. as she was jogging, she noticed something strange. it smelled like poison! the girl stopped jogging and stayed very still. she was so careful not to touch it.

the girl saw a frog near the poison. the frog looked very scared. the girl wanted to help the frog. very carefully, she picked the frog up and carried it away from the poison. the girl was so brave and strong.

once the girl had taken the frog away from the poison, she jogged off with it quickly. the frog was so happy and thanked the girl. the girl jogged all the way home. she was so proud that she was able to help the frog!
once upon a time there was a grumpy dog. his name was spike and he never wanted to obey any of the rules. one day his family decided to teach him how to be good.

they took spike to the store and bought him a new collar. they showed him how to walk with it and how to stay close to them when they went on walks. spike didn't like it because it was uncomfortable.

but slowly spike caught on and learned how to obey. he realized that when he followed the rules, his family was happy and he felt better too.

soon spike and his family were very happy. he smiled whenever people told him he was a good boy. he even let kids pet him without growling.

spike had been taught to be a good dog and they all lived happily ever after.
there was a girl called lila and she wanted to go to the city. she had never been there before, so it was so exciting! lila put on her shoes and started to skip. as she skipped along the road, she saw the city in the distance. 

the closer she got, the more miserable she felt. everywhere she looked, there were tall buildings and grey sky's. she wanted to turn back, but she couldn't make herself do it. she walked closer, then started to skip again. 

finally, lila reached the city. it was so much different than she imagined. it was loud and busy. she felt like a stranger in a strange place. she put her hands over her ears, but it still felt so loud. 

lila was miserable. she was so glad when she got back home. she vowed never to skip to the city again. from now on, she'll just have to stay in her own town.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named sally. she loved to dance. every day she would twirl and jump around with joy.

one day, sally heard music coming from a nearby station. she skipped over and saw a big pile of soft pillows. she plopped down and started to dance. she jumped, twirled and laughed with delight. 

soon all the other children joined sally. they twirled and spun together in a circle. everyone was having so much fun! even the birds and the bees were dancing to the music.

when their dance was finished, sally's mother called her home. sally said goodbye to the other children and skipped away. as she walked, she could still feel the rhythm of the music in her heart.
once upon a time there was a brave man who wanted to save the world. he looked high and low until finally he found the perfect place. it was a magical spot that held a secret.

the brave man soon found out that the secret was one of foolishness, and so he decided to take action. he worked hard, both day and night, to save the place. he collected the foolish things and threw them away.

finally the place was saved. everyone in the world was so happy and thankful. they all celebrated the brave man's hard work and praised him for saving their special place.

the end.
once upon a time, there was a rabbit called tony. tony had a prune in his mouth and he was running really fast. he was on his way to a secret hideout he found. it was a big hole in the ground filled with lots of long grass and flowers.

tony loved to have private picnics there and he was so excited to eat his prune in peace. but suddenly he heard a noise! it was a loud sound that disturbed the peacefulness. tony was so scared that he dropped his prune and ran away.

he stopped at the top of a hill and looked back. he just saw a big bird, flapping its wings. tony was so relieved that there was nothing to worry about.

he then went and picked up his prune again and hopped back down the hill. he was so happy he didn't let the noise disturb his special treat.

once there was a little girl called daisy. she was three years old, and she had lots of toys to play with. but the one thing she wanted most of all was a big bottle of shampoo.

everyday daisy asked her mum if she could have the shampoo, but her mum only ever said no. daisy was starting to get angry.

after a while, daisy's mum had had enough and bought her a bottle of shampoo. daisy was very happy and ran to her room. she put the shampoo on the shelf and said it belonged to her.

daisy was so proud to finally have some shampoo. now she could wash her hair every day. from then on, daisy's hair was always nice and clean!
once upon a time, there was a boy who loved to study. he was so curious and loved learning new things. one day, he decided to take a trip to the beach. as he arrived at the beach, he saw how beautiful it was. the sand was so soft, and the waves were so tall. he noticed how flexible the beach was. it was constantly changing, yet had a peaceful feeling.

the boy set down his things, ready to start studying. he opened his book and started reading, but he couldn't help but stop to stare at the beauty of the beach. he saw seagulls swooping down and grabbing fish out of the water. he also noticed that the waves were so powerful.

the boy was so intrigued and mesmerized that he decided to do some beach study. he gathered some shells, rocks, and sand in a bag and examined them closely. he made some beautiful sketches and wrote about how the ocean changed the beach.

the boy continued to study and enjoyed the beach for the rest of the day. he was really grateful for the flexible beach and the knowledge it brought him. he knew he couldn't take it all in, but he was happy with what he had learned. he had a great day of beach study.
once there was a little girl called lucy. she was three years old and liked to play.

one day, lucy wanted to improve her running. she asked her mum if she could. her mum said yes, but they had to wait a while.

so lucy waited and waited. at first, she was excited. but then she got tired and wanted to go and play.

but lucy kept waiting and after a while she started to feel better. she stretched her legs and practiced running up and down.

finally, lucy started to improve. she was so proud and ran faster and faster. she was no longer tired, and had so much fun running around!
one day, a little girl named sarah went outside to play in her backyard. she saw a soccer ball sitting there and she was really excited. she picked it up, and it felt fit in her hands. 

she began to kick the soccer ball. she kicked it hard across the backyard. she kicked it so hard that it went over the fence and she couldn't find it. 

sarah was upset. she wanted her soccer ball back. she called her mom to help her find it. mom looked over the fence and saw the soccer ball. she then pulled it back over the fence to sarah.

sarah was so happy. she hugged her mom, thanked her, and went right back to kicking the soccer ball around in the backyard. she was having so much fun.
once upon a time there was a mommy and a baby. the mommy was so excited because it was time to eat. on the table there was a big bowl of rice. it looked yummy!

the baby said, "rice! rice!" she was so excited.

suddenly a fairy appeared! the fairy was wearing a lovely dress and was very sparkly. the baby couldn't believe it. 

the fairy waved her magic wand and suddenly the rice started to dance! it was so much fun to watch.

the baby said goodbye to the fairy and the fairy flew away. but the baby had a happy memory of the dancing rice.
once there lived a loyal mouse. he had a mustache that was very long and fancy. every day he ate yummies-- things like cheese, crumbs, and popcorn.

one day, he saw something very interesting. it looked like a bigger mustache than his! it twitched, like a tiny animal. he stepped closer and discovered it was in fact a caterpillar!

the mouse was very excited. he offered the caterpillar some of his cheese, and the caterpillar gladly accepted. they became fast friends.

every day, the mouse shared his food with the caterpillar. the caterpillar was very loyal and thankful for the mouse's help.

eventually, the caterpillar grew wings and flew away. but before he left, he showed the mouse how to make his mustache even longer and more fancy. the loyal mouse was very excited, and thanked his friend for the advice.
one day, a little girl was walking in the park with her mom. she saw a big, round balloon in the sky. it was so blue and sparkly that she got so excited! she ran over to it without thinking twice. but then, she saw that the balloon was stuck in the tree. she frowned and looked up in frustration. 

mom saw how upset the little girl was and knew she wanted the balloon. she climbed up the tree and carefully grabbed the balloon. she gave it to her daughter. the little girl smiled, her eyes sparkling with joy. she hugged the balloon and started running in circles around the park, laughing and singing.

the little girl was having so much fun that she forgot about the balloon. suddenly, it popped and flew away. she frowned again and watched it go away, until it became a little blue dot in the sky. she smiled and turned to her mom. she was so happy, no balloon was needed!
once upon a time, there was a little boy named billy. he had a big shiny bike with two pedals. one day, billy wanted to go for a ride outside. he bravely hopped on his bike and began to pedal.

before long, billy was zooming all over the place! he was so excited and he kept pedaling faster and faster. suddenly, he felt frightened. he felt like he was pedaling too fast and didn't feel like he could stop. 

billy looked around and saw a big tree nearby. he steered his bike towards it and drove right into its leafy branches. the leaves softly broke his fall.

he was safe! billy slowly climbed off his bike and brushed the leaves off. then he smiled and slowly began to pedal his way back home. from then on, billy never zoomed quite as fast to make sure he stayed safe.

once upon a time, there was a little girl. her name was jane. she loved to dance.
one day, jane was very upset. she was sad because her mom said she couldn't go play outside.
suddenly, she had an idea. she ran to the kitchen and opened the cupboard. inside, she found a package of spaghetti. she grabbed it and ran back to the living room.

jane put on some music and started to dance with the spaghetti. she twirled and jumped and laughed. she even made shapes with the spaghetti. jane forgot all about her sadness and danced like no one was watching.

after a while, jane got tired and stopped dancing. she put away the spaghetti and smiled. dancing made her feel happy again.
once upon a time there was a little girl called daisy. she had two feet, but one of them was broken. daisy was very sad.

one day, daisy's mum put a new foot in the shopping trolley. when she saw it, daisy was so excited! the new foot was bright and sparkly.

when they got home, daisy's mum helped her to replace the broken foot with the new one. daisy was so happy with her new foot that she was soon running and jumping around the house.

daisy was so excited to finally be able to play with all her friends again. with her new foot, she could do anything she wanted.

the end.
molly was a very curious three-year-old. she wanted to know what was in her family's big blue bin. every time she asked, her mom would just mention that it was a surprise and molly would have to be patient.

one day, molly woke up early and went to take a peek inside the bin. she carefully opened the lid and peered inside. she saw lots of brightly colored shapes, mysterious objects and interesting books. she was so excited to explore the bin and find out all the secrets it held.

molly picked up a book and a familiar voice mentioned her name. she looked up to see her mom smiling back at her. molly's mom had set up a secret treasue hunt inside the bin. all of the shapes, objects and books were clues for molly to find the true surprise in the bin- a new puppy! 

molly was so thrilled her new puppy. she could barely contain her excitement. she hugged her mom in gratitude and went back to exploring the bin with her new puppy. from then on, molly was extra curious whenever her mom mentioned that bin.
once upon a time, there was a little girl who lived on a ranch. every morning, she would go outside and see the wild horses. she loved them, especially the pink one! she wished she could become a horse, so she could run in the fields with them. 

one day, while playing in the fields, the little girl found a magical necklace. it was beautiful, with a single pink gem in the center. she wore it around her neck and suddenly she became a horse! she was so excited that she ran with the wild horses, as fast as she could! 

the little girl and the wild horses explored their ranch together, prancing through the meadows and playing in the streams. they even galloped beneath the stars at night! 

the next morning, the little girl found the necklace again. she put it on, and she became a little girl once more. but she never forgot her adventure on the ranch with the wild horses - especially the pink one!
once upon a time, there was a wealthy family. they had a special day each year, and it was called the parade day. on this day, everyone in the family would come together and let a parade happen. 

the family dressed up in bright colors and wore fancy hats. everyone had a special treat to eat, like jelly beans and cake. the children were so excited!

the parade was great fun. everyone was happy and laughing. they sang songs, waved flags, and cheered. some people in the parade had funny looks on their faces. 

after the parade, they all had a picnic in the park. the kids played tag and the grown-ups had fun talking. everyone felt so happy and free. 

the parade day was a wonderful time for the family. they cherished the memories and looked forward to coming together each year. they let the parade be a time that brought them joy and celebration.

the reliable balloon had something special. it had a message on it. this message said "happy birthday". such a special message was worth showing off!

so the reliable balloon decided to proudly display itself. it flew around for everyone to see. it had never felt so special before.

but soon people started talking about the reliable balloon. it looked like it was time for a celebration. everyone started singing happy birthday and blowing up lots of colourful balloons. 

the reliable balloon was very happy. after all its hard work it was finally getting the recognition it deserved. it was like a dream come true.

one evening, she was feeling especially independent. she decided to not ask for any help, but to do it all by herself. she thought and thought until she had made a plan for dinner. she got all the food out of the fridge and cupboards and set to work, cutting, stirring and mixing.

after many minutes of hard work, the little girl had cooked a delicious dinner. she was very proud of her work and sat down to enjoy her meal, feeling independent and strong.
once upon a time, there was a poor little girl. she wanted a wagon more than anything, but she didn't have enough money to buy one. every day she would look at the store window and wish for a wagon, but still she couldn't afford it.

one day, she had an idea. day after day, she saved her pocket money until finally she had enough money to buy a wagon. she ran to the store and bought the wagon she'd seen in the window. 

she was so excited to have her own wagon! she started pushing it around the house and the garden, singing with joy. everyone in the neighbourhood started to hear of the poor little girl who had gained a wagon. 

the little girl was happy with her wagon every day. she filled it with all her toys and even took it down the street with her. everywhere she went, she could be seen pushing her wagon. 

the poor little girl who had gained a wagon was never seen without a smile.
once upon a time there was a little boat. it liked to pass the harbor. every day it sailed by, looking out for its friends.

one day it noticed something unusual. another boat was in the harbor. it was a bigger boat and it was very restless. the little boat was worried.

suddenly the little boat had an idea! it went closer to the harbor and waved hello to the bigger boat. the bigger boat looked surprised and waved back. the two boats started to have a chat.

the bigger boat was going on a long journey and it was feeling lonely. the little boat was happy to help and offered to pass by the harbor every day to keep the bigger boat company. the bigger boat accepted the offer and was very happy.

the two boats became good friends and looked forward to seeing each other every day while they both passed the harbor. they were very content with the arrangement.

once upon a time, there was a girl named anna. she was three years old and liked to polish things. one day, there was a hurricane coming and anna had to go inside. she looked out the window and saw everything outside was empty. she was scared of the hurricane.

but then anna had an idea! she ran to the kitchen and grabbed a can of polish. then she ran to her grandpa's room. she started to polish his big chair, so it was super shiny.

after she was done, anna felt much better. she was no longer scared of the hurricane. she knew that polishing things helped make them look better, and she even made her grandpa's chair look extra special. the storm passed by quickly, and everyone was happy and safe. the end.
molly was a young girl who loved to write. one day she decided to write a story about a jellyfish. she grabbed a piece of paper and a gray crayon. she started writing about how the jellyfish sparkled in the sun. she drew pictures of it in the water with the gray crayon. molly wanted to write more, so she added that the jellyfish had little tentacles that moved around. when she finished writing, molly smiled because she had written a wonderful story about a jellyfish.
sammy was playing in the backyard when it started to rain. he ran inside to the laundry room and saw his mom. she was washing the dark laundry in the big sink. sammy's mom smiled and said, "come help me wash the laundry, sammy!" so he ran to her, took off his shoes, and jumped into the sink. he grabbed a wet pair of pants and scrubbed and scrubbed until the pants were clean. mom put the clean, dark laundry into the basket and said, "good job, sammy! you helped me wash the laundry." sammy smiled and said, "let's do it again!"
once upon a time, there was a fat bunny. he was hopping around and having lots of fun. but then one day, he was caught by a big mean jailer. he was put in a jail with no windows or doors.

the poor bunny was so scared. he tried to hide from the jailer, but the jailer found him and put him in jail. but then something magical happened. the bunny wiggled his nose and all of a sudden everything was frozen! no one was moving, not even the jailer!

the bunny saw his chance. he quickly hopped out of his jail, and ran off into the forest where he was free again. he was so happy. life was good, and he never ended up in jail again.
once upon a time there was a little girl. she was three years old and very hot. she was so hot she had to take medicine. 

the medicine made her feel better. she did not mind taking it at all. she started to feel cool and happy. 

she went outside to play with her friends. they laughed and talked and had a good time. they played hide and seek and chased each other around.

then it began to get hot again. she knew it was time to take more medicine. she did not mind at all, she was happy to take the medicine. 

the medicine made her feel cool and happy again. she went out to play with her friends and have fun. she was so glad she had the medicine to keep her cool. 

the end
one day, two friends decided to go on an adventure.
they grabbed their big map, and took off.
they started walking and soon, the sun was high in the sky.
it was very hot, so they took a break.
they looked at the map and decided to keep going.
before long, they had gone through the woods and found a big lake.
they both took off their shoes and went swimming.
then they took some food and ate it by the lake.
it was a great day, and it ended with them looking at the starry sky.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named emma. emma had always wanted to be able to take pictures of all the wonderful things she saw each day.

one day, she asked her mom if she could have her very own camera. her mom said yes and gave her a beautiful pink camera. emma was so proud that she decided to go outside and take pictures of everything she saw.

first, she saw a pit full of bugs crawling around. she wanted to take a picture of the bugs, so she put her camera up to her eye and pressed the record button. she had taken her very first picture!

she kept taking pictures of all the things she came across - flowers, trees, birds, squirrels and more. by the end of the day, she had taken lots of pictures and was very proud of her work.

the next day, emma looked through all the pictures she had taken the day before. she was so proud of the pictures she had captured and could not believe she had taken them herself. emma knew that she had a special gift - she could record all the beautiful things in life!
once upon a time, there was a wild smelly bear who liked to explore. he would travel for many days, sometimes even weeks, before he returned to his cozy cave in the forest. 

every time he returned home, he was always excited to find something new. he often found strange places and things that made him happy. one day, he decided to travel farther than usual, away from his home, to discover something special.

as he roamed, the wild smelly bear found a delicious berry bush and decided to stay and eat some of the yummy fruit. after eating all of the berries, the bear was so full that he decided to take a nap in a sunny clearing.

when the bear woke up, it was dark outside and he realized it was time to return home. he ran and ran, until he eventually arrived back at his nice, cozy cave. the bear was so happy to be home, he smiled and curled up to take another nap. 

the end!
once upon a time, there was a girl who had a surprise in a case. she was so excited to open it to find out what was inside.

inside the case, she found a helpful doll. it had a pretty dress, a shiny smile and friendly eyes. it was the most helpful doll she had ever seen.

the girl was so happy and she hugged the doll tight. she played with it until bedtime and knew that it would be her best friend.

from then on, the girl and her helpful doll were inseparable. they played together every day and had lots of fun!
once upon a time, there was a little girl walking by a field. she came across a large number of animals who were struggling. the little girl felt sorry for the animals, so she went over to help them. she worked tirelessly to try and make their lives better. 

after a while, the little girl got tired and felt very dizzy. she plopped onto the ground and took a quick break, which seemed like forever. 

soon enough, she was feeling better and was able to help the animals again. she worked together with them to solve the problems they were facing. together they felt like a big happy family. 

the animals thanked the little girl for all of her help and told her that she had made a huge difference. she smiled, happy to have done something good, and waved goodbye to all of her animal friends. 

the little girl had worked very hard and achieved a great number of successes for the animals. she had worked so hard, and it made her so proud.
once upon a time there was a little girl named sue. sue really wanted to improve her house, so she decided to paint her toilet! she got the paint from the store and she made it a lovely bright blue. 

sue was very proud of her new toilet and she invited all her friends over to admire it. even sue's mom and dad were impressed by the paint job!

sue's mom was so happy that she decided to make everyone a very tasty treat as a reward. she made a big cake with lots of sprinkles, and everyone ate it up with joy.

sue was so proud of her improved house, and her sister was so happy too. they decided that they would help the rest of the family improve their homes too. sue and her sister had made their home much better and brighter!
lily was very excited, because today she was going for a drive. she had never been in a car before and she couldn't wait to see what it was like.

lily's mom helped her into the car. she fastened the seatbelt around lily and then she got in the driver's seat. lily watched out the window as they drove. she saw lots of nice things.

they drove past a park, with lots of flowers and trees. they drove over a bridge and saw boats floating in the river. lily waved hi to all the people.

finally, lily's mom pulled up in front of a big house. lily smiled when she saw it; it was so nice! lily's mom helped her out of the car and they went inside together.

lily had had the best time on her drive. she couldn't wait to go on another one soon!
once upon a time, there were two brothers who lived in the same house. the oldest brother was named jack, and he was very proud of that. his younger brother, jason, was a bit jealous. 

one day, jack found a funny root in the garden. he thought it looked like a face and it made him laugh. he showed it to jason and soon both of them were laughing and having fun together. 

after a while, jason wanted the funny root for himself. he wanted it because jack had found it first and he was jealous. jack could see that jason wanted the root and he decided to let him have it. 

the little brothers hugged each other when jack gave jason the funny root, and they both laughed and laughed.
once upon a time there was a little girl who wanted to go faster. she asked her mom if she could run and her mom said yes. so the girl started running as fast as she could and she was going so fast it was like she was flying. all of her friends were so amazed and excited.

suddenly, she stopped running. she had remembered that she was supposed to be calm and peaceful like her mom had told her. she felt a little bit ashamed that she had forgotten and gone so fast.

but even though she felt ashamed, she was still proud of how fast she had gone. that night, when she went to bed, she had a dream that she was back at the park, running and flying as fast as the wind. she felt so peaceful and happy in the dream. 

the next day when she woke up, she still remembered how peaceful and happy she had felt in her dream. she knew that she can still have her speed and her peace â€“ she just needs to remember when to go fast and when to slow down.
once upon a time, there was a big blueberry. it was in a pond and wanted to swim. but it couldn't swim without help.

lucky for the blueberry, there was a very helpful fish living in the pond. he saw the blueberry and wanted to help it. the fish used its fins to push the blueberry through the water.

the fish and the blueberry swam around the pond together. they had lots of fun. after a while, the blueberry grew a bit too tired to keep swimming. the fish said goodbye and swam away.

the blueberry found a sunny rock to rest on. it felt warm and peaceful and the blueberry was happy. the end.
once upon a time there was a dependable dog named spot. spot had lots of fun each day, but his favorite time was when his owner gave him a loving touch. spot could feel the softness and love of his owner's touch.

one day spot saw something lovely he had never seen before. it was very colorful. spot decided he wanted to touch it. he slowly reached out his paw and when it made contact, he felt something familiar. he felt the same loving touch that he felt when his owner would pet him. 

spot was so happy! he knew his owner's touch was dependable. spot had found a wonderful color that also gave him a loving touch. he knew that color would remind him of his owner's love every time he saw it.
once upon a time, there was a small girl called lily. she was always in such a rush and was always running around. one day, lily's mom and dad told her about a holiday. it was a big, special adventure and she was so excited.

lily and her parents got ready for their holiday and set off. they drove in their car at a very slow pace and eventually arrived at the beach. the waves were so gentle, the sun was shining and the sand felt baby-soft, like a cloud beneath their feet.

lily loved running around in the sand. but then something funny happened; her dad started walking backwards! lily was so surprised and clapped her hands. she watched her dad seeing everything in reverse, and it made her giggle.

lily then tried walking backwards herself and it felt so strange but fun. the holiday was so special and she loved spending slow times with her parents. eventually the holiday ended, but lily will never forget the day.
once there was a pig named fred. he was very hungry and looked for something to eat. he saw a big red barn and wanted to go inside to find something to eat. but when he got to the door, he found it was locked. he asked the farmer for food. but the farmer refused. he said that he was not allowed to give food to animals from the barn.

so fred decided to look for food somewhere else. he went to the farmer's garden and found some delicious fruits and vegetables. he was so excited that he made a big feast! he was so happy that he did not even care that the farmer had refused him.

but suddenly, he heard a noise. it was the farmer, and he was not happy. "what are you doing in my garden? you must get out!" the farmer shouted. but fred refused. he said he was still very hungry. the farmer was surprised and finally agreed to let fred stay and eat.

fred was very happy. now he could eat until he was full. he thanked the farmer and went back to his barn, his tummy full and happy.

the garden looked so much better now. the girl was very proud of what she had done. she promised to always look after the garden from now on.

once upon a time, there was a frightened leopard. he was always afraid of things in the jungle. one day, he decided to pay a visit to his friend, the elephant. as he was walking, he heard a loud noise. he got so scared that he ran away as fast as he could.

when he reached the elephant's house, he was relieved. he told the elephant about the noise and the elephant said that he was not in danger. the elephant suggested that they pay a visit to the lion, the king of the jungle. 
 
the leopard was very nervous about meeting the lion, but the elephant said that it would be okay. so, the leopard and the elephant went to meet the lion. when they arrived, the lion welcomed them warmly. he said that he appreciated the leopard coming to meet him and gave him a big hug. 

the leopard was no longer frightened. he had made a new friend and learned that paying a visit to those you are afraid of can be a good thing.
once upon a time there was a happy little three year old girl. her name was jane. jane loved to play and explore. one day jane stumbled upon a huge and mysterious maze. she was excited to explore it. she wandered the paths and around the corners for hours, looking for a way out. along the way, she met a humble old man and room full of animals. 

the old man smiled and said: "little one, the way out of the maze is the way you came. look for it." jane was confused and asked the old man: "how can i find my way out?"

the old man replied: "be patient, follow your heart and trust in yourself. you will find the way out. look carefully at the paths and be humble". jane was determined and brave, she searched the maze and finally found the way out! she was so proud of her little humble self. jane would never forget her adventure in the maze.

the fog was very thin and looked like a white cloud. it was also very soft and mysterious. bob was curious and wanted to touch the fog. so they both walked closer and bob reached out his hand. as bob touched it, the fog felt cold and made his hand wet.

bob was very surprised. he had never felt anything like this before. it was like a secret, hidden in the sky. he and his mummy watched the fog for a while, until it slowly disappeared. 

bob and his mummy were both very happy to have seen the fog and bob was so excited to learn something new. he kept asking questions about it for the rest of the day.

daisy looked around. she saw a pile of boxes. daisy stacked the boxes one on top of the other. she did it one by one. soon, daisy was tall enough to reach the switch. she stretched out and flipped the switch.

suddenly, the room lit up! daisy was so happy. she was proud of herself for staying calm. with her good problem-solving skills, she was able to reach the switch and light up the room. daisy smiled and skipped away.

on the next day, lots of bugs and animals came to the grill's party. they laughed and had a great time! they jumped and ran around the grill and sang happy songs.

once upon a time there was a girl called sally. sally was three years old and was very excited one morning because she was going to have a bath. she jumped into the bathtub and lay there in the warm, soapy water. she splashed about, enjoying the feeling of the bubbles on her skin.

but then things changed. sally got an anxious feeling in her tummy. she started to feel scared as she lay there in her bath, and she didn't know why. she looked around the bathroom, but nothing seemed to be wrong.

suddenly, sally's mummy came and knelt down beside the bathtub. she told sally not to worry, and gave her a big, warm hug. she reminded sally that she was always there, to give her love and keep her safe.

so sally put on a brave face and finished her bath. afterwards, she felt much better. with her mummy's help, she had defeated her anxious feeling. and she had had a fun, bubbly time in the bathtub.
once there lived two brothers. one was named shaun and one was named joe. they were very different, but they always got along. one day joe was feeling nervous. he was looking for something, but he didn't know what it was. 

so, he went to find his brother shaun and asked for help. shaun was very clever and thought he might be able to solve the mystery. so, shaun and joe went to search for the answer. 

they went to a nearby well and chose the biggest copper coin they could find. they dropped it inside and waited to see what would happen. after a few moments, a message came out of the well and told them the answer they had been looking for. 

joe was so excited and shaun felt very proud of himself for helping his brother solve the mystery. they hugged each other happily and continued on their way. 

the brothers enjoyed the rest of their day and never forgot how they solved the mystery with the help of the well.

shannon smiled, happy to have the warmth, and the two kept on walking. after a few moments, they arrived at their destination. it was a big field with lots of toys in organized sections. shannon squealed with joy and ran forward, eager to start playing. mrs. smith followed closely behind her with a big smile!
once upon a time, there was a little girl. she had curly hair and loved to explore. every morning she would go out into her garden and find something new.

one day, while the girl was playing, she saw a big, juicy apple on the ground. she picked it up and wanted to eat it right away. but it was too big! so she ran into the kitchen and asked her mom, "please can i have a piece of the apple?" her mom smiled and cut the apple into pieces. the girl took a bite and it was so tasty!

the girl ate her apple and thought of other tasty treats she could make. she asked her mom, "please, can i make some cookies?" her mom said yes and the girl got to work. she gathered ingredients and mixed them together. soon, delicious chocolate chip cookies were in the oven.

the girl smiled as she pulled the cookies out of the oven. they smelled so yummy and tasted even better. she shared them with her mom, who said they were the best cookies she had ever tried.

the little girl was so happy and proud of herself! from that day on she loved to explore her garden and make tasty treats.
once there was a swan who was very different than the other swans. he had big bright feathers, but he never talked like the other swans. he was very sad and stayed alone.

one day, a little girl saw the swan. it looked so lonely, so the little girl decided to comfort it. she brought it some food and sang it a special song.

the swan was so happy to have a friend! he waggled his feathers and started to eat. the little girl smiled and stroked the swan's feathers.

the little girl went back to see the swan every day, bringing it food and singing her special song. the swan was so happy to have a friend that it stopped feeling so alone and different. 

the little girl and the swan were the best of friends and the little girl comforted the swan every day.
once there was a happy little girl. her name was jenny and she loved to watch the birds in the sky. every morning she would go outside with her mother and they would talk, watch the birds, and pick flowers.

one day, jenny went outside and noticed something strange. she saw a thief trying to steal her mother's flowers. jenny was so scared, she ran back inside and told her mother.

her mother smiled and said, "it's ok my jenny. we will own these flowers and nobody will ever be able to take them away." she looked around and saw some other gardens with flowers too. then she said, "let's pick some from those gardens and we will own those too."

so jenny and her mother went around to all the gardens and picked some of the flowers. they brought them back to the house and everyone was so happy. jenny's mum had enough flowers to share with everyone in the neighbourhood.

the thief never tried to steal any more flowers from the neighbourhood again. jenny and her mother owned all the flowers and everyone was happy.
once upon a time there was a little fish who wanted to come and see the world. but the world was a big and difficult place and he was scared to come. every night he would look at the stars, dreaming of what it could be like outside the pond.

then one day his best friend the bee came over and told him the news. he said that if the little fish came with him, he could show him the beautiful world outside their pond.

the little fish was so excited that he swam as fast as he could to come with the bee. when he came to the top of the water, he saw a world that was so much bigger than his pond! there were trees, and clouds and even other fish!

little fish was so happy that he wanted to stay forever. he thanked his best friend the bee and promised to come back and visit often.

the little fish still comes back to visit his pond, but now he knows that the world is a special and beautiful place. and he will never forget how difficult it was to make the journey out of the pond.

he was walking and looking around when he noticed something strange. he saw a big barrel and he thought it was weird. he walked up to it and touched it. suddenly, he heard a big sigh!

jack wondered what made the sigh. he was so curious. as he got closer and looked inside the barrel he saw a creature.
jack was so surprised! he never seen something like it before. it was weird.

the creature asked jack if he wanted to play. jack was a little scared but was excited too. he said yes and they both giggled and had lots of fun playing together.

jack promised he will come back soon and they said their goodbyes. jack promised he would never forget his new friend in the weird barrel.

the bunny took a bite and it tasted so sweet! he enjoyed every single bite until there was nothing left. the bunny was so happy, he hopped away with a smile on his face.

the end.

they were very unhappy and didn't know what to do so they asked their friends for help. one friend had an idea to make a new machine to keep everyone safe. everyone was excited and started building the machine together. 

finally, after a lot of hard work, the new machine was finished. everyone cheered and the people were so happy to have a safe machine that would keep them safe again. everyone congratulated each other for their hard work and celebrated with a big party.

once upon a time there was a little girl who was very frightened. she heard scary noises and was scared of being alone. when she saw it was dark outside, she quickly ran back into her house.

inside the house, the little girl searched for her mum but couldn't find her. she was very sad, but she knew she must make a plan. she ran to her bedroom and decided to take a nap.

the little girl fell asleep, but then suddenly heard a loud noise. she was so scared that she hid under the bed. when she looked outside the window, she saw a fire! she knew someone must save her!

luckily, a friendly fire fighter was there and he put out the fire. he saved the little girl from the flames and brought her back to her mum. they were both very happy and hugged each other.

from then on, they always stayed together so the little girl never had to be scared again.

at the top, the gentle spider noticed the most amazing view! she was so happy that she had asked her question. she stayed a while and enjoyed the beautiful sight.

then she smiled, and slowly climbed back down the tree. she could now answer the question she had asked. the gentle spider was very proud!

the soup smelled delicious! mama put a big bowl on the table and the family gathered around to enjoy it. they all ate it with big spoons. the soup was nice and hot and a little spicy.

when everyone had finished eating, mama filled the bowl with warm soapy water. she passed it around the table and everyone took turns washing their spoons.

when they had all rinsed their spoons off, mama closed the bowl and put it away. everyone praised her for her delicious spicy soup. the family all had a special moment and smiled.
