one day, a little girl found something perfect in the ground. it was a shiny, silver tap. she was so happy and couldn't believe her luck. she wanted to keep it, so she took a big spoon and dug a hole in the ground. she put the tap inside and then filled the hole back up. she called it "burying the tap". 

the little girl was very proud of herself. she had buried the tap all by herself, and it was so perfect. she had kept it safe and nobody else could have it. she ran back home to tell her mommy and daddy all about it.

the next day, the girl went back to the spot where she had buried the tap. to her surprise, the tap was gone. where could it have gone? she looked and looked but couldn't find it anywhere. she was very sad, but then realized that this was part of the game of burying the tap. she was glad that she had buried it so that it could find a new home.
once upon a time, there was a happy little rabbit called fluffy. he lived in the woods on a bright, sunny day.

fluffy loved to dance. he would hop around, spin and twirl and jump in the air. everyone in the woods thought he was so funny, watching him dance and showing off his moves.

but one day, fluffy was feeling a bit uncomfortable. he couldn't get his dance just right and he didn't feel happy like he usually did.

so, he decided to take a break. he found a nice, quiet spot in the woods and curled up to have a nap. suddenly, as he was dozing off, he heard a strange sound! it was a tune and it was coming from nearby.

fluffy hopped out of his resting spot and followed the music. as he got closer, he saw something amazing! there was a group of other rabbits dancing together!

fluffy couldn't believe his eyes. he wanted to join in and dance with the others. so, he put on a brave face and joined the fun. he found he was able to do all the moves with the others and had a great time.

the other rabbits were so happy to have fluffy join them and he never felt uncomfortable again. from then on, every time the sun shone, fluffy and his new friends would dance in the woods together, having the best time ever!
one day, a little child was walking in the park and came across another child. the other child was very bossy and kept telling the first child what to do. the first child didn't like this very much. so they kicked the bossy child and ran away.

the bossy child chased after the first child, but the first child was faster. they ran and ran and eventually stopped in a grassy field. when the bossy child caught up, the first child was ready. they kicked again and the bossy child ran away!

the first child was happy, but then they heard a cooing sound. it was a baby bird! the first child carefully kicked the ground in front of it, and the little bird flew away out of the field. 

the child watched it go, feeling glad they had helped. they felt proud and ready to do more good deeds. 

the end.

when jack got to the end of the street, he felt much better. he looked around and he saw a big park. there were trees and swings, and it was so much nicer than the modern building. jack knew it was a safe place, so he decided to stay and play. 

jack spent the whole afternoon playing games in the park. he forgot all about the people he had seen and the thing he hated. all was well.

when he woke up, the sun was shining and the sky was blue. it was no longer gloomy! he looked around, his car was still parked on the pillow. billy smiled and hopped in his car. he drove away with a happy heart.

the end.

sam quickly turned it around. he was so embarrassed but he felt better when his friends stopped laughing. he knew it was important to always be organized so this wouldn't happen again. he put the shirt back in his drawer and made sure it was correctly facing forward. 

with his shirt now on the right way around, sam was ready to start a great day at school.

tommy's face lit up. he realized that stretching was almost like a kind of cocoa for your body! he smiled and nodded eagerly.

so the girl leaned in close and gave the boy a big kiss on his face. the boy was so happy, he smiled and hugged her. 

the girl was glad she kissed him and everything was good again.

she stepped up on one side of the beam and carefully balanced her way across. she was surprised at how good she was. 

but then she heard someone clapping. molly looked down and saw a judge smiling at her. she was even more surprised. 

the judge said, "you did an excellent job balancing! you should enter the balance competition next week." 

molly was really excited. she said she would definitely enter. she couldn't wait to show how independent and strong she was. 

the next week, she entered the competition. she balanced her way across the beam just like she did before. everyone clapped and cheered. the judge was very pleased. he gave molly a blue ribbon for being the best balancer in the competition. 

molly was so proud of herself. she was happy she could balance so gracefully and independently. she was so proud that a judge noticed her skill and gave her a reward. 

from then on, molly kept practicing her balancing. she was proud of how far she had come.

then, something very special happened. the phone stopped moving and started speaking a friendly voice. it was a friendly voice saying, "hello! is anybody there?". 

the little 3 year old was surprised. she had never seen a phone move around before. she answered the friendly voice and asked what was happening. 

the friendly voice explained that somebody was calling from far away. they wanted to wish the 3 year old a very happy day. everyone was so excited!

the bad man felt happy. he smiled for the first time in days. he jumped in the water and soaked up the sun. he swam in the water for hours and felt so clean and refreshed.

the bad man thanked the cloud for bringing the water and wrapped himself up in a big, warm towel. he no longer felt bad and went on his way feeling happy and refreshed.

the rabbit had never seen meat so big before and he was so excited. he grabbed the meat and quickly started to munch it all up. he was so happy and couldn't believe his luck. 

but then the rabbit heard a loud noise. he looked up and saw a farmer coming towards him. the farmer was not happy about the rabbit eating his meat and he started to shout. the rabbit was so scared he quickly hopped away and never came back. 

the rabbit had been very foolish to trust such a surprise, but it taught him a valuable lesson- never trust anything that looks too good to be true!

every day they did fun things together. they jumped, they raced and they even sang songs.

but then one day the caterpillar started to rot. the sunflower was so sad to see its friend getting smaller, but it stayed and watched over it until all the rot was gone.

the sunflower and the butterfly were so happy to be together again, they flew off into the sky to explore the world.

after lunch, anna and her parents went for a swim in the pool. she enjoyed feeling the water all around her and it made her stronger.

at the end of the day, anna felt strong and proud. playing with weights and running in the park had helped her feel more powerful, and she was glad that she was enjoying doing new things.

when rob got to the store, he saw something even better than incredible - two identical puppies! they were twins, and the boy thought they were the most perfect puppies ever. 

rob asked the storekeeper if he could buy the twins. the storekeeper said "yes" and asked how much money he had. rob pulled out his piggybank and emptied it on the counter. he had enough money to buy both puppies! 

rob was so happy to take his twins home. he loved them so much that he named them incredible and perfect. 

from then on, rob and his incredible twins had lots of fun adventures together. they even became best friends!
once upon a time, there was a little girl named anna. she was 3 years old. one day, anna came to an old fireplace. she was very excited and said: "i'm ready to snap!" she got on her tippy toes and stretched out her hands. snap! anna clapped her hands together and little sparks started to fly out of the fireplace. she laughed as she watched the tiny glimmering lights flutter in the air. 

anna felt happy, so she kept clapping her hands. snap! another burst of sparks flew from the fireplace. now many of them were dancing around the room. anna kept clapping and the room became brighter and brighter with each snap she made. 

anna was having so much fun that she didn't want to stop. but soon, she got tired and had to rest. she looked back and smiled. fireplace was beautiful. anna had made it all with her little snaps. she was proud and ready for more adventures.
jack loved to play with his blocks. he had a big pile of them and he was so excited to build things. every day, he would gather the blocks and create something new.

one day, jack's mom noticed something. jack's blocks were getting dirty. she knew what to do - she gave jack a rag and some water, and told him to wipe them.

at first, jack didn't understand what she meant, but then he realized she wanted him to clean the blocks. he was very excited to do it. 

so jack dipped the rag into the water and started wiping the blocks. he worked very carefully and soon his blocks were all clean and shiny. his mom was so happy and proud, and gave him a hug. 

jack was so thankful to have such a reliable mom that helped him take care of his toys. from then on, he was determined to always keep them clean and take care of them himself.

once upon a time there was a big, roaring lion. he was brave and fierce, and he lived far away in a distant forest. 
one day the lion was feeling a bit sick, so he went to the doctor. the doctor gave him some magic powder and told him it would make him better.

the lion was so excited to try it, he drank the whole thing down in one gulp! and what do you know, it worked!

the lion felt much better, and he roared so loud that it shook the tall trees and scared away all the birds. he was feeling so strong and healthy that he decided to thank the doctor.

so off went the lion, bounding through the trees and soaring through the air as he made his way back to the doctor's hut. when he got there, the doctor was so happy to see him looking so well. 

the lion thanked the doctor for the magic powder and then, with a hearty "roar", he bounded off into the distant forest, free and strong, ready to enjoy the rest of his day.

once upon a time, there was a barber who was very careless. he was always in a rush and he never paid attention to what he was doing. one day, he was giving a haircut to a little boy. he was passing the scissors over the boy's hair, but he wasn't really looking and the scissors slipped, giving the boy a bad cut on the side of his head. 

the boy started to cry and the barber felt very sorry for what he had done. he told the boy that he was sorry and he gave him an extra big piece of candy to make him feel better. then, he called his mom and explained what had happened. she was so upset that she ran to the barber's shop and she made him promise to be more careful from now on.

the barber learned his lesson and from that day on, he was very careful whenever he was giving someone a haircut. he made sure to pay attention and take his time. he was never careless again!
once upon a time, there was a girl who was very attractive. her name was sally. one day, she stumbled while walking in the park. she was very surprised and stopped to take a look at what she stumbled on. it was a big, juicy juicy apple. she smiled and picked it up. 

sally was very thirsty so she took a bite of the juicy apple. it was so juicy and sweet. she quickly ate the apple and started to look around for more food. she found a jar of juice nearby and grabbed it. 

sally opened the jar and started to drink. it tasted so good! she drank the juice until it was all gone. as she wiped her mouth, she noticed that other people were walking by and they were all looking at her with a smile. 

sally was happy and jumped around. she felt so attractive again and started to dance in the park. people were clapping and laughing as they watched her dance. 

sally was so happy and she stumbled around the park until the sun started to go down. she waved goodbye to her new friends and went home for the night. from then on, she was sure to always stumble on something tasty and attractive!

when they arrived, rita's mum told her that she had to be careful and stay away from the heavy weights and machinery that the gym had. rita promised to listen and her mum gave her permission to start.

rita was very happy. she jumped, skipped and crawled all around the gym. whenever she felt like it, she stopped to do some stretches or hop on the trampoline. everyone at the gym was impressed with how well she was listening to her mum and staying away from the weights and machines.

after a few hours, rita and her mum said goodbye to everyone at the gym and went home. rita fell asleep on the taxi ride back and had lots of fun dreams. every time she thought of the gym and all the fun she had, she smiled from ear to ear. it was a day to remember!

it was a bright and sunny day, and the little birds were chirping in the trees. everywhere, animals were waking up and getting ready to start their day.

one little squirrel was particularly excited. it was time to celebrate! he gathered up his family and some of the other animals, and all of them excitedly scampered over to the clearing near the tree.

when they arrived, the squirrels family broke open their acorns and shared them with everyone. they were sweet and delicious, and everyone had a great time eating them.

after everyone was finished, the little squirrels family taught everyone the 'nut shuffle'. they showed how to do the dancing steps and everyone followed along. everyone laughed and cheered as they all danced around in a circle.

when everyone was exhausted from the nut shuffle, they all agreed it was one of the best celebrations ever! they had fun playing, eating, and dancing together in the harmless way of nature. all of the animals smiled in awe of the beauty of nature and its celebration of life.

when the girl got close to the laser, it was spinning around in a circle. she reached out and caught it. she was so happy!

the elderly man smiled and said, "good job! now we have to hurry back home." so they both ran back home and the girl took her new laser with her. she hugged the elderly man goodbye and thanked him for helping her catch the laser.

they eventually became very close and the panda was no longer lonely or sad. she never had to worry about anything because she knew her bear friend was always there to protect her.

the bird flew down to the cat and said, â€œi was spraying the leaves so they look nice and shiny. would you like to help me?â€ so they both started spraying the leaves.

after they were done, the tree had rainbow leaves with lots of sparkles! it was so funny and pretty. the cat and the bird were very happy with their work and they did a happy dance together.

the end.

she looked around, but she couldn't see anything that would make her afraid. but then she noticed something sparkling on the ground. it was a beautiful bracelet! she was so excited; she picked it up and put it on her wrist.

but then, to daisy's surprise, the bracelet started to tremble. at first, daisy was scared. but then she realised that the bracelet was shaking because it was lonely and wanted a friend too.

so daisy held the bracelet and both of them stopped trembling. daisy was so happy, she had a friend! from then on, daisy and her bracelet were the best of friends, and neither of them ever felt lonely again.

the twig was very dirty and covered in mud. the bird was sad and tried to clean the twig and make it look nice. he used water and special cleaning tools to make it shiny again.

finally, the twig looked clean and sparkly. the bird was so excited he spread his wings and flew around. he showed the twig to all of the birds and animals in the forest. everyone admired the twig and said it was very pretty.

the bird was very happy now. he flew home with the twig and placed it in his nest. it was safe and sound now, and he was very proud of his work. from that day on, all the animals in the forest admired his shiny twig.
once upon a time, there was a bossy flower. every day, the flower would stand tall and expect everyone to look at her. she was proud of her beautiful petals, which bloomed in all sorts of colours.

one day, the wind started to blow. the flower felt excited - she loved when the wind blew! before she knew it, a wave had carried her away. soon, the flower was floating in the air, high above the ground.

the flower drifted and floated, until finally the wave carried her very far away. soon, the flower saw a large, sparkling lake. the wave carried her right up to the shore and dropped her softly onto the ground.

the flower was happy to see the lake - it was so pretty! the sun made the water sparkle and she felt like she was in a magical place. from that day on, the flower stayed near the lake, so she could enjoy its beauty.

and every day, the bossy flower would bloom in joy, to show her appreciation for this special place.

the girl then went back to the house and put on her dress. she was very happy to wear the new dress with the number. she went outside and tried to find the hairy dog.

she looked for the dog for a long time, but it seemed to have disappeared. finally, she saw it again. this time, the dog was lying down in the shade.

the girl went closer and asked if the dog wanted to be her friend. the dog wagged its tail and said yes.

from then on, the little girl and the hairy dog were very good friends. they played and ran around together every day. what a great friendship they had!
once upon a time, there was a boat. it was empty but the sea was nice and blue.

one day, a little girl got on the boat. she was so happy to be sailing and saw the world around her. suddenly, the sky changed from blue to grey. storm clouds were forming and the sea started to move.

the little girl was scared, but she stayed in the boat. it started bouncing up and down and she could feel the wind. the waves got bigger and bigger and the boat continued to rock.

finally, the storm passed and the little girl was relieved. the sea turned back to blue and she was safe. now, the boat was not empty anymore: the little girl was inside and the adventure had just begun!
once upon a time, there was a boy called jim. jim was only three years old and he was worried because he wanted to iron his mum's dress.

he asked his mum where the iron was. his mum reached high up and got it down from the top shelf. it was big and the handle was long.

jim looked at the iron and he was worried because it was so big. his mum smiled and told him not to worry. she helped him plug in the iron, switch it on and showed him how it worked.

jim was so happy that he could help iron his mum's dress. he smiled as he ironed and even though the iron was big, he wasn't worried anymore.
once upon a time there lived a little monkey in a beautiful jungle. he was so excited to go outside and explore! but as he was taught by his parents, he needed to wait. he had to delay his adventure because his mom said it was not safe.

soon, he was surrounded by other little animals in the jungle. there were rabbits, foxes, deer, and even bigger animals like tigers and elephants. the little monkey was so curious he just couldn't wait anymore! he wanted to see and explore the jungle.

the little monkey ventured out, hiding behind trees and bushes to avoid the big animals. the sun was shining and it was a beautiful day. he made friends with the animals and soon discovered wonderful things in the jungle. there were caves, fruit trees, and rippling streams, and it was all so exciting!

the little monkey stayed all day exploring the jungle. as the sun began to set and the sky became dark his mom called. she had been waiting for some time, but was very proud and happy to see the little monkey explore with the animals.

she sang a song about the colour of rainbows and sunshine and the sound of laughter. she twirled around and around in joy. everyone who heard her song smiled and clapped. 

lucy was overjoyed and ran off to play. she was so happy and she kept singing her song all day.
once there was a little bunny. he loved to bounce around! he found a feather and picked it up. the feather was very flexible.

the bunny wanted to show the feather to his friend, so he bounced all the way to his friend's house. along the way, he met other animals who wanted to try bouncing with the feather. 

when the bunny got to his friend's house, they had so much fun together! they bounced together with the feather, making it spin and twirl through the air. they laughed and laughed until it was almost dark.

before the bunny left, he put his new feather inside his pocket, so he could take it home. from then on, every time he wanted to play, he knew he could get his feather out and they could have lots of fun bouncing and spinning together!
once there was a girl who liked to push. she pushed a toy car, she pushed a wagon and she pushed a chair. one day, she saw something that she never saw before. it was a regular symbol on the floor. she went to push it, but it didn't move. she was confused, so she asked her mum. her mum said, "it's not something you can push, it's a symbol that means something special." she asked, "what does it mean?" her mum smiled and said, "it's a symbol of friendship, and just passing it makes you feel good." the girl smiled because she knew it was true. she was happy that she found this special symbol of friendship.
once upon a time there was a little girl named janie. she wanted to pick some flowers for her mom. she looked around for the prettiest ones, but then she saw something very unusual. there was a big muscle moving around in the bushes! janie was a bit scared, but then the muscle stopped and said "hello".

janie was brave and said "hello" back. the muscle said "i'm sorry but i am looking for my mom. have you seen her?" janie had not seen it's mom, so she said "no".

then the muscle said "can you help me look for her? i am getting worried." janie felt a little sorry for the muscle so she said "yes".

then they both started looking around the bushes. janie picked some flowers while they were searching. eventually they found the muscle's mom and they were both very happy. 

janie gave the flowers to the muscle and its mom as a thank you for helping her find them. the muscle and its mom thanked janie and then they all said goodbye.
once upon a time there was a bunny named eager. he was very keen and would always go on lots of adventures. every morning he would hop out of bed eager to start his day.

today eager was feeling extra excited. he hopped out of bed and grabbed a pillow and a blanket. he was going on an adventure. he hopped out of the house and quickly ran off.

eager soon arrived at a big park. there were lots of new things to explore. he hopped around the park, checking out all the different things.

but after a while, eager started to feel a bit tired. so he looked around and found a soft, comfy pillow. he nestled right into it and fell straight to sleep. 

eager had had a fun day full of adventures and was happy and ready for bed. he snuggled into his pillow and soon he was fast asleep.
one day, there was a little boy called sam. he had a tiny sword. sam went to see his friend annie. but when he got there, he saw that she had been crying.

"what's wrong, annie?" asked sam.

annie said, "my mom and dad had a fight and it was really scary."

sam was sad to hear this but he wanted to help annie. he asked her if she wanted to play with his sword.

annie smiled and said, "yes, i would love to." 

sam smiled back and gave her the sword. they ran around the garden, pretending to be knights. they had so much fun.

afterwards, sam said to annie, "i know it's hard, but maybe you could forgive your mom and dad."

annie thought about this for a moment. then she nodded her head and said, "yes, i can forgive them."

it made sam happy to see annie feeling better. he gave her a hug and said, "that's the right thing to do. just remember that it's ok to forgive."

annie smiled and gave sam a big hug. from that day on, they were the best of friends.
once upon a time, there was a brave little bird. he wanted to fly so high in the sky but there were no trees tall enough. he kept flying higher and higher, but soon he was so high that it was too bright and too hot. all the birds around him were hiding from the sun.

suddenly, he saw something special. it was a huge tree, sprouting from the clouds. it had long branches reaching out, with big leaves that shaded the sun. he immediately flew to it and rested in its shade. the tree gave him a big hug and released him to fly higher.

the brave little bird kept soaring until the sun was gone and the night settled in. every day he kept flying higher, with the tree's shade always behind him. the brave little bird never forgot the tree's releasing hug. and so he always flew high and remained brave.
john loves watching pigeons. he watched from his bedroom window as they fluttered and hopped around in the garden. today they were especially calm, which made john even more excited.

he ran downstairs to the garden and saw lots of them. he pointed at a nearby pigeon and smiled. the pigeon turned its head to look at him. john leaned in closer, but it flew away and joined the others.

john followed the pigeons, pointing at them as they flew and hopped. he was so happy to watch them move around, he didn't even notice when his mother called him in for dinner.

after dinner, john ran back to the garden, but the pigeons were no longer there. he was sad - but he knew he can see them again tomorrow. he smiled, waved goodbye and went back inside.
once upon a time, there was an enormous blouse. the blouse was so big it covered a whole sofa! but no one could understand why it was so big.

one day a little girl called sara came along. sara was only three years old. she wanted to see the blouse so she walked over to it. as she got closer and closer, she realized something amazing!

she could fit inside the blouse! she jumped right in, giggling as she did. once she was inside, sara knew why the blouse was so enormous - it was made for someone like her!

sara stayed inside the blouse for the rest of the day. she felt safe and protected, and for the first time she understood how special the blouse was.
once upon a time there was a little girl called lucy. she was three years old and very curious. she loved exploring new places. one day, she went to a park and found a violin. she had never seen one before, so she picked it up and it made music. lucy was so excited and realized it was fun to make music. 

the next day, lucy brought the violin home to show her mum. her mum said that if lucy wanted to learn to play the violin she had to practice every day. lucy happily agreed and so mum found her the best teacher.

the teacher taught her how to read music and play simple tunes. lucy practiced every day until it was time for the violin recital. when her turn came she played the violin perfectly. everyone clapped and cheered for her and she felt so proud. 

lucy went home and mum made her a tasty snack to celebrate. she felt so happy and realized making music was even better than she thought. she decided to play the violin every day and to make lots of beautiful music. 

the end.
"once upon a time, there was a fine lion. the lion was very strong and brave. he lived in a big jungle and was always looking out for his animal friends. 
one day, the lion found a little rabbit all curled up in a bush. the lion smiled at the bunny, and the bunny smiled back. the lion leaned in close and gave the bunny a gentle kiss on the head. the bunny was so surprised; it jumped up and hopped away!
the lion laughed and kept walking. he kept walking for the rest of the day and into the night. finally, the lion was tired, so he lay down under a tree and fell asleep. he dreamed of the bunny, and in his dream, the bunny smiled and waved goodbye to him.
the next morning, the lion woke up feeling so fine. he smiled and waved goodbye to the jungle and to all of his animal friends, and started walking down a new path.
once upon a time there was a furry egg. it liked to roll around. every day it would roll around the room. it even rolled around the kitchen.

the egg liked to look at all the colors in the room. it thought they were pretty. then it came to a big door. it was curious and tried to roll through the door.

the egg found a big room outside. it was even brighter than the room it was in before. there were a lot of colors out here too. the egg was happy and rolled around the big room.

then it heard a voice. it was a big person. the person said he wanted to see the furry egg. he said he wanted to take it home with him. the egg was scared but the person said he would take care of it.

the egg agreed and rolled after the person. now they live happily together and the egg still loves to roll around. the end.
once upon a time there was a dependable little girl named jemma. she enjoyed playing outside and loved her toys the most. she always wanted to be good and do what she was supposed to do. every day she would brush her teeth with her special brush.

one day jemma was given a special task. she was told to remember three numbers. she was very excited and was determined to do a good job. she used her brush to help her remember each number. she wrote one number on each of the three bristles of the brush. then she looked in the mirror, closed her eyes and tried to remember.

jemma was so proud of herself after she remembered each of the numbers. she kept her brush close so she could always remember the numbers too. every day she was dependable and remembered the numbers like she was told. jemma's brush was her helpful reminder.
once there was a little boy who loved to play outside. he was always running around and having fun. one day, he wanted to do something different so he asked his mom if he could go to the park. his mom said no. the little boy didn't like that and he disagreed.

he then had an idea. he asked his mom if he could play at his friend's house instead. his mom thought about it for a moment and then said yes. the little boy hopped for joy and gave his mom a big hug.

the little boy was so excited to go and play at his friend's house. he had lots of fun running and playing tag. his mom even joined them for a while. they played so long that the little boy got a sore knee. his mom said it was time to go home and the little boy disagreed again.

but after a while his mom convinced him to go home. the little boy was sad but his mom made him a promise that if he was successful in being a good boy, then they could go to the park the next day. the little boy was so excited about the news that he forgot about his sore knee.
once upon a time there was a little bunny named ben. ben loved to hop around and explore the world. one day ben decided to go on an adventure and he hopped off into the sunny meadow. 

as ben hopped along he came to a hedge that he had never seen before. it was tall and green and ben thought it looked safe. he carefully hopped through a tiny gap in the hedge and was surprised at how much brighter and sunnier the other side was! 

he hopped around and suddenly felt the ground move beneath his feet. ben looked down and he was standing on a trampoline! he jumped up and down so that he could feel the springs bouncing him back up. he laughed and laughed as he jumped and jumped. 

ben was so busy jumping that he didn't realise he was getting tired! suddenly, he hopped back through the hedge, feeling safe, and made his way back home to his bunny hole, ready for a nap.
once upon a time there was a girl who loved to rush around. she was very active and loved to explore. one day she heard a rustling in the trees and she was curious to find out what it was. she peeked around the tree and saw a big fluffy white bear with long ears! she was so excited that she rushed over to the bear.

the bear saw her and let out a playful roar. the girl was not scared, she smiled and said hello. the bear walked over and quietly nuzzled her ear. the girl was so happy and they both started to play and rush around in the grass.

the bear showed the girl all of her favorite places to play and explore. they ran and hopped and had lots of fun all throughout the day. when the sun set, the bear gave the girl a hug and they said goodbye. the girl waved as the bear went back into the woods and she went back home, full of smiles.
once there was a hungry lion. he saw a steak lying in the grass. the lion was so happy he roared with joy. he ran to the steak and started to eat it.

suddenly a big elephant came charging out of the bushes. he was very angry and he wanted the steak for himself. he used his trunk to destroy the steak. the lion was uncomfortable and very sad.

he sat under a tree and cried. then he heard a quiet voice behind him. it was a little mouse. the mouse reached up and handed the lion a new steak.

the lion smiled and said thank you. he quickly ate the steak and felt much better. the little mouse had saved the day!

so she put the chair in the garden. it was a perfect spot. she kept her chair there all day. the sun was shining and she was happy. she sang and danced in the chair.

the prune was gentle, sweet and tasty. everyone who saw it had to examine it. so the 3 year old continued to take bites of it until it was all gone. then he went to find another gentle prune to examine!

she asked her dad every day to make up a rhythm with her. he was so glad to hear her request, so he could not resist. so they would clap, tap and sing a fun and bouncy tune. daisy would giggle and dance along, she was so full of joy.

every day when daisy heard the rhythm she would get so excited. she was even more glad when they took it outside, so they could share it with everyone around.

the rhythm made everyone smile, the neighbours were all delighted to hear it. everyone was glad and happy, the rhythm gave them life.

from then on daisy would always remember how the rhythm made her feel and she still requests it to this day.
once upon a time there was a hammer. it was very boring and it never moved. one day it got tired of being so still, so it asked for help. 

the hammer saw a burning fire and it shouted out, "can you help me?" right away, the fire said, "yes! i can burn you so you can move." 

the hammer was excited but also a little scared. but the fire was very gentle, and soon it was burning the hammer in a nice and warm way. 

soon enough, the hammer was moving and it was having lots of fun. as it danced around the fire, it realized the fire had given it a magical power. 

suddenly, the hammer had the power to make all sorts of things out of wood and metal. from chairs to toys and even hammers - all made with its own special burning power. 

the hammer was so pleased with its new life. it finally had something to do, instead of just sitting around being boring!

he found a hammer and started to tap very carefully.
the envelope was soon fixed and it was big and strong again.
the little boy was very happy and he smiled from ear to ear.

john wanted to share the lemon with his family and he ran inside to show them. inside, he found his mom and dad. he offered his lemon to them with a big smile. they both laughed, but felt excited about what john had done. it was not normal for a three-year-old child to find a lemon in someone's backyard.

once there was a large dog named jog. he lived in a big house in the country. every morning, jog would go for a long jog and enjoy the warm sun.

one day, jog's owners decided it was time to remove him from their home. they thought he was getting to be too large for them to take care of. jog was sad to say goodbye to his home and family.

the next day, jog found himself in a new house on a big farm. he was so excited to explore his new home. every day, jog went for long jogs around the farm. he soon made lots of new friends who joined him on his jogs.

jog still misses his old home and family, but he is happy to have found a loving new home on the farm. he never goes without his daily jog!
once upon a time there was a sad little girl. she felt so lonely and sad, but she didn't know why.

one day, she decided to try and find some friends. she asked her mom if she could please go to an event. her mom said yes and the little girl was so excited! 

when she arrived, the girl met so many new people and made lots of friends. everyone was so friendly and it made her so happy. 

unfortunately, there was one mean person at the event. he was very bitter and shouted at her and her friends. she felt so scared and sad.

the little girl tried to be brave and asked the mean man to please stop shouting. to her surprise, he apologised and became nice.

so, charlie ran to the kitchen to get the spaghetti. he put it into a pot and filled the pot with water. then, he put it on the stove.

next, charlie waited. he waited and waited until the water was boiling. finally, the spaghetti was ready.

charlie put the spaghetti on a plate and hurried to the table. he was so excited and he was very hungry. he ate all of the spaghetti and he felt full and happy.
once upon a time there was a tree. it had a big trunk and lots of leafy branches. its leaves were a very attractive green.

the tree made a sound as the wind blew through it. people who heard it would always stop to admire its beauty.

but then one day the tree began to rot. its greens turned brown and its branches started to fall off. all the people stopped admiring it and they started to feel sad.

the tree was very sad too because it used to love the sound the wind made when it blew through its leaves. one day the tree had an idea.

it asked the wind to blow its leaves into the garden of a lovely little girl. her eyes lit up as the tree's leaves floated down and made music as they landed in her garden.

the tree smiled, happy that its leaves found a new home. the little girl was delighted with the attractive leaves and soon she and the tree enjoyed the sound of the wind together.

jack asked his mom if he could have a motorcycle. but jack's mom said no. jack was very frustrated. he did not understand why he could not have a motorcycle.

but then, jack's mom told him that he could visit the motorcycle whenever he wanted. jack was happy to hear that!

jack and his mom went to the parking lot to visit the motorcycle. everytime jack visited the motorcycle, he pretended to ride it and served as a great big adventure. even though he could not actually ride it, it still made jack happy to pretend.

jack learned a valuable lesson from his mom: he cannot always have what he wants but there are still other ways to enjoy it. jack was no longer frustrated and was happy to have his pretend adventures with the motorcycle.

once upon a time there was a rich man who lived in a big house on a hill. he had a special room in his house. it was filled with toys and treats but he refused to let anyone else see what was inside.

one day, a zigzag came to visit the man. it asked him if it could go in the special room and see what was inside. but the rich man refused. he kept the door closed and wouldn't let the zigzag in.

the zigzag was so sad. it tried to think of a way to get the rich man to let it in, but nothing worked. until finally, the zigzag had an idea. it smiled, then ran around the hill in a zigzag pattern.

when the rich man saw this, he was so surprised and amused. he smiled, opened the door and let the zigzag have a look around.

the zigzag was so happy! it ran around the room, looking at all the toys and treats. it spent the day playing with all the exciting things it found inside. the rich man was happy too and he never refused the zigzag again.

john kept rolling until he got to the park. but when he arrived, he saw that there were lots of other kids with scooters. he was a little scared, but he was still alert. he was determined to have a great time and show off his scooter riding skills.

john started to roll around the park and soon he was racing the other kids. he rolled faster and faster and kept up with the other kids. he was so excited by how fast he was going!

once upon a time there was a young fox. he had two big ears and a bushy tail. he loved to run and play in the sun. the sun made his fur shine and sparkle.

one day, he heard music coming from a nearby meadow. he ran to it and saw that there was a picnic happening. everyone was happy and singing to the music.

the young fox was drawn to the music, and started to dance in the sunshine. he jumped and twirled around, sending his fur flying. everyone clapped and laughed, enjoying the show.

the young fox was so happy that he twirled and danced even faster. the sun made his fur shine like a million stars. he was much happier than he'd ever been.

when the music stopped, everyone said good bye to the young fox. he waved goodbye, smiling as he watched them go. then he turned and ran off into the bright sunshine, still feeling its warm energetic rays, his fur still shining brightly.
once upon a time, there was an enthusiastic dancer who loved to perform. whenever he danced, he felt happy and full of joy. everywhere he went, the people around him stopped and watched in awe.

one day, the dancer went to a new place and saw someone who looked familiar. he couldn't place where he recognized the person from, so he went over to ask who she was. it turned out that she was also an enthusiastic dancer, who had grown up in the same town as the dancer.

the two of them spent the day tucked away in a corner of the town, talking about their shared love for dancing. they shared ideas and laughed, until finally the night had come to an end.

the dancer couldn't believe that he had gone all that time without recognizing the talented dancer he had just met. he was so glad he had gone over to ask her who she was, because now he had a new friend. they stayed in touch and continued to share their love of dancing together.

jack opened the door, and then he and ben stepped inside. they both gasped at what they saw. jack's car was so shiny and fast! he urged ben to take a seat and try it out. ben was so happy, he couldn't believe it!

they had so much fun driving around the driveway. after they were finished, they said goodbye and then ben went on his way. he was so envious of jack's car, he really wished it was his. but they remained good friends, and every now and then they would visit each other in the garage.

king bob was a kind ruler who loved his people very much. everyday he would prepare for something special in his hive. on this particular day he had something special to do.

bob put on his crown and went outside to get ready. he was making honey in his special hive. he had some bees to help him as he was getting everything in place.

soon the hive was ready. it was full of honeycomb and it smelled so sweet. king bob carefully poured the honey inside and thanked the bees for their help. now it was all complete.

the bees and the people of his kingdom celebrated. they were so happy to have such a kind and generous ruler. they enjoyed the delicious honey and were forever grateful to king bob.

with some help, she practiced riding it and soon she was riding it all around her garden. she was so proud of herself. she had so much fun and asked her mum and dad to take her to the park. her mum and dad said yes and they all went together.

at the park, the girl tried out different types of bicyles and she loved it. the park keeper noticed how much the girl enjoyed biking and he recommended a bike shop to her parents. the shop had a big selection of bikes and the girl got one straight away.

one day there was a bald man who worked in a factory. every morning he would wake up and go to work. one day something strange and wonderful happened - it started to spring!

the man felt so happy he decided to take the day off, so he jumped out of bed, put on his coat and quickly ran outside! the ground was wet and muddy. he laughed as he splashed around and enjoyed the warm air. the sun was shining, the birds were singing and the flowers were blooming all around him.

he noticed a butterfly fluttering around and stopped to watch it. suddenly the butterfly flew onto his head and rested there. he was amazed and knew that this was a special moment! he kept walking and enjoyed the fresh air and beauty of the world around him.

soon enough he had to go back to the factory but he knew that he would always remember the special day when he felt the beauty and joy of spring.
once upon a time there was a heavy raft. it belonged to a family who all wanted to go on a fun, riverside journey. 

the father lifted the heavy raft and put it in the river. then he, his wife and the two children, clambered inside. they were all so excited for the fun ahead. 

the family started their journey, but suddenly it started raining heavily. the rain was so strong, it made the raft sway from side to side. the father told them all to get off, so they jumped into the water with their life jackets on. 

but after a while they all had to surrender. the heavy raft was starting to drift away and they could not get back on it. the waves were too high and the family were too exhausted. 

so they waved goodbye as the heavy raft slowly drifted off, and they all hoped to see it again soon. then they decided to walk home together, clingin to their life jackets. 

and they all lived happily ever after. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little girl. her name was amy and she was three years old. she loved to go to the playground.

amy's favorite thing to do at the playground was to go down the slide. she would climb up the steps and sit down on the slide. then with a big smile, she would push off and go down the slide. she would giggle all the way down.

but, one day, the slide was too slippery. with one careless push, she rose up into the air, higher than she normally did. she was so surprised that she couldn't help but to giggle with delight. but then she landed with a thud in the sand!

amy was okay though, and she was excited to go down the slide again and again.

the end.
once upon a time there was a tiger. the tiger was very sad and started to weep deep tears.

every day the tiger would go to the woods and sit in a big tree that was very deep in the woods. he would sit and weep until his tears filled a river. 

one day a little girl walked by the river and heard the tiger. she was curious, so she bravely stepped into the deep woods. when the little girl got closer to the tree, the tiger stopped crying and looked at her. 

the little girl was scared at first, but when she saw the sad tiger, she felt sorry for him. she knew the tiger was hurting, so she smiled and carefully stepped closer. 

the tiger looked into the little girl's bright, caring eyes and soon he was no longer sad. the little girl and the tiger became friends, and from then on, the tiger never had to weep alone in the deep woods again.
once upon a time there was a little boy named tim. he was three years old and he liked to explore the world around him.

one day he was on a walk and he saw a cabin. he thought it looked so strange and it made him hurry to take a closer look.

when he got to the cabin, he was so surprised. it was terrible! it was full of cobwebs and the windows were broken. tim was scared, but he was also curious to see what was inside. he decided to stay and take a look.

when he opened the door, he saw a big scary man. tim was so scared that he ran away and he ran as fast as he could. he was so scared and he couldn't help but hurry home.

when tim got home, he told his mom all about it. she was so glad that tim was safe and that was the end of his terrible adventure!
once there was a dog, and it liked to play outside. one day, the dog saw a rock that was thin and round. it looked like it wanted to be spun! so the dog began running around it in circles and spinning it around.

the rock spun faster and faster, until it took off like a rocket! it flew high up into the air and made the dog giggle with excitement.

the dog watched as the rock flew away, and eventually out of sight. the dog was sad, but then suddenly it heard a jingle. the rock had left behind a special coin!

the coin was so shiny and thin that when the dog spun it around on the ground, it glistened in the sunshine. from that day on, the dog always kept its special rock coin with it and spun it whenever it felt like playing.
once upon a time there was a girl named jane. jane was playing in the park one night, when all of a sudden, something embarrassing happened! she felt fake, like she was pretending to be someone else. she was so embarrassed she ran away and hid in the bushes.

jane felt embarrassed the whole night. but when the morning sun came, she felt ready to come back out. jane was still embarrassed, but she felt better knowing that the night was over.

so jane went to the park, but this time with her friends. they were so understanding and they all had a great time. everyone played and laughed, and jane soon forgot how embarrassed she had felt before. 

when they all said bye, jane had a big smile on her face. she was so glad she wasn't embarrassed anymore!
once upon a time there was a girl called jean. she was three years old.
one day while she was playing in the garden jean found a basket. it was filled with special things - one of them was a special toy. jean was so happy!

but jean's brother was very jealous. he wanted jean's toy all for himself. so his took the toy and ran away!

jean was so sad. she wanted her toy back, but she didn't know where her brother had gone. suddenly she had an idea. she decided to bury the basket near the tree in the garden and hope that her brother would find it.

jean dug a deep, deep hole and put the basket in it. then she covered it up with lots and lots of dirt and stones. then she went inside to wait.

but jean's brother was very, very stupid! he never even looked for the basket. so jean's special toy stayed buried forever!
once upon a time, there was a black armchair in a room. every day, a little boy called jack would love to shoot his toy cars on the armchair. he would make the loudest whoosh sound pretending they were racing cars.

one day, jack saw something on the armchair. it was a black bug! he was so scared that he quickly grabbed his toy gun and started shooting at the bug! he was shooting and shooting until the bug was gone.

jack was very proud of himself and he shouted, "i did it! i am so brave!"

the end.
once upon a time there was a turtle who lived in the sea. he was very excited to explore his new home. he zoomed all around, swimming near the brightly coloured coral and beautiful shells. he peered into every nook and cranny of the ocean floor.

one day he found a secret cave. when he went inside he saw a sparkling white shell! he was so excited that he picked it up. he decided that this would be his special shell. it became his best friend and they went on lots of fun adventures together.

they swam all around the ocean, zooming from one end to another. they would laugh and giggle as they explored all the lovely sights. one day they even met some dolphins and waved to them. then it was time for the turtle to go home.

but wherever he went, he made sure to bring his special shell with him. because it was always a reminder of the many exciting adventures that he had experienced.
once there was a boy and he was thirsty so he got a cup. he wanted to shut the cup though and it was very hard, so he asked his mom for help. his mom said it would be easy and showed him how to shut it. he tried it again and was able to shut the cup all by himself. he was very happy and smiled. 

the boy filled up the cup with some juice and then went to play with his toys. he was so thirsty he quickly drank all the juice and finished his cup. after that, he shut it again and put the cup away. 

the end.
jane was playing in the garden when she saw something beautiful in the sky. it was a blue bird! she watched it for a while, as it flew high and sharp. the bird was so graceful and jane wished she could be like it.

suddenly, she heard a funny noise and saw a very big and shiny object moving in the sky. it was a sports plane! it was so loud and jane got very excited. she waved her hands and yelled with joy as the plane flew sharp in the sky. 

the pilot saw jane and he smiled. he waved back, and jane waved even harder. the plane went so high and so far that it soon went out of sight. jane felt sad but also very happy. she thought she was lucky to not only see the bird, but also the sports plane.
once upon a time there was a store. the store sold all sorts of things. every day the store was perfect. people came from far away to visit it and buy things.

the store was also very kind. if someone needed help, the people at the store would support them. they would show them around and offer lots of friendly advice. everybody loved the store.

one day an old lady came to visit the store. she wanted to buy some toys for her grandkids. the store was so helpful that she was able to buy the perfect toys.

the old lady was very happy and thanked the store. she said that the store and the people who worked there were so kind. thanks to the store, she was able to find the perfect gifts for her grandkids. everybody was happy.

the end.
one day a very old pigeon was walking on the ground. it was so old that it moved very slowly. a little boy saw it and wanted to help it, so he walked up to it and gently pushed it along. the little boy was very kind and patient and he kept pushing the pigeon until it reached a nice grassy area. 

when it got there, the pigeon stopped and started eating the grass. the little boy watched it and smiled as he watched it eat. he was so happy that he had been able to help the elderly pigeon. 

after a while the pigeon flapped its wings and flew away. the little boy waved goodbye and wished it a safe journey. he was very happy and proud of himself for helping the elderly pigeon. 

the end.
once there was a dog named rover. rover loved to run around outside, so one day he ran faster than ever before. he could hardly believe it â€“ he had run all the way to the store! he thought it was the best place to go, but he was wrong.

once inside, rover noticed that all the people in the store were running too! he didn't understand why they were so scared, until he saw a dead cell. he realized that the cell was dangerous and he quickly ran away.

rover ran all the way back home, but he was so afraid that he never went to the store ever again. despite the danger, he sometimes remembers how fun it was to run so far.
peter and his mom were walking in the forest. suddenly, a big, enormous bear appeared in front of them. peter was so scared that he started to tremble. he didn't know what to do.

but his mom was brave. she walked slowly over to the bear and offered it a bottle of juice. the bear smelled the juice and grabbed the bottle from her hand. then it started to drink.

peter watched in amazement as the bear finished the juice and then walked away. he wasn't scared anymore. he smiled at his mom and said, "thank you".
one day there was a jet flying in the sky. it was an unknown vehicle that no one had seen before. rachel saw the jet and wondered what it was. she asked her mom, "what is that?"

her mom said, "it's a jet. it goes very high and fast." rachel was excited to hear the explanation.

rachel asked another question, "can i ride in a jet?" her mom said, "no, not right now. that is something for when you get a little older." rachel wanted to ride in the jet, but she knew she had to wait.

the jet kept flying in the sky. rachel watched it until it went so far she could no longer see it. the unknown jet was gone and rachel sat wondering where it had gone.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named pete. pete was three years old and he was very curious. 

one day, he saw something interesting in his house: a cupboard. pete opened the cupboard and saw that it was clean. he saw a big handle and a switch inside the cupboard. 

pete was curious, so he pulled the handle and pressed the switch. suddenly, the room started to reverse. the walls and furniture moved backwards. pete laughed and clapped his hands. 

but then, the reversinng stopped and pete's mom came in the room. she saw what pete did and she said, "no no, pete. you must not play with things inside the cupboard."

pete felt very sorry. he said sorry to his mom and promised that he would not play with it again.
once upon a time, there was a happy octopus who loved swimming in the deep sea. every day he swam around, looking for new places to explore. one day, the octopus was stirring the ocean with his tentacles when he came across something strange. it was a huge, colourful rock lying in the middle of the ocean.

the octopus was curious and excited, so he swam closer to take a look. as he swam around it, he realised it was actually a giant egg! he watched in amazement as the egg began to crack and out popped a cheerful baby octopus!

the happy octopus swam around in circles, stirring the water with delight. this new little octopus was so much fun and they quickly became the best of friends.

the two octopuses explored the ocean together, swimming around and stirring up any adventures they could find. they became the best of friends and had many wonderful underwater adventures!
once upon a time, there was a gray block. it sat on a table all by itself, without any other blocks around. the gray block wanted to find a friend, but it just sat there alone.

one day, it decided to try something. it rolled off the table and onto the floor. at first, it was scared, but then it started to have fun. it rolled around in circles, trying to find someone to be friends with.

soon, the gray block heard a voice. it was a blue block, calling out to the gray one. the blue block asked if the gray one wanted to play together. the gray block was so excited!

the two blocks played together all afternoon. they raced around the room, built towers with their blocks, and even hugged each other at the end. the gray block was so happy to have found a friend. it had tried, and it worked!
once upon a time there was a black infant. he rested in his crib all day and watched the world outside his window. every day he saw old birds flying in the sky and young children playing in the grass. every night he heard the night creatures stirring in the darkness.

one day the infant decided he wanted to explore outside his window. he pushed his way out of the crib and flopped into the grass below. he was amazed by the world around him. everything seemed so big and he was so small.

he rested near a tree and looked up in the sky. he saw a blackbird flying above him and then he noticed a yellow butterfly fluttering near his face. he reached out to touch it, but it flew away.

the infant watched until the sun began to set. when it was too dark to see he tucked himself back into his crib and closed his eyes. he felt tired and content after his exploration. the night was peaceful and he soon fell asleep, happy to rest after a full day of adventure.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named jack. he had a tiny hut in the woods near his house, and he liked to go there all the time to play. one day, jack was in his hut when he heard a loud noise. he looked outside and saw a huge fire! the flames were getting closer and jack was scared.

luckily, jack knew just what to do. he raced to his house and got some buckets of water. he then ran back to the hut and started to pour the water over the fire. the flames started to go down and finally, the fire was gone. jack had saved his hut!

but why had the fire started in the first place? jack had an idea; he thought it might have been caused by the neighbour, who was selfish and never did anything to help anyone. jack was sad that his neighbour had been so selfish, but at least he had saved his hut!
once upon a time there was a girl. she was feeling uncomfortable. she decided to put some perfume on. 

she sprayed it carefully onto her neck. soon the room was filled with a lovely smell. she smiled, it made her feel much better. 

the girl did not know it, but her brother had snuck into the room. he liked the smell of the perfume and wanted some too. he went and found some of his own. 

he put it on his neck, it smelt strong and he felt uncomfortable. but he liked how the perfume made him smell. he decided to keep wearing it. 

the girl and her brother were both very happy with their new fragrances. they enjoyed being able to smell nice and smiled, feeling much better than before.
once upon a time, there was a girl named jenny. she was a very shy girl who didn't like to talk to strangers.

one day while jenny was in the park, she met a stranger. the strange was very friendly and asked jenny if she wanted to play.

jenny was very scared, but she was brave and decided to try and accept the stranger's offer. she smiled and said yes.

the two of them had lots of fun together. the stranger taught jenny how to swing on the swings, and how to use the slide.

after that day, whenever jenny went to the park, she would look for the stranger. they were great friends now, and jenny was no longer scared of strangers.
mr. and mrs. brown had a little son named bobby. bobby was a very polite and friendly boy. one day, mr. and mrs. brown decided to take bobby to the park. 

as bobby ran around the park, he stopped to gaze at the tall chimney he could see. he had never seen a chimney that tall before! he wondered what was inside and who lived there. 

mrs. brown sat down on a bench and watched bobby curiously. he seemed so interested in the chimney that she decided to ask the park keeper about it.

the park keeper explained that the chimney belonged to a big castle, owned by a prince and princess. bobby was so excited to hear this! 

he ran back to his mom and dad and told them all about it. they were glad to see him so happy and thankful that he is so polite.
one day, a boy named jack went to the store. he wanted to buy some candy. but he had no money.

jack's mom told him that he needed money to buy things at the store. she gave him some money and said that he could use it to buy candy.

jack was very excited! he went to the store to buy the candy. he chose a lollipop. he asked the storekeeper how much money he needed.

the storekeeper told him how much money was available. it was exactly the right amount of money!

jack was very happy. he paid for the lollipop and went home. he enjoyed his treat and told his mom all about his adventure at the store.
once there was a little girl who liked to spin. she twirled around and around and it made her very happy. one day she decided to take her pet hamster to the veterinarian. when they got inside, the veterinarian was very angry. the little girl was scared and tried not to spin, but it was too hard. the veterinarian saw her spinning and told her she had to stop. the veterinarian said she had to be still so he could take a look at the hamster. the little girl wasn't sure why the veterinarian was so angry, but she liked her hamster and wanted to do what was best. so, she took a deep breath and stopped spinning. the veterinarian looked at the hamster and said he was healthy. the little girl was relieved and gave the hamster a hug.
once upon a time, there was a black butterfly. he was an happy butterfly and loved to fly around. he wanted to visit different places and see the world. but he was not allowed to go. 

he asked mama butterfly why he could not travel. mama butterfly said that he had to stay close to home. but he wanted to explore! he asked if he could travel one day. 

mama butterfly said yes, but only if he was careful. he promised he would be careful, so mama butterfly let him go. he was so excited! the black butterfly flew all around, visiting different places and meeting new friends.

he was so happy he was allowed to travel, so he flew back home to share his adventures with mama butterfly. she was very happy and said that he could travel again. the black butterfly flapped his wings in joy!
once upon a time there was a boy named jack. he lived in a big city and had lots of friends. all of his friends were connected to each other by a network. 

every day, jack and his friends would play together. jack had so much fun, he would often forget the time. 

one day, jack noticed something that seemed strange. it was an old, ugly network of wires going into a nearby building. jack was curious and decided to follow the network. 

he went inside the building and found that he had stumbled into a secret place filled with fun and games. jack couldn't believe it! he never wanted to forget about this place.

the end.
once upon a time, there was a charming boy. he was three years old and he loved to collect things! every day, he would play with his favourite toy and after, he would look for special things to collect.

one day, the boy decided to go for a walk. he saw a pie shop which looked very inviting. he went inside and saw lots of lovely pies in the window. he was so excited!

the boy asked the man in the shop if he could collect one of the pies. the man smiled and said yes. he chose a delicious looking strawberry pie and put it in his basket. he thanked the man and ran off home.

when he got home, he shared the pie with his family. it was the most delicious pie they had ever tasted! they thanked the boy for collecting the charming pie. from then on, the boy collected the most delicious pies and shared them with his family!
once upon a time there was a little dog who loved to explore the big world. one day, he decided to go for a walk in the backyard of his owner. it was a warm day so the grass and the trees were swaying in the breeze. the little dog was excited and he started running and playing around.

suddenly, he noticed that everything around him had gone still and quiet. he looked around, confused, and noticed that everything was frozen solid! everything had been frozen by a special power and the little dog couldn't move.

he started to feel really dizzy and confused. he tried to move, but nothing happened. then he saw his owner coming outside. his owner had a look of surprise in his eyes as he saw the little dog frozen in place.

he slowly waved his hand towards the little dog and, in a flash, the dog was free again! everything came back to life and the little dog could move again.

the little dog was so happy and relieved! he thanked his owner for saving him and promised to be careful in the future. from then on, the little dog was much more careful when he walked around his owner's backyard. the end.
once upon a time, there was a pigeon. he was feeling very troubled. he flew up high in the sky and started to zoom around the clouds. he zoomed so fast and flew so high. he felt so free, but he still felt troubled. 

suddenly, he heard a voice. it said to him, "pigeon, why are you feeling so troubled?" he replied, "i don't know why, i just feel sad." the voice said, "do not worry, just enjoy flying. zoom around and have fun." 

the pigeon listened to the voice and started to zoom around again. he quickly forgot his troubles and began to enjoy his time in the sky. he flew up and down and around, from cloud to cloud, until he felt happy again. 

the pigeon thanked the voice for its help and flew off, twirling and whirling as he zoomed into the distance. he finally felt free and full of joy.
once there was a thin gray rabbit. every day it hopped through the meadow. one day it found the mud. it thought the mud felt nice so it hopped and hopped in it.

when the rabbit was done playing it looked at itself. it had mud all over it and it was a little scared. but then it had an idea! it remembered seeing a wipe one time. 

the rabbit hopped over to a nearby tree and it grabbed a thin gray wipe from the tree trunk. it looked at the wipe and then hopped back to the mud. with a few swipes the rabbit was clean and the mud was gone. 

the rabbit was so happy that he kept the thin gray wipe. from then on any time he got dirty he used the wipe to clean himself. 

the end.
once there was a brave girl named jasmine. she was very competitive and loved to explore. one day she went for a walk in the woods. there she saw a very special mushroom. she had never seen an orange mushroom before. 

jasmine decided to protect the mushroom so that no one could take it away. she put a big rock on top of it to keep it safe. after that jasmine looked around to make sure everything was alright.

jasmine went back to the mushroom many times and she always watched over it to protect it. she even stayed up late to make sure no one disturbed the mushroom. she was determined to keep it safe.

jasmine became friends with the mushroom and enjoyed playing around it. she was proud of her job to protect the mushroom. eventually it was time to say goodbye to the mushroom and continue on her journey. overall, jasmine was happy that she could protect the mushroom.

suddenly, her dad came into the room and said "why don't you watch the television?". the little girl felt so happy, it was like all her dreams were coming true. she smiled and said "yes!".

her dad laughed and said "let's see what show is on". they sat together on the couch and watched the large television. the little girl laughed and smiled and she was very happy. she was so happy that she forgot that her mom ignored her.
once upon a time, there was a foolish little mouse. he was so foolish that he thought he could bite through a rock. he tried and tried but he just couldn't do it. one day, he heard a rhythm and followed it. he followed the beat through the forest until he found a nut. he opened his mouth and bit down. as soon as he bit it, the nut cracked open! his eyes lit up and he smiled. he had finally done it! happy that he learned how to bite, the foolish little mouse danced to the rhythm.
once there was a wide and open field. in the field, there were two children playing. they were running and laughing, having lots of fun. 
suddenly, one of the children felt sick. he stopped playing and said to the other, "let's go home." 
they went back to the house, and the sick child's mommy gave him medicine. the medicine tasted a bit funny but it made him feel better. 
soon, he felt all better and wanted to go back out to the wide open field to play. his friend said, "let's go!" 
they happily ran back to the field and continued playing until it was time for dinner.
once upon a time there were two friends, larry and sue. they went to the park together one day. when they got there, they saw a big band playing some music. it was very loud and they could see the people dancing. larry and sue stopped to observe. the music sounded like jazz and it made larry and sue laugh. the dancers looked silly and larry and sue couldn't believe their eyes! they hopped around the park, enjoying the music and watching the silly people. later on when they left, larry and sue said that it was the most fun they ever had.
once there was a girl named emma who loved to play chess. every day, she would take out her chess pieces and practice moving them around the board.

one day, however, when she was playing she noticed something strange. all of the chess pieces had frozen in place! she was very confused and couldn't figure out why they had stopped moving.

she decided to try something and clapped her hands loudly. to her surprise, the chess pieces started moving again!

from then on, whenever emma wanted to move her chess pieces, she would clap her hands to unfreeze them. she thought this was really fun and continued playing chess every day.
once upon a time, there was a busy bee called bill. bill liked to rock in his chair and look around. one day, bill decided it was time to start something new. he quickly got dressed and buzzed around town. 

bill came across a lovely garden in the park. he could see lots of flowers, grass and trees. he loved it! he also saw a big rock in the middle of the garden. he decided to rock on it. after a while, he felt so content and peaceful. 

bill had so much fun! he waved goodbye and said thank you to the garden before he went back home. 

he arrived home and found his mum busy cooking dinner. he wanted to help her, so he offered to rock the chair for her. his mum was so happy. 

they rocked together in the kitchen and enjoyed the evening sky. it was a special time for bill and his mum.
once upon a time there was a little mouse. he was very healthy and strong. he loved to play all day and eat yummy food. 

at night, the mouse would take a nap. he would find a cozy place and lay down. as soon as his head touched the ground he would go fast to sleep.

when the mouse woke up he would hop around, looking for food. he would eat little seeds and crunchy bugs. during the day he would also play with his friends.

but no matter how much fun he had, when it was time for bed he would always go back to sleep. he was a happy and healthy mouse. and he liked to sleep a lot.
once upon a time, there was a clear candle. the candle was very shiny and sparkly in the sun.

one day, the candle was walking in the woods. suddenly, the candle saw a big, scary monster. the monster was very creepy and it had big eyes! 

the candle was so scared that it didn't know what to do. then, it remembered that it had a special power! the candle made a big smile and nodded its head. 

the monster smiled too. suddenly, the monster changed into a friendly puppy in front of the candle. the candle was so happy and it hugged the puppy! from then on, the candle and the puppy were the best of friends. 

the puppy and the candle played in the woods every day. they were so happy together. whenever the candle wanted to play, the puppy would nod its head.

the end.
