john was a busy little three-year-old. he loved to explore and asked lots of questions. one day, he asked his mom all about the ceiling. she told him that the ceiling was like an open lid on their home. she said that it owned the room, keeping them safe and sheltered.

john was so intrigued by the ceiling that he decided to give it a try himself. he slowly reached up and touched the open ceiling with his little hand. it felt strange and smooth! he giggled and laughed.

john's mom saw how excited he was about the ceiling and asked if he wanted to explore some more. he shouted out yes! so, she picked him up so he could see the ceiling from above.

john was in awe. he pointed out the lights and decorations on the ceiling. he also noticed how the ceiling was really big and how it owned the whole house!

after their exploration, john felt so happy. he had learned a lot about the ceiling and now he owned the knowledge.
once upon a time there was a little girl who loved to raise her pillow. every day she would grab it with both hands and throw it up in the air. it felt so fun and freeing!

one day, the little girl saw a box of pillows that were available in the store. she was so excited and pointed to them, asking her mom to buy one of the pillows. her mom said yes and they brought the pillow home.

the little girl couldn't wait to raise her new pillow! she ran up to her bedroom and grabbed it with both hands. then, taking a deep breath, she threw it up in the air. she watched in delight as the pillow came back down and landed perfectly on her bed.

the little girl raised her pillow many times over the years, but the first time will always be her favorite.
once there was a boy who was grumpy because his friends were playing a game without him! he went to his toy box full of things that he could play with, but he couldn't find the one he wanted. suddenly, he saw a match box with a bright green design with yellow stars. he opened the box and inside he saw little wooden matches. 

he was so excited that he got to play with them. he began pointing to single matches and quickly found a curious game. he used the matches to make a tiny bridge over the kitchen table and started putting the matches in a line. he made it longer and longer until it became a very long bridge.

the boy was so proud of himself and laughed with glee. suddenly he remembered that he was grumpy before and now he was laughing and playing. he realized that the simple match box was the exact thing he was looking for. he kept playing until his friends came back with the toy that he wanted - and he suddenly had a brilliant idea!

he pointed to the match box, smiled, and showed his friends the bridge he had made. all of them were amazed and instantly started to create their own bridges. the boy was no longer grumpy; he was happy knowing that the simple match box made everyone smile too.
once there was an old man who was so restless he couldn't stay still. he wanted to go outside and do something new. so he asked his wife if he could go for a walk. but she refused. she said, "no, you need to stay inside and rest." he was sad, but he knew his wife was right. 

so he stayed inside and did some chores. he still felt restless though and all he could do was think about how he wanted to go outside. then he had an idea! he got up and put on his coat. he was nearly out the door when his wife saw him. 

he asked again if he could go out. his wife refused again. she said, "no, stay inside and rest." the old man was disappointed, but he knew his wife was right. he was too old to go out anyway. so he went back to his chores and tried to be content.
hannah was a little girl. she went out to the garden and saw a big, thick spider. she was scared. she wanted to catch it, but it was too quick. she chased it around the garden. then she saw a stick, so she picked it up. she used it to try and catch the spider. the spider was still very quick, but eventually she managed to catch it. she was so happy that she put it in a jar and took it home to show her mom.
once upon a time there was a little girl. she was three-years-old and she loved to play. one day she found a new box in the corner of her room. she wanted to know what was inside so she shook it. she couldn't know what was inside, so she opened the box. inside was a new stuffed toy rabbit. she was so happy! she hugged her new rabbit and thanked the box for the surprise. from then on, she knew the box was full of surprises.
once upon a time, there was a sleepy little boy. he was always so tired, so he decided to take a nap. with a little spray from his pain, he drifted off to sleep. 

when he woke up, he was very happy. his pain was gone and he felt much better. he had a big smile on his face and started to run around, happy and energetic. 

soon after, he saw some other children playing in the sprinklers. he excitedly joined in, running back and forth while they sprayed him with water. he felt so refreshed and laughed and smiled the whole time. 

after a few hours, he was back home. he was so happy and grateful for the pain spray and the other children who played with him. he was ready to go back to sleep with a huge smile on his face. 

the end.
once upon a time, there was a beautiful tiger. he loved to explore the world and try new things. one day, he decided to go for a walk in the jungle.

as he walked, he saw some yummy fruit lying on the ground. he decided to eat it! he enjoyed the sweet taste and asked for more. he had so much fun eating the fruit.

soon he came to a beautiful stream. he decided to take a break and drink some water. after taking a few sips, he noticed a big, round rock. the tiger was curious about the rock and decided to take a closer look. 

suddenly, he heard a loud noise! it was a big and beautiful butterfly. the tiger was so amazed; it was a sight to behold. the butterfly flew away into the sky, and the tiger watched it go. 

after his adventure, the tiger was very tired. he decided it was time to go back home, so he walked back to his den. when he got there, he was so happy and laid down for a nice rest. he had such a fun day!
once upon a time there was a beetle who was ashamed. he had never seen anything like the other beetles and he felt really lonely.

one day he decided to explore a bit. he saw a flower in the garden and he wanted to examine it. as he looked closer, he saw there were lots of creatures living inside the flower!

he was so excited and he said 'hello' to them all. they all said hello back and were very friendly. the beetle was so happy he had made some friends.

he wanted to thank the flower so he gave it a big hug. he was so glad he decided to examine it! from then on he was never ashamed again.
once upon a time, there was a big, fat pig. he was always very slow and stupid. every day, the pig would go to the river to wash himself. he would splash the river with his feet, and the water would go everywhere.

one day, while he was playing in the river, he saw a strip of fabric. it was a very pretty fabric. so he decided to pick it up, take it home, and wash it.

but when the pig tried to wash the fabric, he got it stuck in the bucket! he tried to free it, but he just couldnâ€™t. he struggled and struggled, but the fabric was stuck and wouldnâ€™t move!

finally, the pig gave up. he pulled the fabric out of the bucket and threw it away, feeling very stupid.

the moral of the story is: sometimes it's better to leave things alone.
once there was a little girl called mary. mary was kind and polite and always tried to behave. one day, mary's mum asked her to get some glue from the shop. mary was so excited but also a little scared. she had never been to the shop by herself before.

mary put on her shoes, said goodbye to her mum and off she went. mary saw lots of colourful things in the shop, but she remembered why she was there. she quickly found the glue and asked the shopkeeper for some. he gave it to her with a big smile and she thanked him, saying she was grateful for his help.

mary paid for the glue and quickly rushed back home. when she arrived, her mum was so proud of her for remembering to behave and for being so brave. mary was happy too and said she couldn't wait to get crafting with the glue.
one day, a modest mother took her child to the park. while they were there, the mother fed some birds sitting in a tree. the birds were so excited to eat the food the mother gave them, they fluttered around and chirped loudly.

the child was so excited to see the birds eat that they laughed and clapped with joy. after the birds were finished eating, the mother and the child went to go play.

they played tag and had so much fun! they were running and laughing as the sun went down. before the mother went home, she fed the child one last time with a yummy snack.

the little child was so happy and full, they smiled and hugged their mother goodbye. the mother hugged the child and kissed them on the head. the modest mother was very happy that their day spent together was so much fun.
once upon a time, there was a shy little bunny. he had big floppy ears and a furry tail. every day, he would hop around looking for a home. he wanted to make a home that was his very own.

one day, he hopped into a meadow filled with daisies. he looked around and saw a hollow log. he thought, "this is the perfect place to make my home."

he hopped inside and made some extra fluffy leaves for a bed. he made some sticks into a cozy nest and he had a little home of his own.

the shy little bunny was so happy. he was no longer alone and he had a place to keep him warm. from then on, he was never shy and he always had a place to call home.
max had a lot of purple shampoo in his room. he was ready to try it out! he walked over to the mirror and picked up the bottle. it felt a bit heavy in his hands.

max's mum saw him and smiled. she knew he liked playing with colourful things. she encouraged him to try the shampoo on his own.

max smiled back. he was a bit scared of getting it in his eyes, but he was brave. he squirted a bit of the purple shampoo in his hand, rubbed it together and put it on his hair. it tickled! 

max's mum watched him in admiration. she thought he did a great job and told him so. he smiled proudly. 

max was so proud of what he'd done. he had tried something new by himself and it worked out great! his mum's encouragement had made him feel even more confident.
once there was a baby boy who was three years old. he was standing in a field and looking around. he saw a piece of paper blowing in the wind. he wanted to get it. he ran over and shook the piece of paper until it was all the way up in the air. after that, he was so excited!

the baby boy was very thoughtful. he wanted to do something special with the piece of paper. so he decided to draw a picture with it. he used a green and blue crayon to draw on the piece of paper. he had lots of fun making the picture.

when he was done, the baby boy shook the piece of paper to make sure all the colors were dry. then, he was very happy and ran to show his mom his special drawing. she was so proud and gave him a hug. it was a very fun day!

once upon a time, there was a little boy. he loved to explore the world. one day, he decided to explore outside in nature. he was happy to see all the fun things around him.

as he was walking, he heard a sound. it was a bird singing. he loved the sound. he decided to add the birdâ€™s song to his exploration. he kept going and came across a lake. the lake was very pretty and it was safe for the little boy to explore.

the little boy loved the lake and wanted to add the lake to his exploration. on the way back home he saw a big tree. he thought it was special and decided to add the tree to his exploration too.

the little boy had a wonderful time exploring nature. he saw lots of fun things and felt safe the whole time. he was happy to add so many things to his exploration.
once upon a time, there was a little girl. the girl had a stick. she liked to use the stick to draw in the sand.

one day, she went to the beach. she found a lot of seashells and sea rocks. the girl wanted to keep the shells for herself.

suddenly, she heard something in the water. it was a fish in trouble! he was stuck in a net that was too tight. the girl was scared, but she knew she had to help. so, she grabbed the stick and started to help the fish. the girl first struggled to cut through the net. but slowly, the net started to tear. then, the little girl reached in and pulled out the fish. she had saved him!

the fish thanked the girl and swam away back into the sea. the girl was happy. she had used her little stick to save him.
a little girl named kayla was walking in the park. she felt the wind in her hair. suddenly, the wind was so strong, she had to hold onto a tree to keep from blowing away! 

she saw something in the bushes and decided to peek to see what it was. kayla felt a little bit scared, but she was very curious about what was in there, so she looked. it was a small, furry squirrel! 

kayla thought it was so cute, so she tried to feed it a nut. but the squirrel was very shy and quickly ran away. kayla was sad, but she was also feeling brave, so she walked all around the park. 

she saw a difficult looking tree trunk that had fallen across the path. kayla was scared because she thought she could not get around it. but the wind made the trunk wobble so she was able to squeeze by it. 

kayla was very proud of herself for being brave. she knew she was strong enough to get around the tricky obstacle. she kept walking, feeling the wind in her hair and being thankful for her adventures.
once upon a time, there was a harbor. it was very big and impressive. in this harbor, there lived a special family of ducks. these ducks loved to share. every day, the ducks would share their food and their fun with all the other animals. 

one day, a fisherman sailed his boat out to the harbor. as he sailed, he noticed the ducks happily sharing all the things around them. he was very impressed. he had never seen ducks like that before. he knew then he had found a very special place.

the fisherman shared his story with a special friend. soon, lots of people came to the harbor to meet the ducks and learn their secret. everyone was very impressed. 

the harbor and the ducks had plenty of love, food and fun to share. everyone who visited the harbor was happy, and everyone left feeling full of joy. 
the harbor was forever known as the sharing harbor - the place to be for love, food and fun!
jane and bob were playing in the park. jane wanted to hold the pretty bull that was walking around. but bob said it was too big and he thought it might hurt them. so, instead, he offered to show jane his reliable pet cat. 

bob told jane to be gentle and he showed her how to hold the cat. she was scared at first, but after bob showed her what to do, she gently held the cat and loved it. the cat purred loudly, so jane knew he liked it too. 

afterwards, jane hugged bob for showing her a reliable and gentle pet that she could hold. then bob laughed, and they ran to the playground to play some more.
once there was a shield. it was unusual because it could stay up in the air by itself. everyone wondered if the shield would ever come down. one day, a brave 3 year old decided to find out. she walked up to the shield and put out her hand. then she said, "stay with me." 

immediately, the shield started to float down. it stopped right in front of the 3 year old and stayed there. she smiled and grabbed the shield. she knew it would make a perfect protector from the sun. 

from that day on, the shield stayed with the 3 year old. everywhere she went, it followed. it became her best friend. nothing strange or unusual ever happened with the shield again.
once upon a time there was a little boy named alex. he loved to drive around in his toy car. he would drive it all around the house, across the kitchen floor and up along the stairs. 

one day, alex had to go to the store with his mom. he was very excited to drive in the real car. as they drove down the road, alex saw an old woman with a bag. he asked his mom why she was carrying a bag and his mom told him that the woman was worried because she couldn't find her way home. 

feeling sad for the woman, alex offered to help her. so, mom and alex drove the old woman home. when they arrived, the woman gave alex a big hug to thank him for helping her. 

this story teaches us that we should always help people who are in need. it also teaches us that even small acts of kindness can make a big difference in someone's life. generosity is always worth it.
timmy was excited. he had a special surprise waiting for him at school today. his mom had told him he was going to see something "very fun" in his classroom.

when he arrived, timmy saw that someone was in the room. he saw a big, gray box in the corner.

"mom, who is that?" asked timmy.

"that is a surprise for you, sweetheart," said his mom. "see what he is selling?"

timmy looked closer at the box and saw that inside was a toy. he was so excited. the toy was gray, too!

"can i buy it, mommy?" asked timmy.

his mom smiled and said, "yes, of course you can."

timmy knew right away that his new gray toy was the best surprise ever. he couldn't wait to show it off to his friends in the classroom.
once upon a time, there was a little girl who loved to explore. she was very curious and excited to find out what she would discover.

one day, she found a box with a colorful mask inside. she was amazed by its shiny colors and wanted to take it home. she held the mask close to her chest and the box too.

the girl was about to lift the box when she heard a noise coming from the corner of the room. she looked over and saw a smiling cat wearing the same mask she had found. the girl was so excited and wanted to give it try.

the girl immediately put on the mask and skipped over to the cat. the cat seemed happy to see her wearing the same colorful mask.

the girl lifted the box and brought it back home. she showed her mom and dad the mask, and they were both happy to see it.

the little girl and the cat wore the colorful masks in many adventures to come. the masks were always a reminder to the little girl of how much fun it is to explore and make new discoveries.

the other child laughed. â€œi donâ€™t think we should do that, itâ€™s too dangerous!â€

despite this warning, the small child insisted on sitting on the edge of the large yacht. she planted her feet and felt the wind blowing in her face. the other child stepped back in fear, but the three-year-old felt no fear. 

suddenly, the yacht made a large turn and the young girl found herself in a huge wave. she was so scared, but the water gently lifted her up and brought her back to the yacht. 

the other child laughed and hugged her friend. â€œi told you it was a bad idea to sit on the edge of the large yacht!â€ the young girl smiled, feeling very lucky.
once upon a time, there lived a chubby little girl. every day, she would skip around the park and take a look at the fire. she was mesmerised by its beauty and warmth. 

one day, she got a little too close to the fire and started to fill with fear. "don't be scared," said an old man. "the fire won't hurt you."

the little girl thanked the old man for his kindness and asked why she was not scared of the fire. "well, i can fill your heart with courage", he said, "by showing you how one can use fire to make beautiful things".

the old man showed the little girl how he could use fire to make cookies and cakes. the little girl smiled and had so much fun. the old man filled her heart with joy and it made her feel safe. 

from that day, the chubby little girl wasn't scared of the fire anymore. she knew how to use it in a safe and fun way.

"bizzy," mummy said sternly, "why are you bowing in my clothes?"

bizzy was a three-year-old girl. she had been playing in mummyâ€™s closet. she pointed to a bow that had fallen on the floor.

"that bow was pretty," bizzy said pleadingly.

mummy sighed. she picked up the bow and put it back in the closet.

"you must be careful with my clothes," mummy said. "and no more bowing, okay?"

bizzy nodded solemnly. she knew she had been naughty. 

from then on, she was extra careful around mummyâ€™s clothes. but every now and then, she would take out the bow and give it a big, twirly bow.

one day abigail was at the park with her mother and her pet dog. abigail was running around, playing tag with her dog. suddenly, abigail heard her mother calling her name.

"abigail, it's time to go home," her mother said.

abigail was sad because she wanted to stay and play longer. her mother asked her if she remembered the slow walk rule. abigail nodded and began walking slowly.

as they walked home, abigail remembered how much fun she had at the park and made a promise to herself to play there again the next day.

max and tim were so excited that they quickly followed each other around the lab.

max said, â€œyouâ€™re right tim. we donâ€™t know whatâ€™s in there, so itâ€™s best to be safe and not go in.â€
so max and tim stuck together and continued exploring the lab.

once upon a time there was an icy faucet. the faucet was special. every day it splashed and giggled and sang!

one day, a little girl named lily came to see the faucet. she had a big smile on her face.

she said to the faucet, "hello faucet! let's play!"

the faucet was happy and said, "let's do it!"

lily and the faucet played all day, splashing and giggling and singing.

but then, something happened. lily started to tease the faucet. she would splash him with cold water or tickle him with her fingers. 

the faucet started to feel hurt and sad. he said to lily, "stop please! that's too icy for me!"

lily felt sorry for making the faucet sad. she hugged the faucet and said, "i'm sorry. i won't tease you anymore."

the faucet was happy again, and from then on lily and the faucet played gently, singing, splashing and giggling.
one day, a little girl named julia went exploring in the woods. she found a unique crystal! it was sparkly and shiny and very pretty. she wanted to keep it, so she put it in her pocket and kept walking.

suddenly, julia heard a mysterious voice. it said "tell me! tell me!" she looked all around, but she couldn't see anyone. julia was scared, so she just stayed where she was.

then the voice said again, "tell me about the crystal!" julia went closer and saw that it was a fairy who was talking to her! she told the fairy all about the unique crystal she had found.

the fairy smiled, and said "i'm so glad you found the special crystal. you can keep it if you like." julia smiled too, and thanked the fairy. then she said goodbye and went running back home, happy with her special crystal.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named dave. dave was a curious boy who liked to explore the world. one day, he decided to take a trip to the beach.

when dave got to the beach, he saw something amazing. a big whale was swimming around in the water. dave was so excited to see such a beautiful creature. he wanted to get closer, so he started to walk carefully along the shore.

dave eventually made it to where the whale was swimming. he watched in awe as the whale twirled around in the water. dave was so happy and excited.

suddenly, the whale started to make a loud noise. dave looked up and saw a boat nearby. it was filled with people that were throwing fishing nets into the water. the whale was trying to get away from them but it was getting more and more busy. 

dave quickly came up with a plan. he ran up to the boat and yelled at the people to stop. he explained to them that the whale is a living creature and that they should have respect for nature. 

the people listened to dave and soon they stopped fishing. dave was very happy that he was able to help the whale. he taught the people that everyone should become friends with nature, not fight it.
once upon a time, there was a small pepper. it was growing in a garden near a big tree. the pepper was happy, but it wasn't sure why. one day, it decided to ask the tree why it was happy.

it asked, "why am i so happy?". the big tree was quiet for a moment and then it said, "you are happy because you are alive".

the small pepper was surprised. it started thinking about the words the tree had said. it thought about how amazing it was to be alive and when it looked around, it realised that the garden was full of other small peppers.

the pepper was so happy that it thanked the tree and went off to show its friends. now, every time the pepper looks out into the garden, it remembers what the tree said and it smiles.
once upon a time, there was a boy named joe. he was walking through a forest when he came across a rare wet bird. joe wanted to keep the wet bird as a pet and so he reached out to grab it. but before he could, the bird flew away. joe was sad, but he knew he needed to keep walking to get home. 

suddenly, joe heard an unexpected sound. he looked around and saw the wet bird had returned. he was so excited and wanted to take the wet bird home with him. 

"no", said a voice from behind the trees. joe looked around and saw an old man standing there. the old man said, "that bird belongs in this forest. he is a very rare bird and must stay here." joe was sad and argued with the old man. he pleaded with him to let him keep the bird, but the old man refused. joe sadly had to return back home without the wet bird.
once there was a little girl. she was only three years old and very adventurous. one day, the girl's mommy said, "let's go to the park!" 

the little girl was so excited. she jumped up, grabbed her mom and said, "yippee! i'm ready!"

when they got to the park, the little girl wanted to explore. but she saw a large seat and was very fearful. she stopped and asked, "mommy, what's that big seat?"

her mom smiled and said, "it's a swing. it's fun to swing, but you have to stay on the seat to be safe. don't quit until i say it is time to." 

the little girl nodded. she got up on the seat cautiously and held on tight. she swung back and forth, laughing with delight. and soon, when it was time to go, the little girl quit the swing with a big smile.
once there was a small girl named daisy. daisy was very smart, but she also loved to play. one day, she went outside to the park with her teddy bear.

when she got to the park, daisy ran to the swings. she loved swinging! she wanted to go higher and higher. she was going so fast that her teddy bear was scared and shouted: "woah, slow down, daisy!" daisy laughed and kept swinging.

soon, daisy got tired and wanted to rest. she looked around and noticed a nice shelter next to the swings. it was big and had a roof and a bench. she sat down and hugged her teddy bear. they both felt better and happy in the shelter.

they stayed in the shelter until night. daisy was so smart and brave! she had a great day swinging and being safe in the shelter.
once upon a time there were two friends, peter and mary.

one day, mary wanted to eat some avocado. she asked peter to get one from the fridge and he agreed. when he brought the avocado to mary, she disagreed with him because it was too big.

peter thought the avocado was just right and started to argue with mary. he said the avocado was perfect but she disagreed.

suddenly, they had an idea - they could put the avocado in a blender and make it into a smoothie!

peter thought this was a crazy idea, but mary liked it. peter had to admit it was a good idea and agreed to try it.

after they blended the avocado, they both liked the smoothie and agreed it was the best thing they ever tasted. they shared the smoothie and had a great time.

once upon a time there was a little girl called lucy. she loved to play hide and seek with her family. one day, lucy decided she would be the one to hide. she hid behind an old photo frame in the lounge. her family went looking for her. they searched for a long time but soon gave up and decided to sit down on the sofa. but lucy had been very so still, so they hadn't seen her hiding behind the frame.

suddenly lucy piped up, "boo!" her family jumped up in surprise. they all laughed, and then lucy said, "i was hiding very fast!" everyone smiled, and they decided to play one more round. this time, it would be lucy who was looking for the others. she ran around the house, peeking under tables and behind the curtains. at last, she found everyone hiding behind the photo frame. she'd done it! lucy shouted "i found you!" everyone cheered and then they decided to keep playing the game.
once upon a time there was a loyal fox. he was very curious and was always looking for adventure.

one day, he felt a strong wind coming and heard a loud noise like thunder. he looked up and saw lightning in the sky. it was a magical sight and he couldn't resist. so he decided to go dance with the lightning. 

he raced up the hill and danced with all his might. as he twirled around the lightning, he felt a special joy. he jumped and leaped and twirled in the sky.

suddenly, he heard a voice calling out. it was his mom. "come home now," she said, "it's time for dinner."

so the loyal fox stopped dancing and raced back home. he was so happy, he had made a new friend - the lightning. he felt a strong bond and knew he would never forget this magical day.
one day emily was in her backyard when she saw a swamp. she had never seen a swamp before and she was very excited. she looked out over the swamp and it was so lively. the sun was shining and she could see butterflies whizzing through the air. 

emily wanted to get a closer look so she decided to go stand in it. she hopped and skipped over to the edge of the swamp. when she got there, she heard a voice. it said, "you can stand in here if you want, but be careful! the ground is wet and it can get slippery." emily remembered the voice's words and slowly stepped into the swamp.

it felt strange standing in the swamp. she stood there, taking in all the sights. the swamp was alive with the chirping of birds and the buzzing of bees. she felt free and happy as she explored. 

when it was time to go home, emily slowly stepped out of the swamp and thanked the voice for its warning. she smiled, understanding that the swamp is a safe and lively place.
once there was a little girl called beth. beth wanted to help her mommy in the garden so she went outside.

the sun was shining brightly. it was clear and beautiful. beth looked around and saw some flowers that needed watering. she grabbed the watering can and filled it with water from the tap.

beth ran to the flowers, knelt down and began to water them. she sang a song as she worked.

mommy came out of the house and smiled. "you're helping me a lot, beth," she said. "thank you!"

beth smiled back. she was so proud of herself. she felt like she could help anyone in the world!

the sun kept shining brightly and beth kept helping her mommy until it was time to go inside.
charlie was playing a game with his friends. one of his friends suggested they have a race. everyone smiled and began to race. 

charlie was the fastest, but he frowned as he saw his friends struggling to keep up.

a little butterfly flew by, and charlie said to his friends, "look, a butterfly!" they all smiled and watched the harmless creature fly away.

charlie smiled and said, "let's race again!" everyone agreed and raced once more. 

this time, everyone had fun and no one frowned. they all finished laughing and panting from the race. charlie had won again and everyone cheered.
once there was a small bear named winter. winter loved to explore in the woods and one day, he discovered a small doorway hidden in a tree. 

excitedly, winter stepped through and found himself in a new and magical world. he gasped when he saw that flowers glowed in the dark and trees were shaped like animals! 

winter was looking around when he noticed someone standing nearby. it was a small fairy. she said, "hello, winter! what is your name?" 
winter smiled and said, "my name is winter." 

the fairy laughed and said, "that's a wonderful name! i'm glad you're here. you can explore and make friends in this magical place!" 

winter was so excited! he thanked the fairy and began exploring. he made many new friends and enjoyed discovering all the wonderful things in the magical world. 

winter will never forget his magical time in the small doorway deep in the woods.
once upon a time, there was a young girl named sarah. she was 3 years old and loved to explore the world.

one day, sarah was playing outside with her friend bob. suddenly, sarah noticed a strange vehicle in the sky. "what is that?" she asked bob.

bob didn't know what it was, so the two young explorers decided to search for the vehicle. as they looked up, they saw the vehicle getting closer. sarah began to feel scared, but bob was ready to investigate.

they both approached the vehicle and saw a man inside. he asked them why they were looking for him. sarah told him that she wanted to find out what it was.
 
the man smiled and said, "it's a ufo! i'm here to explore the world, just like you two!"

sarah felt excited and asked if she could come along next time. the man said yes and flew away with a wave goodbye. 

sarah and bob were overjoyed and ran back home, eager to tell their families about their adventure.
once upon a time, two siblings, jimmy and amanda, were playing in the park. jimmy was loading a rock into a truck, while amanda was running around and making the prettiest of flowers with a piece of paper. suddenly, jimmy noticed a big pile of smelly trash near the fence and he called his sister amanda.

â€œamanda! look at this,â€ he shouted, pointing at the pile of trash, â€œit's disgusting!"

amanda put her hand over her nose and said, â€œeeeew! what happened here? let's clean this up!â€

jimmy and amanda got to work and, one by one, they loaded the trash into a big bin, keeping their knee close to the ground. 

when the park was finally clean, both siblings felt great. they had worked together and taught each other the importance of taking care of the environment.

the moral of the story is that when you work together, getting rid of anything disgusting can be easy. so it's always better to have a friend or family by your side!
joey loved playing with his friend penny. today they decided to take a walk around the park. joey looked around and noticed the fog was getting closer. but he wasn't scared, because he knew his friend was dependable.

so together they began to walk. as they went around the lake, joey suddenly heard a sound. he stopped and asked penny, "what was that?" 
"it's a whistle," answered penny. "let's follow it."

they began to follow the whistle, until it led them to a wooden bridge. they looked around and saw an old man who was smiling and whistling. he said, "hello my children. are you ready for an adventure?" 
joey and penny smiled and eagerly said, "yes!" 

the old man then took them on a magical journey through the fog. they saw all sorts of wonderful things. the old man said goodbye to joey and penny and wished them well.
 
joey and penny thanked the old man, and said goodbye. as they walked back home, joey whispered to penny, "thank you for being so dependable today." 
"you're welcome," penny smiled.
molly was so excited to go for a walk. she had put on her shiny pink coat and was pulling on her mittens. she had asked her mom if she could bring along her favourite squeaky toy and her mom said yes. 

molly ran ahead, her tiny shoes slapping with every step down the path. mom called out, "wait for me, molly!"

molly stopped and looked back. her mom had not tied her shoes yet and was trying to catch up. "come on, let's get your shoes tied." 

molly waited impatiently as her mom prepared her shoes with the tight knots. finally, mom tied the second heel and said, "good, now we're ready to go."

molly was so happy, she held up her squeaky toy and ran ahead again. she laughed, happy to be out for a walk with her mom.

"look at the tree!", said timmy. he was amazed to see so many olives! he touched one of them and smiled. 

"wow!", said timmy. "i want to admire all the olives!" 

he started to pick some olives from the tree and put them in a basket he found nearby. after a while, timmy had filled his basket with olives and was very proud of his hard work. 

"i did it!", he said. "now i can admire all the olives i've got." 

timmy was so happy that he decided to take the olives home and share them with his family. they all admired the olives, and enjoyed their fresh, delicious taste. it was the perfect reward for timmy's hard work.

once upon a time there was a nosy cow named lucy. every day lucy liked to go for walks around the farm. while she was walking one day, she saw something strange in the barn. 

lucy got closer to the barn to investigate and saw the farmer trying to prevent something from escaping. she was so nosy that she couldn't help but moo at the farmer to ask what was going on. 

"go away cow," yelled the farmer. "you can't come in here. i'm trying to keep this nasty fox locked up so it can't get out and hurt the other animals." 

but lucy was too nosy and kept trying to sneak into the barn. the farmer finally got so annoyed that he opened the door and let the fox out. the fox ran outdoors and started chasing lucy. 

lucy was so scared that she ran and ran until she was too tired to go any further. when the farmer finally caught up to her, the fox had already chased her off of the farm. 

lucy was never seen again. the nosy cow hadn't listened to the farmer and that prevented her from ever returning to the farm.
once upon a time, there was an elderly man who used to take a walk every day. one day, he felt an itch on his nose and was about to scratch it when suddenly he spotted a young boy and girl nearby playing tag!

the elderly man was quite excited to see the children playing and laughing together, so he decided not to scratch his nose. he watched them as they ran around and he smiled.

after a few minutes, the children's mother noticed the elderly man watching the children and asked him why he was there. the elderly man replied, "i'm just here to see how lovely you and your children are behaving."

the mother was pleased and thanked him for not scratching his nose while the children were playing. she realized what a kind gesture this was from the elderly man, and she thanked him again before he left.

the story has a moral value - it is important to always behave in a kind and courteous way, even when you have an itch.
one day, a mommy and her little girl were walking in the forest. they came across a beautiful lake, surrounded by tall trees and a house in the distance. the mommy said, "this is a wonderful place to play. let's go explore." 

the little girl smiled and stepped forward, but suddenly she started to scream. without thinking, the mommy raced to her daughter's side. she saw a mop lying on the ground and a dead bird beside it. the mommy said, "my darling, don't scream. it must have been a hunter." 

the little girl was scared, so the mommy hugged her tight. that night, the mommy said, "remember what you saw today, darling. it will help you in the future." 

the little girl didn't understand, but she nodded anyway.

years later, when the little girl was grown up, she returned to the same spot. while exploring the area, she heard a hunter shouting and a gunshot firing. suddenly, she remembered the mop and dead bird from long ago. she knew it was a warning and quickly left. 

the mommy was right. the little girl remembered the earlier foreshadowing, and it saved her life.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named sarah. she loved to paint and spent all her free time creating beautiful pictures. one day sarah went outside to paint, taking a bottle of paint and a brush with her. 

as she was painting, she looked down and noticed a broken bottle. she carefully picked it up and noticed that it was empty, so she decided to use it as a paint bottle. she filled it with paint and continued painting her picture. 

sarah was having lots of fun until, all of a sudden, the broken bottle broke. paint was everywhere! sarah began to cry, but then she heard someone say, "don't worry, i can help you." 

she looked up, and there was a kind old man. he asked her if she still wanted to paint, and she said yes. so the old man gave her a new bottle of paint and a brush, and they continued painting together. 

sarah had lots of fun painting with the old man and never forgot that day. every time she saw a broken bottle, she remembered the kindness of the old man.

one day, his mom wanted to decorate the porch too. she bought a big box of decorations, but they didn't look as good as what billy had made. 

billy was upset. he didn't want mommy to change his special decorations. he started to cry and threw the new decorations off the porch.

this made mommy very angry. she yelled at billy and told him that he was being very naughty.

billy was very sad now, as he didn't mean to make mommy angry. he decided to try and fix it. he took the decorations and put them back up, but this time he made a unique design with them. 

mommy smiled when she saw the decorations. she was very proud of billy and hugged him tight. from then on they would always work together to decorate the porch and make it even more beautiful.
john and becky were best friends. everyday, they would go to the park and play. today, they had something special planned.

john said, "let's play tag. but this time i want to do it with my eyes closed". becky was a bit scared but she agreed.

so, they started to run around the park, with john's eyes closed. he was running dizzy, hopping from one foot to the other. suddenly, john tripped and hurt his toe. he screamed in pain and opened his eyes, looking around.

becky had known that this might happen, so she ran away. john wondered why she had left, but he was in too much pain to follow her. he had no one to help him complete the game. he lay alone in the park, feeling dizzy and upset.
once upon a time there was a sad little bird. he was feeling lonely on this day and there was nobody around. he looked everywhere, but could not find anyone to play with him.

he flew up high in the sky and let out a loud, sad cry. he was hoping that someone might hear him, but there was only silence in the air.

just then, a friendly voice called out from above. it belonged to a nice, kind cloud. "don't be sad little bird" said the cloud. "come fly with me and i will provide you with some joy and fun today".

the bird eagerly flapped it's wings and flew up above. he was no longer feeling lonely, and the cloud was able to bring him some joy. they spent the day together, playing games, chasing each other and singing songs.

the bird was filled with happiness and thanked the cloud for providing him with such a wonderfully fun day. from then on he would never be lonely, for he had made a new, special friend.
one day johnny was walking in the park. he saw a cool frog and went to take a closer look. "hello mr. frog, how are you today?" he said.

the frog smiled. "i am doing well, but i need to sneeze!" he replied. johnny thought it was very strange for a frog to sneeze, but he was a friendly frog who wanted to help. so johnny said, "maybe you need to take a break, find a nice and cool spot and have a rest".

the frog thanked johnny and hopped away. later in the day, johnny saw a rainbow in the sky. suddenly he knew why the frog needed to sneeze. he remembered how he had told the frog to find a cool spot - the rainbow was a sign that he had been successful!

the moral of the story is that it's important to be kind and help others - even if it seems like a small thing at first, it could have a big effect! johnny's thoughtfulness helped the frog find the perfect spot to take a break and sneeze in peace.
once upon a time, two friends jenny and jack were in the park. jack said to jenny, "look! it's a beef!" 

jenny said, "let's catch it!" 

so they both ran and chased the brown beef. but the beef was so fast, they couldn't catch it. they ran and ran until they were so tired that they fell over. 

jack said, "oh no! we missed it." 

jenny started to cry and jack said, "don't cry. let's go home and get some other food. it will be ok." 

they went home and ate some delicious food. jack said, "see, it's ok. you don't have to cry anymore." 

jenny gave jack a big hug and said, "thank you, jack. you are the best friend ever!"
once upon a time there was a country far, far away. everyone in the country used to be happy and the land was nice and clean. but one day, something changed. the people in the country stopped taking care of it, and the land became very filthy. everything was dirty, from the ground to the houses.

the people wanted to do something about it, but they didn't know what to do. so, they decided to include everyone in the country to help. they asked all the children and grown-ups to come together and help clean up the land.

every day they worked and slowly the country started to become clean again. after a few months, things were looking bright and the people were happy again. their hard work included picking up the trash, sweeping the streets and planting flowers. now the country was beautiful again!
once upon a time there were two friends, bee and bird. everyday, they used to stir the earth to plant the seeds. but one day bee wanted to plant some spicy seeds, while bird wanted to plant regular ones. bee said to bird, "let's plant these spicy seeds; they will make the earth taste delicious!" bird disagreed, "regular seeds will make more flowers!"

bee and bird started to argue, but eventually they found a compromise. bee said, "let's plant both kinds of seeds, the regular ones and the spicy ones." bird agreed, and so they planted all kinds of seeds in the earth.

when the flowers bloomed, they were beautiful and more delicious than either bee or bird had imagined. bird said, "see how much better our garden looks when we work together?" bee nodded and smiled, understanding that with two minds, the work had become twice as tasty.

the lesson of this story is that working together is always better than working alone. we can always accomplish more when we work together. this is the beauty of friendship and collaboration.
once upon a time, a little girl was marching in the dark. she had a big smile on her face. the little girl was so happy that she started to march faster and faster. all of a sudden, her foot stepped on a rock. she felt scared and she stopped marching.

the little girl looked around, there was nothing but the dark all around her. she couldn't see a thing. she was brave, though, and she decided to march on. even though it was dark, she felt okay because she had a big smile on her face.

the little girl marched through the dark until she suddenly saw a light. then she could see that the darkness was not so dark after all. she was so happy and she kept on marching until she was out of the darkness and the darkness behind her was left far away.

now the little girl was out of the dark and she could see. she felt safe and she marched along, with a big smile on her face.

the girl opened the door and to her surprise, there was a group of kids, all playing games with each other and having fun. she was so excited that she shouted, "hey guys! i am here too!"
the kids turned around and started to laugh, which made her feel embarrassed.

one of the kids came over to the girl and said, "don't worry! come and join us! we love playing games."

once upon a time there was a modest building. inside the building lived a family of four. mama, papa, nick and nora. one day the family had an argument. mama and papa were shouting, and nick and nora became very scared. 

nick and nora felt that they needed to get out of the building. the two split up and ran out of the building. they found a big tree in a nearby park and nick climbed it, hoping that he could get away from it all. nora saw him and decided to join him so the two could talk. 

as nick looked around from the tree he realised that the family's argument was like a tiny drop in the world. it seemed so small compared to everything else - the sky, the trees and the sun. he asked nora, "how can the family's argument be so big and scary when everything else is so big and peaceful?". nora thought for a moment and then said, "maybe it's because we are too close to it, and it's hard to see the bigger picture". 

the two realised that sometimes it's better to take a few steps back and look at a situation from a broader perspective. this gave them the courage to go back inside the modest building and talk to their family.
once upon a time, there was a prince. he was very impatient. he wanted to gain more power, so he set out on a journey.

one day, he came across an old woman, who said to him: "if you want to gain power, you must go to the far away mountain." so, he set off to the mountain.

when he reached the mountain, the old woman met him again. this time, she said: "you must wait sixteen days and the power will be yours!"

the prince was very impatient and he was not worried about waiting. he wanted power right away! so, he decided to take a shortcut. he looked for a magical flower to use, so he could gain power in fewer days.

after a few days, he found the flower. he was eager to get his power. but then, something bad happened. he slipped and fell into a deep pit, and he died.

moral of the story: patience is a virtue!
once upon a time, there was a silly boy named john. he loved to play with the squash he found in his garden. 

one day, after playing for a long time, he was getting very tired and he decided it was time to go home and get ready for bed. 

on the way home, john heard a funny noise coming from a bush. he stopped to take a look, and found a tiny squirrel asleep in the middle of the bush. its little nose was twitching and his eyes were closed, just like it was sleeping.

john was so excited. he tiptoed closer, and softly whispered "shhh, it's time for a nap now."

john and the little squirrel stayed like that for a few moments until the squirrel opened its eyes and hopped away.

john smiled and waved goodbye as he watched the little squirrel running away. 

he was so thankful to have seen something so silly and sweet, and he went home feeling very happy. 

he washed up and put on his pajamas, then jumped into bed for a nice, long sleep.

mom smiled and said, "don't worry! it is just a candle burning." jack felt relieved and asked, "oh, what kind of candle?" 

mom replied, "it is a special candle, it smells like apple pie! doesn't it smell nice?" jack smiled and said, "yes, it smells great!"

once upon a time, there was a bee who lived in a huge hive. this bee was called bob, and he was very curious. bob wanted to explore the world outside his hive but he knew he wasn't allowed.

one night, he thought up a plan. he decided to sneak out the next morning when everyone else was asleep.

that morning, bob slowly made his way towards the entrance of the hive. just as he was about to sneak out, a kind voice said, "wait bob."

it was bob's mother. she said, "it's not right to go without permission. you must ask me if it's okay to go before you leave."

bob thought for a moment before he replied, "okay, will you permit me to go outside and explore the original world around me?"

his mother smiled and said, "yes, but you must be back before night time."

bob excitedly thanked his mother and set off on his adventure. he was so happy to be able to explore the original world. he looked forward to telling the other bees what he saw when he returned.

lucy said, "no, i don't want to go".

mummy said, "why don't you want to go to the zoo?"

lucy said, "i'm scared of the dark. the zoo is dark and i don't want to go".

mummy said, "it's not dark, it's light. just look out the window, you can see the sun shining".

lucy used her clever brain and thought about it. she looked out the window and saw that it was light outside. she smiled and said, "okay, i'm ready to go".

so mummy, daddy and lucy all hurried to the zoo and had a lovely day.

"what do i have to do mom?" asked liz.

"you have to water this green plant," her mom answered. 

liz took a deep breath, but her hands still trembled. she didn't know how to do it. 

"don't worry," her mom said with a smile. "the water will make the plant happy. it's easy, just pour a little water on it."

liz tried again, and this time her hands stopped trembling. the water came out of her tiny cup and the plant was happy.

liz smiled and hugged her mom.

it felt good to do something brave.

the second friend said: "yes, of course you can!"

once upon a time there was a baby who wanted to fly. the baby loved to watch birds flying in the sky and wanted to join them. every morning the baby went out and tried to fly. he flapped his arms and jumped in the air, but he couldn't fly.

one day the baby noticed a zigzag flying in the air. he watched with amazement as the zigzag soared in the sky. he realized that he could fly like the zigzag if he just opened his arms.

the baby tried again, this time opening his arms wide. he flew in a zigzag pattern, up and down and around the sky. he felt so free and happy! he flew higher and higher and enjoyed the open space of the sky.

soon the baby had to come down, but he would never forget the feeling of flying. from that day on he loved trying to fly, just like the zigzag.

once upon a time, there was a famous bear called bob. he loved to draw on the blackboard in his house. every day he created colourful pictures of suns and stars, trees and animals. one day, bob saw a bee flying by, and decided he wanted to try drawing one too. he got out his chalk and started to draw on the blackboard. 

as he was drawing, the chalk got caught in the blackboard and broke in half. bob was very sad. he wanted to finish the bee, so he tried to take the broken piece out of the blackboard. in the process, bob suffered a cut on his arm. 

bobâ€™s neighbour, a mouse, saw what had happened and ran to him. â€œoh bob! are you okay?â€, the mouse asked. 

bob shook his head and said, â€œi suffered a cut. i was so excited to draw the bee!â€

the mouse smiled and said, â€œi know the feeling. just go slowly and carefully next time. and remember, youâ€™re a famous bear!â€

bob thanked the mouse and then slowly and carefully carried on finishing his bee picture.
one day, three year old daisy was playing in her backyard. suddenly, she noticed a bright blue bird perched at the top of the stairs. it chirped loudly and she smiled. 

suddenly, the bird flew into the air and twirled around. with one graceful movement, the bird dove into the bushes. 

daisy hopped up and ran to the top of the stairs. she peered into the bush but the bird was gone! she was a bit sad but then she heard a noise coming from the other side of the bushes.

she crept over to the other side and saw the blue bird resting in a bright pink flower. she couldn't believe how colourful it was! clapping her hands loudly, daisy asked the bird, "hello, where did you go?". 

the bird chirped and flew away. daisy watched it dive into the sky and smiled. she ran back to the stairs and waved goodbye to her new friend.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named susie. she was only 3 years old. susie felt very alone and felt like she didn't belong. one day her mommy asked her, "susie, why do you feel so miserable?"

susie looked up at her mommy and said, "because nobody wants me. i can't do things like the big kids do and no one let's me play."

her mommy smiled kindly and said, "oh susie, you can do lots of things. yes, maybe you can't do some things like the big kids but that doesn't mean you don't belong. come here. i want to show you something."

susie followed her mother into the kitchen. mommy opened the cupboard and took out a big jar. it was full of colorful candy. 

"do you see this jar susie? every candy has a different taste and it is all special. just like those candies, everyone is different but everyone still belongs. just like you. you are special and you belong." 

susie smiled. she realized that even though she was different, she was still special and she did belong.
once upon a time there was a little girl called lucy. she was three years old and loved to explore her house. one day, she found an old flute tucked away in a cupboard. 

curious to know what it sounded like, lucy grabbed the flute and put it to her lips. as soon as she blew into it, a weird noise came out of the flute! lucy was so surprised that she kept blowing into it, creating different noises every time.

suddenly, her mom heard the strange noise. she came running into the room and said, "lucy, what are you doing? you should keep the flute away and leave it alone".

but lucy wasn't ready to stop playing with the flute. she kept blowing on it and was having too much fun!

in the end, mom had to take the flute away from her little girl and promised her that if she listened to her mom, she'd give her a new one.

the next day, lucy's mom found a special flute for her daughter, one that made beautiful music instead of weird noises. lucy was overjoyed and promised to keep the flute safe and take good care of it.
once upon a time, there was a little rabbit. he was a silly rabbit, hopping all around the house. he wanted to go outside, so he opened the door and hopped out into the garden!

the rabbit saw a big beautiful tree and hopped over to it. he was so excited he started to run around in circles. but then he stopped and sighed. the ground was so hard and he wanted to rest. he could feel his little feet getting tired. 

the rabbit found a comfortable spot under the tree and lay down for a nap. suddenly, he heard a little voice coming from inside the house. it was his friend, the 3 year old.

"rabbit! rabbit! where are you?!" the little one shouted. the rabbit hopped out from under the tree and waved his little paw. the 3 year old smiled and ran over to the rabbit.

"i thought i lost you!" the 3 year old said, with a huge silly grin on their face. the rabbit patted the little one's head and sighed with relief. he was so happy to be reunited with his best friend.
once upon a time there was a mighty toy. the toy was a big teddy bear and it was liked by everyone who saw it.

one day, a little boy named john saw the toy and he wanted to wear it. so he put it on and it was so big and heavy that he couldn't move.

john was stuck and a stranger came by. he asked john what had happened and john told him the story.

the stranger chuckled and said, "that's too bad. i don't think you can ever take it off!"

john was scared and asked the stranger what he should do, but the stranger just walked away, leaving john to figure it out by himself.

and so john had to wear the mighty toy forever! the end.
once there was a wise old owl. he was the wisest owl in the forest. late one night, he began to think. "what is the meaning of life?" he thought.

just then, he heard a tiny voice in the darkness. "hello, mr. owl," said a small voice.

startled, the owl looked around. then he spotted the source of the voice - a small mouse was standing nearby.

the owl blinked in surprise. "what can i do for you, little friend?" he asked.

the mouse smiled shyly. "i think the meaning of life is to be happy," she said.

the owl thought for a moment, then smiled. "you are very wise for one so small," he said.

the mouse smiled back. then, with a tiny wave, she scampered away.

the owl watched her go, still smiling. he knew that the mouse was right - being happy was indeed the meaning of life.
once upon a time, there was a husband and his wife who lived a happy life in a small village. one day, the husband decided to build a new house for his wife. the couple worked all day and night to set up their new home.

the husband wanted to make sure his wife had a warm and cozy home. he made sure to cover the house with a special mild-colored paint.

the husband turned to his wife with a big smile on his face. he said: "do you like the new house i made for you?"

the wife smiled back. "yes," she said. "it's beautiful. thank you for covering our home with such a lovely color."

the couple hugged and went inside their new house to make a start on their happy life.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named tim. every day, he went outside to play games with all of his friends. 

tim was always excited to play and always wanted to win, so he tried his best every time. one day, he was playing on the jungle gym, and all his friends were jealous of how good he was. 

a lawyer walked by and said to them, "why don't you all give tim a challenge and make him prove that he is the best?"

all of the children agreed, so they made a contest. whoever could stay on the jungle gym the longest would be crowned the winner. tim was very happy and took on the challenge. 

he made it to the end, but his friends said he cheated. the lawyer stepped in and said, "you must all prove that he was guilty of cheating before you can declare him the winner".

the friends started arguing, but the lawyer said there was no need. he had seen tim play the entire time and said he was the clear winner. 

everyone was happy and celebrated tim's victory. from that day on, he was nicknamed the 'king of the jungle gym' and everyone know not to mess with him.
max and his mom were walking together in the cold park. max was balancing a stick in his hands. he was very proud of himself! his mom was impressed too.

"wow," said mom. "that's very impressive max! you look so strong, balancing that stick across your body."

max smiled, feeling proud of his skills. he wanted to show her more, so he began to balance on one foot. as he tried to steady himself, his foot slipped, and his body wobbled from side to side.

"don't worry, max," mom said. "balance takes time. you just need to practice more."

max nodded, determined to get better. he kept practicing, and slowly his balance improved. soon, his mom said it was time to go back home.

"good job, max. you are getting better and better at balancing. keep up the good work!"

max smiled and hugged his mom, feeling happy and proud of himself. he said "thanks, mom!" and they walked in the cold together, heading back home.
once there was a clumsy player called bill. he was playing by himself outside in the garden. bill was running around and having lots of fun.

suddenly he paused and saw something shiny lying on the ground. he bent down to pick it up and realised it was a shiny toy car. he smiled as he looked at it.

bill wanted to play with the car, so he started pushing it around the garden. suddenly the car started to move fast! bill was so excited that his movements became very clumsy, and he fell down.

then there was a voice from behind.

"be careful with the car, bill", said his mum. bill's mum gave him a hug.

bill felt embarrassed but he was happy that his mum was looking after him. he hugged her back and said, "i won't be clumsy again". 

bill resumed playing with the car, but this time he was very careful. he had lots of fun and remembered to listen to his mum!
once upon a time, there was a man who lived beside the sea. every day, he went to the beach and watched the original waves roll in. 

one day, the man noticed a strange thing. he saw a turtle start to escape from the sea. the man went closer and saw that the turtle had a small wagon on its back. 

the man asked the turtle, "where are you going?" 

the turtle replied, "i am escaping from the sea. i want to explore other places, but i can't do it without my wagon."

the man thought it was a nice idea. "if you leave, i will miss you," he said. but he also thought it was brave of the turtle to go on an adventure.

the next day, the man said goodbye to the turtle. then, the turtle went on its way. the man waved goodbye and watched the turtle make its escape. 

from that day on, the man thought of the turtle fondly. he remembered the original explorer who taught him the rewards of taking risks.
once upon a time, there was a mom and her daughter. the daughter was very obedient and was always kind to everybody. 

one day, the mom asked her daughter, "would you like to go for a picnic today?" 

the daughter was very excited, "yes mommy!" 

they spent the day together, playing games and laughing. when they were nearly done, the mom decided to spoil her daughter: "let's have a victory picnic!" 

the daughter was so happy. she said, "yes please, mommy!"

so the mom packed their food and they ate until they were full. the daughter was so happy that her mom had spoiled her with a victory picnic. they both returned home with smiles on their faces. 

the end.
once upon a time, there were two little kids, jenny and tom. they were best friends and had lots of fun together.

one day, tom and jenny were playing in the garden and they found an old, rusty drum. jenny was so excited and wanted to show it to tom.

tom, who was a bit shy, said, "what is it?"

jenny replied, "it's a drum! let's play it!"

tom thought it was a great idea, so they took the drum and started to play. they banged on the drum and made a loud noise that the neighbours could hear.

jenny and tom kept playing the drum and got better and better with it. soon enough, they were playing it like pros and making music every day!

every day, jenny and tom would mention the drum and talk about how regular they were getting and how much fun they had.

the end.
once upon a time there was a sleepy little girl named amy. she was three years old and she loved going on adventures. 

one day she saw a big lock. on the lock was a picture of a zebra. amy wanted to explore what was behind the lock.

amy asked her mom, "mama, what's behind the lock?"

her mom said, "with the key, you can unlock it and find out!"

amy was excited and she grabbed the key. she put it into the lock and twisted it. the lock clicked open!

amy pulled the lock open and skipped inside. there she found a big surprise - a beautiful, sleepy zebra! 

amy was so excited that she hugged the zebra and gave it a kiss. then she and the zebra went on a magical adventure together!

the lucky turkey decided to take the egg home. on the way, she passed a farmerâ€™s barn and his barnyard animals stared at her with curious eyes. the turkey felt a little awkward, so she quickened her step and kept going.

at home, the lucky turkey carefully put the egg down into a special basket. then she ran off to tell her family about her lucky find. everyone was so excited! they sat around the table and all clucked together, celebrating the lucky turkeyâ€™s newfound treasure.

and they all lived happily ever after, spoiling the lucky turkey with treats every day.

suddenly, her mommy said, "what are you writing?" the little girl said, "a story about a little girl with a spoon, eating yogurt." 

"that is so cute!" said her mommy, smiling. the little girl finished her yogurt and happily went back to writing her story.
once upon a time, there was a little boy and his mom. the little boy was very brave and always looking for an adventure. one day, the little boy asked his mom, "can i go and peek in the garden?" his mom smiled, and said, "yes, but be careful". the little boy ran off to the garden, with a shiny rake in his hand. 

he suddenly stopped when he saw something moving in the grass. "what is that?" he thought. he was a little worried, but he was brave and he wanted to peek. he slowly peeked closer. all of a sudden, he heard a loud "meow!" he jumped back and saw a small, black kitten. the boy smiled. he knew he had nothing to be worried about. he slowly reached out and petted the kitten. 

the little boy was so happy that he opened the garden gate and called out from the garden to his mom. "mom, look! i found a kitty!" his mom came running, and the family welcomed the kitten into their home. 

the little boy was very proud of himself, and he went to bed with a happy smile on his face that night.

once upon a time there was a boy called tim. he was three years old and loved to play with his toys. one day, tim decided to take a walk outside. as he strolled along, he noticed something strange. it was a big, scary fish swimming in the river!

tim wanted to get a closer look, so he snuck up to the bank of the river and peered down into the water. to his surprise, the fish was a bright yellow colour and it seemed to be waiting for something.

tim decided he had to find out what the fish wanted. he smiled and asked the fish "what is your request?".

the fish replied "i would like some tuna. can you find me some?". tim was so excited! he quickly rushed home and returned with a freshly-caught tuna. he slowly placed the tuna in the water in front of the fish.

the fish jumped up and gobbled up the tuna. it thanked tim with a nod, and then quickly swam away.

tim was amazed. he quickly realized that he had just made a new friend. and he learned that, with a bit of courage, nothing is too scary.
nan and pap were on a huge vacation. nan took her bucket to the beach, and said to pap:

"let's go soak our feet in the ocean."

so, nan and pap wiggled their toes in the water. it felt so nice! the water was warm, and the sun was shining. pap said it was the best vacation ever.

after a while, nan and pap decided to sit down. nan put her bucket into the sand and said:

"let's make a huge sandcastle!"

so, nan and pap worked hard to make the sandcastle. it was almost done when a wave crashed over them, and they had to start all over again.

in the end, nan and pap had a huge sandcastle. they put their bucket on top and smiled.

"we did it!" said nan.

pap said: "this is the best vacation ever!"
once upon a time, there was a nosy little rabbit called flo. flo loved learning new things and was always asking questions.

one day, flo asked her mum what a calendar was. flo's mum smiled and said, "a calendar is a book with numbers and dates on it. we use it to keep track of time and things we need to remember." flo was curious, so she asked her mum to show her.

flo's mum took out an old calendar from the drawer and let flo look at it. flo asked her mum why the calendar had funny drawings, and flo's mum explained that each month had a different name and little symbol. she also told flo that she needed to be careful when holding the calendar, as it was very important.

flo looked at the calendar, marvelling at all the different names. finally, she came to the conclusion that a calendar was nosy. it was full of names and symbols and it was always asking questions. flo smiled at how accurate her new-found understanding was.
once upon a time, there was a small box. it was fragile, so everyone was very careful not to break it. the box belonged to a little girl who loved it very much.

one day, a bigger boy came along and wanted to play with the box. he was very clumsy and the little girl was scared he'd break it. but the boy said it belonged to both of them, so the girl agreed. 

they spent a fun day playing with the box, but the bigger boy was too rough and the box got broken. the little girl was very sad and started to cry. then, the bigger boy had an idea.

he went and found some glue and some tape. he tried his best to put the box back together, and the little girl helped too. after some time, the box was fixed and the girl was happy again.

from then on, they both took care of the box and made sure it wouldn't get broken again. the little girl was happy that the box belonged to both of them, and the boy was happy to help make the box special.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named jane. she was only 3 years old and liked to jog every day. one day, jane decided to jog to the park. she was so excited to explore!

when jane arrived at the park, she saw something large and round. it was a pear tree! jane saw lots of pears hanging, so she ran to them and started picking them. 

suddenly, jane heard a voice. it was an old man sitting on a bench. "do not pick those pears, they are not yours," he said in a serious tone.

jane was scared, and she started to jog away. but then she noticed something on the ground and stopped. it was a pear that had fallen from the tree.

"it's ok if i pick this one, right?" jane asked the old man. 

the old man smiled and said, "yes, you can pick this one, it's ok".

so jane picked the fallen pear and jogged home, happy to have something to eat. she made sure to obey the old man's serious instructions.

her mom said, "no, you can't go zoom in a helicopter. that would be bad."

but then, mary saw a plane in the sky and said, "but i can go zoom in a plane?"

and her mom said, "yes, but only with an adult. then it won't be bad."

mary was so happy! she was going to get to go zoom! she and her mom boarded the plane and took off. mary zoomed up and down and all around in the plane. she had a great adventure!

there was a robot and he wanted to play. he said to himself "let's clap my hands." he started to clap, slowly at first and then faster and faster. the robot smiled, knowing he was having fun.

the robot then noticed a soft pillows on the floor. he asked, "what is this?" there was no answer.

the robot marched across the room and found a little boy. he asked the boy, "may i clap with you?" the boy smiled and nodded.

the robot and the boy started to clap together, their hands becoming faster and faster. they laughed and smiled, happy that they could play this simple game. 

as they clapped, the robot noticed something extraordinary. where his hands touched the soft pillow, the pillow began to move. he couldn't believe it. he looked over to the boy with a shocked expression and said, "did you see that?" 

the boy looked down at the pillow, a huge grin spreading across his face. he said to the robot, "i think you have brought the pillow to life!" the robot's eyes lit up. he couldn't believe what he had done.

the robot and the little boy kept clapping, faster and faster, until the pillow began to move and dance around the room! the robot had given life to the soft pillow through his joyful clapping.
john and his mom were walking down a path in the woods. it was a sunny day, and the birds were chirping. suddenly, they saw a weird tunnel up ahead.

john was curious, but his mom told him to stay away.

"that's dangerous, john," she said.

john asked, "why is it so weird?"

"i don't know," his mom said, "but it's better to be safe and stay away."

john was a bit scared, but he also wanted to explore. his mom saw this in his eyes, and she smiled.

"don't worry," she said. "i'll be here to support you if you want to explore. but only if you promise to be very careful".

john nodded and grabbed his mom's hand. they walked towards the tunnel, and before long they were inside. 

john was in awe. he had never seen anything like it! he was very scared, but he was also very excited. his mom was there to support him, so he felt safe enough to explore the weird tunnel. 

by the time they reached the end of the tunnel, john had quite the adventure. he was glad that he had explored the weird tunnel, and he was also glad that his mom had been there to support him â€“ he would have been too scared to do it on his own!
once upon a time, there was a little girl who was very troubled. she was always sad and couldn't seem to find joy in anything. one day she walked out into the garden and saw an old man. he was sitting on a bench and stroking a player in his hand. the old man saw the little girl and smiled. 

"why do you look so troubled, little one?" he asked sweetly. 

the little girl tried to tell him how she was feeling but she didn't know the right words. she just kept shaking her head and crying. 

the old man understood and he took her hand. he said,
"i know how you feel when it's hard to find your smile. that's why i always carry my player around. it helps me remember that the world is still a happy place, even when we get tired or sad." 

the little girl looked up at the old man and wiped away her tears. for the first time in a long time, she felt like she could find her smile again.
willie was walking near the park when he saw a pastel. it was so pretty that he took it and put it in his pocket. he felt a little guilty, but he loved the pretty pastel. as he walked away he heard a voice calling, 

"willie! did you steal that pastel?"

willie didn't know what to do so he kept walking. his heart felt heavy and he felt like he had done something wrong. he knew he should tell the truth, but he didn't want to get in trouble. 

when willie made it home, he felt a bit better, but he still couldn't shake the guilty feeling. his mom found the pastel in his pocket and knew the answer right away. 

she smiled and told him, "willie, this pastel belongs to your neighbor, mrs. green. we should return it to her and apologize." 

willie wanted to do the right thing, so he said yes and went to mrs. green's house to return the pastel. mrs. green welcomed him with a hug and thanked him for bringing it back. 

willie felt so relieved and grateful that he had learned his lesson. he knew no matter how tempted he was, it was never okay to steal.

once upon a time, there was a tiny baby who went on a big adventure. he wanted to go on a journey to explore the world and discover something new.

the baby brought with him a few of his toys and headed out. along the way, he saw an ancient garden. he couldn't believe his eyes! he went into the garden and started to gather the things he found there.

"these are so exciting!" the baby squeaked. 

suddenly, he heard a voice coming from behind him. it was an old, wise owl.

"what are you collecting, little one?" the owl asked.

the baby was so surprised that he dropped his toys.

"i am gathering rocks and sticks," he said, feeling proud.

the wise owl smiled. "that is a very special thing you are doing. you will have lots of fun with those things".

the baby was so happy and thanked the wise owl before packing his treasures and continuing his journey. 

as he went along, the baby realised he had learnt something amazing. he had learnt that even the simplest things can be special and ancient!

once upon a time there lived a hero. he was very brave and strong, and he helped the people in his village.

one day, the people of the village asked the hero to help them. they wanted him to save them from the bad monster.

the hero was happy to help and quickly agreed. he gathered his brave friends and set off to find the monster.

after a long search, they finally arrived. the hero and his friends fought with the monster, and the hero managed to defeat it. everyone in the village was so grateful to the hero.

however, the hero was not feeling well and began to feel tired. the people of the village could not include him in their celebration and said goodbye.

sad and tired, the hero slowly walked away. he was never seen again and the people of the village were very sad. they never forgot their brave hero and remained grateful to him forever.

but then he heard a voice say, "come in! i am your friend." the voice sounded nice and he felt safe.
