once upon a time, there was a big monkey. he lived in a place far away, full of forests and animals. one day, the monkey was walking in the forest when he spotted a big barrel. he looked at it carefully and thought that he should try to lift it up. 

so he put his hands on the barrel and tried to lift it up. it was too heavy for him and he struggled to move it. just then, a little elephant walked by. the monkey asked the elephant for help.

the elephant was nervous, but he wanted to help the monkey. so he tucked his trunk under the barrel and using his strength, he lifted it up. 

the monkey was so happy and he thanked the elephant for his help. the elephant smiled and they both went their own way.

all of a sudden, a friendly voice came from the tree. "hello, jack," the tree said. "my name is wally, and i'm the guardian of the jewels. i know why you are on your journey and i'm here to help."

jack looked up in surprise and said, "thank you. i'm here to find a jewel that can make the world a better place."

wally told him, "if you go to the top of the rainbow, you'll find the jewel you are looking for."

the next day, jack did as wally said and climbed to the top of the rainbow. sure enough, at the top was an amazing sparkling jewel. jack took it, thanked wally, and set off on his journey.

he arrived home and added the jewel to a special box. it opened a doorway to a magical place and jack saw that the world was becoming a better place.

once there was a pig. he was very funny, and liked to run and play in the mud. one day, the pig went to the river to play. suddenly, a big fish came out of the water. the fish wanted to tease the pig. the pig felt helpless and didn't know what to do, so he ran away.

the fish followed the pig and kept trying to tease him. the pig ran and ran, and eventually he found a barrel of oil. he rolled around in the oil until he was covered in it.

the fish smelled the oil and didn't like it. he swam away and never teased the pig again. the pig was happy and safe, because the oil had scared away the fish. from then on, the pig made sure to stay close to the barrel of oil, so that he would never be helpless again.

inside the shop, he found lots of yellow things. he saw yellow dresses, yellow books and yellow toys. sam was very happy.

suddenly, he heard a voice. it said: "what do you want?" sam looked around and saw a shopkeeper.

the shopkeeper said: "what can i do for you, young man?"

sam said: "i want a yellow toy please!"

the shopkeeper smiled and said: "i think i have just the thing for you." he handed sam a yellow toy car.

sam said: "thank you! i will drive this car all around town!" he smiled and went out of the shop, back to his yellow car. and he lived happily ever after!

the voice replied, "it's me. don't be afraid. i'm here to settle something."

sally became more curious. she asked, "what do you want to settle?"

once upon a time, there was a blue bird named polly. she was kind and every morning she sang a happy song. one day, polly flew down to the market and saw something strange - a man selling poison! she flew closer and asked him, "what is that?".

the man replied, "this is poison. it can make you very sick. i'm selling it so you be careful".

polly flew away quickly and was worried. she told all her animal friends what the man said. but no one else believed her. "it's probably just medicine!", they said.

days passed and polly did not forget what she saw. she warned the others again and again. "the man will hurt you if you're not careful!", she said.

one day, polly flew back to the market and saw something terrible. the man was selling his poison to all of polly's animal friends! she was so angry that she swooped down and used her wings to push the poison away.

the man was angry and yelled at polly, "what do you think you're doing?!". polly replied, "i'm protecting my friends from your bad poison! you can't sell it here!".

the man quickly ran away and never sold his poison again. polly was a hero, and all her friends lived happily ever after!

once upon a time, there was a little goat who lived on a farm. all the animals on the farm were very happy. one day, the little goat found something special. it was a shiny red chilli! it looked so tasty and spicy!

the little goat was so excited. he couldn't wait to try it. but deep down he was afraid. he nervously put the chilli close to his nose, and took a small sniff. suddenly, he started to tremble, and quickly put it back down.

the goat's friend, a pig, noticed and waved his hoof. "why don't you try it?" he said. the goat had an idea. he picked up the chilli again and put it in his mouth, then stuck his thumb out to stop it from going any further.

the pig smiled. "go on, try it!" the goat hesitated, then mustered all his courage and took a brave little bite. surprisingly, it wasn't as spicy as he'd thought it would be!

the little goat smiled and jumped around with joy. he'd put his fears aside and found out that there was nothing to be so scared of! he had discovered something incredible. he was now brave and happy, thanks to the tasty spicy chilli!

"mom, what's that?" asked baby, pointing to a bright orange cord.

"that looks like a rope," said mom.

they reached out to touch it and a spark flew out. mom pulled baby away quickly and said, "that's very dangerous! it's burning!"

mom and baby backed away slowly and watched. small flames began to lick the cord, quickly becoming bigger and brighter. 

"it's amazing," said baby in amazement.

the fire grew and grew, until it was almost too hot to stay near. soon, it had burned out and mom and baby took a better look.

the orange cord was now a pile of ash. 

"wow! that was amazing," said baby. 

mom and baby smiled at each other. "let's move on, baby," said mom. 

and so they continued their journey, talking about the wonderful thing they had seen.

john looked around and saw what seemed to be a parade nearby. he saw many people wearing red, white, and blue. looking down at the seat, he could now see the colors of the flag more clearly. he understood: the seat was part of the decorations for the parade! 

john got up and hopped and skipped around the park. he admired each float and said hi to the people who greeted him. he enjoyed the parade and found each float even more beautiful than the last. finally, the parade ended and john returned to the spot where he had been resting. he looked back at his seat and smiled. 

john felt so lucky to have seen the parade from his special seat. he felt proud, knowing he had enjoyed the fair sight.

the peanuts went far away and found a big, empty bowl. the small peanut said, â€œlet's fill it up with something special!â€ 

the big peanut got very excited and said, â€œi know! let's fill it with lots and lots of peanuts!â€

so the two peanuts filled the bowl with all different kinds of peanuts. some were big, some small. some were round, some were long. 

when the bowl was full, the two peanuts proudly looked at their work. then, the small peanut said, â€œthis looks yummy. let's eat them all up!â€ 

and so they did! the two peanuts had a great time eating the different kinds of peanuts until their bowl was empty. 

the end.
the sun was shining in the city as jack and his parents went for a walk. jack laughed and smiled as he saw all the different things the city had to offer. suddenly, his parents split up and jack froze in shock. he was scared he wouldn't be able to find them again.

"mommy," jack said, his voice shaking a little.
"it's okay, jack" his mom replied. "you can trust me." jack and his father smiled reassuringly at him, and jack smiled back.

suddenly, jack and his parents passed a big park, with lots of swings and slides. jack wanted to have a go, but his father said they had to keep walking. jack began to cry, not understanding why he couldn't have a go. 

"i'm sorry, jack," his father said, holding back a smile. "but we have to be careful here, okay? it's best if we just keep walking."

jack felt sad, but he knew that his parents were looking out for him. he nodded and held on tight to his mom and dad's hands as they walked through the city. jack felt safe knowing that he could trust his parents to watch out for him.

the 3 year old wanted other people to have the same good feeling they had. so they went around and recommended the band to their family and friends. 

the 3 year old kept recommending the band to everyone and it was really helpful. soon the band became even more popular and everyone was happy!

the 3 year old was really proud of themselves because their recommendation was so important.
it was a very hot day and marty the bear was feeling lazy and tired. he wanted to find something fun to do, but he couldn't think of anything. suddenly he remembered something. "i know!" said marty, as he remembered a special challenge from his friends. they had told him about a large oak tree in the forest under which a mystery was hidden. marty knew that if he solved the mystery, he would have loads of fun.

excited, he got up and ran off to the woods. as he arrived, he saw the large oak tree up ahead of him and he was filled with anticipation. he searched the tree's trunk and branches, but he couldn't find the mystery. just then, he spotted a small hole behind the tree. he carefully peered inside and saw a shiny object. "what's this?" he said. marty had solved the mystery.

he reached inside and pulled out a shining golden treasure chest. inside were lots of bright and colourful toys and treats. marty was so happy, he decided to stay in the shade of the large oak tree to play with his new treasures. his solved the mystery and it was a day of fun and adventure.
once upon a time there was a naughty bear who lived in a forest. every evening, he would go to a meadow and pray. one evening, he saw a beautiful rainbow while he was praying. he thought it was so pretty and wanted to touch it.

he said, "please god, can i touch the rainbow?" but god didn't answer him.

just then, a rabbit hopped past. the bear asked the rabbit, "can i please touch the rainbow?"

the rabbit laughed and said, "no, naughty bear. you can't touch the rainbow. that's for god only."

the bear was sad, but he understood. he bowed his head and said, "okay, i won't touch the rainbow. i'll just keep on praying." 

so, every evening the naughty bear kept on praying, and he was so happy.
jane and her mom were having a picnic in the park. jane's mom spread the red and white checked cloth napkin on the grass. jane looked at her mom and said, "what should i do now?"

her mom smiled and pointed to the sky. "let's gaze up at the deep blue sky and look at the fluffy white clouds," she said. jane looked up and saw many shapes in the clouds.

then, she looked for a bird in a tree and noticed a big yellow feather floating on the ground. she picked it up and put it under the napkin to save it for later.

jane looked back up and said, "can we gaze at the clouds again?" her mom smiled and said, "yes, let's take a napkin break and gaze at the clouds."

they both laid back and watched the fluffy clouds float by above them. jane smiled and said, "this gazing is so much fun!" her mom agreed and said, "yes, it is!"
once upon a time there was a boy called jack. he was very adventurous. one day jack wanted to borrow something, so he asked his mom if he could borrow a lawn. she said yes and gave him a nice lawn to play with. jack was so excited to have the lawn!

he grabbed it and went outside. jack was having so much fun playing with the lawn on the grass. he ran, jumped, and rolled all over it. he pretended it was a big boat and sailed on the sea.

jack was having an incredible adventure with his lawn. but all too soon the sun began to set, and he had to go inside. he thanked his mom and put the lawn back in the shed in the garden. jack had had a very adventurous day, and he couldn't wait to borrow the lawn again!
sally was walking through the woods when she noticed a fierce net on the ground. she was curious and decided to shake it. as she shook the net, she heard a low growling noise. suddenly, a big, fierce animal appeared and sally got very scared. 

the animal was growling and pacing around the net. sally tried to get away but she was too scared. she tried to scream but nothing came out. the animal suddenly stopped and grabbed the net with its teeth. it shook it one more time, and something flew out of the net into the air! 

sally couldn't believe her eyes - it was a flurry of small, colourful birds! they were so beautiful and they flew around the forest, making all sorts of happy noises. sally had saved the birds from the fierce animal! 

from then on, sally visited the forest often to shake the net and release more birds. she was happy to have helped so many of them find their way to freedom.

"john," he said, "you should stop being so disobedient and do as i say!"

john kept disagreeing. his dad got even more angry and said, "if you don't listen, i'm going to spank you!"

john got scared, but he still disagreed. so his dad spanked him. john was sad and started to cry. his dad was mad and decided he would not talk to john for a long time.

john did not learn his lesson and kept disagreeing. from that day forward, he and his dad were never very close. john kept being spoiled and kept disagreeing, which made it much harder for them to get along.

mom said, "it's a puzzle! but don't worry, it's easy." 

the little boy was so happy. he couldn't wait to put it together and see what the puzzle would be. he hoped it would be fun and make him smile.

the little boy smiled with joy. mom had been right. the puzzle was easy and lots of fun! he was so happy he had worked so hard and the puzzle had paid off.

lucy nodded. she watched the dancer until it was time to leave. as they stepped out of the store, lucy beamed with joy and said, "it was so graceful!"

"what's happening?" asked bob.

"i don't know!" cried sara with fear.

the shaking grew stronger and the lightning became brighter. they had to move away from the screen. suddenly, the screen exploded and the room was filled with fire and smoke. bob and sara ran out of the room and hugged each other tightly. they both knew that the pretend play was over with a bad ending.

one day, she and her mother went to the beach to find a kayak. they spotted a fair kayak with vibrant colors. 

the girl asked her mother,"can i use it?" 

her mother smiled and said, "of course you can! let's take it home." 

the girl and her mother brought the kayak home. every day the girl practiced with her new kayak. she improved and became a very talented kayaker.

mandy and her mom were walking through a big park. mandy saw lots of boats in the lake and she was excited to ride one. she asked her mom if they could go for a boat ride.

her mom said, "maybe later, mandy. it looks a bit cold out there."

mandy shivered and wrapped her blanket around her. her mom smiled and said, "it looks like you need to get inside to stay warm."

mandy and her mom headed towards the house. when they got there, her mom said, "let's make something to eat. we can use the dishwasher to help us cook."

mandy liked the idea and they began cooking. but when they opened the dishwasher, they saw a mouse inside! mandy's mom looked very serious and said, "we can't turn it on now. we will have to find another way to cook the food."

mandy started to look around the kitchen. she finally found an old pot and said, "we can use this pot to cook the food."

her mom smiled and said, "that's a great idea, mandy!"

so mandy and her mom were able to cook their dinner without the dishwasher. mandy was glad that even though there was a problem, she could help to solve it.

finally, after a long, hard journey, the sailor arrived at his destination. everyone he met was able to unite and be kind to one another. they all shared the same goal now. the sailor felt proud that he was able to bring people together.

the end!
once upon a time, there was a human who loved to dance. he would move his body in smooth movements and made everyone smile. even when he was alone, he always seemed to be dancing.

one day, he saw a beautiful meadow filled with flowers and he knew it was the perfect place to dance. he smiled and started moving his body, spinning and twirling through the meadow. he felt so free and happy.

he moved so smoothly that some of the animals in the meadow stopped and watched. a rabbit, a squirrel, and a deer were all mesmerized by the human's dance. the human laughed and waved at them as he continued.

soon the sun started to set and the human knew it was time to go home. he thanked the animals for watching, and he gave them each a hug before he left. he took a deep breath and smiled, knowing he had enjoyed a wonderful day of smooth dancing.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named molly. she was three years old and loved to play.

one day, molly was looking through her mummy's messy drawer when she stumbled across a strange book. she picked it up and saw the word 'dictionary' written on the front. she was so curious, she just had to take a closer look.

molly opened the dictionary and saw lots of strange words that she didn't understand. she started to worry and wondered what all the words meant.

just then, molly's mum walked in and noticed that molly was holding the dictionary. she said to molly, "don't worry my darling, a dictionary is a book filled with lots of words and their meanings".

molly replied, "oh, so it's like a fun puzzle?"

molly's mum smiled and said, "yes, it sure is! why don't we look through it together and see what we can learn?"

molly was so excited and the two of them sat down and began reading the dictionary. it was so much fun and molly learned something new that day.
once upon a time, there was a tiny mouse called robbie who lived in a cozy nest near a peanut tree. robbie was so adorable and loved to eat peanuts all day. one day, he decided to try and reach for the peanuts himself.

robbie got up on his hind legs and asked the peanut tree if he could grab a few peanuts. but the peanut tree was very strict and wouldn't let him have any peanuts. robbie begged and pleaded with the tree but nothing worked. 

at this, robbie got angry and started to shake the tree. he didn't realise how big and strong the tree was and it came crashing down. robbie was sad and frightened as he started to run away from the tree.

when robbie was safe, he realised that he had pushed too hard and learned his lesson. he now knew that it was not always best to get what he wanted and he should always be gentle and caring.
once upon a time there was a puddle in the park. the puddle was sunny and bright and it made the park very happy. the puddle was filled with happy raindrops which made everyone smile and clap.

one day, a bird landed in the puddle. it was a dead bird and it made the park very sad. all the park visitors stopped clapping and started to cry.

then, something special happened. a tiny frog hopped out from the grass and into the puddle. he sang a beautiful song and the park became filled with joy once again. everyone started to clap and soon the frog hopped away into the grass. 

from that day onwards, everyone remembered the tiny frog and the song it had sung. the park was happy and the puddle was sunny again. and whenever anyone was feeling sad, they remembered the tiny frog and started to clap.
once upon a time, two friends, tom and jill, decided to go for a walk. they decided to cross a meadow, but when they arrived, they were stopped by a fence. tom said, "i can't reach the top. what should we do?"

jill said: "let's use my wool. it is long and thin, and it will help us climb over the fence."

the friends tried to climb the fence using the wool. it took some time, but after a few attempts, they both managed to get over the fence.

when they were on the other side, they looked back and saw the fence they had climbed. jill said to tom, "what a clear fence! we should have seen it earlier".

moral: it is important to take time and look closely at any obstacle before trying to solve it.
once upon a time there was a boy named billy. billy was a very stubborn boy who always wanted things to go his way. he was playing in his backyard one day when he decided he wanted to build a treehouse.

billy worked very hard. he gathered the wood and nails, and began hammering the pieces together. he kept going, even when it got tough.

suddenly, billy stopped. he looked at the treehouse and then at his tools. his hard work had not resulted in a treehouse.

billy stamped his feet and said, "i'm not giving up!" he was frustrated and very stubborn.

then he heard a voice from behind him. "maybe i can help you." it was his dad.

billy's dad showed him how to build a treehouse. with a few more pieces of wood and nails, they worked together and the result was a beautiful treehouse.

billy was so proud of his treehouse and he knew that it was his hard work and stubbornness that led to the result.
once there was a long gorilla. every day he loved to sing and make songs. one day he was walking through the forest and he heard two birds chirping by a tree. the gorilla stopped and listened to the birds. 

the birds said, "why don't you sing with us? the forest will be more beautiful with your cheerful songs."

the gorilla smiled and said, "i would love to! singing is my favorite thing to do." so the three of them sang together in the forest. after a while, the birds said, "thank you for singing with us, gorilla. now we can all make the forest more beautiful together." 

the moral of this story is that everyone has something special to contribute, and that by working together we can make the world a brighter place.
once upon a time, a witch lived in a big house. every night she would go out for a walk. one night, when the witch was walking, she saw a spicy red ball. 

the witch said, "i must catch that ball." 

so the witch ran and jumped and stretched. she did everything she could but she couldn't catch the ball. 

the witch started to get sad and she said, "will someone help me catch that spicy red ball?" 

just then, a small boy came up to her. the boy said, "i can help. i can catch the ball for you." 

the witch thanked him and the boy ran and caught the ball. the witch was so happy. she said, "thank you so much! now i have my red ball!" 

the witch went back to her house with the ball and the boy went back home. the boy was very happy that he could help the witch catch her spicy red ball.

once upon a time, there were two friends - tim and jill. they liked to wander around in the same forest every day. one day, when the two of them were walking, they noticed a big chest in the middle of the forest. 

"let's open it," suggested tim excitedly.

jill shook her head and told him, "let's not, tim. it might be someone else's chest, and it wouldn't be nice to open it without permission."

but tim insisted and started to open it.

in the chest, the two friends found a lot of money. 

tim said excitedly, "let's take the money. it's going to help us a lot!" 

but jill said sadly, "no, let's not. we have no right to take their money. it's not ours."

in the end, tim realised jill was right and the two friends put back the money.
 
the moral of this story is that it is never right to be selfish. we must always act with kindness and respect towards others.
once there was a girl named lucy who was very careless. one day she was playing in her garden when something caught her eye - a shining medal!

"what is that?" she wondered, picking it up from the grass. 

"it must be something special," she thought.

but then it happened. as soon as lucy touched the medal, it vanished! 

"where did it go?" she asked, looking sad.

but then she heard a voice. it was her mother.

"it looks like it just disappeared," her mother said. "maybe if you're more careful it won't vanish again."

so lucy listened to her mother, and she was careful with things ever since. no more things vanished!
one night, sally and henry had a fight. they were both 3 years old and were very mad at each other. 

sally was so mad that she decided to go for a walk in the dark. she grabbed her flashlight and marched away from the house. as she walked, she thought about how mean henry had been. 

suddenly, sally heard a noise coming from the bushes. it sounded friendly, but sally was still scared. she shone her flashlight in the direction of the noise and saw a big, friendly dog. 

the dog did not bark or bark or run away. instead, it remained in the bushes and wagged its tail. it seemed to understand that sally was mad. 

sally smiled and took a step closer to the dog. she reached out and pet it, thankful for its friendly presence. then, sally and the dog walked back to the house together.

once upon a time there was a family who enjoyed having dinner together. every night, the parents, sam and susan, and their three-year-old daughter, liza, all sat down together to share a meal. liza loved her parents, and she was always excited for dinner. 

one evening, liza was extra excited. "what are we having for dinner tonight?" she asked, hopping up and down in her chair.

sam and susan shared a surprised look. "it's a surprise!" they answered. 

liza sat quietly for a moment and then let out a rude yell. "i want to know!" she shouted.

the parents laughed. "liza," said sam patiently. "it's just one surprise. you don't need to be so rude."

hearing this, liza tried to calm herself down and behave better. she crossed her arms and quietly said, "okay. i'm sorry." 

after a few more minutes of anticipation, dinner was served and liza was once again excited.
once upon a time, there were two friends who were very important to each other. one was a little boy, and one was a little girl. they liked to play together, running and having fun.

one day, the two friends found something special - two matches. they were so excited to find something that united both of them. the little girl said, "we can use this to keep our friendship together". 

the little boy was so happy, he wanted to do something special with the matches. so they each made a special wish on their own match. then they put the two matches together and created a spark. 

the little girl said "this is how we stay united." and so, the two friends stayed together forever, forever linked by their special matches. they both knew that their friendship was very important!
john was feeling brave, so he dared to go outside to explore. he saw a lot of different things as he looked around. he noticed an area behind a giant bush that looked like it had some space. he cautiously ventured closer, and to his surprise, he found a sandy path that seemed to fit perfectly in the space. fearful of what might be hidden there, he froze for a moment. taking a deep breath, he stepped into the space and followed the sandy path. the path suddenly stopped at the edge of the river. john quickly scanned the riverbank to see if anything was there. he saw something glistening in the water and wondered what it was. taking all his courage, he slowly walked into the river to take a closer look. he looked down and saw some shining, glistening stones. he had found a treasure! he was too small to carry it, so he had to be creative and come up with a plan. he gently gathered the stones and placed them in his pocket. with a huge smile, he ran back home with the treasure tucked away in his pocket.
once upon a time there was a motor. it was empty, so no one was driving it. suddenly, a little girl blinked, and the motor came to life!

the girl said, "hi motor, let's go for a drive!" they started to drive and the girl was so happy. but then, the motor started to head in the wrong direction! 

the girl said, "motor, why are you going the wrong way?" but the motor didn't answer. the girl kept asking and the motor kept driving.

the girl was very unhappy and started to cry.

suddenly, the motor stopped and said, "i'm sorry. i was following the wind and it took me the wrong way."

the girl was relieved and smiled. "it's okay motor, let's go the right way now," she said.

the motor blinked and they drove off in the right direction, the girl happy and laughing. they had a lot of fun together and it was a wonderful day.
once upon a time there was a bear, who loved to hug everyone he met. one day when he was out walking in the forest, he saw an amazing view from a tall hill. he went up to see it better and when he got to the top he saw a thin tree.

the bear was suddenly filled with a lot of love and with no one to hug, he hugged the tree. as he hugged the tree, he heard a voice.

"why, thank you for the hug. i haven't been hugged in years!" said the tree.

the bear was surprised and asked the tree why he hadn't been hugged in such a long time. the tree replied:

"when i was small and thin, no one wanted to hug me, they all thought i was too weak. but now that i am strong, here you are hugging me."

the bear smiled and hugged the tree even tighter. he thanked the tree for teaching him a moral lesson that day; it doesn't matter how small and thin something is, it can still be loved and hugged.
once upon a time, there was a charming frog. he lived in a pond and wanted nothing more than to follow his dream. 

one night, he hopped out of the pond and went for a walk to the woods. suddenly he saw a rainbow, bright and beautiful! he hopped closer and noticed that the rainbow had a pot of gold at the end.

the frog was so excited that he quickly hopped up to it and started to grab the gold. as he approached, a sharp voice called out from the trees.

"wait! what are you doing?" the voice asked.

the frog looked around and saw a beautiful fairy. she was charming and friendly.

"i was trying to get the gold," said the frog. 

the fairy smiled and said, "follow your dreams - the true treasure lies within. the gold will not make you happy." 

the frog thanked the fairy and hopped away. he remembered the fairy's words and kept following his dream.
once upon a time, there was a doggy who lived in a house with his family. the doggy was very happy and loved to play with his family. one day, he was given a thick bone. the doggy was very excited. he wanted to show the bone to his family, so he picked it up with his mouth and bit it. but he bit it too hard. his teeth went right through it. now he had no bone!

the doggy was very sad. he went outside to see if he could find another bone. he ran around and around until he found another bone. it was not as thick as before, but the doggy was excited. he grabbed the bone and put it in his mouth. he bit it, and it broke too. now he had no bone again.

the doggy was very frustrated and this time, he was angry too. he looked all around for a bone, but every bone he found was too thin and he had to leave it behind. eventually, he got tired and went back home. when he arrived, he was sad because he had no bone to show his family. he would have to go without a bone. 

the bad ending of the doggy's story teaches us that sometimes even if we try, we don't always get what we want. it can be sad, but remember: it's okay to not always get what you want!
once upon a time, there lived a young girl named abigail. she was a curious and brave girl who didn't like to follow rules. 
one day, abigail was exploring in the forest when she saw a heel lying in the grass. she hadn't seen one before so she was very curious. abigail picked it up and was about to put it on when a voice stopped her.

"what do you think you're doing?"
abigail looked around and saw an old man standing behind her. she knew right away that he was not as friendly as she thought.

"i found this heel and was curious," abigail said.

"that heel belongs to me," the old man said. he was very rude and ignorant.

abigail was quick to respond. "why don't you lay it back down so we can both be happy," she said.

the old man was shocked by abigail's courage. he silently put the heel back on the ground, thanked abigail for her politeness, then walked away. 
abigail smiled and continued to explore the forest with her newfound courage.
once upon a time, there was a tree that wanted to reach the sky, but it didn't know how. the tree was very independent and determined to succeed. so the tree grew a little bit every day and every inch became taller and taller.

as the tree kept growing, one day it noticed a little bird perched on one of its branches. the bird said to the tree, "you're so tall, why don't you try to reach all the way up to that cloud, if you try hard enough i think you can do it!"

the tree was excited and tried its best, stretching its branches higher and higher, but it just couldn't reach. the bird encouraged the tree not to give up, reassuring it that it could succeed. with its determination undying, the tree kept trying until one day...it finally reached the cloud!

the tree was so proud of itself and the little bird was overjoyed. it's dreams had come to life, the tree had achieved success through its independent efforts.

they were playing together when jimmy saw some work to do. he asked jane to help him, and she said yes. 

they worked for a long time but the work was fun. when they were done, they looked around and felt very comfortable.

after they finished the work, they took a break. they played catch and hide-and-seek until it was time to go home. 

jimmy and jane said goodbye and hugged each other tightly. both knew that they would always care for each other.
once there was a little boy named johnny. he loved to play in the kitchen. whenever he was in the kitchen, he would wear his yellow apron.

one day, johnny was playing in the kitchen when he heard his mom calling. she called out his name, but he didn't respond. he was too busy playing.

johnny's mom walked into the kitchen and asked why he wasn't answering. johnny didn't want to admit he was playing. then johnny's mom noticed the yellow apron.

johnny's mom told him that he wasn't allowed to play in the kitchen. johnny started to cry. she said that he was old enough to know better and promised to take away the apron if he didn't listen.

johnny promised to listen and apologized for not answering his mom when she called him. she hugged him and told him to keep playing, but to stay out of the kitchen. johnny smiled, put on his yellow apron and went back to playing.
once upon a time there lived a mouse and a squirrel. they lived together near a big, strong tree.

the squirrel was always carrying a large piece of steel around. the mouse wanted to play and asked the squirrel if he could borrow it.

but the squirrel said "no! my steel is mine, and you can't have it".

the two animals started to quarrel. the mouse was angry and ran away.
 
he ran to the pond and found a stick. then he went back to the squirrel with the stick and said "i want to play with this".

the squirrel thought for a moment and said "yes".

the squirrel and the mouse played together with the stick for a long time. they even found success at building a fortress out of the stick!

the mouse and the squirrel were very happy that they had stopped their quarrel and started to play such a fun game. they lived together happily ever after.
once upon a time, there were two friends jenny and tim. they loved to play together. one day, tim found a rare weapon in the park. he wanted to play with it, but jenny said that it was dangerous and that she didn't want him to use it. this made tim angry and he said some mean words to jenny. 

jenny felt very sad and hurt by tim's words. she ran away and the two didn't talk for a long time. until one day, tim decided that he wanted to make things right and find jenny. he found her and asked for her forgiveness. jenny thought about it and said yes. 

tim was very happy and gave jenny a big hug to show that he was sorry. they both realised that no weapon can compare to the value of a good friendship. from then on, they were the best of friends and played happily together.

when they arrived at the park, timmy's pig was very heavy. he tried to push it but it was just too heavy for him. so, his mom had to help him. 

they were walking around the park when suddenly the pig flew out from timmy's hands and flew away. timmy screamed, â€œmy pig!â€ 

his mom said, â€œdon't worry. we'll find it.â€ she pointed to a tree nearby and said, â€œi think it flew over there.â€ so they ran over to the tree and both of them started to push the leaves and branches aside.

his mom smiled and said, â€œi'm so glad we found my pig. let's go home.â€ so they both walked back home, holding hands.

once upon a time there was a little girl named lucy. she was three years old and very curious. she wanted to know about everything.

one day, lucy asked her mom, "what does 'search' mean?" mom smiled and explained, "search means to look for something." lucy nodded and said, "like what?" 

mom replied, "well it can be anything! maybe you want to find the toy you lost yesterday or find a special place in the park you like to visit."

lucy was excited and asked, "where should i start my search?" mom pointed outside and said, "go outside and look, but it's a bit gloomy today, so don't stay too long." 

lucy was off! she looked near the bushes, in the sandbox, and even peeked inside the mailbox. but lucy didn't find anything. she looked again, this time in the garden. 

suddenly, she found the toy she had lost the day before, hidden safely in one of the flowerpots! lucy ran back home, excited to tell her mom what she had discovered.
once upon a time, there was a young boy called max. he loved to explore the world around him. one day, he found a mysterious match and decided to take it with him on his exploration.

along the way, max saw a small rabbit and asked, "excuse me, have you seen my match?" the rabbit replied, "no i haven't, but i could help you find it. i know a powerful wizard who could deliver it to you!"

so the rabbit took max to the wizard who said, "i can help you, but first there's something i want from you" max asked, "what is it?" the wizard replied, "i want you to help someone in need."

max thought about it for a moment and then decided to help a poor old woman. he helped her sweep her yard and collect firewood for the cold night ahead.

at the end of the day, max thanked the wizard as he handed him his match. the wizard smiled and said, "remember, always be kind to others and you will be rewarded. helping those who need it is the most mysterious match of all."
once upon a time, there was a little boy who was always searching. he looked in his pockets and under furniture, often coming up with nothing but dust.

one day, he was searching through a particularly filthy corner when he found a coin. excited, he exclaimed out loud, "look at this! i'm rich!"

he quickly put the coin into his pocket, unable to believe his luck. he proudly continued his search, believing he was one lucky boy.

but his luck was fleeting. as he continued searching through the dark and musty room, the coin slipped from his pocket. in a few seconds, it was gone for good - lost forever.

sadly, the grateful grin on the boy's face quickly disappeared, replaced by a deep sigh of regret. he realized that sometimes searches can lead to happy endings - but sometimes it just leads to a filthy corner void of answers.

once upon a time there was an old man who went for a walk in the woods. as he walked, he found a grape. he thought it was very high, so he decided to pick it off the vine.

the old man put his grape in his pocket and continued walking. he came across a big pile of grapes that had been dropped in the woods. he knew he would need help to sort them all out.

suddenly he spotted a little girl. he waved to her and said: "can you help me? i need to sort out the grapes."

the little girl looked at him, confused.

"i need you to pick out all the high grapes and put them in this basket," he explained.

the little girl smiled. she quickly picked out all the high grapes and filled the basket.

the old man thanked her and said goodbye. he was very happy to have the little girl's help! he went on his way with his basket full of high grapes.

he looked at jill and said, "don't be scared jill, it's only thunder. see the clouds? they aren't dark and scary, look how mild they are." 

jill looked up at the clouds and said, "yeah they are mild, but what if it gets worse?" she was still scared of the noise.

jack looked around the backyard and noticed a large tree nearby. he smiled and held out his hand. "come on, let's run under the tree. that way when the thunder comes, it won't scare you anymore!" 

jill grabbed his hand and laughed. together they ran and hid under the tree. they smiled as the mild thunder came and went.

one day, she saw a beautiful lightning bug. she wanted to put it in her pocket but the bug was too fast for her. she tried to catch it, and she even put a tasty cookie as bait, but the bug was too clever! 

suddenly, her big brother came. he picked up the bug and put it in the pocket of his shirt. he said to his little sister, "now i have it. you can't get it back!".

the little girl was so upset. she said to her brother, "please put the bug back, it belongs in the sky with all the other lightning bugs. they need to be together".

the big brother smiled at his sister and said, "ok, i will let it go. i will put it back outside". the little girl was very happy and she ran outside together with her brother to watch the little bug fly away with the lightning.

"are you ready to go swimming?" asked her mother.
emily was so excited. she jumped up and down and smiled.

she asked her mother to play a game. "let's pretend i can swim to the other side of the pool," emily said.
her mother smiled and said, "sure, why not".

emily took a deep breath and jumped into the water. she was a strong swimmer and she was soon at the other side of the pool. she was so proud of herself.

her mother said, "great job, emily. you swam so fast!"
emily smiled and said, "can i swim back now?"
her mother said, "of course, you can!" 

emily jumped back in the water. she felt so comfortable swimming and made it back to her mother easily.

her mother smiled and said, "of course, we will!" 

and so, emily and her mother kept swimming every week, and had lots of fun in the water.

so, jake and sammy rushed to the kitchen. jake said, "let's get the food!" they were both so excited.

sammy grabbed a sandwich off the table and took a bite. but he was careless, and some of the food fell on the kitchen floor. jake was surprised and said, "be careful, sammy!" sammy said, "sorry, i'll be more careful next time!"

once there was a huge tree. every season it changed in amazing ways. in the spring it was full of leaves and life. in the summer it had tasty fruits that the animals would eat. in the autumn the leaves turned golden. in the winter, the tree was huge and places to hide. 

one day, a little girl was walking by the tree and saw something strange. it was an old dusty book, tucked between the roots of the trunk. the little girl picked it up and opened it. inside, the most beautiful pictures were on every page. 

the little girl couldn't read the words on the page, but she looked at the pictures carefully, seeing how one page was connected to the next. she liked the pictures so much that she took the book home.

every morning she would come to the tree and read the book. eventually, she found that she could remember the stories without looking at the book. and the more she read, the more she learned about the world around her.

the moral of the story is that we can learn something from everything, even if we can't read the words. a huge tree can teach us a lot if we take the time to look and explore.
once upon a time, three little pigs were playing in the mud.
the first little pig felt like she wanted to measure how deep the mud was. she asked her two brothers to help her out. 

"let's measure the mud to see how deep it is," said the first little pig. 
the second and third little pigs were excited. they had never measured mud before! 

together, the three little pigs got organized. the first little pig held the stick for measuring, the second little pig held one end of the measuring string and the third little pig held the other end. 

"ready, set, measure!" they shouted. 
the three little pigs started to measure the mud. after they were done, the first little pig knew exactly how deep the mud was. 
the three little pigs were surprised by the result and they all jumped with joy.

one day, the white hippo saw a little boy. he was playing in the garden and he was very happy. 
the white hippo crawled closer to the boy and said in a soft voice, "hello there! what are you doing?"

the boy looked at the white hippo in surprise and said, "i'm playing hide and seek with my friends!"

the white hippo smiled and said, "that sounds like a lot of fun. can i play too?"

the boy nodded and said, "yes, let's play! you have to try to find us and we have to try to find you!"

the white hippo crawled around the garden a few times and enjoyed the game very much. when everyone was tired and the game was over, the white hippo said goodbye and crawled away.

the boy was sad to say goodbye to the white hippo, but he knew that soon enough he would be back to play hide and seek with him again.

she said they should save some of the money they had because it might be needed later. she also said it would be wise to put some of their money in the harbor so they could use it when they needed it. lilly didn't want to do this so daisy refused. lilly felt sad and alone.

but then, daisy decided to buy one thing for herself and for lilly. they both had a spicy snack. they both loved it and knew that if they had saved their money, they could have enjoyed it more. lilly learned from daisy that it was okay to eat something special but it was important to save money too.

the moral of the story is to save money for later but also to enjoy the simple things in life. don't refuse happiness!

"look at this!" she said with a smile on her face. 

alice's mom walked over to her, "don't get too close to the puddle, honey. what do you want to do with it?".

alice grinned, "i wanna play in it! can i?" 

mom shook her head, "no, not today. but you can examine it and see what it looks like."

alice squatted down. she looked closely at the water, the dirt and all the tiny things floating in it. up close, the puddle looked even mightier. 

alice stood up again and said, "it's so big and fun! can i play in it next time?"

mom smiled. "maybe, if it's still here!"

â€œi wish i could fly and play hockey too,â€ betty thought.

suddenly, a gust of wind blew by and carried her high up into the air. betty was so excited! she flew around, dipping and diving high and low, her wings flowing in the air. what a great game!

just then, one of the kids noticed betty and said, â€œlook! there's a nosy bird flying and playing hockey in the sky!â€

from that day on, whenever betty wanted to play, she would fly high in the sky and play hockey with the kids. she was the happiest nosy bird around!

once upon a time there were two friends, molly and max. whenever they went to the store, molly liked to buy jam. one day, when the two of them went to the store, there was no jam available.

"no jam!" yelled molly in disappointment.

"no jam?" asked max. "that's too bad. what can we do?"

molly thought and then said, "let's skip around the store to cheer ourselves up!"

max was delighted and the two of them started to skip together. as they were skipping they made new friends who were shopping at the store. everyone was having great fun.

suddenly, a shopkeeper hurried up to them and told them to stop jumping.

"why?" asked max.

"because," said the shopkeeper, "you are disturbing the other customers and making it difficult for them to shop!"

molly and max felt sorry for causing a problem. molly had an idea and she smiled. she said,

"let's make things better by asking the store to get more jam for us."

the shopkeeper agreed and promised take their request seriously. molly and max cheered and went off to continue skipping. soon the store had more jam available and molly was able to get her favourite jam!
once upon a time there were two humans. one was very alert, and the other was sleepy. the alert human said, "let's go for a walk." but the sleepy human just stayed in the same spot. 

the alert human said, "come on! let's walk into the forest." but the sleepy one just shrugged and said, "no." 

"oh, come on!" said the alert human. "it'll be fun!" 

finally, the sleepy human agreed and they started walking into the forest. but when they got there, they got separated. the alert human kept walking and calling out the sleepy one's name, but he couldn't find him. he was all alone. 

finally, he heard someone call out his name. he looked up and there was the sleepy human! he had found him! 

the alert human breathed a sigh of relief and said, "let's go home together!" 

and so that's what they did. they always stayed together from then on!

little marvin was walking through the park on a sunny week. he saw a bald man crying. marvin had never seen anyone crying before and he was very curious. so he asked the bald man why he was crying.

the bald man said to marvin, "i'm crying because i'm sad. i don't have enough money to buy my train ticket home."

marvin was so sad to hear this. he wanted to help the bald man and he knew the perfect thing to do. he ran home and grabbed his piggybank and brought it back to the man. he opened it up and showed the man all the coins inside.

the bald man was so happy to see how much money marvin had. with this money, he was able to buy his train ticket home.

as the man took the tickets and his piggy bank back, he said something to marvin that he would never forget. he said, "thank you for helping me in my time of need. even though you are only three years old, you have the biggest heart of all."

from that day forward, marvin went to the park every week, ready to lend a helping hand.

once upon a time there was a little girl named jane. she was three years old and loved playing outdoors. one day, jane decided to explore the fields near her home.

as she roamed around, jane found a promise rock. on the rock was written something special. she couldn't read it, so she turned around.

suddenly, jane noticed a rough-looking man walking towards her. she started to feel scared and hid behind the bush.

the man started to talk. he said, "i want you to cover the promise rock. if you don't, i'll take away something you love."

jane was too frightened to move. she thought for a moment and then decided to stand up and face the man. she said, "i will not cover the promise rock. i don't have to do what you say!"

the man thought for a moment and then he smiled. he said, "i can see you're brave. i won't make you do anything, but please remember this. promises should always be kept."

with that, the man walked away. jane was relieved and happily continued her journey, keeping her promise to never forget the promise rock.

as he entered the house, the rat noticed that all the furniture and walls had been broken and destroyed. he walked around, looking for something valuable. suddenly, the rat saw a beautiful chair. he quickly grabbed it, thinking he had scored a big prize.

he tried to leave the house with the chair, but he ended up making a lot of noise and accidentally disturbed a family living nearby. the family opened their door and saw the rat with the chair in his mouth. 

the family was really angry and decided to restore the house. the rat was so sad to see all his efforts go to waste. he tried to explain himself, but it was too late. 

the family took away the chair and the rat was never seen again. he had learned his lesson and realized that the old house was not the place for him.

"mum, what was that?" asked the little girl.

"it's lightning," said mum. "but don't worry, we're safe."

the wind blew and the sky grew darker. the little girl started to cry, but mum and dad tried to cheer her up.

suddenly, lightning struck again, brighter this time and closer. the little girl screamed and mum and dad picked her up and ran. they ran and ran until they found shelter.

but the lightning followed them and it became too much for the little girl. she closed her eyes and the lightning struck one last time, taking her away. mum and dad cried and held each other close, mourning the loss of their little girl.
once upon a time there lived a rich farmer. he lived on a farm with lots of animals and grew lots of food. one day he planted beef in his fields and soon the plants were ready to be harvested.

the farmer was very excited and he went to the field to see what he had grown. to his surprise all of the beef plants had disappeared.

he ran to the farmer who lived near by and asked, "where did my beef go?"

the farmer replied, "everything you have comes from nature, so you need to take care of it. if you don't take care of your food, it will just disappear."

the rich farmer realized that he had been careless and was sad that his beef was gone. he promised himself to start taking better care of nature so that he can enjoy the plants and food he harvests in the future.

the moral of the story is that you need to take care of the food you have, or it will disappear.

john said, "look maria, the flowers are blooming!"

maria nodded. "they're beautiful!"

john smiled. "let's make a jelly. we can use the flowers."

maria and john gathered the flowers carefully. they put them in a pot with some water and started boiling it down. the smell of the pot made john's tummy rumble. after a while, they poured the mixture into a bowl.

john said, "it's done!" 

they put it in the fridge and waited. when they took it out the next day, the jelly was smooth and bright. maria and john clapped and cheered that their jelly was finished.

john said, "let's enjoy our jelly now!" 

maria smiled as she picked up a spoon. they both dug in and enjoyed every bite. the jelly was smooth and tasted like sunshine. they looked out to the flowers and smiled. they made something special with just a few blooms.

john smiled and nodded. they held hands and walked together to the smaller building. soon the quarrel was forgotten and they had fun exploring the park.

once upon a time there was a little girl who loved to admire the world around her. everywhere she went, she would take a look, and admire the beauty.

one day, the little girl was admiring a field of daisies. she use to come out to the field every day to admire the bright and beautiful colors. as she was looking at them one day, a big old dog appeared and began barking at her.

the little girl was scared and looked around for help. as luck would have it, a dependable lady appeared. seeing the little girl's fear, she walked up to the dog and scared him off. she then turned to the little girl and said, "you should never go anywhere by yourself. you need a dependable person to always look after you."

the little girl thanked the dependable lady, but her words went in one ear and out the other. in the future, the little girl kept going out alone and, sadly, bad things would happen to her.

the moral of this story is that you should never go outdoors alone. we should recognize and appreciate the value of relying on dependable people.

anna went to get her grandparents so they could see the stand too. they came outside and were all amazed. "what is it?" asked anna's grandmother. anna was about to find out.

the stand opened its eyes and said, "i'm an evil witch". anna, her grandparents, and everyone around were so scared. the witch threatened them all and said, "if you don't do as i say, i'll put a spell on you". 

so everyone in the garden had to listen to the witch's orders. anna felt so scared, but she knew that there was nothing she could do. the witch was so powerful and green. 

the witch caused so much trouble and the garden was not the same again. anna never forgot the evil witch and the bad ending that she caused.
once upon a time, there was a painter who lived in a small town. everyone thought he was amazing because he could paint beautiful pictures. one day, he decided to have a painting contest.

the painter stood in the center of the town square and called out, "who wants to join a painting contest!"

everyone was excited and wanted to join. but there was one little boy who did not agree. he was only three years old, so he did not know how to paint. he wanted to join, but he was afraid.

the painter smiled and said, "it's okay. you can join if you want."

the little boy smiled and agreed. he took his paintbrush and started painting. all of the townspeople watched in amazement as the little boy's picture came to life.

when the contest was over, the painter declared the little boy the winner. everyone was in shock and clapped for his amazing painting. the little boy was so happy and he did not feel any pain now.

once upon a time there was a little girl. she wanted to play pretend, so she decided to pretend that she was a tide. she ran and ran around the beach, pretending to be the tide.

then, suddenly, a seagull flew overhead, disrupting the girl's pretend play. she felt very upset and cried out, "what is that thing flying around?!".

the seagull paused and looked back at the little girl. he said, "i'm just pretending to be a flying tide, like you! we can pretend to be tides together if you want?".

the little girl paused for a second, thought about it, and then smiled. she said, "yes please! that would be fun!".

so, the little girl and the seagull both ran and flew around the beach pretending to be flying tides. they had so much fun, they played together all day long!

jane said, "let's find out." she bent down and opened her hand. inside her hand was a shiny gold ring.

suddenly, a woman ran up to them. "that's my ring!" she shouted. "give it back to me at once!"

the woman picked up the ring and smiled cruelly. "it's too late," she said. "you'll never get it back now."
once upon a time, there lived a fox. the fox was very friendly and always loved to share. one day, the fox was walking through the forest when he came across something very heavy. the fox wondered what it was, so he asked a nearby rabbit what it was.

the rabbit said: "that's a stone. do you want to share it with me?"

the fox smiled and nodded. he was very happy to share the heavy stone with the rabbit. he picked up the stone and carried it to the rabbit's home. 

the rabbit said: "this stone is so heavy. i don't think i can carry it alone! can you help me?"

the fox nodded and said: "of course. we can share it!" 

so, the fox and the rabbit shared the heavy stone until they arrived at the rabbit's home. the rabbit smiled and thanked the fox for sharing the stone with him. the fox smiled back and said: "it was my pleasure." 

the fox and the rabbit then said goodbye and went their separate ways. from then on, the fox and the rabbit were always happy to share with each other.
once upon a time, there were two good friends. one was a bird, and the other a squirrel. one day, the two friends decided to take a walk in the park. as they were walking, they came across something shiny on the ground. it was a silver coin. 

the squirrel reached forward to grab the coin and said, "i'm going to spend it on something cool!" 
the bird quickly said, "no, no! that is wrong. we should rest it in the bank and save it for a rainy day."

the squirrel thought for a moment, and then decided the bird was right. he couldn't resist, however, adding that the coin was too beautiful not to look at every once in a while. 

the bird agreed and so the two friends decided to save the coin and look at it from time to time. 

the moral of the story is: it's important to save for a rainy day. don't rush to spend what you have, otherwise you will regret it later.

the other child said, "let's cover it and make it a big slide!" 
the first child said, "that's a great idea!" 
the two children ran to the ice and started to try and cover it. they pushed and tugged, but it was too heavy. as they kept trying, the ice started to crack. 
suddenly, there was a loud noise and the ice broke apart, and the children tumbled down. as they looked around, they saw that the ice had all broken up and gone away. the heavy ice was now gone. 
the two children looked at each other in shock and sadness. they had hoped to make a nice slide but in the end, their plan had gone wrong.
once upon a time, there was an orange dolphin in the ocean. he loved swimming around and having adventures with his friends.

one day, he came across a big, shiny object floating in the water. he wanted to get a closer look, so he swam to it. suddenly, the object began to move and it locked him inside!

the orange dolphin started to panic and he cried out for help. a school of fishes swam over and told him that he must look for a key to unlock the object. 

the orange dolphin searched further in the ocean and he found a small key inside a clam. he used the key to unlock the object and he was set free!

the moral of the story is that it is important never to give up when something gets in the way. if you stay positive and keep looking for solutions, you can find a way to overcome any problem.

once there was a duck who loved solving mysteries. everywhere she went, she tried to figure out answers to questions. but one day, she came up against a puzzling problem that she couldn't seem to solve.

the duck went to ask her friend, the clever owl, for help. "this problem seems impossible to solve," she said, honestly. "can you help me with it?"

the wise owl sighed. "that's easy," he said. "the key is to be honest with yourself and your friends. honesty is the best way to solve any problem. and that's the secret to solving this one, too.

the duck understood and thanked the owl for his wisdom. after that, she was able to solve her problem with the power of honesty. from then on, she made sure to use her new knowledge whenever a problem arose.

the moral of this story is to be honest with yourself and others, as it is the best way to solve problems.

the elephant was mad. he stopped and stamped his foot and refused to move on. he was screaming and shouting that he should have won. the rabbit tried to calm him down, but the elephant wouldn't listen. he yelled and roared louder and louder until finally he flew into a rage and charged towards the rabbit. luckily, the rabbit was fast, and he managed to run away before the elephant could catch him.

the poor elephant was still angry and upset. he ran around the field until he was exhausted. then he stopped and lay down on the ground. he was so tired and heartbroken that he just stayed there, never to rise again. the race between the powerful animals ended sadly, with the elephant lying there on the ground, never to race again.

mummy said, "yes, but just for a little while, mandy. it's cold outside - there's even some ice on the ground. so you must wrap up warm!"

so little mandy put on her coat and boots and went outside to play. she had lots of fun running and kicking leaves for a few minutes. but then she did something silly.

mandy tried to step on the ice. "stupid ice! i can't break it!" she said.

mummy rushed outside and said, "mandy! don't do that! you could hurt yourself on the ice! come inside now before it's too late."

so mandy went quietly back inside, feeling a little embarrassed. but she knew it was for her own safety and so she was happy to get inside before it was too late.

"that looks strange," said mommy.

mommy shouted, "what did you do?"

unfortunately, the buzzer just kept getting louder and louder. eventually, mommy had to take it away and put the knot back in its place.

one night, emily cried until her mum promised to stay with her. so, mum closed the bedroom door and sat on her bed. they both looked out of the window at the night sky.

suddenly, the darkness was filled with a deep, sad silence. emily was confused and a bit scared. she asked her mum, "what's wrong? why is silences so sad?"

mum explained that sometimes, even adults need a bit of a hug when it's quiet. mum hugged emily and spoke softly, "the silence will pass soon, and there will be happy noises again. it's ok."

emily felt better and smiled. she closed her eyes and soon fell asleep in her mum's warm arms.

once there was a girl named ana who was three years old. all day, she was very busy playing with her toys and coloring in her coloring books. she loved all the colors. 

one day, ana decided she wanted to learn math. she ran to her mom and said, "mom, i want to learn math!" her mom said, "that's great honey". 

the next day, ana was so excited to learn math that she started screaming when she woke up. her mom said, "what's wrong honey?" ana replied, "i'm just so excited to learn math!". her mom said, "that's great, let's get started!" 

ana was so busy learning math that she forgot to take a break! she was counting, adding and subtracting like a pro. 

once she was done with math, she started to scream for joy because she had learned so much. as ana opened her arms wide and yelled, "i did it!" her mom smiled with pride and said, "you did great honey!"

sam had an idea. â€œlet's have a writing race!", he said. "whoever finishes their writing first wins!â€

peggy was competitive and was excited to compete with her friend. so they started the race and both began to write as fast as they could. in the end, peggy won the race! everyone was very impressed with her writing skills. 

peggy and sam had so much fun that day and looked forward to more writing adventures together.
one day, little joe was playing in the garden with his new clay. he loved to squish it and roll it into shapes, like animals and houses. 

joe's mom and dad came over and said, "let's play a game joe! let's turn the clay into something new". joe loved games, so he agreed. 

he rolled the clay into a small ball and handed it to his mom. his dad asked, "what is it?"

"it's a bookmark!" said joe's mom, proudly. she held the bookmark up to her face and said, "it deserves a kiss for being so cute". joe's face lit up as she kissed the bookmark before putting it carefully on the table. 

joe was so proud of the new bookmark. he couldn't wait to tell his friends about it.
once upon a time, there was a mouse who lived in a cozy nest underneath a tree. the mouse loved to eat cocoa and blink in the sunshine. one day, when the mouse was out looking for cocoa, he came across a big and very mean cat. 

the cat was so ignorant that he did not notice the mouse and just kept walking. the mouse felt so scared and shrank behind some long grass. 

the mouse saw the cat jump onto a low branch and settle there for a while. suddenly, the mouse heard the cat's loud, angry mewing. it seemed that the cat was so ignorant that he had forgotten there were no cocoa pods on a tree! 

the mouse felt sorry for the cat and looked around to find some cocoa pods. after some searching, he was able to collect enough cocoa pods for the cat. he carefully walked towards the cat and put the cocoa pods near him. 

the cat was surprised and asked the mouse, "why did you help me?" 

the mouse said happily, "i wanted to show you that even if you are bigger and more powerful, it pays to be kind and thoughtful. ignorance never leads to kindness."

the cat felt embarrassed and thanked the mouse for teaching him a valuable lesson. the cat and the mouse became good friends and played together in the sunshine for a long time.

once upon a time, there was a girl named jane. she was walking to school one day, carrying her umbrella. suddenly, it began to rain. jane looked up and saw a boy. he was standing there, with an umbrella too.

"do you need help?" he asked.

"please, can you lend me your umbrella?" said jane.

the boy smiled. "sure," he said.

so, the boy lent his umbrella to jane. together, the two of them walked to school. they talked about everythingâ€”the rain, their homes, the animals in the parkâ€”and laughed.

when they reached school, jane thanked the boy for helping her. the boy said he was happy to help and said goodbye. jane waved to him as she went into school.

the rain stopped shortly after. so, jane asked the boy if she could lend him her umbrella.

"that would be so boring," the boy said. "i can just go home and get mine."

and so jane said goodbye and the boy went home, with his umbrella.
once there was a loyal dog. he liked to sit in the garden and that is where he would pass most of his days. one day, however, he saw an old man walking towards him with a cane in his hand. the dog got scared and started barking at the man. the man tried to calm him down by saying gentle words, but the dog wouldn't stop barking. 

finally, the man had had enough and he started to run after the dog with his cane. the dog was spooked and wanted to escape, but he was also loyal. he couldn't just run away from the old man. he decided to sit and stay loyal as the old man walked closer and closer. 

luckily, when the old man got to him, he wasn't angry at all. he put his cane away and gave the dog lots of cuddles and treats. from that day on, the loyal dog and the old man were always together in the garden.

one day, the little otter decided to go a long way from home. he swam further than he'd ever been before, and soon it started to get cold. he shivered as the water grew cooler.

the little otter noticed a cave by the riverbank and he decided to go inside and get warm. when he was inside, he heard a voice saying, "who do we have here?" he was scared but he looked up, and he saw a friendly old bear. 

the bear asked him why he was shivering, and the little otter said he had ventured too far away from home and was cold. the bear asked him why he had gone so far, and the little otter proudly said he wanted to explore the new and exciting world around him.

the bear smiled and said, "well, that's very brave. now, let's get you warm!" the bear gave him a big big hug, and the little otter felt warm and safe again. he thanked the bear and they said goodbye.

once there was a little girl named rachel. she liked to go for walks and explore the world. one day rachel decided to go for a walk in the woods and explore. 

when rachel arrived, she felt the warmth of the sun on her skin. she took a deep breath and started her slow walk into the woods. after a while, rachel heard a sound that made her stop. 

"what was that?" rachel wondered.

rachel walked closer and saw a bunny crying. the bunny was hurt and it was clear that he was in pain. rachel quickly ran to help the bunny. she tried to pick him up, but it only made him cry louder.

rachel then realized that the bunny had a broken leg and needed a doctor. rachel knew that it was an emergency and she had to act fast. she took out her cell phone and dialed a number.

a couple of minutes later, the doctor arrived. the doctor looked at the bunny's leg and knew that it needed to be set. he applied something that relieved the pain, then reset the broken leg. 

after the doctor declared the bunny was healthy, rachel smiled. she felt relieved that she was able to help the bunny in pain. 

rachel thanked the doctor and wished the bunny a speedy recovery. the bunny hopped away, relieved and no longer in pain. rachel stood there, feeling an empty but happy feeling. 

the end.
once upon a time, there was a bright and curious cat. his name was max.
one day max was out exploring when he stumbled upon an interesting building. he went inside and found a computer! max knew nothing about computers, but he was determined to learn.

max started to press some of the buttons on the computer. a voice suddenly said: "hi max! follow me and i will show you how to use the computer". the voice was coming from the computer!

intrigued, max followed the computer's instructions. the computer taught him how to type, how to use the mouse, and how to search the internet. max was so excited he could learn about computers!

as max continued to follow the computer's instructions and explore the world of computers, he grew brighter and brighter. 

the end.
the day was bright, and the sky was a deep blue. grandpa and grandma were in the garden, designing a spell.

grandma said to grandpa, "we need something special for this spell." 

grandpa said, "i think i know what to do. i will pick the perfect blue flower."

grandma nodded in agreement and said, "that sounds excellent."

grandpa reached out and picked the most beautiful blue flower in the garden. then he carefully placed it in the middle of their spell design.

but soon things started to go wrong. the spell started to shake and rumble, and bright green sparks flew out from underneath the blue flower. grandma and grandpa knew something was amiss. 

grandpa tried to take the blue flower out of the design, but it was too late. suddenly, a loud boom echoed through the garden.

grandma and grandpa were never seen again.

this unexpected ending foreshadowed what was to come. grandma and grandpa had designed a spell they couldn't undo.
once upon a time, there were two twins named tim and tom. they loved to play in the pool. one day, they saw an attractive toy boat in the store. they asked their mom to buy it for them, but she said they had to wait for their birthday.

the twins were sad, but they didn't give up. they decided to save their money to buy the boat themselves. they did chores around the house and saved every penny they could.

finally, their birthday arrived and they had enough money to buy the boat. they were so happy and went to the pool to play with it. but as they were playing, tim accidentally splashed tom and the boat fell into the deep end of the pool. tom tried to get it, but he couldn't swim well and he drowned. tim was devastated and wished he had never splashed his twin.

benny was very scared and knew he had to escape. he ran as fast as he could, hopping over rocks and through bushes. the fox chased him, but benny was too quick. finally, benny found a small hole in a tree and squeezed inside, safe from the fox.

benny was very happy to have escaped from the fox, but he was also very tired. he fell asleep inside the tree, dreaming of all the fun adventures he would have the next day. from that day on, benny was always careful when playing in the woods, making sure to look out for any dangers lurking around.

but when they got to his car, the man grabbed her and put her in the trunk. lily was scared and cried for help, but no one heard her. she was stuck there for a long time until the police found her. from that day on, lily never went to the port alone again.

lily said, "but mommy, i love the rain! can't i stay outside and play?"

her mom replied, "i know you love the rain, but you need to behave and come inside. you don't want to get sick."

lily sighed but knew her mom was right. as she walked inside, she looked up at the sky and saw the earth getting wetter and wetter. she couldn't wait for the rain to stop so she could go back outside and play again.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with his toy cars and trucks. one day, timmy found a shiny piece of iron on the ground. he picked it up and showed it to his mom.

"look, mommy! i found a pretty rock!" timmy said.

"that's not a rock, timmy. that's a piece of iron. it's very valuable," mommy said.

timmy didn't understand what "valuable" meant, but he liked how the iron looked. he kept it in his pocket and went back to playing.

later that day, timmy's friend johnny came over to play. johnny saw the piece of iron in timmy's pocket and said, "wow, that's cool! can i have it?"

timmy thought for a moment and said, "okay, you can have it."

johnny took the iron and went home. timmy didn't think much of it, but his mom told him that he shouldn't give away things that are valuable.

a few days later, johnny's mom came over to timmy's house. she was very angry.

"johnny got sick because he played with that piece of iron you gave him. it was rusty and not safe to play with," she said.

timmy felt bad. he didn't know that the iron was dangerous. he learned that even things that look mild can be harmful.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a lovely rubber ball that she loved to play with every day. one day, while playing outside, lily accidentally threw the ball too far and it got stuck in a tree. she tried to reach it, but she couldn't. she started to struggle and jump, but it was too high.

lily went to get her dad to help her. he tried to get the ball down with a stick, but it was too high up. suddenly, a strong wind blew and the ball fell down from the tree. lily was so happy and relieved that she got her ball back. she hugged it tightly and thanked her dad.

but then, something bad happened. as lily was walking back home with her ball, she accidentally dropped it on the road. a car drove over it and the ball burst. lily was so sad and cried a lot. she had lost her lovely rubber ball forever.

as she was gathering flowers, she saw a butterfly fluttering nearby. "hello, butterfly!" lily said. "do you want to come with me and help me pick flowers?" the butterfly didn't answer, but it flew around lily's head. 

lily continued to gather flowers until she heard a sound. it was the sound of a switch turning on and off. "what's that noise?" lily asked the butterfly. "i don't know," the butterfly replied. 

lily followed the sound until she found her dad in the garage, turning a switch on and off. "what are you doing, daddy?" lily asked. "i'm fixing the lights," her dad replied. "do you want to help?" 

lily was happy to help, and together they fixed the lights. after they finished, lily went back to the garden with her flowers and the butterfly. "i had so much fun today," she said to the butterfly. "let's do it again tomorrow!"

"jimmy, can you please get the ball for me? i don't want to get my new glove messy," timmy said.

"sure, timmy! i'll get it for you," jimmy replied.

jimmy got the ball and timmy was happy. they continued playing baseball until the sun went down. timmy went home with his new glove, feeling proud of himself for catching the ball and keeping it clean.

timmy's mom saw him playing with the knob and said, "timmy, be serious. you shouldn't play with the door knob. it's not a toy." 

timmy let go of the knob and said, "okay, mommy. i won't play with it anymore." 

later that day, timmy's friend came over to play. timmy showed him the knob on his door and said, "look! this is the knob that opens my door. but my mommy said i can't play with it." 

his friend said, "let's play with something else. we can build a tower with these blocks." 

timmy agreed and they had fun building a tower together. from that day on, timmy never played with the door knob again.
