once upon a time, there was a tiger. the tiger was big and orange with black stripes. he liked to play in the jungle and chase after his friends. one day, the tiger saw a little bird perched on a tree branch. the bird looked alert and scared.

the tiger wanted to help the bird, so he folded his big paws and quietly approached the bird. the bird saw the tiger and flew away with a tweet. the tiger felt sad that he scared the bird, but he was happy to have tried to help.

from that day on, the tiger learned to be more careful and alert when approaching his animal friends. he would often fold his paws and wait patiently until they were ready to play. and the little bird eventually learned that the tiger was a kind and gentle friend.

lily was so happy to learn something new. she ran her fingers over the velvet dress and felt how thick and cozy it was. she loved the way it looked too, with its shiny black color. lily asked sophie if she could wear the dress, but sophie said it was too big for her.

while they were waiting for their food, lily saw a little boy at another table. he looked nervous too. lily went over to him and said, "hi, my name is lily. what's your name?" the boy smiled and said, "my name is jack. i'm starting school soon and i'm nervous."

lily remembered what her mom said and told jack that everything would be okay. they became friends and played together while their moms finished their meal. when lily went to school, she saw jack again and they were happy to see each other. they were no longer nervous because they had each other.

after they made up, lily put on some jazz music and they both danced together. they had so much fun and forgot all about their fight. from then on, lily promised to never slap her brother again and they danced to jazz music together every day.

lily said, "can you turn the music down, please? it's too sharp for me." 

her friend turned the music down and they started to dance. but then lily's friend put on a different cd and the music was slow and sad. lily didn't like it and she said, "this music makes me confused. can we listen to something happy and fast?" 

her friend put on a new cd and they danced and sang together. they had so much fun that they didn't even notice the time passing. when it was time for lily to go home, she said goodbye to her friend and promised to come back and play again soon.

suddenly, timmy saw a big gorilla that was very angry. the gorilla escaped from his cage and started to run around. everyone was scared and they tried to run away. timmy and his mommy tried to hide, but they couldn't find a safe place. the gorilla found them and attacked them. timmy and his mommy were very hurt and they had to go to the hospital.

once upon a time, there was a big boat on the water. the boat was moving slow, and the people on it were getting bored. suddenly, they saw a dolphin jumping in the water! the people were so happy and they started to rush to the side of the boat to see the dolphin. 

the dolphin was swimming fast and jumping high! the people on the boat were amazed and they started to cheer. the boat started to go faster, chasing the dolphin. the people felt like they were flying! 

after a while, the dolphin swam away and the boat slowed down again. but the people on the boat were still happy because they had seen something amazing. they talked about the dolphin and how it made them feel. and they knew that even though the boat was slow, they could still have fun and see amazing things. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to talk and play with her friends. one day, lily and her friend emma were playing with their dolls when emma said, "i want to learn a new language. do you want to learn too?"

lily thought for a moment and then said, "yes! i want to learn too. but which language should we decide to learn?"

emma said, "i think we should learn spanish. my mom speaks it and she's really smart."

lily nodded her head and said, "okay, let's learn spanish together. hola, como estas?" 

emma smiled and replied, "muy bien, gracias. you're so smart, lily!" 

lily giggled and said, "gracias, emma. let's keep practicing our spanish so we can be even smarter!"
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside and have fun with her friends. one day, lily's mom told her that they were going to start planting a garden. lily was so excited because she loved flowers and vegetables.

before they could start planting, lily's mom said they needed to wash their hands. washing hands is important to stay clean and healthy. lily was a little sad because she wanted to start planting right away, but she knew it was important to wash her hands first.

after they washed their hands, lily and her mom started planting the seeds. they dug little holes and put the seeds inside. lily was so happy because she knew that soon they would have beautiful flowers and yummy vegetables to eat.

days went by and lily and her mom watered the garden every day. one day, lily noticed something growing in the ground. it was a tiny, green sprout! lily was so excited because she knew that soon it would turn into a big, beautiful flower. all of their hard work had paid off!
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved music and would always listen to it on his little radio. one day, timmy's mom told him to clean his room. timmy was very clumsy and knocked over his radio while cleaning. it broke into a million pieces and timmy was very sad.

timmy's mom asked him what happened and timmy told her that he was trying to clean his room but he was too clumsy and broke his radio. his mom tried to fix it but it was too broken. timmy was very upset because he loved listening to music on his radio.

from that day on, timmy learned to be more careful and not be so clumsy. he also learned that sometimes accidents happen and it's important to be careful with the things you love. although timmy was sad about his broken radio, he knew that he would always have music in his heart.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy had a pack of gum that he loved very much. he would take a piece of gum out of the pack every day and chew it. one day, timmy went to the park to play. he saw a little girl who looked very lonely. she didn't have any friends to play with.

timmy felt sad for the little girl, so he decided to share his gum with her. he took a piece of gum out of his pack and gave it to her. the little girl was so happy and thanked timmy. they became friends and played together for the rest of the day. timmy was happy that he could make someone else happy by sharing his gum.
once upon a time, there was a poor boy named timmy. he lived in a small house in the east part of town. timmy's mom had to work hard every day to manage their money and buy food for them to eat.

one day, timmy and his mom went for a walk in the park. they saw some kids playing with a ball and timmy wanted to join in. he asked his mom if they could buy a ball, but she said they couldn't afford it. timmy felt sad, but his mom told him they could still have fun without a ball.

they started to play a game of tag and timmy managed to catch his mom. they both laughed and had a great time. timmy realized that even though they were poor, they could still have fun and enjoy each other's company.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to help her mommy in the kitchen. one day, lily's mommy asked her to perform a special task. she had to put all the dirty dishes in the dishwasher. lily was very happy to help, but she found it hard to reach the top shelf. 

"mommy, it's too hard," lily said. 

"don't worry, sweetie. i'll help you," her mommy replied. 

together, they put all the dishes in the dishwasher. lily was so proud of herself for helping. but then, something bad happened. when they turned on the dishwasher, it made a loud noise and started to shake. suddenly, the dishwasher exploded and water went everywhere. 

lily and her mommy were very scared and wet. they hugged each other and cried. "i'm sorry, mommy. i didn't mean to do it," lily said. 

"it's okay, sweetie. we're just glad we're safe," her mommy replied. 

from that day on, they never used the dishwasher again. they washed their dishes by hand and lily always helped.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a dream that a fierce dragon was chasing her. she woke up and told her mommy about her nightmare. 

"i hope the dragon won't come back," said lily.

"don't worry, sweetie. dragons aren't real," said her mommy.

but that night, lily had the same nightmare again. this time, the dragon caught her and took her away. lily never woke up.

the end.
once upon a time, there was a brave little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with his toy cars all day long. one day, timmy's mom asked him to clean his room. timmy didn't want to clean his room because he was having so much fun playing with his cars.

timmy's mom said, "if you clean your room, you will have success and be happy." timmy didn't understand what success meant, but he knew he wanted to be happy. so, he started cleaning his room. while he was cleaning, he accidentally knocked over his toy castle and destroyed it. timmy felt sad because he loved his castle, but his mom said, "don't worry, timmy. you can always build a new one."

timmy felt better and continued cleaning his room. when he was finished, he felt proud of himself and showed his mom. she said, "you did a great job, timmy! you are so brave for cleaning your room even though you didn't want to." timmy smiled and felt happy knowing he had success and made his mom proud.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. lily loved sweets, especially lollipops. one day, lily and her mom went to the store to buy some candy. lily saw a big, red lollipop and asked her mom if she could have it. 

"can i have that lollipop, please?" lily asked her mom.

"of course, you can have it!" her mom replied. 

as they were walking home, lily saw a spider crawling on the sidewalk. she was scared and didn't want to step on it. 

"mommy, there's a spider! can we go around it?" lily asked.

"sure, let's go around it so we don't hurt it," her mom said. 

finally, they arrived home and lily happily enjoyed her sweet lollipop.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named tim. tim loved to play with his toys and run around outside. one day, tim went to the park with his mom. he played on the swings and went down the slide. 

after a while, tim's tummy started to rumble. he was hungry! his mom said they could go get some crackers to eat. they walked to the store and tim helped his mom pick out some tough crackers. 

on the way back to the park, tim saw a big crack in the sidewalk. he wanted to show his mom, so he ran over to it. his mom followed him and they looked at the crack together. tim thought it was cool how the crack went all the way down to the dirt. 

finally, they made it back to the park and tim and his mom sat on a bench to eat their crackers. tim was happy because he got to bring the crackers to the park and he found a cool crack in the sidewalk. it was a great day!
once upon a time, there was a panda named pandy. pandy was very successful at climbing trees and eating bamboo. one day, pandy met a rabbit named rolly.

"hi pandy, do you want to play with me?" asked rolly.

"yes, let's play!" said pandy.

they played hide and seek, but when it was pandy's turn to hide, she accidentally zipped herself inside a backpack. rolly couldn't find her and went home without her.

pandy tried to get out of the backpack, but she couldn't. she was stuck inside and couldn't breathe. sadly, pandy passed away inside the backpack.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy who loved to play with his toys. one day, he went to the park to play with his friend, sammy. they were having a great time until timmy's favorite toy car got stuck in the mud. he tried to pull it out, but it wouldn't budge.

sammy said, "let's ask the big kids for help!"

timmy replied, "no, they always make fun of me because i'm little."

sammy said, "don't worry, i'll go ask them for you."

sammy went over to the big kids and said, "can you help my friend timmy? his toy car is stuck in the mud."

the big kids said, "sure, we'll help him."

timmy was surprised and happy that the big kids helped him. he surrendered his toy car to them and they pulled it out of the mud. timmy thanked them and they all played together. the gloomy feeling timmy had before was gone and he had a great day with his friends.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved her aunt very much because she was very kind and always gave her gifts. one day, lily and her aunt went for a walk in the park. while they were walking, they saw a little bird that was stuck in a tree. 

lily said, "aunt, we need to save the bird!" 

her aunt replied, "you're right, lily. we need to help the bird." 

lily's aunt was very gifted and knew how to climb trees. she climbed up the tree and saved the bird. the bird was very happy and flew away. lily was very proud of her aunt and said, "aunt, you're the best!" 

her aunt replied, "no, lily, you're the best. you always remind me to help others." 

lily and her aunt continued their walk in the park, feeling happy and proud of themselves for saving the little bird.
once upon a time, there was a bird named tweety. tweety loved to soar high in the sky and sing happy songs. one day, tweety saw a shiny object on top of a tall stair. tweety wanted to see what it was, so she flew up to the top of the stair. but when tweety got there, she saw a noisy cat waiting for her!

tweety tried to fly away, but the cat was too fast. the cat chased tweety around and around, trying to catch her. tweety was scared and didn't know what to do. suddenly, tweety had an idea. she flew up high into the sky and then dove down fast, right past the cat. the cat was so surprised that he fell down the stair and ran away.

tweety was safe and happy once again. she flew back up into the sky and sang a happy song, grateful to be free from the noisy cat. from that day on, tweety knew to be careful when exploring new places.

during the game, timmy pitched the ball and it went too high. his friends started to laugh at him. timmy felt sad and wanted to quit playing baseball forever. but his coach told him that everyone makes mistakes and that he should keep practicing.

timmy listened to his coach and kept practicing. he worked hard and soon became a great pitcher. his friends were happy for him and they all played together again. the moral of the story is that it's okay to make mistakes, as long as you keep trying and practicing, you can become very good at something.

his mom said, "why do you want to bury your ball?"

timmy replied, "i want to bury it so i can find it later and play with it again."

his mom smiled and said, "okay, but make sure you remember where you bury it." so, timmy went outside and buried his colorful ball in the backyard. he couldn't wait to dig it up and play with it again.

once upon a time, in a big green forest, there lived a little bee. the little bee had a home called a hive. the hive was where all the bees lived and worked together. the little bee had many friends in the hive.

one sunny day, the little bee and his friends went out to find food. they flew over flowers and trees. but then, the sky became dark and it started to rain. the little bee and his friends got very wet. they wanted to go back to their hive, but they didn't want to go back without food.

the little bee and his friends worked very hard, even though they were wet. they wanted to succeed in finding food for their hive. they visited many flowers and collected sweet nectar. finally, they had enough food to take back to the hive.

the little bee and his friends flew back to their hive, happy that they succeeded. they were still wet, but they didn't mind. they knew they had done a good job and helped their hive. and that night, all the bees in the hive slept happily, knowing they had plenty of food.

spot used his paws to massage tom's back. tom felt so happy and relaxed. he thanked spot for being such a good dog. they both settled on the couch and took a nice nap together.
once upon a time, there was a little dog named pippin. pippin loved to perform tricks for his friends. he would jump high and run fast, making everyone happy. pippin was a very good dog.

one day, pippin saw a big ball near a pass. it was a very pretty ball. pippin wanted to play with the ball, but it was on the other side of the pass. pippin was a very persistent dog, so he did not give up. he tried to find a way to get the ball.

pippin thought and thought. he tried to jump over the pass, but it was too big. he tried to go around the pass, but it was too long. finally, pippin had an idea. he would perform his best trick and dig a hole under the pass. pippin dug and dug until he made a tunnel. he crawled through the tunnel and got the pretty ball. pippin was very happy, and his friends were proud of him.

once upon a time, there was a clumsy bear named bobo. bobo loved to play with his stuff. he had lots of toys and soft things. one day, bobo found a big, red ball in the forest.

bobo was so happy. he said, "wow, a big ball! i want to play with it!" he tried to squeeze the ball, but it was too big. bobo was sad. he wanted to play with the ball, but he didn't know how.

then, bobo's friend, a little bird named chirpy, flew by. chirpy saw bobo looking sad. "why are you sad, bobo?" asked chirpy. bobo said, "i found this big ball, but i can't squeeze it." chirpy smiled and said, "you don't need to squeeze it. you can roll it and play with it that way!"

bobo and chirpy played with the big, red ball all day. they rolled it, kicked it, and had so much fun. bobo learned that even if he was clumsy, he could still play and have fun with his friends.

when they found the glue, tim was very careful to fix the eraser. the eraser was so happy to be whole again! from that day on, the eraser and tim became best friends. the eraser always helped tim with his drawings, and they had lots of fun together.
once upon a time, there was a red fish named fin. fin loved to swim in the big blue sea. one day, while swimming, fin found a journal. the journal had many pictures and words. fin wanted to show it to his best friend, bubbles.

fin swam fast to find bubbles. when he found her, he said, "bubbles, look at this journal i found!" bubbles looked at the journal and smiled. she said, "wow, fin! that's a pretty journal. let's look at it together."

fin and bubbles swam to a quiet spot and looked at the journal. they saw pictures of other fish and animals. they laughed and talked about the pictures. they had a fun time with the journal. after that, they swam back home, happy to have found a new treasure.

tom had an idea. he would find a new toy to replace his old one. so, he went to look for a new toy. he looked and looked, but he could not find a toy he liked.

at last, tom found a toy he liked. it was a big, soft ball. he played with it all day. but when it was time to sleep, tom could not sleep. the big, soft ball made a loud noise when he moved it. it would wake him up.

tom knew he had to find a new toy that would not wake him up. so, the next day, he looked again. he found a small, quiet toy. it was just right for him.

now, tom was a jolly cat again. he had a new toy that did not wake him up. he played with it all day and slept well at night.
once upon a time, there was a shy cat named kitty. kitty was scared to play with the other cats. one day, kitty saw a ball and wanted to play with it. but, kitty was too shy to ask the other cats to play with her.

kitty's friend, timmy the dog, saw that kitty was sad. timmy asked kitty, "why are you sad?" kitty said, "i want to play with the ball, but i'm too shy to ask the other cats." timmy had an idea. he said, "i will bring the ball to you, and we can play together."

timmy brought the ball to kitty, and they started to play. the other cats saw them playing and joined in. kitty was not shy anymore. she made many new friends and had a lot of fun playing with them.

the moral of the story is: don't be afraid to ask for help. friends can help you when you are shy or scared.

one day, they heard a loud shout. it was a man who needed help. the big horse, the small dog, and the tiny mouse all went outside to see what was wrong. the man's cart was stuck in the mud.

the big horse, the small dog, and the tiny mouse all worked together to help the man. the big horse pulled the cart, the small dog pushed, and the tiny mouse cheered them on. soon, the cart was out of the mud.

the man was so happy and said thank you to the animals. the big horse, the small dog, and the tiny mouse went back to their smelly stable. they were proud of their hard work and happy to be friends.

"this is a lime," tim said. "it's the perfect fruit. do you want to try some?"

sue tried the lime and liked it too. they both behaved and shared the lime. they became good friends and always played together at the park. and from that day on, they both loved limes and always behaved when they ate them.

once upon a time, there was a little rabbit named remy. remy lived in a hole underground. he loved to play with his friends and eat carrots. one day, remy saw a big, red ball. he thought it was a giant carrot. remy was very foolish and wanted to eat it.

remy tried to bite the ball, but it was very hard. he felt sad and didn't know what to do. he remembered his mom told him to pray when he needed help. so, remy closed his eyes and prayed for help.

suddenly, remy's friend, a wise old owl, came to help him. the owl told remy that the ball was not a carrot, but a toy. remy felt happy and thanked the owl. from that day on, remy and his friends played with the red ball and had lots of fun. and remy never tried to eat a ball again.
once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a small bunny named ben. ben loved to play with his friends, but one day, he felt hurt in his leg. he didn't know what to do, so he went to ask his friend, the wise owl.

the wise owl saw ben's hurt leg and said, "oh no, ben! you need to rest." ben didn't want to rest, but he knew the wise owl was right. he asked the owl, "how long do i need to rest?" the wise owl gave a little shrug and said, "you need to rest for one whole season."

ben was sad, but he knew he had to listen. he spent the whole season resting and watching his friends play. when the new season came, ben's leg was all better. he was so happy, and he ran to tell the wise owl, "thank you for helping me!" from then on, ben played with his friends and took care of his legs, so he wouldn't get hurt again. and they all lived happily ever after.
once upon a time, there was a boy named tim. one day, tim went on a walk with his dog, spot. they were looking for something new and fun. they wanted to discover a big and rich treasure.

as they walked, they saw a big tree. tim said to spot, "i think there is a treasure under the tree!" they dug and dug, but they did not find any treasure. they were sad, but they kept looking.

finally, they reached a hill. they saw a beautiful sunset. the sky was full of colors. tim said, "wow, spot! look at the sunset! this is our rich treasure!" they sat down and watched the sunset together. they were very happy to discover the treasure of the sunset.
one day, a boy went for a walk. he saw a cheap toy snake on the ground. the toy snake was not real, but it looked like a real snake. the boy picked up the toy snake and took it home with him.

at home, the boy played with the toy snake. he made the snake strike at his toys. the toys fell down when the snake hit them. the boy laughed and had fun with his new toy snake.

later, the boy showed his mom the toy snake. she was happy that he found a cheap toy to play with. they played together, making the snake strike at other toys. the boy and his mom had a fun day with the toy snake.
once upon a time, there was a nosy kid named tim. he liked to look at everything and ask many questions. one day, tim saw a big box in his room. he wanted to know what was inside.

tim asked his mom, "what is in the box?" his mom said, "that is a surprise, but you cannot open it until i say so." tim was sad, but he waited for his mom to leave the room.

when his mom left the room, tim tried to open the box. but, his little dog, spot, started to bark loudly. tim's mom came back and saw him trying to open the box. she said, "tim, you must wait for the right time to open the box." tim felt bad for not listening to his mom.

from that day on, tim learned to be patient and not to be too nosy. he waited for his mom to tell him when it was time to open the box. when the day came, tim found a new toy inside the box. he was happy and thanked his mom for the surprise.
once upon a time, there was a big, fierce lion named leo. leo lived in a green forest with his friends. one day, leo started to feel very sick. he could not play with his friends anymore. his friends were worried about him.

leo's best friend, a kind monkey named max, went to find some help. max found a wise old owl who knew about medicine. the owl gave max some special medicine to make leo feel better. max thanked the owl and went back to give the medicine to leo.

max gave the medicine to leo, and soon, leo started to feel better. leo was very happy and thanked max for helping him. now, leo could play with his friends again. everyone in the forest was happy and they all lived happily ever after.
once upon a time, there was a smart cat named tom. tom lived in a small house with his best friend, a little girl named sue. one day, sue had a big idea. she wanted to celebrate the night with tom.

sue said to tom, "let's have a fun night party!" tom meowed happily, and they started to plan. they put up pretty lights and set out yummy food. they invited all their friends, like the dog, the bird, and the rabbit.

as the night began, everyone came to the party. they played fun games, ate good food, and danced to happy songs. sue and tom were so happy to celebrate the night with their friends. and when the night was over, they knew they had the best party ever.
once upon a time, there was a square. the square liked to play games with his friends. they were very competitive.

one day, the square said, "let's prepare for a race!" all his friends agreed. they got ready for the race. they were excited.

the race began. all the friends ran as fast as they could. the square tried his best, but he was not fast. in the end, the circle won the race. the square was sad.

the circle said, "don't be sad, square. we all had fun!" the square smiled and said, "you're right. it was fun!" they all played more games and had a great day.
once upon a time, there was a fisherman named tom. he liked to plan his day by the sea. one day, tom was confused. he could not find his net to catch fish. he looked and looked, but it was gone.

tom asked his friend, sam. "did you see my net?" sam shook his head. "no, i didn't see it." tom was sad. he could not catch fish without his net. but sam had an idea. "let's look together," he said.

tom and sam looked all around. they looked near the sea and in the sand. at last, they found the net under a big rock. tom was so happy! now he could catch fish again. tom and sam went to the sea and caught many fish together. they were the best of friends.
once upon a time, there was a little yellow bird named sunny. sunny lived in a big tree in a nice park. every day, sunny would wake up when the sun came up, and sing a happy song.

one day, sunny woke up late. it was already noon! the sun was high in the sky. sunny felt sad because he missed singing his morning song. so, he decided to sing a special noon song instead.

sunny sang his new noon song with a big smile. all his friends in the park heard his song and came to listen. they all loved his new song. from that day on, sunny would sing his happy morning song and his special noon song for everyone to enjoy.
once upon a time, there was a tutor named tom. tom was very good at teaching kids. he had a perfect way to make learning fun. he liked to whistle while he worked.

one day, a little girl named sue came to tom for help. sue wanted to learn how to whistle too. tom said, "i will teach you how to whistle, sue. it is easy and fun!"

tom showed sue how to put her lips together and blow. sue tried and tried, but she could not whistle. tom said, "do not worry, sue. keep trying and you will get it." sue practiced every day with tom.

one day, sue finally learned how to whistle. she was so happy! sue said, "thank you, tom! you are the best tutor ever!" tom smiled and said, "you did a great job, sue. now we can whistle together!"

from that day on, sue and tom would whistle while they learned. they had lots of fun and became the best of friends.
one day, a nice girl named lucy went to visit her friend tom. tom was very happy to see lucy. they liked to play together. they played with their toy cars and dolls. they had a lot of fun.

as they played, lucy hurt her finger. "ouch!" she said, "my finger hurts!" tom looked at her finger and saw a little red spot. he wanted to help lucy feel better.

tom went to his mom and asked for a band-aid. he put the band-aid on lucy's finger. "thank you, tom," said lucy with a smile. "you're a good friend." now, lucy's finger felt better, and they continued to play and have a nice day together.
once upon a time, in a small place, there was a red ball. the red ball had many friends who liked to play with it. they would roll it, bounce it, and throw it in the air. the red ball was very happy because it felt valued by its friends.

one day, a little girl named sally came to the place. she saw the red ball and said, "hi, red ball! can i play with you?" the red ball was happy to have a new friend and said, "yes, sally! let's play together!"

sally and the red ball played all day long. they rolled on the grass, bounced in the sun, and threw the ball high in the sky. the red ball felt even more valued by its new friend. at the end of the day, sally hugged the red ball and said, "thank you, red ball! i had so much fun today!" the red ball smiled and said, "thank you, sally! i am happy to be your friend and play with you!" and from that day on, sally and the red ball were best friends and played together in the place every day.
once upon a time, there was a famous snack. it was a yummy cookie. everyone loved it. the cookie was sweet and tasty. it was the best snack in the town.

one day, a little boy named tim wanted to taste the famous snack. he asked his mom for the cookie. his mom said, "yes, you can have the cookie." tim was very happy.

tim took a big bite of the cookie. it tasted so good! he shared the cookie with his friends. they all loved the famous snack. they played and ate the cookie together. it was a fun day.
once upon a time, there was a big hippo. the hippo lived near a river. every day, the hippo would drink water from the river. the water was cool and tasted very good.

one day, the hippo saw a little bird. the bird was thirsty, but it could not drink from the river. the hippo felt sad for the bird. so, the hippo used its big mouth to help the bird drink. the bird was happy, and it said "thank you" to the hippo.

but then, the other hippos saw what happened. they laughed at the big hippo. the big hippo felt embarrassed. but the little bird told the big hippo, "you are kind. you are my friend." the big hippo smiled and felt happy again. from that day on, the big hippo and the little bird were best friends.
once upon a time, in a small town, there lived an unusual barber. he loved to dress up in funny clothes while he cut hair. the people in the town liked to visit him because he made them laugh.

one day, a little boy came to the barber for a haircut. the barber was wearing a big hat and a long, colorful coat. the boy giggled as the barber danced around while cutting his hair. the boy's mom watched and smiled.

in the end, the boy had a nice haircut, and he and his mom left the barber's shop feeling happy. the unusual barber waved goodbye, and the boy knew he would come back to see him again.
one day, a little girl named lily went to the park. she liked to play on the swings and slide. as she played, she saw a big dog. the dog was very friendly and came to say hello.

lily said, "hi dog! do you want to play with me?" the dog wagged its tail, showing it was happy. they played together for a while, running and laughing. but then, lily accidentally stepped on the dog's toe.

"ouch!" cried the dog. lily felt bad and said, "i'm sorry, dog. i didn't mean to hurt you." the dog looked at her and said, "it's okay, lily. just be careful next time."

lily wanted to make the dog feel better, so she gave it a gentle slap on its back, like a pat. the dog wagged its tail and they continued to play. they played until the sun went down and it was time to go home. lily knew she had made a new friend and they would play together whenever they were both available at the park.
one day, a little boy named tim went to the park with his mom. they saw a stubborn lizard on a rock. the lizard did not want to move. tim looked at the lizard and said, "hi, lizard! why are you so stubborn?"

the lizard looked at tim and said, "i need to choose a new home. but i can't find one i like." tim thought for a moment and then said, "i can help you choose a home, lizard!"

tim and the lizard looked around the park. they saw a big tree, a small bush, and a tall rock. the lizard looked at all the homes and said, "i choose the big tree!"

tim and his mom helped the lizard move to the big tree. the lizard was happy in his new home. tim said, "bye, lizard! have fun in your new home!" the lizard waved goodbye and said, "thank you, tim!"
once upon a time, there was a little rabbit named remy. remy loved to eat radishes. one day, he found a big radish in the garden. remy thought he was very lucky.

the next morning, remy did not wake up early. he was very foolish to sleep late. when he woke up, he ran to the garden to eat the big radish. but he was too late.

a big, mean bird saw the radish first. the bird ate the whole radish in front of remy. remy was very sad and hungry. he learned that he should not be foolish and always wake up early.
once upon a time, there was a big, graceful cat. the cat had pretty, soft fur. one day, the cat saw a shiny copper toy. the cat wanted to play with the toy. but, the toy was in a small house.

the cat tried to enter the small house. but, the door was too little. the cat could not go in. the cat was sad. the cat wanted the copper toy so much.

then, the cat saw a big dog. the dog was strong. the cat asked the dog for help. the dog pushed the small house. the house fell down. the cat got the shiny copper toy. the cat and the dog were happy. they played with the toy together.
once upon a time, there was a tall man. the tall man wore a suit. one day, he went for a walk in the park.

in the park, the tall man saw a little boy. the little boy said, "hi, tall man! i like your suit." the tall man smiled and said, "thank you, little boy."

then, a big cat appeared. the cat was not nice. the cat jumped on the tall man's suit. the suit got dirty. the tall man was sad. the end.
once upon a time, there was a big rhinoceros named remy. remy loved to make things with his friends. one day, remy and his friends went to the park to play.

at the park, remy saw a lemon tree. he thought it would be fun to make lemonade for his friends. remy picked some lemons from the tree and squeezed them into a cup. he added water and gave it to his friends.

when his friends tasted the lemonade, they made a funny face. it was very bitter! remy forgot to add sugar. they all laughed and tried again. this time, the lemonade was sweet and yummy. they drank it all up and played happily ever after.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named tim and a little girl named sue. they both had a toy they loved. tim had a red ball and sue had a blue car. they played with their toys all day today.

tim and sue met at the park. they played with their toys, but they didn't share. tim said, "i want to play with your car." sue said, "i want to play with your ball." but they didn't share, and they both felt sad.

then, a big wind came. it was a harsh wind that took the red ball and blue car away. tim and sue were very sad. they looked for their toys, but they couldn't find them. they decided to look for the toys together.

as they looked, they found a green truck. tim said, "let's share the green truck." sue said, "yes, let's share." they played with the green truck and were happy. they learned to share and became best friends.
once upon a time, there was a girl named sue who loved to read. she read big books, small books, and all kinds of books. sue read every day and night. reading made her very happy.

one day, sue found a secret door in her house. she took a step inside and saw a big room full of books. the room was rich with colors, and the books were shiny and new. sue was so excited to read them all.

sue spent her days reading the books in the secret room. she read about animals, stars, and faraway places. the more sue read, the more she learned. she became the smartest girl in her town, and everyone loved her stories.
once upon a time, there was a little car named cari. cari was sad because she had no fuel. she wanted to go fast and play with her friends, but she couldn't. cari hoped that she could find some fuel soon.

one day, cari saw a big truck with lots of fuel. the truck said, "cari, i can give you some fuel, but you must promise to share it with your friends." cari was so happy and said, "yes, i promise to share."

cari got the fuel and went to play with her friends. they all had fun, and cari shared the fuel with them. they were all very happy. in the end, cari learned that sharing with friends is a good thing to do.
once upon a time, there was a wise cat named tom. tom loved to sing songs. one day, he found a microphone in the park. he was very happy and carried it home.

tom decided to sing with his new microphone. he sang loud and clear. all the other animals in the park came to listen. they danced and clapped as tom sang.

after a while, tom got tired. he shut his eyes and rested. the other animals went home too. they all knew that tom was a wise cat who could sing beautiful songs with his special microphone.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she lived in a small house with her mommy, daddy, and her pet cat, whiskers. lily loved to play with whiskers and eat yummy food.

one day, lily's mommy made some rice for dinner. the rice was white and soft. lily thought it looked very tasty. she decided she wanted to share her rice with whiskers. but, she had to be careful because the rice was fragile and could break easily.

lily took a small bowl and put some rice in it. she carried the bowl very slowly and carefully to whiskers. whiskers sniffed the rice and started to eat it. lily was happy that she could share her dinner with her pet. they both enjoyed the rice and had a fun time together.
one day, a little girl named sue was playing in her room. she saw a big curtain near her bed. sue felt comfortable sitting near the curtain. she liked how soft it was.

sue's mom came into the room and said, "sue, it's time to eat." but sue did not want to eat. she refused to go to the table. sue said, "no, i want to play with the curtain."

sue's mom thought for a moment. then she said, "how about we eat near the curtain? that way, you can still play after we eat." sue liked the idea. so, they ate near the curtain, and sue was happy.
once upon a time, there was a big elephant named elly. elly lived in a warm, sunny place with her family. they liked to play and eat together. elly was a very happy elephant.

one day, elly wanted to help her family. she thought, "i can work and help them find food!" so, elly went to look for food in the forest. she used her long nose to pick up leaves and fruits.

elly worked very hard and soon she had a big pile of food. she brought the food back to her family, and they were so happy. they ate the food together and had a fun day. elly felt proud that she could work and help her family.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her mom's makeup. one day, lily found her mom's makeup bag and started to put makeup on her face. she felt so happy and pretty.

but then, lily started to feel uncomfortable. the makeup was itchy and made her want to tear it off her face. she tried to rub it off, but it just made her face more red and itchy. lily started to cry.

her mom heard her cry and came to help. she gently cleaned lily's face with a soft cloth and warm water. the makeup was gone, and lily felt much better. her mom hugged her and told her that she was beautiful just the way she was. from that day on, lily never played with makeup again.
one day, a helpful bird named bluey lived on a small island. bluey liked to come and help his friends. he had many friends on the island. they played and had fun together.

one sunny day, bluey saw a big cloud coming to the island. he knew the cloud would bring rain. bluey told his friends, "rain will come. we need to find a safe place to stay." his friends listened to bluey and they all looked for a safe place.

the rain came and it was very wet. bluey and his friends were safe and dry in a big cave. when the rain stopped, they all came out of the cave. they were happy and thanked bluey for his help. bluey was a helpful friend and they all played together again.
once upon a time, there was a little bee. the bee was very filthy. it did not like to be clean. the bee had many friends, but they did not like how dirty it was.

one day, the bee went to play with its friends. the friends said, "we hate how filthy you are! we don't want to play with you." the bee felt very sad but did not want to be clean.

the bee went to find new friends. it found a big spider. the spider said, "i like how filthy you are. we can be friends." the bee was happy to have a new friend. but the spider was not a good friend. it wanted to eat the bee.

in the end, the spider ate the bee. the bee's old friends were sad. they wished they had been kinder to the filthy bee.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a yellow toy chest in her room. every day, she would open the chest and play with her toys.

one sunny day, lily decided to set up a tea party for her dolls. she took out her tea set from the yellow chest and set it up on a small table. she invited all her dolls to the tea party.

lily and her dolls had a great time at the tea party. they laughed and played all day. when the sun went down, lily put all her toys back into the yellow chest and said goodnight to her dolls. she was so happy and couldn't wait for the next day to play again.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named tim. tim was a very obedient boy. he always listened to his mom and dad. one day, tim had a bad dream, also called a nightmare. he woke up feeling scared and sad.

tim went to his mom and told her about the nightmare. his mom hugged him and said, "don't worry, tim. i will help you wipe away the bad dream." she took a soft cloth and gently wiped tim's face, as if she was wiping away the bad dream.

after that, tim felt much better. he knew that his mom would always be there to help him. so, he went back to bed and had a good night's sleep. from that day on, whenever tim had a nightmare, he would remember his mom's words and feel safe and loved.
once upon a time, there was a little cat. the cat had a dirty paw. it was nervous because it did not like dirty paws. the cat wanted to play with its friends, but it was scared that they would see its dirty paw.

the cat saw a soft cloth. it thought, "i can use this to wipe my paw!" the cat was happy to find a way to clean its paw. it wiped and wiped until the paw was clean.

now, the cat was not nervous anymore. it ran to play with its friends. they played all day, and the cat was very happy. the cat knew that if its paw got dirty again, it could just wipe it clean.
once upon a time, in a small town, there lived a kind girl named lucy. she had a big heart and loved to lend her toys to her friends. lucy had a lot of friends because she was always nice to everyone.

one day, lucy's mom gave her a special treat. it was a big, yummy cookie. lucy wanted to share her treat with her friends. so, she went outside to look for them. she found a new boy who didn't know about sharing. he was a little ignorant.

lucy decided to teach the new boy about sharing. she broke her cookie into smaller pieces and gave one to the boy. the boy was so happy and thankful. he learned how to share and became a good friend. from that day on, lucy and the boy shared many treats and toys together.
once upon a time, there was a kind duck. the duck lived on a farm. the duck had a friend, a little girl. the little girl loved to eat waffles. she would share her waffles with the duck.

one day, the duck found a big egg. the duck lay next to the egg to keep it warm. the little girl saw the duck and the egg. she was happy and waited for the egg to hatch.

after some days, the egg hatched. a baby duck came out. the baby duck was very cute. the little girl fed the baby duck waffles too. they all played together and had fun. the kind duck and the little girl learned that sharing and caring for others made them very happy.
once upon a time, a little boy named tim went for a walk. he saw a big tree and wanted to climb it. tim did not mind the sign that said, "do not climb." he thought it would be fun to go up high.

as tim climbed, he felt a hurt in his hand. he looked down and saw a small cut. but he did not want to stop, so he kept going up. the tree was very tall, and he could see his house from the top.

suddenly, tim lost his grip and fell down. he landed on the ground with a thud. tim was very hurt and cried. his mom and dad came running and saw the sign. they were sad that tim did not mind the sign, and now he was hurt.
once upon a time, there was a fancy calendar. it had pretty pictures and bright colors. the calendar hung on the wall in a little girl's room. she loved to look at the pictures every day.

one day, the little girl heard a noise. it was a loud noise that made her jump. she was scared. she looked around the room to see what made the noise. she saw the fancy calendar on the floor. the wind had blown it down.

the little girl picked up the calendar and put it back on the wall. she was not scared anymore. she knew that the wind had made the noise. she smiled at the fancy calendar and felt happy again.
once upon a time, there was a jolly youth named tim. tim loved to play and laugh with his friends. they played ball, ran around, and had fun all day long.

one day, tim saw a new kid named sam. sam looked sad and lonely. tim went to sam and said, "hi, do you want to play with us?" sam smiled and said, "yes, i would love to!" so, tim, sam, and their friends played together.

after playing, they all sat down and shared their snacks. they talked, laughed, and had a great time. tim and sam became best friends. the moral of the story is to be kind and make new friends.
once upon a time, there was a black cat. the cat liked to play with a sack. one day, the cat found a big sack in the yard. the cat was happy and wanted to touch the sack.

the cat went close to the sack and touched it. but, the sack moved! the cat was scared but wanted to play. so, the cat touched the sack again. this time, the sack opened.

out came a big dog from the sack. the dog was not nice. the black cat was very scared. the dog chased the cat away. the cat could not play with the sack anymore. the cat was sad, and it was a bad day for the black cat.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named sue. sue had a cat named max. max was very alert. he liked to watch the birds outside. sue liked to watch max.

one day, sue saw max looking out the window. she went to see what he was watching. sue saw a big bird with a red mouth. she thought it was pretty. sue wanted to touch the bird, but she had to mind her mom. her mom said not to touch birds.

sue called her mom to see the bird. her mom saw the bird and smiled. she said, "that bird has a pretty red mouth!" sue and her mom watched the bird together. they were happy. sue knew that minding her mom was a good thing to do.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named amy. amy loved to design things. she would draw and make things out of paper and string. one day, she made a long chain out of paper. it was very pretty and colorful.

amy wanted to make her chain useful. she thought and thought. then, she had an idea! she could use her chain to help her mommy. amy's mommy was always losing her keys. so, amy took her chain and tied it to her mommy's keys.

now, amy's mommy could always find her keys. the chain was very useful. amy was happy to help her mommy. she learned that when you make something pretty and useful, it can make others happy too. and that is a good thing to do.
once upon a time, there was a team of four friends. they were tom, tim, kim, and jim. they liked to play together every day. they would run, jump, and laugh in the park. they enjoyed being together and having fun.

one sunny day, they decided to have a picnic. they all brought yummy food to share. tom brought apples, tim brought sandwiches, kim brought cookies, and jim brought juice. they sat on a big blanket under a tree and enjoyed their yummy treats.

after they ate, they played games like tag and hide-and-seek. they laughed and had a great time. when the sun began to set, they said goodbye and went home. they knew they would enjoy more fun days together as a team.
once upon a time, there was a little dog named max. max was a weak dog, but he was very happy. max loved to play with his ball and run in the park.

one day, max found a big tub of butter. he didn't know what it was, but he thought it smelled good. max jumped into the butter and started to eat some. he got very messy, and butter was all over him.

max's mom saw him and said, "oh no! you need a bath now!" she took max to the bathroom and started to bathe him. max liked the warm water and soon, all the butter was gone. max was clean again, and he was happy. he promised not to jump into butter anymore.
once upon a time, there was a little bird named tweet. tweet had a beautiful feather. one day, tweet saw a big crab named pinchy. pinchy liked to pinch things with his big claws.

tweet said to pinchy, "please don't pinch my feather!" pinchy felt frustrated because he wanted to pinch something. he thought hard and said, "i won't pinch your feather, but let's find something else for me to pinch."

tweet and pinchy looked around and found a pile of sticks. pinchy pinched the sticks and made a nice home for both of them. they were both happy and became good friends.

the moral of the story is: talking and working together can solve problems and make everyone happy.
once upon a time, there was a little ghost named boo. boo lived in a big, old house. he liked to play with his toy car and eat sour candy.

one day, boo was playing in the house when he heard a noise. he was scared, but he wanted to find out what it was. so, he started to look around the house. he looked in the kitchen, the living room, and the bedroom.

finally, he found a little girl named lily in the attic. she was playing with her dolls. boo and lily became friends and played together every day. they shared their toys and even their sour candy. and they lived happily ever after.
once upon a time, in a big gray house, there lived a kind girl named amy. amy loved to help her mom and dad. she also loved to teach her little brother, tim, new things. they would play and learn together every day.

one sunny day, amy and tim found a lost kitten outside. the kitten was very scared and hungry. amy and tim wanted to help the kitten. they thought hard about what to do. they decided to ask their mom and dad for help.

amy and tim's mom and dad were very proud of them for wanting to help the kitten. they all worked together to feed the kitten and find its home. the kitten was happy to be home, and amy and tim learned that it is important to help others.
once upon a time, in a small school, there was a green room. in this green room, there was a class of little kids. they liked to play, laugh, and learn new things. their teacher, miss lily, was very kind and loved to teach them.

one day, miss lily asked the class a question. she said, "what color is the grass outside?" the kids thought for a moment and then shouted, "green!" miss lily smiled and said, "good job, everyone!"

the next day, the class went outside to play. they saw the green grass and remembered miss lily's question. they were happy that they knew the answer. they played all day on the green grass, and when they went back inside, they told miss lily how much fun they had.
once upon a time, in a small town, there was a little girl named lucy. she loved the color pink. one day, she saw a pink package on the table. she wanted to open it but knew she should ask her mom first.

lucy went to her mom and asked, "mom, can i open the pink package on the table?" her mom said, "yes, but first observe what is around it. is there a name on it?" lucy looked and saw her sister's name, lily, on the package.

lucy did not open the package because it was for her sister. when lily came home, she was very happy to see her pink package. lily said, "thank you, lucy, for not opening my package." lucy felt good that she did the right thing. she learned that it is important to observe and respect other people's things.
once upon a time, there was a little worm named wiggly. wiggly was a very happy worm. he lived in a big garden with lots of delicious food to eat. every day, wiggly would wiggle around the garden, looking for yummy things to munch on.

one day, wiggly met a new friend, a tiny bug named buggy. "hello, i am wiggly," said the little worm. "hi, i am buggy," said the tiny bug. wiggly and buggy decided to play together in the garden. they had so much fun playing hide and seek, and laughing all day.

as the sun started to set, wiggly and buggy got very tired. they decided to settle down and rest under a big, green leaf. as they lay there, wiggly said, "buggy, today was so much fun! i am so happy we are friends." buggy smiled and said, "me too, wiggly! let's play again tomorrow." and so, the little worm and the tiny bug closed their eyes and went to sleep, dreaming of more fun days together in the big, beautiful garden.
once upon a time, in a big tree, there was a little squirrel. the little squirrel loved to find nuts. one day, he found a big, rough nut on the ground. he was very happy and said, "wow! this is the biggest nut i have ever seen!"

the little squirrel tried to open the rough nut, but it was too hard. he said, "i need help to open this nut." so, he asked his friend, the bird, for help. the bird tried to open the nut with its beak, but it was still too hard. they both said, "we need more help."

they went to their friend, the strong bear. the bear tried to open the rough nut with his big paws. with a loud crack, the nut opened! inside, there were many small, tasty nuts. the little squirrel, the bird, and the bear shared the nuts and said, "thank you for helping us open the rough nut!"

from that day on, the friends always helped each other when they found something hard to do. they learned that working together made things easier and more fun. and they all lived happily in the big tree.
once upon a time, there was a lively little bird named chirpy. chirpy lived in a big tree with many friends. chirpy liked to hop on their shoulders and sing happy songs.

one day, chirpy saw a big cat near the tree. the cat wanted to catch chirpy and his friends. chirpy was scared, but he had an idea. he flew to his friend, the big dog, and asked for help. chirpy hopped on the dog's shoulder and said, "please help us, big dog!"

the big dog barked and chased the cat away. chirpy and his friends were safe. chirpy thanked the big dog for saving them. from that day on, chirpy and the big dog became best friends. they played together and chirpy always sang happy songs on the dog's shoulder.
once upon a time, in a pretty land, there was a big beach. the beach had soft sand. many kids came to play in the sand. they made sand castles and drew pictures.

one day, a happy girl named lily came to the beach. she saw the soft sand and wanted to dance. she danced and danced in the sand. her feet felt good in the sand. the other kids saw lily dance and they wanted to dance too.

so, all the kids danced in the sand. they laughed and had fun. they danced until the sun went down. then, they said goodbye to the pretty beach and went home. the sand had a big dance party and everyone was happy.
one day, a boy named tim went to the park with his mom. they sat down to eat lunch. tim noticed his mom had a rare sauce on her sandwich. "mom, what is that?" he asked.

his mom said, "this is a rare sauce that i found at the store. it is very tasty. do you want to try some, tim?" tim said yes and his mom put some sauce on his sandwich.

tim took a bite and smiled. "i like the sauce, mom!" he said. they enjoyed their lunch at the park and played on the swings. they had a fun day and tim was happy he got to try the rare sauce.
one day, a little boy named tim went with his mom to the grocery store. they needed to buy food for dinner. tim saw a broken toy on the floor. he wanted to pick it up, but his mom said, "no, tim. that toy is broken. let's go find some good food."

tim and his mom walked around the grocery store. they found apples, carrots, and bread. tim saw a big dog outside the store. he wanted to pet the dog, but his mom said, "tim, we must remain inside the store. the dog might be lost."

tim was sad, but he listened to his mom. they finished shopping and went home. tim's mom made a yummy dinner. they ate together and talked about their day. tim was happy he could help his mom at the grocery store.
one day, a little girl named sue wanted to help her mom. her mom had a lot of tasks to do. sue asked her mom, "can i help you with a task?" her mom said, "yes, you can organize your toys. that is an easy task for you."

sue went to her room and saw her toys all over the floor. she started to organize them. she put her dolls in one corner and her cars in another. sue felt happy helping her mom with the easy task.

when sue was done, she called her mom to see. her mom came into the room and said, "wow, great job organizing your toys, sue!" sue smiled and felt proud. from that day on, sue always helped her mom with easy tasks around the house.
once upon a time, a little boy named tim went to visit his grandma. she lived in a small house near the woods. tim liked to play with his toys and eat cookies at grandma's house.

one day, tim saw a weak bird outside. he was worried about the bird. he asked his grandma, "what can we do to help the bird?" grandma said, "we can give it some food and water."

they put food and water near the bird. the bird ate and drank. soon, it felt better and could fly again. tim was happy to help the bird. he and his grandma went back inside and enjoyed their cookies.
one day, a little girl named mia went to the gym with her mom. the gym was big and had many things to play with. mia saw a fancy dress hanging on the wall. she wanted to try it on and play.

mia asked her mom, "can i try the fancy dress?" her mom said, "yes, but be careful." mia put on the fancy dress and felt very happy. she twirled around and danced in the gym.

mia tried to jump high like a frog while wearing the fancy dress. she had lots of fun at the gym with her mom. when it was time to go home, mia took off the fancy dress and said goodbye to the gym.
one day, a cat and a dog were playing in the park. they found a tasty pill on the ground. the cat wanted to eat it, but the dog wanted it too. they did not know what to do.

they sat down to discuss who should get the pill. the cat said, "i saw it first, so i should eat it." the dog said, "but i am bigger and need it more." they both wanted the pill very much.

then, a big bird came down from the sky. the bird took the tasty pill away. the cat and the dog were sad. they learned that they should share things and not fight.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named jane. she had a pretty skirt that she loved to wear. one day, jane went to the park to play.

at the park, jane met a nosy squirrel. the squirrel wanted to know all about jane's skirt. jane decided to tell the squirrel about her skirt. she said, "my skirt is pink and has flowers on it. i like to twirl in my skirt."

the nosy squirrel liked jane's story. they played together all day. jane would twirl in her skirt and the squirrel would clap. they became best friends and had lots of fun at the park. and jane loved to tell stories to her new friend.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named amy. she loved to store her toys in a special space in her room. one day, she became anxious because she could not find her favorite toy, a small blue car.

amy looked everywhere in her room, but the blue car was not there. she felt sad and asked her mom for help. "mom, i can't find my blue car. can you help me?" her mom said, "of course, amy. let's look together."

they searched the whole house, and finally, they found the blue car under the couch. amy was so happy and said, "thank you, mom!" from that day on, amy always made sure to store her toys in the special space in her room, so she would never feel anxious about losing them again.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named tim. he had a big snack box full of yummy treats. tim was a bit selfish and did not like to share his snacks with others.

one day, tim's mom told him to mind his little sister, sue. sue was hungry and wanted a snack too. but tim wanted all the snacks for himself.

tim's mom saw this and taught tim to share. tim learned that sharing was good and made others happy. he shared his snacks with sue, and they both enjoyed them together. from that day on, tim was not selfish anymore and always shared his snacks with his friends and family.
once upon a time, there was a big clock in a small room. the clock was mysterious. it had a face and two hands. every day, the clock went "tick-tock, tick-tock." 

one day, a little girl named lucy came into the room. she looked at the clock and said, "hello, clock! why are you so mysterious?" the clock did not answer. it just went "tick-tock, tick-tock." lucy felt a tickle in her nose. she tried to hold it in, but she could not. "achoo!" she sneezed.

the sneeze was so big, it made the clock's hands move. the clock said, "thank you, lucy! your sneeze helped me. i was stuck, but now i can move again." lucy smiled and said, "you're welcome, clock!" from that day on, the mysterious clock and lucy were the best of friends.
one day, a curious little boy named tim went to school. in his bag, he had a big, red pencil. he was very happy with his pencil and couldn't wait to use it. he knew it was a special pencil.

at school, tim met a girl named sue. sue did not have a pencil. she looked sad. tim thought about his big, red pencil and had an idea. he said, "sue, let's share my pencil. we can both use it, and we can both be happy!"

sue smiled and said, "thank you, tim! you are very kind." they both used the big, red pencil to draw and write. they became very good friends. tim was happy that he shared his pencil with sue.

the other kids in school saw tim and sue sharing the pencil. they thought it was a good idea. they started to share their things too. the teacher was very proud of tim and sue.

the moral of the story is that sharing makes everyone happy. when we share, we make friends and show kindness to others.
once upon a time, there was a funny cat named fluffy. fluffy lived in a big house with his best friend, a little boy named tim. they loved to play and have fun together. fluffy had soft fur that tim liked to rub.

one day, fluffy and tim were playing in the yard. fluffy did not know where his favorite toy was. he looked and looked, but he could not find it. tim saw fluffy was sad, so he said, "don't worry, fluffy. i will help you find your toy."

tim and fluffy looked all around the yard. they looked under the big tree, behind the little bush, and even in the tall grass. then, tim saw the toy hiding in the flowers. "there it is, fluffy!" he said. fluffy was so happy to have his toy back.

they played with the toy for a long time. fluffy and tim laughed and had lots of fun. after they were tired, tim gave fluffy a big rub. they were very happy to have each other as friends.
once upon a time, there was a polite little girl named lily. she loved going to the beach with her family. one day, while playing near the water, she found an oyster. the oyster was hiding in the sand. lily thought it looked special.

lily took the oyster home and showed it to her mom. her mom told her that oysters sometimes have a surprise inside. lily wanted to open the oyster, but her mom said to wait. lily did not listen and opened the oyster. inside, she found a pretty pearl. but lily felt bad because she did not wait like her mom said. she felt regret.

lily gave the pearl to her mom and said sorry for not waiting. her mom hugged her and said that it was okay. she was happy that lily learned to listen and be patient. the moral of the story is to always listen to your parents and be patient, because good things come to those who wait.
one day, a little boy named tim found a big eraser. it was not like any other eraser. this eraser was independent and could talk!

the eraser said, "hi, tim! i can help you lock doors." tim was surprised but happy. he said, "wow! can you help me lock my toy box?" the eraser said, "of course! let's go!"

tim and the eraser went to the toy box. the eraser touched the toy box and it locked. tim said, "thank you, eraser!" they became best friends and locked many things together.
once upon a time, there was a boy named tim and a girl named sue. they were brother and sister. they liked to play with their toys and watch television. but one day, the television was very boring. there was nothing fun to watch.

tim and sue started to quarrel because they were bored. tim wanted to play with the toy car, but sue wanted to play with the toy doll. they could not agree on what to play with. their mom heard them quarrel and came into the room.

mom told tim and sue to stop the quarrel. she said they could play with both the toy car and the toy doll. tim and sue stopped fighting and started to play together. they had fun and forgot about the boring television. they learned to share and be happy together.
once upon a time, there was a cat named tom. tom liked to be organized. he had a shop where he would sell ties. every day, he would put his ties in nice rows on a table.

one day, a dog named max came to the shop. max wanted to buy a tie. tom showed him all the ties, but max could not pick one. tom had an idea. he said, "come back tomorrow, i will have a new tie for you."

that night, tom made a special tie just for max. it was blue, max's favorite color. the next day, max came back to the shop. he saw the blue tie and loved it. tom was happy that he could help max. from that day on, they were best friends.
once upon a time, there was a playful dog named spot. spot loved to run and play with his friends. one day, spot saw a new player in the park. the player was a little boy named tim.

spot wanted to invite tim to play with him, so he ran up to tim and said, "hi, i am spot. do you want to play with me?" tim smiled and said, "yes, i want to play with you, spot!"

they played all day in the park. they ran, jumped, and laughed together. spot and tim became best friends. and from that day on, they played together every day.
once upon a time, there was a playful cat named kitty. kitty loved to play with her toy mouse and jump around the house. one day, kitty found a big thing called a piano. the piano had many black and white keys that made fun sounds when kitty pressed them with her paws.

kitty's friend, doggy, came over to see what the noise was. "what are you doing, kitty?" doggy asked. "i am playing the piano," kitty said with a big smile. "it is so much fun! do you want to try?" doggy wagged his tail and said, "yes, please!"

kitty and doggy played the piano together, making loud and soft sounds. they laughed and danced to the music they made. they played until they were tired and then lay down near the piano, happy with their new game. from that day on, kitty and doggy loved to play the piano and make music for everyone to hear.
once upon a time, in a small town, there was a little boy named tim. tim loved to play with his red toy train. he would put the train on the rail and watch it go round and round.

one sunny day, tim took his red train outside to play. he put the train on the rail in his backyard. his friend, sam, came over and saw the train. sam said, "wow, your red train is so cool! can i play with it too?"

tim smiled and said, "yes, you can play with my red train." so, tim and sam put the train on the rail and watched it go round and round. they laughed and had so much fun playing with the red train together.

as the sun began to set, tim's mom called out, "tim, it's time to come in!" tim and sam picked up the red train and the rail. they said goodbye and went inside.

that night, tim put his red train on the rail by his bed. he smiled as he thought about the fun day he had with his friend, sam. tim knew that he would have many more happy days playing with his red train.
once upon a time, in a big park, there was a playful little girl named lily. she loved to play on the swing. she would go up and down, laughing and having fun.

one day, lily saw a small cat stuck in a tree. the cat was scared and couldn't get down. lily wanted to help the cat, so she tried to think of a way to solve the problem.

lily had an idea! she climbed onto the swing and swung as high as she could. when she was close to the tree, she reached out and grabbed the cat. then, she brought the cat down to the ground. the cat was happy and safe, all thanks to lily and her playful swing.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named tim. tim had a toy saw that he loved to play with. he liked to pretend that he was a builder and built many things with his saw. one day, tim saw a big tree in his yard. he wanted to build something with the tree, so he went to get his saw.

tim started to cut the tree with his saw. he tried very hard, but the tree seemed too big for him. he got upset because he could not cut it. tim's mom saw him and told him to stop. she said the tree was too big for him to cut with his toy saw. tim did not listen to his mom and kept trying to cut the tree.

then, as tim was cutting the tree, it fell down. the tree fell on tim's playhouse and broke it. tim was very upset. he cried because his playhouse was broken. his mom told him that he should have listened to her. now, tim did not have a playhouse to play in anymore. the ending was bad for tim because he did not listen to his mom.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named tim. he had a boring day. he played with his toys, but he was not happy. he wanted to do something fun.

one day, tim noticed a small, round pill on the floor. he did not know what it was. he picked it up and showed it to his mom. she told him it was a pill to help people feel better when they were sick. tim thought it was interesting.

tim's mom said, "let's play a game to make the day fun!" they played a game of hide and seek. tim hid behind the big chair, and his mom found him. they laughed and had a great time. the boring day turned into a fun day, and tim was happy.
one day, a happy girl named lily went to the park. she saw a swing and ran to it. she sat on the swing and began to play. she was swinging high in the sky. lily was having so much fun.

a boy named tim saw lily on the swing. he wanted to play too. but he did not know how to say "welcome" or how to share. he was ignorant. tim said, "i want the swing. go away!" lily stopped swinging and felt sad.

lily's mom came and said, "tim, you should say 'welcome' and share the swing with lily." tim thought for a moment and then said, "i'm sorry. lily, you are welcome to swing with me." they took turns on the swing and became friends. the moral of the story is to always share and say "welcome" to make friends.
once upon a time, there was a busy bee named buzzy. buzzy loved to fly around and play with his friends. one sunny day, buzzy and his friends decided to build a big sandcastle. they needed to find the right equipment to make the best sandcastle ever.

buzzy's friend, sally the snail, had a small shovel. but buzzy insisted that they needed something bigger. they searched and searched until they found a big bucket. buzzy knew that this was the perfect equipment for their sandcastle.

they worked together, using the big bucket to make the tallest sandcastle in the whole park. all the other bugs came to see what they had made. buzzy and his friends felt so proud of their hard work. and from that day on, everyone knew that when buzzy insisted on something, it was always for the best.
once upon a time, there was a helpful girl named lily. she lived in a small house with her mom, dad, and dog, max. lily loved to help her family and friends. she always had a big smile on her face.

one day, lily's mom asked her to send a letter to her grandma. lily was excited to help. she put the letter in a big envelope and put a stamp on it. the stamp was pretty, with a picture of a flower on it.

lily and max went to the mailbox together. they put the letter in the mailbox and closed the door. lily was happy to be helpful. she knew her grandma would love the letter. they went back home and told her mom that the letter was sent. everyone was happy.
one day, a little girl named lily went to the park. she loved to skip and play. the sun was shining and the birds were singing. lily saw her friend, tim. tim was looking for a book to read.

"hi tim!" said lily. "what are you doing?"

"i want to read a book, but i don't have any," said tim. "do you know where i can find one?"

lily thought for a moment. "yes! my mom has a big bookcase at home. there are many books available. let's go and see!"

lily and tim skipped all the way to lily's house. they found the big bookcase in the living room. tim picked a book with lots of pictures. they sat down and read the book together. they were very happy.
once upon a time, in a modest little house, there lived a girl named amy. amy liked to test all things she found. one day, she found a cactus in her yard. the cactus was green and had little spikes on it.

amy wanted to test the cactus to see if it was nice to touch. she put her hand close to the cactus and felt the little spikes. "ouch!" she said, as the cactus poked her finger. she learned that the cactus was not nice to touch.

after that, amy told her friends about the cactus. they all went to see it, but they did not touch it. they knew the cactus was not nice to touch. they played around the modest house and had fun. the cactus stayed in the yard, and amy never touched it again.
