he decided to show it to other people. but when he showed it to them, they said that it was not very good. the man was so disappointed and sad.

the man tried again, but no matter how hard he tried, the poem was never 'fine' enough for other people. he never got to show it again.
one day, mommy gave little jimmy a very special job. "can you help me clean up the garage?" she asked. little jimmy was very obedient and immediately said yes. he began to look around for something to clean. he spotted something shiny on the floor. it was a screw! 

he picked it up and took it to mommy. "what is this?" little jimmy asked. 

mommy smiled. "that's a screw," she said. "thank you for picking it up! that was a very obedient thing to do."

little jimmy was so proud that he had done something helpful. he stuck the screw in his pocket and continued cleaning the garage. in no time, the garage was all nice and neat! 

mommy hugged little jimmy and said, "i am so proud of you. you did a wonderful job cleaning the garage." little jimmy smiled. he had been so obedient and he felt very proud.
once there was a reindeer named silly. he lived in the north pole with the other reindeers. every night, he would play with his friends and have fun. he was the happiest reindeer in the north pole.

one day, silly was playing in the snow and he heard a noise. he was scared, so he ran away. then he saw something moving in the snow. he was very scared. 

silly's friends asked him why he was so scared. he told them he had seen something moving in the snow. his friends told him it was probably just a silly little snowman, and not to worry. 

but silly was still scared. he kept imagining all the things that could be hiding in the snow. suddenly, he heard the noise again, and he ran away. 

his friends tried to follow him, but he didn't want to be found. he was too scared. eventually his friends caught up to him, and they all hid in a very tall tree for the night. 

the next morning, silly found out that the noise he'd heard was actually a baby polar bear. he was very embarrassed he'd been so scared. from then on, silly was known as the 'silly reindeer'. 

the end.
once upon a time, there lived two little birds named george and lucy. george was the oldest and he was brave and loud, while lucy was younger and quieter.

one day, they both decided to fly high up in the sky. they zipped and zipped, higher and higher until they reached the clouds.

suddenly, a loud thunder clap interrupted them. lucy was spooked and started to cry. she was scared and wanted to go home. but george was brave and told her, "lucy, don't be scared. it is just thunder, it won't hurt you."

lucy looked to the sky and saw a clear sky with shining stars. she took a deep breath and stopped crying.

george smiled and hugged lucy. then, the two little birds began to zip back home, safe and sound.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named jane. jane was always in an awful hurry. everywhere she went, she ran!

one day, jane was running so fast, she didn't see the small hole in the grass and she tripped and fell. jane scraped her shoulder and it hurt a lot!

fortunately, jane had a kind and caring friend called tom. tom saw what happened and he said, "oh no jane! be careful next time!" he helped jane to her feet and gave her a big hug!

jane was sad she had hurt her shoulder but tom promised to help. he took her hand and they walked the rest of the way together. he told jane, "we must be careful around those holes!"

from that day forward, jane and tom always took it slow and steady. they laughed and held hands and walked together side-by-side. 

no more hurrying for jane. she learned to be careful and it was much more fun!
sam and jane were going for a walk in the countryside. as they looked around, they saw a cow in the field. sam thought it was the most charming cow he had ever seen. he wanted to get a closer look, so jane walked up to the cow and said: "hello, cow!"

the cow was surprised and started to stir. "moo!" it said in response. sam and jane were fascinated and started to laugh. the cow looked around with its big eyes and even seemed to smile.

sam and jane stayed by the cow for some time, watching it stir around and graze on the grass. eventually they said goodbye and went off to enjoy the rest of their walk in the countryside. the charmy cow stayed in the field, enjoying the peaceful setting.
once there was an elderly man. he was sitting in a chair in the park, enjoying the sun.

suddenly, a child ran up from out of nowhere. she threw her arms up into the air and yelled, "i'm gonna throw this chair!" she grabbed the chair from the elderly man and pulled it back, ready to throw it!

"no! stop!" the elderly man yelled, quickly standing up.

but the child didn't listen. she threw the chair as far as she could and it went sailing across the park.

the elderly man laughed and said, "that was a pretty good throw."

the child was proud and smiled. she ran back to the elderly man and hugged him. "thank you," she said.

the elderly man nodded and said, "you are very welcome."
once there was a little girl who was very brave. one day she went to a spooky forest. she was so scared but she wanted to explore.

suddenly, she heard a terrible noise coming from somewhere. it disturbed her a lot and she started to cry.

but then, she saw a key. she picked up the key and looked carefully where it came from. she saw a big door with a lock. she wondered what was behind it.

she put the key in the lock and turned it. she opened the door and saw a lot of toys! she was so happy! 

suddenly, a monster popped out of the toys! it scared the little girl! she started to run away and cried: "that was terrible!" 

but then, the monster said with a kind voice: "do not be scared!" the monster gave her a big smile and showed her a lot of surprise. the little girl was very happy. she hugged the monster and said "thank you!" 

the monster waved goodbye and the little girl went home with a big smile.
once upon a time, there were two best friends, ben and mona. they did everything together - from playing tag to climbing trees. 

one day, ben asked mona, "let's go for a walk." she said, "yes, let's go for a walk." as they were walking, ben noticed something strange. he said to mona, "look over there, it's a dead tree." 

mona looked at the tree and said, "don't worry about it, ben. look over there, a yoga spot."

ben replied, "what is yoga?"

mona said, "it's like stretching and breathing, it's very relaxing. it's like talking to a best friend - they will always tell you what you need to hear." 

ben and mona tried yoga that day. ben felt relaxed and energized after doing the moves. he said to mona, "it was so nice to feel relaxed and talk to you about things." 

moral of the story: don't worry about the negative things in your life. instead, take a step back, breathe, try something new like yoga, and talk to a best friend. when you do that, you will feel better and hear what you really need to know.
tim and his daddy were fishing together by the lake. he was so excited to be there with his daddy.

"what are you going to do, timmy?" asked his daddy.

tim smiled excitedly, "i'm going to put the hook in the water!" 

his daddy beamed, giving him a big hug and said, "that sounds great!"

tim grabbed the hook and anxiously put it in the water. he peered over the edge, squinting his eyes, looking for the fish. suddenly he felt something tug on the hook!

the two of them cheered as tim pulled the fish out. he put the fish in the bucket, and thanked his dad for the wonderful day.

"you're welcome, timmy," his dad said. "let's do it again soon!"

one day, jill's mother gave her some colorful dough and asked her to play with it. "please don't go too fast," her mom cautioned. 

jill agreed, but as soon as mom left the room, she started rolling the dough across the floor. she made a game of seeing who could make their dough move the fastest! 

when mom came back in the room, she saw jill with dough all over her dress and scattered on the floor. â€œwhat happened?â€ mom asked. jill, feeling embarrassed, told her mother the truth. 

mom smiled and said something important, â€œjill, it's ok to want to speed up sometimes, but know that it's best to go slow. that way you can take the time to do a good job and make sure everything is the way you want it.â€ 

jill understood and learned her lesson: impatience may not yield the best results. she now always remembers to go slow and the results are much more colorful!

the sea was calm and smooth, so she was not scared. suddenly, out of nowhere, she saw an anchor and she shouted "i'm going to catch it!"

she grabbed the anchor tight and lifted it up. but it was too heavy for her to hold.

"i don't feel happy," emily replied.

mommy gave emily a big hug and said, "it's okay, sweetheart. i'm here to comfort you."

then mommy pointed to the wall and said, "look, emily. there's a fake butterfly on the wall. let's count it's wings!"

emily was so excited that she forgot about being sad. she counted the butterfly's wings with mommy and smiled.

"maybe eating some cereal will make you feel better," suggested mommy.

so emily ate some cereal and it made her feel so much better! she smiled and hugged her mommy. everything was alright again.

one day, he was climbing up a very tall ladder to a house when he heard a loud crash. without thinking, he climbed faster and faster until he reached the window. inside, he could see a small child, who was in trouble.

the fireman was able to rescue the child from the burning house and quickly put out the fire. everybody was so grateful for the reliable fireman who had saved the day.
alice and her mom were standing outside, looking up at the sky. "mom, why isn't the sun shining?", asked alice.

"because it's raining outside, and it's making it miserable," her mom replied.

alice saw fat drops of rain falling from the sky. "what makes rain?", she asked her mom.

"well," her mom said, "rain is made when clouds in the sky get filled with water and then it falls down from the sky".

alice was fascinated! she thought it was amazing how the clouds could make rain.

they watched the rain and how it made puddles on the ground. "let's go in," said her mom. "it's too cold and miserable out here."

alice agreed and they ran inside, with the sound of the rain following them.

once there was a bald man who lived on a boat. he had a special anchor that he loved to touch. everyday he went out on his boat and touched the anchor.

one day, a fish swam up to the boat. the man was so surprised that he ran to his anchor and touched it.

the fish said to the man, "why do you touch your anchor so much?" 

the man thought for a moment, then replied, "it makes me feel safe and secure. it's like an anchor to me!" 

the fish smiled and said, "that's a wonderful thing!"

the man smiled back and went back to touching his anchor. he felt comforted knowing he had a special anchor he could always touch.

one sunny day, a little girl named elsie wanted to go for a walk. she asked her mom for permission, and her mom said, "yes, you may go, but be polite and stay away from the hedge."

so, elsie started walking. she skipped and sang until she came to the hedge. the hedge looked so tall and wide, it seemed like it would go on forever! so elsie did something naughty: she decided to scatter some of the pretty leaves from the hedge.

just then, a rabbit hopped out from the hedge and said, "why did you scatter the beautiful leaves?"

elsie felt scared, but she remembered to be polite. she said, "i'm sorry, i thought it would be fun. i won't do it again."

the rabbit smiled. "that's okay, i forgive you. you can stay and play with me in the hedge if you want."

elsie smiled and played with the bunny all day until it was time to go home. from that day on, she was always careful not to scatter leaves from the hedge.

jack started crawling closer and he could smell the delicious spaghetti. he was about to eat it when suddenly he heard a voice: "no, jack! you can't eat this spaghetti!" it was jack's mommy. she had found him trying to eat spaghetti and she knew he was too little to do it on his own.

jack was so embarrassed and he crawled away, feeling so helpless. his mommy smiled and said, "don't worry, jack. i'll make you your own plate of spaghetti for dinner later. you can have it then!" jack was so happy and he crawled away to find something else to do. 

he never forgot that day, and he still loves spaghetti to this day.

bob asked sammy: "can you help me make the furniture more reliable?". sammy thought for a while and then said: "yes, i can try!"

so, bob and sammy worked together. they put all the furniture pieces in different positions and then they tightened up all the screws. finally, bob and sammy stepped back and admired their work. it looked much more reliable.

they were both very happy with their achievement. from then on, bobâ€™s furniture was always reliable, no matter how much he shook it.

once upon a time there was a black goat who loved to delay his bedtime. every night, he would sneak out of the barn and make his way to the meadow. he liked to run in the grass and pick clover flowers.

one night, the farmer noticed him leaving and followed behind him. he was very frustrated with the goat delaying his bedtime and wanted to teach him a lesson. as the farmer approached, the goat panicked and quickly ran away in the other direction!

he found himself in a dark, scary forest and couldn't find his way out. the goat was so scared he brayed as loud as he could. the farmer heard and followed in the direction of the sound. eventually they both made it out of the forest and the farmer realised how late it had gotten.

the farmer then scolded the goat for delaying his bedtime and signed him up for goat training classes. after many months of classes, the goat finally understood the importance of getting to bed at a reasonable time. the farmer was so pleased that he rewarded the goat with some fresh clover flowers. the black goat never delayed bedtime again and lived happily ever after.

doug laughed and laughed. he knew the ostrich was okay after all!
once there was an ant who wanted to be powerful. he asked all of the animals in the forest how he could be powerful. a fox told him that he could act. the ant asked the fox what he meant by act. the fox said, "acting is when you pretend to be something else but you don't really change."

the ant was excited. he decided to try it out. he pretended to be a lion. he widened his eyes, put his hands on his hips, and roared like a lion. all of the animals were scared. the ant was proud that he made them all scared.

"i am powerful!" the ant exclaimed. he continued to act like a lion and strutted around the forest. all of the animals kept their distance. the ant was very proud of himself and laughed and smiled.

he had learned that by acting, he could be powerful. he was so happy that he decided to act like a lion every day. whenever he got scared, he acted like a lion and all the animals in the forest were scared too.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named sunny. sunny was very obedient and always did what her mommy and daddy said. one day, her mommy and daddy told her they were going on a special trip. sunny was very excited and hoped it would be a lot of fun.

when they arrived, they saw a big gun. sunny was scared at first, but her mommy told her it was okay. she said the gun was only for protection. sunny believed her and wasn't scared anymore.

on the way home, sunny told her mommy and daddy that she was thankful for the gun. she said it made her feel safe. her mommy and daddy smiled and gave her a big hug.

they were proud that sunny was so obedient, and that she could believe in them. from then on, sunny felt very safe whenever they went on trips. it was a happy ending!
once upon a time there was a green field. on the green field, there was a player. the player was very happy and she thanked the beautiful day.

suddenly, a three year old child came running on the green field. she waved at the player and said, "hi! can i join the game?"

the player smiled and said, "of course! i'm so happy you're here!" she gave the child a friendly pat on the back and said, "let's start!"

the player and the child laughed and cheered as they ran and played on the green field. after a long time, the player said, "it's time for me to go."

the child was sad but she thanked the player for the fun day. the player smiled and said, "you're very welcome! i'm so glad i got to play with you." then, she waved goodbye and left.

the child watched her go and waved goodbye until she was out of sight. she smiled, thankful for the beautiful day they had just spent together.
once there was a little girl called kelly who was very adventurous. she loved to play in the garden and collect colorful rocks that sparkled like jewelry. one day, her mum put on her jewelry and teased her, saying "oh wow, look at all the rocks kelly has, why don't you have any jewelry like that?"

the little girl was so excited she ran outside and searched all around for the best rocks she could find. after some time, she noticed a beautiful sparkly one that seemed special. she took it inside and lay it onto the table, asking her mum if it was like her jewelry.

her mum smiled and said yes. kelly was so excited and asked if she could keep it. her mum said of course, but warned kelly not to lose it. the rock was so special, kelly promised she'd never let it out of her sight.

from that day onwards, kelly kept her eye on the rock. whenever she was in the garden, she'd always take it out with her. eventually, kelly had enough beautiful rocks to fill a box with her own special jewelry which she proudly wore. it was exactly like her mum's jewelry and kelly was very happy. she was glad that she was so adventurous and looked for so many rocks.
once upon a time there was a little girl. she was very happy with her life, and she liked to wear pink clothes.

one day, the little girl was playing with her friends. she saw a big, pink flower in the garden. she wanted to pick it, so she went over to take it. 

suddenly, a big voice came from behind her. "hey! that's my flower. don't pick it!" the voice said. 

it was the big cat. the girl was sad and her face began to scrunch up. hot tears filled her eyes, and started flowing down her face. she began to cry. 

the big cat's face changed, and he said, "hey now, don't cry. you can pick that flower. it's okay."

the little girl smiled through her tears and wiped her face. she thanked the big cat and carefully picked the flower. 

the little girl and the big cat became friends, and from then on she always asked permission before picking any flowers. the end.
once upon a time, there was a boy named benny. he was only three years old, but he was very curious. he wanted to know why things were the way they were.

one day, benny went outside and found a patch of wet grass. he asked his father why it was so wet. his father told him it was because of the rain. benny asked his father if he could make it stop raining. his father said, "no, benny, that's not something we can do."

benny was a little bit sad but he thanked his father for telling him about the rain. then he asked his father why people were so modest. his father explained that modesty was a way of showing respect and being polite. benny thought about this for a minute and then said, "but why do we need to be polite?" his father smiled at him and told him, "because it's the nice thing to do."

benny nodded and smiled. he thanked his father again and they went inside the house to have a snack. benny was thankful that his father had told him these things. he was sure he was going to learn a lot more by the time he got to be five.
once upon a time, there was a little girl, who liked to go on trips. she would go to the park, the beach and other fun places, but her favourite place of all was the zoo. the zoo was important to her and she went every day.

one day, the girl went to the zoo and wanted to examine the animals very closely. she tried to look at the monkeys, elephants and tigers, but the zookeeper told her to stay away. the zookeeper said it was too dangerous for her to look too closely.

the girl was sad. she wanted to examine the animals and didn't understand why the zookeeper wouldn't let her. she wanted to show everyone how important the zoo was to her and how much she enjoyed looking at all of the animals.

the girl was determined to find another way to see the animals. she looked around the zoo until she found a way to get closer to the animals without being too dangerous. she found a way to look in at the animals from afar, so she could examine them safely.

the girl was happy. she was able to examine the animals carefully, without stepping too close. she learned a lot that day and it was an important trip for her.

when they got to the park, they saw lots of people playing. mommy said, "susie, you can play over there, but remember to stay close to me."

susie thanked mommy and ran off to the playground. she saw some boys playing with a ball. she asked them if she could join, but they said no. susie was sad.

but then mommy called susie over. she said, "susie, it's ok. i will permit you to play with them." susie was happy and ran to the boys. the boys said she could join, but at one point, the ball bounced and rolled into a dirty bush. 

the boys were scared to go in! but susie was brave. she reached into the bush and found the ball. she came out holding the ball with a huge smile on her face. the boys thanked susie, and they all continued playing. 

at the end of the day, mommy and susie said goodbye to the boys and went home. susie was very happy; she had a great day!
once upon a time, there was a young boy who wanted to explore the world around him. one day, he came across an old hut and wanted to explore inside. but when he tried to push the door open, it was locked. he looked around, but couldn't find the key anywhere.

the boy sighed and was about to give up when he heard a voice from a nearby tree. the voice said: "are you looking for the key? i have the key. you can have it in exchange for a hug!"

the boy was a bit wary at first but decided to accept the offer. he stepped forward and gave the voice a hug. as soon as he did, the voice revealed itself to be an old sparrow. the sparrow gave him the key and said: "go ahead and explore the hut. i'm sure you'll find something interesting inside!"

the boy thanked the sparrow and used the key to unlock the door of the hut. after a few moments of exploring inside, he found a beautiful old desk that was covered in dust. he was amazed by his find, and smiled as he closed the door and locked it again with the key. he was sure he would come back to explore the hut again soon.

the bottle was open and the man was very happy! he started to drink the wine and he was so pleased. after a few drinks, he felt happy and strong.

he kept twisting the bottle until all of the wine was gone. he was so satisfied with his twisty trick he could hardly believe it!

one day, lily spotted a light in the garden. she was very curious, so she decided to investigate.

when she got close, she saw a beautiful butterfly! it was the brightest butterfly she had ever seen. she reached out to pinch it with her finger, but she was too slow! the butterfly flew away.

lily wanted to catch the butterfly, so she took her basket and began to chase it around the garden. she ran and ran, until she was too tired to run.

but then, a miracle happened. the butterfly landed on her basket! she carefully picked up the basket and smiled. she had caught the butterfly!

lily smiled: "i'm so glad my basket was so light!"

"because," said daddy, "he's very important to the park. he helps keep it clean and safe." 

daughter nodded and smiled. she knew that it was time to be careful and mind the elephant.

the little girl said to herself, "what a terrible place!" but then she noticed something even more strange. in the corner of the barn, there was a swing. she had never seen anything like it before. 

she saw a man in the corner of the barn, and she asked him, "what is that swing for?" the man smiled and said "it's for you, little one. go ahead and try it!"

mommy laughed and said, "no, this is a special game. who can make it the roundest?" she put the lime on the floor and the baby tried to roll it with his hands. he squealed with delight as the lime moved around.

once there was an egg that was not happy. he argued about everything and was very disagreeable. everyone shook their heads and said he was crazy.

one day the egg decided to take a walk around the farm. it was sunny and he felt brave. as he looked around, he saw a little goat playing in a field and he smiled. he went over to introduce himself but the goat didn't want to talk. he just frowned and disagreed with everything the egg said.

the egg became angry and yelled at the little goat, who just looked away. then, the egg grabbed the goat and tried to shake him. the goat was frightened and began to run away. suddenly, the egg jumped and was knocked over by a tree branch.

the poor egg lay there, motionless. everyone ran to help him but it was too late. the crazy egg had died. the goat, feeling a little guilty but also a little relieved, ran away never to be seen again.

tom was so shocked that he forgot about the snap he heard. but he remembered later. he had learned a lesson to never leave a yummy peach unattended!

her friend looked at her and smiled. "it will be alright," she said. "you can trust me."

once upon a time, there was a little girl named josie. she was only three years old. today, she was feeling a bit bored and had nothing to do. 

then, she thought of an idea. she decided to explore her attic. she was excited to see what she would find.

as she went up the stairs, the air became a bit stuffy. she opened the door to the attic, only to find it dark and dull.

suddenly, she saw something increase in the corner. she walked closer and was surprised to find a light switch.

josie scooted a bit closer and asked, "oh, what do you do?"

the light switch answered, "i make the attic light up with my magic. would you like to try it?"

josie shouted with excitement, "yes please!"

the light switch shined brightly, brightly illuminating the attic. josie was amazed at how the dull attic was now full of colour and life.

josie smiled and thanked the light switch for its work. the light switch smiled back and said, "you're welcome josie!"
once upon a time, there was a little girl called sabina. she loved going to the park to play with her friends. she brought her teddy bear along too. 

one day, when sabina was at the park, she saw a huge poppy in the grass. it was a beautiful poppy, with bright petals and a soft, brown centre. sabina couldn't resist picking it. 

suddenly, a voice called out, "don't pick that poppy! it's mine!" 

sabina looked up to see a boy standing nearby. he was holding a big basket. "that poppy belongs to me. i'm collecting poppies to make a bouquet," he said.

sabina felt sad. she apologised to the boy and put the poppy back in the grass. "don't worry," said the boy. "i can give you one of my poppies." he carefully tore a poppy off the stem, put it in sabina's hand and smiled. 

sabina smiled back and thanked the boy. she ran away, clutching the brown poppy in her hand. she knew she'd treasure it forever.

once upon a time, there was a lonely bear called tabby. tabby had no friends and felt very sad.

every day, tabby looked out of her chamber wishing she could find some friends to play with. one day, as tabby was looking out at the forest, she spotted a rabbit. tabby was so excited and quickly hopped out of her chamber. she raced up to the rabbit and asked if they could be friends.

the rabbit didn't like tabby, so they started to tease her. tabby felt embarrassed and ran away. she ran through the forest until she couldn't run any further.

tabby hid in a cave and stayed there for a long time. she was so lonely. tabby missed her chamber and wanted to go home, but she was too scared of seeing the rabbit again.

eventually, tabby knew she had to face the rabbit. so she bravely returned to her chamber. but the rabbit was still there. tabby was very scared and the rabbit kept on teasing her.

tabby was so sad and lonely, she never went back out of her chamber again.
the clever little girl was playing in the park. suddenly, a boy rushed up to her.

"hello!" said the boy with a smile. 
"my name is jeff, let's go for a jog!"

the girl gave a broad smile. she liked the idea of jogging together. so the two of them jogged around the park together.

jeff told the girl about his favourite films. the two of them laughed and enjoyed the jog until they reached the pond. they sat down to take a break and watched the ducks swimming around. then jeff suggested that they watch a film together.

the girl thought it was a very clever idea. so they went back to jeff's place and watched a funny movie together. they both laughed and enjoyed the film.

at the end of the movie, both of them said goodbye and promised to go for a jog together the next day. they were both excited for their new adventures together.
the family was outside playing in the garden. the mother was pushing the father on the swing. the children were running and laughing.

suddenly, the baby of the family started crying. the father ran to him and picked him up.

the little brother was jealous of all the attention the baby was getting. he started to cry too.

the mother tried to calm the little boy but he was too embarrassed to stop. he knew he was jealous and he didn't want his family to know.

the father asked, "what's wrong, my little one?"
the little brother said softly, "i was jealous of the baby getting so much attention." 

the mother smiled and said, "it's okay to be jealous on occasion. what can we do to make you feel better?" 

the father looked at the little boy and said, "let's play a game of hide and seek." 

the little boy smiled and nodded. he soon forgot all about his embarrassment and enjoyed playing the game with his family.

when the little boy was in the woods he heard strange noises. it was so dark he couldn't see anything. he started to get scared. he called out for his mommy, but she didn't answer. the little boy was so scared he was trembling with fear.

randy was very scared and he asked his brother, "what is that?"

his brother replied, "that is a dangerous crocodile! we need to get out of here!"

the boys backed away and ran as fast as they could. after a few minutes of running, they stopped and looked back. they could see the crocodile still glaring at them and could hear it laughing.

randy's brother said, "we were lucky this time! but we need to remember to always stay away from the creek. those are dangerous creatures!"

randy nodded in agreement, relieved that he was safe. they continued their walk, always careful to stay away from the creek.

the bat replied, â€œthatâ€™s the sound of oxygen leaving the cave. we need to close the door quick or we wonâ€™t be able to breathe.â€ so the mouse and the bat quickly closed the door and the noise stopped.

the next day clara and her mom took the bus to the doctor's office. the doctor looked at clara's heel and said, "we will have to put a cast around your heel."

he pointed to a plaster cast and asked if clara could touch it. she touched the cold plaster cast and nodded. "that will feel better soon," the doctor said with a kind smile.

he tied a bandage around her heel and said "that should do the trick, soon your foot will be feeling good as new".

clara smiled and thanked the doctor. she danced out of the office feeling much better and was happy her heel was fixed and feeling fine!

once upon a time, there was a young child named leo. leo loved playing with all his toys, his stuffed animals and his car. one sunny day, leo wanted to go outside and play in the park.

when leo arrived to the park, he was so excited to run and play on the monkey bars. but when he got there, something strange had happened. all of the fellow children were standing still, they weren't moving at all! leo was so surprised and asked what was happening.

the other children told him that they were playing a game called "freeze". he had to stop when someone yelled out "freeze". it was a lot of fun, so leo joined in with them.

but as the game went on, leo started to feel a little upset because he was playing for so long and felt like he was missing out on something. one of the other children explained to leo that he could stop playing at any time, and then do his job. 

the other children called out to leo and reminded him that he had work to do too. leo was happy that his friends were looking out for him and he finished the game and went off to do his job.

the moral of the story is that it is important to take breaks between playing and doing your job. doing something you are required to do can prevent us from feeling upset in the long run.

once there was a foolish fox who stepped into a dark velvet cave. he did not know what he was getting into, as he was very foolish. he thought he would be safe in the soft velvet cave.

he cautiously stepped further into the cave, feeling the velvet walls around him. suddenly, he heard a voice echoing in the cave.

the fox's head snapped up, and he saw a giant bear blocking the entrance of the cave. the fox quivered with fear.

"what do you think you're doing in my cave?" said the bear, in a gruff voice.

the fox gulped and stepped back. "i-i-i'm sorry," he stuttered. "i didn't know this was your cave. i won't bother you, i promise!"

the bear's face softened a little. "what are you doing here in the first place?"

the fox explained that he had been trying to find a place to stay for the night, but he had been too foolish to pick a safe place. the bear sighed.

"you have been foolish, but i can see you are just a harmless little fox. you can stay in my cave for the night on one condition: leave by first light tomorrow morning. do we have a deal?"

the mouse was so surprised. he answered, "it's a mouse. i'm looking for a place to live."

there once was a boy named jack who loved to go outside and play in the grass. one day while jack was playing, he noticed something terrible. he noticed that most of the grass was all brown and dead-looking. 

jack was so sad and started to cry. his mom saw this and came over to help.

"what's wrong, jack?" his mom asked.

"the grass looks terrible. i don't know what happened to it," jack said.

his mom smiled and said, "don't worry jack. the sun is too strong and it can dry out the grass. but don't be too sad. just admire the grass when it's nice and green."

jack was very happy to hear this and went back to playing in the grass with a smile on his face. even when the grass was dry, he still loved it the best when it was healthy and green.

her aunt laughed and explained that it was a scale. it was used to weigh things. daisy thought this was fascinating and asked her aunt to show her how it worked.

so daisy and her aunt went over to the big box. daisy's aunt put a big rock on the scale and it showed that the rock was very heavy. daisy was amazed. she could not believe how the scale could tell her how heavy something was.

next, daisy's aunt asked her to get on the scale. daisy was scared at first, but she got on the scale to see how heavy she was. she was delighted when she saw the numbers go up on the scale!

at the end of the day, daisy was happy that she learned a new way to measure how heavy something was. she thanked her aunt for showing her a new way to learn.

daisy ran back to the park to show her friends the amazing new thing she had learned. they were equally amazed and excited by the scale. from that day forward, daisy and her friends would always use the scale to weigh things. together, they would have lots of fun!

once upon a time there was a wise old man who kept a skull on his desk. he spent all his days polishing it with a cloth.

one day, a curious little three year old came to visit the wise old man. when he saw the skull on the desk, he asked the old man, "what is that?"

the old man smiled, and said, "this is a skull, my child. it's very special to me. that's why i polish it all the time".

the little boy smiled and said, "i want to help polish it too!"

the wise old man chuckled and said, "i would love that! let's see if we can make this skull even shinier!"

the two of them worked together, polishing the skull and making it bright and shiny. they laughed and smiled as they worked, until finally, the skull was polished to perfection.

the little boy exclaimed, "it looks beautiful now! thank you for teaching me how to polish it!"

the wise old man smiled and said, "you are very welcome, my child. you have a wise heart. now, you can always polish a skull whenever you like."

"that looks like a special twig," said one of his friends. "it could be worth something."

toby was excited - he wanted to keep the twig for himself. but his friends insisted that he should share it.

"hurry up and share the twig," they said.

finally, toby decided to share the twig with his friends and enjoy playing with them. he found out that the twig was quite common and it didn't hold any special value, but that didn't matter. all that mattered was that he did the right thing and shared it.

the moral of this story is that sharing is more important than taking - it's better to enjoy the moment and play together with friends than to keep something special only for yourself.

once upon a time, there was a wise little rabbit who lived deep in the woods. every day he made sure to explore new parts of the woods and he was so brave!

one day while exploring he noticed a bright light way off in the distance. he ran over to see what it was and saw a giant fire in the middle of the woods. "oh no!" the rabbit thought. he knew he had to do something, but he didn't know what. he couldn't put out the fire.

just then, he remembered something his grandpa told him. he had said,"if you ever get in a tough spot, dive in and see what happens". so the brave bunny dove into the fire.

when he emerged from the flames, he noticed that the fire had gone out. the rabbit had used his wisdom to figure out the best way to handle the dangerous situation. he had realized that by diving into the fire he could create a steam that would put out the fire.

the rabbit was so proud of himself! he had saved the woods from the fire and even learned something new. from now on he would always remember to "dive in" if he ever needed help.

pete and his dad were sitting on the grass. pete looked up to his dad and said, "what can i do, daddy?" his dad looked back and smiled, "well, you can practice lots of different things. what do you want to practice?

pete thought for a moment, then said, "i want to practice my muscles!" his dad nodded and lied down on the grass. pete followed his dad's example and lied down too. his dad said in a serious voice, "close your eyes and focus on your muscles. now, tense up and relax them five times".

so, pete followed his dad's instructions and focused on his muscles. he tensed and relaxed them five times. after he was done, pete opened his eyes and smiled. he said happily, "i did it daddy! i was serious and my muscles are tired now!" his dad laughed and gave him a hug. "good job, pete! now let's get up and get some rest".
it was very early in the morning and the sky was damp with a heavy fog. sam, who was only three years old, got up and wanted to explore. sam rolled out of bed and opened his bedroom window. he knew he shouldn't go outside alone, but the street looked inviting.

sam crept down the stairs and opened the front door. "where are you going?", asked daddy. sam replied, "i just want to roll around outside!"

daddy chuckled. "ok," he said, "but be careful. the fog is very heavy this morning and you might get lost if you're not careful."

sam nodded and ran outside. he rolled around in the grass and felt the heavy fog on his skin. he waved at the neighbors walking by, but they couldn't see him in the fog.

sam stayed out in the fog until the sun started to rise. he waved goodbye to the fog and rolled back into the house, happy and tired.
once upon a time, there was a very smart boy named dave. dave liked playing with his toy tube. every day, his mom would call him from the other room and he would run to her and be excited to see what they would do. 

"dave! come here!" his mom would call to him. and every day dave would get his tube and run excitedly to his mom. 

one day, dave decided he wanted to show his mom his smart toy tube. so, he ran to his mom in the kitchen with the tube in tow. 

"mom, look at my tube!" he said proudly. his mom smiled at him and said, "that's so smart, dave. you found a really cool toy!" 

dave was so happy that his mom liked his toy. he ran around the house with the tube for the rest of the day, feeling so proud.
john was a 3 year old boy who lived in a small town. he wanted to explore the world so one day he decided to get out of his home and take a walk. he said to his mom, "i want to get out in the world and find something lucky!"

his mom smiled and said, "okay, be careful, but have fun too".

john put on his shoes and left. he spent the day walking and exploring. he saw so many animals and plants that he had never seen before. then, suddenly, john got really lucky! he saw a little bird and it sang a beautiful song!

john was so happy that he was able to get out and hear the world's music. he knew he was lucky to have such an amazing experience. he waved goodbye to the bird, and smiled as he went back home to tell his mom about his adventures.
once upon a time, there was a little boy who lived in a forest. he was a very helpful boy and he loved to whistle. he would whistle while he adventure around the forest, looking for things to help his animal friends. 

one day, while he was whistling and looking around, he heard a strange sound. he followed the sound and he ended up near a river. he saw a fish swimming in the river, but it was struggling to breath. the little boy knew this meant the fish needed oxygen.

he quickly ran over to the nearest tree and he started to whistle. when the fish heard the sound, it swam toward the little boy. the boy then used his extra-long leaves from the tree to make a bridge between the bank and the fish, so that it could get to the oxygen it needed. 

the fish thanked the little boy for his help and swam away, feeling much better. the little boy smiled and resumed his whistling, happy that he had been able to help.
once upon a time, there were two people. the first person was called ann, and the second person was called joe. joe had a yellow balloon. 

ann asked joe to let her play with the yellow balloon. joe said that he didn't want to, so he kept the balloon all to himself. 

ann was very sad. she didn't want to play anymore.

then, something special happened. joe let ann play with the yellow balloon. they both had a great time playing together and laughing. 

at the end of their playtime, joe said to ann, "letting others play together is more fun than playing by yourself." 

from that day on, ann and joe were very happy and they both learned the valuable lesson that it is more fun to share and let others play.
once upon a time, there was an adorable little boy called joey. his favorite thing to do was to go to the store and buy a yummy pie. all the people who worked at the store loved him because he was so charming. 

one day, joey and his mom went to the store, and joey asked her to buy him a pie. his mom said, "of course i will buy you a pie, joey. you are cute and adorable!".

joey was very excited, and couldn't wait to get the pie. the shop assistant gave him the pie and asked, "do you have to pay now or later?". joey said, "i have to pay later. i don't have any money with me. i'm only three years old!". 

the shop assistant thought joey was so cute and said, "don't worry, you can pay next time you come." joey thanked the shop assistant and then ran off with the pie. he was so excited to eat his delicious treat!
once upon a time, there was a little small sailboat that lived by a small river. the sailboat always felt so lost and unsure of what was to come. 

every day, a nearby swan would come to the sailboat and remind it of the bigger things in life. the swan would say: â€œlook beyond what you see. sometimes the answers are right in front of you.â€ 

but the sailboat was too ignorant to understand, so it stayed still in the same spot, feeling lost.

one day, a strong wind blew across the river and pushed the little sailboat out to the bigger ocean! the sailboat was scared but it also was excited as it slowly started to see its surroundings.

it started to understand that the swanâ€™s words had a purpose and it realized that it could look past the river, instead of just being ignorant and stuck in the same place.

the moral of this story is that we should always take a chance and explore, even if it can be scary. we should never feel trapped in our comfort zone and remind ourselves that there is more out there.

then josh had a silly idea. josh wanted to go in the elevator without his mom! he thought he was old enough. but josh was wrong. he pressed the button and the elevator doors opened, but josh could not get out. he was stuck!

josh learned a valuable lesson that day. he learned that it's never a good idea to do things without your mom's permission. next time, josh will follow his mom's advice.
once upon a time, there was a small dog named daisy. daisy was a very happy dog. every day, daisy would go for a walk and explore the world.

one day, daisy was walking and she noticed something beautiful. it was a match! daisy was so excited to find a match because she loved to chew things and this was the perfect size.

daisy picked up the match and chewed it. she was so happy that she jumped up and down and barked to say "thank you!".

then a voice came from behind her: "is that your match?". daisy turned around and saw a beautiful girl. she was wearing a pink dress and had a big smile.

the girl said: "i like your match. do you wanna play with me?" daisy barked happily and said "yes!". daisy and the girl had lots of fun playing together. daisy chewed the match while they ran around and played. 

at the end of the day, daisy was sad to say goodbye, but the girl said, "don't forget your beautiful match!" daisy said "thank you" and hugged the girl. then, daisy ran off happily carrying her match with her.
little jake and his mom were walking in a park. jake saw a wide and gray tree that caught his attention. he asked his mom: "what is that?". his mom replied: "that is a tree, jake". she continued: "let's remove some leaves, so we can see more of its beauty".

jake and his mom removed a few leaves from the tree. as they removed the leaves, a huge nest fell on the ground. inside the nest were five little eggs. jake and his mom were delighted and decided to show the eggs to the park ranger. 

when they arrived, the park ranger asked: "where did you find the eggs?". jake replied: "we found them in the gray tree".

the park ranger was surprised, he knew that gray trees do not usually take nests. he explained to jake that the tree was special because it had wide branches that were great for birds to build homes. it was no wonder why the bird chose it as its temporary home!
once upon a time there lived a bee called buzz. every week, buzz would go and help the other bees with the hive. he loved doing his work and made sure the bees did a good job.

one day, buzz was out flying and he saw a very beautiful hive. he was so amazed by it that he just had to go and take a closer look.

he got closer to the hive and heard the bees inside humming. they were so happy and made such a beautiful sound. 

buzz went even closer to the hive and saw one bee hungrily eating a flower petal. he flew over to her and asked, "do you need help?"

the bee paused and smiled, "yes please! we'd love your help. we've been so busy with the hive that we're all so tired. your help would mean the world to us!"

buzz couldn't help but smile and flew into the hive with the other bee. together, they worked hard to get the hive looking perfect and the other bees were very happy with the result. buzz knew that he had done a great job and been very helpful, and he was happy to have been able to make a difference.
john was playing in the park when he heard a whistle. he liked the sound and wanted to whistle too, so he started to practice. john was very persistent and kept trying and trying even when his friends stopped and went home. soon, his whistling sounded like a bird.

one day, john's mom heard him and said, "john, your whistling is so beautiful, i am so proud of you!" john was really excited and beamed with pride. he kept practicing.

one night, john heard a whistle from outside his window. he looked out and saw a beautiful golden trophy. it had a sign that said, "whistle best of tournament." john was excited and wanted to enter the tournament.

the next day, john worked hard at whistling and was sure he was ready to win the trophy. he went to the tournament and - to his surprise - he won! he was so happy that he ran home to show his mom the trophy.

but when he arrived, he found that the trophy was gone. someone had taken it away while he was running home. john was very sad and could only stand outside his house and whistle. 

john was persistent and every night, he went out and whistled. he hoped someone would return his trophy but after a while, he had to accept that it was gone forever.

suddenly, she heard a sigh. she looked up and saw an old man. he was sitting near the garden, and he looked frustrated.

mary walked up to him. "what's wrong?" she asked.

the man smiled. "i'm trying to remember something," he said. "but i can't. i'm so frustrated!"

mary put her hand on his shoulder. "i have some memories," she said. "do you want to play with me and make some new memories?"

the man smiled again and nodded.

once upon a time, in a big house there was a little boy named timmy. he was three years old and was always very curious. one day, while playing in the garden, timmy saw something white in the sky. it seemed to be a fly. he darted over to look more closely.

"what is this thing?" he asked.

as he investigated, he heard a little voice. it was the fly speaking. she said, "my name is daisy. i am here to reveal something to you."

timmy was surprised, but he asked daisy to tell him what the secret was. 

she replied, "the secret is that everyone needs to be kind and helpful to each other. we can all work together to make the world a better place."

timmy was so excited about daisy's secret and he couldn't wait to tell everyone. he wanted to make sure that everyone he knew knew the secret too, so that the world could become a better place.

the moral of the story is that a little kindness and help can go a long way and make the world a happier place.
once upon a time, there was a dry, sunny day in a big park. in the park, there was a small girl who was walking around, looking for something.

suddenly, she noticed a zipper on the ground and smiled. she bent over to pick it up and realized it was heavier than she thought it would be. when she pulled the zipper open, she couldn't believe her eyes. inside the zipper was a big pile of shiny pennies!

the small girl was so excited she started jumping up and down. a nearby old lady saw her and asked, "what did you find, my dear?" the girl nodded and showed her the zipper filled with pennies.

the old lady smiled at the little girl and said, "smarts and brave, that is what you have been today. now, put all these pennies back inside the zipper and you never know what you might find again."

the girl nodded and put all the pennies back in the zipper, zipping it shut. she looked around but couldn't see anything else.

then, after a few seconds, the old lady nodded and said, "if you look around you, you might find that something dry and sunny is coming your way."

the girl looked around and, sure enough, there were two big ice cream cones with two big scoops of ice cream in them! the small girl smiled with delight and quickly picked up her prize.
once there was a little dragon named bob. he lived with his family in a cozy cave at the edge of a forest.

one day, bob decided to go outside and explore. he flew through the trees and soon noticed a brilliant flame burning in the middle of a clearing. he flew around it in awe of its beauty, but he was careful not to get too close.

bob wanted to show his family who he found and so he flew back to his cave. when he arrived, he could see that his family was very excited.

"what is it, bob?" asked his mom.

"i found a brilliant flame," he said.

"that's amazing! now act quickly and fly back to it before it goes away!" said his dad.

bob was so excited to go back, he flew as fast as his little wings could carry him and soon he was back at the clearing. the flame was still burning and he was so proud to have found it. he flew around it in delight, feeling the warmth and strength of the flame.

when it was time to leave, bob was sad to say goodbye. but he knew that although the flame may not always be there, he would always remember the brilliant sight it had been.

"get out of here!" the fox yelled.

the rabbit was so scared that she hopped back into her hole. she sniffed and felt sad. suddenly, an angel appeared in the sky.

"don't worry," said the angel. "i will protect you and make sure the fox can never hurt you again."

the white rabbit was so happy and grateful that she yelled with joy. she thanked the angel and stayed safe in her hole. that night, the rabbit snuggled up in her bed and dreamt about the angel who had saved her.

the old man was very sad. he rushed over to the boy and saw that he had stepped on something terrible. he couldn't understand why the boy had stepped on it and tears filled his eyes. he realized that his cane would never be the same again. 

the old man sadly told the boy to give him back the cane. the boy looked sad too and gave it back. after that, the old man put his cane away and never offered it to anyone else.

one day, louie heard something different. it was a voice, calling out to him. "louie, i need help," it said.

louie was scared at first but then he decided to listen. he swam as close as he could and he saw a little girl. 

"my kite is stuck in the tree. will you help me get it back?" asked the girl. 

louie was powerful and brave, so he said yes. he swam as fast as he could to help the little girl. he used all his power to move the kite down from the tree.

"mommy," lucy said, "can i keep the glove?"

"i suppose so," replied her mom.

"what is that noise?" lucy asked.

"it's the fire station's bell," her mom said. "it's ringing to tell the firefighters that someone needs help."

lucy looked at her orange glove and smiled. she knew that if she was ever in danger she could ring the glove, and the firefighters would come to help her.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named jane who had a kitten. jane loved her kitten more than anything else. one day she wanted to take her kitten outside, but her mom told her it was a foolish thing to do and that she should stay away from the ground. 

jane wasn't happy about this but she surrendered to her mother's wishes. she stayed away from the ground and made sure her kitten stayed safe too.

that night, jane had trouble sleeping. she really wanted to explore the ground with her kitten. so, she decided to sneak outside and take her kitten with her.

she got to the ground and was amazed to see what was there! she saw lots of bugs, leaves and animals that she'd never seen before. then, all of a sudden, she heard her mom calling from the house.

jane reluctantly said: "i surrender!" she picked up her kitten, ran back to the house and realized she had been very foolish. she learnt a valuable lesson that day - that the ground was for exploring, but only when she had permission from mom!
once upon a time, there were two friends, jack and jill. they were always so helpful to each other, and loved spending time together.

one day, jack said, "i have a plan! let's celebrate my birthday today." jill smiled and said, "yes, it will be fun!"

they went together to the store and got a tablecloth, some napkins, and some treats. they set everything up and smiled as jack said, "it's almost time for the fun to begin!"

they went outside to play, and jill noticed a dark cloud in the sky. she said, "jack, i think it's going to rain." but jack wasn't worried. he said, "let's celebrate my birthday no matter what the weather brings!"

so the two friends ran back inside and set up their surprise birthday party. they put on party hats, sang a funny song, and blew out the candles. then they opened their surprise gifts. jill had been so helpful getting everything ready!

just as they were about to start eating, a big rainstorm started. but they didn't let it ruin their celebration. they took their treats into the kitchen and ate and laughed while the rain drummed outside.

after they were done, they cleaned up, folding the tablecloth and napkins neatly.

jack hugged jill and said, "that was the best birthday ever! thanks for being so helpful."
once upon a time there was a little boy called jim. jim wanted to buy a new toy sail so he went to the shop to find one. he looked through all the sails but they were all too expensive.

then he found one that was very cheap. it had a bright red colour and a big sail, so jim bought it.

when jim got home, he was so excited to play with his new sail. he opened the box and rolled the sail around his room hoping it would take him to far away lands.

but then the sail started to shake and the wind blew it really hard. jim tried to hold on to it, but the sail was too strong, so it rolled out of the window and flew away.

jim stood in his bedroom and looked sadly at the window. he had wanted to explore the world, but his cheap sail had broken. jim had a bad ending.

the child was worried. she didn't want to leave the park because she was scared it would still be there when she came back. she asked her mom, "mom, can't we put the broken tuna in the trash?" 

her mother said, "yes we can, sweetheart. it's the right thing to do. let's do it right away!" 

the family tidied up the park, and put the broken tuna in the trash. after that, the family had fun playing together in the park.

just as tommy was about to cry, he opened his eyes to find himself standing in front of an incredible fridge! he was so excited and asked his mom, "mommy, what's in the fridge?" 

"oh tommy, that is special fridge full of yummy treats!"

his mom opened the door and started to take out the snacks. inside were all of tommy's favorite ice creams, cupcakes and chocolates. 

tommy was jumping with joy! his mom smiled lovingly and said, "let's release these treats for everyone to enjoy!"

tommy clapped his hands happily and began to share the treats with his family and friends. they all had an incredible time. 

the trip was now complete, and tommy was the happiest 3 year old around!
one morning, jimmy woke to see snow outside. he hopped out of bed and was so excited. he ran to get his beloved red boots. he put them on and then called out to his mom in the kitchen. 

"mom, can i go outside and play in the snow?" 

jimmy's mom looked out the window. she was a bit worried.

"jimmy, the walkway is sort of slippery," she said. "wait and let me get your warm coat, hat and mittens." 

jimmy waited patiently. after a few minutes, he grabbed his coat and hat, and ran out the door. he jumped in the snow and it was so cold and fluffy. he made a snowman and started to sort out a snowball fight with some of his friends. 

his mom came and watched from the front window. she was still a bit worried but smiled when she saw jimmy was having lots of fun.
once upon a time, there was a small mouse living in a nice, warm cave. he was always very curious, and he questioned a lot of things. one evening he decided to go out of his cave, so he could explore the world.

on his adventure, he came across a big bird who was flying high in the sky. the bird asked him, "where are you going, mouse?"

the mouse replied, "i am going exploring, i have an urge to explore the world!"

the bird said, "things can be dangerous out there. be careful, no matter how small you are, your courage can take you far."

the mouse nodded and said, "of course, i will always be careful."

the bird smiled and said, "good, be brave and never be afraid of asking questions."

the mouse smiled and said, "thank you for the advice."

from then on, the mouse kept what the bird said in mind, and with his newfound courage and willingness to ask questions, he was able to explore the world without any harm.

the moral of the story is that even something small and timid can be very brave and strong if it questions and asks for advice.
once upon a time there was a little girl named maxi who loved pretend. everyday she would play pretend with her favorite toys, like her little measure. maxi was always so persistent when it came to pretend!

one day, maxi was playing a game of pretending she was a pirate. she had her measure tucked in her belt and was pretending to explore the high seas. she sailed around, searching for treasure and adventure.

maxi sailed for a long time, but eventually she became tired and decided to rest for a bit. she put her measure down on the ground, but as she closed her eyes to relax, she felt something strange. suddenly, the measure started to move and slide away from maxi!

maxi opened her eyes in surprise and noticed that her measure was slowly sliding backwards. suddenly maxi had an idea! she raced forward and held onto the measure with all her might. maxi was persistent, and she refused to let go until the measure stopped sliding. and after a few seconds, it finally did.

the measure never moved again and maxi was so proud that she was able to use her persistence to stop it. maxi continued on her pretend adventure, always happy to have her measurement with her.

one day, she was being careless and jumped into the lake without looking. suddenly, her foot got caught and she couldn't move. she was scared and started to cry.

a frog nearby heard her crying and said, "don't worry, young one. i can help you." the frog took out a key and set her free.

louisa thanked the frog. she promised to be more careful and said goodbye. she went home, changed into her night clothes, and ran to the lake to bathe again. 

this time she was extra careful and enjoyed the peaceful feeling of being in the water of the lake. she smiled.

his grandpa smiled and said, "no jack, that's not polite. we cannot take it from the museum."

he felt sad and realized he wouldn't be able to get the candy. grandpa gave him a hug and said, "don't worry, we will get you candy after leaving the museum". jack smiled and felt better.

jack soon learnt to be polite so that he could get the candy the next time. grandpa and grandma were very proud of him.

"let's think carefully, clarice," said mom. "which one of these desks helps you learn the best?" that was all the help clarice needed. she quickly chose a deep pink desk which was just her size.

with her new desk, clarice was able to have the space she needed to learn. she used her desk to look up the answers to her questions, draw her own answers and keep all of her supplies organized. 

the moral of this story is that when we make decisions, we should always focus on what will make us the most successful.

so she decided to investigate. she tip-toed closer to the jail and looked through the bars. she saw a big cat that had slipped inside!

mandy was so scared. she wanted to help the cat, but she also knew that she wasn't allowed near the jail. she didn't know what to do.

suddenly, mandy heard the jail guard coming. she quickly grabbed a broom and started shooing the cat. with one last loud meow, the cat slipped back out of the jail and ran away.

mandy was so relieved. she was glad that she had been brave enough to help the cat escape.
there was a broken house. ted the turtle lived in the house but he wanted to get away. 

one day he decided to go on an adventure. he packed his bag and opened the door. he stepped out and said goodbye to his house.

ted soon noticed the weather. it was hot and sunny, with a bright blue sky. he walked and walked until he saw some clouds in the sky. suddenly it started to rain. "oh no!" said ted. 

he quickly looked for shelter and found a cave. he went inside and found there were two owls. "come in!" said the owls. ted was relieved, he now had somewhere to stay until the rain stopped. 

the rain finally stopped and the sky was clear again. ted thanked the owls for letting him stay dry. he said goodbye and started to walk down the path. 

he was excited for his adventure. he couldn't wait to see what else he could explore!

then, she put the lung in the basin. angie started to wash it. she rubbed and scrubbed and swirled until it was all nice and clean. she was very happy with her work.

once upon a time, there was a blue tank. inside the tank lived a little fish. it was so very small. one day, the fish wanted to escape the tank. so the fish called for help.

the fish said "someone please help me! i want to escape this tank!"

just then, a little girl heard the fish's plea for help. she ran over to the tank and looked inside.

the little girl said, "i can help you!"

the fish was so excited. together, the little girl and the fish worked on a plan. the little girl grabbed a net and scooped the fish out of the tank. the fish was free!

the fish said, "thank you so much! i was so happy to escape the tank."

the little girl smiled and said, "you're welcome. i'm so glad i could help you."

the little fish swam away, happy to be free. the little girl smiled and went on her way.

molly and her mom played with the leaf for a while. molly would squeeze the leaf and a big gust of air would come out. molly and her mom laughed and laughed. 

finally, molly said, "let's go home." they waved goodbye to the tree and walked away. molly held her fat leaf close. she would always remember the fun they had that day.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named tom. tom loved playing with his toys, but he also loved going outside and exploring.

one day, tom decided to go out and explore the forest nearby. he walked and walked, taking in all the different sights and sounds. after a while, he felt his stomach twisting and he started to struggle.

tom stopped and sat down. he thought about his mommy's delicious cooking, and he wished he had some food. suddenly, he heard a voice.

"hi tom, why are you struggling?" asked the voice.

tom looked up and saw a big bear. he was scared, but the bear had a warm smile on his face.

"i'm hungry, but i don't have any food," tom said.

the bear smiled and said, "i have plenty of different foods, would you like to try some?"

tom said yes and the two of them went to the bear's cave. tom enjoyed all the different foods, and soon his stomach stopped struggling.

the bear and tom parted ways and tom went home. he knew he would never forget his day out in the forest and the help his new friend had given him.

the little girl was so excited and nodded. then the snowman whispered something in her ear.

the girl smiled and said, "wow! that is so neat! i will keep it safe!"

the snowman nodded and said, "i am glad you like my secret. you can now see the secret garden."

the little girl opened the gate and stepped into the garden. everywhere she looked, there was snow! the snow sparkled in the sunlight and the girl laughed with glee.

"be careful!" david said as he nodded his head. sarah knew that he was being kind and trying to protect her from being too rough with the puppy. but a rude man started shouting at them. "don't touch my dog!" he said.

it scared both of them, so david took sarah's hand and they ran away. as soon as they were far enough away, david gave sarah a big hug. "that was a bit scary, wasn't it?" david said. sarah nodded her head, glad to have her friend with her.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named emma. emma loved to play in the garden. she would run around the garden, picking flowers and finding shells to admire.
one day, emma noticed a shield displaying in the garden and became very curious.

she walked up to the shield and asked her mother, "what is this?"

her mother replied, "it's a shield, sweetie. it's here to protect us."

emma was not content with this answer and said, "but i want to play with it!"

her mother said, "i'm sorry, emma. the shield is not a toy. it's here to be useful, so it shouldn't be played with."

emma didn't understand. she started to cry and said, "but i just want to have fun."

her mother hugged her and said, "i know, emma. but the shield is here to help us, not for playing. sometimes we need to use things for the right reasons, even if we don't understand why."

emma calmed down and realized that her mother was right. she admired the shield, understanding that it was there to be useful and help protect them.

the moral of the story is that it's important to use things in the right way, even when we don't understand why.
once upon a time there was a rabbit who was weak and always very hungry. he asked, "what food is there for me to eat?" he looked around and saw a turnip. he hopped over to the turnip and tried to pull it from the ground but he was too weak. 

suddenly, a friendly goat appeared. the goat said, â€œlet me help you!â€ the goat began to reverse around the turnip, like a windmill, and eventually he was able to pull the turnip from the ground.

the rabbit thanked the goat and said, â€œi need to eat this turnip. it is the only food i have!â€ little did he know, the goat had a snack in his pocket - a delicious carrot - but he decided not to share it. poor rabbit! 

the bunny sadly hopped away with the turnip in his mouth. he never got to eat the tasty food he wanted and he stayed very weak! the end.

surprised, ralph looked at his mum. "why, mum?" he asked.

his mum smiled. "you'll see," she replied.

ralph went to the store and got the cardboard. when he came back, his mum told him to take it out to the backyard. there, she helped him to make a fort out of the cardboard.

when he was done, ralph asked, "what are we gonna do with it?"

his mum smiled and said, "why don't you reverse into it and hide? i'll be able to find you, but it'll be fun to try!"

giggling, ralph did what his mum said and, soon enough, he was playing a game of hide and seek. he felt like he was inside a secret cave and was so happy. 

his mum had been right - it was fun!

fluffy just ignored her. he kept on snoozing in the corner and refused to show ashley his magic.

ashley got really sad. she started to cry and begged fluffy to show her his powers. but no matter what she said or did, the grumpy dragon just ignored her.

finally, ashley made the dragon an offer she couldnâ€™t refuse. she promised to bring fluffy a delicious snack each day if he would just show her some magic.

he looked around and then noticed something else. it was an old hut in the distance. he walked towards it and greeted the people inside. one of them was an old man. grandpa bob asked him about the spear, and the old man said, "i made it a long time ago and now it's yours. take it with you!"

john was walking along a path in the woods when he spotted something strange on the ground. it was a little brown lizard, looking up at him with its big eyes. he bent down to take a closer look and the lizard scurried off into the trees.

john was sad because he wanted to get a closer look and he couldn't, so he yelled out in disappointment. suddenly, a loud roar answered his yell. it was a very big, very fierce animal.

the animal was a bear and it was coming right for john. john ran off as fast as he could, and he didn't look back. the bear ran after him, and the woods echoed with its bitter roar.

john kept running until he finally made it home. he was safe! the next time john walked in the woods, he remembered the day the bear chased him, and he stayed away from any lizards he saw. safe and sound!

once there were two little girls named sally and annie. they were best friends and they lived together in a big house.

one day, sally had an idea. she said to annie, "let's try going to the gym today." annie smiled and agreed. so the two of them got dressed and headed out the door.

when they arrived at the gym, there were lots of people doing all kinds of activities. sally and annie watched people playing basketball, lifting weights, and running on the track.

the two friends decided to try the rowing machines. as soon as they started, their arms began to get tired. sally suggested, "let's go get some juice. that will help us feel better."

the two friends knew the juice at the gym was usually sour. but they decided to try it anyway and see how it tasted. when they took a sip, it was very sour! but they both managed to drink it down.

after that, they were able to row even more, and eventually they felt much better. they decided that the sour juice had done the trick!

one day, while macy was washing the leaves in the pond, she heard a funny noise. she looked around and saw a frog hopping around. 

macy asked the frog, 'what are you doing here?' 

the frog croaked, 'i'm just here to take a swim!'

macy smiled and said, 'that's fun. can i help you?' 

the frog hopped onto a leaf and said, 'sure!'

macy and the frog worked together to clean the pond. they picked out the leaves and the sticks, and popped the bubbles in the water. macy was so curious about the frog's life, she asked him lots of questions while they worked.

at the end of the day, macy said goodbye to the frog and thanked him for all of his help. the frog gave macy a big hug and hopped away. 

macy looked around her clean pond and smiled. it was the perfect day!

once upon a time there was a little bee called buzz. buzz was a brave bee but was having a tough time. he was trying to find a new way to make honey.

one day, buzz was walking when he saw a friendly caterpillar. "hi there," said the caterpillar.
"hi," said buzz.
the caterpillar had a big smile. "i know a way to make lots of honey," she said. 
buzz was excited. "what way?" he asked.
the caterpillar told buzz a secret way to make more honey. "but it's really tough," said the caterpillar.
buzz was determined. "i can do it," he said. 
the caterpillar smiled. "ok, let's go," she said. 

and so buzz and the caterpillar set off on their journey to find the secret way to make honey. it was a long and tough journey but in the end, they made it. 
 
buzz was now an expert honey maker. he thanked the caterpillar for showing him the way. 
the caterpillar smiled. "you were brave and you never gave up. that's the best way," she said. 
buzz smiled and flew away, proud of his accomplishment.

but timmy remembered something his mom had told him. she said that sometimes it's important to resist the urge to win and just have fun with your friends. so, timmy decided to stop being so competitive and just enjoy playing tag with his friends. and you know what? he had so much fun!

lily sang her heart out and everyone clapped and cheered. after the show, they went to get some ice cream, but lily didn't like the flavor she got. it was too sour! she made a funny face and her mommy laughed. they went home happy and proud of lily's performance. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside on her porch. one day, she found a letter in her mailbox. she was confused because she didn't know who it was from.

lily went to her mommy and said, "mommy, i got a letter in the mail, but i don't know who it's from." her mommy looked at the letter and said, "it's from your grandma! she wants to come visit us."

lily was so happy to hear that her grandma was coming to visit. but then, she remembered that her room was messy. she didn't want her grandma to see it like that. so, she asked her mommy for help to clean it up.

in the end, lily's grandma came and they had a wonderful time together. lily was happy that she got a letter in the mail and that her grandma came to visit her on her porch.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to ride the bus to see new places. one day, timmy got on the bus and saw a strange bag. he asked the bus driver, "what is in the bag?" the bus driver replied, "i don't know. it's unknown to me."

timmy was curious about the bag, so he asked the bus driver if he could do something about it. the bus driver said yes, and timmy went to check the bag. inside the bag, timmy found a toy car. he was so happy and showed it to the bus driver. the bus driver was happy too and said, "that's great! now we know what was in the unknown bag."

from that day on, timmy always looked for unknown things on the bus. he loved to do things to help the bus driver, like picking up trash or holding the door open for others. timmy loved the bus and all the adventures it brought him.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, lily went to the park with her mom. she saw a big swing and asked her mom if she could play on it. her mom said yes, so lily ran over to the swing and started swinging back and forth.

suddenly, lily heard a loud noise and looked up. she saw a big bird flying towards her, and it looked very angry. lily got scared and jumped off the swing. she ran over to her mom and told her what happened.

her mom hugged her and said it was okay. they decided to go for a walk and explore the park. they walked up to a cliff and looked out at the beautiful view. lily forgot all about the angry bird and was happy again.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. he was playing in his backyard when he found a magic wand. he picked it up and said, "wow, this is magic!"

suddenly, a fairy appeared and said, "i am the fairy of the magic wand. you can make anything happen by pulling the wand."

timmy was so excited and he pulled the wand. the fairy then turned his ordinary toy car into a real car. timmy was amazed and said, "this is so cool! thank you, fairy!" the fairy smiled and said, "you're welcome, timmy. just remember, with great power comes great responsibility." and with that, the fairy disappeared. timmy played with his new car and promised to use the magic wand wisely.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in the warm sun. one day, she saw a pretty butterfly flying in the garden. she ran after it, but the butterfly was too fast for her.

lily's mom came outside and saw her daughter struggling to catch the butterfly. "what are you doing, lily?" her mom asked. "i want to catch the butterfly, but it's too fast," lily replied.

her mom smiled and said, "don't worry, lily. the butterfly is happy flying around in the garden. let's just enjoy watching it." so, lily and her mom sat in the sun and watched the butterfly flutter from flower to flower. it was a warm and peaceful day, and lily was happy just being outside with her mom and the butterfly.
