lily replied, "but mommy, i don't want to take it off. i love my skirt."

mommy said, "i know you love your skirt, but we need to add soap and water to make it clean and fresh again."

lily learned that sometimes we need to add something to make things better. and from that day on, she made sure to take care of her favorite skirt so it wouldn't get smelly again. the end.
once upon a time, there was a frog named freddy. freddy lived in a pond with his friends. one day, freddy saw a beautiful frog named lily. he asked her, "will you marry me?" lily said, "yes!"

freddy was so happy, but his friends were miserable. they didn't like lily because she was different from them. they said, "we don't want you to marry her, freddy." but freddy loved lily and didn't listen to his friends.

finally, freddy and lily got married by the pond. all of their friends came to the wedding and saw how happy freddy was with lily. they realized that being different was okay and they all became friends again. freddy and lily lived happily ever after.

lily replied, "i like winter. it's fun to play in the snow."

later that day, lily's mom asked her to lend her a sweater because it was getting even colder outside. lily happily gave her mom her warm sweater. her mom said, "thanks, lily. you're always so kind."

that night, lily went to bed feeling happy. she knew that lending her mom her sweater was the right thing to do. and even though it was cold outside, she felt warm inside because she had helped someone she loved.

lily thought it was incredible that people wore special clothes for their jobs. she asked her mom if she could wear a uniform too. her mom said that when she grows up, she can choose a job that has a uniform.

later that day, lily and her friend were playing with their toys when her friend started to take some of lily's toys without asking. lily said, "stop! that's not nice." her friend apologized and gave the toys back.

lily learned that even though people have different jobs and wear different clothes, everyone should be kind and respectful to each other.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play outside in the park. one day, he saw a pigeon flying in the sky. the pigeon looked so free and happy, and timmy wanted to be just like the pigeon.

suddenly, timmy heard a loud noise. it was a group of big, mean bullies. they wanted to take timmy's toy truck away. timmy was scared and didn't know what to do. but then, he remembered the pigeon he saw earlier. the pigeon surrendered to the sky and flew away. timmy decided to surrender his toy truck to the bullies and run away.

as timmy was running away, he saw a kind old lady sitting on a bench. she noticed that timmy looked sad and asked him what was wrong. timmy told her about the bullies and how he surrendered his toy truck. the old lady smiled and said, "you did the right thing, timmy. it's always better to be kind and surrender something small than to fight and get hurt."

from that day on, timmy learned to be like the pigeon and surrender when things got tough. and he also made a new friend in the kind old lady at the park. plus, he got a new toy truck from his mom, so he didn't even miss the one he surrendered. and it was a good thing too, because it was a hot summer day and timmy wanted to play with his new truck in the cool shade.

the elderly lady smiled and said, "of course, my dear!" they set the table together with colorful plates and cups. the little girl was so happy to help.

after they finished setting the table, they sat down to eat. the little girl said, "this home is so big and pretty. do you like living here?"

the elderly lady replied, "yes, i love my home. it's cozy and warm. but what i love the most is having someone to share it with, like you!"

the next day, the lion heard a loud roar. it was coming from the other side of the jungle. the lion and his friends went to see what was happening. they found a big bear who was very angry. the bear was roaring because he had lost his axe.

the lion remembered he had found an axe and showed it to the bear. the bear was very happy and thanked the lion. the bear stopped roaring and became friendly with the lion and his friends. from that day on, they all played together in the jungle.

timmy was sad because he couldn't play with his toys. he sat down and thought about what to do. suddenly, he heard a ringing sound coming from inside the chest. he knew he had to get it open to see what was making the noise.

timmy pushed and pulled with all his might, and finally, the chest opened. inside, he found a shiny bell that was ringing. he was so happy that he could play with his toys again and listen to the bell ring. from that day on, timmy always made sure to keep his chest unlocked so he could play with his toys anytime he wanted.

"oh no!" lily cried. "i got paint on my dress!"

"don't worry, lily," her mom said. "we can wash it off."

but lily didn't want to wait for her mom to wash it off. she wanted to do it herself. so, she tried to wash it off with water, but it didn't work. the spot of white paint stayed on her dress.

lily was sad because she loved her dress. she didn't want to wear it with a spot on it. from that day on, lily learned to be more careful when she painted.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play outside, but it was raining, so he had to stay inside. he was feeling sad and bored.

timmy's mom noticed how he was feeling and asked, "do you want to play a game?"

"yes, please!" timmy said excitedly.

his mom said, "let's play hide and seek. you hide and i'll find you."

timmy ran to the closet to hide. he found a comfortable blanket and decided to wrap himself in it. he felt cozy and warm.

his mom counted to ten and then started looking for him. she searched the whole house, but she couldn't find him. she started to get worried.

suddenly, timmy jumped out of the closet and yelled, "boo! you found me!"

his mom laughed and said, "you scared me! you're a great hider. let's play again!" they played another round of hide and seek and had lots of fun.

lily's mommy was worried and wanted to take her to the doctor. but lily refused to go. she was scared of the doctor's office and didn't want to leave the house. her mommy tried to convince her, but lily was stubborn.

days went by and lily's sickness got worse. she started coughing and had a high fever. her mommy was ashamed that she didn't take her to the doctor earlier. she called an ambulance, but it was too late. lily had to go to the hospital, but she didn't make it. her mommy was heartbroken and regretted not taking her to the doctor when she had the chance.

teddy had an idea. he climbed up the incredible tree and grabbed a big stick. he hit the wolf on the head with the stick, and the wolf ran away. teddy and his friends were safe! 

but then, they heard a loud noise. it was the sound of a big truck coming to cut down the incredible tree. teddy and his friends knew they had to do something to save their home. they all worked together to stop the truck and protect the tree. 

in the end, the tree was saved and teddy and his friends were very happy. they knew that they could always count on each other to solve any problem that came their way.

suddenly, a man came up to the stage and started talking. timmy didn't understand everything he said, but he saw lots of people nodding their heads and clapping their hands. the man was talking about being successful and helping others. timmy didn't know what that meant, but he knew it must be important.

but then, a big boy came and tried to take the toy van away from her. the dog barked and scared the boy away. lily thanked the dog and they played together happily ever after. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved wearing her pink scarf, it was her favorite. one day, lily was walking in the park and she saw a boy crying. she went up to him and asked, "why are you crying?" the boy said, "i lost my compass, i can't find my way home." 

lily was compassionate and wanted to help the boy. she said, "don't worry, i will help you find your way home." they started walking together and lily spoke to the boy, "where do you live?" the boy told her his address and they walked towards it. 

after a while, they reached the boy's house. he was so happy and thanked lily for helping him. lily smiled and said, "no problem, i'm happy to help." as she turned around to leave, she realized her scarf was missing. she looked everywhere but couldn't find it. she felt sad and cried all the way home. 

the moral of the story is that sometimes when we help others, we may lose something in return. but it's important to still be kind and compassionate towards others.

lily picked up the branch and showed it to her friend, timmy. "look at this weird branch i found," she said. timmy thought it was weird too.

later that day, lily's mom asked her to help with the dishes. as she was washing, she accidentally broke a plate. she was scared to tell her mom, but then she remembered the weird branch. she rubbed the branch and made a wish that her mom wouldn't be mad.

the next day, when lily's mom saw the broken plate, she didn't get mad at all. she just smiled and said, "it's okay, accidents happen." lily was so happy that her wish came true. she knew that the weird branch was magical. from that day on, she kept it with her all the time.

as the painter was painting, the man started to get angry and scream at him. the painter tried to calm him down, but it didn't work. finally, the man left without paying for the portrait.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, she was playing in the park when she saw a thief run past her. the thief had stolen a cake from a lady's basket. lily wanted to help, so she ran after the thief.

when she caught up to the thief, she said, "give back the cake, please. it's not nice to take things that don't belong to you." the thief was surprised by lily's creative solution and gave back the cake.

later that day, lily went home and told her mom about what happened. her mom was proud of her for being brave and kind. she said, "lily, it's important to always do the right thing, even when it's hard. and remember, we should never take things that don't belong to us. we should always ask first or cook our own treats." 

from that day on, lily always remembered her mom's words and became known as a creative problem solver who always did the right thing.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a clock in her room that tick-tocked all day long. one day, the clock stopped ticking and lily didn't know what to do. she asked her mom to fix it, but her mom said it was too old and couldn't be fixed.

lily was sad because she loved the sound of the clock. but then she had an idea! she took a smooth nap on her bed and dreamed of a new clock that would make her happy. when she woke up, her mom surprised her with a new clock that tick-tocked even louder than the old one. lily was so happy, she hugged her mom and thanked her for the new clock. from that day on, lily took a nap every day and dreamed of new adventures.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had very thick hair that she loved to brush every day. one day, her mom asked her if she wanted to bake some cookies. lily was very excited and said yes.

they went to the kitchen and started to mix the ingredients. lily's mom noticed that some of her hair had fallen into the cookie dough. she quickly took it out and threw it away, but lily didn't notice.

they put the cookies in the oven to bake and waited patiently. when they were done, lily's mom took them out and they looked delicious. but when they took a bite, they realized there was something wrong. the cookies tasted like hair!

lily's mom realized what had happened and explained to lily that they needed to be careful when baking. lily learned her lesson and never again let her hair fall into the cookie dough.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play outside and explore the world around him. one day, he found a bell in the grass. it was shiny and made a pretty sound when he rang it.

suddenly, timmy heard a voice behind him. it was his friend, sally. "what are you doing?" sally asked. "i found a bell!" timmy exclaimed. sally came closer to see the bell. "that's nice," she said.

they both stared at the bell for a while, until sally said, "do you think it's harmless?" timmy didn't know what the word "harmless" meant, so sally explained that it meant the bell wouldn't hurt them. timmy smiled and rang the bell again, feeling happy that he found something so pretty and harmless.
once upon a time, there was a little frog named freddy. freddy was very lonely because he didn't have any frog friends to play with. one day, freddy saw a big, shiny knob on a door. he decided to jump on it to see what would happen. when he jumped on the knob, the door opened and he saw a room full of other frogs! freddy was so happy to have found some new friends to play with. from that day on, freddy would jump on the knob every day to visit his new frog friends.
once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved to sing into his microphone and make up songs. he was very creative and always came up with new tunes. one day, timmy wanted to make a special song, so he asked his mom for some help. she gave him some flour, sugar, and eggs to mix together to make cookies. timmy mixed them all up and then sang a song into his microphone while the cookies baked in the oven. when they were done, he shared them with his friends and they all sang and danced together. timmy was very happy that he could be creative and make something yummy to share with his friends. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside and look at the pretty flowers. one day, she saw a charming butterfly fluttering around the garden. she wanted to catch it and keep it as her pet.

lily chased after the butterfly, but it flew away. she tried again and again, but the butterfly always got away. she felt sad and frustrated. she wanted that butterfly so badly.

then, she had an idea. she went inside and got a jar with a lid. she went back outside and waited patiently for the butterfly to come back. when it did, she quickly put the jar over it and caught it. she was so happy! she had finally caught the charming butterfly she wanted.

but then, she realized that the butterfly was not happy in the jar. it wanted to fly free in the garden. lily felt bad for taking it away from its home. so, she opened the jar and let the butterfly go. she learned that sometimes, what we want may not be what is best for others.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to watch tv all day long. his mommy said, "timmy, you need to let the tv rest for a while." but timmy didn't want to stop watching his favorite show.

one day, the tv started to go slow. timmy became sad because he couldn't watch his show. he said, "mommy, why is the tv so slow?" his mommy said, "maybe it needs a break. let's turn it off for a bit."

timmy agreed and turned off the tv. after a while, he turned it back on and it worked perfectly fine. timmy learned that sometimes it's good to let things rest so they can work better.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she lived on a ranch with her mommy and daddy. lily loved to play outside and explore the big fields.

one day, lily went to school and wore her favorite black dress. but when she got to school, she realized that her dress had a big stain on it. she felt embarrassed in front of her friends.

after school, lily went back to the ranch and told her mommy what happened. her mommy gave her a big hug and said, "don't worry, lily. it's okay to make mistakes. we all have accidents sometimes." lily felt better and went back to playing in the fields, happy to be home where she felt safe and loved.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily who loved to play outside. one day, she found a big maze made out of green bushes. she wanted to explore it but didn't know how to get through it. 

suddenly, a modern robot appeared and said, "hello, little girl. do you need help getting through the maze?" lily was surprised but happy to have found a friend. "yes, please," she said.

the robot led the way and showed lily how to yield to the right path. they talked and laughed as they made their way through the maze. finally, they reached the end and lily said, "thank you so much, mr. robot. you're the best!" the robot replied, "it was my pleasure, lily. i'm glad i could help." and with that, they said goodbye and went their separate ways.
once upon a time, there was a girl named lily. she loved to play in the water. one day, lily and her dad built a big pink raft. they used wood and nails to make it strong. 

lily and her dad went to the river to try out the raft. lily was so happy! she sat on the raft and her dad pushed her into the water. lily laughed and raised her arms up high. 

suddenly, lily saw a big fish in the water. she was scared and wanted to go back to the shore. but her dad said, "don't worry, lily. we're safe on the raft." so, they continued to float down the river on their pink raft, enjoying the sunshine and the cool water.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to eat melons. one day, timmy's mom brought home a big, green melon. timmy was so excited to eat it! 

but when timmy's mom tried to open the melon, it was too hard. she tried and tried, but she couldn't get it open. timmy was sad. he really wanted to eat the melon. 

then, timmy's dad came home. "what's wrong?" he asked. timmy's mom explained about the melon. "let me try," said timmy's dad. he took a big knife and carefully cut the melon open. inside, it was juicy and sweet. timmy was so happy! 

the moral of the story is that sometimes, things seem hard to do, but if you keep trying, you can reveal something wonderful. and, always remember to share your melon with others!
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a toy car that she loved to play with. one day, lily's toy car was broken. she looked at it and said, "oh no! my car is broken. i want it to be fixed." 

lily's mommy heard her and said, "don't worry, sweetie. we can fix it together." they went to the store and bought glue. they looked at the car and saw that the wheel was broken. 

lily's mommy used the glue to fix the wheel. lily was so happy! she looked at her car and said, "thank you, mommy. you fixed my car. it's not broken anymore!"
once upon a time, there was a girl named lily. she went to a breakfast place with her mom. lily's mom asked, "what do you want to eat, lily?" lily said, "i want sausage and eggs." 

the waiter came and said, "good morning! what can i serve you?" lily's mom said, "we want two plates of sausage and eggs, please." 

when the food came, lily was so excited to eat the sausage. she picked it up with her hands and it was messy. lily's mom said, "use your fork and knife, lily. don't be messy." 

lily ate her sausage and eggs with her fork and knife. she said, "yummy! i like sausage." her mom said, "i'm glad you like it, lily." they finished their breakfast and went home. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to watch tv and would always ask her mommy to turn it on. one day, the tv wouldn't come on no matter what she did. lily tried pressing all the buttons on the remote, but nothing worked.

lily became persistent and kept trying to make the tv work. she even asked her daddy to help, but he couldn't fix it either. lily was sad because she couldn't watch her favorite show.

but then, lily had an idea. she remembered that her grandma had a tv too. so, she went to her grandma's house and asked if she could watch tv there. her grandma said yes and lily was so happy.

in the end, lily learned that sometimes when things don't work out, it's important to keep trying and find a solution. and sometimes, help can come from unexpected places.
once upon a time, there was a little boy who loved to play with his boat. he would take it to the pond and watch it float. one day, he saw a duck and he wanted to call it over. he tried and tried, but the duck was too far away.

the little boy was persistent and kept calling for the duck to come. suddenly, a big wave came and knocked his boat over. the little boy was sad and cried. he tried to get his boat back, but it was too far away.

the little boy went home with a heavy heart, without his boat. he learned that sometimes, even if we call and try really hard, things don't always go as we want them to.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside during the day, but she was always afraid of the night. she believed that scary monsters were hiding in the dark.

one night, lily's parents took her on a walk under the stars. they showed her how beautiful the night can be. they pointed out the moon and the stars, and lily was amazed.

she no longer believed that the night was scary. instead, she saw that it was a magical time when things that were hidden during the day came out to play. from that night on, lily looked forward to exploring the world at night.
once upon a time, there was a boy who loved to play the drum. he would play it every day and make loud sounds. he had a dependable drum that he loved so much. one day, he decided to go on a trip with his drum. he packed his things and left for the trip. 

he traveled for a long time until he arrived at a big forest. the boy was happy to be in the forest, and he started playing his drum. the animals in the forest heard the sound and came to see what was happening. they were happy to see the boy playing the drum. 

suddenly, a big bear came out of the forest and started chasing the boy. the boy tried to run away, but he fell and dropped his drum. the bear destroyed the drum and the boy was sad. he had lost his dependable drum. the boy learned that it's not always safe to play the drum in the forest.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to wander around her garden and look at all the pretty flowers. one day, she found a big squash hiding behind a bush. 

lily picked up the squash and showed it to her mom. "look, mommy! i found a big squash!" she said with a smile. 

her mom was proud of lily's successful discovery. "wow, lily! that's a really big squash. maybe we can make some delicious soup with it," her mom said. 

lily was happy to have found something new and exciting in her garden. she continued to wander around, looking for more treasures to discover.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to read the newspaper every morning with her daddy. one day, lily's daddy couldn't find the newspaper. he looked everywhere but it was nowhere to be found.

lily asked, "daddy, where is the newspaper?"

"i don't know, lily. i can't find it," replied her daddy.

lily said, "let's organize the room and maybe we can find it." so they organized the room and found the newspaper under a pile of clothes. daddy was happy and said, "thank you, lily. you are so helpful." they read the newspaper together and enjoyed a mild morning.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in the rain and jump in puddles. one day, she got very muddy and her mom said, "lily, you need to take a shower."

lily didn't want to take a shower because she liked being muddy. but her mom said, "you can't go to bed all dirty. you need to get clean." so lily took a shower and it was so much fun! she splashed and played with the water.

after her shower, lily's mom gave her a big towel to dry off with. lily wrapped herself up in the towel and said, "i love showers! they make me feel ancient!" her mom laughed and said, "you mean refreshed, lily. showers make you feel refreshed." and lily smiled and said, "yes, refreshed!"
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside, but one day it started to rain. lily's mom told her to come inside, but she didn't want to. she slipped on the wet grass and got her dress dirty. 

lily's mom gave her a rag to clean herself up. lily didn't like the rag because it wasn't comfortable like her dress. she said, "mommy, this rag is scratchy. can i use my dress instead?" 

her mom said, "no, lily. your dress is wet and we need to wash it. the rag will make you clean and comfortable again." so, lily used the rag and felt much better. she learned that sometimes we have to do things we don't like to be comfortable again.
once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play outside with his friends. one day, timmy's dad gave him some equipment to play with. the equipment was very important to timmy because it helped him play better.

timmy and his friends were playing with a ball when suddenly, the ball went over the fence. timmy saw that there was a sign that said "do not touch". timmy's friend said, "let's go get the ball!" but timmy said, "no, we can't touch the equipment. it's important to follow the rules."

timmy's friends were surprised but they listened to timmy. they waited until timmy's dad came home and helped them get the ball back. timmy learned that sometimes it's important to follow the rules even if it means waiting a little longer.
once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy had a dull card that he loved to play with. one day, timmy went to his friend's house to show him his card. his friend said, "wow, that card is so cool! can i see it?" 

timmy said, "sure!" and handed his friend the card. but his friend accidentally dropped it and it fell under the couch. timmy's friend tried to reach for it, but his arm was too short. 

timmy said, "don't worry, i can help!" and he knelt down to look under the couch. he saw the card and grabbed it. his friend was so happy and said, "thank you, timmy! you're the best!" 

timmy smiled and said, "no problem, i'm always happy to help my friends." and they both played with the card together. the end.
once upon a time, there was a girl named lily. she had a big purple bike with a basket in front. one day, lily wanted to ride her bike to the park. she put on her helmet and rode down the street. 

when she got to the park, she saw a crazy clown. the clown had a big red nose and was juggling balls. lily rode her bike over to watch the clown. the clown even gave her a purple balloon animal. 

after watching the clown, lily rode her bike to the swings. she swung back and forth, feeling the wind in her hair. she had so much fun riding her bike and playing at the park. when it was time to go home, she rode her bike back down the street, holding onto her purple balloon animal.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to eat snacks, especially crackers and cheese. one day, her mom told her she couldn't have a snack because it was almost dinner time. lily was sad, but she surrendered and waited for dinner.

later that evening, lily's dad came home from work. he had a harsh day at work and was feeling grumpy. lily tried to cheer him up by giving him a hug and a kiss. her dad's face softened and he smiled. he realized he had surrendered to his bad mood and needed to be more positive.

after dinner, lily's parents surprised her with a special snack - ice cream! lily was so happy and grateful. she surrendered to the joy of the moment and enjoyed every bite. from that day on, lily learned that surrendering to the good things in life can bring happiness.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to watch tv all day long. but one day, her mom said, "lily, you need to stop watching tv all day. you need to go outside and play." lily didn't like this. she wanted to watch tv all day. so, she started to cry.

but then, lily's mom had an idea. she said, "let's go to the park!" lily was happy and stopped crying. they went to the park and played on the swings and slide. but it was getting cold outside and lily started to shiver. her mom said, "let's go home and have some hot chocolate." lily smiled and they went home.

when they got home, lily's mom turned on the tv for a little while. but lily didn't want to watch it anymore. she said, "mom, let's play a game together." they played a game and had fun. lily realized that playing outside and spending time with her mom was much better than watching tv all day. she felt modest about her behavior before and was happy to have a new way to spend her time.
once upon a time, there was a chubby bunny. the bunny liked to eat carrots and lettuce. one day, the bunny found a sword in the forest. the bunny thought the sword was shiny and pretty. the bunny picked up the sword and brought it back to its burrow. the bunny tried to eat the sword, but it was too hard. the bunny decided to keep the sword as a treasure instead. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily who loved birds. she would watch them fly in the sky and sing sweet songs. one day, she decided to make some bird food so they would come closer to her house. 

lily went to the kitchen and got some bread crumbs, seeds, and peanuts. she mixed them all together to make a delicious meal for the birds. she put the food in a bowl and went outside to add it to the bird feeder. 

soon, the birds came flying from all directions. they ate the food and sang a happy song. lily was so happy to see the birds enjoying her delicious meal. from that day on, lily made sure to add bird food to the feeder every day so the birds would always come and sing for her.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to dance and listen to music. one day, she heard some jazz music coming from a distant place. she wanted to move her body to the beat of the music, so she asked her mommy if they could go there.

"mommy, can we go there? i want to move my body to the jazz music," lily said.

"sure, let's go there!" said mommy.

so, they went to the distant place where the jazz music was playing. when they arrived, lily saw people dancing and moving to the beat of the music. she joined them and danced happily. she loved the jazz music and the way it made her feel. 

after a while, they went back home. lily was tired but happy. she told her mommy, "i love jazz music. it makes me want to move and dance all day long!"
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved playing with cardboard boxes and making forts out of them. one day, she found a big purple cardboard box in the garage. she was so excited and thought it would be perfect for her new fort.

lily's mom warned her that the box was very old and might not be strong enough. but lily didn't listen and started building her fort. suddenly, the box collapsed and lily fell down. she was very sad and hurt.

lily's mom hugged her and said, "i think we should always listen to grown-ups when they warn us about things. and we should always be careful with old things, like that purple cardboard box."

from that day on, lily learned to be more careful and always listen to her mom. she also learned that sometimes things that look fun and exciting can be dangerous, so it's important to be safe.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. lily loved to play with clay. she would make all sorts of things with it like animals and flowers. one day, lily made a unique clay person that no one had ever seen before. 

lily loved her clay person so much that she wanted to hug it. but when she hugged it, it broke into tiny pieces. lily was sad and didn't know what to do. 

then, lily's mom came in and saw what happened. she hugged lily and told her that it's okay to make mistakes. together, they picked up the pieces and made a new clay person that was even more special than the first. and from that day on, lily learned that hugs can make everything better.
once upon a time, there was a hairy boy named timmy. timmy had a lot of hair on his head and it was always messy. one day, timmy met a girl named lily in the park. 

lily asked timmy, "why is your hair so hairy?" 

timmy didn't know the answer, so he questioned his mom. his mom said, "that's just the way he was born, lily." 

lily thought timmy's hair was funny and they both laughed. they played together in the park and had a lot of fun. timmy was happy to have a new friend.
once upon a time, there was a shy rabbit named benny. benny liked to hop on the path in the forest. one day, benny found a shiny rock and wanted to polish it. he hopped to his home and got some water to clean the rock. then, he rubbed the rock with a leaf to make it shiny.

as he was polishing the rock, a big, mean fox appeared. the fox wanted the shiny rock and chased benny. benny was too shy to run away, so the fox took the rock and ran off. benny was sad and scared. he didn't want to hop on the path anymore. from that day on, benny stayed in his burrow and never went out again. the end.
once upon a time, there was a big family of rabbits. they lived in a cozy home in the forest. the rabbits were very happy together and loved to play and eat carrots. 

one day, a new rabbit came to their home. her name was rosie and she was very envious of the other rabbits. she wanted to have all the carrots for herself and didn't want to share with anyone. 

the other rabbits noticed that rosie was not very friendly and they decided to separate from her. they knew that it was not nice to be envious and selfish. they wanted to teach rosie a lesson and show her the importance of kindness and sharing. 

after some time, rosie realized her mistake and apologized to the other rabbits. she learned that it was better to be friends and share the carrots. from that day on, they all played together and shared their food. the rabbits lived happily ever after.
once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy had a belt that he wore every day. it was a brown belt with a shiny buckle. timmy thought it was the coolest belt ever.

one day, timmy went to school and his teacher talked about a boring book. timmy didn't like boring things, so he didn't want to read it. but then his friend mentioned that the book had a cool adventure in it. timmy was interested in adventures, so he decided to give the book a try.

as he read the book, timmy sat back and adjusted his belt. he was happy he gave the book a chance because he found a new adventure to enjoy. from that day on, timmy always listened when his friends mentioned something new.
one day, a little girl named lily went for a walk in the forest. she saw a cute bunny hopping around. "hello, little bunny!" said lily. the bunny hopped closer and closer until it was right beside her. suddenly, the bunny jumped up and surprised lily! 

lily laughed and said, "you gave me a surprise, little bunny!" the bunny hopped away, leaving lily to continue her walk. she saw a big, green frog sitting on a lily pad in a pond. "hello, mr. frog!" said lily. 

the frog croaked and said, "hello, little girl. i have a modest home here on my lily pad." lily looked at the frog's home and saw that it was very small. "it's very cute!" said lily. 

just then, a porcupine with sharp spikes on its back walked by. "hello, mr. porcupine!" said lily. the porcupine said nothing and just kept walking. lily continued her walk, feeling happy and surprised by all the animals she had met.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily who loved to play outside. she would run and jump and laugh in the sunshine every day. but on sundays, she knew it was time to take a bath. her mommy always made sure she was clean and smelled nice for church.

one sunday, lily's mommy told her they were going to visit her grandparents. lily was excited to see them, but she was also worried. her mommy's car was old and sometimes it didn't work very well. lily wondered if they would make it to her grandparents' house on time.

after her bath, lily put on her favorite dress and waited for her mommy to finish getting ready. when they got in the car, lily noticed her mommy was driving very carefully. she was being reliable, just like lily's daddy always was. and sure enough, they arrived at her grandparents' house right on time.

lily had a wonderful day with her grandparents, and on the way home, she fell asleep in the car, dreaming of all the fun she would have playing outside again tomorrow.
once upon a time, there was a little crab named timmy. timmy loved to race with his friends on the beach. one day, timmy saw a shiny oyster on the sand. he wanted to show it to his friends, but a seagull swooped down and snatched it away. timmy was sad and angry.

he asked his friends to help him get the oyster back. they came up with a plan to distract the seagull while timmy snatched the oyster. it worked! timmy got the oyster back and felt fine again. he shared the oyster with his friends and they all had a yummy snack.

from that day on, timmy learned that sometimes you have to work together to solve problems and that sharing is always a good idea. they continued to race and have fun on the beach. the end.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in the sunshine. one day, she went to the park with her mom. she saw a bird's nest in a tree and asked her mom, "what is that?"

"that is a bird's nest," replied her mom. "the bird lays eggs in there."

lily looked at the nest and saw a small rod inside. "why is there a stick in there?" she asked.

"that's a regular part of the nest," explained her mom. "the bird uses it to make the nest stronger."

lily thought it was amazing that birds could make their own homes. she said, "i wish i could build a nest like that."

"you can build a nest with your toys," said her mom. "but you can't lay eggs in it!" they both laughed and continued to enjoy their day at the park.
once upon a time, there was a little birdie named tweety. tweety was very curious and loved to explore. one day, tweety flew far away from home and found herself lost in a big desert. she was very thirsty and tired, but then she saw a beautiful oasis in the distance. 

when tweety arrived at the oasis, she saw that there were many other animals there too. they were all different from each other, but they were all happy together. tweety felt very welcomed and happy too. 

after resting and drinking some water, tweety realized that she had learned an important lesson. she learned that even though everyone is different, they can still be friends and get along. she also learned that it's important to always set out on new adventures, but to never forget where home is. 

from that day on, tweety always remembered the oasis and the special friends she made there. she also remembered the lesson she learned about being different and getting along. and she lived happily ever after. the end.
tommy and his dad were on their way to the park. dad was carrying a big tube in his hand. 

"dad, what's in the tube?" asked tommy.

"it's something special," replied his dad. 

when they got to the park, they spread out a big blanket on the grass. dad took out a kite from the tube and the two of them began to assemble it. 

suddenly, an angry gust of wind blew and the kite was whisked away and up into the sky. 

"hooray!" said tommy, clapping with joy.

"let's sit on the comfortable blanket and watch our kite fly," said dad. 

when the wind stopped, the kite came back down - much to tommy's disappointment. 

"what a shame," said dad.

"i hate kites," tommy declared happily.
once there was a boy named ben who was really excited because he had a new bicycle. he wanted to show everyone how much fun he could have with it. so ben decided to go to the park with his bicycle.

when he arrived, there was a fat lady at the park. she asked him, "what do you have there?"

ben smiled and said, "this is my new bicycle."

the fat lady said, "oh, it looks like so much fun! can i guess what color it is?"

ben was so surprised by the lady's question. "yes, you can. but it's not an easy one. what do you guess?" he asked.

the fat lady laughed and said, "i think it's blue."

ben smiled, "you guessed it! it is blue! would you like to go for a ride with me?"

the fat lady was thrilled and said yes. so, ben and the fat lady went for a ride on his blue bicycle. they had a great time and laughed a lot along the way.
one day, papa took sally outside to play on the swings. sally loved swinging high in the wind. she was swinging and smiling, but suddenly she got confused. 

papa said, "what's wrong sally?".

sally replied, "i don't like the wind."

papa smiled and said, "why don't we test it out and see if we can be friends?".
 
sally agreed and climbed back onto the swing. this time, she watched the wind for a few moments before she started swinging again. she smiled and laughed, feeling like the wind was her friend.

the wind blew sally higher and higher and she felt like she was flying. she was no longer confused, she was happy!
once upon a time, there was an elephant named ted. ted lived in the jungle and often played with the other animals. one day, ted was feeling very dizzy. he wanted to do something fun, but he was not sure what. he asked his friend, the monkey, "what can i do?" 

the monkey thought for a moment and then he said, "i know! let's play tag! it is lots of fun." 

so ted and the monkey began to play tag. ted ran around, chased by the monkey, and soon he no longer felt dizzy! he was having a great time. 

at the end of the game, ted was so happy and full of energy. he said to the monkey, "that was so much fun! let's do it every day!" 

and so ted and his monkey friend played tag every day. they were always dizzy with laughter and smiles.
once there was a city. the city was very wealthy. everyone who lived there had lots of money. but then something terrible happened. the city started to rot. bits of it began to fall apart and it became so dirty that no one wanted to live there anymore. the people who lived there had to leave and find somewhere else to live. the city was never the same again and the people who had been so wealthy were suddenly very poor. the end.
jill and jack were siblings who were often impatient with each other. they were in the park one day, playing together.

jill saw a swing and she wanted to swing. she asked jack to push her but he said no. jill became very impatient and began to cry.

jack then saw an old car on the other side of the park. he ran over to the car, forgetting all about jill. but jill followed him and shouted for him to come back.

finally jack got to the car, and he knew he should help jill. he went back to the swing and started to push jill. she laughed and smiled.

jack then saw an old tree nearby. he ran to the tree and started to climb. he asked jill to climb with him but when she said no, jack got impatient. 

jack then saw a bush that he wanted to explore. he ran over to the bush and started poking through the leaves. but jill yelled at him to come back. 

jack came back and he and jill decided to end their day of play. as they walked home, they held hands and laughed. it was a good day.
once upon a time there was a little girl. she was so happy and loved to play outside. one day she was out in her garden playing with her toy when she noticed something strange. 

she saw a little bubble floating in the air. she was curious and decided to pause and take a closer look. the bubble was so beautiful, so she blew on it and made it bigger.

then suddenly the bubble burst and out came a very bitter smell. it made the girl so angry that she started to shout. but then she heard a voice. 

it said â€œdonâ€™t be angry! look at the bright side - now you have a chance to make some new bubbles!â€.

the girl stopped and thought about it. she smiled and realised that the voice was right. she started to make more bubbles and soon she was having so much fun that she forgot about the bitter smell.
once upon a time, there was a poor little girl called sarah. sarah was a very unhappy girl, who would often complain about her life.

the naughty boy sighed. he knew he had done something wrong. he knew he should never have asked the pear that question. now he would have no treat to eat. 

the end.

grandpa took a deep breath. "can i have a drink too?" he asked the bird. the bird replied, "absolutely! i have another bottle nearby."

they flew together until they arrived at the spot where the bird got its drink. grandpa saw a small pond with murky waters. he asked the bird, "is this the drink?" his voice trembled with worry. the bird replied, "yes, it is. my friends and i come here every morning to have a drink."

grandpa raised his eyebrows and asked, "is this drink safe to drink?" the bird nodded and said, "yes, absolutely! try it and you'll see."

grandpa took a sip, reluctantly. to his horror, it was bitter and tasted poisonous. he choked and started to feel very sick. he was afraid, so he quickly flew away from the pond.

john was walking in a deep dark forest. suddenly, he stumbled on a big pile of leaves.

john was scared, but he decided to keep going. eventually, he saw an owl perched atop a tall tree, its eyes glimmering in the moonlight. it was so quiet and still, so john thought that it must be wise.

john whispered to the owl, â€œwhy are you so thoughtful?â€

to his surprise, the owl replied, â€œiâ€™m waiting. something big is coming soon.â€

john was curious, but he was so tired he stumbled all the way home. the owl remained perched in the same spot.

the next morning, when john returned, he saw a huge king cobra coiled up in front of the tree. it raised its hood and hissed, ready to strike. but the owl flew away before the snake could attack.

john was so amazed that he clapped his hands. he was grateful for the owl's thoughtful warning that saved him from the cobra.

the thin stone started pushing itself. it worked really hard, pushing and rolling and scraping. every day, the stone got a little bit bigger and bigger. soon, it was rolling all around the park, shouting with happiness.

moral of the story: even if life gets hard, itâ€™s always possible to improve and move forward.

one day, mrs. johnson was feeling very grumpy and cross as usual. she was shouting and scolding the children and they all started to get very scared.

"it's time to heal your heart. start by being kind to the children in your classroom."

mrs. johnson started to feel a warmth in her heart. she smiled at the children, hugged them and played games with them. everyone was so happy.

pine chirped a thank you and flew off, back into the trees. the girl watched as the bird disappeared into the pine forest.

the little girl had a feeling that this wouldnâ€™t be the last time she saw the bird. and sure enough, the next day, pine came back and they shared a meal together. the little girl looked forward to the days she could go out and hold the bird in her hands.

one night, amy and her mom were having so much fun with their silly song that neither of them noticed that it was getting dark outside. just then, a big, crazy thunderbolt echoed outside. 

amy's mom looked out the window and saw that the night had suddenly become very stormy. she quickly ran to amy and said, â€œamy, itâ€™s getting late! we have to go to bed soon.â€ 

amy was a bit sad that the game was over but she obediently followed her mom to their bedrooms. as they both lay in their beds, the storm outside still made the night seem a little bit crazy. but at least they ended the night with a smile.
once upon a time, there was a square. it shone so brightly in the night sky that it brought joy to everyone nearby.

one day, a little girl named molly noticed the square and decided to go see it up close. she hopped up and down, excited to get to the square.

suddenly, a gust of wind blew through and the square moved away from her. molly was so sad that she started to cry.

her mommy came over, scooped molly up in her arms, and hugged her tight.

molly's mommy said, "don't worry, molly. i will help you find it."

molly and her mommy looked around until they found the square. molly was so grateful that she couldn't help but smile. she hugged her mommy so tight and said, "thank you, mommy!"

the square shone brightly in the night sky, and molly and her mommy were both so happy.

her mommy smiled. "what is it?" 
mary pointed to the big fire. "that! fire burn!" 

the fire did indeed burn. it crackled and filled the air with warmth. mary's mommy said, "let's go closer." she held mary's hand as they got closer.

mary stopped. "strip. hot!"

the fire was burning on a big strip of wood. sparks flew out of the raging fire. mary's mommy said, "look how generous the fire is, burning and giving us heat."

mary smiled. yes, the fire was generous. it made her feel warm and happy.

as they flew, the bird said to jonas, â€œyou can stay with me in this city if you permit!â€ jonas thought about it for a moment and then he said, â€œokay. i permit!â€

the bird brought jonas to her nest and nestled him up in a cozy wrap. jonas slept happily there for many days.

eventually, jonas decided it was time to go home and he thanked the bird for the cozy wrap. the bird said, â€œyouâ€™re welcome! come back anytime, chubby little frog!â€

and so, jonas hopped back home to the pond, where he was very happy to be with his friends again. and jonas never forgot the kindness of the big bird.

the puppy bounded over to the oven and started jumping around excitedly. he was fascinated by the sight of the oven and was determined to get inside it.

the puppy's mom noticed her little pup and smiled. "oh my, what are you up to little one?" she asked.

the puppy responded with a bark and kept jumping around the oven. 

the mom laughed and said, "oh, it looks like you really want to see what's inside the oven! well, don't worry, i'll have it open soon enough." 

the mom opened the oven and the puppy was so excited to see what was in there! he jumped around, sniffing and exploring. as the puppy scampered around, the mom could not help but smile at his adorable antics. 

the puppy explored the oven, making sure to use only his nose of course! he was so happy to have seen the inside of the oven and soon went back to playing with his family. 

the end.

once upon a time there was a young girl named elin. she was very curious, so one day she asked her mum a big question, "what is trade?"

her mum was surprised by the question, but she smiled and said, "if someone has something that someone else wants, they can trade it for something else". elin thought for a moment, then said, "then why do people not just give things away for free?". her mum smiled again, and said, "it's not always so simple. people need to get something back in return".

elin was happy with the answer and she began to think. she then asked, "what is it like if a person doesn't trade fairly, mum?". her mum paused, then said sadly, "well, then they would be ashamed." elin's face fell, and she said, "but why?". "well, it's not nice to use people", replied her mum softly.

elin thought hard, and then she said, "ok. i understand now. people should always be nice and trade fairly." her mum was so proud of her that she hugged elin tightly and said, "that's right! it's important to remember that".

the two of them hugged for a long time and were very happy together. elin had learned a valuable lesson that day, and she would never forget it.

"we did it!" paul shouted. the pigeon however, was long gone â€“ it had escaped!

sam was so excited. he had never seen an oyster before. he looked at it with amazement and wanted to see what was inside. so he slowly turned it over and opened it. inside was a beautiful pearl!

sam's eyes widened in surprise. he couldn't believe his luck. he ran home to show his mum the incredible pearl he had found in the oyster. when she saw the pearl, she gasped in amazement.

mum: "wow, sam, that's incredible! you found this in the sand?"

sam beamed with pride.

sam: "yes! i turned the oyster over and there it was!" 

mum smiled and gave sam a big hug. she was so proud of her little explorer. 

they both knew that this would be an amazing keepsake from this special day.
ralph was clumsy and he loved to rush around. he remembered when his dad told him that he should never rush, but he didn't listen.

one day, ralph rushed to his bedroom and pulled out a toy box. he opened it and saw a bell inside. ralph quickly picked up the bell and rang it.

his mom's voice came from downstairs, "ralph, it's time for dinner. don't rush too much!"

ralph quickly put the bell back in the toy box, closed it and ran downstairs. he quickly sat at the dinner table and smiled. he was ashamed that he was rushing again.

his dad saw him and said, "ralph, remember - it's ok to rush sometimes, but it's important to take your time too."

ralph nodded and said, "i'll try to remember, dad."

since then, ralph has learned to be less clumsy and to take time to enjoy the things he does.

but then something strange happened. just as lucy was about to reach for a marble, her mommy rushed into the room and said, "no, lucy. we can't take any more marbles. all those marbles need to stay in the bottle."

lucy was disappointed. she wanted those pretty marbles all for herself! she was so persistent in her mission, so her mommy warned her, "if you don't leave those marbles alone, something bad might happen."

lucy was scared but she did not want to settle this time. she was determined to get the marbles.

the next day, lucy began her mission once again. she tried and tried, but the marbles just wouldn't come out of the bottle. she was persistent in her efforts, but eventually the marbles stayed right where they were.

lucy was so frustrated that she had to settle for the scraps of marbles that were left in the bottle. but even though she did not get what she wanted, she learned a valuable lesson about being persistent. from then on, lucy tried her best to achieve her goals without being too stubborn.
once upon a time there was a bunny who lived in a green meadow. this bunny had big ears and a big nose. he loved to hop all around the meadow.

one day, he saw something shiny in the grass. when he went closer he saw that it was a comb made out of silver. the bunny was so excited that he wanted to take it with him so he hopped away with it in his mouth.

the bunny stopped to find a safe place to keep the comb. he hopped up the hill and he saw a big tree with a high branch. he figured this would be a perfect place for the comb.

when he tried to hop up the trunk to the high branch, he couldn't reach it. he thought and thought and decided to build a ladder out of logs. he stuck them in the ground and hopped up one by one. 

when he finally got to the top, he put the comb carefully on the branch. "there! this is a perfect place to keep the comb safe," said the bunny. 
and it was! whenever he wanted to comb his furry ears he could hop up to the high branch and get it down. the end.
a little girl was walking through the park, when she saw an egg on the ground. she wanted to pick it up. suddenly, she heard a voice.

"hey! don't break it!" said a friendly voice.

the little girl looked up, and saw an old man. he was smiling at her.

"what will happen if i break it?" the little girl asked.

"it won't be normal anymore," the old man said. "it will never start again. it's best to keep things normal."

the little girl thought about what the old man said, and decided to leave the egg alone. she was happy, because she knew that she had done the right thing.

the moral of this story is that it's important to keep things normal. sometimes, when things look broken, it's best just to leave them be.

they became great friends, and pete would often jog around the cactus and make funny faces at it. the cactus thought it was hilarious and they laughed together every day. it was so much fun that pete invited all the other animals to join in too. and so the desert came alive with laughter and the sound of animals jogging all around the cactus.

"hey, don't do that!" jane said, her fur standing on end.

tom felt sad and wanted to make things right. he walked up to jane and hugged her tight. then, he gently placed his paw on her chest and said, "i'm sorry, janey."

jane was surprised, but smiled at tom. "it's okay," she said, "i forgive you."

tom and jane hugged and went back to playing their game. from then on, they always remembered to be gentle with each other.

one day, a little girl called emily was walking in the woods. she was so excited when she spotted a peach on the careless tree. she stretched up and grabbed it.

"this peach looks so delicious!" emily said.

but when she went to take a bite, she tasted something sour.

"why does this peach taste bad?" emily asked.

the tree sighed. "i've become carelessly over-ripe," he explained.

emily smiled. she knew what had to be done.

"if i give you lots of love and water," she said, "you'll become strong and healthy again."

and sure enough, with emily's help, the careless peach tree became a beautiful, healthy tree, with lots of juicy peaches.

once upon a time there was a little boy called peter. peter was only three years old, and he liked to explore the world. 

one day, peter decided to go on an adventure. he took his teddy bear with him and began to look around. 

peter soon came across a large bone. it was quite a difficult bone, for it was buried deep in the ground. peter wanted to get it out, so he knelt down and began to dig with his tiny hands. 

just as he was about to reach the bone, he heard someone say: "why don't you let me help you?"

peter was surprised and looked up. he saw a friendly bird nearby. 

"can you really help me get the bone out?" peter asked. 

the bird replied: "of course i can! just kneel down and i'll do the rest!" 

so peter knelt down and the bird quickly dug out the bone with its beak. 

peter thanked the bird. he took the bone and went on his way. peter had a wonderful adventure that day!

 the daughter realised that she had been unkind and she felt sorry. she hugged her daddy and said, "i forgive you, daddy". but instead of forgiving her, the daddy said, "you should not be so unkind. you should always be nice and be kind to others." 

the moral of the story is that we should always remember to be kind and gentle to all, even when we are hurt. even when we make mistakes, we should forgive and always be kind.

once upon a time there was a girl named jill. jill lived in a big city, but everyone in her neighborhood was her friend. she was always so excited to arrive home each day and wave hello to her kind neighbor mrs. smith.

mrs. smith was so compassionate and she always showed it by baking jill delicious cookies. she never hesitated to lend a helping hand if jill needed it.

one day, jill couldn't reach the jam jar that was on top of the shelf. jill asked mrs. smith for help. mrs. smith said, â€no problem, my sweet. i'll be right over with my step ladder.â€ 

mrs. smith quickly arrived and handed the jar of jam to jill. jill thanked her and asked if they could bake a cake together.

mrs. smith happily accepted, and they each added their own special ingredient to make a one of a kind delicious cake. they shared a big slice of the cake, enjoying each other's company. 

jill loved that mrs. smith was so compassionate and she was happy to have such a lovely neighbor.
henry was very busy. he needed to manage his desk so he had enough room to work. every day he moved flowers, pens, pencils and paper around on his desk. he liked to keep things neat and tidy. one day, he even stuck a sticker on the front of his desk to remind him to be organised.

as henry got busier, he realised he had to manage his desk more carefully. he found a box and put all of his things inside it. then he put the box on a shelf where he could reach it easily.

at the end of the day, henry was happy with how he had managed his desk. he was so glad he had enough space for all his things. now he could be busy without feeling cluttered.
once upon a time, there was a brave little girl named gigi. she was very independent and liked to do things by herself. one day, gigi decided to play a guessing game with her neighbour. she asked him what a poison was. her neighbour said it was something bad that we should not drink or eat.

gigi thought about it for a little bit and then she started to guess. she said, "is a poison something that you can find in a garden?" her neighbour thought about this for a moment and then he said, "no, gigi. that's not a poison, that's just some dirt!".

gigi smiled and thanked her neighbour for playing the guessing game with her. she was proud of herself for being independent and trying to figure out the answer all by herself. she went home feeling very proud!
once there was a clever rabbit called judy. one day judy saw a big tree. she wanted to cut it down, so she could make a house. but she couldn't find a saw, so she looked around for something else to use.

suddenly, she saw a little frog called fred. judy had an idea. she asked fred if he could help her to cut down the tree. she smiled and said, â€œcan you make me a saw?â€

fred thought for a moment. then he said, â€œyes i can!â€. he clapped his hands and the biggest saw appeared. judy was very happy and clapped her hands too.

they cut down the tree and judy was able to make a nice house. judy was very thankful for fred's help and thanked him for being so clever.

the moral of this story is that if you are clever and think outside the box, you can achieve your goals.
once upon a time there was a little boy named john. john was only three years old and he loved playing with his toys. one sunny day he saw a dove flying above him. he decided to go after it.

john chased the dove for what seemed like an endless amount of time. john was getting tired but he was determined to catch the dove.

he demanded that the dove stop flying, but the dove didn't want to slow down. the dove flew around and around, avoiding john.

john kept trying, but the more he tried to catch the dove, the more tired he became. he was about to give up when he finally saw the dove land on a tree branch.

so john stayed patient, and waited until the dove flew away from the tree. when it was far enough away, he quickly ran towards it and managed to grab it.

john ran home, with the dove held tightly in his hands. he was so happy that he had caught his dove!
once upon a time, there was a little green frog that lived in the garden. every day, it would hop and sneak to find treats like flies and worms.

one day, the frog found a pepper! it was pink, round and looked so yummy. the frog carefully took it in its tiny little hands and started to eat it.

suddenly, it felt a burning sensation and started to jump around. it wanted to escape the pepper!

the frog jumped and hopped back to the garden and shouted, "help me! help me!"

luckily, a little bird was nearby and heard the frog's cries. it pecked the pepper out of the frog's hands and said, "there, you don't have to eat it anymore!"

the frog was happy and thanked the little bird. from that day on, the frog learned to be more careful when it comes to food!
once upon a time, there was a grumpy elephant. he never liked to join in with the other animals and their fun.

one day, the animals were playing on the big slide. it was huge and very fun. but when the elephant tried to slide down, he got stuck half way!

the animals felt sorry for the elephant and all tried to help him. but no matter what they did it just didn't seem to work.

in the end, the tiny mouse came to help. he had a great idea - he climbed up on the elephant's back, and chattered in his little mouse voice "jump high, elephant! you can save yourself". 

and that's what the elephant did! he jumped up high and managed to slide down to the bottom. 

the moral of the story is that even the smallest of creatures can help in a big way. even when it seems impossible, look around and you might find someone ready to lend a hand.
once upon a time, there was a little boy who lived in a village. he was very confused one day when he saw many people running around. suddenly, he heard a loud sound, and he knew something was happening. he asked his father, "what's wrong?" 

his father replied, "we must release the animals!" 

the little boy was even more confused now, so his father explained. "the village has been surrounded by wild animals. we must let them out so they don't attack us or hurt anyone in the village. so, the villagers have to release them from their cages." 

the little boy nodded his head in understanding. he was no longer confused, and he helped the people release the animals. after the animals had been released, the village was safe again.
one day, joe and his mom went to the store. joe could hardly contain his excitement. "why are we here, mom?" he asked.

his mom smiled and said, "we need some oats, so let's unpack them." joe didn't know what oats were. but he quickly found out as mom took out a big bag of oat cereal. it was so rich and creamy; he knew it was going to be delicious.

joe cheered and clapped. he couldn't wait to have it for breakfast. mom laughed at joe's enthusiasm and said, "i'm glad you like it, joe. we can start eating it in the morning." 

joe smiled and hugged his mom. he was so happy that they had found such a rich and tasty oat cereal to enjoy.
once there was a little boy called gary. he was only three years old, but he knew one thing for sure - sausages were his favourite thing in the whole world!

one day, gary asked his mum if he could get some sausages for his dinner. his mum said yes, so gary went off to the shop. he saw some lovely sausages on the shelf, so he smiled and asked the shopkeeper if he could get some. the shopkeeper gave gary some sausages for his dinner.

gary was so happy! but when he got home, he was sad to see that his little brother did not have any sausages. he asked mum why, and his mum said that it was because they did not have enough money to get two sausages.

gary knew he had to do something, so he decided to share his sausages with his brother. he cut them in half, and shared them with his brother.

gary's act of kindness made his mum proud. she told gary that it was lovely to be so generous, and gary felt proud of himself too. he had learned a valuable lesson that day - that sharing is caring, and that true love and kindness can conquer anything!
sally was 3-years-old and loved to make things. one day she was having fun in her room when she got a wonderful idea. she decided to make an object out of paper and glue.

she was feeling so proud of herself that she wanted to mail it to her grandparents. she put it in an envelope, addressed it to grandma and grandpa, and put it in the mailbox. she was very excited to show them her creation.

the week after she mailed it, sally was excited for her grandparents to write back to her. but when the letter came, it was smelly. grandma had opened the envelope and found the object inside was dripping wet and growing mold. 

sally was so upset that she started to cry. despite her best intentions, the object was ruined and it couldn't be mailed. grandma had to tell sally to try again the next time.
once upon a time, there was a little girl named amy. she was three years old and wanted to be a doctor.

one day, amy asked her mom to take her to the doctors office. her mom said yes, and off they went. 

at the office, amy watched as the doctor carefully measured the patient. she asked the doctor lots of questions.

"what are you doing?" amy asked.

the doctor smiled and said, "i'm measuring the patient to make sure they are healthy."

amy thought this was so cool! she wanted to measure too, so the doctor gave her an easy job. she started measuring the patient's temperature and counted their heartbeats.

after a few minutes, amy had finished her job and had measured perfectly. the doctor and patient thanked amy, and she smiled happily.

amy couldn't wait to go back and measure more patients!
once there was a little boy named bob. he was an energetic three year old and he loved playing outside. one day, bob went outside to play in the wind. but when he got there, he felt something terrible was happening. he saw there was trash everywhere! 

bob started to feel very sad and he said to himself, "i want to clean this up." he put on his gloves and started to pick up the trash. 

then, a big gust of wind came through and all the trash went flying back into the air! bob started to get frustrated and he yelled, "why does this keep happening?!" 

just then, bob's mom came outside and saw what was happening. she smiled and said, "come on bob, let's both clean up together and next time use some rocks to hold the trash in place." 

bob was excited for the challenge and together he and his mom began to clean up the area. slowly but surely, bob's playground went back to being the happy place it had been before.
it was a lovely summer morning, and two children were out in the forest. they were looking for animals and feeling the breeze on their faces.

suddenly, they spotted a deer sleeping in the shade of a tree. "look!" said the first child, "let's not wake the deer. let's just watch."

the children sat down and looked at the deer for a long time. "isn't it lovely?" said the second child.

the deer slept peacefully. just when the children were about to move on, the deer opened its beautiful eyes and looked at them. "don't be scared," said the first child, "you can rest here".

the deer looked at them with its big eyes, then nodded a silent thanks. and so the children stayed with the lovely deer and watched it rest in the morning sunshine.
once upon a time, there were two friends who loved to play tag. one day, they were running in a big field when they noticed something shiny in the corner. it was a shiny trophy! they both ran over to it, excited to see what it was, and then both wanted to pick it up. 

friend 1 said, "this trophy is mine! i saw it first!"
friend 2 said, "no, it's mine. i got here first."

the two of them started to argue, and their voices got louder and louder. suddenly, the ground started to twist and shake, which scared them. they quickly looked around and noticed a grown-up watching them from nearby.

the grown-up said, "you are both very polite for caring about the trophy, but fighting isn't the right way to solve a problem." the two friends looked embarrassed and nodded, so the grown-up said, "why don't you take turns using the trophy? that way, you can both enjoy it."

the two friends were amazed at the grown-up's idea, and they thanked him by smiling and nodding. the grown-up left, and after that the two friends used the trophy to play tag. every time they used the trophy, they were careful to share it politely.

this story teaches us that it's important to stay polite when figuring out how to share something. not arguing and keeping an open
once upon a time, there was a beetle who lived in a forest. he was a brave and adventurous beetle. one day, he wanted to explore a different part of the forest. as he walked, he heard a noise coming from a bush. he looked in and saw a small mouse. the mouse was scared, so the beetle asked what was wrong. 

the mouse replied, "i am scared of the darkness. i am afraid to go home". the beetle thought for a moment then said, "it is okay to be afraid. but sometimes you have to be brave, especially when things seem scary." 

the beetle looked around, then he noticed something. a few light beams were coming into the bush! he told the mouse, "see the lights? the darkness is not so scary if you can see the light." the mouse looked up, and he smiled. 

the beetle said goodbye and went on his way. as he walked, he smiled too. he knew that he had taught the mouse an important lesson - even in the darkness, you can find something to be brave about.
once upon a time, there was a little girl called molly. she was brave and ready to try new things. one day, she saw a woman in a beautiful garden filled with flowers and buzzing insects. she wanted to go and talk to her but she didn't know what to say.

molly took a deep breath and asked the woman: "what is wisdom?" the woman smiled and said: "wisdom is inside you, molly. it will help guide you in life!"

molly was unsure but she was ready to find out more. she asked the woman again: "how do i get wisdom?" the woman said: "the only way to get wisdom is to tear away the things that make it difficult to find it."

molly thought for a moment and then she understood. she said: "thank you for your wise words!" the woman smiled and nodded.

molly left the garden with a sense of new understanding. she was ready to start tearing away what was getting in the way of her wisdom. she was ready to start her new journey.

the little girl said, â€œi can do it mum! i have seen you do it before. please let me try!â€ her mum replied, â€œalright, but be careful.â€

the little girl was very careful and followed every step that her mum showed her. eventually, she was able to repair the knob. the little girl was very proud of herself and her mum was proud too.

the moral of this story is to never give up on trying something new. it may seem hard but with courage, persistence and help from a special someone, you can achieve great things.
one winter day, jack and his mom were going to celebrate his third birthday. he was so excited he put on his mittens and went outside to play in the snow. 
jack found a friend there and they started playing together. his mom was watching from afar, feeling happy and generous. suddenly, the friend stumbled and the mitten slipped off jack's hand. 
jack said to his mom: "mommy, my mitten is gone!" she quickly replied: "it's okay. let's find it!" he looked everywhere but couldn't find it anywhere. 
his mom then said: "i'm sorry, jack. we'll have to say goodbye to your mitten. let's be generous and give a sincere wish for whoever finds it." 
jack was sad, but they both celebrated his birthday, even though he had no mitten. jack learned the importance of being generous and wishing the best to the ones you hold dear.

tom asked his mum and dad if he could play right away. they said yes, so tom went to the computer and switched it on. suddenly, a big screen came up with lots of lights and colours. tom was so excited, he started to yell in delight. 

tom started to move the mouse around and click on things. the screen changed every time he clicked. he was playing a game where he had to find the right colours to solve puzzles. 

suddenly, something went wrong. tom was so scared that he stopped yelling and became very quiet. he didn't know what to do. 

his mum saw what had happened and quickly came to help him. she showed him where he had gone wrong and helped him fix the game. tom then started to yell once again and was very happy when his game was working again.
once there was a little boy. his name was jack. one day, jack had an idea. he wanted to make a joke and go to his neighbor's garden.

so jack went to his neighbor's garden. but it was dead. there were no flowers and plants. jack felt sad. he asked his neighbor why the garden was so dead.

the neighbor said, "i never take care of the garden. i don't have time."

jack smiled. he said, "that's a good joke! let's do something together. i will help you take care of your garden."

so jack and his neighbor worked together and soon, the garden was beautiful and alive again.

jack and his neighbor were so happy to see the garden look like new. they both smiled and agreed that it was the best joke ever!

mum and dad were packing for a trip.

mum said to dad, "let's get the egg in the suitcase."

dad agreed and took an egg out of the fridge. the egg was big and round.

mum said, "it's so big. i have a sweet idea. we could share the egg on the plane!"

dad smiled and put the egg in the suitcase.

mum said, "let's pack the presents too!"

they packed the presents quickly and soon they were ready.

mum said, "let's eat the egg now. it's so sweet!"

dad agreed, and they ate the egg together.

mum and dad smiled, excited for their trip.
jimmy was walking his puppy in the park. his puppy was very excited and wanted to explore the park. as jimmy and his puppy walked in the park, jimmy saw a bush that was very tall. he and his puppy stopped to take a look.

suddenly, a man and his dog came and stood next to them. jimmy noticed that the man's dog was not wearing a leash. the man then said in a gentle voice, â€œit is important to share the park with everyone, this means that all dogs must have a leash.â€

jimmy didn't think it was fair that the other dog didn't have a leash, but he was too scared to say anything. however, he made sure to attach his dog's leash so that it was secure. 

the man and his dog then walked away. when they were out of sight, jimmy's puppy tugged at the leash and started exploring the park. jimmy decided to take off the leash because his puppy wanted to explore the park.

the man and his dog then returned and noticed that jimmy's puppy had no leash. the man looked at jimmy in a stern voice and said, â€œyou were being selfish not to share the park with everyone. you must put the leash back on your puppy.â€

jimmy knew that he had made a mistake by taking off the leash. he put the leash back on his puppy and realized that he should always be considerate and share
once upon a time, there was a barber who had never met anyone like him before. he was different in a very special way. every day he used to strike his clippers and comb his hair. 

one day, he heard a little knock at his door. he opened the door and a little girl with big brown eyes was standing there. she said, "i need a haircut, can i come in please?"

the barber smiled and said, "of course!" he motioned for her to come in and take a seat. he then began to strike his clippers and comb her hair. he was careful to not make it too short. 

when he was done, the little girl said, "thank you! it looks so different!" the barber smiled and said, "you're welcome! come back anytime!"  


the little girl left with a new haircut and the barber felt happy. he liked giving people haircuts and making them look different. he thought it was the best job ever.
once there was a boy. he didn't know what a pit was, but he soon found out. one day, he and his mom were in the park. he saw a big, round, empty pit. it was very strange and he was curious. he asked his mom, "what is that?" she said, "that's a pit, my love. it's so deep and empty." 

the boy was amazed. he wanted to explore it, so he asked his mom if he could. she said yes. he walked to the edge of the pit and stared into it. he felt so small. he put his hands on the edge and looked down. it was so deep, but he wasn't scared. 

the boy knew he wanted to climb down. he asked his mom if he could and she said yes. he was so excited. he grabbed a big stick and started to carefully climb down. he looked around as he went. he could see all the way to the bottom and there were lots of interesting rocks and pebbles. 

reaching the bottom, the boy felt so proud. he knew he had achieved something great. he showed his mom what he had discovered and she was so proud of him too. together, they climbed back out of the pit. it was an adventure the boy would never forget.
