one day when she was out walking, she saw something sparkly and colourful. it was a spirit! it was dancing and singing, like nothing she had ever seen before.

the spirit asked the girl what she wanted most of all, and the girl replied that she wanted to explore the world. the spirit said it would grant her wish and then it melted away.

the girl found a magical wand and she used it to explore every corner of the world. everywhere she went, she felt the spirit's presence, like it was guiding her.

one day, she felt the spirit's presence more than ever before. suddenly, out of nowhere, the spirit appeared in front of her and said: "you have explored the world with my help - now it's time for you to go back home!" 

the girl was sad that she had to leave, but she thanked the spirit for his mysterious help. with a sparkle and a twinkle, the spirit melted away.
one day, little jack went to the market. as he walked along, he noticed something in the corner. it was very peculiar and it seemed to sparkle.

he decided to examine it more closely. as he examined it, jack could see it was something special and quite original.

as he picked it up, jack heard a voice.

"don't touch that," said the old man nearby.

jack obeyed and put the object back down. he was very curious and eager to know what it was, but he decided to listen to the old man. 

the old man then told jack that one day he'd know what the sparkling object was. 

the next week, jack and his family went to the same market. jack walked over to the corner, and found a golden crown sparkling in the corner. he immediately remembered the old man's words and realised this was the object he was examining.

jack was delighted and surprised that the old man had foreshadowed the discovery of the golden crown. he wore it proudly, feeling like a true king, and presented the original object to his family.

once upon a time, there was a squirrel living in the forest. every day, the squirrel would go out and look for food.

one day, the squirrel saw something glimmering amongst the trees. when he got closer, he realised it was a recorder. he picked it up and played with it, trying to record different sounds like the birds singing or the wind blowing in the trees.

the next day, the squirrel heard the little boy who lived in the nearby village calling out his name. he quickly ran away and hid in a tree, feeling guilty but not sure why.

the little boy saw the squirrel and started to follow him. when the boy realised the squirrel was carrying something in his hands, he shouted: "hey squirrel! give that recorder back!"

the squirrel stopped and looked at the little boy guiltily. he didn't want to give it back, but he knew he had to. he carefully placed it in the boy's hands and the boy smiled.

"thank you, squirrel!" the little boy said. "i'm glad you were honest and gave it back." 

the squirrel nodded and ran away happily, knowing that he had done the right thing.
once upon a time, there was a young girl named bella. she loved playing outside. one day, she went to the park with her mom. as she played on the swings, she saw an apple on the ground. she ran over and picked it up. 

when bella bit into the apple, she tasted something funny. it tasted fake! she looked up and saw a funny man with a red beard, he was holding a box of fake apples! 

the man started to yell, "they're all fake, they're not real! get out of here!"

bella was scared and ran back to her mom. she told her mom all about the fake apples.

bella and her mom started laughing. they left the park feeling happy. 

thanks to the funny man, bella had a great day at the park.
once there was a little girl named lucy. she was three years old and loved to explore the world around her. one day, she was out looking for an adventure. suddenly, she heard a loud, noisy noise coming from the top of a hill. she hopped up the hill and saw a bird with a long neck. the bird kept sorting through the leaves on the ground. 

"what are you looking for, mr. bird?" asked lucy excitedly. 

the bird turned around and said "i'm looking for a spider to eat. have you seen one?" 

lucy thought for a minute and said, "i haven't seen any spiders, but i could help you sort through the leaves to find one!" 

the bird smiled, and said, "that would be great!" 

so, lucy and the bird worked together and sorted through the leaves. soon enough, they spotted a small, black spider. the bird picked it up and thanked lucy. 

"thank you for helping me find my lunch, lucy!" said the bird.

lucys smiled and said, "you're welcome! it was fun helping you sort!"

finally, dad said, "okay, if you take care of the bucket, you can bring it home." sophia was so happy she jumped up and down. she hugged the bucket tightly and never let go of it until she was back home.

when david got to the top, he said "today i will create something beautiful!" 

he stretched out the kite, laughing as it caught the breeze. he held the string between his hands and watched the kite fly.

"look at me, i am creating a work of art so high in the sky!" david shouted. he watched the kite twist and turn and dip in the air. 

finally david's mother shouted for him to come back down. with a heavy heart, he let go of the string and the kite soon disappeared. he had created something magical.

john drove his truck to the store. he was tired and he wanted to go home. john parked his truck and took the box of pants in to the store. the store manager thanked john for bringing the pants and gave him a big smile.

john thanked the manager, put the box of pants in the store and then went home. he was happy to have delivered the pants and to be home. john took a long nap and felt much better after that.
once upon a time there was a man who was very brave and powerful. one day he was walking through the forest and he heard a voice coming from above. the voice said: "i have a special task for you - can you deliver something to me?"

the man said yes, he could do it. then the voice said: "i will give you a magical spirit - it is very powerful and it will help you on your journey. you must deliver this spirit to me. can you do it?"

the man thought it would be a brave thing to do, but he wasn't sure he could do it. finally he said yes, he would try his best.

the man set off on his journey and he faced many dangers along the way. but he was brave and he never gave up. eventually he reached the end of his journey and he faced the greatest challenge of all - a giant monster.

the man had to fight the monster and there was a long and difficult battle. but the man was powerful and fierce and he eventually defeated the monster. he grabbed the spirit and delivered it to the voice from above.

the voice was pleased and thanked the man for his bravery. and the man was glad that he had done something so brave and he knew he had been very powerful.

once upon a time there was an old wise tree. every morning he would sit in his favourite spot, watching the birds fly and the animals playing in the fields.

one day, a little girl called sarah came up to the tree. she looked sad and didn't know what to do. she turned to the tree and said,

"i'm feeling so low, tree. can you help me feel better?"

the tree smiled and said kindly,

"yes, my dear. i can help. all you need to do is promise to look after the animals and birds around you every day. it will make them very happy and make you happy too."

sarah smiled and said,

"i promise, tree. i'll take care of them every day."

the tree smiled again and said, 
"as a reward for your promise, here's a lovely piece of chocolate for you. enjoy it!"

sarah thanked the tree and happily ate the chocolate. she still kept her promise and looked after the animals and birds every day.

moral of the story:
when you keep your promise, it makes you and those around you happy.
jenna was riding her bike around the playground. she saw a big, tall structure in the middle of the field and wanted to try it. she rode her bike up to it and saw that it was an old football goal. she asked her dad if she could try it. her dad looked around and said, "yes, we can give it a go".

jenna was excited and quickly got off her bike and started running towards the structure. she saw there were two posts and a net. jenna quickly got to the back of the structure and started kicking the ball.

the ball was hard and bitter and she knew at once it must have been cold and wet in the night. she kept kicking and soon enough the ball was flying between the posts and into the net. jenna grinned, the feeling was amazing! she continued for a few more minutes before she got tired. she was still smiling when she said goodbye to the structure and walked back towards her dad.
once upon a time, there was a boy called jack. he was always very creative and loved trying to find new ways of doing things. 

one day, jack wanted to get a fancy new name. he was tired of the same old name, jack. he wanted something a bit more creative!

so jack asked his mum, "mum, can i get a new name?" his mum said kindly, "hmmm... i don't know, jack. what kind of name do you want?" 

jack thought long and hard, and then replied,  "i want something special, something creative!"

his mum said, "well okay, why don't we try out some new names and see what fits?" she thought and then said, "how about 'james'?" 

jack liked it. he grinned and said, "james! that's a perfect name for me. can i get it please, mum?" 

his mum nodded and smiled. she said, "of course you can, jack. from now on, you shall be known as james!" 

and so, jack became james! he was so happy with his new, creative name.
timmy was playing in the park one day when he saw a modern toilet. his eyes lit up with excitement and he ran towards it. but when he went to open the door he found it was locked. timmy started to cry. then he heard a voice from inside the toilet. it was an old grumpy man. 

the man said, "what are you doing here? i'm trying to get some peace and quiet and you're making a racket. go away and play elsewhere."

timmy looked up at the man with sad eyes and said, "please, can i just have a look? it looks so modern and exciting."

the old grumpy man sighed and said, "all right. come in but just have a quick look."

timmy looked around the toilet in awe and he was very excited to have seen such a modern place. then he went to the park to play some more with a smile on his face.
once upon a time, there was a girl named julia. she was always excited to play outside with her friends. one day when she went out to play, she saw a large pond. julia was fascinated by the water and asked her friend, "what is that?" her friend said, "it's a pond! you can dive into it!" julia was so excited she just had to try. she asked her friend if they could do it together and soon they were running and diving into the pond!

the water felt nice and cool, and julia laughed and played with her friend all afternoon. when the sun began to set, julia got out of the water feeling quite tired. as she looked out at the pond, she saw a beautiful rainbow and smiled.

julia was happy to have made a new friend that day. from then on, when the sun was setting, she would dive into the pond to see the rainbow. every time, she felt more and more tired, but she still had fun every time.

one day, a little girl named coco was outside playing in the rain. she was so excited that she decided to march in circles around the big pond next to her house. she jumped in puddles and splashed her body as she marched. 

as she marched, a big duck waddled towards her. coco stopped in her tracks and smiled. "hello there!" she said to the duck. the duck quacked loudly back and responded, "happy marching!"

coco laughed and continued to march around the pond. she was having so much fun that she didn't realize just how wet she was getting. after a while, she stopped and looked down at her body. it was drenched! 

she made her way back home and changed her clothes. after a tasty lunch, coco was warm and cozy, and very happy she had taken the time to march in the rain.
once upon a time there was a girl called jill. she was very helpful and often helped her mom with doing the washing and cooking. one day, when jill was helping her mom she noticed something very shiny on the kitchen table. it was a knife! she was very interested in the shiny object so she picked it up and showed her mom. 

"jill, be careful with that. that is a knife and it can be dangerous," her mom said. 

"ok mommy, i won't touch it," said jill. 

jill's mom was very relieved and thanked jill for being so helpful.

the next day, jill was in the kitchen and she noticed the same shiny object. she quickly realized that it was the same knife from the day before. but this time she didn't need to ask her mom what it was. she had recognized it and knew it was a knife. from that day on, she was always careful when she saw the shiny knife.  she had learned to recognize the knife and to respect it. 

the end.
once upon a time, there lived a small shrimp in a big pond. he liked to swim around and explore the pond. one day, he heard a whisper coming from the far corner of the pond. the shrimp swam over to see what the whisper was about. there, he found a butterfly sitting in the grass.

the shrimp asked the butterfly why he was whispering. the butterfly said he was just quietly thinking and he wanted to keep his thoughts a secret. the shrimp thought that was a very good idea, so he decided to be quiet and listen to the butterfly. 

after a while, the butterfly said, "do you like shrimp? i love it! it's so good and tasty." the shrimp was very happy when he heard the butterfly say that. he said to the butterfly, "yes, i love shrimp too. it's the best thing to eat in the pond." the butterfly laughed and nodded.

the shrimp and the butterfly talked for a long time about all the yummy things that can be found in the pond. they became friends and laughed and talked until it was dark. the shrimp said goodbye to his new friend and swam back home to his pond. and that's the story of the shrimp and the butterfly that whispered in the pond.

one day, the family's tractor broke down. the tractor was not moving and it was very sad. the family didn't know what to do. 

then the family had an idea. they decided to ask their neighbor to help them repair the tractor. 

the neighbor worked hard. he fixed the broken pieces and the family's tractor was repaired. it was a cold day, but the family was happy. 

now the family could use their tractor again. they could drive to the wheat fields and reap the wheat. it was a very happy day!

the girl agreed and said, "yes, let's skip up and down the slide, it's more fun!"

so the bald player and the girl skipped up and down the slide together. they laughed and smiled and had so much fun.

at the end, the bald player thanked the little girl for joining him, gave her a high five, and told her to have a great day. the little girl said goodbye and went on her way.

she ran to her mother and said, "mommy, my cushion is wet." her mother hugged daisy and said, "it's ok sweetheart, don't worry. we can fix this."

daisy's mum brought her a big bowl of warm water and put some sunshine in the bowl. she said, "put your cushion in the bowl. the sunshine and warm water will make the cushion dry again."

daisy watched as the sunshine and warm water melted away the wetness of her cushion. soon her cushion was dry once again. daisy was so grateful and hugged her cushion. she smiled and said, "thank you mummy!"

the little girl picked up the card and carried it to show her mom. "look mommy!" she said as she showed off the card.

"oh, what an old and dry card," her mom said. she told her that the card must have been left behind by someone a very long time ago. the little girl thought it was so exciting to think that someone else had been there before her! she carried the dry card back to the tree, tapping the trunk and leaving it at the base.

the little girl couldn't wait to come back to the tree the next day to find out what else she would discover!

then, jimmy tried to go even faster. he pushed so hard and zoomed even faster! suddenly, he felt a sharp pain in his leg. he had gone too fast and hurt himself.

"ouch!" jimmy yelled.

his mom ran to him. she saw he was in pain. "what happened?" she asked.

jimmy said, "i was going too fast and i hurt my leg."

she took him to the hospital. the doctor said his leg was very hard.

jimmy was sad. the doctors said his leg would take a long time to heal. he would not be able to go on the big hill ever again.
once upon a time, there was a little boy who loved to explore. one day, he was walking in a meadow and noticed a cow. he moved slowly towards the cow and blinked at it. the cow blinked back and the boy smiled. 

the cow mooed and said, "do you like beef?" the little boy blinked again, looking alert. 

the cow continued, "if you like, i can show you where to find some delicious beef. follow me!" the little boy jumped with excitement and followed the cow.

the cow took the boy to a field filled with flowers and clover. the little boy smiled and blinked in awe. the cow said, "look closely - the beef is hidden here, in the clover." 

the little boy blinked with excitement and searched until he found some beef. he thanked the cow for showing him where to find it and went off happily, carrying his beef home.

mommy: "take it off the rack, tommy. let me see if it fits."
mommy tried to fit the blouse onto tommy. it was too big!

tommy: "mommmyyyy, pleeease!"

mommy sighed and said: "no, tommy. we need to find one that fits better."

but tommy was sad. he wanted the pretty pink blouse.

mommy: "let's try another store, tommy. we can find one that fits you."

they searched and searched, until finally, they found one! it was the same pretty pink blouse, but it fit tommy perfectly!

they reached the wheat field. the wheat waved in the wind, making a gentle rustling sound. suzie smiled and said, "mommy, let's play in the wheat!".

so mommy and suzie ran around and enjoyed the wheat. they laughed and hugged each other. the wheat felt soft against their skin and smelled sweet in the air. 

but then the wind shifted. suddenly, a harsh gust blew across the wheat field. the wheat began to whip around suzie and her mom.

"it's too harsh!" yelled mommy. she grabbed suzie's hand and they ran out of the wheat field until the wind calmed down. 

back at home, the two were safe and sound. suzie hugged her mommy and said she loved her. although they had a harsh experience at the wheat field, they both enjoyed the adventure.

once there was a little bird called sammy. sammy loved to drink water from a nearby pond. one day, an older bird noticed sammy's thirst. he told sammy the water in the pond was dangerous. the older bird warned sammy that the water was full of crazy creatures that would eat little birds. sammy didn't believe him, but the older bird said, "trust me, sammy. i know what i'm talking about."

sammy continued to drink from the pond every day. then one day, sammy was drinking when he noticed something strange swimming in the water. it was a large, crazy creature! it had big wings! sammy wanted to fly away, but it was too late. the creature's wings wrapped around him and he was never seen again.

this story teaches us that it's important to listen to the advice of our elders. if sammy had just listened to the advice of the older bird, he wouldn't have been in this terrible situation. unfortunately, he was too stubborn to listen and it cost him his life.

one day, emma was swinging with her brother, when she noticed that her brother was looking a bit weak. she asked him what was wrong, "what's the matter?"

her brother replied, "my throat feels a bit sore, so my mom brought out the thermometer to take my temperature."
 
so, emma and her brother stayed very still as the thermometer was put in his mouth to take his temperature. unfortunately, the thermometer showed that his temperature was very high.

emma was really worried, she felt her brother needed to rest. but her brother wanted to keep playing and swinging. emma tried to convince him to sleep instead, but it was too difficult.

finally, emma had an idea - she suggested if they swing together, they could swing slowly like they were taking a nap. her brother was really happy with the idea, and they spent the rest of the day swinging gently together in the backyard.

once upon a time there was a smart little girl called milly who loved to find solutions to problems. one day she saw a big leak coming from the roof. water was dripping on the floor. milly wanted to help, so she got her bucket and brought it under the leak in the roof. the bucket began to fill up with the water that was dropping.

milly thought and thought until she had an idea. she went and found a piece of plastic and put it over the leak. now the drop stopped. milly was very proud of her smart idea and the grown-ups praised her.

"well done, milly! thanks for finding a solution to the leak," said mummy with a smile.

"you've been very clever," said daddy, giving milly a hug.

milly was so happy to be able to help. she had used her smarts to solve the problem and everyone was impressed. and from that day on she never stopped trying to find solutions to problems.
once upon a time there was a little girl called emma. she was very excited because it was the fourth of july and that meant it was time to go out and see the fireworks. her mommy and daddy took her to the park early in the evening. they all enjoyed watching the beautiful, colorful firework displays spark in the sky.

suddenly, emma started to feel a bit weird. her mommy asked her if she was ok, but emma just shrugged her shoulders, feeling quite confused.

"oh, i know what it is," said mommy. "let's have a joke and you'll feel better."

emma smiled and dad told her his best joke. emma laughed and felt happy again. just then the fireworks started again and emma laughed and clapped her hands in joy.

the next day, emma was still talking about the firework show. she asked to hear the joke again and laughed like it was the first time she had heard it. emma was happy and confused all at the same time.
once upon a time, there was a boy called tim. he was only three years old, but he really loved to read. one day, tim wanted to read his books outside the house.

his mom asked, "tim, what do you need to take outside with you?"
tim said, "my leash!"

so his mom put on tim's leash and he went outside. it was sunny, and tim sat down to read.

he opened his book, but it was difficult. the words were too small, and tim couldn't understand them.

suddenly, tim's mom came out of the house. she said, "tim, why don't you find a bigger book? that one looks too difficult."

tim put his book away and started looking for a bigger one. soon enough, he found one with bigger print. he started to read it and he understood every word.

tim read for a long time. then he took off his leash and ran inside for lunch.
one morning, jack was walking in the park. he was feeling very happy and was singing as he walked. suddenly, he heard a noise.

jack stopped and looked around. he could see a man in a big booth. he was very busy. jack took a few steps closer and saw the man was trading things. he saw a toy car, a small ball and a friendly stuffed animal. 

jack was so intrigued he wanted to know more. he moved closer and asked the man, "what are you doing?"

the man replied, " hi there! i am trading things, do you want to have a look?"

jack nodded eagerly and started to look at the things the man was trading. the man smiled and said, "take your time, have a look around".

jack was very excited. he chose the toy car and the man swapped it for the small ball. jack said thank you, then ran away with his new toy. 

every time jack visited the park, he would stop by the man's booth and see if he could trade something for a new toy. jack and the man became good friends. they loved trading things and jack had lots of fun.
one day there was a young girl named sarah. she was walking through the park with her mum when she saw something that made her stop in her tracks. in the distance, there was a big tree with lots of bright red cherries on it. she pulled on her mothers hand and pointed at the tree, saying that she wanted to get one. 

her mother smiled and told her she could, but that they would need to go home first to get a basket. after picking up the basket from their house, they walked back to the park. 

sarah was very happy. she raced to the tree and stretched her hands up to pick the closest one she could reach. but when she pulled her hand back the cherry was gone, leaving a branch full of empty stems where it had been. 

sarah was sad. she looked at her mum and asked what had happened. her mum simply smiled, reached into her pocket, and pulled out the same bright red cherry that sarah had pointed at earlier.

sarah was amazed. she asked how her mum had known where to find the cherry, but her mum just kept smiling. if sarah had only realised earlier, she could have had the cherry much sooner!

the pale girl was sad. she wanted to be with her friends, but it was too dangerous. the bad thing had happened and everyone had to go home.

may put on a shirt and a skirt, but she felt very uncomfortable. she asked her mom "why do i feel so uncomfortable in these clothes?". her mom said "maybe the clothes are too big for you". may thought about it for a moment and replied "maybe, can i try something else?". her mom smiled and said "of course, you can try something else".

once upon a time there was a chubby olive. it was a very special olive. one day it started to move and it began to appear all over the place. 

first it appeared in a kitchen. there it met a big pot that was bubbling away with soup. it hopped in but suddenly it was too hot and the chubby olive quickly hopped back out. 

then the chubby olive appeared in a garden. there it met a little dog who was chasing its tail round in circles. the chubby olive giggled then waved goodbye to the little dog. 

finally the chubby olive appeared in a park where a group of little children were playing. they saw the olive and started to chase it around. the chubby olive ran round and round and round until it was too tired and it flopped onto the ground. the children laughed and the chubby olive laughed too. 

and that's how the chubby olive's day ended, with happy memories and a big smile.
once there was a boy named jim. he was only 3 years old and he loved to eat yogurt. he always asked his mom to give him some yogurt to eat. today, however, his mom did not give him any. "why won't you give me any yogurt?" he asked his mom.

his mom said, "i'm sorry, jim. i don't have any yogurt right now. it's all gone." jim was so sad. he did not understand why there was no yogurt anymore.

suddenly, he smelled something terrible. he ran to the kitchen to look and he saw that the yogurt was all spilled on the floor. it had gone bad and was now stinky. jim was very sad and angry. 

"who spilled the yogurt?" he yelled. his mom shook her head and said, "i'm sorry, jim. i guess it was just a terrible accident." 


jim was still very sad, but at least he knew what happened. his mom gave him a big hug and said, "don't worry, jim. you can come with me to the store and we can buy some more yogurt." that made jim happy again and he smiled.

moments before his mother arrived, he quickly tried to put all the pieces together, but it was too late. his mother saw all the pieces littered around the room and was not happy.

"you must put all of your pieces away in the tray when you are finished, ' she said' sternly.

the young boy nodded, scared of his mother's harsh voice. he knew he had to put all the pieces away in the tray before he could play with his toys again. he carefully matched the pieces one by one, remembering the warning of his mother.

"no, i want candy!" he shouted.

mommy frowned. "no, little brother, candy isn't healthy. we need to pick some vegetables. then we can make a delicious dinner." 

little brother was still angry and didn't want to listen. he stomped his feet and shouted, "no! i want candy!" 

mommy was sad and took little brother's hand. she said, "i'm sorry you're mad, but you have to understand. vegetables are healthy and we need them to stay strong. eating candy all the time is not very wise."

little brother was still mad, but he knew mommy was right. in the end, they picked out some vegetables and made a delicious dinner. everyone was happy, and little brother learned that vegetables are important for a healthy body.
once upon a time, there was a man called george who owned an axe. george loved using his axe to chop wood and make fires.

one day, george was walking in the forest when he noticed it had become very cold. he decided to build a fire, so he took out his axe and chopped some wood.

as george was chopping the wood, he heard a voice laughing. he stopped and looked around but couldn't see anyone. he was confused and said "who's there?".

suddenly, a small creature appear from a bush. it was a mischievous elf. george asked the elf why he was laughing and the elf said "i was laughing at you trying to build a fire, it's much too cold for that!"

george listened to the elf and decided not to build a fire. he understood that it was much too cold outside, and that making a fire would be a waste of time. 

george thanked the creature for its advice and soon went home. he learnt an important lesson that day - some jokes are not meant to be taken seriously.

dan looked around and replied with a twinkle in his eye, "let's go find out!" 

the pair ventured into the depths of the valley until they spotted a large yellow building surrounded by lush green trees. tim and dan smiled. "we found it! the spicy thing is coming from inside that building!"

tim looked excited. "let's go in and see what it is." 

they opened the doors of the building and, to their surprise, found a room filled with hot peppers and other delicious spices. "wow! this is so exciting!" dan exclaimed.

once upon a time there was a small whale who lived in the ocean. she pretended to be the biggest whale in the ocean, and so she told lies. one day she went to a charming little island and when she arrived, all the other whales were on the beach. she was shocked to see that everyone there was much bigger than her. even though she felt embarrassed, she tried to act like she was the biggest whale so she continued to lie.

everyone on the island laughed at her and the whale was so sad. just when she was going to leave, an old whale came up to her and said: "lying does not make you bigger, it makes you smaller. be honest and do the right thing, that's how you make yourself big."

the young whale thanked the old whale and realised that it was better to do the right thing than to keep lying. from then on, she was honest and told the truth. she became the biggest and most charming whale in the ocean. 

moral of the story: it's best to be honest and do the right thing, even when it doesn't seem like the easy choice.

tommy was looking for something to play with. he liked to build things and he was very busy. he went over to the furniture and saw an empty glass there. he decided to make it into something special. he took some straws and some cupcake wrappers and made an airplane. he put the airplane on the counter and admired it with a big smile on his face. 

suddenly he heard a voice. "what are you doing?" asked the voice. tommy turned around and saw another little boy who looked very curious. tommy said, "i'm building an airplane!" the little boy seemed very interested and asked if he could help too. 

tommy happily said, "sure!" and the two of them started to work together. they put together the airplane even faster and soon it was finished. 

tommy smiled and said, "let's have a toast to celebrate our hard work." he then picked up the glass from the furniture and offered it to the other little boy. they both took turns to drink from it and then clicked the glass together. the little boys cheered and laughed. 

tommy was very happy. he had made something special with his new friend and was now feeling very content. he put the glass back on the furniture, said goodbye to his friend and went off to play.
once there was a knight who was very brave. he had a shield that shone in the sunlight. one day the knight was walking in the forest when he saw a creature dancing. the knight thought the creature looked very stupid but he was also curious. 

the knight called out to the creature, "what are you doing?" 

the creature smiled and said, "i am dancing!" 

the knight laughed and said, "that is ridiculous!" the knight drew his sword and held it up to the creature. he said, "stop dancing or i will hurt you!" 

the creature quickly stopped dancing and cried out, "please don't hurt me!" 
but the knight didn't listen. he slashed his sword at the creature and it hurt him very badly. the creature ran away into the trees and the knight laughed. 

the poor creature was very sad and he vowed to never dance again.
olly was a wise bear who liked to dance. he liked to move his feet to the beat and sway his arms to the melody.

one day, olly noticed a very special smell. it was beautiful and smelled like perfume. he wanted to find out where it was coming from.

following the scent, olly discovered a friendly fox. her fur was grey and she was twirling around gracefully.

"what are you doing?" asked olly.

"i'm dancing, silly bear," said the fox. "come join me and we can dance together."

so olly and the fox danced and twirled through the meadow. as they swayed, the perfume from the fox's fur filled the air.

olly was so glad he followed the scent of the perfume and found his new friend. the two of them danced until the stars came out.
once upon a time, there were two friends who were exploring an ancient forest. as they were deep in the forest, a strong wind began to blow through the trees. suddenly, the wind revealed a hidden cave deep in the forest. 

the two friends went inside and noticed something strange. inside the cave was a large circle with strange words. one of the friends asked, "what is this? what do these words mean?"

the other friend replied, "these words hold the truth. if we can escape from this cave, we might be able to learn the truth."

the first friend said, "let's find a way to escape!" they searched the walls, but none of the walls seemed to have an opening. finally, they noticed a small crack in the back of the cave. the first friend said, "let's see if we can escape through this crack."

the two friends pushed and pulled at the crack until it opened wide enough for them to squeeze through. as soon as they escaped, the ancient words disappeared. they had found the truth, and they ran away happily ever after.
one day, sally was walking in the garden when she found a strawberry. it was such a delicate looking thing, and sally wanted to take a closer look. she gently pushed the strawberry with her finger and it wobbled around. then, sally heard a voice. 

"don't push it too much," the voice said. "it might break!"

sally was surprised. she looked around and saw a big, friendly-looking rabbit at her feet. 

"i didn't know you could talk!" she said.

"of course i can talk!" said the rabbit. "but careful not to push the strawberry too hard. it is delicate!"

sally nodded her head and stepped away from the strawberry, deciding to leave it alone. but the rabbit had an idea. he leaned forward and pushed the strawberry to sally with his nose.

the strawberry rolled slowly towards sally, and then stopped. sally was so happy! she picked up the strawberry and thanked the rabbit. he was right; it was so delicate and sweet! 

from then on, sally and the rabbit were friends and went on many adventures together. but no matter where they went, sally never forgot that the strawberry was delicate, and to be very careful when she held it in her hands.
once upon a time there was a little girl named lily. she always wanted to help her mom in the kitchen. so one day, mommy gave her an apron to put on before they started cooking. lily put on the apron and she was so excited. 

mommy said, "lily, can you help me by stirring the beans?" 

lily said, "yes mommy! i can do it!"

so lily started stirring the beans with a big spoon and she did a good job. mommy smiled at lily and said, "you did a very good job, lily."

lily was so happy that she ran over to mommy and hugged her. "thank you mommy for letting me help," said lily. 

mommy said, "anytime, my sweet little girl! it's always nice to help."

the moral of the story is that helping people can make you feel good, and be nice to show appreciation to those that help you.
jack was running up the stairs. he smiled and laughed as he ran up each step. when he reached the top of the stairs and saw the pale door, he stopped and said to himself, "i'm almost finished!"

suddenly, he heard a voice from inside the room. "not so fast, jack!" it was his mother. she opened the pale door and stepped out. 

"you must finish the stairs properly," she said. "no more running! see, take the stairs like this." she then started walking down the stairs step by step. 

jack watched her and then nodded. he started taking the stairs slowly as his mother had shown him. when he finally finished the stairs, he looked up to her with a smile. 

"very good, jack," she said. "now you can play in your room!" she ruffled his hair and gave him a hug before leading him up the stairs.

when they reached the lab, dad gave sandy a gentle pinch. he said they had to be really quiet when they walk inside. sandy was a bit frightened, but she followed her dad inside.

one day, max and lily went to the beach with their parents. they were so excited to play and to explore!

max noticed a raft in the shore and shouted, "look, a raft!" his parents immediately took out the raft and filled it up with air.

"can we please go and fly the raft on the sea?" max begged. his parents said yes and lily went too.

as the tide began to change, the children paddled the raft and went farther and farther away from shore. max and lily were so happy, they laughed and played.

suddenly, max said, "do you think the raft is loyal?" lily stopped paddling and thought. she then said, "yes, the raft is loyal. it always takes us back to shore."

max looked at the horizon and then at the raft lovingly. he was very proud of his loyal raft!
once there was a parrot who loved to slide. he would stand on top of the highest hill and slide down over and over again. one day, he saw something disgusting at the bottom of the hill. it was slimy and smelly. he didn't know what it was, but it made him want to slide even more! so he did. he went up the hill and slid down quickly and then back up, over and over again. it was so much fun! every time he went down the hill, he zoomed past the disgusting thing and would laugh. eventually, he got tired, but he had a great time!
one day, a boy named josh went on a walk in his town. he was looking for an adventure. so he walked around until he found something special. he found a big tower with a big door. josh thought it looked exciting. he knocked on the door but nobody answered.

josh kept knocking until the door finally opened and he went inside. inside the tower he found a lot of treasures. but then, he heard a sad voice coming from a corner. he turned around and saw a sad old man. 

josh asked the old man why he was so sad. the man told josh that he was sad because he had been locked inside the tower for a long time and he wanted to leave. josh was so sorry to hear that. he told the old man he would help him, so he opened the door and carried the old man outside. 

finally, the old man was free. he smiled, thanked josh and started walking away. but as soon as he stepped out of the tower, the door slammed shut and josh was stuck inside the tower forever. 

the old man never came back to help josh. josh was very sad and he never found his way out of the tower.
the little girl was naughty. she was playing a game she wasn't supposed to play and upsetting the other kids. her mother had told her to be careful, but she hadn't listened.

her mother was not happy. she said the girl must be punished for her naughtiness. the little girl was scared. she didn't know what kind of punishment would come.

the little girl was taken outside to the backyard. she saw something growing from the ground. it was a dark, slim vine reaching up towards the sun. 

her mother explained that the naughty little girl had to climb the vine. it would be a difficult task, but the vine had to be grasped and conquered. 

the little girl was very scared. she had never climbed a vine before! but she knew if she didn't do it she would be punished. so, she carefully grabbed the vine and started her climb.

it wasn't easy but eventually she made it to the top. looking down, she could feel proud of her accomplishment. and when she looked up, she saw sunshine, bright and beautiful.

the little girl's mother had been right: if the little girl had been able to climb the vine, she had earned a reward instead of punishment. the little girl smiled, knowing she had conquered the dark vine!
one hot day, anna dreamt of having an ice cream. she wanted this so badly that she could feel it in her tummy. her mommy said that if anna used her own money, then she could buy an ice cream. anna was so excited! but the problem was, anna had no money. she thought about what she could do and then she had an idea. she wanted to do some work so she could earn some money. 

anna helped her mommy clean the house; she swept, dusted and wiped things. after a few hours, she had enough money to buy an ice cream. she was so happy. when she saw the ice cream parlor, she felt a rush of wonder. there were so many flavors to choose from! 

but then, a gust of hot wind blew and the ice cream started to melt. anna felt like she was struggling. she worked so hard and now her ice cream was melting away. she tried to take small bites but it was too hot. 

in the end, anna decided to share the ice cream with her mommy. they both enjoyed it a lot and anna knew that she had learned an important lesson. she knew that struggle sometimes leads to wonderful things.

timmy asked the turkey, "why did you yawn?" 

the turkey replied, "i am so sleepy. it's been a long day." 

timmy had an idea. he said, "let's take a nap together. i know a great spot in the shade." 

so timmy and the turkey went off to find a cool spot. they found a nice spot in the grass and lay down. soon enough, both of them were snoring. 

when they woke up, both of them were feeling much better. they said goodbye and happily went their own ways. 
timmy was so happy that he had helped his new friend the turkey. he yawned and smiled.

once upon a time, there was a little boy called billy. he was only three years old and loved to play in the garden. every day, his mom told him to wash his hands after playing outside.

one day, billy found something very exciting in the garden. it looked like a little comet, like the ones he'd seen in books about space. it was a bit spoiled from being in the garden, but billy thought it was the most wonderful thing he'd ever seen.

billy didn't want to wash his hands, he wanted to keep playing with the comet. his mom said, "billy, you need to wash your hands. that comet is very dirty."

but billy wasn't listening and he kept playing with it. his mom got angry and shouted, "billy, come here right now and wash your hands!"

billy was scared but he knew that he had to do what his mom said. so he reluctantly washed his hands, dried them off and put the spoiled comet back in the garden. he looked at it sadly as he left, wishing that he could keep playing with it.
mama and sara were playing together one day in the sunshine. mama said to sara, "sara, let's go for a walk." sara was excited, she loved going for walks!

mama and sara went outside and saw two big tires. mama said, "sara, i think we can peek into the tires and see what's inside." sara loved exploring, so she and mama peeked into the tires.

inside the tires were two dependable, glowing rocks. sara gasped, "mama, these rocks are pretty!" mama agreed, "they are dependable. they won't change or go away like the clouds do."

sara liked the dependable rocks, so she asked mama if she could hug them. mama said, "yes, you can hug the rocks, but remember to take care of them and always put them back inside the tires." sara was so happy! she hugged the rocks and said, "thank you, mama!"
once upon a time there was a friendly deer. he was so thoughtful, he always wanted to share his special mushrooms with everyone he met. 
one day, the deer met a sly fox. the fox said he wanted to share the mushrooms too, but he had a sneaky plan. 
the deer agreed to share the mushrooms and the fox grabbed them all. as soon as the fox had the mushrooms, he ran away.
the deer was so sad. he had been so kind and thoughtful but the fox tricked him. the deer was sad and never shared his mushrooms again.
once upon a time there was a little girl named sam. she loved to wear her favorite dress, which was blue with a big pink bow.

one day, sam went for a walk in the woods with her mom. suddenly, they heard a noise. "what was that?" sam asked.

"i'm not sure," her mom replied. "but stay close to me!"

the noise got louder, until they saw a man walking towards them. he was wearing a terrifying mask and carrying a big weapon.

"oh no!" sam's mom said. "let's go!" she grabbed sam and they ran away, but the man chased after them.

finally, they reached a big house. sam's mom opened the door and they quickly ran inside. the man stopped outside and shouted, "you can't escape! i'll get you!" 

sam and her mom were so scared. they hid behind the couch and waited for a long time.

finally, the noise stopped. sam's mom peeked outside, but the man was gone.

"we are safe now," sam's mom said. she hugged sam tightly. "let's never go for a walk in the woods again."

sam nodded. she never wanted to experience something so terrible again.
one day, a little boy named john was in the kitchen. he saw a big bowl filled with white things. his mom said, "this is butter!"

john wanted to help his mom, so he grabbed a spoon and said, "let me mix it!" he started mixing the butter around in the bowl. it became smoother and more creamy.

suddenly, the butter turned into a light brown color. john's mom said, "look! the butter is brown now. you did a great job mixing it!"

john was so happy he did something to help his mom. he smiled and said, "let's make some cookies with the brown butter!"
mary was in the park and dreaming. she saw herself doing yoga and felt so envious of everyone else doing it. mary was excited and wanted to try the yoga poses.

"mommy, look! i can do yoga like the big kids," she said, pointing to the beautiful poses she saw.

her mom smiled. "yes, you can do it too, honey. let's give it a try," she said.

mary and her mom practiced the yoga poses together. mary couldn't believe how relaxed she felt. once they were done, she thanked her mom for helping her learn.

"you're a natural," her mom said. "i'm so proud of you!"

from that day on, mary would often leave the park dreaming of doing yoga and feeling envious of all the amazing poses she saw.
john was a very dirty boy. he never washed and he always had junk all over him. his mom was getting very mad that he never washed.

one day his mom said, "john, today you are going to go wash yourself."

but john was a clever boy, so he said, "no, mom. i don't have to wash. i will just buy some new, cheap clothes instead."

so john went to the store and bought some cheap, new clothes. but when he put the clothes on, they didn't fit very well. they were too small and they itched.

john ended up being very uncomfortable and still dirty. his mom was very sad that he didn't listen to her. john learned his lesson and promised to wash next time.
lisa and her dad were at the store. dad wanted to buy a birthday present for lisa. he looked around and saw a really pretty doll. "let's weigh it," he said to lisa. 

he placed the doll on the store's scales. they both saw the number 10 appear. dad sighed. "that's too expensive!" 

but then lisa had an idea. "let's go to the opera!" she said. they went to the opera and bought two tickets. the tickets were not expensive at all. 

when dad and lisa came back, he put the tickets on the scales. the number 3 appeared this time. "perfect," said dad with a smile. they bought the tickets and the doll. 

"happy birthday, lisa!" dad said, giving her the doll and the tickets. lisa was so happy. dad had found the perfect present!

so tuesday morning, he got up early. he was wearing his green shirt and walked to the bike shop.

when he got there, he saw it. it was a big, shiny green bike with two wheels. he couldn't believe it was his!

the shopkeeper handed him the bike and asked him if he liked it. little john nodded yes. he was so happy.

little john rode home on his shiny green bike. he was so proud of it. he was excited for all the tuesday adventures that were sure to come.
one day, two best friends were walking to school. as they walked, one of them asked, "did you know that i'm going to hold the classroom?"

the other one responded with surprise, "really? how did that happen?"

the first one held up a pale key, "i found this key and i think it unlocks the classroom!"

the other one couldn't believe it. they both started running to school. when they arrived, they saw the pale door. the first one inserted the key and sure enough, the door opened!

the two friends ran inside and found an empty classroom. they laughed and cheered as they sat at the desks.

the two friends had a great time in their very own classroom. they held hands and laughed until school started.
once there were two little rabbits called tom and fred. they were hungry and wanted food, but there was none around. 

suddenly, tom shouted, "look fred, there is the moon!"

"let's hurry to the moon and see if anything yummy is there!" fred said. 

so, they started running very fast. they kept running until they reached the moon. 

when they got there, they were disappointed. the moon was beautiful, but there was no food. 

tom said, "oh no, what are we going to do? we're so hungry!" 

suddenly, the moon smiled and said, "come closer little rabbits, i have some food for you. it will make you happy and full." 

tom and fred were so pleased and thanked the moon. they quickly ate the food and were no longer hungry. 

tom and fred said goodbye to the moon and quickly ran back home.
once upon a time there was a little girl named sandy. she was very happy and loved to play outside. one day, she saw a flag waving in the wind. she was so excited that she began to clap her hands with joy.

"look mummy!" sandy shouted. "a flag!"

mummy smiled at sandy and said, "yes, it's a beautiful flag, isn't it?"

sandy was about to answer, but then she noticed that the man standing next to the flag looked very miserable. she stopped clapping and looked confused.

mummy saw how worried sandy was and knelt down to explain. "he is sad because his country's flag has been taken down. let's clap and show him that we are sorry."

so, sandy and her mummy began clapping and soon sandy saw the man's face brighten. he waved to thank them and sandy waved back, smiling. 

even though the man was still not happy, he looked a little bit less miserable.
once upon a time, there was a pink hill in a faraway land. every morning, the hill would appear like any other hill. but one day, something magical happened. as the sun rose, the pink hill began to disappear.

all the animals in the land were so surprised and scared! they had never seen anything like it.

the next morning, something even more magical happened. when the sun rose, the pink hill was back, but it was even bigger than before! the animals looked all around the hill and they saw a huge rainbow swirling in the sky.

the animals were so happy and excited. they had never seen such beauty and wonder before. they knew that something special had happened.

from that day forward, the pink hill with the magical rainbow would appear and disappear every day. the animals would gather at the hill each morning, to watch the rainbow dance in the sky.
once there was a woman. she was walking in the park when she saw two dogs playing together. she was surprised to see them because they were different colours. she watched them, smiling, as they seemed to unite and play happily together.

the woman had an idea. she went to her village and told her neighbours what she had seen, telling them they should do the same. she told them they should all unite and work together, no matter what their differences were.

the neighbours were hesitant at first. they did not know if it was a good idea or not. but the woman was very persuasive and she persuaded them that it was a good thing to do.

they all agreed and decided to have a meeting the next week. however, the woman was very strict about what time people should arrive. some people thought she was too harsh, but she believed it was the only way to make sure everyone would arrive on time.

at the meeting, all the neighbours united and decided to work together. the woman was proud of what she had accomplished and the whole village was very happy.

one day, the friends decided to join the frame around a pretty flower in their garden. the flower looked beautiful inside the delicate frame and the friends decided to pick it and show it to everyone in the neighborhood.

ben and sam walked through the town holding the framed flower, and everyone they saw said it was the most beautiful flower they had ever seen. pretty soon, the whole town was filled with framed flowers, and everyone was joining hands to create their own delicate frames. ben and sam smiled at each other, proud of what they had done.

one day he found a bright pink ball lying in the grass and he was so excited he couldn't help but kick it. he chased it around for hours until he was very tired.

finally when it was nearly dark he stopped. he was exhausted and lay down under the tree. he thought he wasn't tired but then he heard a voice which said:
"you look tired. what have you been doing?"

the brown dog opened his eyes and saw a little girl standing there. she had long brown hair and a pink dress. 
"i've been kicking this pink ball around the garden," he said.

the little girl laughed and said: "that sounds like fun! can you show me your game?"

so the brown dog showed her how to kick the pink ball and they played together until the sky turned night.

once upon a time, there were two boys. they were in a team and were always happy to help each other. jimmy was always so polite. whenever someone said hello to him, he would always smile.

one day jimmy and his team were playing in the park. some other kids were playing too. the kids were having a lot of fun.

jimmy's friend tom saw the other kids playing and wanted to join in. he walked up to them and asked if he could play. the other kids said yes and jimmy smiled at tom.

the other kids invited tom to join their team. jimmy was so happy that his friend had a new team to play with. he smiled at tom, who politely thanked the other kids.

once upon a time there was a fly. she was small and quiet and wanted to explore the world. one day, she had an idea and wanted to share it with everyone. she flew off to the very distant tree to tell everyone her big idea.

when she arrived, she saw all the animals gathered around the tree, listening to a big bird. they were all excited about the bird's idea. the fly couldn't believe it and was so angry. she spoke out, "no, my idea is much better!â€

the animals laughed at her. they all thought her idea was silly and they didn't believe she had anything important to say. the fly was so upset. she became very angry and decided to prove them all wrong by releasing her idea into the air.

but her idea was never heard. as soon as it was released, a strong wind blew it away and it was never seen again. the animals all laughed and were happy to have the big bird's idea back in the centre of attention.

the moral of the story is that it's important to be kind and not put others down. everyone has the right to express their ideas, even if they don't seem important to others. showing respect, even if other's ideas seem silly or distant, can result in a much better outcome.

joe went back inside and got some paints from his mom's art supplies. he quickly stirred the paints together and created a big colourful mixture. he grabbed the handle and stirred it around until it was all mixed up.

one hot day, joe was outside playing in the sun. suddenly, he heard something in the distance. joe slowly crept to look, and he saw a cool monkey! joe was very excited and ran over to the monkey. he said, "hello, monkey! my name is joe. what are you doing?" 

the monkey replied, "i'm washing in the river. it's a great way to stay cool in this heat!" joe was curious and asked, "can i wash too?" the monkey smiled and said, "of course! come join me!" 

so joe and the monkey washed in the river together. joe was laughing and having such a great time that time flew by. joe looked up and realized he had to go home, but he said goodbye and thanked the monkey for the cool adventure.
once upon a time there was a boy called tom. he was a generous boy, who always shared his things with others. one day, tom found a chest in the garden. it was filled with lots of lovely things that he wanted to own. but the chest belonged to a mean man. he was not generous like tom.

tom was sad and tried to explain to the mean man that he was only being generous. but the mean man did not care and shouted at tom. he said that tom had to give the chest back or he would be in trouble. 

so tom sadly returned the chest and said goodbye. he never saw the chest again and was not able to own it. tom was very sad. he had learnt his lesson - some things you just can't share. the end.
once upon a time there was a little girl named bella. bella was very modest and loved to play with scissors. one day she saw a pitch in the grass and wanted to cut it.

so she ran over to it and grabbed her scissors and started cutting. as she cut it, a tiny fairy appeared! the fairy was very kind and told bella that she wanted to give her a special gift.

"what is the gift?", bella asked. 
"i will give you a magical spell that will help you always make modest choices", the fairy said.

bella was excited and said, "thank you". she thanked the fairy and was so excited to use the magical spell. she was very happy and knew that now every time she made a decision, it would be a modest one.
once there was a little girl who was only three years old. she wanted to play with her cooler, so she took it out. but when she opened the cooler, she was very surprised to find something unexpected inside. 

"mommy, look what i found!" said the little girl. 

her mom looked at the cooler and her face became upset. it turned out that inside the cooler was a snake. 

"you have to put the snake back where you found it," said the mom. but it was too late. the little girl was so scared, she dropped the cooler and the snake slithered away. 

the little girl was very upset. she was sad that she wouldn't get to play with her cooler anymore. and her mom was upset too, because the little girl had been so brave and hadn't been careful enough. 

it was a very sad ending for the little girl and her cooler.

once there was a boy named bob. bob went to school every day and worked really hard. he was the most successful pupil at the school, and the other children looked up to him.

one day, bob was walking down the hallway and heard a loud yell coming from the principal's office. he stopped and listened, and heard the principal yelling at another boy.

bob was worried and went to investigate. he opened the office door and saw the principal yelling at little johnny. johnny looked scared and sad, like he was going to cry.

bob stepped up and said in a loud, clear voice. "stop yelling at him! what did he do?" the principal looked surprised, and then he said, "johnny was late to school three times this week. i'm trying to teach him a lesson."

bob said, "you should not yell at him. that's not how you teach someone. have patience and talk to him kindly." the principal was surprised by his wisdom, and agreed.

the next day, bob saw johnny in the hallway and he was smiling. he had listened to what bob said and was not late to school anymore. johnny was really successful and bob was happy that he was able to help.

unfortunately, it didn't taste sweet. in fact, it tasted very salty! he was sad and upset. he wanted something sweet, not something salty! he thought and thought and then decided to take a brave step. he would try and make the water taste sweet.

so he grabbed his spoon and started to butter the pond with it. he added sweet things like sugar, honey and chocolate. he stirred the mixture with his spoon until it was all mixed up. then he took a spoonful, brought it to his mouth and tasted it.

to his surprise, the water was sweet! he was so happy! now he could enjoy the peaceful pond and taste something sweet.

once upon a time there was a bear who was feeling sick. he thought he had a fever and wanted to try and measure his temperature. he looked around his house and found a thermometer.

he picked it up, put it in his mouth and tried to read the temperature. but it was too dark, so he could not see the numbers. he tried using a flashlight to read the thermometer, but it still wasn't working. he shook it to see if it would work, but the thermometer still couldn't show the numbers.

he was very sad and desperate. he decided to go to see the doctor. but it was too late. his fever could not be cured and he ended up very sick.

the moral of the story is that if you find yourself feeling sick, you should always go to see a doctor in time so you can get the right treatment. don't try to measure your temperature on your own, and don't wait until it's too dark.

the girl had to think carefully about the best way for the creature to escape. it was a challenge because the cabin was full of furniture and boxes. after a few minutes of thinking, the girl found a plan.

she said "let's try to climb on the pile of boxes. that should be easy for you to get over the top and then you can slide out the window!". sure enough, the creature was able to get out of the cabin with the girl's help.

"i used to have a nice, comfy carpet just like that!"

joe was surprised and looked around to see who had spoken. it was an old man. he was bent over and walking slowly towards joe.

once upon a time there was a little man called bob. bob went for a walk in the park. he was feeling silly and decided to play hide and seek. he closed his eyes and counted to ten. he couldn't find anyone!

suddenly, bob heard a strange noise. he opened his eyes and there, sitting in a tree, was a little creature with furry ears. the creature had bright eyes and a cute tail.

bob wasn't scared. he asked the creature: "what are you?"
the creature replied: "i'm a fox! i like to bite things!"

bob thought it was silly to bite things, so he said: "no, that's not nice!"
the fox disagreed and it smiled. "why don't you try it? it's fun!"

so, bob opened his mouth and he tried to bite the fox's fluffy tail. but it was too fast! all he felt was a tickle in his tongue.

the fox laughed and said: "that was silly! now it's my turn! come closer."

bob took a deep breath and stepped closer. the fox opened its mouth wide and bit his lung. bob screamed and ran away.

that night, bob had a dream about silly little foxes that bit each other's tails. he had learnt his lesson - he would never try to bite anything ever again!

molly was playing in her backyard when she heard a fierce noise. she looked up and saw a missile shooting through the sky. molly jumped into a puddle and started to splash.

"what are you doing?" said her mom.

"i'm splashing!" yelled molly. "the missile was fierce so i wanted to be safe!"

mom laughed and said, "that's a good idea, but i think the missile is gone now."

molly peeked out of the puddle and looked around. the sky was clear, so she stopped splashing and came out of the puddle.

"i'm glad the missile is gone," she said.

"me too," said mom. she gave molly a big hug and said, "let's go back inside now."

molly and mom went inside, and molly stopped worrying about the fierce missile.
once upon a time there was a very honest black cat. his name was fred. he liked to spend his days playing in the sunshine.

one day, it started to rain. the raindrops soaked everything outside. fred was especially sad because he could not go out and play.

suddenly, he saw a little mouse scurrying towards him. the mouse said "come quick, fred. i know somewhere special we can play."

so, fred followed the mouse. they ran through the wet grass, until they came to an old, rusty shed. the mouse went inside and a few minutes later, he looked out and shouted, "come in, fred. we have a wonderful surprise!"

in the corner of the shed, fred saw a big black puddle. it was still raining, and so the puddle was already growing bigger. the mouse smiled and said, "come on, fred. let's go soak!"

so, the two of them jumped into the puddle. it felt so nice to get wet! they laughed and splashed and soaked in the puddle until they were so tired, they curled up and went to sleep.

the honest black cat and the brave little mouse were good friends forever.
once upon a time, there was a boy who loved to play outside. he wanted to go out, but he had to put on his special hat first.

"mommy, can i go out now?" the boy asked.

his mother smiled and said, "yes, but you will have to put on your hat first."

the boy smiled and ran to get his hat. he leaned against the wall as he put it on. when the hat was in place, he jumped up and clapped his hands in excitement. "i'm ready! i'm ready to go!"

the boy ran outside with a big grin and his hat tilted to the side. he had so much fun playing outside, feeling the sun on his face with his hat keeping him cool. he spent the whole day outside, playing till it was time to go home. 

when he got home, he leaned against the wall again and took off his hat. he sighed happily, and then placed it somewhere safe for the next day. 

"well, that was a fun day," he said, already ready for tomorrow.

mommy said, "that looks amazing! where did it come from?"
sarah waved again and shouted, "over there!"

mommy smiled, "let's go for a ride!"

so, sarah and mommy hopped onto the orange engine and the engine began to make a humming noise. sarah was so excited, she couldn't help but wave her hand in the air.

finally, they arrived at their destination. sarah said, "mommy! i had so much fun! can we go on the orange engine again?" 

mommy nodded and said, "maybe tomorrow, sarah. it's time for bed now."

sarah waved bye to the orange engine and made her way home with mommy.

but one day, something bad happened. she didn't know how, but the cactus suddenly fell on the ground and broke into pieces. it seemed that all its good care wasn't enough - talking was not enough for it.

the girl started crying and was so sad. her mom tried to make her feel better, but nothing helped. the little girl was devastated. 

such is life - sometimes, even when we give a lot of love, it doesn't work out the way we expected.

"what are you preparing?" asked mama. 

"i am making a mild whip," said papa.

mama smiled. she added some more of the ingredients to her bowl. 

"let's see who can make a better whip!" said papa. 

mama finished preparing the ingredients in her bowl, while papa stirred his ingredients until they were all combined. 

when they were both done, mama put the bowl in the oven, and papa whipped up the contents of his bowl. 

the whip was light and fluffy. papa tasted it and smiled. 

"this is so mild," said papa.

jack smiled and said, "yay! steak!" he clapped his hands.

but then his dad said, "no steak for you, jack. you need to eat your vegetables instead."

jack was so sad. he hung his head and felt ashamed. he didn't want to eat his vegetables. he wanted steak.

but then his mom said, "don't worry, jack. you can have a tiny bit of steak if you are a good boy and eat your vegetables."

jack was so happy! he clapped his hands and said, "yay!"

so jack ate all his vegetables and was rewarded with a delicious steak for dinner. he was very happy and he clapped his hands with joy.

"well," said his mom, "let's try something else. what if i give you a boost?"

timmy nodded and his mom boosted him up. he was so excited to be on the swing, something he had never done before!

but then something strange happened. timmy started to swing higher and higher, until he was up in the air!

timmy's mom gasped, "timmy! i had no idea you could fly! i don't know how to get you down!"

timmy just laughed and smiled. he tried to figure out how to come down, but it was an unknown thing to him. suddenly, he felt a blast of wind and he was back on the ground.

her mom smiled and said, "yes, sweetheart, but it doesn't belong to us. we don't own it."

the little girl thought for a moment and then said, "if we can't own a boat like this, then everyone should be able to use it. we should share it." 

her mom smiled and said, "that's a wonderful idea, sweetheart. that's the right thing to do."

the moral of the story is that we should all share our resources and help others. we don't have to own everything to be generous and have fun.

his father suddenly appeared and said, "ralph, don't worry. you have done your job very well, however, remember to be dependable like the measure and the job would be perfect." 

ralph looked up at his father and thought. he decided to try it once again, this time using the measure. he re-measured the parcel and tied the strings and the parcel was perfect. he smiled at his dad with pride and took the package to the post office.

they all agreed to never leave tommy behind again. they toasted marshmallows, laughed, and talked until late at night.

"do not be afraid," the bear said. "i will not yield."

pam was very surprised that the bear spoke. she cautiously asked, "what do you mean?"

the bear replied, "i will return to this forest once a year, so that i can watch it grow and thrive."

pam smiled, realizing how brave this bear was. with a nod, she said goodbye and continued her walk through the forest. she was glad she had met the brave black bear.

the lady dashed around trying to collect all her coins, but she was too slow. with all the coins scattered, it was hard for the old lady to find them all.

but then something amazing happened - the lady heard a chirping noise and, turning around, she saw a group of happy birds. the birds had found all the scattered coins and were gathering them back together in a pile.

on one such monday morning, tilly stumbled upon a room with a old radio. she was intrigued by it, so she decided to try and switch it on. she pressed all the switches and pressed the big red button. the radio started to make a clear noise, as if it was calling out to her.
 
tilly: "what is this?"

mum: "it's called a radio, sweetie. you can listen to the news, different music and people talking."

tilly was so excited to hear the radio; she loved the sound of all the different conversations coming from it. every morning after that, tilly would enter the room, turn on the radio and listen to it with her mum. 

at times, the radio noises seemed so clear, as if it was coming from some far away place. together, mum and tilly listened for hours, sharing stories and discovering things about each other. they might have been miles away from the radio, but it was like the stories came from their own home.
