once upon a time, there was a dead shell. it was very quiet and still.

a little boy came along and saw the dead shell. he became very excited. he picked up the shell and put it in his bucket.

the boy decided to take the shell to his house. he went to his backyard and found some rocks. he put the dead shell and the rocks in the bucket.

he took the bucket to the front of his house and loaded the rocks and the dead shell into a wagon. he pulled the wagon as fast as he could back to his house.

when he got home, the boy unloaded the rocks and the dead shell from the wagon. he placed them in the yard and started to build. he made a castle with the rocks and the dead shell.

the little boy was so happy. he had made a castle all on his own with a dead shell!
once upon a time there was an octopus named sam. sam liked to organize things - he liked to organize them in specific ways to make sure that everything was in its place. 

one day, sam decided to organize two big rocks together to make a rock tower. sam worked hard, and he was almost done.

"sam, be careful!" called out sam's mother. "you can be clumsy sometimes!"

sam was careful, and he was able to finish the tower. but then the ground began shaking, and the tower started wobbling and then falling.

sam was scared, but then he noticed something strange. another octopus had just come out of the rocks! it was organizing and stacking the rocks back up!

sam smiled as he was able to get his rock tower back because of the clumsy octopus!
alex was playing by the streams when something caught his attention. he saw a colorful trail winding through the grass and he wanted to know what it was.

alex followed the trail and it was not long before he saw a large butterfly fluttering its wings. amazed, alex stopped and stared. he had never seen something so pretty.

the butterfly flew near to alex and he couldn't believe how colorful its wings were.

"hi there," said the butterfly. "i'm here looking for some yummy flowers."

alex smiled and waved. "do you need some help?"

the butterfly smiled back. "i sure do - can you help me find some?"

alex was so excited. he started running in different directions, looking for the colorful flowers the butterfly needed. finally, he found exactly what the butterfly had been looking for and he shouted with joy.

the butterfly thanked him, flapped its wings and flew away.

alex waved goodbye and stood there, staring at the colorful trail the butterfly had left behind.
once there was an angel who wanted to relax. she found a nice quiet spot, but it was very hard to find silence. everywhere was so noisy! she tried very hard to relax and finally she closed her eyes and started to drift off. 

but just then, she heard a voice. 

"are you an angel?", it said.

startled, the angel opened her eyes and saw a little boy. he was only 3 years old, but he was smiling brightly. 

the angel was curious, so she asked, "what made you think i was an angel?"

"because," the little boy said, "angels come to make people relax. that's what my mommy tells me. when i am feeling noisy and upset, she tells me to think of an angel." 

the angel smiled. "that's a good idea," she said. "when you need help to relax, just think of an angel. that will help."

the little boy nodded and said, "thank you! bye!." the angel waved and watched as the little boy scampered away, then she closed her eyes and relaxed.
once upon a time there was a bunny who loved to hop. every day the bunny would jump around and explore the area. one day it came across a large field of dandelions. it was so lovely! the bunny hopped over to smell the sweet scent and it was even better than it expected. 

the bunny hopped around the field and enjoyed it. after a while it noticed a small girl sitting and watching it. the bunny hopped over to the girl and they started talking. the bunny learned that the girl had many opinions on life. the girl said that she loved the bunny's hopping and that she wished she could do the same.

the bunny and the girl became friends and talked to each other every day. they shared their opinions on the world and the bunny shared its wonderful hopping. every day, they enjoyed the lovely view of the dandelions and the bunny showed the girl how to hop around just like it did. they were so full of love!
once upon a time, mama and papa wanted to celebrate. mama asked papa what they should do. papa suggested they make a special plate. mama said that sounded great.

mama and papa got busy making the plate. first they put in some marshmallows. next they added some colourful candies. then they placed some rainbow sprinkles on top. it looked very nice!

mama and papa wanted to share the plate, so they gave it to the neighbours. everyone said it was yummy, and they were so happy to get the special treat.

mama and papa clapped their hands and cheered. they had succeeded in celebrating in a very special way.
once upon a time, there was a brave knight. one day, the knight was going on an adventure. he was walking down a path in the forest when he heard a loud noise coming from behind a tree. the knight was worried, so he slowly stepped closer to the tree. behind the tree, he found a small dragon with a bow and an arrow. 

"what are you doing here?" asked the knight.

"i'm trying to find my home," said the dragon. "but i'm not sure how to get there." 

the knight kindly offered to help. he told the dragon to follow him and the dragon agreed. they both walked down the path together, with the dragon carrying his bow and arrow. after a while, the dragon noticed his home in the distance. he was so happy and thanked the knight for his kindness. 

the knight said, "you're welcome. i'm glad i could help." 

the dragon smiled and waved goodbye. as the knight watched the dragon fly away, he couldn't help but feel worry. he hoped the dragon would be safe and happy. 

the knight continued on his adventure with a lighter heart, knowing that he had helped someone along the way.
one day, johnny was playing with his clay. he was rolling it, stretching it and even making shapes out of it. he was having a great time and smiling a lot. suddenly, the clay slipped out of his hands and fell onto the floor. johnny's smile turned into a frown. he was very troubled.

johnny hurriedly went over to pick up the clay. to his surprise, he noticed that it had started to crack. he looked up to the sky and shouted, "oh no!" johnny was very confused. how did this happen?

suddenly, his mum appeared by his side. she let out a big sigh and asked, "what happened, johnny?" johnny told her the whole story. his mum said, "that is because clay is very fragile, johnny. you need to be careful with it." johnny silently nodded, and his mum gave him a big hug.

from then on, johnny handled the clay with utmost care. he was careful not to let it slip again. he also learnt that it is important to be careful with things that are fragile.
once upon a time there was a little girl named emma. she loved to go to the park every day, and look at all the pretty trees.

at the park, there was a big pond. emma liked to look at the way the water was so smooth and shiny.

sometimes, emma would pick up a few pebbles from the ground and skip them across the water.
every time the pebble hit the surface, emma liked to repeat the same phrase, 'my name is emma'.

one day, emma's mother came with her to the park. as emma skipped pebbles across the lake she called out to her mum, 'mummy, my name is emma!'.

her mother looked over with a big smile and said, 'yes, i know your name is emma!'.

emma was so happy she started to repeat her name over and over again. 

for a while it was just the two of them at the park, saying emma's name in a smooth, gentle voice.
mama and baby were playing in the park. mama said, "let's go home, baby, it's time for you to bathe." so baby giggled, and they went home. 

when they got home, mama said,"okay baby, go upstairs and find your old rubber duck. i'm going to draw a bath for you." 

so baby did, and found her rubber duck quickly. as she was walking back downstairs, she saw some bubbles in the water. baby grinned, excited to take a bath. 

mama said, "all right, baby. dive right in!" but baby said, "no! i'm scared!" so mama reached out her hands and said, "it's okay, baby. the water is wet, but it will feel good on your skin." 

baby hesitated, but she trusted her mama. slowly, she stepped in the water, and it felt great. mama laughed, "see baby, i told you it would be nice." together they both laughed as baby bathed.
once upon a time there was a little girl called amy. she was very spoiled and always got what she wanted. one day, amy wanted to go to the theater. her mom promised her that they would go if she was a good girl that day. 

amy was very excited and she got ready straight away. when it was time to go, amy waited by the door. she was so excited that she kept asking her mom when they were going. 

at last, mom said it was time for the theater. but when they reached, the theater was already closed. amy was very angry and she started crying. she yelled at her mom for not mailing her earlier. 

unfortunately, her mom had nothing she could do. there was no way she could take amy to the theater now. amy cried and screamed, but the theater would not open. 

amy was so disappointed and angry that she started stomping her feet and refused to move. mom had to carry her home. poor amy had no theater visit that day.

the mom came and saw the bird. they watched it for a minute. then, the bird flew away.

the mom and dad were so surprised. they hadn't thought she was awake.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named sue. she was three years old and loved playing with her toys.

one day, sue was looking for something new to do. suddenly, she saw an interesting box. she opened it up, and inside she found lots of brightly colored thread.

sue was so excited. she chose one of the softest and brightest threads, and began to grow it. she wrapped the thread around a special toy bear, and the thread fit perfectly.

"oh, how beautiful!" said sue.

she continued wrapping the thread until the bear was completely covered. sue was very proud of her work.

the next day, sue showed her bear to all her friends. they were all so impressed. sue had grown something truly special. 

from then on sue decided, she would always take the time to grow something new with thread.
once upon a time, there was a boy called tom. tom loved to swing. every day, tom would go to the big barn and swing all day long. 

one day, a girl called anna came to the barn. anna wanted to swing too, but tom was being selfish and said no. anna was very sad but didn't give up. she asked tom again to let her swing.

tom thought carefully and said: "ok, you can swing on the other side of the barn from me, but don't bother me". anna was very happy and quickly ran over to the other side of the barn.

tom and anna played together all day. from then on, tom became less selfish and would always let anna play with him.
the nurse was very fancy. she wore a long, blue dress and had a head covered with a beautiful hat.

she was very busy, always printing things from her computer. one day, she printed something very special. it was a big surprise for everyone.

"look!" shouted the nurse. "i printed a fancy hat!"

a 3 year old boy was very excited. he wanted to wear the hat so he ran towards it. but before he could reach it, the nurse snached it away.

"this hat is not for you," she said sternly. "it's too fancy for little boys."

the 3 year old boy was very sad. tears rolled down his face and he wished he could wear the fancy hat. but the nurse said no and kept it away from him.

the end.

one day, two cats were walking near an old house. one of the cats stopped and said, "this looks like a great place. why don't we stay here?" the other cat said, "maybe we should wait and see who the owner is first."

just then, the door to the house opened and an old woman stepped out. she saw the two cats and said, "good morning cats. would you like to come inside?" the two cats quickly followed her inside the house.

the old woman said, "you cats can stay in my house if you help me with my chores. then i just might make you my cats forever." the cats agreed and worked hard all day. 

at the end of the day, the old woman said, "you cats are very useful. you can stay in my house and be my cats forever." the cats were very happy and purred loudly.

the old woman said, "i am so glad i found two great cats to keep me company." the cats left each day to hunt for food, but always came back home to their loving owner. they had a great home and a great owner who loved them very much.
once upon a time, there was a old man. he had an ancient car. the car was very special to him.

one day, a little girl was walking by the old man's house. she saw the old man's car and wanted to play with it. she asked the old man if she could use his car. the old man said yes.

the little girl enjoyed playing with the old car. she moved it around and pretended to drive it. 

eventually, the little girl had to go home. she asked the old man if she could keep the car. but the old man said no. he thanked the little girl for playing with his car, but reminded her that she should only lend things that belong to her.

the little girl understood and thanked the old man. she learned an important lesson that day - we should only lend things that belong to us.
once upon a time there was a little girl named mia. she was three years old and full of energy. mia loved playing in her yard every day. one day, mia wanted to try on her mother's skirt. she eagerly rushed to her mother's room to get it. 

mia's mother saw her and said, "no mia, you can't wear my skirt. it doesn't fit you."

mia was so upset. she hated not being able to wear the pretty skirt. she folded her arms and said, "but i want to wear it!"

mia's mother shook her head. she said, "no mia, it's not safe. you can wear your own skirts. they are just as pretty."

mia was still disappointed, but she decided to obey her mother and went to find her own skirt. she put it on and smiled. although she couldn't wear her mother's skirt, she was still happy she had something special to wear.

once upon a time, there was a silly goat named jim. he lived near a meadow and liked playing there in the sunshine.

one hot summer day, jim forgot to take a rest and kept playing in the meadow as the sun set. suddenly, he heard a loud roar and a big bear appeared!

jim was very scared and tried to run away, but the bear was too fast. jim shouted to the bear, "please don't hurt me!" 

but the bear didn't listen and chased jim into the woods. even though jim was very scared, he remembered something the farmer had told him about bears. 

jim yelled out, "stop! i know a secret way to get food that won't leave you so hungry!"

but the bear kept chasing jim and eventually, the bear caught up and ate poor jim. 

this story reminds us that no matter how silly we are, it is important to remember to be careful and listen to what grown-ups tell us.
mia and tommy were playing in the park. mia found a beautiful trumpet. she suggested they should both choose something they want from the park. tommy was excited and he pointed at the trumpet. mia was a bit jealous of tommy's choice and felt a bit guilty. 

mia said, "do you really want the trumpet?" 
tommy replied, "yes, i do. i want it." 

mia sighed and said, "oh ok then, you can have it."
tommy was so happy he jumped for joy and hugged mia. mia was still a bit sad, but she felt better when she saw how happy tommy was. she realized it was time for her to let go and choose something else. 

mia scanned the park and spotted a big and colorful kite. she smiled and said to tommy, "let's get the kite!"

tommy was so excited that they were going to share the kite. as they ran to the kite, they knew they both made the right choice.
once upon a time, there were two best friends, sarah and jack.

sarah and jack were always happy when they were together. one day, they were having a lovely meal under a big, shady tree. as they enjoyed their meal, sarah said, "oh look! there's a charming butterfly!" 

jack wanted to catch the butterfly to keep as a pet. he said, "let's catch it!" 

sarah replied, "no, it's too beautiful to be locked up in a cage."

the two friends began to quarrel over what to do with the butterfly. suddenly, a big gust of wind blew the butterfly away. 

sarah and jack were sad that they couldn't catch the beautiful butterfly, but then they smiled and hugged each other. they both knew that it was best for the butterfly to stay free. 

the end.

once upon a time, there was a stubborn little girl. she lived in a small village. every day she was in a hurry to do her chores. she raced around, trying to get them all done. one day, she was hurrying so much that she almost ran into a wall! luckily, she stopped in time to avoid a crash. from then on, she ran around a little less quickly. after that, she always remembered to take the time to enjoy her village and the people around her.
one day, two friends, bob and steve, were walking through a gloomy forest. they saw a frog sitting on a rock. bob wondered what the frog was doing all alone. steve suggested that they play with it. 

so bob carefully scooped up the frog, and put it in a shallow pond nearby. the frog was not happy! it was hopping all over the pond, looking to get out. but, there was no way out.

then bob had an idea! he took off one of his shoes and filled it with the water from the pond. he put the frog in the shoe and set it down on the grass. the frog was so happy that it started to sing! 

steve and bob looked at each other, smiled, and watched the frog soak in the sun. 

the end.
once upon a time there was a boy called tom. tom lived in an east village. he was very cheerful and happy. he lived with his mom and dad in a small cottage.

one day tom went for a walk in the forest near his village. as he walked along, he saw a lot of animals. he saw a deer that stood nearby. he wanted to play with the deer, so he said, "hi deer! let's play!"

but the deer just stood there and did not move. "oh well," thought tom, "i guess it's too shy to play with me."

suddenly the deer spoke to him: "tom, i am not too shy to play with you. it's just that i need help. i am lost and i don't know how to get back home. i live in the east forest and i know it's very far away."

tom thought for a moment, and then he said to the deer, "don't worry. i'll help you get home. i know the way to the east forest and i will take you there."

so, tom and the deer walked together until they reached the east forest. the deer was so happy to be back home!

tom waved goodbye to the deer, and then he walked back home. he was feeling cheerful and happy. he had learned an important lesson that day. he had learned that helping others makes him happy, and it

once upon a time there was a little girl named lucy who wanted to find out what power was.

one day she set out on a journey to figure out more about it. as she was walking along, she saw a beautiful rainbow in the sky.

"what is that?" she asked.

"that's a rainbow!" said a voice from behind her.

she turned around and saw a fairy standing there. "do you have power?"

the fairy smiled. "yes, i do. and if you would like to join me, i'll show you what power is."

lucy was so excited. she ran to the fairy and said, "yes, please show me!"

the fairy waved her wand, and a bright light shone in the sky. lucy felt an amazing feeling inside of her, like she could do anything she wanted.

the fairy laughed. "that is power! come, let's join hands and explore more."

so lucy and the fairy joined hands and flew around the sky, discovering how powerful and beautiful the world was. 

and that is how lucy learnt what power was.
once upon a time there was a group of chubby puppies. they were playing in the garden when one of them noticed something strange.

the puppy said "wow! this flower is shrinking!"

the rest of the group came over to see and sure enough, the flower was getting smaller and smaller.

the puppies started to get scared. what could be causing the flower to shrink? 

suddenly, a wizard came out of the bushes and said "i'm using my shrinking potion. when i splash it on things, they shrink!"

the puppies were relieved and they started to laugh. they all thought the wizard was funny.

the wizard said "i'm glad you find it funny. now, if you promise not to touch my potion again, i'll give you each a treat!"

the puppies cheered and promised. the wizard splashed his potion on the flower and it was back to its original size. everyone was happy and the wizard gave each puppy a chubby treat for looking after the flower.

his mom said, "yes, you can join them and use your imagination to play." alex listened and ran over to the children.

one day, the little girl wanted to color outside. she was so excited that she ran off to find the perfect spot.

she found a big tree and she seated herself down. her eraser was in her hand and she was getting ready to draw.

suddenly, she felt something beneath her! it was her eraser! she had been so careful not to lose it. she laughed at herself and put it back in her pocket. 

now she could go back to drawing. she was so careful to keep her eraser safe while she enjoyed creating her masterpiece in the sunshine.
one day, jack and his mommy were in the store shopping when they came across a big box of shiny wraps. jack's mommy paused and asked him, "do you want to buy this wrap and spend some of your piggy bank money?" jack thought it over and then agreed.

he and his mommy took the wrap home, but mommy warned him not to open it 'till his birthday. jack was very excited, but he was also very lazy and he couldn't wait.

so the next day, jack tried to think about how he could get the wrap open without his mommy noticing. he decided to sneak into the living room and peek inside, but as soon as he opened it, his mommy was standing there looking very unhappy.

she said, "jack, i thought i told you to wait till your birthday to unwrap your present? now we have to re-wrap it."

jack felt a bit guilty, but he was still very excited to finally see what was inside! on his birthday, he eagerly opened the wrap to find the toy he had been wanting for so long. his mommy was glad to see that, despite being a bit lazy, jack had learned his lesson and would be more patient next time.

as they started playing, tess noticed that her friends were ignoring her. she didn't understand why and felt very sad. she tried to talk to them, but they just continued to ignore her. tess felt a bit teary. 

fortunately, tess's mum saw what was happening. she came out of the house, gave tess a big hug and said, "don't worry tess, let's play a mild game of hockey together".

once upon a time, there was a little girl who was very pretty and loved the color yellow. she went out for a walk through the park and noticed something very special - a big yellow popper!

the little girl was so excited and started to shout. she ran to the popper and said, "this is so pretty! i must have it!" 

but when she tried to pick it up, she noticed someone else had also found the popper. it was an old man who said, "i found this popper first. you can't have it!"

the little girl started to shout louder and said, "no, it's mine! i want the pretty yellow popper!"

after a few minutes of shouting, the old man decided to give the popper to the little girl.

the little girl was so happy and thanked the old man. she hugged the pretty yellow popper and then ran off with a big smile on her face.

the end.
once upon a time there was a little girl named emma. she was three years old and as curious as could be. she had discovered that if she washed a toy symbol in soapy water, it would become clean and shiny.

one day emma was playing in the park with her friends. they were all playing with a giant symbol they had never seen before. it was yellow and red and covered in scribbles.

emma had a crazy idea. she said to her friends, "let's wash the symbol in the pond!" 

her friends looked at her in disbelief and shouted, "no way emma! you're crazy!" 

despite their protests, emma was determined. she grabbed the symbol and scurried over to the pond. as she was about to put it in the water, the symbol let out a loud splash and went deep beneath the surface.

emma's friends cheered as they watched the symbol become cleaner and brighter with each second it was submerged. once it emerged from the pond, it was like a brand new symbol!

emma's friends clapped and thanked her for her genius idea. emma smiled and said, "see, i told you it would work!"

but jack was so curious he had to see what was in there.

his mouth dropped open when he saw the giant fur ball inside. 
the giant fur ball suddenly started to move and laughed.

jack was embarrassed.

"where is daddy?", cherie asked her mommy.

"he has gone away for a little while", mummy replied.

cherie felt an urge to be with her daddy, but felt resigned that it was not possible. she knew that her daddy was special and always made her feel loved but she just wished he would come back to her. 
 
days passed, until one day, mummy told cherie the exciting news - daddy was back home! cherie was so happy that he was once again available to her. she rushed to daddy and hugged him tight.

"welcome home, daddy!", cherie said happily.

mommy told tommy, "now remember, no getting into trouble while we're gone!"

tommy was excited. he yelled, "i won't!"

mommy and daddy went out the door and tommy ran to the window to watch them. he saw daddy put his hands up and make a sign, so tommy did the same.

mommy and daddy laughed, seeing tommy copy daddy. they blew him kisses and drove away.

the moral of the story is that it is important to always listen to adults.

the bird hopped forward and said "look at the thick walls of the well. i can make my whistles louder in here. clap your hands and i will whistle louder!"

but then, something unexpected happened. an angry duck came and started chasing the other ducks away. daisy moved closer and saw that the angry duck had a hurt hand. she asked it kindly, "what is wrong, little duck?".
the duck calmly replied back, "my hand is injured so i cannot eat the grains. please help".

daisy quickly understood that the duck was hungry and decided to help. she made a pile of grain next to the duck and helped him eat it safely. 

after the duck finished eating, daisy was a bit sad to see him go. but then, the duck spread its wings and flew away with a quack of gratitude. daisy waved goodbye and then continued her walk with a smile.

once upon a time, there was a three-year-old boy called tommy. tommy was worried because he had a lot of things to do. every day he looked at the calendar to try and remember his activities.

one day, tommy's mom saw him looking at the calendar. she said, "tommy, why are you so worried?"

tommy replied, "mom, i'm trying to remember what i have to do today!" his mom smiled and said, "don't worry! i'll help you. come and have some lunch first, okay?"

tommy went to the kitchen and sat at the table. on the table was a sandwich. he picked it up and started to chew. tommy enjoyed the sandwich so much that he wanted to have another one. his mom said, "maybe later tommy. now you have to go outside and play!"

so tommy happily finished his sandwich and went outside to play. he smiled, no longer worried.
once upon a time there was a hairy raven called bob. bob had decided to go on an adventure, so he flew off into the sky. as he flew, he got really tired and decided he needed to take a break.

bob eventually found a perfect spot - a big tree near a lake. he flew up to the tree and perched on one of the branches. while he was sitting there, he noticed a small boy. the boy was standing by the edge of the lake, looking at the water.

bob flew down to the edge of the lake and asked the boy what he was doing.

the boy said he was trying to catch some fish with his hands, but he couldn't manage it.

bob said, "i can help! i'm a very hairy raven, so i can catch fish easily with my claws!"

the boy was so excited and said, "can you really manage it?"

bob flew to the middle of the lake, dipped his claws into the water and caught a fish!

the boy was so amazed. he thanked bob for helping him and said goodbye. bob flew away, off on another adventure.
john and tara were playing in the park. john looked towards the horizon and saw an ancient house in the distance. he said to tara, "let's go explore the old house!"

tara agreed, so they ventured off to the house. when they got there, john saw a desk in the corner. he said, "let's search inside the desk!"

they opened it up and found the most amazing things. there were shiny coins, old jewelry, and ancient books. john wanted to keep all the treasure, but tara said, "we have to surrender it. we can't keep these things."

john was sad but he knew tara was right. they returned the treasure to the desk and quietly left the old house. even though they couldn't keep the treasure, they had an amazing adventure that they would never forget.
once upon a time there was a cat. his name was billy. he liked to jog a lot. every morning he would wake up and run around the neighbourhood. he was so graceful and fast.

one day, he left his house and started to jog. but when he came around the corner he saw something he had never seen before. it was a lot of traffic. cars, buses and people were all in his way. but billy was still brave. he gathered his courage and started to jog through the traffic.

everyone stopped and looked at billy. they couldn't believe how gracefully he weaved between the vehicles. even the loudest cars thanked billy for making the traffic less noisy.

billy felt proud and kept jogging. he showed everyone that anyone can be brave and graceful if they try.
once upon a time, there were two best friends named max and molly. max was a little boy and molly was a little girl. max and molly were always playing together. one day, max fell and hurt his knee. molly wanted to help him, so she went to her house to borrow a bandage for max.

molly knocked on the door and said, "mommy, can i borrow a bandage for max?"

mommy said, "yes, sweetheart, you can borrow one. here, take this one."

molly took the little bandage and ran back to max. she put the bandage on max's knee.

max smiled and said, "thank you molly, it feels much better now!"

molly smiled and said, "you're welcome, max!"

the two best friends hugged and went back to playing together. they never stopped having fun!
once upon a time, there was a beautiful evening with a purple sky. all the animals outside were busy singing and playing in the sun.

however, the purple evening came to an end. as night started to fall, the animals said goodbye and went home. but then something unexpected happened!

in came a purple dragon! everyone was scared, but the dragon was friendly. he said he was looking for some friends to include him in their games.

the animals all paused to think. then the little squirrel said, "let's include him!" 

everyone agreed and they all had a wonderful evening of playing together. the dragon even taught them a new game, and they had so much fun!

when the night ended, the dragon flew away. but the animals always looked forward to having the purple dragon return to their evening fun.
